column17: A pick up motor vehicle transporting the newly appointed Puntland Intelligence Agency (PIA) in charge of Sanaag region was shot at by armed soldiers at a road block next to Global Hotel junction in the evening of 22/03. Reports indicate that the vehicles occupants defied police stop order and subsequent shooting. The PIA officer and his body guard were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Jubaland forces backed by AMISOM (KDF) took-over Kudhaa village (97km SW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 22/03. The allied forces faced no resistance from al Shabaab fighters who apparently vacated the village before the arrival of the joint forces.

Hundreds of residents of Yaaqshiid District staged a peaceful demonstration in Suuq Bacaad neighbourhood in the morning of 22/03 in protest against the rise of insecurity in the neighbourhood. The demonstration started shortly after the killing of two SNG soldiers in the area by unidentified armed men.

An IED hidden in a black plastic bag and left on the road side exploded prematurely in Fagax junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 22/03. The target was not clear and the perpetrators escaped. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against armed forces guarding the rear gate of Makah Al-Mukaram Hotel in the evening of 22/03. The guards responded with gunfire after the blast. The perpetrators managed to escape. No casualties were reported. Simultaneously unidentified attackers threw two hand grenades at SNG police forces base in Zona K neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the night of 22/03. One police officer was reportedly injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two SNG soldiers in Suuq Bacaad neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 22/03. The perpetrators escaped.

Two militia groups from Habar-Gidir Suleiman and Ayr sub-clans clashed in Xundhurre village (38km NE of Dhusamareeb) in the afternoon of 23/03. The clash was related to clan revenge form previous killings. A militia man from Suleiman was killed in the clash. Elders have stepped in to defuse the situation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM convoy passing in the vicinity of Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 23/03. The AMISOM forces open fire after the blast. The device damaged a water browser. Two civilian bystanders were killed in the subsequent shooting.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces manning a checkpoint in Cumar Beere village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 23/03. The fighting lasted for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A gunman from Dhulbahante/Reer Elmi Naaleeye sub clan shot bullets into a vehicle carrying employees working for an INGO in Laf Weyne village (29km W of Xudun) in the afternoon of 23/03. The shooting followed a quarrel between the gunman and the village committee members plus the INGO staff (who were doing training for cash for work project) about one of the armed mans local clan members, who had allegedly been excluded by the village committee. The INGO staff members -- who were already in the vehicle -- ran away and got back to Laas Caanood unharmed.

A former Ceel Buur District Commissioner during president Abdullahi Yusufs time was abducted by al Shabaab fighters in Daafeed village (21km SE of Ceel Buur) on 23/03. Reports indicate that the abducted man was taken to Wabxo village (43km NW of Ceel Buur). The motive is unknown.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against SNG forces passing in Barakat Cemetery neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 23/03. The forces responded with gunfire after the blast. The perpetrators managed to escape. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and injured a SNG soldier in Shirkole neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 23/03. Other SNG soldiers in the area arrived at the scene immediately and took the victim to hospital. The assailants escaped after the shooting.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Aymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 23/03. Both sides engaged in a heavy and brief armed clash after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 23/03. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Nasteexo neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina District) in the night of 23/03. The reason behind the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column8: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Gunmen from Mareehan/Reer Diini shot and killed an Ethiopian intelligence working as Liyu Police officer from the saReports indicate that the victim use to arrest local people from the area and later handover to Ethiopian intelligence over the border, where the detainees disappeared without any trace. The victim was leaving a restaurant when the incident happened. The reason behind the killing is linked with revenge from the relatives of the missing people that the victim handed over to Ethiopia. The attackers also injured the victims body guard and two civilian bystanders. me Mareehan sub-clan in Cabud Waaq in the night of 24/03.
Unidentified attacker(s) killed two men in Muraale Village (9km E of Qoryooley) in the night of 24/03. Reports indicate that the victims were members of Saalax militia. The perpetrator(s) escaped.

Two opposing militias hailing from Habar Gidir and Biimaal clashed near Buufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the morning of 24/03. The fighting was reportedly initiated by the Biimaal militias after they attacked a checkpoint manned by Habar Gidir militias. At least four combatants from both sides were killed in the fighting.

SNG police together with NISA personnel attacked SNG military manning a checkpoint in the vicinity of Baar Ismail in Xaawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 24/03. The joint forces were in a mission to arrest military officers who reportedly robbed a vehicle near Afgooye. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire. Two soldiers and two civilian bystanders were injured.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a security guard guarding a business store hailing from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan near Miir police station in Galkacyo (north) in the night of 24/03. Reports indicate that the victim was seen last time with his colleague from Dir clan before the incident happened. The reason behind the killing is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped with the victims gun.

Gunmen hailing from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan ambushed a Toyota Land Cruiser belonging to Saad sub-clan in an area near Ceel Farax (15km SE of Galkacyo) in the night of 24/3. The reason behind the incident is currently unknown. The driver - who was driving alone - was injured. The perpetrators escaped.

Unknown gunmen shot and injured a nomadic woman and her child in a make shift homestead in Deefow village (29km NW of Bled Weyne) in the night of 24/03. The identity of the attackers is dispute where some sources suggest that they were Dir militias while another version reports that they were Liyuu police who mainly control the area and been suspected of siding with Dir clan.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in the vicinity of Abdi Wayel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 24/03. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of SNG forces engaged in intra-clash gunfire in Suuq weyn neighbourhood (Wadajir-Medina District) in the morning of 24/03.The exchange of gunfire started after one of the group negligently discharge gunfire where the other side responded by firing back. Three civilian bystanders were killed and two others injured.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Shanta Geed neighbourhood (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 24/03. The reason behind the killing remains unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

A RCIED targeted a convoy of ministerial delegation from SWIA (South West Interim Administration) in K60 Settlement (28km NE of Marka) in the morning of 25/03. The convoy came from Afgooye and was heading to Marka when the incident happened. The device missed its target causing no casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM Ethiopian contingent vacated their base in Buq-Goosaar (50km SW of Beled Weyne) on 25/03 and moved to Ceel Cade (26km NE of Bur-Goosaar) where the Ethiopians have another base. Al Shabaab fighters soon took over the village following the departure of the Ethiopian forces. Reports indicate that some civilians also left the village in fear of been targeted by al Shabaab fighters. Its not clear why the AMISOM forces vacated the village. The move might negatively impact on accessibility and might also reinforce al Shabaab economic blockade against liberated towns in the area.

A gunman hailing from Habar-Yunis/Muse Care sub-clan shot and injured a man from Habar-Yunis/Muse Turwa sub-clan in Galool-Togoyo near Xamilka village (17km E of Ceel-Afweyn) on 25/03. The motive behind the incident is reportedly related to an escalated dispute over a pasture land. The perpetrator escaped.

SNG NISA forces conducted a security operation in Kaxda neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the afternoon of 25/03. The forces arrested three men who apparently erected an illegal checkpoint in the area. The men initially exchanged gunfire with NISA forces but later surrendered. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position near the livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 25/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a man in the vicinity of Abu Hureyrah Mosque in Bakara market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 25/03. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

An IED prematurely exploded in Mitir-Bacaad approximately (8km S of Buulo Burte) on the road to Jowhar in the morning of 26/03. Reports indicate that al Shabaab operatives were installing the device when the incident happened. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and another one was injured.

Militiamen loyal to Sultan Wabar open fire at a Somaliland military base in Qol Ujeed (25.5km NE of Borama) on 26/03 and immediately escaped towards the boarder of Ehtiopia. No casualties were reported. This is second incidents of Sultan Wabar militias attacking Somaliland base either police post or military base and quickly retreating back.

A group of armed men with a battle wagon loyal to the former deputy police commissioner, Muhyadin Gacamey, exchanged gunfire with an alleged defector from their units with a motive of apprehending him in Tsunami area in the morning of 26/03. The gunfire lasted for about ten minutes after which two persons including the alleged defector were injured. Puntland police later sealed off the area.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and injured a man from ""unrecognized Westland State Administration"" hailing from Jejele clan in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled-Weyne) in the evening of 26/03. The Westlands State Administration claims to be controlling sub-villages in western Beled-Weyne town. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded two businessmen hailing from Rahanweyn/ Jiroon and Laysan sub-clans respectively and arrested three others in Doon-dardiir village (23km SW of Xudur) in the morning of 26/03. Reports indicate that business people were accused of smuggling food to Xudur even after al Shabaab authority gave them stern warning on 23/03. Xudur is among towns that al Shabaab have put under economic blockade.
A man hailing from Ogaden/Awliyahan killed another man from Shiqal in Weel Cade (28km SW of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 26/03 following a dispute over pasture land.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against Jubaland forces base in Centarka in Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 26/03. Reports indicate that the device landed at the front gate causing no casualties. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNG forces outpost in Aymiska neighbourhood (former Insurance building) in Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 26/03. Two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Jubaland and AMISOM-Kenya forces oust al Shabaab forces from Yoontoy Yarey following a fighting on 27/03. Causalities not known.

column9: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Fresh clan clash broke out between Hawadle and Dir/Faqa Omar Faqa Mohumed in Deefow village (29km NW Beled Weyne) in the morning of 27/03. Hawadle militias on their side claimed that their opponent were supported by Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries who control the area. Exact casualties cannot be ascertained since communication was switched off, however five hawadle militias were injured and brought to Beled Weyne hospital where one of the victims succumbed to his injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An IED targeted a vehicle belonging to Jubaland forces in Via Afmadow in Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 2703. The vehicle was damaged but no human casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Wardhiigley District police station in the night of 27/03. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the scene. A SNG police officer was injured in the armed clash while casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

An al Shabaab attack on Maka Al-Mukarramah Hotel and subsequent battle with SNG forces begins at 4pm on 27/03 and lasts through the following morning. Several hostages were taken by the attackers, who numbered three. Causality figures vary, between 12 and 18, which included the death of the Somali ambassador to Switzerland. Later reports confirm the total dead numbered 14. Several more wounded. By the end of the siege military forces had regained control of the hotel.

An al Shabaab attack on Maka Al-Mukarramah Hotel and subsequent battle with SNG forces begins at 4pm on 27/03 and lasts through the following morning. Several hostages were taken by the attackers, who numbered three. Causality figures vary, between 12 and 18, which included the death of the Somali ambassador to Switzerland. Later reports indicate the total dead numbered 14. Several more wounded. By the end of the siege military forces had regained control of the hotel.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in near the seaport (Marka) in the night of 28/03. The fighting lasted for about half an hour after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Mushaani Village (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 28/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A group of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire with suspected al Shabaab fighters who were allegedly trying to kill one of the SNG soldiers in Doonka Weynow (12km N of Afgooye) in the morning of 28/03. No casualties were reported.

Gunmen from Dhulbahante/Hassan Ugas sub-clan reportedly carjacked a track and abducted three men from Hawiye/Hawaadle sub-clan who were on board at the time in the vicinity of Bali-Hadhac (62km NE of Buuhoodle) on 28/03. The motive of the attack is currently unclear but its believed to be related to a previous incident where gunmen from Hawiye carjacked a Dhulbahante track in Beled-Weyne area following a dispute over business. Reports indicate that Somaliland police in support of local Dhulbahante elders reportedly rescue the three men and their track and brought to Laas Caanood police station.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland security forces on a mission to disarm all police officers who left their bases without authorization shot and killed a civilian in Argo neighbourhood in the evening of 28/03. The reason behind the incident is currently unknown. No arrest was reported regarding the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Buulo Jan neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 29/03. The device reportedly hit one of the AMISOM vehicles. AMISOM forces opened gunfire indiscriminately in response to the attack. The AMISOM forces later conducted a security operation, arrested five armed militiamen and seized a number of explosives devices. The militiamen (Biimaal) were later released after SWIA ministers requested AMISOM forces to release them. Both AMISOM and civilian casualties were confirmed but the exact figures are currently unknown.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 29/03. Casualties are unknown.

An IED targeted a check-point (a tax collection point) in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the morning of 30/03. The target was said to be SNG forces manning the checkpoint. Two civilians were injured by the explosion. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a civilian man and his wife in their home in Boqoleey section of Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the night of 30/03. The motive behind the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland Intelligence base in Gulwade section of Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the early morning of 30/03. No casualties were reported from Jubaland forces side while local residents reported one al Shabaab injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces based in Kudhaa village (53km E of Badhaadhe) in the early morning of 30/03. No casualties were reported.

Residents in Wadamogo (18km E of Caynabo) held a peaceful demonstration that was attended by elders and residents mainly women, to show their full support to the decision made by Habar Jeclo elders to end the dialogue between Dhulbahante and Habar Jeclo. The elders noted through the media that the Dhulbahante have tied the talks with the conditional release of Jama Kutiyee, a Dhulbahante man who is currently being held in Somaliland prison after he was reportedly convicted of terrorism charges.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces base in Abdi Wayel neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 30/03. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers detonated an RCIED at NISA forces manning a security checkpoint at Dabka junction (Waaberi District) in the morning of 30/03. One NISA soldier was reportedly injured. The perpetrators escaped.

SNG soldiers manning a checkpoint at Ex-control Afgooye (Hodan District) opened gunfire at a mini-bus carrying civilian passengers in the evening of 03/04. The motive is unclear. One passenger was killed in the shooting.

SNG/ASWJ clashed with al Shabaab fighters in an area south of Buurdhuubo (35km SE of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 31/03. The clashes broke out after both sides arrived in the area to solve a dispute over land ownership between two farmers. Two soldiers from SNG/ASWJ sides suffered minor injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 31/03. AMISOM fighters opened gunfire after the blast. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces checkpoint in the outskirt of Afgooye in the evening of 31/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Gunmen from Habar-Jeclo reportedly shot and killed a man hailing from Dhulbahante/Khalid sub-clan in Balli Cadaad near Xadhaadhanka Village (155km SE of Burco) in the evening of 31/03. The motive behind the killing remains unknown but is believed to be related to the recent armed clashes between the two warring clans in the area of Meygaagle village (26km N of Buuhoodle). The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces manning a checkpoint in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 31/03. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Pro self-declared Westland state militias hailing from Jejele sub-clan shot and killed two men they claimed were al Shabaab members in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood of Beled Weyne in the evening of 01/04. The militia reportedly said that the men had confessed to be al Shabaab members, although this could not be verified independently.

SNG forces conducting a security operation outside Buulo Burte clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Jameeco Mubaarak (21km SE of Buulo Burte) in the morning of 01/04. There are conflicting casualties of al Shabaab fighters. Villagers reported that bodies of al Shabaab fighters were put on the streets for the public to view. Numbers not known.

A peaceful demonstration was staged in Dhusamareeb attended by the public to voice their support for the Central State building conference to be held in Dhusamareeb in the afternoon of 01/04. No insecurity incident was reported. Reports indicate that Somalia president has postponed his planned visit to Dhusamareeb.

A SNG soldier (Xawadle) was shot and injured by unidentified perpetrators in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 01/04. The motive is unknown but could be related to clan revenge. The assailants escaped.

A brief armed clash reportedly erupted between herders from Habar Jeclo/Sool Madow and Dhulbahante/Ahmed Garad sub-clans near Kalshaale Village (40km NE of Buuhoodle) on 01/04. The fighting follows the recent fresh tensions between the two sides following the killings of Dhulbahante man near Xadhaadhanka Village on 31/03. One combatant from Dhulbahante/Ahmed Garad sub-clan was injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a check-point manned by SNG forces in Bariirre Village (26km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 01/04. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a local tax collector in Dhagax-Tuur neighbourhood in Afgooye in the afternoon of 01/04. No casualties were reported.

A civilian man was abducted from his home in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) by unidentified people in the morning of 01/04. His decapitated body was found in the same morning at the new livestock market area in Isha neighbourhood. The motive is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A group of al Shabaab operatives reportedly exchanged fire for a short while with Puntland forces manning the southern check point of Bossaso in the evening of the 01/04. Two people were reportedly injured in the shootout.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed Jubaland forces traveling in a private Mini-bus in Yoontoy Yare Village (25km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 01/04. The forces were heading to Buulo Gaduud when the incident happened. One Jubaland soldier was killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Defusal: Jubaland forces on patrol discovered an IED in Aargo section of Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the night of 01/04. The IED was safely detonated.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base near Livestock Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 01/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

SNG forces conducting security operations on industrial road opened gunfire at a University Bus carrying students heading to Somali University in Hawl-Wadaag District in the morning of 01/04/2015. The driver was killed and a civilian female bystander was injured in the shooting. Reports show that the forces suspected the Bus and opened gunfire at it. SNG forces have arrested the shooter.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a woman in the vicinity of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 01/04. The motive is currently unknown.

""A driver for an INGO was shot and injured in Hawl-Wadaag. He was taken to the hospital because his wounds required surgical intervention. The attack was reportedly a result of tension between clans.""

Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a woman's residence in Siliga in Berdaale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the early morning of 03/04 after no one had showed up to open the door. The gunmen killed the woman together with her daughter. The reason for the killing is unknown but unconfirmed reports indicate the woman was a cook for the SWIA Security Minister. Another woman was shot and killed at the same time in the same neighbourhood by other unknown gunmen. The victim was said to be the chairperson for the neighbourhoods watch team. The perpetrators escaped and no arrest was made.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Sheikh Abrone neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 04/04. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. One civilian bystander was reportedly injured in the shooting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A hand grenade thrown by suspected al Shabaab operatives, targeting the house of Jubaland police commissioner landed in a nearby civilian residence and injured a mother and her two daughters in Siinay section of Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 04/04. The injured civilians were taken to Kismaayo hospital for treatments. No arrests were reported.

Unidentified armed men with pistols shot and killed a SNG military officer at Former US Embassy Building area (Wadajir District) in the evening of 04/04. The reason for the killing is unclear and the perpetrators escaped.

A SNG soldier shot and killed his colleague at the MIA Civilian Gate (Wadajir/Medina District) in the morning of 04/04 following a dispute over unknown reasons. Other SNG soldiers in the area arrested the perpetrator.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Lami yaraha neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the midday of 04/04. The reason for the killing is unknown and the perpetrator escaped.

Kenyan war planes reportedly destroyed two al Shabaab positions Gaadondhowe Village (40km SE of Beled Xawo) on 05/04 in response to the Garissa University killing. The destruction of the camps could not be independently confirmed. Al Shabaab later denied their destruction.

A Somaliland army officer from Habar Jeclo/Soolamadaw sub-clan killed his colleague and injured another in a Somaliland army base in Gambadha Village (28km E of Laas Caanood) in the morning of 05/04 following an escalated dispute. The victims hail from Habar Yonis/Cali Siciid. The perpetrator was arrested and transferred to Burco.

Unidentified gunmen opened fire at civilians in Gadoon Village (22km SE of Godinlabe), killing at least 3 people in the morning of 05/04. The motive of the attack is said to be clan revenge between within Habar Gidir/Ayr/Absiye sub-clans.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Puntland forces manning a check point near Karama 1 Hotel in Bosasso in the evening of the 05/04. The two sides exchanged gun fire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Three soldiers reported wounded.

Unidentified gunmen shot and injured the DC of Carmo and his sister in Carmo (205km S of Bosasso) in the evening of 05/04. The DCs body guard was killed in the attack. The motive of the attack is unknown but it is believed that the attackers were al Shabaab elements. The incident happened in the residence of the DC.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in Livestock Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 05/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after that al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a vehicle belonging to Waaberi DC near Waaberi Police station (Waaberi District) in the evening of 05/04.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Galbeed Police Station in Dharkeynley District in the evening of 05/04. The grenade exploded without causing casualties. The attackers managed to escape.

A group of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Ceel-Afweyn court on 06/04 to express their anger against the regular postponement of cases against local youths. The demonstrators were mostly parents of the detained youths from Habar-Jeclo/Biciide sub-clan and Habar-Yunis/Sacad Yonis sub-clan following clashes between rival youth gangs.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Baar Ismail checkpoint (Afgooye) in the morning of 06/04. AMISOM forces opened gunfire after the blast. Another IED was found near the scene of the blast and was later disabled.

Armed men from Rer Mahad and Rer Qalaf (who are both Umar Mohamud-Majerteen Clan) clashed over the ownership of a parcel of land in an area close to Warshad Kaabka in Galkacyo north on 06/04. One combatant was killed and two others injured. Puntland police intervened and managed to disperse the two sides.

Two INGO staff members were stabbed and injured by a civilian man using a dagger over alleged land dispute in Garowe in the morning of 06/04. No arrests were made in connection with the incident but the police are searching the perpetrator.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost at the former Eimiska building (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 06/04. Two sides exchanged gunfire briefly but no casualties were reported. Al Shabaab fighters also carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base at the former Pasta Factory (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 06/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly but casualties could not be established.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in Al-Baraka neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 06/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at SNG soldiers manning a checkpoint at Florence Junction (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 06/04. No casualties were reported and the attackers escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two people (civilians) in Al-Baraka neighbourhood in Hodan District in the evening of 06/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the perpetrators escaped.

An unidentified gunman shot and killed an elderly man in Afarta Darjiino Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 06/04. The reason for the killing is unknown. The victim had been involved in a land dispute with another person and the regional court ruled in his favour recently. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED supposedly targeting an AMISOM convoy exploded in the vicinity of Ceel Saliini Village (32km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 07/04 and missed the target. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

A gunman from Habar Jeclo/Soolamadaw sub-clan shot and killed a man from Dhulbahante/Barkad sub-clan near Qorilugud Village (38km NW of Buuhoodle) on 07/04 after suspecting the man of being on spying mission. However, reports indicate that the victim was mentally ill. The perpetrator escaped. The killing caused tension between Habar Jeclo and Dhulbahante sub-clans in area with both sub-clans mobilizing their militias. The murder comes at a time when there were ongoing talks between the two sub-clans with a view of ending the sporadic revenge killings between the two sides.

An IED targeted the second deputy governor of Mudug Region, Ahmed Muse Nuur, behind Galkacyo Hospital in Galkacyo North in the morning of 07/04. His body guards opened fire after the blast. The deputy governor and seven others were injured in the explosion. There was a second explosion that seemingly targeted curious residents who milled around the incident scene. One person was injured in the second blast. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland Darawish forces staged a peacefully demonstration in protest over salary non-increment in Kismaayo in the morning of 07/04. The Darawish forces have been demanding increment since the beginning of this year. The soldiers refused to collect their March salary.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces launched a hit-and-run attack against al Shabaab fighters in Turqata Village (20km W of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 07/04. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash. Jubaland forces seized two AK 47 rifles belonging to the two al Shabaab fighters.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 07/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified armed men with pistols shot and killed an assistant engineer working as a third party contractor for a UN agency and injured his driver in Xamar Bile neighbourhood (Wardhiigleey District) in the morning of 07/04. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack on 08/04. The only justification given by al Shabaab for the attack was the fact that the victim was a member of Banadir regional administration.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 7 April, [al Shabaab] forces in Galguduud region heavily attacked bases belonging to Ethiopian forces in Ceelbuur town. Reports say that [al Shabaab] inflicted heavy casualties (numbers not known) on the enemy forces. Radio Andalus is pro al Shabaab.

A Dhulbahante armed group loyal to Mohamed Farah Aden, the former Puntland minister of fisheries, who recruited locals and mining experts to explore minerals exchanged gunfire with Somaliland forces in a mountain near Carro Weyne village (45km NE of Buuhoodle) on 08/04. The former minister and his team refused to surrender to Somaliland forces who were attempting to stop the exploration activities. The former minister and four of his team were arrested while a man from Dhulbahante/Barkad sub-clan was injured and later succumbed to his injuries in Laas Caanood. Local elders have stepped to try to secure the release of the former minister.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Dhagaxtuur neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 08/04. The perpetrators escaped.

Somaliland troops based in Widh Widh (48km NE of Buuhoodle) exchanged gunfire with former Puntland minister of fisheries in accompany of armed men. The forces later managed to arrest the Ex-minister and three of his men on 08/04.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a woman in Billaajo Carab neighbourhood (Shibis District) in the afternoon of 08/04. The victim was reportedly working with the local district administration. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Garasbaaley (Hodan District) in the evening of 08/04. The RCIED hit one of the AMISOM vehicles. AMISOM forces opened gunfire after the blast. Casualties could not be established. The perpetrator(s) escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 08/04. The fighting lasted for almost fifteen minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

A SNG soldier opened gunfire at a mini-bus at Ex-Control Afgooye in the afternoon of 09/04, killing one passenger (male) in the afternoon of 09/04. The reason for the shooting remains unclear and the perpetrator was arrested by SNG forces in the area but was released later.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded two elders (between 80 and 90 years-old) from of Rahaweyn/Luweys sub-clans in Hunyaley Village (13km E Xudur) in the night of 11/04. The al Shabaab executed the elders after accusing them of working with the apostate administration (referring to ISWA administration in Xudur).
A local journalist working for Radio Mogadishu Website was shot and injured by unidentified men armed with pistols near KPP Junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 10/04.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces attacked al Shabaab fighters near Wareer Maleh Village (39km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 11/04. One al Shabaab fighter was killed in the clash. The AMISOM forces seized nine sets of SNG army uniforms.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in the vicinity of Mahad Alle Car Wash in Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 11/04. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties numbered two (Alldhacdo).

At least six mortars fired from unknown location targeting the former Defence Ministry landed near the former Guulwadayasha base and the Ministry in Dayniile District in the evening of 11/04. Initial reports indicate that three civilians were killed and seven others wounded in Guulwadayasha neighbourhood in the mortar attack.
Unidentified men armed with Pistols shot and killed two SNG Mogadishu municipality tax policemen in Suuq Bacaad Market (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 11/04 and escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked a hotel in Qoryooley town where the governor of Lower Shabelle had been staying in the night of 12/04. The guards of the governor engaged in a 30-minute shoot-out with the attackers. One of the governors guards was killed and four others wounded in the fighting. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

A Somaliland soldier from Warsangeli/Reer garad Sub-clan shot and killed his commander from Warsangeli/Dubays in Ceel-Buh Village (112km SE of Ceerigaabo) in the morning of 12/04 following a dispute of the soldiers salary payment. The soldier was immediately arrested by other Somaliland soldiers.
Al Shabaab fighters attack residence of the District Commissioner of Beled Xawo (12/04). Further details of the attack not known.

At least four Mortar rounds fired from unknown location landed inside the ministry of defence compound (Dayniile District) in the morning of 12/04. A ceremony to mark the Somali National Army Day Anniversary was taking place in the Compound when the mortar rounds landed. No casualties were reported. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack through Somalimemo.net.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Two RCIED explosions took place at Dayniile Junction in the vicinity of the former Jaale Siyad Military Academy (Dayniile District) in the morning of 12/04. The explosions happened just after a AMISOM/SNG military convoy guarding the SNG president passed the area. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. The president was travelling to Dayniile to attend a ceremony marking the 55th anniversary of Somali army at the former Defence Ministry.

""According to a local media report, 3 aid workers for an INGO, 2 UN contracted staff from a private company, and 2 private company staff members were kidnapped in Gedo by armed gunmen thought to be part of Al Shabaab. The aid workers were allegedly abducted between Garilley and Fafahdun towns and taken to Bardere. They were all released on different dates with the help of local elders and the last release of the INGO staff members took place on June 14th.""

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED exploded in the vicinity of Ceel-Wareegow village (11km NE of Marka) in the morning of 13/04. An AMISOM convoy heading to Mogadishu was passing the road when the incident happened. No casualties or vehicle damages were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces at a checkpoint in Cumar Beere (9km NW of Marka) in the night of 13/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Security guards for the Public works and housing deputy Minister of ISWA (Interim South West Administration) shot and killed a civilian man (a wheelbarrow porter) in Horseed neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the morning of 13/04. The reason for the killing remains unknown and no arrests were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in S. Company Building (Heliwa District) in the evening of 13/04. The two sides engaged in a brief gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. One SNG soldier was reportedly killed in the clash while three others were injured.

Xawadle militia exchange gunfire with security personnel at a private construction site of a sports stadium in Ceel Jaale neighbourhood in Beled Weyne on 14/04 following a land ownership dispute between the local authority and the Xawadle militia. Xawadle militia decided to stop the construction using by force. No casualties were reported but the construction is suspended until the problem is solved.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces checkpoint in War Mahan Village (30km NW of Afgooye) in the evening of 14/04. Both groups engaged in a brief exchange of gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces and al Shabaab fighters reportedly clashed in Galgala village (35km SW of Bosasso) in the evening of 15/04. Reports indicate that the fighting was initiated by al fighters and lasted for around 45 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Four suspected al Shabaab fighters dressed in SNG forces uniform carried out a complex attack on the Ministry of Culture and Higher Education compound near Zobe Junction (Hodan District) on 14/04. There was a suspected SVBIED explosion at the gate followed by armed men storming the building. The attackers threw hand grenades and exchanged gunfire with SNG police guarding the compound. NISAs Gaashan unit and AMISOM forces immediately arrived at the scene and engaged in gun battles with the attackers. Initial reports indicate that about 11 people, including two police officers and the attackers, have been killed. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack. Among the injured was a Chinese diplomat. Later reports hold a total of 21 dead; six security operatives and 15 civilians (Xinhua).
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Ceelasha Biyaaha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 15/04. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against NISA base in Sarta Qabyada building (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 15/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Mahadaay (12km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 16/04. A girl was hit and injured by a stray bullet. No other casualties were reported.

Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against the Somaliland forces based in Kalabaydh Village (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 16/04. The Somaliland forces responded with artillery fire after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Militiamen hailing from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed a pastoralist hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan near Gamafole Village (55km NE of Galkacyo) in the evening of 16/04. The incident was reportedly in revenge for previous killings between the two sides.

Reports from Cadaado town, the HQ of the Ximin and Xeeb state, say large protests are going on there against plans to have Dhuusamareeb the [new] capital of the central regions. The protests are ongoing at the Ximin and Xeeb presidential HQ with hundreds of angry people stoning the HQ building.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters and ENDF clashed near Korow-Rooge Village (15km SE of Baidoa) in the morning of 17/04. The fighting started after al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF military convoy travelling between Daynuunay Village and Baidoa town. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in Siinka Dheer (Afgooye District) in the night of 17/04. The fighting went for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of the Jubalands health minister in Waamo section of Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 17/04. The bomb landed in an open area, injuring one of the security guards of the minister. The attackers escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters and Puntland police manning Baalade police station in Bosasso clashed in the evening of 17/04. The fighting was initiated by the al Shabaab fighters who attacked the police station. The two sides exchanged fire for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The stations deputy police commander was injured in the clash.

An armed clash broke out between Duduble and Habar Iji at a water catchment in Lebi Dunle, near Dhaban dhulkuhayn area (about 26km N of Dhusamareeb) in the morning of 18/04, following a dispute over water catchment in the area. Three people were killed (I from Duduble and 2 from Habar Iji) and several others were wounded.

Biimaal militia ambushed two SNG soldiers riding on a motorbike near Gendawi (7km W of Marka) in the morning of 18/04. The two sides engaged in an armed clash before the SNG soldiers received reinforcement from Shalaambood and forced the attackers to withdraw. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. Two SNG soldiers were injured during the fight.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AMISOM (KDF) contingent conducted attacked al Shabaab base in Gheldezza area (90km SW of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 18/04. Reports indicate that 12 al Shabaab fighters were killed and their weapons seized. Three KDF soldiers were killed and seven others injured.
SNG forces arrested a suspected al Shabaab operative in Waajid in the afternoon of 18/04. The suspect managed to escape from the police during but was immediately shot dead before going far.
SNG forces on security operation shot and killed an al Shabaab sympathizer in Qaydar Edi Village (27km NW of Xudur) in the afternoon of 18/04. The SNG forces later returned to their base in Xudur.

Al Shabaab fighters picked a civilian a woman from her house in Goof Gaduud Village (30km NW of Baidoa) and beheaded her in the outskirt of the village in the night of 18/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear. The victim hails from Rahaweyn/Harin sub-clan.

Unidentified armed men in car shot and killed a Puntland state MP in front of his house in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the midday of 18/04. The reason for the shooting remains unclear and the perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed two SNG soldiers in Sei-Biano neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the night of 18/04. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters opened fire using small guns towards new Kismaayo airport from north-eastern direction of the airport in the evening of 19/04. AMISOM/KDF responded by opening fire in the direction of the attackers. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/ENDF convoy in Gasarla (8km SE of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 19/04. Reports indicate that the convoy was returning from Buur Hakaba when the ambush happened. The telecommunication network was switched off during the attack. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and two others were injured. Injured AMISOM soldiers were evacuated to Baidoa.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM military convoy travelling between Leego (49km E of Buur Hakaba) and Bali-Doogle Airport (13km NW of Wanla Weyn) in the morning of 19/04. The ambush started with RCIED explosion followed by direct confrontation between the two sides. Two AMISOM soldiers were killed while 12 others were injured. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based near Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 19/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about fifteen minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a taxi driver in his residence in Aymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 19/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the assailants escaped.
SNG forces on security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Buq Goosaar (50km SW of Beled-weyne) in the morning of 20/4. One al Shabaab fighter was killed in the clash.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at the residence of Beled Xawo District Commissioner in the evening of 20/04. The hand grenade exploded in an empty area. Security guards at the residence opened fire after the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrator managed to escape. This is the second time in a span of two weeks in which the DCs residence came under attack.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Mushani Village (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 20/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces base in Rimaygacmeed (5km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 20/04. The fighting lasted for about twenty minutes before the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

A IED targeted a UN agency mini-bus transporting staff between the UN International Guest House and the UN compound in Garowe along the tarmac road opposite Rugsan Hotel in the morning of 20/04. Preliminary information indicates that the attack was carried out by a suicide bomber on foot (PBIED). At least seven people were killed including four UN international staff while seven others, two in serious conditions. Al Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a rickshaw driver in Berdale neighbourhood in Baidoa in the night of 20/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces base in Afmadow in the night of 20/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. An 18-year-old girl was reportedly injured by a stray bullet. Casualties from the warring sides could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in Heliwa Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 20/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Two armed groups hailing from Leelkase and Majeerteen sub-clans exchanged gunfire in Halabookhad IDP camp in Galkacyo North in the evening of 21/04. The shooting reportedly started after the two groups had a dispute over the administering of the camp in Halabookhad. A civilian bystander (woman) was seriously injured by a stray bullet. The woman later succumbed to her injuries at a private hospital in Galkacyo. Puntland mobile police forces in Galkacyo reportedly arrived at the scene and arrested number of combatants from the two sides with the help of the area elders.

An armed clash broke out between the two sub-clans of Dhulbahante (Farah Ali and Samokaab Ali) in Taleex 21/04. The motive of the armed clash is believed to be related to killing revenges and the prolonged disputes between the two sides. Reports later on 21/04 indicate that four combatants were killed. Dhulbahante traditional elders arrived in Taleex to prevent further clashes and open reconciliation talks meeting between the two sides. Somaliland forces were also deployed in the town to also prevent further clashes.

Al Shabaab fighters allegedly abducted a header near Afmadow in the afternoon of 21/04 while grazing his animals. Reports indicate that the man was taken to Buale town in Middle Juba region (100km NE of Afmadow). The reason behind the abduction is currently unclear.

A VBIED targeted Banoda Restaurant, opposite Central Hotel in Boondheere District in the afternoon of 21/04. About 12 people were killed and dozens others injured. The restaurant was frequented by Somali Government officials, security officers and the diaspora. The perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack, saying that the restaurant is frequented by staff working at the presidential palace, other government staff and the diaspora.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 21/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Al Shabaab infighting kills five and injures seven in Halgan and Garesiyaani areas of Hiiraan. The clash stemmed from money extorted from motorists.

Local media reported that a peaceful demonstration organized by Garbahaarey district administration in protest against the selection and distribution of local MPs in Kismaayo took place in Garbahaarey on 22/04. The demonstrators were shouting slogans against Jubaland Interim state. No insecurity incident was reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Cabdi Wayel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 22/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen driving in a vehicle exchanged gunfire with NISA forces in the vicinity of KM4 neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 22/04. Reports indicate that the NISA forces reportedly started the shooting after the gunmen denied security instructions. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of SNG forces, police and military clashed in Zona K neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 22/04. The clash started when about 100 Police forces led by Banadir Region Governor reached Zona K neighbourhood to evict civilian families who were living in state-owned building in the neighbourhood which the military forces opposed. Reports indicate that there were some casualties from both sides but the exact figure of the casualties could not be established. The police forces retreated back from the scene.
Al Shabaab infighting kills five and injures seven in Halgan and Garesiyaani areas of Hiiraan. The clash stemmed from money extorted from motorists.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed two men in Xaawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the night of 23/04. The victims were reportedly working for Afgooye tax collection department. The perpetrators escaped.

Heavily armed gunmen suspected to be members of Al-Shabaab on the morning of 23/04 kidnapped senior Arabia chief in Mandera County Kenya along the Mandera-Arabia road. The chief was driven across the border into Somalia where he was killed at Gadoon Dhowe, Beled Xawo District.

Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade against police pick-up in Buulo Mareer town (29km SW of Marka) in the morning of 23/04. The vehicle was reportedly carrying a newly appointed police commissioner for Buulo Mareer. The vehicle was damaged by the blast but no human casualties were reported. The perpetrator(s) escaped.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Jiiro Maskiin neighbourhood (Wadajir District) in the morning of 23/04. The perpetrators escaped.
A senior military officer was shot dead in the Somali capital, al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility. The district within the capital is not known.

Non-violent activity: A group of al Shabaab fighters went to Qaydar Edi Village (27km NW of Xudur) on 24/04 and allegedly confiscated mobile phones and other valuables from the residents while reportedly setting on fire the fence of a water catchment. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters intimidated the villagers and forced them to move to Moro Gabey (28km SW of Xudur).

SNG forces on a security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Burdho village (27km NE of Tayeeglow) in the morning of 24/04. The fighting lasted for around 30 minutes and both sides used light and heavy weapons. One SNG soldier was seriously injured while two al Shabaab fighters have been killed and their guns were been confiscated.

Residents of Sinai neighbourhood (Hargeisa) held a peaceful demonstration on 24/04 in protest against arrest of one of their local religious leader. The arrested religious leader was accused of violence, inciting the public and criticizing the government of hosting so many foreigners in the country.
Al Shabaab authorities executed a man who allegedly abused Prophet Mohammed following after a court found him guilty. The execution was carried out in a public ground in Jamaame on 24/04.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNG forces based in Ceel Buur in the night of 25/04. Both sides exchanged gun-fire for around 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not been established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/SNG forces convoy in Abaq Beeday village (16km E of Xudur) along the main road between Xudur and Tayeeglow in the afternoon of 25/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties on both sides could not be established while AMISOM forces have so far not confirmed the ambush.

Unidentified attacker(s) shot and killed a member of council of elders from Jejele clan in front of his house in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the night of 25/04. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear. The perpetrator(s) escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a former SNG MP hailing from Rahanweyn/Gelidle sub-clan in Abdalla Shideeye section in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 25/04. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the assailants escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed an SNG government official in Kor-Damac neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 25/04. The victim was a chairperson of a neighbourhood in Dayniile District and the reason for the killing is currently unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed an SNG government official in Israac neighbourhood (Xamar jajab District) in the evening of 25/04. The reason behind the killing remains unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in the outskirt of Afgooye in the night of 26/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a while after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

A group of gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab fighters stopped a mini-bus transporting goats from Maxaas to Buulo Burte in Abooreey (22km NE of Buulo Burte) in the night of 26/04 and abducted the owner and taking to unknown destination.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab operatives shot and killed two body guards of newly nominated Jubaland MP in Via-Afmadow in Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 26/04. The motive behind the killing remained unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in KPP neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 26/04. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear while the assailants escaped.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Moalim Nur neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) over dispute of manning of a checkpoint in the evening of 26/04. One soldier was killed and three others were injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces manning a checkpoint in the outskirts of Bariirre Village (27km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 27/04. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab attackers took over the check-point but withdrew shortly thereafter Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces manning a checkpoint in Cumar-Beere Village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 27/04. The two groups exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in the Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 27/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

An IED targeted a vehicle driven by a staff of an INGO near Radio Galkacyo in Israac neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the morning of 28/04. The device seems to be planted inside the vehicle before it exploded. The staff escaped unhurt but the blast injured three women passerby and seriously damaged the vehicle. No arrests were made in connection with the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: A RCIED targeted AMISOM (KDF) convoy in Gosay area - a grazing land - (38km SW of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 28/04. An AMISOM (KDF) truck was damaged at the rear part by the blast. The forces open fire after the explosion. No casualties were reported both the explosion and the subsequent shooting.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces base in the outskirts of Janaale (13km NW of Marka) in the evening of 28/04. The exchange of gunfire lasted for a few minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces and al Shabaab/Galgala fighters clashed in Galgala mountain (35km SW of Bossaso) in the morning of 28/04. The clash started after Puntland forces advanced towards al Shabaab/Galgala fighters position in Galgala mountains. Casualties could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against Puntland police forces manning at the first check point of Bosasso port in the night of 29/04. A bystander businessman was killed by the blast while two women were injured. The perpetrators escaped. No arrests were made in connection with incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Puntland police manning the first check point of Bosasso port in the night of 29/04. A bystander (businessman) was killed in the blast and two others were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a NISA post in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the evening of 28/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about five minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces in Janaale (13km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 30/04. The forces opened fire after the blast. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Mareerey Village (roughly 5km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 30/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No Casualties were reported.

Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade at a crowd in a market in Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 30/04. Reports indicate that SNG soldiers were present at the scene when the incident happened, but it is not clear if they were involved. Four businesswomen were injured in the blast.

Unidentified men armed with AK47 shot and killed a local radio (Radio Baidoa) reporter and his wife near Unay junction in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the night of 30/04. The victims were in their house when the incident happened while a third person (a neighbour) who came out of his house following the gunshot was also killed. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown.

Al Shabaab abducted a local a pastoralist from Waraha Dhobley Village (45km NW of Buale) in the night of 30/04. Reports say the man was taken and detained in Buale. The reason of the abduction is not clear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Puntland forces in Galgala (35km SW of Bosasso) on the night of 30/04.The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Puntland soldier was reportedly killed in the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against the SNG forces position in Ramey Gacmeed Village (4Km S of Afgooye) in the night of 01/05. The two sides engaged in a brief exchange of gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Khatumo forces reportedly attacked Somaliland forces based in Kalabayr (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 01/05. Somaliland forces responded with heavy guns after which the Khatumo were forced to withdraw. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy detonated near Bilan Bridge in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 02/05. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. Reports indicate that an AMISOM truck was damaged in the explosion. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Ceelasha Biyaha. The soldiers opened fire after the blast. No injuries reported, perpetrators unknown.

Unidentified armed men shot and injured a local Imam shortly after evening prayers in Kooshin neighbourhood in Beled Weyne in the evening of 02/05. The victim sustained serious injuries and was rushed to hospital for treatments. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and run attack against SNG forces outpost in the Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 02/05. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
A RCIED targeted the District Commissioner of Ceel Waaq on 03/05. Slight injuries reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at SNG police on foot patrol in Xawo Tako neighbourhood in Afgooye in the evening of 03/05. The hand grenade missed the target and caused no casualties. The attackers managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Siinka Dheer settlement (Afgooye District) in the evening of 03/05. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a residential house of a man from Rahaweyn/Emid sub-clan in Berdale neighbourhood in Baidoa in the night of 03/05. The owner of the house and the gunmen exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. The motive is unclear. The man is involved in a road construction project in the neighbourhood which is funded by an INGO. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters killed two SNG soldiers and captured two others in a surprise against SNG forces manning a check point in War-Cadey neighbourhood of Beled Xawo in the night of 03/05. A small number of SNG forces were at the checkpoint during the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters removed a resident (Luways) from his house in Diinsor in the evening of 03/03 and beat him to death. There is no information that a court has sentenced the man but rumours indicate that he was accused of having relationship with the SNG.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers shot and killed Puntland Darawish soldier hailing from the Majeerteen/Ali Jibrail in a tea shop near the milk market in Bosasso and injured the tea shop lady in the evening of 03/05. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear. The incident is believed to be clan revenge but police say it was an al Shabaab perpetrated act. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters killed two women in Bana Village (15Km SE of Xudur) in the night of 03/05. The reason is unknown. However, reports indicate that the victims were businesswomen and were suspected of smuggling goods into Xudur which is under an al Shabaab economic blockade.
Al Shabaab attacks the home of the District Commissioner of Afgooye District, leading to the deaths of several of his security guards.

Militias from Habar Gidir/Saleban and Habar Gidir/Ayr sub-clans clashed in Xamro village (48km SW of Xarardheere) on 04/05 over grassland dispute. Four combatants from both sides were injured in the clash and tensions are reportedly building up in the area.

column6: Police Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Prison Guards
column17: Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a Jubaland prison officer in Farjano neighbourhood in Kismaayo in the evening of 04/05. The reason for the killing remains unknown and the perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Tixsiile village (20km NW of Afgooye) in the evening of 04/05. The two sides engaged in a brief gunfire. Casualties could not be established.

A group of people held a demonstration in Masalaha area in Mohamud Haybe District (Hargeisa) in the morning of 04/05. The demonstrators were claiming the ownership of a piece of land given to a group of businessmen by the government. Local traditional elders also held a press conference and said they will not allow the government to give their land to the business people. Police arrived at the scene and shot in the air to disperse the protesters. No arrests were made.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and injured a civilian man in Biyo Kulule neighbourhood in Bosasso in the evening of 04/05. The victim was taken to Bossaso hospital for treatment and the attackers escaped. It was later learned the victim may have had some link to al Shabaab, either now or in the past.

Armed militiamen manning an illegal checkpoint opened fire at a lorry near Mudul-Braawe Village (5km NW of Baraawe) in the morning of 04/05. The motive behind the shooting is believed to be an attempt to extort money from the driver. An old man in the truck was killed in the shooting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against Puntland police forces manning a checkpoint in new Bossaso neighbourhood in Bossaso in the evening of 04/05. A bystander was reportedly killed and two others injured. A second hand grenade was thrown at the police just minutes after the first one after which both sides exchanged gunfire. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against Puntland forces based in Yalho village (50km S of Bossaso) in the evening of 04/05.The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which Puntland forces withdrew. Further reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters took over the village briefly and burnt two battle wagons from Puntland forces. Three Puntland soldiers were reportedly killed and six others injured in the attack. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Abdi Wayeel building (Heliwa District) in the night of 04/05. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG military commander in the vicinity of Cigarettes and Matches Factory Compound (Dayniile District) in the evening of 04/05. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the assailants managed to escape from the scene.

Two groups of SNG military forces exchanged gunfire in the vicinity of Ex-control Afgooye (Dharkenley District) in the morning of 04/05 over a land ownership dispute. The commanders of the two sides intervened and managed to stop the exchange of gunfire. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a group of SNA soldiers manning illegal checkpoint in the outskirt of Aw Dheegle (37km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 05/05. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Sha

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Cumar-Beere village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the morning of 05/05. The two sides exchanged gunfire. No casualties were reported.
SNG forces briefly take over Abal village and release a prisoner held in an al Shabaab prison. No causalities reported.
Al Shabaab reportedly execute four they accuse of spying for the CIA. Two of the executed were SNG soldiers.

A businessman shot at a local government official during a meeting to end a land ownership dispute in Berbera on 05/05. The man missed the target and immediately escaped. The official was unhurt and the police are looking for the perpetrator.
A business woman was shot and killed in Qansax Dheere town by suspected al Shabaab fighters in the evening of 05/05. The motive is unknown and the assassins escaped. No arrests were reported.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a young man in Al-Baraka neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 05/05. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG army based at Sarta Qabyada in Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 05/05. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeting AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 06/05. The RCIED hit one of the AMISOM vehicles. AMISOM forces reportedly opened gunfire after the blast while they also closed the road and denied civilian access for some hours. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy passing near Rage-Ceele (45km NE of Warsheikh) in the morning of 06/05 which was followed by brief exchange of gunfire. One AMISOM soldier was reportedly killed in the crossfire.

An IED or hand grenade attack targeted a teashop in Xaawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 06/05. A group of SNG forces were in the area when the incident happened. It is not clear whether the explosion was caused by an explosive device planted in the teashop or a hand grenade. Reports indicate that a number of SNG soldiers and civilian bystanders were injured.

Unidentified gunmen in a car shot and killed the deputy DC of Wadajir/Medina District in Nasteexo neighbourhood (Wadajir District) in the morning of 06/05. One of the guards of the district official was also killed in the attack. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG soldiers manning a security outpost in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 06/05. Casualties are unknown.

Unidentified attacker (s) armed with pistols shot and killed one of Hodan District youth council members near the District Office (Hodan District) in the evening of 06/05. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. Perpetrator (s) escaped.
Al Shabaab attacks a police checkpoint in the Suuqa Xoolaha area, police causalities reported, exact numbers not known. Andalus is pro-al Shabaab.

SNGF on security operation engaged in an armed clash with al Shabaab fighters in Abooreey, 21 KM NE of Bulo Burte in the afternoon of 07/05. Reportedly around five al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clashes before al Shabaab withdrew. The security operation is meant to remove al Shabaab from the main roads, where they regularly attack civilians or AMISOM convoys to reinforce the economic blockade imposed on liberated towns.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM/ENDF convoy was ambushed by suspected al Shabaab fighters in Korow Rooge (15km SE of Baidoa) around midday of 07/05 from al Shabaab fighters. During the ambush, no casualties were reported and al Shabaab fighters withdrew immediately.
