ENDF forces started a security operation and arrested 25 people from the village and took them to Baidoa for further investigation but it is not clear if the arrested people are normal villagers or al Shabaab affiliates. AMISOM convoys are regularly ambushed by al Shabaab fighters on the road between Baidoa and Buur Hakaba.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier and injured another one in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood of Heliwa District in the evening of 07/05/2015. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the assailants managed to escape from the scene.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a former al Shabaab member who defected to the Somali Government in Towfiiq neighbourhood of Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 07/05/2015. The victim was a former Judge in Diinsoor District of Bay Region but defected from al Shabaab side soon after the killing of Abdullahi Sahal aka Isku-Dhuug by an American Drone Strike in 2014. A pro-al Shabaab website, Somalimemo.net published a report claiming that Amniyat killed him in Towfiiq neighbourhood of Yaaqshiid District, the report accused him of being behind a number of Drone attacks on al Shabaab Officials.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Saldhiga Galbeed Police station in the morning of 07/05/2015. The hand grenade did not cause any casualty and attackers managed to escape from the scene.
A RCIED planted inside a NISA kiosk along Aden Cade road (Wardhiigley District) detonated in the morning of 07/05. Two soldiers were killed and another two were injured. Perpetrators escaped.

Supporters of Somaliland opposition parties staged a demonstration against the decision by the Upper House of Parliament to extend the term of the current government for one year. The demonstrators burned tires at the main Burao bridge. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators. Later in the evening the presence of heavy patrols and police was felt around the towns central business district.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: An AMISOM/KDF convoy was hit by a RCIED explosion in Kolbiyow, 33 KM SW of Badhaadhe District in the morning of 08/05. One Caspir was damaged in the explosion and four KDF soldiers were injured. The convoy proceeded after the attack and no other incident was reported.

Garre and Abgaal fighters fought the second time in two days inside Qoryooley town in the evening of 09/05 following confrontations on Friday (08/05). The fighting lasted for about twenty minutes after which the fighting stopped. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab kills two women in Bana village, outside of Xudur.

After the killing of two women by al Shabaab fighters in Bana village, 15 KM SE of Hudur, SNGF conducted a security operation in Orogley, 23 KM SW of Hudur including the outlying villages on 08/05. One woman, hailing from Jeron sub-clan and married to an al Shabaab fighter was killed by SNGF in revenge in Orogley for the killing of two women by al Shabaab in Bana village. It is not the first time that SNGF in Bakool region conduct revenge killings after al Shabaab fighters were killing civilians in the region.
Six al Shabaab fighters are killed by military forces outside Xudur in an offensive that liberated seven unnamed locations.
Al Shabaab target and assassinate a Puntland MP following evening prayers in Galkacyo North.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Joint AMISOM/SNGF forces on security operation have arrested an al Shabaab fighter in Caday, 15 KM SE of Ceel Buur in the evening of 09/05. The man, said to hail from Murusade sub-clan was transferred to Ceel Buur main base for further interrogation. During the arrest, two other al Shabaab fighters were killed by the forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy heading from Rabdhuure to Wajiid in Waab Giraad village, 54 KM SE of Yeed in the morning of 09/05. Both sides engaged in an armed clash and used small arms fire and heavy weapons. One ENDF track was destroyed after it was hit by a RPG. Al Shabaab retreated from the scene. Fifteen al Shabaab fighters were killed and eighteen others injured. The casualty from ENDF sides cannot be established. A military helicopter landed on the site after the fighting ceased and al Shabaab was repelled from the area presumably collecting injured ENDF soldiers. Around 12:00 the same convoy was ambushed again by al Shabaab at War Dhujiiley village, 55 KM SE of Yeed. Both sides briefly exchange small arms fire and two al Shabaab were reportedly killed in this incident. Al Shabaab were repelled and retreated from the area. The convoy proceeded to Buur Dhuxunley village, 59 KM SE of Yeed. The telecommunication was switched off during the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy heading from Rabdhuure to Wajiid in Waab Giraad village, 54 KM SE of Yeed in the morning of 09/05. Both sides engaged in an armed clash and used small arms fire and heavy weapons. One ENDF track was destroyed after it was hit by a RPG. Al Shabaab retreated from the scene. Fifteen al Shabaab fighters were killed and eighteen others injured. The casualty from ENDF sides cannot be established. A military helicopter landed on the site after the fighting ceased and al Shabaab was repelled from the area presumably collecting injured ENDF soldiers. Around 12:00 the same convoy was ambushed again by al Shabaab at War Dhujiiley village, 55 KM SE of Yeed. Both sides briefly exchange small arms fire and two al Shabaab were reportedly killed in this incident. Al Shabaab were repelled and retreated from the area. The convoy proceeded to Buur Dhuxunley village, 59 KM SE of Yeed. The telecommunication was switched off during the incident.

Garre and Abgaal fighters fought the second time in two days inside Qoryooley town in the evening of 09/05 following confrontations on Friday (08/05). The fighting lasted for about twenty minutes after which the fighting stopped. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 09/05. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after that the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Somali journalists, (among others) protest AMISOMs use of sniffer dogs. Location not known; likely in Mogadishu.

Al Shabaab fighters took over Dhamase village, 105 KM SW of Beled Xawo without any armed clash with SNG forces in the night of 10/05/2015. They burnt down a military base for SNG forces, the al Shabaab fighters took over the village soon after SNG forces vacated the village after receiving info that al Shabaab fighters are planning an attack the village. No casualties were reported. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the village in the early morning of 11/05.

Militiamen loyal to Sultan Wabar ambushed Borama central police commander and his escort (about fine soldiers), who travelling to Qol-Ujeed in the vicinity Fulin Fulka (7km NW of Borama) in the morning of 10/05. The ambush was followed a brief shooting after which the commander and his soldiers retreated back. A Somaliland soldier was injured.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an armed clash in Qansaxdhere town in the early morning of 10/05/2015. Both sides engaged in a gunfire that lasted for about one hour. One fighter from al Shabaab side and a soldier from SNG side were reported initially reported killed in the attack, though the numbers was raised to five in the following days (Goobjoog website).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM/ENDF on security operation clashed briefly with al Shabaab fighters in Abow Casharow, 5 KM south of Baidoa town on the 10/05. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and a third one was wounded. Al Shabaab fighters immediately retreated.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two Jubaland tax collectors in Suuq Yare section of Shaqalaha Neighbourhood in the evening of 10/05. The perpetrators escaped from the scene and Jubaland security forces conducted a search security operation but no arrests were reported.

An ISWA soldier trainee who was visiting his family was abducted from his house in Hareri-Kaadoyow, approx. 7 KM SW of Baidoa on 10/05 by suspected al Shabaab fighters. They took him to Idale village, 57 KM SW of Baidoa together with his AK47. No more information is available on his fate.

Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade at Marka Police Station in the morning of 10/05. The police forces conducted a security operation in the neighbourhood after the blast and arrested three suspects. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack on SNG forces outpost in Livestock neighbourhood in Heliwa District in the night of 10/05/2015. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly and al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Supporters of Somaliland opposition parties staged a demonstration against the decision of the Upper House to extend the term of the current government for another one year and ten months. Police arrived at the scene, shot towards the protestors and arrested several Wadani opposition party supporters. Seven protesters were injured in the demonstrations.

Ceel-Afweyn police conducted security operations at Ceel-Afweyn Central Market and arrested eight people in the afternoon of 11/05 after scuffles broke out between Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis and Habar Jeclo/Biciide sub-clans. Ceel-Afweyn police said the scuffles are linked to previous stabbing incidents between the two sub-clans following a dispute over the sharing of teachers at Ceel-Afweyn secondary school and Ministry of Education positions on 24/11/2014.

Supporters of Somaliland opposition parties staged a violent demonstration against the decision of the Upper House to extend the term of the current government. The demonstrators burned tires at the main bridge in Burco. Police arrived at the scene to disperse the crowd and arrested a number of Wadani party supporters while three protestors were injured due to the police intervention. Police also surrounded the office of the Wadani opposition party and arrest five senior members for disturbing the peace.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked SNA and police forces that were heading to Rabdhure around Calaame village, 23 Kms SE of Yeed on 11/05. Both sides briefly exchange small arms fire and al Shabaab fighters were repelled from the area. Two al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed and one Police officer was injured in the attack. The soldiers and police forces are part of the local authority deployment of forces to Rabdhure district. No further casualty was reported from the incident and the convoy proceeded to Rabdhure district.

Unidentified attacker(s) threw a hand grenade at a gym in Hanti-wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar town) in the night of 11/05. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. The owner of the business was reportedly injured by blast. Perpetrator(s) escaped.

Unidentified armed men shot and wounded one of SNG Immigration Official in Hawl-Wadaag District Office area in the afternoon of 11/05. The attackers fled the area in their car. The official was transferred to hospital for treatment.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces outpost in Sarta Qabyada in Yaaqshiid District in the night of 11/05/2015. The two sides engaged in a brief gunfire but casualties could not be established.

A SNG police man shot and killed a civilian man in Cagadhiig neighbourhood in Wardhiigley District in the morning of 11/05/2015. The reason for the killing remains unclear and no arrests were reported.

An IED was targeting a mini-bus in Xaawo-Cabdi neighbourhood (Afgooye District) in the morning of 12/05. It is not yet known if the device was a land mine planted beside the road or if it was RCIED attack. The mini-bus came from Afgooye and was heading to Mogadishu when the incident happened. The motive is unknown. Two people were injured by the blast.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters car-jacked a small truck, and kidnapped the driver, owner, his son and two other passengers. The motive is unknown but the owner could have defied the economic embargo imposed by al Shabaab on liberated towns.

An IED Explosion targeting SNG Police outpost detonated in Dabka Junction of Hawl-Wadaag District in the early morning of 12/05/2015. One police officer was reported injured in the explosion, the attackers managed to escape from the scene.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG Police forces outpost in Livestock Market in Heliwa in the evening of 12/05/2015. The two sides engaged briefly gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Al-Shabab kidnapped 14 crew members of an Iranian fishing boat off the coast of Galguduud.

SNGF attacked a house in Moro Gabey (28 KM NW of Xudur) during a security operation in the evening of 13/5. The house is owned by al Shabaab fighters who run away after 20 minutes of gun-fire exchange with SNGF. A woman and her child were seriously injured during the gun fire exchange. No casualties were reported from SNGF or al Shabaab fighters.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Buulo Mareer (29 KM SW of Marka) on 21/05. Three SNGF were injured during the clash. Casualties on al Shabaab side are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters confiscated a private vehicle and kidnapped the owner in Buur Weyn (29 KM south of Bulo Burte) on 13/05. The whereabouts and the fate of the driver are unknown and he stands accused of collaboration with AMISOM/SNF forces, who briefly took over Buur Weyn the previous week.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a young civilian they picked from a car travelling to Baidoa on the 12/05/2015 in Jameecado Abdi-Gurey settlement (18 KM SE of Buur Hakaba town) and put his dead body in Jameecado village in the morning of 13/05/2015. The reason for the killing remains unclear, but unconfirmed reports show that the victim had a small digital Camera with him when al Shabaab fighters picked him from the car.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG police in Ali Turaya neighbourhood on 13/05. After a brief exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab retreated and no casualties were reported.

One SNGF soldier was found dead with bullet wounds in his head in Shalaambood (8 KM west of Marka) in the early morning of 14/05. It is still unclear if it was an assassination or if there is another reason for his killing as his gun was found with him.

Sultan Wabars militias attacked a Somaliland army base in the vicinity of Fulin Fulka (7km NW of Borama) in the afternoon of 14/05. Reports indicate that the militias open fire towards the base while Somaliland military responded by firing back after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked SNGF, manning a check-point in Cumar-Beere (9 KM NW of Afgooye) early morning of 14/05. Both sides exchange small arms fire briefly before al Shabaab attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

SNG forces reinforcing other SNG forces in the area managed to retake Dara Salam village (32 KM NE of Qoryoley) from al Shabaab fighters the midday of 15/05/2015 after heavy fighting between them and al Shabaab fighters, the SNG forces took over the village. Casualties could not be established.

SNG forces reinforcing other SNG forces in Awdheegle village vicinity (37 KM SW of Afgoye) have retaken the village from al Shabaab fighters took over the village in the Midday of 15/05/2015. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the village after heavy fighting with the SNG forces. The village is again in the hands of SNG forces.

A group of youths staged a peaceful demonstration Barhada Square neighbourhood in Garowe on 15/05 in protest against arrest of one of their local Quran teachers. The arrested religious teacher was accused of violence, inciting the public and criticizing the government of hosting so many foreigners in the country.
Al Shabaab fighters briefly overtake Awdheegle before vacating the village. SNG forces re-entered the village shortly thereafter. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNGF in Dara Salam village (32 KM NE of Qoryooley) in the early morning of 15/05. After heavy fighting between SNGF and al Shabaab fighters, SNGF were over-powered and left the village. Casualties so far cannot be confirmed.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNGF forces in Aw-dheegle (37 KM SW of Afgooye) in the early morning of 15/05. After heavy fighting between SNGF and al Shabaab fighters, SNGF were over-powered and left the village. Casualties so far cannot be confirmed, wit

Militias loyal to Sultan Wabar attacked a Somaliland army Base near Boon Village (near Borama) in the night of 15/05 and withdrew quickly. Somaliland forces responded with gunfire and attempted to capture them but the militiamen managed to escape. No casualties were reported.

Four unidentified gunmen killed two policemen and seriously another in Shedaha area in Hargeisa in the morning of 15/05. The police officers were guarding a plot of land under the directive of Hargeisa regional court being disputed by the two groups. The court ordered the police to guard the land and stop any construction activities. The attackers are believed to be one of the groups involved in the dispute. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces convoy passing Fiidow village (44 KM N of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 15/05/2015. Reports show that three SNG forces were killed while 11 others were wounded in the clash. The casualties from al Shabaab fighters side could not be established. The injured SNG forces were airlifted from Jowhar to Mogadishu for treatment by AMISOM Helicopters.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNGF in Mubaarak village (30 KM NE of Qoryooley) in the early morning of 15/05, seizing the territory. Government forces regains the territory later that afternoon.

The dead body of man was found in Kaboora sub-section of Waamo section in Farjano Neighbourhood of Kismaayo in the morning of 15/05/2015. The dead body had three bullet wounds on the head. The motive is unknown and the assailants escaped.

A nomadic man from Habar Jeclo/Soolamadaw sub-clan was killed by unknown gunmen driving a Toyota Surf near Qorilugud Village in Buuhoodle District on 15/15. The perpetrators are believed to be from Dhulbahante/Samakab Ahmed sub-clan. The fresh killing reportedly affected a mediation meeting between Habar Jeclo and Dhulbahante that was expected to take place on 17/05 in Qurilugud Village. The incident also caused tension in the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed and attacked an AMISOM/KDF convoy in Hawindha (93 KM SW of Afmadow, on the road between Dhoobley and Tabta) in the afternoon of 16/05. Casualties are unknown but the convoy managed only to reach Dhoobley around 19:00 pulling two damaged military vehicles and one damaged Pro-Box civilian vehicle which was previously car-jacked by al Shabaab.

SNG forces conducting security operations clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Bana village (15 KM SE of Xudur) in the morning of 16/05/2015. The government forces reportedly shot and killed al Shabaab member in the village.

Hundreds of pro-Khatumo staged a protest in Saalax Dheer (60km SW of Laas Caanood) on 18/05 in protest against Somaliland presence in SSC area. The protestors marked the day as cleaning day in Khatumo controlled areas to clean up the haters of Somali unity. No insecurity incident was reported.

Supporters of Khatumo state staged a demonstration in protest against a planned Somaliland national day (18 May) celebration in the town on 16/05. The demonstration came after logistics for the preparation of the Somaliland day were delivered in the town by pro-Somaliland Dhulbahante officials. Khatumo officials who addressed the demonstrators said that they will accept Somaliland national day to be commemorated in Buuhoodle.
Eyl residents protest against increasing illegal fishing activities in the region on 16/05.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED explosion targeting AMISOM convoy took place in Abroone neighbourhood of Marka town in the afternoon of 17/05/2015. The AMISOM convoy opened indiscriminate gunfire after the blast but causalities could not be established.

Khatumo militias reportedly attacked Somaliland forces based in Taleex in the evening of 17/05. The two sides used both light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for about two hours after which the Khatumo militias withdrew. A Somaliland soldier was killed and another one was injured.

Khatumo militias reportedly attacked Somaliland forces based in Kalabayr Village (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 17/05. The two sides used both light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for about an hour after which the Khatumo militias withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against Jubaland Force (JLF) base Centarka in Shaqalaha neighbourhood in the evening of 17/05.The hand grenade hit the inner fence of the base, JLF responded to the attackers suspected direction by opening gun fire but no casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A RCIED targeted a convoy of Interim South West Administration president Sharif Hassan Sheikh Aden near Afgooye town in the afternoon of 18/05. The convoy came from Afgooye and was heading to Lafoole when the incident happened. The device missed its target causing no casualties. Sharif Hassan, who talked over the media condemned al Shabaab over the responsibility of the attack, though it is not entirely clear they were the responsible party.

A group of youths engaged fighting using stones while attending Somaliland independence day (18th May) in Burco on 18/05 due to their political difference. Two female bystanders were injured while several vehicles windscreens were shattered. Police arrested unspecified number of youths following the incident.

Pro-Somaliland residents of Laas Caanood marked the 18th May to join the rest of Somaliland in a celebration held in the offices of the mayor and the DC on 18/05. However another group of residents, pro-Khatumo have staged a demonstration against Somaliland calling the 18th of May a cleaning day while chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. Police open fire and dispersed the protestors. No casualties were reported.

A group of youths confronted with police in Borama in the morning of 18/05 while Somaliland independence day celebration (18th May) was on going. The youths belted stones with the police chanting slogans to support Sultan Wabar separatist movement. Reports indicate that, the incident was triggered by one of the elders who speak about clan issues while addressing the crowds who have attended the celebration. No arrests were reported.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.

A group of local residents in Garowe staged a peaceful demonstration in Barhada Square in the morning of 18/05. The protest was meant to express the rise of insecurity in the region and was organized by a well-known local politician. The demonstration ended peacefully.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.

Pro-Somaliland residents in Badhan held a celebration to mark the 18th of May - Somaliland independence day - in the office of the DC on 18/05, while pro-Puntland and Khatumo staged a peaceful demonstration in the street chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The protest ended peacefully.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.

Kismaayo residents held protests following a decision by more than 40 Federal MPs to table a motion against their administration. The demonstrations were also held in Afmadow, Badhaadhe and Dhobley on 18/05, bringing together the youth, women, professionals and traditional elders as well as business people. Local administrators were also present to voice the displeasure with the move by the federal MPs. It was peaceful demonstration, no casualties reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF re-supply convoy close to Khadijo Hagi (39 KM SW of Beled Xawa) in the morning of 18/05. The ambush was initiated by a RCIED explosion followed by small arms fire. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 18/05. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties reported.
A land mine targeted Southwest State President Sharif Hasan Shaykh along Afgooye-Arbiska road, outside Lafoole. The politician survived, no other causalities reported.

A SNG soldier was attacked, shot and killed in front of his house in Hawl-Wadaag on 18/05 by unknown assailants. Another man, who responded to the shooting, was firing at the attackers and they fled, without managing to take the victims gun. The assailants escaped and no arrests were reported.

Hundreds of pro-Khatumo supporters staged a protest against Somaliland government in Widhwidh (49km NE of Buuhoodle) on 19/05. The protestors marked also 18th May as a sanitation day in Khatumo controlled areas. No insecurity incident was reported.

An armed clan clash erupted in Guri-Cado (approx 23 KM north of Beled Weyn) in the evening of 19/05 between Xawadle and Dir sub-clans. Two people are confirmed so far dead during the fighting. The clashes are connected with previous armed confrontations and so far, all stakeholders failed to find a lasting solution.

Al Shabaab fighters Loyal to the current al Shabaab leader (Ahmed Diriye) assassinated eight al Shabaab fighters from Mahad Karatey supporters in Kuunyo-Barrow Village (74km NE) of Jilib town in the morning of 19/05. Motive behind the attack is reported to have been long-standing dispute within al Shabaab leadership.

Three NISA soldiers were shot and killed by SNAF forces in Sei-Biano neighbourhood of Hodan District in the evening of 19/05. The incident is related to undisclosed dispute between the NISA and military soldiers, which occurred in the same neighbourhood in the afternoon of 18 May. There were no arrests reported.

Al Shabaab fighters took over Awdheegle village (37 KM SW) of Afgooye on the morning of 23/05 after clashes with SNG forces. AMISOM forces had evacuated the area (though not necessarily the town) on 22/05. More than 10 SNG soldiers were reported killed in in the clash but casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established. Al Shabaab forces had briefly took over the village on 15/05.
KDF air force bombarded places around Gadoon Dhowe (41 KM SW of Beled Xaawo) in the early morning hours of 20/05. Casualties not reported.

SNGF conducted a security operation in Ceel Gudo village (20 KM NW of Tayeeglow) on 20/05. Al Shabaab and SNGF engaged in an armed fight and reportedly seven al Shabaab fighters and 3 SNG soldiers were killed. After the operation, SNGF returned to their base in Tayeeglow.

ISWA organized a demonstration in Baidoa against Jubaland selection of MPs. Police was deployed in strategic places and most businesses have closed as local Administration was addressing demonstrators in the foot-ball stadium.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and injured a Puntland soldiers (PIS) in Soweto neighbourhood (Bossaso) in the evening of 20/05. The victim later succumbed to his injuries. No arrests were made in connection with the incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed an JLF convoy heading to Kismaayo at Yoontoy Yarey Village neighbourhood (25 KM NW of Kismaayo Town) using small arms fire on 20/05. No casualties reported.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) on 21/05. Three SNG soldiers were injured.

Militiamen from Habar-Gidir/Saad sub-clan in a vehicle opened fire their clansmen sitting in a teashop near Embassy Hotel in Galkacyo (south) on 21/05. The attackers were reportedly targeting a man for previous killing clan revenge. Five people (one lady and four men) including the target man was injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped from the vicinity.

A group of three unidentified armed men with pistols shot and killed a civilian old man in Aargo of Fanoole neighbourhood in Kismaayo town on 21/05 in the morning. Reason behind the killing is not clear and the perpetrators escaped the scene.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A RCIED exploded at a business point at Goob Weyn village (12km NE of Kismaayo town) in the afternoon of 21/05. Two civilians died in the explosion while one civilian and two JL soldiers were injured. The three injuries along with the dead bodies were brought to Kismaayo hospital. Suspected al Shabaab perpetrators managed to escape.

Al Shabaab court in Jilib sentenced a woman to death and ordered the release of another woman in the afternoon of 21/05. The court accused one of the women for being a spy for Jubbaland state while it acquitted the other and ordered for her release. The women were arrested from Jana Cabdalle Village (58KM, SE of Afmadow town) on 18/05/2015. The accused woman was executed by firing squad outside the town of Jilib town.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Shanta Geed neighbourhood (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 21/05. The perpetrators escaped.
Traders protest a killing of two of their colleagues in Bakaara Market on 21/05.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters targeted an Ethiopian Military convoy with an IED explosion in Mooda-Mooda village (25 KM SE) of Baidoa in the midday of 22/05 before an armed clash erupted between the two sides. One al Shabaab fighters was reported killed and another wounded while one solider was injured from the Ethiopian side, and an Ethiopian military vehicle got slightly damaged, the network was off during the convoy movement.
Habar Jeclo and Dhulbahante militias clash in the vicinity of Kalshaale (30km NW of Buuhoodle) on 22/05. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters took over Mubaarak village (30 KM NE) of Qoryooley District in the morning of 23/05/2015 after armed with SNG forces in the village, al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the village later and casualties from both sides could not be established.

Members of Gadbursi and Issa clans clashed using sticks and daggers in Xariirad Village (58km SE of Borama) following a dispute over ownership of borehole. The incident happened after the Gudabirsi tried to fence around the well which was immediately opposed by the Issa clan. Two Gudabirsi and one Issa were injured in the clash. Police intervened and dispersed the rival groups.

Habar Gidir militia launched an attack against Biimaal militia basis inside Marka in retaliation of two men killed in the outskirt of Marka on 23/05. The Biimaal militia retreated from their positions after the attack. Two Biimaal militia men were killed in the fighting while unconfirmed number of injuries was confirmed from both sides.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed a civilian traditional clan elder in Bukriyay neighbourhood of Baidoa in the morning of 23/05. The reason for the killing is unknown and the killers escaped. The victim was in the past arrested by SNG government for having suspected links with al Shabaab fighters but he was later released.

A man from Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud sub-clan was shot dead by Dhulbahante/Hassan Ugaas sub-clan in the vicinity of (Faleeryaale 32 Km N of Garowe) in the morning of 23/05 following a personal dispute. No arrests were made.

Unidentified armed men driving a luxury car shot and killed two civilian men and injured a third one in Korontada junction in Wadajir District in the morning of 23/05/2015. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the attackers fled in their vehicle. One of the victims was working for Ministry of Transportation/licensing Department and others were personal friends to him.

Unidentified armed men driving an ambulance opened gunfire at a car transporting three SNG MPs in Shaqaalaha junction area of Hodan District in the afternoon of 23/05. One MP and two bodyguards were killed while another MP was wounded in the attack. The attackers managed to escape from the scene, and the reason for the attack remains unclear yet though al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack. However, the spokesman for the Internal Security Ministry in a press conference in Mogadishu on 24/05 stated that SNG forces driving an armed military vehicle was behind the assassination of the MP in Shaqaalaha area on the 23/05. The spokesman stated that the attack took place irresponsibly as the vehicle transporting the MPs refused to let the armed vehicle to overtake it, which led the military forces vehicle to block the car of the MPs and soldiers on board opened gunfire at the car.

Clan militias hailing from Habar Gidir and Biimaal fought in Buulo Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 24/05. Two combatants were reportedly killed during the fight which lasted for twenty minutes. The two groups clashed in the area the previous day.

A group of clan militias from Harti of Dhulbahante sub-clan attacked Sheekhal militias in Hoosingo Village (97km NW of Badhaadhe) in the evening of 24/05. The attack was in revenge of the killing of business man from Harti by Sheekhaal clan near Hoosingo. The clash lasted more than half an hour after which the Harti/Dhulbahante militias withdrew. Four civilians were injured in the clash. Casualties from the warring sides could not be established.

Armed men in a battle-wagon believed to be Khatumo militias opened fire at Somaliland military camp near Qorilugud Village (Buuhoodle District) and escaped on 24/05. Somaliland army responded by firing at the attackers. One of the attackers reportedly suffered injuries and got arrested by Somaliland forces after he fell from the speeding battle wagon.
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces convoy in the vicinity of Jiiro Gurey Village (16km NW of Awdiinle) in the night of 23/05. One SNG soldier and an al Shabaab fighter were injured in the clash.
Two groups of SNG forces clashed over money extorted from public transport vehicles in Wado Marexaan area (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 24/05. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed a civilian man driving a small car in Suuqa Beerta in Waaberi District in the morning of 24/05. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the killers managed to escape from the scene.
Al Shabaab claims to have taken over Janaale following the exit of government forces on 24/05.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An Ethiopian military convoy passing near Mooda-Mooda Village (25km SE of Baidoa) was targeted with an IED explosion in the morning of 25/05. The Ethiopian forces responded with gunfire, killing a civilian in the area. Casualties from the Ethiopian military could not be established.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a private vehicle, transporting khat in Ilka Addo (16 KM NE of Beled Weyn) in the morning of 25/05. There was a small arms fire exchange between the owner and the attackers. One attacker was killed during the clashes.

Municipal council workers backed by Somaliland police demolished kiosks built near the main roads of Laas Caanood on 25/05. A group of local traders staged a demonstration in front of the municipal council office after the demolition but were immediately dispersed by the police.

Rickshaw drivers and owners staged a violent demonstration against ISWA Administrations over the suspension of rickshaw commuter service in Baidoa in the morning of 25/05. The demonstrators were reportedly throwing stones. Business premises were closed in Baidoa due to the violent demonstrations. ISWA security forces reportedly suspended rickshaw transport in Baidoa on security grounds. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a group of SNA soldiers manning an illegal checkpoint in Cumar-Beere Village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the evening of 25/05. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the SNG soldiers withdrew. No casualties were repor

Al Shabaab fighters executed four men accused of being spies for SNG and the Kenyan Government in a public ground in Diinsoor in the afternoon of 25/05. The execution took place after an al Shabaab court reportedly found them guilty of spying.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces position in Livestock Market neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 25/05. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the area. No casualties were reported. Simultaneously Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces outpost in Abdi Waayeel building (Heliwa District) in the night of 25/05. The two sides engaged in a fifteen-minute gunfire exchange after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNG forces position in Gubta neighbourhood of Dayniile District in the night of 25/05. The two sides engaged in a brief gunfire but no casualties were reported.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed two civilians in KPP neighbourhood of Hodan District in the evening of 25/05. The reason for the killings remains unclear but unconfirmed reports indicate that the victims were former al Shabaab members that had defected to Somali government.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan AMISOM soldiers kill seven members of al Shabaab in the southern town of Dobley.

column8: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Daily fighting at multiple locations took place between 26-29th of May between local pastoralists and Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries occurred along the Ethiopia-Somali border. Among the villages affected by the Liyu Police offensive are Laba Baar, Isma Dhaqa, Balli dhiig and Sariiro. These villages all lie along Galgadud border. The Givernor of Galgadud region Mr. Hussein Ali Wehliye (Cirfo) appealed to the Federal Government of Somalia to take action against the invasion of the Ethiopian Liyu Police forces. More than fifty people including civilians were killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces went back to their bases in Awdheegle (37km SW of Afgooye) and Mubaarak villages on 26/05. AMISOM withdrew from Awdheegle on 22/03 for undisclosed reasons. The Somali National Army forces that had remained in Aw Dheegle and the surrounding villages were attacked twice by al Shabaab fighters, and suffered heavy losses.

SNGF on security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Ceel Bacad (20 KM SE of Bulo Burte) in the morning of 26/05. SNGF forces managed to destroy some al Shabaab positions in the village. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed while one SNGF was injured. SNGF went back to Bulo Burte after the operation.

Biimaal militia ambushed the lower Shabelle deputy governor in charge of security in Waa Cuneynaa waa Cabeynaa neighbourhood in Marka in the afternoon of 26/05. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 15 minutes after which the deputy governor and his security guards withdrew back to the town. The deputy governor came from Marka and was heading to Shalaambood settlement when the incident happened. He was denied to proceed to Shalaambood. The deputy governor hails from Habirgidir.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out hit and run attack against SNG forces position in the outskirt of Afgooye (4km S of Afgooye) in the night of 26/05. The two sides engaged in a brief gunfire but casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at SNG forces outpost in Hanti-Wadaag neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the night of 26/05. Four SNG soldiers were reportedly wounded by the explosion and the attackers managed to escape.
SNG military forces capture the areas of Ceelbacaad, Jameeco, and Mubaarak outside of Buulobarde on 26/05, killing ""some"" al Shabaab and recovering weapons.
SNG military forces capture the areas of Ceelbacaad, Jameeco, and Mubaarak outside of Buulobarde on 26/05, killing ""some"" al Shabaab and recovering weapons.

column8: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Daily fighting at multiple locations took place between 26-29th of May between local pastoralists and Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries occurred along the Ethiopia-Somali border. Among the villages affected by the Liyu Police offensive are Laba Baar, Isma Dhaqa, Balli dhiig and Sariiro. These villages all lie along Galgadud border. The Givernor of Galgadud region Mr. Hussein Ali Wehliye (Cirfo) appealed to the Federal Government of Somalia to take action against the invasion of the Ethiopian Liyu Police forces. More than fifty people including civilians were killed.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces manning a checkpoint in Mareerey Village (about 5km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 27/05. Casualties could not be established.

The former Iskushuban DC (Majeerteen/Osman Mohamud) was shot dead by militias from Majeerteen/Ali Saleeban in Carmo (100km SW of Bossaso) in the evening of 27/05 in inter-clan revenge killing. Reports indicate that the incident could be related to the killing of two men from Ali Saleeban by Osman in Iskushuban over charcoal burning early this year.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces stationed in the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 27/05. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

SNG Police forces clashed with local residents living in a state-owned building in Jaale Siyaad Military academy area in Hodan District in the morning of 27/05. Reports show that police forces opened gunfire at some of the residents who resisted the police from destroying some building and forcefully evicting residents there. The residents responded with gunfire after the conflict escalated. Two police men were reported killed while two others injured, a civilian girl has also been hit and killed by a stray bullet.

SNG police clashed with a local militia comprised of residents living in state-owned building near Jaale Siyaad Military academy in Hodan District during forceful eviction in the morning of 27/05. Reports indicate that police forces opened fire at the residents after resisting the eviction. A local militia opposing the eviction clashed with the police. Latest reports indicate that both the police and local militias received reinforcements and the armed clash intensified. Further reports indicate that some army soldiers who live in the area backed the local militia during the clash. Two police men were reportedly killed and two others injured. A girl died after she was hit by a stray bullet.
A Puntland official is shot and killed outside of Bosasso by suspected al Shabaab gunmen. Date of the shooting is not known. Source dated 27/05.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM convoy 10km N of Mahadaay in the morning of 28/05. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire for a while after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The convoy came from Mahadaay and was heading to Jalaqasi when the incident happened. The convoy preceded the trip after the attack. Casualties are unknown.

Clan militias from Majerteen/Osman Mohamud sub clan ambushed and attacked other militias from Majerteen/Ali Saleeban sub-clan in an area near Iskushuban town in the morning of 28/05. Two Ali Saleeban militias were seriously injured and had their vehicle destroyed. The motive is believed to be related to clan revenge. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at a house used by SNG solders in Mursal neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the night of 28/05. The forces responded with gunfire but no casualties were reported and the attackers managed to escape.

Detonation: An accidental explosion took place in a teashop in Garbahaarey town in the afternoon of 28/05. The explosion reportedly blew up prematurely as a man (former al Shabaab fighter) tried to plant it in a teashop frequented by ASWJ and SNG Officials in the town. Initial reports showed that only the man who was planting it died in the incident.
A man from Habarjeclo/Adan Madoobe sub-clan stabs a man from Majerteen to death in Burco (28/05). The reason for the attack is not known.

Al Shabaab fighters have beheaded a civilian man and put his dead body on the road linking Goof-Gaduud and Manaas villages in the morning of 28/05. The victim hails from Leysan sub-clan of Rahanwein and the reason for the killing remains unknown.

Tension reportedly ran high between Ciise and Gudabuursi sub-clan in Xariirad Village (58km NW of Borama) on 28/05 following dispute over water resources. The two sides reportedly clashed with sticks and stones. The tension began after members of Cise clan rehabilitated the borehole in the village, connected it to a new water pump and said that they had handed over the running of the borehole to a private water company. Police arrested a number of people including two Ethiopian officers who were on visit from the Ethiopian villages along the border. Ten people were slightly injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters took over Kaaxda neighbourhood of Dharkenley District without any armed clash with SNG forces in the night of 28/05. Reports show that al Shabaab fighters spent hours in the neighbourhood and withdrew later voluntarily, no killing or other casualties were reported during the take-over period.

An armed clash between suspected al Shabaab fighters and SNG forces took place in Sayidka junction area in the afternoon of 28/05. Reports show that the clash started when the suspected attackers tried to assassinate SNG security forces on security patrol in the area. A civilian girl has reported died in the clashes and the attackers managed to escape from the scene.

At least two people have been killed while five others were injured after two rival political factions clashed in Ceel Waaq on 28/05. Fighters loyal to the area deputy commissioner Sahal Maalin Adan and others loyal to a former Ceel Waaq district commissioner fought after Sahal was accused of being behind the killing of the former district chief.

column8: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Daily fighting at multiple locations took place between 26-29th of May between local pastoralists and Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries occurred along the Ethiopia-Somali border. Among the villages affected by the Liyu Police offensive are Laba Baar, Isma Dhaqa, Balli dhiig and Sariiro. These villages all lie along Galgadud border. The Givernor of Galgadud region Mr. Hussein Ali Wehliye (Cirfo) appealed to the Federal Government of Somalia to take action against the invasion of the Ethiopian Liyu Police forces. More than fifty people including civilians were killed.

Somaliland authorities in Lawya Caddo destroyed several illegal constructions that were used for smuggling goods in Xamamka area on 28/05. The residents of the area protested and refused to clear the area. The police arrested several people and transferred them to Zeylac central prison.

column8: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Daily fighting at multiple locations took place between 26-29th of May between local pastoralists and Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries occurred along the Ethiopia-Somali border. Among the villages affected by the Liyu Police offensive are Laba Baar, Isma Dhaqa, Balli dhiig and Sariiro. These villages all lie along Galgadud border. The Givernor of Galgadud region Mr. Hussein Ali Wehliye (Cirfo) appealed to the Federal Government of Somalia to take action against the invasion of the Ethiopian Liyu Police forces. More than fifty people including civilians were killed.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Beled Xawo District administration forces clashed with KDF forces in Beled Xawo over a border dispute on the 29/05. The clash started when Kenyan forces started destroying buildings on the Somali and Kenya border, Kenyan government is seemingly trying to construct a wall on the border between Somalia and Kenya starting from Mandera. The two sides exchanged a brief gunfire and a gun was taken from KDF side though it was returned to them after reconciliatory talks between two sides. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A stray bullet fired by two Puntland soldiers who were allegedly shooting at each other at a checkpoint in Yalho village (45km S of Bossaso) on 29/05 hit a civilian man. The two soldiers escaped from the scene following the incident and the police are pursuing them. It is not known why the two soldiers were firing at each other.

A demonstration against KDF forces for destroying buildings on Somali Kenyan border organized by Beled Xawo administration took place in Beled Xawo in the morning of 30/05. All businesses in the town were closed during the demonstrations. No casualties or other problems were reported during the operations.

Ceel-Afweyn police arrested a man from Habar Jeclo/Ahmed Farax sub-clan in Ceel-Afweyn on 30/05 after he attacked the local police commander using a club. The commander hails from Habar Awal/Sacad Muse. The perpetrator reportedly accused the commander of previously detaining him illegally.

Militiamen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Saad sub-clan manning an illegal checkpoint on the outskirt of Galkacyo (South) on 30/05 exchanged fire over money extorted from motorists. One militiaman was injured in the clashes.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters from Galgala Mountains shot and killed a 60-year old farmer in Galgala, Maraja vicinity, (35Km to NW of Bossaso) in the morning of 30/05. The reason of the killing is currently unknown and the police are investigating the incident.

Al Shabaab fighters engaged in an armed clash with a group of armed robbers who were involved in armed banditry activities against civilian travelers near Yoontoy yarey Village (25 KM, NE of Kismaayo town) in the morning of 31/05/2015. During the gunfire exchange al Shabaab fighters managed to catch one of the armed robbers and beheaded him while the rest managed to escape.

A group of people staged a protest at liberty garden in Ceerigaabo on 31/05 to express their anger against the killing of Yusuf Dirir, a Somali-MP (Habar yonis) who was killed in Mogadishu on 23/05. The protestors were chanting slogans against SNG president and accused the SNG of being behind the killing of the MP. They demanded quick and fair trial of those who were behind the attack.

Unidentified gunmen believed to be Galgala/al Shabaab fighters killed a businessman from Warsangeli/Dubays sub-clan in Af Urur village (88km SE of Laas-Qoray) in the night of 31/05. The motive of the killing in unknown and the perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters in Salagle town picked two civilian men from their houses in the town in the evening of 31/05. The reason for the abduction remains unclear; and the abductees were taken to unknown location, both men hail from Awlihan sub-clan of Ogaden.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a civilian business man in Goof-Gaduud village (30km NW of Baidoa) in the night of 31/5. The victim was shot and killed in his business centre, the reason for the killing remains unclear and reports show that the victims mother works for local NGO in Baidoa.

A business man, hailing from one of the Rahanweyn sub-clans was shot and killed by a man, (Jajeele) in his shop in Hawl-wadaag neighbourhood on 31/05. The motive is unknown and the perpetrator managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded six civilian businessmen hailing from Jiron sub-clan of Rahanwein in Walag village (57 Km NW of Baidoa) in the night of 31/05. The victims were killed for secretly transporting business goods into Waajid town. One man was executed directly in Walag village while the four other bodies were discovered by villagers at the water catchment in Kurto village (60 KM NW of Baidoa). The donkeys were also killed.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces outpost in Livestock market neighbourhood of Heliwa District in the evening of 31/05. The two sides engaged in a brief gunfire but casualties could not be established.
A number of Somali MPs protest a plan by the Kenyan government that would construct a wall along portions of the border between Somalia and Kenya in an effort to stem al Shabaab attacks in Kenya.

Residents of Beled Hawo held demonstrations against ""colonial tendencies"" of the Kenyan government on 01/06. The protest may also be related to a potential plan of the Kenyan government of construct a wall along portions of the border between Kenya and Somalia in an effort to protest border towns from al Shabaab attacks.

A vehicle transporting sugar from Kismaayo to Kenya was targeted with an IED in Hosingo village (97KM, NW of Badhaadhe District). The destroyed vehicle was part of a convoy that left the city of Kismaayo on 31/05. Resident reported that al Shabaab attacked JLF and AMISOM troops who reached the area to rescue the vehicle. No human casualties reported so far.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: KDF forces, based in Khadijo Hagi (42 KM NW of Belet Xaawo) shelled areas around Gaddoondhowe (43 KM NW of Belet Xaawo) in the morning of 01/06. Casualties cannot be confirmed. The shelling came after reports were circulating about al Shabaab troop movements in the area.

Dhulbahante and Shiekhal clans clashed over pasture after Shiekhal attacked animal headers from Dhulbahante in Dad Gumbi Grazing area (97KM NW of Badhaadhe town) in the morning of 01/06. Reports show that four people from both sides were killed while others with wounds were admitted to Dhobley hospital for treatment.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A vehicle transporting sugar from Kismaayo to Kenya was targeted with an IED in Hosingo village (97KM, NW of Badhaadhe District). The destroyed vehicle was part of a convoy that left the city of Kismaayo on 31/05. Resident reported that al Shabaab attacked JLF and AMISOM troops who reached the area to rescue the vehicle. No human casualties reported so far.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in the outskirt of Afgooye in the night of 01/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No reports of casualties.

Unidentified armed men opened fire and killed two men hailing from Sheekhal sub-clan and injured another one from Ogaden sub-clan in Garsoor neighbourhood in Galkacyo (North) in the evening of 01/06. The motive of the attack remains unknown and the perpetrators escaped. No arrest was made in connection with the incident.

Two groups hailing from Habarjeclo/Soolamadaw sub-clan reportedly clashed using sticks and stones in Habari Heshay village (13km S of Caynabo) on 01/06 over a land ownership dispute. Several people sustained minor injuries. Caynabo police arrived at the scene and arrested a number of people involved in the scuffles.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed Jubaland forces that were coming back from daily patrolling duties in Bula Gudud village (30 KM NE of Kismaayo Town) on 01/06. No casualties were reported during the ambush.
AMISOM-Kenya Air Forces launch an aerial bombardment against al Shabaab positions in Godindhabe area 35Km south of Balad-Hawo, along the border with Kenya. Casualties, injuries not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces based in Jowhar airstrip fired several mortar rounds against al Shabaab hideouts in Cali Fool Dheere area (21km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 02/06. The artillery attack followed after AMISOM Forces received information regarding al Shabaab movements in the targeted area. Casualties could not be established.

Hargeisa police carried out a security operation in Mohamoud Haybe neighbourhood in Hargeisa on 02/06 following a recent killing by a gunman from Ciidagale/Abokor Muse sub-clan against a man from Ciidagale/Abdi Bari sub-clan. The police erected checkpoints and were seen searching vehicles and patrolling the streets in the neighbourhood. Meanwhile, some locals staged a violent demonstration and burnt tires in front of Total Hotel. The protestors were demanding the perpetrator to be executed; however, police arrived at the scene and dispersed the protestors.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali National Army Forces backed by AMISOM forces took over the control of Tortoorow Village (49km NW of Afgooye) early in the morning of 02/06. The allied forces moved from Aw Dheegle one day before and they did not encounter any resistance on the way. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew Tortoorow before the SNA/AMISOM forces reached.

Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade against a group SNG soldiers in a checkpoint in Buunda yareey neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the night of 02/06. Perpetrator(s) escaped. Casualties are unknown.

A suspected al Shabaab fighter shot and killed a SNG deputy police station Commander in a public place in Horseed neighbourhood of Baidoa in the evening of 02/06. The guards of the victim responded with gunfire and killed the murderer on the spot. Al Shabaab claimed responbility. Two civilians were reported injured in the shootout but no death reported.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA convoy outside Aw Dheegle town in the afternoon of 02/06. Both sides engaged in an exchange of gunfire for almost ten minutes and finally the SNA convoy managed to proceed to Tortoorow. The convoy left from Aw Dheegle (37km SW of Afgooye) and was heading to Tortoorow when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.

A group of SNG Military forces ambushed a SNG Military convoy escorting SNG Military commander General Abdirizak Khalif Elmi in Muuri Village ( 17 Km SW of Afgooye) midday of 02/06/2015. Reports show that one of the body guards of the Commander was killed in the attack while three others were injured.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Belet Xawo town in the morning of 02/05. The clashes started when the local Administration forces spotted a former al Shabaab member (defector) carrying a gun in the town, the defector got the gun from the former Belet Xawo DC as he was staying with him since he defected from al Shabaab. One the guards of the former DC was killed in the clash while the defector was arrested and the former DC was called to Doolow to ease the tension, he is currently in Doolow for talks.

Xawadle militia attacked Asharaf village (approx. 36 KM NW of Belet Weyn, on Somali/Ethiopian border) in the morning of 02/06. The village is inhabited by Aw-Hassan (Sheekhal sub-clan). One woman was killed during the attack and some houses were burned down by the attackers.

A gunman from Ciidagale/Abokor Muse sub-clan shot and killed a man from Ciidagale/Abdi Bari sub-clan at Star Hotel area in Mohamud Haybe District (Hargeisa) in the morning of 02/06 over a land ownership dispute. The incident follows after two local traders who disputed land ownership deployed gunmen to guard the area. Police arrived at the scene, shot in the air to disperse the gunmen and arrested the perpetrator.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM [African Unions Mission in Somalia] troops that are based at the Jowhar airport are said to have shelled a number of localities outside the town of Mahadaay in Middle Shabelle where Al-Shabab fighters are said to have been based. Causalities, date not clear: source dated 03/06.

Two armed militia hailing from Xawadle and Dir clans have clashed in Deefoow village of 30km SW of Belet Weyn in the morning of 03/06. The sides engaged in fierce fighting in the village and casualties from both sides could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNA forces based in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 03/06. The fighting reportedly lasted for about ten minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade at SNG soldiers position in the vicinity of Salaama Hotel (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 03/06. The SNG soldiers opened gunfire after the blast. The perpetrator(s) escaped. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against NISA troops outpost in Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 03/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a male civilian in the vicinity of Bakaras Dahablaha section (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 03/06. The motive behind the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted a group of AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 04/06. The device missed its target. An AMISOM fuel tanker reportedly passed before the incident happened. AMISOM forces opened gunfire indiscriminately in response to the blast. Two civilian bystanders were killed in the shooting.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed two SNG soldiers in Bakaara Market, Hawl Wadaag in the evening of 04/06. The reason for the killing remains unknown and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces outpost in Maslax Compound area in Heliwa District in the night of 04/06. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire but casualties could not be established.

Unidentified two men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian woman in Ceel Dheere neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the morning of 04/06. The victim was reportedly working for the Ministry of Finance and the incident happened when she was on her way to work. Nobody claimed responsibility as of now.

The Somaliland authorities in Lughaya have destroyed several illegal constructions that were allegedly used for fuel smuggling and Illegal fishing. The area residents demonstrated against the destructions and refused to clear the area. The police continued the demolition and arrested several people who were transferred to Borama central prison.

Al Shabaab fighters arrived in a vehicle in Shaatilow (18 KM NW of Luuq) in the early evening of 05/06. They took over the village without any resistance and after a few hours left voluntarily again. No casualties were reported and their motive remains unclear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against AMISOM positions in Tortoorow Village (49km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 05/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire for fifteen minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No reports on casualties.

Detonation: Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at Saldhig Galbeed Police station in the evening of 05/06. The hand grenade landed in an open space and did not cause any casualties, and the attackers managed to escape from the scene.

An RCIED exploded, targeting the DC of Maxaas in the afternoon of 06/06 in Teedan Village (66 KM SE of Belet Weyn). The DC escaped unhurt but three of his security guards and two civilians, including a child, were injured during the blast. All victims are hospitalized in Maxaas hospital and no arrests were reported.

A fire broke out in two temporary shelters belonging to poor families in the area of Hodan Qaylo neighbourhood in Burco in the night of 06/06 following after unidentified people set a fire and locked the doors The motive of this incident remains unknown and police are investigating the matter. The family members who were sleeping at that time when the fire broke out were reportedly rescued by the emergency fire fighters.
A man who belongs to Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud sub clans shot and killed a man that belongs to Ogaaden clan following an escalated dispute over a land. Police detained the culprit.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 07/06. The convoy was heading towards Mogadishu when the incident happened. One AMISOM Caspir was reportedly damaged by the explosion. Casualties are unknown.

ASWJ militia launched an attack against SNA positions in Dhusamareeb town in the morning of 07/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the SNA withdrew from the town. Dhusamareeb was expected to be the Administrative Capital of Galmudug State which is going to be formed in Cadaado. No official statement from the Somali Government yet.

Citizens of the Dunbuluq area of Hargeysa held a demonstration and blocked the main road that goes downtown, burning tires. The police intervened and dispersed them. The demonstration related to the murder that happened in the district last week. The demonstrators were relatives of the victim, who demanded the police to submit murderer to the regional court and to implement the death penalty. This is the second time that they held demonstration in that area.
Local authorities organized a peaceful demonstration against the approved motion of no confidence by the Somali Federal Government in Mogadishu against the JL parliament. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against AMISOM forces on foot patrol in Sheekh Abroone neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 07/06. AMISOM forces opened gunfire to different directions after the blast. A young civilian male was killed in the AMISOM shooting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali National Army together with AMISOM forces launched an attack against al Shabaab hideout in the outskirts of Tortoorow Village (49km NW of Afgooye) in the morning of 07/06. There was heavy exchange of different types of gunfire before the al Shabaab fighters retreated. Casualties are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighter shot and killed a middle aged man who wanted to transport Khat to Garbahaarey on 07/06 around 20 KM north of Garbahaarey town. The vehicle together with the khat was set on fire.

Government forces recapture several unnamed villages in Hiiraans Maxaas district. [Military Forces] said that ""they inflicted severe loses to al-Shabaab by killing several of its fighters and seized arms"". The commissioner said that there were no casualties on their side. Date(s) of the capture not known, source dated 08/06.

Roads in Kismayo town were closed together with shops and restaurants in preparation of an organized demonstration against the Central Government Parliament decision to declare JL parliament illegal. Rumours indicate that JL authority and their supporters want to declare an independent state of Jubaland. The demonstrators met in the stadium and the demonstration ended peaceful without any reported incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against AMISOM/SNA positions in Tortoorow (49km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 08/06. The fighting started with several mortar rounds fired by al Shabaab fighters before the armed clash started. The fighting lasted for few minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack SNG forces outpost in Berdale neighbourhood of Baidoa in the morning of 08/06/2015. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew, no casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in the outskirt of Afgooye town (Afgooye District) in the night of 08/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNG forces outpost in Qansax Dheere town in the morning of 08/06. The sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew, no casualties were reported.
ASWJ militia entered and took over Mareer Guur Village (27km NE of Dhusamareeb) without resistance in the afternoon of 08/06.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unknown attackers hurled a hand grenade against Centarka Shaqalaha police station early morning of 08/06. JLF responded with small arms fire in all directions and no casualties were reported. Perpetrators managed to escape

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces outpost in the former Perfume factory building area and well as the Sarta Qabyada building area in Heliwa District in the night of 08/06. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about 20 minutes after that the al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the scene. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at SNG forces manning a security checkpoint in Salama Hotel area in Hawl-wadaag District in the night of 08/06. The forces responded with gunfire but no casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNG forces out post in Eimiska in Yaaqshiid District in the night of 08/06. The sides engaged in a brief gunfire after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Scuffles broke out between two groups armed with knives and sticks inside Burco court compound on 09/06 over land ownership dispute. The two groups were from Habar-Jeclo sub clans and were waiting for the court to make a ruling before one group opposed to the anticipated outcome of the court. Burco police shot in the air to disperse the two groups before arresting them.
Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG soldiers checkpoint in Cumar-Beere Village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 09/06. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces positions in Ceelasha settlement (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 09/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

A demonstration organized by local population against AMISOM forces based in Garbahaarey town took place in Garbahaarey town in the morning of 09/06. The local residents were protesting against AMISOM forces for not doing anything about the insecurity.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Two groups of Puntland forces exchanged gunfire at Tuka-Raq army base (48km E of Laas Caanood) on 09/06 for unknown reasons, however, the incident is believed to be related to a dispute between the two groups - one from Majerteen/Isse Mohamud and another one from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud - over carrying out attacks against Somaliland forces based in Gambadha. One soldier was reportedly killed and another one was injured in the shooting incident.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNGF staged a demonstration outside Jazeera training camp, close vicinity to Jazeera Gate at noon of 09/06 to express their anger over the non-payment of salaries for the last six months. AMISOM troops deployed to bring the situation under control and to disperse the demonstrator. Some gun-shot were heard but so far no casualties are reported.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a group of SNG soldiers in security checkpoint in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 09/06. No casualties were reported.

The employees working for Somaliland citizens registration staged a violent demonstration in Ceerigaabo central market on 10/06 over unpaid salaries. The protesters marched through the streets, blocked the roads and burnt tyres. Police arrived at the scene, dispersed the crowd and arrested about ten protesters.

ASWJ organized a peaceful demonstration in Dhusamareeb on 10/06 against the state building conference in Cadaado and the expected outcome. They rejected an appeal by the UN SRSG and Minister of Interior and Federalism to return to their bases and pledged not to recognize any outcome from Cadaado.

Two militias hailing from Mataan Cabdulle sub clan of Abgaal and Cili sub clan of Abgaal fought in the vicinity of Ceel-Beeneed (21km N of Warsheikh) in the morning of 10/06. The cause of the conflict is said to be related grazing land dispute and the ownership of a water source in that locality. Middle Shabelle Regional Administration is trying to solve the problem. Casualties are unknown, though, Shabelle lists the dead at ten.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position near Mareerey Village (roughly 5km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 10/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration and marched through the streets in Buuhoodle on 10/06 to show support to the recent peace agreement reached by Habarjeclo and Dhulbahante elders. The rally was organized by the locals and was attended by senior Khatumo officials led by the DC. Khatumo officials and the protesters both condemned the small groups that are opposing the recent peace agreement.

Suspected al Shabaab fighter shot and killed one woman and injured another one in Bokreyey neighbourhood of Baidoa Town on 09/06. The dead woman hails from Leysan, she was the sister of recently assassinated Leysan elder, and the injured woman hails from Garwale clan. Motive is unknown and the perpetrators managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against a group of SNG soldiers in a police outpost in the vicinity of Livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 10/06. The exchange of gunfire between the two groups lasted few minutes. Casualties are unknown.

An IED targeted a SNA vehicle near Aw Dheegle (37km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 11/06. It is not yet known if it was RCIED or a landmine. The device reportedly hit the vehicle and caused light damage. Two SNA personnel were reportedly injured by the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/ENDF convoy, heading from Leego to Buur-Hakaba in Jameeco Cabdi-Guray in the evening of 11/06. Heavy fighting broke out between the sides which lasted for some hours. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM-Djibouti base in Buurhakaba on 11/06. Heavy gunfire could be heard in various areas in Beled Weyne. The fighting occurred late in the night. Casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against an AMISOM outpost on the western side of Belet Weyne town in the night of 12/06. Reports indicate that the suspected al Shabaab fighters arrived in vehicles and started firing at the AMISOM base. There was a brief exchange of gun fire and the attackers escaped. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A public mini-bus, prepared as a VBIED rammed into AMISOM/ENDF forces supply vehicle across the bridge of Buur-Hakaba in the morning of 12/06. AMISOM/ENDF was on their way to re-enforce their troops which came under attack the previous evening in Jameeco Cabdi-Guray. Unverified sources indicate that one supply lorry burned down and the number of casualties could not be confirmed. Telecommunication was switched off during the incident.

SNGF attacked al Shabaab fighters position in Dulmurux village (33 KM NE of Luuq) in the morning of 12/06. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and a PKM was captured from al Shabaab, two SNGF were injured in the attack. Al Shabaab fighters were repelled and fled from the area. The SNGF soldiers returned to their base in Wajiid district after the operation.

SNGF on security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Abal village (15 KM SE of Xudur) in the evening of 12/06. Two mid-level al Shabaab commanders were killed (one Amniyat) after SNGF ambushed the al Shabaab who were walking outside the village. There was a brief exchange of small arms fire, killing the two al Shabaab men while the others managed to escape. SNGF returned to their base in Xudur without casualties.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an ambush against SNGF in Ceel Cade village (55 KM west of Belet Weyne) on 13/06. Both sides exchange gun-fire before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Four SNGF were killed and the casualties from al Shabaab side are not known.

SNGF on security operation killed two suspected al Shabaab fighters during a security operation in Abaq Beeday (16 KM east of Xudur) in the night of 12/06. SNGF returned to their base in Xudur and no other casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
