column17: Armed militiamen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Saad sub clan launched an attack against Puntland police outpost in the vicinity Cagaarweyne in Garsoor neighbourhood in Galkacyo (north) in the evening of 12/06. The two sides exchanged gunfire for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The attack could be connected to the current tensions related to the formation of Central State and splitting of Mudug region. No casualties were reported.

After a fight over a piece of land erupted in Luuq town, two people were stabbed and one man was shot. All three wounded were transferred to Doolow for medical attention. Assailant and victims are from the same sub-clan of Gabaaweyn (Rahanweyn). No arrests have been reported.

SNGF on security operation engaged in heavy fighting with al Shabaab fighters in the morning of 13/06 in Quraclle village (26 KM SW of Yeed). The fighting lasted for over two hours and the interim DC of Rabdhure was killed in addition to one killed SNGF and four killed al Shabaab fighters. SNGF retreated to their base in Rabdhure.

Unidentified armed men in a civilian vehicle shot and killed a government soldier on foot patrol in drive by shooting in the vicinity of 21st October School in the afternoon of 13/06. The motive behind the killing is not known. Perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a mini-bus driver in Dabakaya neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the evening of 13/06. The incident happened following an oral dispute over the payment of extortion money. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab suicide bomber targets an armoured AMISOM-Ethiopian convoy on the outskirts of Buur Hakaba, Bay Region. Reports claims a number of Ethiopian forces were killed, while others were injured in the attack. No numbers provided.
Pro-al Shabaab radio reports an attack on unidentified pro-Somali government and pro-Ethiopia forces on the outskirts of Tayeeglow on 13/06. Fatalities, injuries not known.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces base outside Afgooye town in the night of 14/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in the vicinity of livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 14/06. After a brief exchange of gunfire the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/ENDF convoy coming from Xudur in Kulunjerer (39 KM NE of Wajiid) on 15/06. Both sides engaged in heavy fighting before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties on both sides are unknown as the communication network was switched off. The convoy continued towards Wajiid.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM/ENDF launched an attack against an al Shabaab position in Daanjeeri village (23 KM NE of Buur-Hakaba on 15/06. Both sides engaged in heavy fighting before al Shabaab fighters retreated from the village. Casualties on both sides could not be established.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA base in Mushaani (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 15/06. The fighting lasted close to ten minutes before the attackers withdrew.

Borama residents staged a peaceful demonstration in front of local government offices on 15/06 in protest against garbage collection company that was contracted in the collection of waste in the town. The protestors were complaining about litters lying on the roads and all over the town. Police arrive at the scene and dispersed the protestors.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked police outpost in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 15/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A RCIED targeted a SNA Toyota pickup in the vicinity of Xaawo-Cabdi settlement (9km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 16/06. The security forces opened gunfire to different direction in response to the attack. Four NISA personnel were confirmed dead while unconfirmed numbers of NISA personnel were also injured by the blast.

Unidentified Assassins shot and killed a police officer in the vicinity of the main market (Marka) in the afternoon of 16/06. A civilian male bystander also died in the shooting and a child sustained serious injuries. The perpetrators escaped.
Somaliland police clashed with local clan militias guarding a disputed piece of land that was under construction at Masalaha area in Mohamud Haybe District (Hargeisa) in the morning of 16/06.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Soldiers loyal to former Puntland police deputy commander Muhyadiin Ahmed Muse shot and killed their former colleague hailing from Majerteen/Isse Mohamud in the afternoon of 16/06. The motive of the killing is currently unclear but some reports suggest that the victim has reportedly earlier stolen an AK 47 rifle from the attackers. Both the attackers and the victim hail from the same sub-clan. No arrest was made.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNG NISA position in Sarta Qabyada (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 16/06. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Two SNG soldiers are killed by a roadside bomb blast outside Mogadishu in the Hawa Abdi area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM position in Hawl Wadaag section of Belet Weyn in the night of 17/06. The gun fire exchange lasted for around 10 minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
A RCIED or a Land Mine targeted an SNG forces vehicle at Ex-Pasta Factory (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 17/06. A soldier was injured while the vehicle was damaged.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A vehicle laden with explosive devices driven by a suicide bomber hit the wall of Cadaado conference hall in the morning of 18/06, where clan representatives and several political stakeholders are holding talks for the creation of Central State. Subsequently, three armed men tried to break in to the hall. The SNG security forces and AMISOM (ENDF) guarding the conference managed to kill all the three before they reach the conference hall. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack through Somalimemo.net, a pro-al Shabaab web based media outlet. Further reports suggest that three SNG soldiers were also killed in the attack.

Members of the Hargeisa university management committee fought each other following the Deans decision to ban some teachers from returning to the university. Some of the members sustained minor injuries. Police officers intervened and arrested 4 of the demonstrators.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces based in Geedweyne village (28km SE of Doolow) in the morning of 18/06. The two sides engaged fighting that took several hours after which the attackers withdrew. Two deaths reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland security forces on house to house searches in Calanley neighbourhood on 18/06 were fired at by an unknown number of suspected al Shabaab fighters from a house and the exchange of small arms fire lasted for 10 minutes before the suspected al Shabaab managed to escape into the nearby bush. No arrests reported during the operation.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier near Adan Cadde junction (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 18/06. The attackers managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against NISA outpost in Cabdi Waayeel cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 18/06. The exchange of gunfire lasted for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier inside Bakara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 18/06. Perpetrators escaped.
Unknown gunmen killed a government soldier at a junction near Aden Adde Airport in Mogadishu on 18 June. The gunmen also made away with the gun of the slain soldier.

Two groups (Aden Essa and Muse Dheriyo) of Dami clashed using stones, sticks and knifes outside of Hargeysa. More than 20 people were injured during the clash. Police intervened and shot several bullets in the air and dispersed the crowd. More than 30 people who were members of the two groups were arrested. A stray bullet hit one of Muse Dhariyo clans man and injured him causing the elders to accuse the Police officers of arresting only their group and they did not take any action against Aden Essa clan.

The Somaliland authorities in Lowyacado have destroyed several illegal constructions that were used for goods smuggling. The area residents demonstrated against the destructions and refused to clear the area. The police continued the demolition and arrested several people who were transferred to Zeylac central prison. The police arrested an officer working for Zaylac local government accusing him of involvement on organizing demonstrations against the demolition. This was the third one since last month.

A man hailing from Arab clan killed his clans man in Ina cunyaa village, Police in Balaygubadle district seized the perpetrator and detained him in Balaygubadle. The motive of the incident was a land dispute. Other sources reported that the victims livestock entered the perpetrators yard and ate the grass that he had reserved for his livestock, thereafter, taking a gun and shot the victims livestock.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a civilian man after accusing him of spying for the Somali Government soldiers at Lagaley village (44 KM SE of Yeed) in the night of 19/06. The victim was captured by al Shabaab a few days before from a nearby village after returning from Yeed village, controlled by SNGF and AMISOM/ENDF.

Al Shabaab fighters engaged NISA troops in an armed clash in SOS junction and Cabdi Waayeel Cinema areas in the evening of 19/06. The exchange of heavy gun-fire, including RPGs lasted roughly 20 minutes before al Shabaab withdrew. The number of casualties is unknown. An attack also occurred at the local perfume factory area, causalities not known.

Two SNGF survived an assassination attempt when a group of three men, armed with pistols opened fire at them whilst patrolling on Jamhuriya road on 19/06. The soldiers engaged the attackers in a gun fire, which later disappeared. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed two SNG soldiers in the vicinity of Salaama Hotel (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 19/06. Perpetrators escaped.

A hand grenade exploded in the hands of the attacker who was intending to throw the hand grenade against Marka Police Station in the evening of 20/06. The attacker reportedly received injures as a result of the hand grenade explosion and he was rushed by his colleagues away to an unknown location.

Heavily armed al Shabaab militia launched an attack against SNPF base in Mukayaga neighbourhood (Afgooye) after mid-night in 20/06. After a brief armed clash the al Shabaab fighters managed to take over the base. Al Shabaab fighters seized four vehicles before they withdrew. At least three police officers were killed in this fight.

The Somaliland authorities in Lughaya have destroyed several illegal constructions that were used for fuel smuggling and Illegal fishing. The area residents demonstrated against the destructions and refused to clear the area. The police continued the destruction activity and arrested several people and transferred to Borama central prison.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A RCIED was targeting an ENDF/AMISOM contingent convoy near Goof gadud village (30 KM NW of Baidoa) on 20/06 that was coming from Wajiid and was heading to Baidoa. The blast did not cause any damage or casualties

About a hundred pro-Puntland people staged a peaceful demonstration in Dhahar village (170km S of Laas-Qoray) on 20/06. The demonstration was aimed at expressing support to the recent reshuffle of Puntland cabinets. The protestors marched in the streets chanting slangs in which they are supporting the Puntland administration and welcoming the newly appointed ministers from Warsangeli.

Unidentified gunmen believed to be from Habarjeclo/Soolamadaw sub clan reportedly shot and killed a person from Dhulbahante/Reer Hagar sub clan in the area of Horufadhi village (40km N of Buuhoodle) in the night of 20/06. The motive of the killing remains unknown. The Dhulbahante reportedly mobilized its clan militias and attacked the herders from Habarjeclo and both militias exchanged gunfire in which both sides retreated from the scene. The perpetrator escaped unidentified and no casualties were reported in that attack. The traditional elders from both warring clans intervened and started to investigate the exact perpetrator. Unconfirmed reports are suspecting the involvement of Khatumo forces against the recent killing in order to create insecurity between the two clans since the recent attacks against the telecommunication companies.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNA convoy in the vicinity of God Doofaar (roughly 40km NE of Afgooye) in the morning of 20/06. Fierce fighting erupted after the ambush and the fighting lasted close to thirty minutes after which the SNA retreated towards Afgooye town. The SNA convoy were chasing after the al Shabaab attackers who attacked a Police outpost in Mukayaga neighbourhood (Afgooye). Fifteen SNA personnel were confirmed dead and even more were injured. Al Shabaab attackers also suffered losses but exact figures could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM forces based in the outskirt of Buulo Mareer town (29km SW of Marka) in the night of 20/06. Casualties are unknown.

Non-violent activity: Militiamen hailing from Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud loyal to the dismissed ex Puntland police deputy commander General Muhyidin established an illegal road block at the south outskirt of Dangoroyo (115 km NE of Garowe) in the evening of 20/06. No money extortion was reported. The motive of the road block is not yet clear. There is ongoing mobilization in Garowe on how to remove the checkpoint.

A clan elder who is taking part in the reconciliation conference was shot and killed in by unknown men in the vicinity of Dayah Electronic Company on 20/06. The elder was also a member of the 62 elders council and Xawadle by clan. The perpetrators managed to escape and no arrest was reported.
Al Shabaab raids a Afgooye police station, killing eight police officers on 20/06.

A Somaliland army officer shot and injured his colleague in the army base of Kalabaydh (30km S of Laas Caanood) on 21/06 for unknown reasons. The victim later died, while the perpetrator was immediately arrested by the army.

Non-violent activity: Drivers using the Belet Weyn- Galkacyo, road protest that an Agoon clan militia has set up an illegal road-block in Qamno village (roughly 30 KM NE of Belet Weyn) to extort money from each transporter/vehicle. So far no incident was reported and also SNGF did not intervene.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNGF with support of allies conducted a security operation in Baardheere (Gedo Region) on 21/06. According to sources, the operation was opened with one air missile, hitting the police station in Baardheere town. SNG Special Forces were dropped by helicopters/planes and started their assault on an al Shabaab position. Heavy weapons were deployed and around 8 al Shabaab members were killed and another ten wounded. After the assault, Special Forces were picked again by helicopter/plane and returned to their base. In this surprise attack, no SNGF casualties were reported. Unconfirmed reports indicate that at least four high ranking al Shabaab senior members were killed although no al Shabaab bodies or injured were taken away by plane. (Sheik Fidow, Barre Qooje, Sheik Shacir and Abu Daaud, Senior al Shabaab members were supposedly killed).

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Wadajir neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 21/06. The victim was an INGO staff. The motive behind the killing is not known.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG soldiers based in Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 21/06. Both sides engaged serious exchange of gunfire and the fighting lasted for almost twenty minutes. Casualties could not be established.

A vehicle loaded with explosives detonated at the entrance of NISA training centre in the vicinity of Maxfalka (Shibis District) in the morning of 21/06. Three al Shabaab attackers tried to enter the facility but NISA personnel opened gunfire against them. Four al Shabaab fighters and two civilians were killed during the armed clash; NISA also lost a soldier in the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against NISA outpost in Cemiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 21/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire for fifteen minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces police outpost in the vicinity of Gubta (Dayniile District) in the night of 21/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Macmacaanka neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the morning of 21/06. The victim was working for the Office of the Prime Minister and he was going to his working place when the incident happened. Perpetrator(s) escaped.

Property destruction: Dir militia have reportedly burned down eight houses in Guri Cado (23 KM NW of Belet Weyn) in the early hours of 22/06. Property destruction: The village was inhabited by Xawadle families who had already displaced before to other areas due to the on-going conflict between Dir and Xawadle. No human casualty was reported.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed six SNG soldiers that defected from Wajid district near Goof Gadud village (30 KM NW of Baidoa) as the soldiers were heading on foot to Baidoa on 22/06. Both sides briefly exchange small arms fire and four soldiers were killed in the incident. Two others managed to escape from al Shabaab and reached SNGF bases near Baidoa late last night. SNGF soldiers recovered the bodies this morning from Haween village (18 KM NW of Baidoa) for burial.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a probing attack against SNGF base in Xudur on 22/06. SNGF did not respond to the one minute firing and al Shabaab fighters withdrew.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Shacabsoore neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 22/06. Reports indicate that the victim was working for an INGO. The motive behind the killing is not known. Perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a traditional elder in Buundoweyne in the evening of 22/06. This is the second killing of a high profile individual in the town since the beginning of Ramadan. Elder Omar Barre, also a Xawadle clan elder, was shot dead in the town on 20/06/2015. The perpetrators managed to escape but further reports indicate that the police in Belet Weyn have arrested and detained four people suspected of involvement in the murder of the elder. The late elder was the brother of the Mayor of Belet Weyn,

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a Tax collector in Xaawa Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye District) in the morning of 22/06. The victim was busy with his daily work when the incident happened. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: Mutiny Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: At 15:15 Government forces attacked the houses of Gen. Muhyidin and Abdiyare. Heavy gun fire was heard especially from the house of Gen. Muhyidiin. The Puntland forces reportedly entered the houses and searched them, no casualties reported.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a tax collector in Suuq Boocle neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the afternoon of 22/06. Perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in livestock neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the morning of 22/06. Perpetrator(s) escaped from the scene. Two other soldiers were killed by unidentified attackers in the same area later in the evening.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Ceel Gaabta neighbourhood (Xamar Jabjab District) in the afternoon of 22/06. Perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against a group of SNA soldiers manning a checkpoint in the outskirt of Bariire (27km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 23/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a while before the SNA personnel withdrew from the checkpoint. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNG forces outpost in Mukayga location (Afgooye) in the early morning of 23/06. The two sides exchanged gunfire but casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a businessman/elder in Horseed neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 23/06. The victim came out of a mosque when the incident happened. Perpetrators escaped from the scene.

A dead body of a man was found under the old bridge in Ahmed Dhagah District (Hargeisa) in the night of 23/06. Police confirmed that the victim was killed with a knife that was found at the site. The identity of the perpetrator(s) and the motive behind the killing is currently unknown; however, the police are investigating the incident.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed an elder in Siinaay neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 23/06. The motive behind the killing is unclear. Perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified armed men with pistols shot and killed a Police man in Jamhuuriya neighbourhood of Karaan District in the early afternoon of 23/06. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the assailants managed to escape from the scene.

Three unknown assailants armed with pistols attacked three police officers at Via Liberia junction (Waberi) on 23/06. One soldier was killed while another one was injured during the attack. Assailants managed to escape from the scene.
Al Shabaab fighters ambush KDF convoy near Likooley Village (96km SW of Beled Xawo) on 24/06. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab militants attacked Kenyan convoy transporting food and logistic to Kenyan troops based in Ceel Cade (96 km SW of Belet-Xawo), the military convoy crossed from the Kenyan boarder into Somalia. Al Shabaab attack started with a land mine device followed by exchange of gunfire between al Shabaab and the KDF convoy. Reports say that one of the military vehicles was hit by the explosion and resulted in the death of 10 soldiers.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Qoryooley in the night of 24/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No reports on casualties.

Al Shabaab sentences an ISWA soldier, who was captured by them a few days ago in the outskirts of Baidoa with his gun to death and publicly executed him in Labaatan Jirow (50 KM NE of Baidoa) on 24/06. His body was buried in the village by al Shabaab.

A SVBIED was targeting an UAE government convoy and detonated off the former military hospital which is adjacent to the UAE training facility in Hodan District on 24/06. Three soldiers and three civilian bystanders were killed while three more soldiers and two civilians were also injured. Later reports indicate nine dead. (Associated Press) The UAE officials escaped unscathed. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack and said UAE officials were the target.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a man in Wadada Jaayga in Dharkenleey district in the evening of 24/06. The reason for the killing remains unclear; the assailants took the car and a pistol from the victim and managed to escape.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG traffic policeman in Hodan District in the evening of 24/06. The reason for the killing remains unclear and the killers managed to escape from the scene.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a NISA outpost in Biyo Degeenka (Heliwa District) on 24/06. The exchange of gun-fire lasted for 10 minutes before al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

An armed clash erupted between Murale and Marehan sub-clans in Dhamase (108 KM SW of Bulo Xawo on 25/06. One person was killed. Reports indicate that Marehan initiated the clash as revenge for the killing of one of their clan members by Murale on the Kenyan side of the border.
Jubaland Darawish commander Col. Mursal Geedi was killed in an IED attack on his home. No other casualties reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a complex attack against AMISOM/Burundian base in Leego (49 KM SE of Buur-Hakaba) in the morning of 26/06. According to first reports, the attack started with a massive SVBIED and was followed by armed gun men who fought their way inside the camp and took it over. AMISOM re-enforcement is said to be on the way. Fifty AMISOM casualties reported as well as the capture and beheading of a government official (Shabelle Media Network).

Al Shabaab authorities beheaded the deputy chief of Leego village by the name Hassanow Madayle in Saraar Goobo village (67km SE of Buur Hakaba) in the night of 26/06. The victim was caught with several SNA personnel and AMISOM translator by al Shabaab fighters during the Leego attack on 26/06. Two other Somali men were also beheaded along the Leego deputy chief.
Al Shabaab beheads a government official captured during their attack on the AMISOM base in Leego.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against Bosnia section of Dhoobley Town (120 KM east of Afmadow) where TIS/DAI is drilling a borehole which was guarded by Dhoobley police in the evening of 26/06. All communication was switched off after LA received a tip that al Shabaab fighters might advance towards the town. After 20 minutes of gun-fire exchange, which could be heard also in Liboi town, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Three JLF and one al Shabaab fighter have reported died while three soldiers and one Kenyan engineer got injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Around 12 al Shabaab fighters ambushed a JLF patrolling vehicle in Hanta Biyaha, Gulwade Shaqalaha neighbourhood in Kismaayo Town in the night of 26/06. After brief exchange of gunfire JLF killed Xudayfa a former Amniyat Commander in Kismaayo who was heading the attackers. His body was brought to Suuq Yasin in Farjano were he use to reside for public identification. Two more al Shabaab fighters were injured but they managed to escape. JLF captured one BKM, two AK47 and one Hand-grenade. No casualties reported from JLF side.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a JLF convey heading to Bula Gudud Village at Yoontoy Yarey Village (25KM NE of Kismaayo town) in the morning of 26/06. After an exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties reported from both sides.

Hundreds of people, most of them IDPs, staged demonstration against government officials over corrupting the humanitarian aid in the afternoon of 26/06. The demonstrators accused some government officials for diverting the humanitarian aid. The police responded the scene and dispersed the protestors. No incident was reported during the demonstration.

Forces of Dharkenley DC and SNGF clashed near Badbaado IDP settlement vicinity after suspecting the other side of being wrong elements. Two civilian casualties were reported from stray bullets. No other casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A roadside bomb explosion has killed a senior army commander in the outskirts out southern city of Kismaayo. The IED is suspected to have been placed by al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack against AMISOM forces base in Tortoorow Village (49km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 27/06. The clash between the warring sides lasted for more than ten minutes before the attackers retreated back. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces based in Mudul-Braawe (5km NW of Baraawe) in the night of 27/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed an elder in Beyturaas neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 27/06. The motive behind the killing is unknown. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A Puntland soldier shot and killed an armed man from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan and injured another near Darxumo Market at the green line of Galkacyo in the morning of 27/06. The shooting reportedly followed after the victim tried to assassinate the soldier. No arrest was made.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG police outpost in Ex-Control Balcad (Heliwa) in the night of 27/06. After a brief exchange of gunfire the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab attack SNG forces at Ex-control Balad junction in Yaaqshid district. Varying calibre of weaponry was exchanged during the fighting that ensued. The attack took place over the evening hours. Casualties not reported.

Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters initiated an armed clash and finally took over Waldena village (approx. 90 KM SE of Dhoobley) along the border line after defeating a militia, loyal to JL in the night of 27/06. Information is scarce as communication is switched off however 12 JL militia are reportedly killed. Al Shabaab took over the village where at the same time a clan reconciliation meeting was on-going.

A group of Habar-Jeclo/Reer Biniin sub-clan reportedly assaulted a man hailing from Issa Muse/Abdalla Qoyan sub-clan in the area of Booraamo village (26km NE of Burco) on 28/06. The motive of the incident remains unclear. However some reports indicate that the victim was among a group of elders interviewed by the reconciliation committee regarding the historical ownership of a disputed Diiriye Guuleed village. Police arrested several elders from the perpetrators sub-clan after the attackers escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces in Ceelasha (12 km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 28/06. After a fighting lasted for fifteen minutes, the SNG forces withdrew from Ceelasha police station and al Shabaab fighters took over the police station. Al Shabaab personnel remained there until the following morning. NISA forces were deployed and restored order. Casualties are unknown.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration against Somali Federal Government and the UN Special Envoy to Somalia, Nicholas Kay, in Garowe in the morning of 28/06. The demonstrators expressed their anger against the upcoming Galmudug state that claims the ownership of entire Mudug region. They strongly criticized the Federal Government over its federalism policy while waving banners that read slogans such as ""Puntland will never accept violation of the constitution"". Similar demonstrations also took place in Bosasso.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces base in Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 28/06. Both sides exchanged gunfire for not less than one hour after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration against Somali Federal Government and the UN Special Envoy to Somalia, Nicholas Kay, in Garowe in the morning of 28/06. The demonstrators expressed their anger against the upcoming Galmudug state that claims the ownership of entire Mudug region. They strongly criticized the Federal Government over its federalism policy while waving banners that read slogans such as ""Puntland will never accept violation of the constitution"". Similar demonstrations also took place in Bosasso.
Al Shabaab executes three of its own members for spying in Saacow on 28/06.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a corrections officer in the vicinity of Sarkuusta (Dharkenley District) in the evening of 28/06. Perpetrators escaped.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab overtakes Tortoroow after a withdrawal of SNG and AMISOM forces. No reported violence.

Hundreds of residents of Galkacyo led by local Puntland authorities in Mudug staged a peaceful demonstration on 29/06 against the Somali Federal government and the UN envoy to Somalia, Mr. Nicholas Kay, in Galkacyo (North) in the morning of 29/06. The residents were protesting against the upcoming Galmudug State which according to its interim constitution states that the central states border will stretch up to Nugaal region. The demonstrators who criticized the president, the Speaker and the UN envoy to Somalia, terming them as clannish, spoiler and imperialist respectively, while waving placards announcing that Puntland will never accept destruction, new era of civil war and clan hatred. The governor of north Mudug region told the media that they will force President Hassan Sheik Mohamud to seek entry visa for Mudug Region.

Borama residents staged a peaceful demonstration in front of local government offices on 29/06 in protest against local garbage collection company of not cleaning the town. The protestors were complaining about waste lying on the road and other parts of the town and they blamed both the local government and the contracted company. Reports indicate that the local people are pushing for the new mayor to address the issue.
Two unknown assailants armed with pistols shot and killed a SNGF in Hawl-wadaag section of Belet Weyne in the evening of 29/06. The perpetrators managed to escape and no arrests were reported.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF in the outskirts of Bariire (27 KM SW of Afgooye on 29/06. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces base in the southern outskirt of Afgooye town in the mid-night of 29/06. After a brief armed clash of both sides the attackers withdrew. No reports of casualties.

Hundreds of residents of Burtinle stage a peaceful a similar demonstration as that of Galkacyo in the morning of 29/06. The protestors also criticized the Somali Federal government and the UN envoy to Somalia, Nicholas Kay for their support of the upcoming Galmudug state.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against a JLF base camp in Acadeamia (8 KM north of Kismayo) on 29/06. Around 9 JLF were killed and 6 wounded and al Shabaab took over the camp before withdrawing later voluntarily. Unconfirmed reports also indicate that some JL soldiers were taken away by al Shabaab to unknown location.
The head of tax collection of Waaberi District and his body guard was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in Suuq Beerta area on 29/06. The assailants managed to escape from the scene.

Two suspected al Shabaab operatives tried to shoot and kill a police officer at the Black Sea Junction in Hodan District on 29/06. The police man was able to fire back and the two attackers managed to escape. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNPF outpost in Gubta neighbourhood in the night of 29/06. The fire exchange reportedly was around five minutes before the attackers withdrew.

Unknown gunmen shot at an ASWJ official in Abudwaaq on the 30/06 in an attempt on his life. His bodyguards opened fire and in the confrontation, a civilian man was killed and another one was injured. The motive is unknown and the perpetrators managed to escape.

Hundreds of residents in Bossaso have taken into the main streets of the town on 30/06, protesting against the president of the Federal Republic of Somalia, Hassan Sheikh Mohamud, Parliament speaker Jawaari and the UN Special envoy to Somalia, Mr. Nickolas Kay. The protestors called the Puntland government to cut all relations with the central government. Bari regional officials who were taking part in the rally addressed the protesting mass.

A RCIED was targeted at SNG forces vehicle in the outskirt of Afgooye town along Afgooye Marka road in the afternoon of 30/06. Six SNG soldiers were reportedly injured in the attack. Perpetrators escaped.

Similar demonstrations were held both in Iskushuban and Ufeyn towns (67km NW of Iskushuban) on 30/06 to protest against president of Somalia, the Speaker of the parliament and the UN envoy to Somalia over their support to the central state formation. The protestors were demanding Puntland government to cut all the relation with the central government and they addressed by district officials.

Similar demonstrations were held both in Iskushuban and Ufeyn towns (67km NW of Iskushuban) on 30/06 to protest against president of Somalia, the Speaker of the parliament and the UN envoy to Somalia over their support to the central state formation. The protestors were demanding Puntland government to cut all the relation with the central government and they addressed by district officials.

30 June 2015: A pastoralist man from Saleeban sub-clan killed another pastoralist man from the Habar-Gidir/Saad sub-clan in revenge for the earlier killing of his brother in the vicinity of Dagaari village (29km SW of Galkacyo. There were ongoing talks between the two sub-clans over the two successive incidents while both the perpetrators were arrested.
Unknown assassins shot and killed a district judicial official in Buundo Yare section of Afgooye town on 30/06. The perpetrators managed to escape and no arrests were reported.

Tensions ran high in Kulmiye neighbourhood in Ceerigaabo on 30/06 after group of people, mostly youth and women, from Warsangeli/ Ba Ugaas Labe sub-clan stoned a venue where traditional elders from Habar Yonis/Abdalle Haamud) and Warsangeli/ Ba Ugaas Labe sub-clan were meeting with Sanaag regional governor to discuss the recent murder of Warsangeli man by a perpetrator from Habar Yonis. The group stoned the venue following rumours that Warsangeli elders were planning to accept blood compensation for the murder of their kinsman. Police dispersed the group.

More than hundreds of people mostly, drivers and conductors of commuter buses staged a peaceful demonstration in western part of Burco against the city mayor and the local councillors on 01/07. The protestors were complaining against a directive issued by the local municipal council allowing tricycles (Tuktuk) to play same routes as of the public buses. The drivers reportedly blocked the roads with their buses. Police arrived at the scene and arrested a number of protesters.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurled some hand grenades against a police station in Hawl-wadaag neighbourhood in Beled Weyne on 01/07. Two police officers sustained injuries and the attackers managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNA personnel manning a checkpoint in the vicinity of Mushaani Village (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 01/07. The SNA personnel were forced to withdraw after few minutes of fire exchange, though it is not clear if al Shabaab gained any or all control of the village. Causalities not known.

Armed clan clash flared up for the 2nd time in one week in Dhamase (110 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) on 01/07 between Muruule and Marehan sub-clans. Reports indicate that 12 combatants from both sides were killed and a score of other were injured. So far no clan negotiations are reported and both sides are said to re-group.

Two groups of Marehan sub clans (not named) clash for several hours in Garbaharey. Apparently, the infighting was triggered by the killing of a business woman yesterday by a soldier who seemingly has killed already 2 more people in the previous year. Tensions are escalating between the sub-clans of the victim and perpetrator. Causalities not known.

Two gunmen hailing from Majerteen and Dhulbahante clans exchanged gunfire over unspecified personal dispute in an area near Hargeisa bus station in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 01/07. A bystander man from Dhulbahante was killed by a stray bullet while the Dhulbahante gunman was also injured. No arrest was made.
Unknown assailants armed with pistols shot and killed a famous elder in Bulgari neighbourhood who was on his way to his residence on 01/07. The perpetrators managed to escape.

An IED detonated at SNG forces vehicle in Heliwas livestock market in the afternoon of 01/07. It is not known if the device was a RCIED or land mine planted along the road. Unknown numbers of SNG soldiers were affected in the explosion.

Unidentified three gunmen attacked a mosque in which worshippers were performing ISHA prayers in the vicinity of Gubta (Dayniile District) in the night of 01/07. According to the reports received from where the incident happened, the target of the attackers was two elders who were praying in the mosque. Dayniile District Police Commissioner told to the media that they arrested one suspect in connection to the incident. One elder was killed and another one was injured in the shooting. The Imam (the man who was leading the prayers) was also injured.

A gunmen from Dhulbahante/Jama Siyaad sub clan and Habar Younis/Sacad Younis sub clan reportedly exchanged a sudden burst of gunfire in Guumays village (45km E of Caynabo) in the evening of 02/07. This follows when the gunmen from Jama Siyaad sub clan started to fire to the gunmen of SacadYounis who arrived at that time in the village teashops. The motive of the shooting remains unknown but is believed to be related a revenge killings. Two men from the Sacad Younis clan were reportedly killed and three were injured. Three battalion of the Somaliland troops were immediately deployed to create buffer zone and prevent further attacks from both sides.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Abu Hureyra Mosque of Bakara Market in the morning of 02/07. The reason for the killing remains unclear. Perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked NISA outpost in Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the morning of 02/07. The fighting lasted for few minutes before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a government official in Afgooye on 02/07.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Following the retreat of AMISOM forces from Qoryoley al Shabaab overtakes the village. No report of violence.

Herders from Dhulbahante and Majerteen sub-clans briefly exchanged gunfire in the area of Arooley village (44km S of Taleex) on 03/07. The clash lasted for about an hour after which both militias retreated from the scene. The motive of the clash remains unknown and no casualties were reported. Pro-Puntland forces with battle wagons were reportedly deployed to disperse and create buffer zone between two warring herders.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A JL soldier shot and killed a colleague in a dispute in a location 8 KM north 0f Kismayo in the morning of 03/07. JL forces were sent to arrest the killer but so far, no arrest was reported. Cause of the dispute unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An IED was targeting a JLF vehicle convoy in Yoontoy Yare (27 KM NE of Kismayo) on 03/07. Four JL soldiers are reported dead and five more injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in the vicinity of livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 03/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

SNG forces opened fire on a civilian vehicle in the vicinity of Xero Gaadiid (Cabdicasiis District) in the night of 03/07. The driver, reportedly working with an international aid agency but off duty at that time and driving a private car, was injured in the shooting. The motive behind the shooting is unknown.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and injured a SNG soldier in Dabakaayo Madow neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the night of 03/07. Attackers escaped.

Well-armed al Shabaab fighters entered into Wanlaweyne town in the evening of 04/07 after the SNG forces withdrew from the town towards Ballidoogle base. The al Shabaab militants withdrew voluntarily from the town about mid-night and went back to their locations.
A RCIED was targeting a SNG vehicle in the vicinity of Mudul-Braawe (5km NW of Baraawe) in the evening of 04/07. The explosion reportedly damaged the vehicle but human casualties are unknown.

A man from Dhulbahante shot and injured the police commander of Fiqi Fuliyes police post in Ceerigaabo in the evening of 04/07. The motive is currently unclear. The victim also hails from Dhulbahnate clan. The perpetrator escaped.

Hundreds of residents in Bacaadweyn staged a demonstration against the president of SNG, Speaker of Parliament and the UN envoy to Somalia in the morning of 04/07. Local officials and elders who addressed the rally called on Puntland government to cut all relations with the SNG.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Two groups of Puntland forces exchanged gunfire at a customs office 60km N of Qardho in the evening of 04/07. The motive of the clash is unknown. However, the incident is believed to be related to a dispute between the two groups. One soldier was reportedly injured in the clash.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unknown perpetrators hurled a hand grenade attack at JLF foot patrol and have injured one soldier at Umburitori, Fanole neighbourhood of Kismaayo town on 04/07 night. No other casualties reported.

An unidentified gunman believed to be Galgala/al Shabaab fighter opened fire and injured two women and a man in a teashop in Midigale village (74km S of Laas-Qoray) in the evening of 04/07. The motive of the attack is unknown and the perpetrator escaped.
Al Shabaab fighters took over Buufow Bacaad (5 KM NW of Merca) after attacking a SNGF base in the village on 05/07. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters and nomads engaged in an armed clash in Babweyne (44 KM NE of Hudur) on 05/07. The conflict broke out over confiscated livestock, taken by al Shabaab. Three al Shabaab fighters and two local pastoralists were killed and SNGF sent re-enforcement to Babweyne in support of the locals.

Unidentified gunmen believed to be pro-Khatumo militia shot and killed a Somaliland army officer and injured another in Kalabaydh village (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 05/07. The two victims are from Dhulbahante/Jama Siyaad sub-clan and Habarjeclo clan respectively. The motive of the killing is unknown and the perpetrators escaped. Somaliland forces conducted a security operation in the outskirts of the village following the attack but no arrests were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Armed al Shabaab fighters launched attack against AMISOM/SNA positions in Mahadaay (21 KM NE of Jowhar) in the night of 05/07. The attackers managed to enter into the town but after almost one hour of gun fire exchange they were pushed back by AMISOM and SNA forces. Casualties from both sides are unknown.

Armed gun-men attacked a busy Qat market in Jalalaqsi where people were chewing in the evening of 05/07. In the surprise attack, a gun-man opened fire and managed to kill one soldier and injured two more and two civilians. Further reports indicate that the gun-man also threw two hand grenades which did not explode. The attacker, thought to be al Shabaab member managed to escape from the scene with the help of others. SNG soldiers arrived at the location after 20 minutes and opened fire in the air to disperse gathered people.

An IED believed to be magnetic that was attached to a vehicle exploded in the vicinity of Ceel-Gaabta neighbourhood (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the morning of 05/07. A NISA officer who was driving the targeted vehicle sustained injuries. No other casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian woman in Nasteexo neighbourhood (Wadajir-Medina District) in the morning of 05/07. The victim used to run a small scale business in Nasteexo neighbourhood. The motive behind the killing is unknown. Perpetrators escaped with a motorbike they were riding.

A gunman from Habarjeclo/Soolomadaw sub-clan shot and killed a man from Habarjeclo/Omar sub-clan and injured another in Habari Heshay village on 06/07 following a dispute over water reservoirs. Habarjeclo/Omar sub-clan retaliated and killed a man from Soolomadaw sub-clan. Tensions run high in Adhiboob near Habar Heshay village after both sub-clans reportedly mobilized their clan militia. Reports indicate that Somaliland deployed a large number of its troops to prevent further clashes between the two sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab shot and killed an ENDF defector, who was previously shown to the public in Ufurow in Hubay (30 KM south of Qansax Dheere on 06/07. The reason is unclear but some sources indicate that he was shot after he tried to escape from al Shabaab forces.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNA base in Laantabuur (12km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 06/07. Both sides engaged in heavy exchange of gunfire for twenty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers were pushed back. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and two SNA soldiers got injured.

A SNG soldier threw a hand grenade into a crowd of civilians at the market close to Sheikh Ibrahim building in Isha neighbourhood on 06/07. He also immediately opened fire at civilians and other SNGF. Hospital sources report to have received 3 dead and 12 injured civilian, some of them serious. The perpetrator first managed to escape heavy gun-fire from other SNGF but was soon apprehended and arrested at the outskirts of the town. The motive of the soldier, working for the SNA Generals unit is so far unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNG army out-post near the perfume factory in the night of 06/07. After exchanging gun-fire for 10 minutes suspected al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A SNG officer, working for the Ministry of Finance was shot and killed by armed unknown men with pistols on 06/07. The perpetrators managed to escape. A second officer and two soldiers were killed in a drive-by shooting along the industrial road, also in Hawl Wadaag.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG police forces on patrol in Caafi Mineral Water Factory area in the night of 06/07. After exchanging gun fire for around 20 minutes al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF base in Bacadada, Hawl-wadaag of Beled Weyne neighbourhood on 07/07. The exchange of gunfire lasted for around 5 minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. So far, no casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Sheekh Abroone in the morning of 07/07. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire and immediately conducted security operation in the neighbourhood. A large number of people were arrested during the operation. One civilian was killed by AMISOM forces who said she was intending to throw another hand grenade at them and two other civilian bystanders were wounded by stray bullets.

Resident community including women, children, young people, and elderly carried out a peaceful demonstration voicing concerns about insecurity and instability in the town after violent incidents against civilian occurred previously in the town. Demonstrators used slogans of security, stability demands from the local authorities. Gedo region governor Maxamed Cabdi Kaliil and Iiman CadbowKaarshe Garbaharey district commissioner addressed the demonstrators on their demand for security, peace and stability.

A public civilian driver was shot and killed while driving his car by unidentified gunmen at the main bridge entrance of Buur-Hakaba town. The motive behind the killing is not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed two men on motorcycles in Buur Weyn (29 KM S of Bulo Burte) in the night of 07/07. They were on their way, transporting khat to Bulo Burte. In the confrontation, one man was wounded and the second man was arrested by al Shabaab. Their motorbikes were also confiscated and nothing is known on their fate.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Suuq Boocle neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the evening of 07/07. The motive behind the killing is not known. Unconfirmed report indicated that the attackers were also SNG soldier who were looking after the victim over undisclosed reasons. Perpetrators escaped.

An IED believed to be magnetic that was attached to a Toyota Noah detonated in the vicinity of Walaalaha Pharmacy (Karaan District) in the morning of 07/07. The target is still not clear but initial reports indicate that the victim was a land broker. The motive behind the attack is not known. No group claimed the responsibility of the attack. Two men were killed in the explosion and four bystanders were injured.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a tax collector in Dabakaya Madow neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the afternoon of 07/07. Perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base on the west side of Jalalaqsi Town in the night of 08/07. Both sides exchanged fire for 20 minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attacker armed with a pistol shot and killed former Afgooye DC Mr. Abdullahi Abdi Iidey in the vicinity of Dhagaxtuur in the afternoon of 08/07. The victim responded with gunshot before he died and injured the perpetrator.
A vehicle, belonging to Waaberi local authorities exploded in the afternoon of 08/07. Three people were injured in the explosion.

Wadajir/Medina District Police and SNA personnel manning a checkpoint near the Jazeera Military Training Centre fought over the control of the checkpoint in the afternoon of 08/07. The incident happened after Wadajir DC instructed the SNA personnel to leave the checkpoint, a call denied by the SNA soldiers on the checkpoint. Two SNA soldiers were killed and three others were injured. It is not clear which group maintained control of the checkpoint.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a NISA Officer in the vicinity of Geed Jacayl (Wardhiigley District) in the afternoon of 08/07. The victim was reportedly heading to his home when the incident happened. Perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Gunmen armed with pistols have killed a government soldier in Mogadishus Hodan District on the evening of 09/07.
Police disperse two rioting youth groups. Some of the rioters sustain gunshot injuries.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed two SNG soldiers in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 09/07. The victims were buying khat when the incident happened. Perpetrators escaped.

A group of youth orphans from an orphanage centre in Jigjiga Yar neighbourhood in Kood-Buur district attacked other youth group in the neighbourhood using sticks, daggers and stones on 09/07. The attacking youth destroyed windows of houses while disturbing the residents in the area. The clash was triggered a dispute over the ownership of a playground in front of the orphanage centre, the youth from the centre claim that its their ground while the other group insist that its a public ground. Forces from custodial corps who were also responsible of the orphanage centre arrived at the scene and shot at the air to separate the two groups. A stray bullet hit a youth from the attacking group and seriously injured him while also arresting some others from the same group.

A gunmen from Dhulbahante/Wacays Aden sub clan reportedly shot and killed herder man from Habar Jeclo/Soolamadaw sub clan near Qorilugud Village (38km NW of Buuhoodle) in the afternoon of 09/07. The incident is related to cycles of revenge killings between the two sub-clans. The perpetrators reportedly took away an AK-47 belonging to the victim and escaped.

AMISOM supported local militia in Bulo Burto called Macawisley left Bulo Burto and attacked Tardo in the evening of 10/07. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed and their guns were taken. After the armed confrontation, the militia went to Jalalaqsi where they were welcomed by LA. It seems a new strategy that AMISOM is supporting and equipping local militia in their fight against al Shabaab.

Unknown perpetrators shot and seriously wounded an Imam, who was entering the mosque for Tahajud prayers in Nur Xawaad neighbourhood on 10/07. The perpetrator managed to escape and the Imam was rushed to the hospital. The motive is unknown.

column9: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attacker armed with a pistol shot and killed one off-duty JLF soldier in front of his house after the Ramadan break in Shaqaalaha neighbourhood in the night of 10/07. The perpetrator escaped from the scene and no arrests reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attackers shelled at least four mortar rounds at AMISOM base inside Mogadishu Stadium (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 10/07. Another two mortar shells also landed in the vicinity of Villa Somalia. SNG did not release any statement on the mortar attack. The mortars are believed to be fired from the outskirts of Mogadishu. Casualties are unknown.

A VBIED detonated in front of the Siyaad Hotel (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the evening of 10/07. The explosion was followed by serious exchange of gunfire between the hotel guards/ SNP force and the al Shabaab attackers. Reports show that the attackers were seven in number including the suicide. Security forces reinforced the scene and closed the whole area. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the attackers were aiming at Hotel SYL which is adjacent to Siyaad Hotel and that they diverted to Siyaad when the SYL Hotel guards fired them very seriously. Numbers of dead not known.

Around five al Shabaab attackers launched a complex attack against Wehliye Hotel (Hawl-Wadaag District) and along the busy Maka Al Mukarama road in the evening of 10/07. The attack started with a car explosion (VBIED) followed by exchange of gunfire between the al Shabaab attackers on one side and the SNG forces and the hotel guards on the other side. The attackers did not manage to enter the hotel due to fierce resistant which was coming from the SNG forces/ Hotel guards. The fighting lasted for one hour and twenty minutes after which the security forces killed all the attackers and restored the order. Five people were killed in the attack and roughly ten others were injured. The four al Shabaab attackers were also killed. Two Federal MPs are among the injured.

Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades against AMISOM forces on foot patrol inside Marka town in the morning of 11/07. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire to different directions after the blast. Confirmed reports indicate that AMISOM forces entered a mosque (Al-Raxmah) and killed the imam and his assistant inside the mosque. The indiscriminate gunfire opened by AMISOM forces also injured six civilians. Tensions turned high and people took the streets of Marka to show their anger against AMISOM forces behaviour towards the civilians. The demonstrators were burning tyres and they had slogans saying AMISOM has to leave. The demonstration was continuing until 15:00.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades against AMISOM forces on foot patrol inside Marka town in the morning of 11/07. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire to different directions after the blast. Confirmed reports indicate that AMISOM forces entered a mosque (Al-Raxmah) and killed the imam and his assistant inside the mosque. The indiscriminate gunfire opened by AMISOM forces also injured six civilians. Tensions turned high and people took the streets of Marka to show their anger against AMISOM forces behaviour towards the civilians. The demonstrators were burning tyres and they had slogans saying AMISOM has to leave. The demonstration was continuing until 15:00.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF supply convoy in Boodaan (50 KM SE of Yeed) on 11/07. Both sides exchange small arms fire and RPGs. Casualties from the incident is not yet known as the telecommunication network in the area including Wajid town is switched off for the last two days.

Suspected al Shabaab members threw 2 hand grenades against the house of ISWA Deputy Minister of Husbandry and previous Deputy DC on 11/07. No casualties were reported during the explosion. SNGF responded with gun-fire, killing one of the attackers and injuring a second man, who was handed over to the police after receiving medical treatment in the hospital.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces based in Ceel-Jaale (7km SW of Marka) and SNA forces collided mistakenly after the AMISOM forces thought that the SNA forces were al Shabaab fighters. The SNA forces came from Shalaambood and they were heading to Marka when the incident happened. Two SNA soldiers were killed and five others were injured. One of the SNA vehicles was also damaged.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Nov 7. Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades against AMISOM forces on foot patrol inside Marka town in the morning. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire to different directions after the blast.

An off-duty SNG soldier who was walking home alone was shot and killed in Hawo-Tako, outside Beled Weyne in the afternoon of 11/07 by unidentified gunmen. The motive is unknown and the perpetrator escaped from the scene. No arrest was reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Nov 7. Following a grenade attack by unidentified assailants, confirmed reports indicate that AMISOM forces entered a mosque (Al-Raxmah) in Marka town and killed the imam and his assistant inside the mosque.

Reports confirm that KDF conducted an airstrike against Dhamase village (103 KM NW of Buulo Xaawo) in the early morning of 12/07. Residents report that at least 10 people are reported to have been killed including children who were in Holy Quran School. Dhamase is under control of al Shabaab but usually has no permanent presence in the village and clan clashes between Murule and Marehan are reported in the area. The reason is unclear why KDF bombed the village. KDF also bombed Nus Dariiq (83 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) and Laan Qurac (76 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) was bombarded and civilian casualties and livestock death were reported.

Reports confirm that KDF conducted an airstrike against Dhamase village (103 KM NW of Buulo Xaawo) in the early morning of 12/07. Residents report that at least 10 people are reported to have been killed including children who were in Holy Quran School. Dhamase is under control of al Shabaab but usually has no permanent presence in the village and clan clashes between Murule and Marehan are reported in the area. The reason is unclear why KDF bombed the village. KDF also bombed Nus Dariiq (83 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) and Laan Qurac (76 KM SW of Bulo Xawo) was bombarded and civilian casualties and livestock death were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF convoy was targeted with an IED, which exploded in Qansax Dheere shortly before the convoy reached the place on 12/07. No casualties were reported. All communication was switched off in Baidoa since early morning as a ENDF convoy left from Baidoa for Burhakaba.

A demonstration in protest against an alleged allocation of land belonging to Berbera port to businessmen was held near the port of Berbera on 12/07. The demonstration follows after workers started to construct a new building near the port, which local media claimed was given to the businessman by the government. A number of local business people were part of the demonstrators. The demonstrators tried to stop the construction by throwing some stones at the construction workers. They also called on the port manager to stop the allocation of state-owned land to the businessmen. Police dispersed the demonstrators and arrested a number of then.
Two groups of Marehan militia fought over extorted money in the afternoon of 12/07. One man was killed, another one wounded and the shooter managed to escape from the scene.

A box with a mobile phone attached was placed close to Dahabshiil Bank in Cadado Town on 12/07. A civilian tried to pick the phone and the box exploded damaging his hand. The motive is unknown and no other casualty was reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An ENDF convoy was targeted with an IED in Aawdiinle (30 KM NE of Baidoa) on 12/07. One casualty was reported on ENDF side who was transferred to hospital for treatment.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters and allied forces clashed briefly in Buur Dhuxunle, (60 KM SE of Yeed) on 12/07. After exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters escaped. One civilian was killed in the exchange and 2 SNGF were injured. After the attack, ENDF/SNG also left the town.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed one of the Afgooye sub district officials in the Xaawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye town) in the evening of 12/07. The motive behind the killing is unknown. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Intelligence JL forces attacked JL security forces from the Minister of Interior and Security in Calanley neighbourhood, close to the Ministry. Villagers are reporting heave gun-fire is used. Apparently during the disarmament process, a soldier from the Minister of interior confiscated a gun from the Intelligence forces and refused to render it back. Casualties are unknown as the fighting was on-going during the reporting time.

Unidentified armed men in a vehicle killed Kaxda District Secretary and two of his guards in drive by shooting in the vicinity of Dabakaaya Madow (Dharkeynley District) in the morning of 12/07. The attackers escaped from the scene.

NISA and SNA personnel fought in the vicinity of Tarabuunka (Hodan District) over unknown dispute in the afternoon of 12/07. One NISA soldier was killed and one SNA member was injured during the clash.

Well-armed al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNA bases in Rage-Ceelle town (47km NE of Warsheikh) in the morning of 13/07. After a heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for more than twenty minutes the al Shabaab militants managed to take-over the town. SNA forces retreated to AMISOM base in the outskirt of the town. Casualties reported are so far 8 SNGF and 4 civilians, al Shabaab side is unknown. Heavier casualties reported from other sources.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired about 5 rounds of mortars against AMISOM base in Qansax Dheere in the early morning of 13/07. No casualties were reported and the attackers withdrew.
Following a take-over of Raga Ceel by al Shabaab, al Shabaab exits and SNG forces again gain control of the town.

Two militia groups from Habar-Gidir (Suleiman and Ary sub-clans) clashed in Camaara village (70km W of Hobyo) on 13/07. The motive of the clash is believed to be clan revenge between the two sides. Traditional elders and clerics have stepped in to defuse the hostilities between the fighting groups; however the two sides are still mobilizing their militias. Three militias from Suleiman were killed while unknown numbers of militias from both sides were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy in War Dhujiiley (56 KM SE of Yeed) on 13/07. Both sides exchanged small arms fire before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Two civilians were killed and 2 SNGF were injured during the fight.
Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in night of 13/07. Casualties are unknown.

SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire with two SNG personnel who were extorting money from the public transport in the vicinity of Ceelgaabta (Xamar Jab Jab District) on 13/07. The two soldiers escaped. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against NISA outpost in Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 13/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out attack against Yaaqshiid District Police Station in the night of 13/07. The police force exchanged gunfire with the attackers for a while before the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. One soldier was killed and another one injured during the fight while three al Shabaab fighters were also injured.

A man from the Galjeel sub-clan shot and killed a man from the Jejeele sub-clan for unknown reason in Hawl-wadaag section in the afternoon of 14/07. Other armed Jejeele clan members immediately chased after the killer and shot and killed him. The killing and revenge killing caused tension in Hawl-wadaag section and more clan clashes can be anticipated. Further reports indicate that, elders went into negotiations and the 2 bodies were exchanged.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF military operations against Al-Shabaab were continuing in Qansax Dheere and surrounding villages in the morning of 14/07. Mortar fire is heard outside Qansax Dheere. ENDF forces shelled Bulo Gumar village (8 km and Buulo-Masaajid 10Km SW of Qansax Dheere) respectively, said to be military bases for al Shabaab. The artillery/mortar attack from ENDF hit a house in Buulo Gumar Village where two children and their mother were killed; in Buulo-Masaajid village no injuries/dead were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNGF base in Bulo Burte in the night of 14/07 and fired also a mortar round. After both sides exchanged gun-fire for around an hour, al Shabaab fighters retreated. No casualties were reported.
Two groups of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire in Laanta Buuro (12km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 14/04 over the collection of money extorted from public vehicles. No casualties were reported.

Militiamen hailing from Marehan/Wagardhac shot and killed two men hailing from Habar-Gidir/Saad near Laanwaaley village (40km SW of Galkacyo) in the afternoon of 14/7. The motive of the killing is allegedly related with previous clan revenge between the two sub-cans. The killing has generated tension in the area. No other casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a NISA soldier in the vicinity of Cinema Mogadishu (Wadajir District) in the night of 14/07. Unconfirmed reports stated that the victim was recently appointed for Marka intelligence chief. Attackers escaped.
Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG police based near the Livestock market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 14/07. No casualties were reported.

A group of unidentified attackers armed with pistols attacked SNG soldier in Garas Balley locality (Dharkenleey District) in the morning of 14/07. The soldier defended himself against the attackers and he survived.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Ethiopian and al Shabaab forces engage in an hour-long battle near Wajid. Ten al Shabaab fighter believed killed in the fighting.
A KDF convoy was hit by an IED planted on the road close to Likooley village. The convoy was travelling from Ceel Cadde to Wajiir through Dhamase. One vehicle was damaged. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 15/07. The explosion reportedly missed the target as the device exploded after the convoy passed. No casualties were reported.
A KDF convoy was targeted with a RCIED near Ceel Cadde (51KM SW of Garbahaarey on 15/07. One KDF vehicle was damaged but casualties are unknown. The convoy was heading from Dhamase to Ceel Cadde.
During a handing over ceremony, a security guard of the former DC opened fire and injured a SNGF guarding the site.
Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNA forces base outside Afgooye town in the night of 15/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly. No casualties reported.
Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG soldiers manning an illegal checkpoint in the vicinity of Mushaani village (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 15/07. Casualties are unknown.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a taxi driver in the vicinity of Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 15/07.The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. Perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the night of 15/07. The fighting lasted for few minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Joint KDF/SNGF advanced closer to Bardheere in the night of 15/07 and took over Taraka village (49 KM SW of Bardheere) after exchanging artillery fire with al Shabaab fighters. It is unknown if the joint forces will remain in the village or proceed towards Bardheere in line with the Juba Corridor Offensive. Taraka is a strategic location which links Bardheere with Ceel Waaq and Kenya.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy, which was travelling between Tayeeglow and Ceel Garas in Ceel Gudo (20 KM NW of Tayeeglow) in the morning of 16/07. Reports indicate that 4 al Shabaab fighters were killed while four others were caught alive. ENDF casualties are unknown.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a tax collector in Janaale (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 16/07.
A government soldier shot and killed a traveller over non-payment of extortion money.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA post in Sarta Qabyada in the evening of 16/07. Both sides exchanged gun-fire for around 10 minutes before al Shabaab withdrew. No casualties were reported.

ASNG soldier opened gunfire against a group of people who were receiving humanitarian food aid in the District Office (Xamar Weyne) in the morning of 16/07. An Arab NGO was distributing food and clothes to the people in need with the help of the district authority. A district official who talked to the media stated that the gunfire was unintentional. One civilian was killed and another was injured. The soldier was arrested.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Suspected drone strike, later revealed as originating from the United States, targeted a vehicle with Senior al Shabaab members on board in Jungal Village (23 KM NW of Bardheere) in the early morning of 16/07. Thirty suspected causalities, some reports declare 51 (The Star, Nairobi). Unconfirmed reports indicate that the drone strike was targeting a vehicle with Ismail Jabhad and Ismail Dheere, two Senior al Shabaab military commanders on board.

Ceel Cilaan village (46 KM NW of Diinsoor) was bombarded by air by anti-al Shabaab forces (not identified), targeting al Shabaab vehicles. Unconfirmed reports indicate that both civilians and al Shabaab fighters were killed or injured during the strike, exact numbers not known.
ASWJ fighters ambushed SNG police in the Xananbure area (40 KM SE of Cadud Waaq). Seven SNG police men were injured.
Residents protest the killing of a traveller by a SNG soldier the previous day.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNA forces based in Gol-Weyn after mid-night on 17/07. The fighting was going on until 05:00 in morning. SNA forces in Shalaambood and Buulo Mareer sent reinforcement troops to Gol-Weyn early in the morning but they were both ambushed by al Shabaab fighters on their way to Gol-Weyn. Six SNA soldiers were killed while al Shabaab fighters lost 16.
Al Shabaab fighters executed an al Shabaab fighter, accused of spying and relaying information to ENDF/SNGF in Baardheere.
Residents protest against forced evictions in Hodan evictions.

A group of youth and businessmen demonstrated against the new mayor of Borama and the governor of Awdal region in Borama on 18/07. The protestors were unhappy over the local governments slow response following a recent fire breakout at the local market which destroyed several shops. Police arrived at the scene and arrested several teenagers who threw stones at the police.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF took over Ufurow (18 KM SW of Qansax Dheere) on 18/07. As of 19/07 al Shabaab are back in town after joint forces continued with their military operation towards Diinsoor. No violence reported in either transfer.
