A SNGF vehicle was hit by an IED in Faaxfax Dhuun (75 KM SW of Baardheere) on 18/07. Two injuries reported.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Baar Ubax (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 18/07. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: A suspected US drone strike reportedly attacked a vehicle carrying the acting Intelligence al Shabaab officer in Adad-Gurey (30 KM SW of Diinsoor) on 18/07. Causalities not known.
ASWJ forces, after getting re-enforcement attacked SNGF base in Bangelle (20 KM SE of Cabud Waaq) in retaliation for the morning attack. Casualties from the second fight are unknown.

Fighting broke out between ASWJ and SNGF in Laandheer village (approx. 18 KM SE of Cabud Waaq) in the morning of 19/07. After heavy fighting, ASWJ lost 5 of their soldiers before both sides retreated for re-enforcement.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A SVBIED rammed into an ENDF convoy and SNFG troops heading to Diinsoor district in Dharqo (45 KM SW of Baidoa) on 19/07. Two SNGF died in the attack but 6 killed ENDF cannot be verified.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF/SNG convoy near Idale (58 KM SW of Baidoa) in the evening of 19/07. Both sides exchanged small arms fire before al Shabaab fighters retreated. Two SNGF are reported to be killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A SVBIED rammed into an ENDF convoy in Lulaaye (40 KM SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 19/07. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked an ENDF/SNGF convoy in Eesow, (approx. 49 KM east of Diinsoor) in the afternoon of 19/07. After a brief exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF and al Shabaab clash in Ceel Cilaan. Causalities not known.

ENDF/SNGF took over Ufurow (18 KM SW of Qansax Dheere) on 18/07. As of 19/07 al Shabaab are back in town after joint forces continued with their military operation towards Diinsoor. No violence reported in either transfer.

Hundreds of worshipers from Al Huda mosque staged demonstration in Sheikh Bashir neighbourhood (Burco) on 20/07 in protest against a bill-board installed by Somaliland Ministry of Labour and Family Affairs in partnership with a UN agency campaigning for gender balance in the town.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An air strike against al Shabaab fighters was conducted in Doodaale village (79 KM SW of Buur Hakaba on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that some al Shabaab fighters were killed and a battle wagon destroyed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF on security operation took over Moro Gabey (28 KM NW of Hudur) and Garas Weyne (47 KM NW of Hudur) in the afternoon of 20/07. In both villages ENDF/SNGF were confronted by al Shabaab fighters but ""no serious fighting"" was reported before the allied forces took over the villages. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF on security operation took over Moro Gabey (28 KM NW of Hudur) and Garas Weyne (47 KM NW of Hudur) in the afternoon of 20/07. In both villages ENDF/SNGF were confronted by al Shabaab fighters but ""no serious fighting"" was reported before the allied forces took over the villages. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Allied forces conducted airstrikes in Bisiq Cadde (51 KM SW of Buur Hakaba) and Barariya (28 KM SE of Buur Hakaba) before noon on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the target were al Shabaab fighters, travelling from Diinsoor into Buur Hakaba District. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Allied forces conducted airstrikes in Bisiq Cadde (51 KM SW of Buur Hakaba) and Barariya (28 KM SE of Buur Hakaba) before noon on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the target were al Shabaab fighters, travelling from Diinsoor into Buur Hakaba District. Casualties are unknown.
A RCIED exploded in Ivo the ex-central bank in Sahara neighbourhood in the afternoon of 20/07. It is an open area and no casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in Cambarey Village (45km SW of Marka) in the morning of 20/07. One of the AMISOM vehicles was damaged by the explosion. Human casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF took over Kulunjerer (40 KM NE of Wajiid) in the afternoon of 20/07. No armed confrontation was reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An IED was hidden in the bush at the road side in Ceel Cilaan village (46km NW of Diinsoor) and exploded as ENDF engineering team were searching the area for explosives on 20/07 injuring 6 ENDF soldiers. After the explosion al Shabaab fighters engaged in small arms fire with ENDF resulting in the death of 2 al Shabaab fighters and one taken alive.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy in Buur Dhuxunley (60 KM SE of Yeed) on 20/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that there were al Shabaab and civilian casualties but the exact number is unknown. Additional reports add that ENDF were supported by Lieui police during the fight.

Controversial reports indicate that ASWJ has taken over the control of Cabud Waaq in the afternoon of 20/07 while other reports say that local militia, who are ASWJ sympathizers took over the police station in town. Violence not reported.

Presidential security guards physically assaulted three local journalists who attempt to cover the departure of SNG prime minister, Umar Abdirashid Ali, from Galkacyo airport on 20/07. The soldiers also reportedly damaged the equipment of the journalists.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF took over the control of Rama Caddey (50 KM SW of Diinsoor) in the afternoon of 20/07. Both sides exchanged gun-fire before al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the village. No causalities reported from either sides.

Armed unknown men with pistols shot and killed an alleged NISA informant in Suuq Yare neighbourhood (Dharkeynley) in the morning of 20/07. It is believed that his information led to the arrest of al Shabaab members. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Unidentified gunmen kill a senior government intelligence officer in Dharkeynley.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF take over Safar Nooley near Dinsoor in the morning of 21/07. No report of violence or resistance.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/SNGF convoy in Raamacadey (approx. 80 KM SW of Baidoa on 21/07. Serious fighting broke out between the two parties until al Shabaab forces withdrew. AMISOM/SNGF is still in the location in the morning of 22/07. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF and al Shabaab clash in Ceel Cilaan for a third consecutive day. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNA convoy in the vicinity of Buufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the morning of 21/07. Two civilian bystanders were reportedly injured during the gunfire exchange.
KDF forces conduct an airstrike against al Shabaab in Jungal on 21/07. Shabelle Media Network reports 51 deaths. US forces launched a drone strike in the area on 16/07.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces conducted a search and security operation in Baytaruus neighbourhood to flash out suspected al Shabaab elements in the morning of 21/07. The forces did house to house searches and recovered some guns. The operation went out of hand after some people were shot and killed by AMISOM in their houses and other inhabitants also opened fire. Unconfirmed reports indicate that 13 civilians (some sources claim 19) were killed and around 20 wounded during the operation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM convoy opened fire against 3 public buses in SOS neighbourhood in the afternoon of 21/07. The motive is unknown and one student died while unknown number was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM jets on 21/07 launched air raids against Al-Shabaab camps in areas near the town of Dinsor in southern Somalia. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF took over Wabxo (50 KM NW of Bulo Burte) from an unknown power on 22/07. Exact details and number of casualties are unknown.

SNGF/JLF allied with KDF/ENDF/AMISOM took over Bardheere Town in the afternoon of 22/07. No fighting was reported since al Shabaab vacated the town in anticipation of allied forces advance without major resistance. Bardheere was under control of al Shabaab since 2009.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF took over Muqakoor (67 KM NE of Bulo Burte) from an unknown or unreported power on 22/07. Exact details and number of casualties are unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Reports indicate that KDF and ENDF forces using helicopters bombarded the outskirts of Bardheere to provide air support to the advancing AMISOM/SNGF troops. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AMISOM and Jubaland forces establish a base of operations in Weel Maro.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF attacked Siji village (approx. 67 KM SE of Yeed on 22/07. After an exchange of gun fire, al Shabaab fighter withdrew from the village. Four al Shabaab fighters were killed and no other casualties were reported.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in Hobyo on 22/07 to express their support to the newly elected Galmudug president, Abdikarim Hussein Gulled. Local officials, elders and the residents requested the president to support the construction of Hobyo seaport.
Upon the liberation and arrival of allied pro-government forces two civilians were shot and killed on suspicion of affiliation with al Shabaab.
Prior to the arrival of pro-government allied forces to Baardheere, al Shabaab killed a civilian on their exit.

A civilian man was shot and killed by another civilian man in Gafay Village (8km NE of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 22/07 over dispute of farmland ownership. Both the victim and the perpetrator hail from the same clan (Jareer Weyne/Shiidle).

A civilian man was shot and killed by unknown men armed with pistols, the killing comes after tension and al Shabaab troops movement continues in the town of Baardheere due to the on-going Juba Corridor Offensive. The motive behind the murder is no known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Reports indicate that four men armed with AK 47 attacked Qulateyn (Intelligence base) near Hormuud Telecom in Calanley neighbourhood of Kismaayo town on 22/07 and JLF at the base responded to the attackers, after brief exchange of gun fire, the attackers managed to escape into a civilian house near the base and are surrounded by JLF. Causalities not known.
Unidentified gunmen shot and injured a woman working for local NGO in Baidoa.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM-SNG forces battle al Shabaab in several areas of Xudur district, overtaking Mura-gabe, Garas-wayne and Lagalay. Seventeen al Shabaab deaths reported among the three areas.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM-SNG forces battle al Shabaab in several areas of Xudur district, overtaking Mura-gabe, Garas-wayne and Lagalay. Seventeen al Shabaab deaths reported among the three areas. One soldier died during the operation.

""Two INGO vehicles were stopped by a militia close to Belet Weyne. The 5 INGO staff traveling in the vehicle were temporarily detained but released after clan elders negotiated on their behalf . One of the INGO drivers is still being held. The motive was said to be clan related.""

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM-SNG forces battle al Shabaab in several areas of Xudur district, overtaking Mura-gabe, Garas-wayne and Lagalay. Seventeen al Shabaab deaths reported among the three areas.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF/Lieu Police took over Labaatan Jirow (48 KM NE of Baidoa) after an armed confrontation in the outskirts of the village. Four al Shabaab fighters are said to have been killed. It is not known if the forces are planning to stay in the village or will move to another village.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Unconfirmed reports indicate that ENDF forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters and former al Shabaab Baidoa district court chairman was killed in Buur Dhuxunle (59 KM SE of Yeed)

Armed al Shabaab fighters attacked a group of SNG soldiers who were manning an illegal checkpoint in the vicinity of Cumar-Beere village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the morning of 23/07. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in the outskirt of Afgooye town in the morning of 23/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Reports indicate that two bodies were found beheaded in the outskirts of Labaatan Jirow (48 KM NE of Baidoa) in the evening of 23/07. The motive is said that al Shabaab sentenced the two man to death for spying for the enemy.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: ASWJ supporters and former police-men send militia take charge of a police station. This move angered Galmudug supporters, who equally mobilized their militia and attacked the police station in the evening of 23/07. Around two combatants were killed and 6 others wounded.
Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against police outpost in Ciise Cabdi neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 23/07. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces base in the vicinity of Livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 23/07. After a brief armed clash, the attackers withdrew. No reports on casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy was targeted with a RCIED in Xaawo Cabdi on 24/07. Perpetrators escaped and no casualties were reported; vehicle damaged.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Attack helicopters (ENDF) launched an airstrike against Dalan Doole village (approx. 60 KM NE of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 24/07. Reports indicate that around 15 civilians were killed and some al Shabaab vehicles destroyed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNA convoy was ambushed between Buufow Bacaad and Shalaambood (Marka District) in the morning of 24/07. Both sides engaged in a serious exchange of gunfire after which the attackers disappeared. Casualties of both sides are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNAF/ISWA forces took over Diinsoor from al Shabaab without resistance. It is not clear if al Shabaab had vacated the village prior to the AMISOM advance.

Unidentified attackers killed an MP in drive-by shooting in the vicinity of Korontada (Wadajir/Medina District) in the afternoon of 25/07. His driver and a guard were also killed by the attackers. The MPs name was Abdullahi Bantu. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Attack helicopters (ENDF) bombarded Sigle (approx. 75 KM NE of Buur Hakaba) late afternoon of 24/07. The village was bombarded after some al Shabaab fled from Dalan Doole (approx. 60 KM NE of Buur Hakaba). Reports indicate that many civilians including women and children are killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Around twenty al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNGF base in Muqakoor village (67 KM NE of Bulo Burte) early morning of 25/07. After a brief exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Fighting broke out between al Shabaab and new police from zone 5 (Somalia Ethiopian) in Labaatan Jirow village (47Km NE of Baidoa) on 25/07. Three al Shabaab members were killed and 20 other were apprehended, there has been population displacement trying to escape from the conflict violence that continue in this village against al Shabaab.
Two clan militia, both from Hawiye/Abgaal clashed over grazing land in Ceel-beeneed, outside Warshiikh on 25/07. The fight continued for around 2 hours and casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Joint ENDF/SNGF took over Ufurow (18 KM SW of Qansax Dheere) in the morning of 25/07. It is the second time in two weeks that Ufurow is changing hands as ENDF/SNGF after taking over small villages are leaving usually after 2 days again. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a Somali Civil Servant in Macalin Nuur neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) on 22/07. The victim was working for the Office of the Prime Minister. Perpetrators escaped.

Allied forces attacked Carro-Case (33 KM SE of Belet Xaawo) on 26/07. Both sides used heavy weaponry before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Three SNGF and seven al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash.

SNG police forces exchanged gun-fire with SNGF at Gaalware (5 KM west of Afgooye) over an illegal check-point to rob passengers on 26/07. After a brief shoot-out, SNG police arrested two soldiers and other four managed to escape.
Two groups of soldiers clash over an illegal checkpoint in Afgooye.

Al Shabaab executed a man by firing squad east of Buale Town on 26/07 morning. Al Shabaab Sharia law court said that the man, identified as Soomow Abdisalan, admitted of having killed innocent civilians mid 2014 in the vicinity of Buale Town, the court did not give further details about the alleged killing.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A senior police officer was injured after unidentified gunmen opened fire at police conducting security operation along Professor Jimcaale Road in Garowe in the night of 26/07. The incident reportedly happened as police tried to separate the groups of women involved in scuffle over unknown reason. Police fired in the air to disperse the women but unidentified people responded by firing in the direction of the police, seriously injuring a senior police officer.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: JLF shot at a speeding Mini-bus that refused to stop while heading to the airport to attend the welcoming of the SNG president on 26/07. Three female civilians at Barcaleen check point were injured and taken to Kismaayo hospital for medication.

A small truck, laden with explosives detonated near the entrance gate of Jazeera Hotel on the airport road on 26/07. The huge explosion was followed by some gun-fire from hotel and other guards in the area. Initial reports indicate that at least 16 people (inside and outside the hotel) were killed and more than 20 were wounded. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

A group of Hargeisa University students attacked the university with stones in the morning of 27/07. The reason behind the attack is unclear but it is believed that the students were barred from doing examinations. The students damaged windows and a number of vehicles parked in the compound. Police shot in the air and dispersed the group. They also arrested 20 students. Six lecturers were injured in the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF forces shot and injured two Leysan militia men in Caragaduud (13 KM west of Baidoa) after mistaken them for al Shabaab fighters on 27/07. The injured men were brought to Baidoa hospital for further treatment.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF on security patrol went on Baad Cade Road (north of Baidoa) in the early morning of 27/07 to follow up on complains of illegal check-points set up by armed men dressed in military uniforms with the aim to rob civilians. On arrival, two of the present uniformed men at the illegal check-point were shot and killed while a third one was wounded after a short clash.

An armed clash reportedly erupted between the two sub-clans of Dhulbahante (Baharsame and Qayaad) near Dharkeyn Genyo Village (76km E of Buuhoodle)on 27/07 following prolonged disputes and revenge killing between the two sides. The two sides exchanged fire for about an hour. Three combatants were killed (one from Baharsame clan and two from Qayaad clan) while a number of others were injured. A group of elders from Laas Caanood went to the area to defuse the tension.

Unidentified armed men believed to be al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a civilian man inside Janaale town (14 KM NW of Marka) in the evening of 27/07. The motive behind the killing is not known but unconfirmed reports suggest that the victim used to be a SNG soldier although he left the job long time before.
Armed al Shabaab personnel launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in the outskirt of Livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 27/07. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ""Dozens"" of al Shabaab are killed in Jameco area just 20 kilometres west of Burhakaba in Bay region. AMISOM-ENDF was also able to overtake the town. Date not clear.

Militiamen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Saad sub-clan reportedly ambushed Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud herders near Ballibusle (80 km SW of Jariiban) in the evening of 28/07. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the Saad militias withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Two groups of SNG forces fought inside Wanla Weyne town over dispute of extorted money from an illegal checkpoint in the morning of 28/07. Two SNG soldiers were injured by the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based in Warmahan (30km NW of Afgooye) in the night of 28/07. After a brief exchange of gunfire the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
An IED targeted a NISA Officer in Yaaqshiid District in the morning of 27/07. The device is believed to be magnetic that was attached to the vehicle of the victim. The victim sustained injuries.
AMISOM-KDF forces battle al Shabaab near Baardheere, 24 reported enemy dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF helicopters bombarded three villages in Baidoa district on 29/07. Main target were said to be moving al Shabaab vehicles concentrated around Lo Gaddud (20 KM S of Baidoa), Baanyaale (20 KM SE of Baidoa) and Haawa Dhaysile (approx. 27 KM SE of Baidoa).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF helicopters bombarded three villages in Baidoa district on 29/07. Main target were said to be moving al Shabaab vehicles concentrated around Lo Gaddud (20 KM S of Baidoa), Baanyaale (20 KM SE of Baidoa) and Haawa Dhaysile (approx. 27 KM SE of Baidoa).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF helicopters bombarded three villages in Baidoa district on 29/07. Main target were said to be moving al Shabaab vehicles concentrated around Lo Gaddud (20 KM S of Baidoa), Baanyaale (20 KM SE of Baidoa) and Haawa Dhaysile (approx. 27 KM SE of Baidoa).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF attack helicopters bombarded Daudow village (6 KM S of Baidoa) in the morning of 29/07. Unconfirmed reports indicate that 9 al Shabaab fighters were wounded together with two civilians.

An armed clash between two groups of clan militia reignited again in Ceel-beeneed (22 KM NW of Warsheikh) in the morning of 29/07. The two groups (both Abgal) are fighting over crazing land. After more than 6 hours of sporadic fighting, twelve people from both sides are reported killed while more got injured. Elders are trying to de-escalate the situation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF on military operation attacked Madaa village (25 KM SE of Tayeeglow) in the morning of 29/07. Al Shabaab/ONLF militia and ENDF/SNGF engaged in a prolonged fight before Al Shabaab/ONLF fled from the village, being persuaded by ENDF/SNGF. First information indicates that six al Shabaab fighters, five ONLF militias were killed in the attack and one al Shabaab fighters was captured alive. ENDF/SNAF also captured one PKM, four RPGs and some other small arms fire and ammunitions. It is not clear if the ENDF gained control of the village.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF attacked Siji village (approx. 40 KM SE of Rabdhure) on 29/07. Both sides engaged in a pro-longed gun battle until al Shabaab forces were forced to retreat. Six al Shabaab fighters were killed and their bodies displayed in the village. No other casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ISWA military and ENDF attacked Jameecadi Habardooy (11 KM SE of Baidoa) on 29/07. Both sides engaged in a gun battle which lasted more than 30 minutes before al Shabaab retreated into the bush. The armed clash was followed by an ENDF helicopter air bombing of the area. So far no casualties were reported.

A civilian man from Misra Village (10 KM SE of Diinsoor) killed an al Shabaab member with an axe on 29/07. Both are from Dabare sub-clan and the motive is said to be revenge for getting several times arrested, fined and mal treated by the al Shabaab fighter during the time, al Shabaab was in control. The perpetrator took the gun of the victim and escaped from the village to Diinsoor.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF launched an ambush against al Shabaab fighters close to Buur Cadey (37 KM SE of Rabdhure) on 29/07. Reports indicate that four al Shabaab fighters have been killed in the armed clash and no casualties were reported from the allied forces side.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF base in Rimaygacmeed (6 KM south of Afgooye) on 29/07. The exchange of gun-fire lasted for about five minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
An anti-Puntland rally was held in Buuhoodle on 29/07 in protest against the presence of Puntland revenue authority and their forces who are recently involving tax collection in the region.

Three armed men hailing from Abgal/Daud shot and killed farmers from Hawiye/Moblen over a disputed piece of land in Cadayga Moobleen (10 KM NW of Balcad) in the morning of 29/07. Numbers unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape and no arrests were reported or clan elder intervention.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Bakaara Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 29/07. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-ENDF forces overtake Ceel Dheer from al Shabaab following an offensive on the town. Eleven reported deaths combatant dead, plus one civilian.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-ENDF forces overtake Ceel Cali from al Shabaab without resistance.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-ENDF forces overtake Buqkoosaar from al Shabaab without resistance.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNG force takes over Ceel Boon Village, no reported violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeting an AMISOM convoy in Rusiya neighbourhood of Marka town on 31/07. A water rowser was completely damaged during the explosion but AMISOM casualties are unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Two men of Jejeele sub-clan were shot and killed in a clan revenge attack by Galjecel in Hawl-Wadaag section, western side of Beled Weyn early morning of 31/07.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Following an RCIED attack in a AMISOM water browser, security forces went on a security operation in the neighbourhood and killed six civilians at a wedding party.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF outpost in the Livestock Market in the night of 31/07/2015. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF helicopters carried out air bombardment in Makuudo Village (8 KM SW of Baidoa) late night of 01/08. The village was bombarded after reports indicated that some al Shabaab fighters have arrived in the village. Al Shabaab fighters are said to have managed to escape in the bush and no casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF helicopters were bombarding Bisiq cadde (51 KM SW of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 01/08. There are reports of civilian casualties which cannot be independently confirmed. The targets of the bombings not known.
Al Shabaab launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Muqakoori (67 KM NE of Bulo Burte) in the night of 01/08. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a big farm near Danow village (16km W of Marka) in the night of 01/08. The guards and the attackers exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. Three guards of the farm were killed by the attackers and their guns were seized. The identity of the attackers is not so far known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF helicopters were bombarding Buulo Fulaay (41 KM SW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 01/08. There are reports of civilian casualties which cannot be independently confirmed. The target of the bombings are not known.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: More than a hundred supporters of pro-Khatumo state staged a violent demonstration against the Puntland authority in Buuhoodle on 01/08. Police shot in the air to disperse the protestors. A woman bystander was injured in the shooting. Several Puntland police were injured.
An armed clash erupted between two sub-clans of Habarjeclo (Omar & Soolomadaw) in Habari Heshay village (13km S of Caynabo) in the afternoon of 02/08. No casualties were reported.

Armed gunmen from Warsangeli sub clan of Abgaal killed a civilian man from Maxamed Muuse sub clan (Abgaal) in the afternoon of 02/08. In retaliation to this, Maxamed Muuse militia killed a civilian man who hails from Warsangeli sub clan of Abgaal in the same afternoon at 14:00.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF attack helicopters launched an airstrike against Dalan Doole village (approx. 60 KM NE of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 03/08. The target is believed to be al Shabaab. Causalities not known.
Unidentified gunmen raided the house of Janaale chief and beheaded him outside Janaale village in the night of 03/08. The victim was appointed for this post by ISWA. Perpetrators escaped.
A man from Habarjeclo/Abokor Ahmed sub-clan stabbed his fellow clansmen to death in Unuunley village (45km E of Burco) on 03/08 following a dispute over pastureland ownership.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces based inside the former Perfume factory building (Heliwa District) in the night of 03/08. Casualties are unknown. A similar attack occurred at Cabdi Waayeel Cinema at about the same time, again no causalities reported.
Al Shabaab attacks a military base in Yaaqshid. Causalities reported, numbers not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-ENDF/SNG take over Ceelgod from al Shabaab. No violence reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-ENDF/SNG take over Warxoolo after an hour-long battle with al Shabaab. Casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Detonation: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of AMISOM troops on foot patrol in the vicinity of Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 04/08. The hand grenade missed the target, no injuries.

SNGF who were in the vicinity of the airstrike conducted by ENDF managed to capture two technicals with heavy weapons mounted from al Shabaab on 03/08. The forces confiscated the technicals but fell into an ambush by al Shabaab on the road between Dalaan Doole and Daynuunay. In the armed confrontation, 2 SNGF were killed and one was injured.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF base in Mushaani (14 KM NW of Marka) on 04/08. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-ENDF/SNG take over Wabxo from al Shabaab. No violence reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-ENDF/SNG take over Beruged from al Shabaab. No violence reported.

A man was killed in the outskirts of Ceel Boon (41 KM SE of Luuq) in the afternoon of 04/08. The motive is unclear but villagers assume that the man was executed by suspected al Shabaab members to aiding ENDF in their previous assault on Ceel Boon.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a Police Officer in Gaheyr neighbourhood (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the morning of 04/08.

A magnetic IED attached to a vehicle detonated in the vicinity of former Banadir Secondary School (Hodan District) in the morning of 04/08. A NISA Officer was driving the vehicle and reportedly sustained injuries. No other casualties.
Demonstration staged against a charge of AMISOM human rights abuses by the local government.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Fighting broke out between al Shabaab and ENDF/SNGF in Faan-weyn village (46 SE of Garbaharey) on 05/08. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed while two others were arrested before al Shabaab withdrew.
Suspected al Shabaab fighter launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF check-point in Laantabuur (12 KM SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 05/08. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab forces attack SNG forces at Bariirre on 05/08. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a brief hit and run attack against NISA troops in Ciise Babdi, Gubta neighbourhood on 05/08 before they withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM aircraft launch attacks on al Shabaab locations at Warhole village near Ceelbuur. Several causalities reported, numbers not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF helicopters bombarded areas in between Nuur Fanaax (42 KM SW of Beled Weyne), Ceel LahCeele (41 KM SE of Beled Weyne District) and Booco (55 KM NW of Bulo Burte) after heavy al Shabaab movement and armed engagement was reported in the area on 06/08. Al Shabaab claimed two ENDF personnel carriers were destroyed and 35 allied soldiers were killed, though these numbers were not confirmed.
Movement of forces: Al Shabaab vacates Halgan, SNG forces have not responded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks an AMISOM-Ethiopian convoy in the Nur Farax area of Beled Weyne. Seven dead.

An armed clash broke out in Bulo Jan neighbourhood after a Habergedir man was shot by a Biimaal over an unknown dispute on 07/08. Both sides exchanged gun fire which killed one of the combatants and injured four others. Elders are busy to diffuse the tense situation.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Pro-Puntland Warsangeli militias reportedly attacked pro-Somaliland/Warsangeli forces in Hadaaftimo (30km NW of Badhan) on 07/08. These Somaliland Warsangli forces concluded military training in Bixin Village (30km NW of Ceel-Afwayn) and were heading to Laas-Qoray when the fighting broke out. The two sides exchanged fire and after which the Pro-Puntland forces to withdraw. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters clashed with NISA soldiers in the Abdiwayel Cinema neighbourhood in the evening of 07/08. After a brief exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab suspects withdrew and no casualties were reported.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a soldier in Marka. Date not known, source dated 08/08.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF attacked al Shabaab in Yaabal Shallow village (approx. 23 KM SW of Xudur) on 08/08. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF forces were firing at a private mini-bus, which travelled from Beled Weyne to Halgan (41 KM north of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 08/08. Six people have been reported dead. It is believed the ENDF forces thought them to be al Shabaab.
A civilian man was shot and killed by a NISA officer at Afarta Darjino Junction in the afternoon of 08/08. The motive of the killing is unknown and no arrests were reported.
An al Shabaab suicide vest detonates prematurely in Mogadishu (neighbourhood unknown), killing the attacker, no other casualties reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-Ethiopian forces open fire on a bus carrying civilians, five dead. The shootings took place along Beled Weyne-Halgan Road. The reason of the attack is not known.

Police and a group of people at a construction site in Jigjiga Yar neighbourhood in Hargeisa clashed on 09/08. The police went to the site to enforce a court order suspending the construction work at the site which is disputed by two parties at the regional court. Police fired in the air to disperse the group that hurled stones at them. One person was killed and another seriously injured by stray bullets.

SNGF on military operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Tugaar-Hosle (18 KM NW of Diinsoor) on 09/08. After the armed confrontation, al Shabaab withdrew. One al Shabaab fighter was killed and two SNGF were injured. AMISOM from Diinsoor send troops to the village on 10/08 in the morning to assess the information.

Unidentified man armed with a pistol attempted to shoot the leader of Darood clan in Qardho on 09/08. However, the gunman was overpowered by a bodyguard before he fired his gun. Further information indicate that the man hails from, Majeerten/Ugaar Saleban and is suspected of being an al Shabaab member.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked workers at a water excavation site in Tuur Mumin (approx. 6 KM NW of Garbahaarey) on 09/08. Workers were beaten and excavation tools were confiscated by al Shabaab. The local foreman was taken away and beaten further but later released.

An IED exploded in a tea-shop in Halgan village (41 KM north of Bulo Burte), which was frequented by SNGF on 10/08. First reports suggest that one person was killed and five others injured. The injured were transported to Beled Weyne Hospital for treatment.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked the Central prison in Beled Weyne in the early morning of 10/08. Some reports indicate that parts of the prison got damaged but number of casualties is unknown. Rumours indicate that the motive of the attack was to free some of their colleagues. One al Shabaab death reported (Xinhua).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF helicopters attacked Tabarow (42 KM NW of Baidoa) in the early afternoon of 10/08. Casualties cannot be verified but rumours indicate that several al Shabaab fighters including a foreign fighter were killed in their vehicles.

SNG police forces clashed with SNGF in Jambaluul village (6 KM NE of Afgooye) on 10/08. The SNG police went to the village to remove an illegal check-point, manned by SNGF. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF check-point in Cumar-Berre (9 KM NW of Afgooye) on 10/08. After an exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Two SNGF were injured in the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF based now in Halgan village on military operation took over Buqcagable (25 KM NW of Bulo Burte). No clash was reported as al Shabaab was vacating the village before the arrival of the allied forces.
Two al Shabaab members were arrested by al Shabaab on suspicion of spying for SNFG/ENDF Air force in Labaatan Jirow (48 KM NE of Baidoa) on 10/08.
SNG forces kill al Shabaab fighters during a skirmish in Diinsoor. Date not clear: source dated 10/08.
Arrests: SNG forces capture an al Shabaab commander.
A RCIED exploded in Misra village (9 KM SE OF Diinsoor town) on 11/08. Three SNGF were wounded.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF check-point in Bariire (27 KM SW of Afgooye) on 11/08. Unconfirmed reports indicate that SNGF had to abandon the check-point and no casualties were reported. It is not clear if al Shabaab overtook the post.

A Somaliland soldier shot and killed another solider and seriously injured a major in Borama in the morning of 11/08. The motive is currently unknown. Other soldiers managed to arrest the perpetrators

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: SNFG/ENDF attacked al Shabaab fighters in Misra village (9 KM SE of Diinsoor town) on 11/08. The fighting continued for several hours before al Shabaab retreated. Fatalities are unknown, several injuries reports and ENDF took over the village.
Militiamen hailing from Darood/Amaanle opened fire at a group of Majerteen/Osman Mohamud men in Bandar Bayla in the afternoon of 11/08. Three Osman Mohamud men were injured in the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A Puntland soldier shot and killed another and injured a civilian in front of Bossaso Bank in the morning of 11/08. The motive is unknown. Police later arrested the perpetrator.

An IED, planted near the main gate of Simad University in Xamarjadid neighbourhood exploded in the evening of 11/08. Motive and reason are unknown and one civilian by-stander was injured in the blast.

A hand grenade was hurled by unknown men against SNG police men security out-post near Salama Hotel on 11/08. The hand grenade fell in an empty place and the explosion did not cause casualties. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a brief hit and run attack against NISA soldiers in the neighbourhood of Abdiwayel Cinema on 11/08. No casualties were reported.

A hand grenade was hurled by unknown men against SNG police men security out-post at the junction between Madina Hotel and Via Roma in the evening of 11/08. Two police men got injuries and the perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Ethiopian-AMISOM forces launch an aerial bombardment against Booko settlement, Hiiraan region. 98 deaths suspected. Date not known, source dated (11/08).
Al Shabaab attacks Kismayo airstrip the evening of 11/08. Military personnel at the base returned fire. Causalities not known.

An IED which seemingly planted in a tea-shop exploded in Bardaale (53 KM NW of Baidoa) on 12/07. The tea-shop is frequented by SNGF and the explosion was targeting the Bardaale police officer (Falar) who was sitting in a restaurant. At least seven soldiers and three civilians were injured.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF in Carbiska (5 KM SE of Afgooye) on 12/08. The exchange of gun-fire lasted for around 15 minutes before attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Two groups of SNG forces clash in Buurdhuubo (36km SE of Garbahaarey) after suspecting each other as hostile (12/08).
Residents found a decapitated body of a civilian man at a check-point in Mordiinle village (10 KM SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 12/08. The motive is unknown.
Unidentified gunmen kidnap a woman in Shantalle Cinema (12/08).

A RCIED targeted a SNGF Toyota vehicle in Arafat neighbourhood in the morning of 12/08. Two soldiers got injured in the explosion while other soldiers opened fire and injured a civilian by-stander. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA troops in Sarta Qabyada in the night of 12/08. After an armed confrontation attackers withdrew and no casualties were reported.

An armed clash between two armed groups hailing from Leelkase and Majeerteen clans briefly engaged in an area called Gargayo near Cagaaran (30 km N of Galkacyo) on 13/08. The two groups reportedly clashed over farms. One man hailing from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud was injured in the clash.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF in Rimaygacmeed (5 KM SW of Afgooye) past mid-night on 13/08. The exchange of gun fire lasted around 15 minutes before attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab claim they have targeted and killed an Ethiopian commander in Miisra on 14/08. The report has not been confirmed.
A SNG soldier was caught and beheaded by al Shabaab fighters on the Buur Hakaba - Baidoa Road roughly 14 KM outside Buur Hakaba.

Unidentified gun men shot and killed a civilian man in Buulo Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 14/08. The reason behind the killing is not known but it is believed that one of the clan militias in Marka is behind the attack. The victim was one of the medical staff in Marka hospital. Perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gun men shot and killed a business man in Buulo Mareer (29km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 14/08. The victim was killed in retaliation of another killing that has happened in Gendawe (7km W of Marka) on 13/07.
A civilian woman was beheaded by unknown persons in Siji village (approx. 40 KM SE of Rabdhuure) on 14/06. She was accused of spying for the allied forces.

Two hand grenades were thrown against the SIMAD University compound on 14/08. The hand grenades exploded but no casualties were reported. This is now the third incident in connection to SIMAD University after an IED exploded on 11/08 and leaflets appeared on 12/08 warning students/parents and teachers from studying in SIMAD.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Tensions rose between the resident community and the newly announced administration of Jubaland in Garbarhaarey on 15/06. ENDF troops dispersed demonstrators gathering in a public place in Garbahaaarey and no casualties were reported.

Two ASWJ militia clashed at the police station in Cabud Waaq after one group of ASWJ militia was not happy that their colleague was arrested after selling his gun on 15/08. No casualties were reported.

Members of two Habar Jeclo sub-clans (Omar and Reer Yonis) clashed using sticks and machetes following an escalated dispute over land in Gadh Gumareed Village (35km N of Caynabo) on 15/08. Causalities not known.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters stopped a civilian vehicle around 9 KM outside Buur Hakaba- Baidoa road and shot and killed the driver. The vehicle was seemingly transporting khat.

Militias of Westland State set-up checkpoints and patrols in Hawl-wadaag sector on 15/08. In the afternoon, a checkpoint at the entrance of the town manned by Westland militia (Jejeele clan) opened fire at a truck wounding three passengers who were taken to the hospital for treatment. The truck and the passengers belong to Makane clan (Bantu). This created high tension between the two clans in the town.
Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols attacked a mosque in Xida village in Qardho district in the evening of 15/08. The motive of the attackers is currently unclear. Casualties not reported.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Unspecified number of Puntland soldiers with battle wagon reportedly stormed the house of former Puntland deputy police commissioner shooting into the air and denying access to the premises as well as existing on 15/06. Reports indicate that the soldiers action was related to unpaid salaries.
Unidentified assailants shot and killed a tax collector near Carwo Limoni on 15/08. The perpetrators managed to escape and no arrests were reported.

A woman working for the Parliament was shot and killed by unknown gunmen in the vicinity of Hormud building on 15/08. A second civilian by-stander was seriously injured and died later in the hospital. Perpetrators managed to escape and no arrests were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF on military operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Samataro (57 KM NW of Bulo Burte) on 16/08. After an exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. One al Shabaab fighter was killed while casualties on the allied forces side are unknown.

Westland militias patrolling Hawl-wadaag market (Hilaac subsector) shot and wounded a civilian man from Heegan subsector of Hawl-wadaag on 16/08. Heegan subsector is dominated by Galjecel clan and they responded with shooting at Hilaac sub-sector.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF vacated Halgan village, (61 KM north of Bulo Burte) in the morning hours of 16/08. Al Shabaab took over the village again. Reason for the departure of ENDF/SNGF is unknown.

Peaceful rallies were organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election in Hoosingo (98 KM NW of Badhaadhe) and Kulbio (33 KM SW of Badhaadhe) on 16/08. No incident was reported.

Peaceful rallies were organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election in Hoosingo (98 KM NW of Badhaadhe) and Kulbio (33 KM SW of Badhaadhe) on 16/08. No incident was reported.
Peaceful rallies were organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election in Dhoobley (118 KM SW of Afmadow) on 16/08. No incident was reported.
Pro-Somaliland demonstrators protest the President of Khatumo during a visit by the latter.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Militiamen hailing from Dhulbahante/Reer Abokor clashed with Ethiopian soldiers near Buuhoodle along the border on 16/08 following after the Ethiopian forces attempted to arrest their kinsman. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire after which the Ethiopian forces retreated back. Three ENDF injuries reported.
Two clan militia (Habar-Gidir and Biyomaal) exchanged briefly and sporadic gun-fire in Bulo Jan neighbourhood on 16/08. Casualties are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Buur Dhuxunle (33 KM NW of Rabdhure) on 16/08. After exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab suspects withdrew. No casualties were reported.

SNGF opened fire against a minibus at an illegal check-point in Cabdow Dibile (8 KM SW of Afgooye) killing the driver instantly on 16/08. The driver refused to stop at the check-point and SNGF fired after him. No arrests were reported.

A group of residents of Ceel-Afwayn mostly, youth and women staged a peaceful demonstration on 17/08 in protest against scarcity of water in the town. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the protestors. No arrest was made.

column7: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: ISWAF/Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries on a security operation fell into an ambush in Ceel-Baar (approx. 12 KM SW of Wajiid). During the prolonged fight, eight ISWA soldiers were killed and 5 injured, while al Shabaab casualties are said to be five dead and two injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Heavy fighting between ENDF and al Shabaab is reported in the area between Raangaabo (33 KM SW of Belet Weyn) and Buqcagable (25 KM NW of Bulo Burte), near Luuqjelow, on 17/08 and still on-going on 18/08. Information are difficult to obtain but rumours indicate that there a lot of casualties (Radio Mogadishu reports 30). One unconfirmed report indicates that also the al Shabaab head of Ceel Cade (55 KM west of Belet Weyn) was killed in the fight together with other al Shabaab commanders.
A demonstration was organized by JIA President Supporters (HI Party) to celebrate his re-election on 17/08.

Unknown perpetrators threw a hand grenade against the residence of the former DC of Wardhiigley District in Caga Dhiig neighbourhood in night of 17/08. Her security guards opened fire in the suspected direction but no casualties were reported from the explosion and the shooting. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA post in the vicinity of Cabdi Wayel Cinema in the night of 17/08. The exchange of gun-fire lasted for some minutes before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two fighting groups mainly, women and youths hailing from Warsangeli (Bihi Door and Salah sub-clans) in Xin-Galool village (141km SE of Ceerigaabo) turned into chaos on 18/08 and the subsequently business premises were looted and vehicle screens were smashed. Unspecified numbers of people were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF attack helicopters conducted an airstrike in Messagit Mohamed Omar village (22 KM SW of Ceel Dheer) on 17/08. Supposedly two al Shabaab vehicles and their occupants were killed or destroyed. Exact details are unknown as Ceel Dheer is since many years uncontested under the control of al Shabaab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Heavy fighting between ENDF and al Shabaab is reported in the area between Raangaabo (33 KM SW of Belet Weyn) and Buqcagable (25 KM NW of Bulo Burte) on 17/08 and still on-going on 18/08. Information are difficult to obtain but rumours indicate that there a lot of casualties. One unconfirmed report indicates that also the al Shabaab head of Ceel Cade (55 KM west of Belet Weyn) was killed in the fight together with other al Shabaab commanders.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy on its way to Mogadishu was targeted with a suspected al Shabaab RCIED in Boodboodka, entrance of Afgooye town on 18/08. AMISOM troops opened fire in the direction of the explosion. One civilian by-stander, who is believed to be a westerner, was killed and a Caspir damaged. AMISOM casualties are unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: SNGF with support from ENDF and Lieue police attacked an al Shabaab base in Ceel Boon (41 KM SE of Luuq) in the morning of 18/08. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about 1 hour but casualties could not be established. It was reported by Somali-language Universal TV that SNGF, ENDF forces overtook the base and 11 al Shabaab fighters were killed.

Armed clan clashes erupted again between Habar-Gidir and Biimaal militia in the morning of 18/08 in Bulo Jan neighbourhood. Three militias are confirmed dead from both sides and clan militias are still inside the town.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Cumar-Beere (9 KM NW of Afgooye) on 18/08/2015. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab burnt unknown amount of charcoal stock in a charcoal dealers camp in the vicinity of Golasha Matrooba (100 KM SW of Kismaayo) and abducted five labourers on 17/08. Further reports indicate the labourers are still missing none of their relatives had known where they are about.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces position in Gubta neighbourhood of Dayniile District in the night of 18/08/2015. Casualties could not be established.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a small SNGF base in Rimaygacmeed (5 KM SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 19/08. No casualties were reported.

The newly appointed Governor for Gedo Region was twice ambushed and shot at in Garbahaarey on 19/08. The New Governor wanted to visit SNGF base in town during the ambush. He was unable to go home and sought refuge in the ENDF base. So far no reaction from the ENDF side and supporters of the previous Governor made it clear that they will not accept the new administration. No casualties were reported.
Buulo Mareer deputy chief was shot and killed in Bulo Mareer (29 KM SW of Marka) on 19/08. He is Biimaal and became a revenge victim of the renewed clan fighting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An armed clash between four JL-soldiers who escaped from Bula Gadud Village (30KM, NE of Kismaayo town) and al Shabaab fighters took place on 19/08 at Gobo Kibir. After brief exchange of small arms fire three JLF were killed and one managed to escape into the bush to unknown destination. Reason for the dissertation is not clear but they were reportedly heading to Afmadow town.

Two groups of suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attacks at the same time at the Perfume Factory and Cabdiwayeel neighbourhood in Heliwa district against NISA and SNFPF on 19/08. Casualties are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA base in Eymiska in Yaaqshiid District in the evening of 19/08. The exchange of gun-fire lasted only for a few minutes before attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNG police base in Gubta neighbourhood in the night of 19/08. After an exchange of gun-fire, attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

An unknown perpetrator hurled a hand grenade against SNGF on foot patrol on Jamhuriya Road in the night of 19/08. The hand grenade missed the soldiers and exploded, causing no casualties. The perpetrator managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces clash with al Shaba near Afmadow on the evening of 20/08. Pro-al Shabaab media outlets claimed that some Jubbaland soldiers were killed and others were captured in the fighting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against ENDF/SNGF base in Muqakoori (67 KM SW of Bulo Burte) on 20/08. The exchange of gun fire lasted around half an hour before attackers withdrew, No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against ENDF/LP/SNGF base in Ceel Boon (41 KM SE of Luuq) in the night of 20/08. Both sides exchanged gun-fire before attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters and ENDF/LP/SNGF clashed in Lafmarket (approx. 35 KM SE of Luuq) on 20/08/2015. Lafmarket is on the road between Luuq and Ceel Boon (41 KM SE of Luuq) in a hilly area. After fierce fighting allied forces were first pushed back but received reinforcement from Wajiid. 40 al Shabaab, 10 government forces dead.

After heavy fighting in Lafmarket, retreating al Shabaab fighters and LP clashed again in Ceel Xarare (60 KM SE of Luuq and 22 KM SW of Wajiid) on 20/08. So far casualties are unknown but displacement of civilian population is reported from many surrounding villages.
""Scores"" [of] government soldiers including military commander were killed in a al Shabaab attack on army base in Giriley village near Somalia-Kenya border.

Heavy armed al Shabaab fighters attacked Geriley village (150 KM SW of Baardheere) early morning of 21/08. Heavy fighting lasted for around two hours before al Shabaab fighters withdrew towards Diif in Afmadow District. Al Shabaab took over shortly the village, killing the SNGF commander, taking arms and ammunition, burning three SNGF vehicles and abducting two soldiers alive before they withdrew. Their fate is unknown so far. There is also tension now in Diif village due to fear of an immediate Al Shabaab attack.

Heavy fighting broke out between al Shabaab and police in Arinley village (approx. 35 KM SE of Luuq) in the morning of 21/08. Unconfirmed information states that around 12 al Shabaab fighters were killed. This comes after al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack during the night on Ceel Boon Village.

A SNG soldier opened fire at a vehicle of a civilian over an apparent unknown dispute in Beled Xawo in the evening of 21/08. The man died instantly and the SNG soldiers managed to escape and is said to have fled to Doolow.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: JLF conducted a hit and run attack against an al Shabaab check point and killed five al Shabaab fighters and caught one al Shabaab fighter with AK47 alive, two civilians were also injured during the clash by cross fire at Abdi Dhoore Village (30KM NW of Kismaayo town) on 21/08/2015 afternoon.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: SNFG and ENDF gain control of Gurbaan village on 22/08.

A vehicle, parked at Juba Junction (kilometre zero) and close to Juba Hotel exploded on 22/08. Main target is said to be a tea-shop along the main road to NISA HQs which is frequented by NISA, police officers and SNGF. Four people are reported to have died in the explosion and around 10 more are said to have been injured, mainly FG security personnel.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Between sixteen and twenty AMISOM solders are killed in an al Shabaab suicide car bomb attack at a Jubaland army base in Kismayo on the morning of 22/08. The two inhabitants of the car were also killed in the blast. The number of dead was raised to 25 in the following week.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A RCIED was targeting an ENDF convoy 3 KM outside Raabdhuure on the road to Buur Dhuxunley in the morning of 23/08. In the explosion, two ENDF were injured. ENDF opened fire after the detonation of the device, killing two civilians in the vicinity.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against 2 SNGF outposts in Sabiid (9 KM west of Afgooye) and Mayey (10 KM NW of Afgooye in the early evening of 23/08. The exchange of gun-fire lasted for about 20 minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Seven soldiers were killed over two days.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against 2 SNGF outposts in Sabiid (9 KM west of Afgooye) and Mayey (10 KM NW of Afgooye in the early evening of 23/08. The exchange of gun-fire lasted for about 20 minutes before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Seven soldiers were killed over two days.

Some SNGF based in Beled Xawo rebelled against the order to deploy in Garbahaarey on 23/08. They were disarmed by force by the SNGF commander. One soldier was shot and killed during the exercise while twenty more were disarmed and transferred to Doolow.

Unknown men, armed with AK 47, suspected to be Biiomaal shot and killed a woman in Xamaali neighbourhood in the early morning of 23/08. Her two children were injured in the incident. The motive is likely a revenge killing in the renewed clan clashes between Habergedir and Biiomaal.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters captured two men on motor cycles transporting khat in Burjada-Cinta, (4 KM SW of Belet Weyn) on 23/08. The two men were killed and the motor-bikes and the khat were destroyed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubba administration soldiers have shot and killed at least 5 unarmed civilians and wounded 5 others in an unnamed area 30km outside of Kismayo. The reason for the attack is not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF forces came under attack by al Shabaab forces at Bur Daar. According to bystanders, Al-Shabaab fighters began shelling an Ethiopian military base, which led to hand-to-hand combat. The extent of casualties caused by the attack remains unclear. Two soldiers captured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against ENDF/SNGF base in Tre Cento (31 KM SE of Beled Weyne) on 24/08. Both sides briefly exchanged gun-fire and no casualties were reported.

SNGF of Banadir were deployed to Sabiid (9 KM west of Afgooye) and Mayey (10 KM NW of Afgooye) to launch counter-attacks against al Shabaab who attacked both villages the day before. In attacks and counter-attacks by both forces seven SNGF are reportedly killed and five more were injured. Casualties on al Shabaab side are unknown. It was later confirmed al Shabaab took control of the villages.

SNGF of Banadir were deployed to Sabiid (9 KM west of Afgooye) and Mayey (10 KM NW of Afgooye) to launch counter-attacks against al Shabaab who attacked both villages the day before. In attacks and counter-attacks by both forces seven SNGF are reportedly killed and five more were injured. Casualties on al Shabaab side are unknown. It was later confirmed al Shabaab took control of the villages.
Puntland security forces detained two unidentified groups that engaged in a shoot-out following an escalated dispute over land in Garowe on 24/08. No casualties were reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked a SNGF/ENDF military base in Qodaxey in the outskirts of Garbahaarey on 24/08. Four Combatants from both sides have been killed and more were injured.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF took over the control Goof Gaduud (approx. 30 KM NW of Baidoa) in the morning of 24/08. Al Shabaab retreated from the village beforehand and no causalities were reported.

Somaliland Intelligence officer was found dead in the agency headquarters in Hargeisa in the night of 24/08. The deceased had bullet at his forehead while his pistol was found lying next the body. Details surrounding the incident is currently unclear.

A man hailing from the Marehan/Wagardhac sub-clan shot and killed a man hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan in Xero Jaale (20 km E of Galdogob) in the afternoon of 24/08. The motive of the killing was reportedly clan revenge. The perpetrator escaped.

A man hailing from Ugaar Suleiman shot and killed another man from Ali Suleiman in the vicinity of Qodax village (82Km NE of Qardho). Reports indicate that the killing follows clan revenge between the two sub-clans. No arrest was made.

Unknown attackers threw a Hand grenade against SNG police post in Gen. Dauud Branch Office area on 24/08. SNGP opened fire in the direction of the attack and one female bystander was injured by gun-fire. The hand grenade did not cause injury and the perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against ENDF/SNGF base in Diinsoor in the night of 25/08. After a brief exchange of gun-fire, attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported. The Somali and ISWA presidents are visiting Diinsoor on 26/08.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Rimaygacmeed (5 KM SW of Afgooye) in the night of 25/08. Both sides exchanged gun-fire for around 10 minutes before attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Goof Gaduud Buurey Haraaw (30 KM NE of Baidoa). Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly and attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab forcibly recruits, abducts children from Buale, Saacow and Jilib while they were at school.
Al Shabaab forcibly recruits, abducts children from Buale, Saacow and Jilib while they were at school.
Al Shabaab forcibly recruits, abducts children from Buale, Saacow and Jilib while they were at school.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Biyo Degaanka neighbourhood, Livestock market area on 25/08. Both sides briefly exchanged gun-fire before attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
A clash between al Shabaab and SNG forces kill seven members of the former in Buurhakaba.
At least 12 Al-Shabaab members were on 25/08 killed by government forces in heavy clashes in a village near Garbaherey town in Gedo region.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a well-coordinated attack against a small SNGF base in Kulunjerer (39 KM NE of Wajiid) on 26/08. Seven SNGF were killed and one PKM and an AK 47 were taken by al Shabaab fighters. Al Shabaab took over the village and their casualties are unknown.

Two sub-clans of Habar Yonis/Muuse Turwa militias engaged in a shoot-out following an escalated dispute over frankincense farms ownership in Doonyaha Village (30km W of Ceerigaabo) on 26/08. No casualties were reported.

Militiamen hailing from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan reportedly shot and killed a herder from Habar-Gidir/Saad in an area called Laandheere (10 km S of Ballibusle) which is 80 km SW of Jariiban) in the afternoon of 26/08. In retaliation, Habar-Gidir/Saad sub-clan militias reportedly followed the perpetrators, killed one and injured another in the same evening.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column7: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Al Shabaab fighters and END Liyu Police paramilitaries clashed in Qoond Hood (46 KM NE of Garbahaarey). After heavy fighting the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties from both sides are unknown so far.

SNGF/ENDF forces launched an attack against al Shahbaab base in Karbis (20 KM north of Garbahaarey on 26/08. Seven al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in addition to the SNGF commander and two other soldiers.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: SNGF/ENDF/LP conducted a military operation and took over Xabaalo Barbar (71 KM SW of Baidoa) on 26/08. Al Shabaab fighters retreated before the joint forces arrived and no casualties were reported, though as they retreated the group planted several IEDs and detonated the ordinances.
After renewed fighting and regrouping, SNGF took over Kulunjerer (39 KM NE of Wajiid) on 26/08 again. This time reports indicate that 14 al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clashes.

Two unknown assailants armed with pistols shot and killed an elder in Hawl-wadaag neighbourhood on 26/08. The elder was member of the Hiraan Region Elders Committee. The assailants managed to escape and no arrests were reported.

Unidentified militia armed with AK 47 shot and killed a farmer in Lebiga (4 KM NW of Jowhar) on 26/08. The motive of the killing is said to be land dispute between two sub-clans (Xawadle and Abgaal - it is not know who was the aggressor or victim). No arrests were reported.

SNGF/ENDF/LP conducted a military operation and took over Xabaalo Barbar (71 KM SW of Baidoa) on 26/08. SNGF rejected calls by civilians to evacuate the village and ordered them to stay. A mini-bus driver was seriously beaten by SNGF after he wanted to drive with passengers out of the village.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Bakaara Market neighbourhood of Hawl-Wadaag District on 26/08. The soldier was on his way home when he was attacked. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Two groups of SNFG exchanged gun fire over a dispute on extortion of money sharing, taken from business lorries coming from Mogadishu in Daynunay (19 KM SE of Baidoa) on 27/08. Both sides exchanged gun-fire for about 20 minutes before other SNGF intervened and brought the situation under control. No casualties were reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNGF in Ceel Cilan (46 KM NW of Diinsoor) on 27/08. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew after an ENDF convoy was rushing to SNGF support. ENDF were searching the area after the fight and discovered an IED. ENDF/SNGF tried to detonate the device safely but it exploded, injuring one ENDF soldier seriously. No other casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column7: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: ENDF/Liyu Police paramilitaries opened fire at a civilian mini-bus, travelling from Bardaale to Gedo region in Qoond Hood (46 KM NE of Garbahaarey) on 27/08. First reports indicate that three civilians and the driver were killed. Motive is unknown.

Deadly clan clash erupting in central Somalia has left at least 1 person dead and wounded 2 others, according to local residents. The clash is said to have started in Sorakey area between Elbuur and Galhareeri towns. The two unidentified groups are believed to be fighting over a borehole.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A hand grenade was thrown at AMISOM foot patrol by unknown attackers in Janaale (14 KM NW of Marka) on 28/08. No injuries were reported and perpetrators managed to escape.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNGF/ENDF base in Xabaalo Barbar (70 KM SW of Baidoa) in the evening of 28/08. Both sides exchanged heavy gun fire before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Unconfirmed reports indicate that around 11 al Shabaab fighters were killed and four soldiers from the allied forces.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF base in the livestock area in Bur-Heybe (32 KM NE of Buur Hakaba) on 28/08. SNGF were busy collecting taxes from pastoralists, coming to the market to sell their animals. One civilian was killed and another one got injured in cross-fire while SNGF or al Shabaab suffered no casualties.

An armed clash reportedly erupted between the two clans of Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub clan and Majeerteen/Omar Mohamoud sub clan in the vicinity of Qoriley village (56km SE of Laas Caanood). This was following a dispute over water reservoirs. The two sides reportedly exchanged heavy gunfire in which the clan militias from Omar Mohamoud retreated from the scene. A man from Omar Mohamoud was reportedly killed and a stray bullet hit a young boy bystander.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Ethiopian Liyu Police paramilitaries open fire against two public transport vehicles killing a man while injuring three others in the vicinity of Balli Gubadle (63km SW of Hargeisa) in the morning of 28/08. The passengers stated that they two vehicles were travelling in side Somaliland territory along the border while the Ethiopian police crossed the border to stop the vehicles.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed JLF convoy escorting Aljazeera journalists to Bulla Guduud at Yoontoy Yare Village neighbourhood (25 KM NE of Kismaayo town) on 28/08 afternoon. After a brief exchange of gun fire al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab attacks an ""apostate intelligence base"" in Heliwa. Several ""deaths and injuries"" reported, no numbers given.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF on military operation took over Safar Nooley (15 KM SE of Diinsoor) in the morning of 29/08. No armed clash was reported as al Shabaab withdrew before the arrival of the allied forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF on military operation took over Rama Caddey (50 KM SW of Diinsoor) in the morning of 29/08. No armed clash was reported as al Shabaab withdrew before the arrival of the allied forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Two hand grenades were thrown against AMISOM soldiers in Beyterus neighbourhood of Marka on 29/08. AMISOM opened fire in the direction of the assault. A number of people were arrested by AMISOM but figures or casualties are unknown so far.

Three unknown assailants armed with AK 47 shot and killed a young civilian man in Israac neighbourhood in the evening of 29/08. The victim was reportedly a shop keeper based in Bosasso who had come to Galkacyo to visit his family. The assailants managed to escape and no arrests were reported. Another civilian man, a son of a local elder, was in Israac neighbourhood assassinated by the same gunmen.
A hand grenade was thrown in a public place and four innocent people were injured in the evening of 29/08. The al Shabaab suspect behind the explosion was detained.

Unknown men armed with pistols shot and injured the section Head of Xamarjabjab in the evening of 29/08. The victim succumbed to her injuries later in the hospital. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab forces retake Xabaalo Barbar after a series of successive attacks. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Allied Forces entered Halgan (41 KM north of Bulo Burte) in the morning of 31/08. An IED exploded at a former al Shabaab position in town causing no casualties. Allied forces were targeted with three IEDs on their way from Garasiyaani and Halgan on 30/08 killing one ENDF and injuring four others.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF on military operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Garasiyaani (55 KM NW of Bulo Burte) on 30/08. Both sides exchanged heavy weapons fire and an unconfirmed number of casualties on both sides are reported.
