Marehan clan militia attacked al Shabaab fighters who forcefully collected livestock as Zakat from nomadic families in Goley Village (25km SE of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 18/10. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed and the militia managed to re-take the livestock from the al Shabaab fighters. The al Shabaab fighters ambushed ENDF/SNG forces who wanted to support the militia. Four SNG soldiers, including a military officer, were reportedly killed in the ambush. Al Shabaab casualties could not be established.

Two gunmen hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad sub clan reportedly forcefully took an AK-47 rifle from a man hailing from Habar Gidir/Saleban sub-clan near Qaydarrey Village (125km W of Hobyo) in the morning of 18/10. In revenge, armed Saleban men, abducted two unarmed Saad men in the area.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a shop keeper inside his shop in Suuq Bacaad neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 18/10. The motive behind the killing is unknown but unconfirmed reports suggest that the victim attended Cadaado Conference for the formation of Gamudug State. Perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Nasteexo neighbourhood (Wadajir District) in the morning of 18/10. The victim was on his way to the airport where he used to work when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.

Two groups of militiamen hailing from Jejele and Hawadle clashed in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the morning of 19/10 following dispute over tax collection. The fighting lasted for five hours where dozens of people were killed.

Galjecel and Jejeele militias clashed in Buq-Goosaar (51 KM SW of Belet Weyn) in the morning of 19/10. The clan militias fighting is connected to the Belet Weyn armed clash. Four combatants from both sides were killed during the fighting.
Government forces clash with an unidentified group in Buqkoosaar. Details limited.
Government forces clash with an unidentified Ethiopian clan group in Beled Weyne over tax collections on 19/10. Eleven soldiers reported dead in the fighting.
Al Shabaab forces attacks a military base in Yaaqshid and Heliwa Districts on 20/10. ""Several deaths"" reported.

Two groups of pastoralists hailing from Abgaal and Murusade clashed in Warmahan village (30km NW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 20/10. The clash was apparently triggered dispute over the ownership of pastureland. At least two people were killed while another five were injured.

SNG forces carried out security operations in various villages in Garbahaarey District as far as Goley (36km SW of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 20/10. The operation followed an armed clash between SNG forces and al Shabaab fighters in the area. Causalities of the clash not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces took over Wabxo town (41km SW of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 20/10 without resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Al Shabaab fighters vacated the town prior the arrival of the allied forces.
Unidentified attackers shot and killed a well-known cleric in Cabud Waaq in the evening of 20/10. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown.

Gunmen from Ali Saleebaan shot and killed a man hailing from Osman Mohamud in Qandala district on the evening of 20/10. The motive behind the murder is presently unknown. Reports suggest that the deceased used to be a pirate and was flocking with some pirate operatives at the time of the killing. The perpetrators have not been arrested and remain at large.
Al Shabaab forces attacks a military base in Yaaqshid and Heliwa Districts on 20/10. ""Several deaths"" reported.

Unidentified two men armed with knives onboard of a vehicle reportedly assaulted and stabbed a local journalist working for Waaheen local newspaper in the vicinity of Dahabshiil offices in Farah Omar neighbourhood (Burco) in the morning of 21/10. The motive of the attack remains unknown. The perpetrators reportedly destroyed a laptop and other properties belonging to the victim and later escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a group of SNG forces in the vicinity of Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 21/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualtie

Hundreds of Berbera citizens held a demonstration against the handover of Berbera Oil Terminal to a local businessmen. The demonstrators burned tires and held slogans against the privatization. The police came to the scene, shot bullets over demonstrators to disperse them. The police also arrested 7 persons and accused the organizers of civil unrest.

An ISWA soldier shot and killed his colleague who was on duty manning a security check point in Mayafulka (7km NE of Baidoa) in the morning of 22/10. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. The perpetrator hail from Rahanweyn/Boqolhore while the victim is from Rahanweyn/Harin sub-clan.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man hailing from Abgal and injured bystander at Topaz hotel in Galkacyo (South) in the evening of 22/10. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown. Reports suggest that the victim was in the past a member of al Shabaab operatives but latter defected. He had also worked at the cafeteria of the same hotel as a waiter. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.

Many fishermen demonstrated against the governments inaction against foreign boats fishing in the area. Many people gathered in front of Cost guards office and the police station, the mayor and the police commander talked to the gathering and denied that there were foreign vessels fishing in the area. They added they would seize any fishing vessel found working in the area without a permission from the government.

Two youth groups who were hailing from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub clan and Dhulbahante/Qayaad sub clan reportedly clashed with knives and clubs in Laas Caanood in the evening of 23/10. This motive of the clash remains unknown but is believed to be related the recent revenge killings between the two warring clans of Baharsame and Qayaad clans. Police arrived at the scene and shot live bullets to disperse the two warring rivals and arrested a number of youth. No causalities reported.

A gunman from Habarjeclo/Ahmed Farah sub clan reportedly shot and killed a young boy from Habarjeclo/Reer Xaad sub clan and injured another one from Habarjeclo/Reer Yusuf sub clan in Hodan Qaylo neighbourhood, Burco, on 23/10.

Two men armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a civil servant in Wadajir District in the afternoon of 23/10. National Intelligence and Security Agency forces responded and exchanged gunfire with perpetrators. The security forces managed to capture one of the attackers.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attack and kill a senior Puntland military official in Galkacyo North on 23/10. The group later claimed responsibility for the attack.

Residents of Xarrirad held a peaceful demonstration in front of the local authoritys office to protest against the perceived lack of response to water scarcity in the town and the absence of local government officials from the town. The demonstrators demanded the election of a new local council. The police did not intervene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack to Baardhere airport with mortar gun fire in the mid night 24/10. Currently the airport is a military base for ENDF, who fired back. The exchange of gun fire between the combatants resulted in an undetermined number of civilian casualties. Casualties of both sides are unconfirmed.

Government soldiers engage in fighting with al Shabaab in Diinsoor. One al Shabaab death reported. The dead is believed to be a Pakistani national fighting with the group. Date of battle not known - source dated 24/10.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: AMISOM/KDF contingent allegedly supported by American forces (the latter, presumably from the air) launched a military offensive against al Shabaab fighters as part of ""Jubaland Corridor Offensive"" near Yoontoy Yarey village (25km NE of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 25/10. Reports indicate that the operation destroyed a boat used by al Shabaab fighters to cross river Juba. At least 15 al Shabaab fighters and a local man, reportedly the owner of the boat were killed during the raid. Further reports suggest that there were also air strikes on the eastern side of the river Juba near Yoontoy Yarey village. No casualties were reported as a result of the air strikes. In later sources indicated AMISOM forces had gained control of the area.

A group of unidentified attackers opened gunfire against SNG security personnel on a checkpoint in Shaqaalaha junction (Hodan District) in the night of 25/10. The perpetrators who escaped from the scene involved in a road accident on their way close to Ramadan Mosque (Hodan District) but they escaped on foot however their car was later recovered by the security forces. No reported causalities.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces based near Ceymiska (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 25/10. Attackers escaped. Causalities not reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNGF on security operation were ambushed in Golweyn (31 KM SW of Luuq) on 26/10. The ambush was initiated by an IED explosion, followed by heavy gun-fire, using PKM, RPGs and AK 47 weapons. First reports indicate that one of the ENDF was killed and two were wounded while two SNGF were wounded during the fight. On the other hand four al Shabaab fighters were killed, five injured while two others captured. Radio Al-Furqaan reports 13 dead.

A group of tuk-tuk drivers (tri-cycle) staged a peaceful demonstration at Sayidka Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 26/10 in protest against banning of tuk-tuks to use Makah Al-Mukarama road especially areas close to main entrance of Villa Somalia. The ministry of Interior stated that the ban is related to security matters and not suspending tuk-tuk operations. A police officer at the scene shot and killed one of the protestors. Other SNG police at the scene arrested the perpetrators.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA forces based at former Perfume Factory (Heliwa District) in the night of 26/10. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks AMISOM Kenya forces in Badhaadhe on the evening 26/10, inflicting ""huge losses.""

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces attacked an al Shabaab base in Qoleyle Village (20km S of Luuq) in the early morning of 27/10. AMISOM/SNG forces took over the village after several hours of fighting. Five combatants from both sides were killed and eight others were injured.

SNG forces on foot patrol engaged a small group of al Shabaab fighters in a brief fire fights in Muqakoor (67km NE of Bulo Burte) in the evening of 27/10. One al Shabaab fighter was killed while a SNG soldier was injured and the rest of the al Shabaab fighters managed to escape.

Two groups of clan militias hailing from Rahanweyn/Luway and Geledle sub-clans clashed in the areas of Gowrar and Lowa Forar in Qansax Dheere District in the morning of 27/10 following disputes over grass land. The two sub-clans had historical conflicts over grass land and water points and they share border . Two combatants were killed while six others were injured.

KDF convoy shot and severely injured a camel herder boy in Darasalaam (141 KM SW of Baardheere District) on 27/10. The reason is unknown and the convoy continued with their travel. Relatives took the boy to Wajir/Kenya for treatment.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Jubaland forces positions in the outskirts of the north western side of the town in the night of 27/10. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No reported causalities.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against SNG soldiers based in Baar Ubax neighbourhood (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 27/10. SNG soldiers opened gunfire after the attack. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in the vicinity of livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 27/10. The fighting lasted for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties remain unknown.

Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade against a group of Somali police force in the vicinity of Suuqa Cawska in Bakara Market (Hodan District) in the night of 27/10. No casualties were reported. The perpetrator(s) escaped.
A powerful bomb targeting government soldiers occurred in Afgooye on 27/10, killing ""a number"" of soldiers.
A senior official says at least 15 militants have been killed and their small weapons seized on 27/10 in an armed conflict in Al Shabaab base near Diinsoor town.

Macaswiley, a local militia which is supported by AMISOM went on security operation on 28/10. They left Bulo Burte in two groups, one group attacking Buur Weyne (30 KM NW of Bulo Burte) on the west side road to Jalalaqsi and the second group attacked Afcad (31 KM SE of Bulo Burte) in the east road to Jalalaqsi. Buur Weyn was briefly taken over by the militia but they returned to Bulo Burte short while after. The second group who attacked Afcad entered in an armed confrontation and four al Shabaab fighters were killed. Due to the bad weather, militias went to Jalalaqsi after the fight and took two heads of beheaded al Shabaab fighters with them.

Macaswiley, a local militia which is supported by AMISOM went on security operation on 28/10. They left Bulo Burte in two groups, one group attacking Buur Weyne (30 KM NW of Bulo Burte) on the west side road to Jalalaqsi and the second group attacked Afcad (31 KM SE of Bulo Burte) in the east road to Jalalaqsi. Buur Weyn was briefly taken over by the militia but they returned to Bulo Burte short while after. The second group who attacked Afcad entered in an armed confrontation and four al Shabaab fighters were killed. Due to the bad weather, militias went to Jalalaqsi after the fight and took two heads of beheaded al Shabaab fighters with them.
Clashes between Saleban and Duduble militias leave more than 10 people dead in the vicinity of Cada Kibir Village (41km SE of Cadado) on 28/10.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against SNG military based in Laanta Buur (12km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 28/10. Casualties could not be established.

A gunman from Dhulbahante/Barkad sub clan shot and killed his fellow clansman in the area of Balihadhac village (62km NE of Buuhoodle) on 28/10 over unknown reasons. The perpetrator initially managed to escape but was later arrested in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) after traditional elders and Somaliland carried security operations to arrest him.

A gunman from Dhulbahante/Barkad sub clan shot and killed his fellow clansman in the area of Balihadhac village (62km NE of Buuhoodle) on 28/10 over unknown reasons. The perpetrator initially managed to escape but was later arrested in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) after traditional elders and Somaliland carried security operations to arrest him.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base near Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 28/10. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Local resident staged a demonstration against the DC of Buur-Hakaba on 29/10. Traditional elders and key community members opposes Ali Hassan Olympica the current DC, who was nominated by ISWA as a district commissioner for Buur-Hakaba District. The locals complained that the nomination was not free and fair election process and requested from SNG/ISWA state to intervene the matter immediately. The protestors demanded free and transparent election of the position of the DC and should be fully approved by the entire community.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An IED targeting ENDF/SNG forces convoy near Babaa village (15km SW of Luuq) in the morning of 29/10. The device missed its target and exploded after the convoy passed it. The convoy was coming from Luuq and heading to Yurkud when the incident happened.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces based in Jacar village (42km SE of Ceel Buur) on 29/10. Following the clash al Shabaab fighters later displayed six bodies of SNG forces killed in the battle as well as weapons seized during the fight. Al Shabaab f

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA base in the southern outskirts of Afgooye Town in the night of 29/10. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a few minutes but no casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA base in the southern outskirts of Afgooye Town in the night of 29/10. Both sides exchanged gunfire for a few minutes but no casualties reported.

A group of lorry and public transport drivers together with passengers protested in front of Lawya Caddo custom office on 29/10 following after the drivers were accused by the custom office of using irregular paper work. Police arrive at the scene and arrested several drivers and passengers.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SIMAD University main campus (Wardhiigleey District) in the night of 29/10. The motive behind the attack is unknown. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators escaped.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab attack the resident of a senior al Shabaab commander in Ufurow, engage in fighting which resulted in death and injury, numbers not known. Ethiopian forces were also involved.
Al Shabaab attacks the Afmadow District Commissioner at his residence on 29/10, killing ""several"" of his body guards. The commissioner survived.

Hundreds of civilians held huge demonstration near the Mogadishu Football Stadium on 30 October, protesting against the AU Mission in Somalia [AMISOM] forces, which allegedly killed a young boy last month [September] who was playing football.

An IED planted in a tea-shop in Daynuunay (20km SE of Baidoa) detonated in the night of 30/10. The tea-shop owner together with another woman and two SNG soldiers were injured in the blast. Reports indicate that the teashop was frequented by SNG soldiers to chew khat.

Reports indicate that Al Shabaab/Galgala fighters reportedly killed Sheikh Abdulkadir Mumin along with some other fighters loyal to him at Galgala mountainous ranges in Bosasso district on 30/10. This incident happened after the high-ranking member and spiritual leader of the group pledged his allegiance to the Islamic State (ISIL) recently. A later report claimed the death of the Sheikh was not true.

Al Shabaab fighters took a civilian man in Misra (11km SE of Diinsoor) on 30/10 and later beheaded him in the outskirts of the village. The victim was accused of working for the Somali Government. Later the local residents were called to collect the body for burial.

A man hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Ahmed Farah sub-clan stabbed and seriously injured a man hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Basan Buur sub-clan in the vicinity of Fadhi Gaab (36km SW of Ceel-Afwayn) on 30/10. Reports indicate that the motive behind the incident is reportedly related to dispute over grazing land. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.
A gunman shot and killed three civilians in Ina Higle Village (80km SE of Hargeisa) on 30/10. The motive of the killing is not known.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Ceel Qalaw neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina District) in the afternoon of 30/10. The motive behind the attack is so far unknown. The attackers escaped.
Kenyan forces allegedly open fire on a group of civilians, killing a local elder near Faafax Dhuun on 30/10.
Clan fighting between Dir and Xawadle militias erupted again in Kabxanley village (21km NW of Belet Weyn) on 31/10. So far there are only reports of one injury.
An IED exploded in a teashop in Daynuunay village. Six injuries reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked Garas Weyne and Moro Gabey villages (48 & 29km NW of Xudur) respectively in the morning of 31/10. Unconfirmed reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters managed to take over Moro Gabey village but fighting was ongoing at the time of reporting. Further reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters killed three SNG soldiers in Moro Gabey and also took a truck full of military supplies before they vacated the town later.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked an ENDF military base in the outskirts Qansax-Dheere town in the night of 31/10. Reports indicate the attack started with motor fire targeting the base followed by exchange of gunfire from both sides which lasted about an ho

Al Shabaab fighters attacked Garas Weyne and Moro Gabey villages (48 & 29km NW of Xudur) respectively in the morning of 31/10. Unconfirmed reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters managed to take over Moro Gabey village but fighting was ongoing at the t

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenya Defence Forces(KDF) conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab positions in Wadajir and Dalayad villages (38kmNE and 25km N of Badhaadhe) respectively on 01/11. As a result of the airstrikes 17 al Shabaab fighters including two senior commanders were allegedly killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenya Defence Forces(KDF) conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab positions in Wadajir and Dalayad villages (38kmNE and 25km N of Badhaadhe) respectively on 01/11. As a result of the airstrikes 17 al Shabaab fighters including two senior commanders were allegedly killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A rocket believed to be RPG landed inside an AMISOM base in Sarta Minashibiyo (Marka) in the morning of 01/11. AMISOM forces in the camp opened gunfire in to different directions in retaliation to the attack. Casualties are unknown.

Over 200 people demonstrated peacefully in front of the Governors house and along the main road in Belet Weyn in protest against the setup of the technical committee for the upcoming Hiraan and Middle Shabelle state. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNG police forces on foot patrol in the vicinity of Marka Police Station (Marka) in the morning of 01/11. The police forces conducted a security operation after the attack and arrested about 40 people; most of them were later released. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A Puntland Darawish constable shot and killed three soldiers and injured five others in a defence base in Galgala Mountains in Bosasso district on 01/11. The motive behind this is currently unclear. Another soldier at the base shot and killed the perpetrator.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A mini-bus loaded with explosives detonated at the main gate of Sahafi Hotel (Wadajir/Medina District) in the morning of 01/11 with unidentified number of al Shabaab gunmen storming the hotel as they exchanged gunfire with the security guards. A suicide bomber detonated a second set of explosive inside the hotel about 30 minutes later. NISAs especial operation unit called Gaashaan was deployed to the scene to battle with the militants. The siege lasted for more than four hours after which the AMISOM/SNG forces concluded the operation. The hotel is often frequented by Somali government officials, business executives and it has been also targeted before where two French security advisers were abducted from the hotel by al Shabaab fighters back in 2009. At least 15 people were killed (later estimated at 25), including the owner of the hotel, a parliamentarian and the attackers while score others were injured. Al Shabaab fighters immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Zobe junction (Wadajir-Medina District) in the morning of 01/11 over unknown reasons. The victim was sitting in a teashop when the incident happened and no arrest was reported.

A private vehicle exploded near Waberi police station (Waberi District) in the morning of 01/11. The device is believed to be attached to the vehicle. The owner who is one of the SNA officials was not in the vehicle when the incident happened. No casualties were reported.

A private vehicle exploded near Waberi police station (Waberi District) in the morning of 01/11. The device is believed to be attached to the vehicle. The owner who is one of the SNA officials was not in the vehicle when the incident happened. No casualties were reported.

A mini-bus loaded with explosives detonated at the main gate of Sahafi Hotel (Wadajir/Medina District) in the morning of 01/11 with unidentified number of al Shabaab gunmen storming the hotel as they exchanged gunfire with the security guards. A suicide bomber detonated a second set of explosive inside the hotel about 30 minutes later. NISAs especial operation unit called Gaashaan was deployed to the scene to battle with the militants. The siege lasted for more than four hours after which the AMISOM/SNG forces concluded the operation. The hotel is often frequented by Somali government officials, business executives and it has been also targeted before where two French security advisers were abducted from the hotel by al Shabaab fighters back in 2009. At least 15 people were killed (later estimated at 25), including the owner of the hotel, a parliamentarian and the attackers while score others were injured. Al Shabaab fighters immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.
Al Shabaab attacks a convoy near Waantabe, Bali Doogle Airport, killing between 35 and 40 soldiers. Seven al Shabaab dead. Date of the attack not clear, sources dated 02/11.
Al Shabaab ambushed a group of government soldiers in Wanlaweyn on 02/11, fifteen deaths reported.

Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG military convoy near Kaba Hirig Village in Wanla Weyne District in the evening of 02/11. A heavy fighting that lasted for more than an hour followed the ambush. The convoy which consisted of five military vehicles was heading to Bali-Doogle airbase when the ambush happened. ""Heavy losses"" of human casualties and property damage were reported.

A group of al Shabaab fighters Ambushed AMISOM/KDF convoy at Bilis Qooqaani Village (47km SW of Afmadow) in the morning of 02/11. The Ambush started with twin IED explosions targeting the convoy followed by exchange of gunfire for about 10 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Military forces kill six al Shabaab fighters during a firefight in Buurweyn.
Al Shabaab attacks a vehicle carrying khat, kills the owner and abducts three others in Madhaayte.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed AMISOM convoy near Garasiyaani (Beled Weyne District) in the afternoon of 03/11. The convoy was going towards Beled Weyne when the incident happened. Casualties remain unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A body guards attached to the commander of Carmo police academy shot and killed a police officer at a checkpoint in Carmo (80km S of Bossaso) in the afternoon of 03/11. The incident was reportedly as a result of dispute over Khat collect at the checkpoint. Tensions reportedly run high after the relatives of the victim refused to collect the body for burial and demanded the perpetrator to be handed over.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces positions near Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 03/11. Casualties could not be established.
Residents protest al Shabaab following a deadly attack on an area hotel.
Two groups of Somaliland forces clashed in Gambadha (30km NE of Laas Caanood) on 04/11. At least one soldier was killed in the clashes.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a checkpoint manned by SNG forces in the vicinity of Mushaani village (14km NW of Marka) in the night of 04/11. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdre

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces conducted a security operation in Gamboole Village in Wanla Weyne District in the night of 04/01. The security operation was reportedly in a respond to earlier ambush against SNG forces in the area on 02/11. Local media reported that AMISOM forces killed a pastoralist during the operation and arrested three others however, neither AMISOM nor SNA have so far commented on the alleged killing.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces attacked an al Shabaab base near Sabca-Ashraf Village (12km NE of Kismaayo) in the morning of 04/11. Reports indicate that the base has been destroyed during the clash and al Shabaab fighters reportedly left the base to unknown destination. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted against an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ceel-Jaale (5km SW of Marka) in the morning of 05/11. The convoy came from Ceel-Jaale and was heading to Shalaambood when the incident happened. Local residents confirmed death and injuries of AMISOM forces (unknown numbers) as well as damage to of one of their vehicles.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG/ISWA forces base in Buur-Hakaba town in the morning of 05/11. Reports indicate the al Shabaab fighters targeted a police station in Darussalam section of the town followed by side exchange of heavy automatic machine guns
Six killed and twelve are wounded in a drive-by style al Shabaab shooting in Beled Hawo.

SNA (Somali National Army) and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Warmahan Village (Wanla Weyne District) in the evening of 06/11. After a brief exchange of gunfire, the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug security forces conducted a security operation against militia manning illegal road-block in Godinlabe Village (Cadaado District) in the morning of 06/11. The two sides exchanged fire briefly after which the militia withdrew and the road-block was destroyed. One Galmudug soldier was killed during the operation.

Food aid donated by a Kuwaiti charity was looted by locals in Gargara Village (Lughaya District) on 07/11. The incident happened after a group of people who were not in the list of the beneficiaries disrupted the distribution exercise.
Detonation: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Marka Police Station (Marka) in the morning of 07/11. The hand grenade landed on an empty place. No casualties were reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: SNFG/ENDF/KDF carried out an attack against an al Shabaab base in Jungal Village (22km NW of Baardheere) in the morning of 07/11. The operation follows after al Shabaab fighters forcefully took livestock as Zakat from the nomads in the area. Unconfirmed reports indicate that nine al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against the residence of the deputy governor of Lower Shabelle Region in the evening of 07/11. The guards of the deputy governor arrested two men whom they suspected of being behind the attack. No casualties were reported.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen shoot and wound a Somali MP near the Parliament building. Later, the MP succumbed serious to his injuries in a Mogadishu hospital.

Gunmen hailing from Habar Gidir/Saleban sub-clan reportedly shot and killed a man hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan and injured another near Hilmo Village (53km S of Galkacyo) in the evening of 08/11. Saad gunmen fired back and injured one of the perpetrators. The motive of the attack was reportedly related to clan revenge.

SNA (Somali National Army) and al Shabaab fighters clashed in the vicinity of Garasyaani Village (Beled Weyne District) in the afternoon of 08/11. The attack was launched by the SNA following a tip-off received that al Shabaab fighters were regrouping in the area. SNA claimed that they had killed four al Shabaab fighters.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF occupied the regional administration offices in Garbahaarey on 08/11 following prolonged dispute between the current administration and the former.

Gunmen hailing from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud reportedly abducted a herder from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan near Lamo Ali Biid (16km N of Galkacyo) in the evening of 08/11. The motive is not clear but unconfirmed reports indicate the abduction followed after unspecified number of camels crossed to Saad area and presumed that the camels had been stolen by Saad. Omar Mohamud clan elders stepped in to release the victim.
NISA forces and suspected al Shabaab fighters engaged an exchange of gunfire in the vicinity of Ceymiska (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 08/11. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against police based at the former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the night of 08/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Food aid donated by Saudi Red Crescent was looted by locals in Lughaya on 09/11. The incident happened after a group of people who were not in the list of the beneficiaries disrupted the distribution exercise. Police shot in the air. The aid was donated to the people affected by the recent floods in the district and was being distributed by a local NGO. Four people were injured in the shooting. Similar unrest occurred in the area two days earlier.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces position in Ceelasha settlement (Afgooye District) in the night of 09/11. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy near Ex-Control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the evening of 09/11. The blast reportedly destroyed one of the AMISOMs vehicles. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire. An unknown number of AMISOM soldiers were reportedly killed in the explosion while a civilian bystander was injured in the shooting.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Aargada (Wadajir/Medina District) in the morning of 09/11. First reports indicate that the victim used to work for SKA -a foreign company based at Mogadishu International Airport.
Al Shabaab gain control of Cow Qurun after a battle with government forces. No causality figures disclosed.
A senior official of Mogadishu Airport security is attacked and killed by suspected al Shaba in Dharkeynley.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED targets a passing AMISOM convoy on 09/11, killing a civilian woman.

An armed clash erupted between clan militia loyal to former Somaliland army local commander (Habar Yonis/Muse Ismail) and the police forces in the vicinity of Tuulo Dacar neighbourhood in Ceerigaabo on 10/11. This follows when police backed by the army conducted a security operation in attempt to arrest the former army commander after they accused him of smuggling weapons from Yemen to Somaliland via Laasasurad coast. A woman bystander and five others were reportedly injured in the clash. The clash triggered violent protest by the local residents against the security forces. The protestors reportedly blocked the roads and burned tires on the main streets.
An anti-al Shabaab war plane (not identified) conducted an air strike again al Shabaab positions on the outskirts of Baioda on 10/11. Causality numbers, if any, were not reported.

An armed clash erupted between clan militia loyal to former Somaliland army local commander (Habar Yonis/Muse Ismail) and the police forces in the vicinity of Tuulo Dacar neighbourhood in Ceerigaabo on 10/11. This follows when police backed by the army conducted a security operation in attempt to arrest the former army commander after they accused him of smuggling weapons from Yemen to Somaliland via Laasasurad coast. A woman bystander and five others were reportedly injured in the clash. The clash triggered violent protest by the local residents against the security forces. The protestors reportedly blocked the roads and burned tires on the main streets.
Two militia groups hailing from Habar Gidir and Biimaal fought in the vicinity of Buufow Bacaad (Marka District) in the morning of 10/11. One combatant was so far confirmed dead.
Two men armed with pistols shot and killed Dharkeynley District Judge in Heegan neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 10/11. Perpetrators escaped.

A VBIED was targeted against a convoy escorting ISWA President Sharif Hassan Sheikh Adan in the vicinity of Carbiska (Afgooye District) in the evening of 11/11. The ISWA president was travelling from Afgooye to Mogadishu when the incident happened. Another explosion (probably a RCIED) was again targeted the convoy but both blasts did not hit the intended target. This is the second time President Sharif Hassan survived an assassination attempt along Mogadishu-Afgooye road. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility for the attack. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked at SNG forces manning a check point in Makuudo area (7km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 11/11. The soldiers were robbing people from the rural areas heading to Baidoa. Al Shabaab militants killed two soldiers in the shoot-ou

Unidentified gunmen killed two elders and their driver near Balanbale (Cabuud Waaq) in the afternoon of 11/12. The victims participated in the formation of Balanbale administration and were heading to Guri-Ceel when the incident happened. The motive behind the killing is unknown but it is believed to be clan revenge. The victims hail from Habar Gidir/Ceyr sub-clan. The perpetrators believed to be Marehan escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Tension reported ran high between Khatumo and Puntland administrations in Boocame Village (64km E of Laas Caanood) in the morning of 11/11. The tension began after Khatumo forces with two battle wagons exchanged fire with Puntland forces. The clashed was in reaction to pro-Puntland supporters who attempted to oppose the visit to the village by a Khatumo delegation.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a military officer in the vicinity of African Village (Hodan District) in the evening of 11/11. The perpetrators stole a pistol and cash from the victim before escaping.
Infighting among government forces causes casualties including deaths and injuries in Wadjir-Medina. Among the dead are a senior commander. The reason for the clash is not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed Ugandan forces outside Bulo Mareer on 12/11. The Ugandans suffered casualties, but no further details were immediately available.
Two groups of al Shabaab clash in Saacow over allegiance to ISIL (ISIS). Five reported deaths, other reports claim 9 dead. Date not clear - source dated 12/11.

Food aid donated by Emirates Red Crescent Kuwaiti charity was looted by locals in Fiqi Adan area (Borama District) on 12/11. The incident happened after a group of people who were not in the list of the beneficiaries disrupted the distribution exercise.

A civilian from Abgal/Daud sub-clan was shot and killed by a pastoralist from Dir/Qubeys sub-clan in Ceel Geelow Village (17km N of Balcad) in the evening of 12/11. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown and the perpetrator escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack at NISA forces position in Lafoole (Afgooye District) in the night of 13/11. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire. Lower Shabelle authority claimed that the security forces had killed six al Shabaab fighters.

A civilian man was abducted by a group of suspected al Shabaab fighters in Ceel neighbourhood (Qansax Dheere) in the night of 13/11. The man was allegedly accused of collaborating with SNG/ENDF forces in the town.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked Jubaland forces based at Academia (7Km NE of Kismaayo) on 13/11 night. The two sides exchanged heavy fire for about an hour. Reports indicate that 14 Jubaland soldiers were killed and nine others injured. Al Shabaab casualtie

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Qosol Tire Village (50km NE of Xarardheere) in the morning of 13/11. After a brief exchange of gunfire, the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Galmudug military officer told to the media that they have killed four al Shabaab fighters and captured unspecified number of prisoners. Other reports suggest that a Galmudug officer was also killed in the clash.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in the vicinity of Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 13/11. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A remote-controlled roadside bomb targeted a AMISOM convoy in Heliwa, perpetrators not known. Causalities reported, numbers not known.

SNA forces based in Shalaambood launched an attack against a group of Biimaal clan militias who erected a road-block in Gendawe village (7km S of Marka) in the afternoon of 14/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire after which the SNA took over the location. At least four combatants from both sides were killed.

Al Shabaab fighters and local pastoralists clashed in an area near Qosol Tire Village (50km NE of Xarardheere) in the afternoon of 14/11. The fighting broke out after al Shabaab fighters demanded Zakaat from the pastoralists. Two al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the clash.

Security guards of the governor of Hiraan shot and seriously injured a third-party contractor of a UN agency in Beled Weyne on 14/11. The victim later succumbed to his injuries. The reason for the shooting is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Armed clan militias hailing from Majeerteen/Reer Biciidyahan launched an attack against Puntland police stationed at the former Ministry of Public Work building in Israac neighbourhood in Galkacyo (North) in the morning of 14/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Three people were killed (two combatants and teenage bystander) and 10 others injured. The attack is believed to be linked to the recent eviction of people living at the building.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A bodyguard of Carmo Police Academy commander shot and injured a man hailing from Isse Mohamud in Garowe on the evening of 14/11. The motive of the incident is yet to be established. Tension ran high after the Academys commander rejected an order from Puntland police commissioner that he be put under a house arrest.
""A UN contractor was killed after an assailant in another vehicle pulled up to his car and shot at it. The contractor died of his injuries at the hospital.""

A group of students and teachers demonstrated in front of the office of the regional director of education in Xariirad (133km SW of Zeylac) on 15/11 over the poor infrastructure of the town. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed them.

A group of Ministry of Livestock employees demonstrated in front of the ministry headquarters against the director general of the ministry in Hargeisa on 15/11 due to lack of payment of two months salaries.

A local reporter was reportedly beaten and arrested by the bodyguards of Sanaag regional governor in front of the governors office in Ceerigaabo on 15/10 for allegedly recording news without permission. The reporter was later released.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man inside a teashop in Buulo Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon 15/11. The motive is said to be clan revenge. The gunfire also injured a civilian bystander. Reports add that a group of SNG soldiers in Marka killed the perpetrator in the same neighbourhood.
Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces position in Livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 15/11. Casualties are unknown.
Al-Shabaab captures five senior pro-ISIL(ISIS) commanders in Buaale town. Date of capture not known - source dated 16/11.

Hundreds of students from two public high schools staged a protest in front of the ministry of education headquarters in Hargeisa on 16/10 over mismanagement of scholarship scheme by the ministry officials. The students voiced their concerns over corruption allegations by some of the ministry officials. The protest later ceased after senior ministry officials informed students that their complaints will be considered.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNA convoy in the vicinity of Gol-Weyn Village (21km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 16/11. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire which lasted more than an hour. The convoy was reportedly heading towards Baraawe when the incident happened. Somali Memo reports 12 AMISOM deaths, including a commander.
The body of a man who had defected from al Shabaab to ISIL is discovered in Qalawil, near Buale. The body may belong to those arrested the previous day. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Police officer hailing from Reer Mohamoud sub-clan of Majeerteen shot and killed a civilian man from Siwaaqroon sub-clan of Majeerteen near Suweyto area of Bosasso on the night of 16/11. The motive is unknown. Police arrested the perpetrator.
An argument between two groups of SNG forces over the responsibility of ration cards of displaced people leads to a shootout, killing 13, many were civilian.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab kills a Intelligence Service officer in Galkacyo North on 17/11.

Two clan militias from Abgaal/Warsangeli and Jareer/Shiidle sub-clans clashed in the vicinity of Mandheere Village (39km NE of Balcad) in the evening of 17/11. The motive was reportedly a dispute over farmland ownership in the village. One Jareer/Shiidle man was killed.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: SNG/ENDF forces attacked a group of al Shabaab fighters who were forcing local pastoralists to pay Zakat in the outskirts of Qansax Dheere in the midnight of 17/11. One al Shabaab fighters was killed and his gun confiscated while another was injured. Further reports indicate that another fighter was also arrested by the forces and traditional elders from his sub-clan are advocating for his release.

Unidentified gunmen (lasted revealed to be al Shabaab) shot and killed a civilian man from Dir/Gaadsan sub-clan at the green line (Galkacyo) in the evening of 17/11. The victim was at a wedding event when the incident happened. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown and the perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade against Marka police station in the afternoon of 17/11. No casualties were reported.

SNG police forces and NISA exchanged gunfire briefly in the vicinity of MIA (Waberi District) in the afternoon of 17/11. The motive behind the intra-clash is unknown. One police officer was reportedly killed.
A bomb planted under the car of government official detonates in Dharkeynley District killing one and injuring a second.
Al Shabaab captures a SNG soldier outside of Baidoa, executes him on 18/11.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA base in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 18/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

An explosion was heard inside a residence where a group of SNG soldiers were spending the night in Dhagaxtuur neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the early morning of 19/11. It is not clear whether the explosion was caused by an IED device planted in the residence or by a hand grenade. Local residents have confirmed the injuries of two SNG soldiers and the local authority is yet to comment on the incident.

Non-violent activity: Gunmen from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub-clan reportedly opened fire at the residence of a Somaliland MP in Laas Caanood on 19/11. The motive remains unclear. The gunmen immediately escaped but were later arrested in a security operation conducted by the police. The MP was not in the house by the time of the attack. No casualties were reported.

On 19/11/2015 at 20:00 a hand grenade was thrown to the compound of the former JLF police commander in Qalinle Junction, at Guulwale section of Shaqalaha neighbourhood in Kismayo town. The grenade apparently hit an open space inside the compound, causing no casualties. The intended target is not known.

Reports indicate that two armed militia clashed over the construction of livestock holding-ground in Laanta Hawada (14km E of Garowe town) in the morning of 19/11. The incident happened after pastoralists attacked the people at the construction site claiming that the area is a grazing land for their livestock. Both groups hail from Majerteen/Isse Mohamud. Elders and police intervened to defuse the tension. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian man in Caabud Waaq in the evening of 19/11. The motive behind the killing is unknown. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted at an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ex-Control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the afternoon of 19/11. The explosion reportedly damaged one of the vehicles in the convoy. AMISOM forces opened fire after the blast. No causalities reported.

Unidentified attacker armed with pistol shot and killed a business woman inside Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 19/11. The attacker was immediately shot and killed by a NISA officer who was in the area.

Unidentified attacker armed with pistol shot and killed a business woman inside Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 19/11. The attacker was immediately shot and killed by a NISA officer who was in the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A remote blast targeted AMISOM soldiers in Balcad, causalities reported, though numbers of dead not known. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrators.
Al Shabaab attacks a SNG base in Yaaqshid District. The attack came minutes after an attack on a base in Heliwa. Causalities not reported.

Al Shabaab attacked a federal government militia base in Biya Dageenka, in Huriwaa Districts Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood. Locals reported hearing the sound of artillery and heavy gunfire being exchanged between the two sides. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM soldiers open fire on Warshadaha Road, causing fatalities and injuries. Witnesses said a civilian, cows, and goats were killed by shots fired by the soldiers. Specific causality numbers not known. The reason for the attack is not known.

Heavily armed clan militias staged in the streets of Beled Weyne in the morning of 20/11. These militias are demanding the arrest of Hiraan Governor Mr. Abdifitah Hassan Afrah following the assassination of Mahdi Shiikhaal (UN contractor). No specific reports of violence.

Pastoralists from Essa and Gadubirsi clans clashed using sticks and daggers following an escalated dispute over grazing land in 20/11. Local elders stepped in to mediate between the two sides. Seven combatants were injured in the incident.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a ISWA soldier in Adeegow Village (Waajid District) on 20/11. The victim is among the recently trained soldier and was heading to see his father in the village when the incident happened. The victim may not have been a combatant at the time of abduction. The victim hails from Hadame/Rahaweyn sub-clan.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man in a teashop in Buulo Jaan neighborhood on 20/11. The motive is said to be clan revenge. Neither clan identified.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: A man hailing from Esse Mohamoud sub-clan of Majeerteen stabbed to death a man from an IDP from Somali Bantu in Garowe on 20/11. Reports indicate that the incident occurred after the perpetrator and the victim had physical fight over payment of wages at a construction site. Police arrested the perpetrator.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Drone believed to be of American reportedly bombed al Shabaab position in Balad Amiin (roughly 30km NW of Wanla Weyne) in the night of 21/11. Reports indicate that the drone had been targeting a senior al Shabaab commander in the area. Eight al Shabaab fighters were killed but there are no reports suggesting that the commander was killed in the airstrike.
At least four are wounded when an IED detonated at a shop in Buulobarde.
Two Al-Shabaab factions have clashed in southern Somali town of Buaale over links with the Islamic State group. Causalities, date not known - source dated 21/11.

An IED exploded inside a tea shop frequented by SNG soldiers in Bulo Burte in the morning of 21/11. There were no SNG soldiers present in the tea shop when the incident happened. One civilian was killed and a number of others were injured.

Somaliland army officer from Dhulbahante/Jama Siyaad sub clan reportedly shot and killed his colleague (also a Jama Siyad) at the Somaliland army base of Gambadha (16km E of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 21/11. The motive is unknown. The perpetrator managed to escape but was later arrested.
Two groups of SNA forces clashed in Jowhar Town in the afternoon of 21/11. The reason of the clash is said to be related to a check-point dispute. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a former al Shabaab member in Beled Xaawo Town on 21/11. The victim defected from al Shabaab and surrendered to SNG forces in Beled Xaawo where he was allowed to run his own business. No one has so far claimed responsibility for the killing.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade at AMISOM troops on foot patrol in the vicinity of the fish market (Marka) in the morning of 21/11. No casualties were reported.
Former members of al Shabaab, now in allegiance with ISIL (ISIS), establish a base in Lowdar grazing area (150km N of Buale) on 22/11.

Two sub-clans of Habarjeclo/Iidle Biciide engaged in a shootout in the area of Karin Biyood (10km S of Ceel Afweyn) on 22/11 following a dispute over pastureland ownership. This follows when a group from one of the sub clans of Iidle Biciide rejected the entry of livestock belonging to the other clan in the pastureland claiming the ownership of the grazing land. No causalities reported.

A group of al Shabaab fighters attacked another group which declared allegiance to ISIS and set up a new base Lowdar grazing area (150km N of Buale) on 22/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire in a clash which lasted for about an hour. More than 20 fighters from sides were reportedly killed.

Al Shabaab fighters seized 11 donkey carts transporting goods at Aleemow village (20km N of Waajid) on 22/11. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters killed the 11 donkey carts, burnt down the goods and tortured the loaders, but released them later.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Puntland and Galmudug forces clashed near Garsoor neighbourhood in Galkacyo in the morning of 22/11. The fighting reportedly flared up after Puntland government began to construct a road that connects parts of Garsoor to the main tarmac road near the south checkpoint. Five people-four combatants and a civilian-were killed in the clash. More than 30 other people were also injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Baar Jowhar (Heliwa District) in the evening of 22/11. The device reportedly caused no damage. AMISOM troops opened gunfire after the blast but no casualties were reported.

A group of families of Burco police staged a peaceful demonstration in Burco on 23/11 over reports of new plans by the local municipal authorities to sell the residential houses of police. The protestors accused the mayor and his associates of trying to sell state-owned properties. They also said that seven police officers were arrested by the mayor and his team after expressing concerns over the new plans.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Rimaygacmeed village (5km SW of Afgooye) on 23/11. The two sides engaged heavy gunfire for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdraw. Casualties could not be established.

Armed group hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan shot and seriously injured a herder man hailing from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan near Godod Village (30km E of Galkacyo) in the evening of 23/11. Reports indicate that the motive behind the incident was reportedly related clan revenge. The perpetrators escaped.

Djiboutian border guards shot and injured a khat dealer trying to smuggle khat into Djibouti near the border town of Lowyacado (Zeylac District) on 23/11. The man was admitted to a hospital in Djibouti.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Kaaraan District Police station in the night of 23/11. No casualties were reported. Perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against NISA outpost in the vicinity of Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 23/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Haji Adan secondary schools students staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the ministry of education office in Ceerigaabo on 24/11 over the replacement of their principal. The protestors marched along the streets that pass the government offices chanting slogans against the ministry. The regional officers on education denied the allegations, saying that there are some people in the city who want to disturb the peace and are behind this protest.

A RCIED planted in a teashop frequented by SNG forces exploded in Buur Dhuxunle (27km N of Waajid) in the afternoon of 24/11. The owner of the teashop was killed while three SNG soldiers were injured by the blast.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A RCIED was targeted against newly trained ISWA soldiers who were doing a joint military exercise with ENDF near Nation-Link Telecommunication company office in Qasaxdhere in the morning of 24/11. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack against AMISOM/SNG forces based in Arbacow village in Afgooye district in the night of 24/11. The two sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab attackers withdraw. Casualties could not be established.
Al Shabaab attacked government soldiers along a road in Yaaqshid. Any causalities were left unreported.

Al Shabaab clashed with armed residents over a forceful Zakah collection in locations in the outskirts of Maxaas town (Qorof and Mariiri locations) on 25/11. Eight members of al Shabaab reported dead following the clash.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills a senior government official while he was travelling near Maka Al-Mukarama Hotel. Date not clear - source dated 25/11.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A military convoy belonging to African Union troops in Somalia (AMISOM) have been targeted in double bomb blasts in the southern Somali coastal town of Marka on 25/11. Casualties believed, though numbers not immediately known.

An explosive detonated in Boolaay neighbourhood of Waberi on 25/11, targeting government soldiers. The resulting explosion caused casualties including death and injuries (numbers not known) on the government militias side.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Galgala/al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against Puntland forces based in Galgala area in the evening of 25/11. Casualties from both sides could not be established.
Government forces repel a al Shabaab attack near Baidoa town on 26/11. Government forces claim two al Shabaab dead while al Shabaab claim dead 15 soldiers.

Al Shabaab fighters and local pastoralists clashed in Qorof grazing area (Bulo Burte District) in the morning of 26/11. The fighting broke out after the pastoralists refused to pay livestock as Zakat demanded by the al Shabaab fighters. Casualties not reported.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed two tax collection officers in the vicinity of Suuq Boocle (Dharkenleey District) in the afternoon of 26/11. The attackers escaped.
Suspected al Shabaab attack and kill two, including a government official in Dharkeynley on 26/11.

A man hailing from Galjecel was killed by Jareer (Bantu armed men) in Bulo Burte on 27/11. Galjecel gunmen in return killed two men hailing from Jareer in retaliation of the previous killing. Later on gunmen from Jareer killed again a Galjecel man in Bulo Burte town in revenge.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters position in Carshaanley Village (13km SW of Baraawe District) in the morning of 27/11. The two sides exchanged fire after which the allied forces took over the control of the village. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNGF forces convoy near Jiiro Gurey Village (8km SE of Bardaale) in the afternoon of 27/11. The ambush was started with the detonation of an IED planted on the road side followed by an exchange of gunfire for about 30 minutes. Three SNG soldiers were killed and nine others were injured in the clash. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNG forces convoy near Golweyn Village (21km SW of Marka District) in the afternoon of 27/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters seized SNG soldier who was travelling from Xudur town to Waajid in Kulan Jareer (40km W of Waajid) in the morning of 27/11 and took him to unknown location. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters beheaded the solider later.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force; Aid Workers (Somalia)
column17: Puntland Special Protection Unit (SPU) for humanitarian agencies apparently siege UN Common Compound (UNCC) in Garowe on 27/11 and defiantly denied any access in to the premises. The incident happened after a UN agency who was funding the SPUs operation stopped to pay stipends.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base at the former Jaale Siyaad Military Academy (Hodan District) in the night of 27/11. Casualties are unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: At least five people were killed and nine others injured on 28/11 in a heavy fighting between Somali National Army backed by the African Union peacekeeping forces (AMISOM) and Al-Shabaab militants in Barawo town.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG/ENDF base at Bardheere airstrip on the mid night of 28/11. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters initiated the attack with several rounds of mortars before engaging in a direct confrontation with the allied forces. Th

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces killed a Jubaland soldier in a shoot-out in Hoosingo Village (Badhaadhe District) in the afternoon of 28/11. The victim reportedly defied an order from his commander went to his home. He was killed after he opened fire at soldiers who were ordered to arrest him. A woman bystander was also injured in the shoot-out.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces attacked al Shabaab fighters collecting livestock in the name of Zakat from pastoralists in Liini grazing area (35km SW of Afmadow) on 28/11. No casualties were reported. Jubaland forces seized 63 cows collected by al Shabaab and took them to Afmadow.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Heavy armed clashes are took place in Galkacyo town between Puntland and Galmudug administrations on 28/11. More than 20 combatants and an undetermined number of civilians (including one medical staff) were killed in the clash, and more than 40 people were injured.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a police outpost at Hawl-Wadaag Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 28/11. One police officer and a female bystander were injured in the attack. Perpetrators escaped.

Looting: Al Shabaab fighters entered Kaxda District Office (Dharkenleey District) in the night of 28/11. No clash was reported as there were no police in the office when the incident happened. The al Shabaab fighters stole office computers during their two-hour stay at the premise. Contents of the computers are not known.
SNG aircraft bombard al Shabaab locations in Ceel Dheere, Ceel Lahelay and Yasoman causing ""heavy losses.""
SNG aircraft bombard al Shabaab locations in Ceel Dheere, Ceel Lahelay and Yasoman causing ""heavy losses.""

Two sub-clans from Habar-Jeclo/Biciide (Baho) and Habar-Yunis/Muse Tuurwa reportedly engaged in a shootout in the vicinity of Dhagaxyo Waylo near Xamilka (82km S of Ceerigaabo) in the morning of 29/11 following a dispute over ownership of a pastureland. This incident followed after one of the group blocked livestock from other group to graze the area. Somaliland police arrive at the scene, separated the fighting groups and arrested unspecified number of people from the two sides. A man from Habar-Jeclo/Biciide sub-clan was allegedly injured.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNGF positions in Ceelasha Biyaha (12km E of Afgooye District) in the night of 29/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in the vicinity of the Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 20/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
SNG aircraft bombard al Shabaab locations in Ceel Dheere, Ceel Lahelay and Yasoman causing ""heavy losses.""

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces attack al Shabaab fighters collecting livestock from pastoralists (Zakat) in Liini area (35km SW of Afmadow) on 28/11. Causalities, if any, not known.
Military forces clash with al Shabaab in Qoryooley on 30/11, ""heavy [al Shabaab] losses"" reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted against an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Golweyn Village (21km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 01/12. The explosion reportedly destroyed an AMISOM oil tanker. AMISOM forces captured and killed three civilian bystanders in retaliation of the attack.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against Marka Police Station (Marka) in the evening of 01/12. One police officer was injured in the blast. Perpetrators escaped.

Two militias hailing from Habar Gidir and Biimaal clans exchanged gunfire in the vicinity of the market (Marka) in the afternoon of 01/12. The fighting lasted for twenty minutes and two combatants were injured in the clash. The motive behind these fresh clashes is believed to be related to the tax collected from the market.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted against an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Golweyn Village (21km SW of Marka) in the afternoon of 01/12. The explosion reportedly destroyed an AMISOM oil tanker. AMISOM forces captured and killed three civilian bystanders in retaliation of the attack.

A group of gunmen belonging to Dhulbahante/Baabdalle sub-clan reportedly opened fire at a Toyota Land Cruiser belonging to Warsangeli sub-clan in the vicinity of Daalo neighbourhood in the evening of 01/12. The motive of the shooting is reportedly an attempt to carjack the vehicle in revenge of past carjacking. However, the vehicle sped off and managed to escape. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded an old man in Rabdhure in the morning of 01/12. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear however, rumours report suggest that al Shabaab fighters accused the victim of spying for SNG forces in the town.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: An air strike from an American drone against al Shabaab officials in Kuunya Barrow in Baraawe District in the night of 02/12. Local residents reported two big explosions in the area. Senior al Shabaab officials are believed to be the target in the attack. The target was later reported to be Abdirahman Sandheere, who was determined killed by the strike.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Puntland and Galmudug forces clashed again in an area not far from the Puntland controlled checkpoint on the tarmac road in Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo) in the morning of 02/12. The fighting was allegedly triggered accidentally and its not clear which side started the fighting. Two combatants from the two sides were reportedly killed in the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces shot and killed a unidentified militiaman near Marka Police Station in the morning of 02/12. The incident happened after the AMISOM forces suspected the victim of attacking their compound.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired at least six mortar rounds at Maslax base - an AMISOM military base - (Heliwa District) in the night of 01/12. Reports indicate that the mortars were reportedly fired from the northern direction of the compound. Casualties are could not be established.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a local tax collector in the vicinity of Dabakaya Madow (Dharkenleey District) in the morning of 02/12. Perpetrators escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column9: ISIL: Islamic State of Iraq and Levant
column17: AMISOM-Kenyan aircraft bombed Yaraa Lafagari and Diif in Lower Juba region, where members of the pro-Islamic State [ISIL/ISIS] Al-Shabab faction are based. It is reported that al Shabaab/ISIL sustained causalities, though specific numbers are not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column9: ISIL: Islamic State of Iraq and Levant
column17: AMISOM-Kenyan aircraft bombed Yaraa Lafagari and Diif in Lower Juba region, where members of the pro-Islamic State [ISIL/ISIS] Al-Shabab faction are based. It is reported that al Shabaab/ISIL sustained causalities, though specific numbers are not known.

Police and vendors clashed in the streets of Borama on 03/12. The incident happened after the vendors left the areas allocated to them by the municipal council and returned to the main streets. They hurled stones at the police and municipal council workers. Police fired in the air to disperse the traders. Seven vendors were reportedly arrested. Three police officers were reportedly injured in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNGF base in Dhurey Village (19km NW of Waajid) on the night of 03/12. The two sides exchanged fire for about 30 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No causalities were reported.

Dir clan militias killed a prominent businessman hailing from Sacad sub-clan on the Green Line in Galkacyo in the afternoon of 03/12. The motive is currently unknown. A Galmudug MP was injured during the attack. No arrest was reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Police Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland police attacked an armed group from Jubaland forces in the vicinity of Dalxiiska in Farjano neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the morning of 03/12 following a land dispute between one of the fighting groups. One civilian death, three arrests following the violence.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Police Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland police kill a Jubaland soldier in Kismayo over an alleged dispute over land.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Heavy armed clash erupted between Puntland and Galmudug administrations in Galkacyo in the morning of 03/12. Reports indicate that both sides are using heavy artillery. The fighting resumed despite a peace agreement reached by the two administrations brokered by the Somali Prime Minister Omar Abdirashid on 02/12. At the time of writing this report the fighting was still ongoing with causalities not yet counted.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier at Ceymiska check point in Farjano neighbourhood of Kismaayo shot and injured a driver of over-speeding vehicle in the morning of 03/12. The incident happened after the driver reportedly ignored instructions to stop.

An IED attached to a vehicle belonging to a journalist exploded in the vicinity of KM4 (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 03/12. The victim was seriously injured and she was apparently working for a government run media under the Ministry of Information. It was later reported the victim had succumb to her injuries.

Food aid donated by UAEs Khelifa Charity Foundation charity was looted by locals in Boon Village (Borama District) on 04/12. The incident happened after a group of people who were not in the list of the beneficiaries disrupted the distribution exercise. The aid was being distributed by a local NGO.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA forces in the vicinity of Baar Village (Beled Weyne District) on 04/12. The two sides engaged in a serious exchange of gunfire for more than an hour. Reports indicate that ENDF supported the SNA during the clash. SNA commanders claimed that they had killed 10 al Shabaab fighters including a foreign fighter.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA (Somali National Army) base in Ceelasha village (Afgooye District) in the evening of 04/12. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Unidentified perpetrators beheaded a gatekeeper of Ala Maqan IDP camp in front of his house just after picking from his home in Mursal neighbourhood of Baidoa on the night of 04/12. The motive is currently unknown. The perpetrators are believed to be AS operatives. The victim hails from Rahaweyn/Hariin sub-clan. ISWA police conducted a security operation in the area following this incident but made no arrest.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Infighting among Puntland forces in Kismayo kills five and wounds others during the morning hours of 04/12.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted at an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Bali Doogle Airport (Wanla Weyne District) in the afternoon of 05/12. The explosion reportedly destroyed one of the AMISOM vehicles. AMISOM forces responded with gunfire after the blast. Casualties are unknown.

A group of students from Dayib Gurey School in Ahmed Dhagah District (Hargeisa) staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the Ministry of Education in Hargeisa in the morning of 05/12. The students were protesting against lack of teachers. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed them.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected Kenyan warplanes targeted al Shabaab convoy near Yora village (65km S of Afmadow) on 05/12. The convoy was transporting an unspecified number of al Shabaab fighters and at least one vehicle was destroyed. Casualties are unknown.
Rahaweyn/Jilible militia attacked al Shabaab fighters in Ceel Garas near Xudur (05/12). The clan militia was reportedly provided logistical support by ISWA/ENDF forces. No reported causalities.

Pro-ISWA clan militia (Rahaweyn/Jilibkle sub-clan) attacked al Shabaab fighters in EL Garas Village (2km E of Xudur) in the evening of 05/12. The militia reportedly launched the attack after getting logistical support from SNGF/ENDF. Reports indicate that one al Shabaab commander was killed in the clash and three others injured. Casualties from the militia side could not be established.

An unidentified masked man armed with a pistol believed to have links with al Shabaab reportedly shot and killed a taxi driver hailing from Dhulbahante/Jama Siyad-sub clan in the vicinity of Puntland bus stage in Laas Caanood in the evening of 05/12. The motive of the assassination remains unknown. Reports indicated that the victim received several death threat messages from unidentified people but believed to have links with al Shabaab sympathizers.
