The victim was behind the arrest of two suspected al Shabaab members in Laas Caanood in 2011 and 2013 by the Somaliland police.

A group of disgruntled SNA soldiers closed the road that links Wadajir-Medina District to Jazeera Training Camp on 05/12. The troops were complaining about lack of payment of salaries. The closure affected the traffic in the area.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against NISA (National Intelligence) base in Cabdi Waayeel Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 05/12. Casualties are unknown.
A roadside bomb targeting military officers has killed at least two people and wounded three others in the Dayniile neighbourhood. No immediate claim of responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: An AMISOM-Kenyan convoy hits an al Shabaab in Dhobley killing five soldiers.

Scuffles broke out between two groups of Dayax Secondary School students in Ceerigaabo on 06/12. The two groups from Isaq and Harti clans engaged in a fist-fight and a number of students suffered slight injuries. Ceerigaabo police arrived at the scene, shot in the air to disperse the two groups and arrested a number of them. The trigger of the scuffles remains unknown.

Gunmen shot and killed an ASWJ official in Olol Village (Dhusamareeb District) in the morning of 06/12. The motive behind the assassination is believed to be a clan revenge. Both the perpetrators and the victim hail from the same sub-clan of Habar Gidir/Ceyr. The perpetrators escaped.

Armed clan militia from Habar-Yaqub sub-clan of Marehan attacked and raided the office of the DC in Belet Xaawo in the morning of 06/12. The exchange of gun-fire between the local administration forces and the clan militia lasted for nearly one hour before the militia withdrew. No casualties were reported. The Haber-Yaqub are accusing the local authority to have released five murderers without trial killing Habar-Yaqub clan members. Local authorities made several arrested related to the fighting the following day.

A man from Majerteen/Idig-Facle sub-clan stabbed a man from Majerteen/Isse Mohamud sub-clan to death in Garowe in the evening of 06/12 following an escalated dispute between the perpetrator and the victim. The perpetrator was arrested.

A man from Majerteen/Idig-Facle sub-clan shot and killed a man from Leelkase sub-clan in Garowe in the evening of 06/12. The motive of the killing is yet to be established. The perpetrator escaped and the police are investigating the matter.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: A soldier from Puntland Daraawish forces shot and killed his colleague in the vicinity of Yalho Village (49km S of Bosasso) in the morning of 06/12. The motive of the incident is yet to be established and the perpetrator escaped.

A land mine exploded along the Industrial road near SIMAD University (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 06/12. The target was probably a traffic police officer who used to park his vehicle there. One police officer and two civilian bystanders were reportedly injured in the blast.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a Syrian engineer in the vicinity of Digfeer hospital (Hodan District) in the morning of 06/12. The victim used to work in Digfeer Hospital and the motive behind the killing remains unknown. No one has claimed responsibility for the killing and the perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and killed the Cabud Waaq chief of police on 07/12.

A ISWA military officer from Raxanweyn/Hariin sub-clan was shot and killed by an ISWA soldier in Mursal section of Baidoa in the morning of 07/12. The perpetrator, who is suspected of having links with al Shabaab, took the gun of the victim and escaped. Both the victim and perpetrator hail from the same sub-clan. ISWA police conducted security operations but did not manage to arrest him.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed ENDF/AMISOM convoy in Mooda-Mooda Village (29km SE of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 07/12. The convoy left Mogadishu and was heading to Baidoa when the incident happened. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes. Casualties could not be confirmed.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and injured a NISA officer in the vicinity of Beyturaas (Marka) in the morning of 07/12. The motive is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM base in Mudul-Braawe (5km NW of Baraawe) in the night of 07/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Somaliland police stormed the residence of a local reporter working for Star TV in Berbera in the morning of 07/12. The police reportedly assaulted the journalist after he refused to cooperate. The reason for the arrest of the journalist remains unknown but reports indicate that it could be linked to a recent report he made against the governor.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed an elderly man in Sheikh Abrone neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 07/12. The victim was a Quranic school teacher and the motive behind his killing is currently unknown. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the victim attended a meeting called by AMISOM and the local administration.

Two sub-clans of Gadabuursi clashed using sticks and stones in Karin Karin village (18km E of Baki) on 07/12 following dispute over grassland ownership. Local elders intervened and separated the fighting groups. Five people were reportedly injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the police officer in charge of Bosasso Airport in Bosasso in the morning of 07/12. The gunman(men) was later identified as a member of the Puntland military.

Two groups of SNG forces engaged in an intra-clash in the vicinity of Afisyooni neighbourhood (Waberi District) in the afternoon of 07/12. The exchange of gunfire started after a group of SNA soldiers tried to disarm a group of off-duty soldiers who were carrying their guns in the public. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks AMISOM-Uganda bases in an around Baraawe, including in Ambareso village. Any causalities were left unreported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab attack an AMISOM-Uganda convoy in Bulo Mareer, no causalities reported.

Supporters of two convicted men attacked the prison in Belet Weyn on 08/12. During the armed clash between prison guards and the supporters of the detainees, the two men managed to escape. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM/ENDF troops moved through Belet Weyn in the morning of 08/12 and travelled to Ceel Cali (65km SW of Belet Weyn) where they set up a new base.

column7: ISIL: Islamic State of Iraq and Levant
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters (suspected ISIL faction) attacked Bulla Barwaaqo Check point (5km NW of Dhoobley) in the evening of 08/12. The attackers take over the village and torched down a house belonging to the chairman of the settlement and left after about 30 minutes. Further reports from the locals indicate that there was large numbers of al Shabaab fighters movement in the area along the border. No causalities reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM forces based in Ceelasha (12km E of Afgooye District) in the night of 09/12. The fighting lasted for about thirty minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties unknown.

Militants loyal to ISIL overtake the Lower Juba town of Tuulo Barwaqo, over 120 kms northwest of Kismayu. The militants insisted that they were IS loyalists who had replaced the Jubaland authority in the area. Jubaland militia had withdrawn the village earlier.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Geed Jacayl neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the afternoon of 09/12 over unknown reasons. A civilian bystander was reported killed in the shooting while casualties from the warring sides could not be established.

Pro-ISIS faction has taken over Biliq Maro and Dhey Tubaako (22km NE & 18km SE of Jilib) respectively in the afternoon of 10/12 without resistance from al Shabaab fighters in the villages. Reports indicate that the same fighters have taken over six smaller villages in Jilib district, though it did not provide dates and locations.

A small group of ISWA security forces conducted a security operation outside Diinsoor and attacked an al Shabaab base in Tuur Wailun (30 KM SE of Diinsoor on the 10/12. The ISWA forces managed to defeat the heavily armed al Shabaab forces and took over the village from al Shabaab who retreated. The forces erected a check-point at the outskirt of the village for tax collection. Al Shabaab fighters retaliated back and attacked the checkpoint. Four ISWA soldiers were killed while another one injured. Casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established while al Shabaab reportedly seized one PKM and 3 AK 47 from the deceased soldiers.

Pro-ISIS faction has taken over Biliq Maro and Dhey Tubaako (22km NE & 18km SE of Jilib) respectively in the afternoon of 10/12 without resistance from al Shabaab fighters in the villages. Reports indicate that the same fighters have taken over six smaller villages in Jilib district, though it did not provide dates and locations.

Pro-ISIS faction has taken over Biliq Maro and Dhey Tubaako (22km NE & 18km SE of Jilib) respectively in the afternoon of 10/12 without resistance from al Shabaab fighters in the villages. Reports indicate that the same fighters have taken over six smaller villages in Jilib district, though it did not provide dates and locations.

Dhulbahante clan militias with two battle wagons reportedly attacked pastoralist from Habar Jeclo/Soolomadaw sub-clan in the vicinity of Qocondhaale near Horufadhi Village (39km N of Buuhoodle) in the evening of 10/12. The motive of the attack remains unclear but is believed to be related to previous revenge killing, especially the killing of an elderly man from Dhulbahante/Reer Hagar sub-clan. The two sides exchanged fire before both sides withdrew without any intervention. One Habar Jeclo man was killed in the clash.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against a checkpoint manned by SNG soldiers in Cumar-Beere Village (9km NW of Afgooye District) in the morning of 10/12. Both sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters were repulse back by the SNG forces at the checkpoint. Casualties could not be established.

A magnetic IED attached to a vehicle detonated in the vicinity of Makah Al-Mukarama Hotel (Hodan District) in the morning of 10/12. A NISA officer was reportedly driving the vehicle when the incident happened. The driver was injured in the blast.

Al Shabaab forces launched an attack on government forces in Diinsoor on the morning of 10/12. Nine reported soldier deaths, al Shabaab causalities not reported or known. In the following days al Shabaab publicly displayed the bodies of the dead in area.

Residents of New Hargeisa neighbourhood (Hargeisa) staged a demonstration against Hargeisa deputy mayor and accused him of selling an old cemetery in the neighbourhood on 11/12. The protesters blocked vehicles and workers trying to develop the cemetery. Police arrived and ordered the workers and the vehicles to leave the area immediately. Police also dispersed the protestors.

Report indicates al Shabaab fighters shot and injured two civilians in their home in Burdhuxunle Village in the night of 11/12. SNG forces conducting security operation forced man who was known to be health nurse to come out from his house to do medical care for the two civilians shot by the al Shabaab before they died. The nurse ignored the instructions given by the soldiers and the SNG soldiers killed him on the spot. The motive behind the murder of the two civilians is not known.

Resident community report that SNG forced carried out attack against al Shabaab in Ceel Cilaan Village (45km NW of Diinsoor) in the morning of 11/12. Report indicates that unconfirmed number of casualties from both sides.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a SNG military Base in the out skirts of Gariley Village (in the outskirts of Baardheere) in the mid night of 11/12. Reports indicate that the fighting broke out after al Shabaab fighters carried out military offensive agains

Suspected al Shabaab fighter shot and killed a Sheekhal (possibly pro-ISIL) man in Galshekh Abikar (approx. 35km NE of Jilib) in the afternoon of 11/12. It is not cleat whether the victim was killed by al Shabaab for being pro-ISIL or if there was another motive behind it.

The head guard for an INGO and his associate, a military commander, were assassinated in a restaurant located in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood in the afternoon of 11/12. The victims were shot by two unknown attackers carrying pistols. The perpetrators escaped afterwards. A third person, the NGO staffers son, was also shot and remains in critical conditions. The motive of the attack remains unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A group of Jubaland forces demanded transport from a truck driver to Kismaayo town at Dhagax Jabinta along the old airport road in the morning of 11/12. The truck driver refused their demand and one of the soldiers shot and killed the driver. No arrest was reported in relation to the killing.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column9: ISIL: Islamic State of Iraq and Levant
column17: Jubaland forces reclaim Bulla Barwaaqo from al Shabaab-ISIL fighters after it had been taken by the latter on 08/12. No reported causalities - it is not clear if there was any violence.

A group of local people from Dhulbahante - believed to be pro-Khatumo - reportedly set fire on an fuel tanker belonging to a local trader from Habar-Jeclo in the vicinity of Higlo-Fiqi village (40km E of Laas Caanood) on 12/12. The motive behind the incident is currently unclear however, it believed to be related to the current tensions regarding the ongoing oil explorations in Sool region.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces based in Jowhar airstrip reportedly fired several mortar rounds against IDP camp in the outskirt of Jowhar in the night 12/12. The motive behind the shelling is not known. Three people were injured from the explosions.

About thirty gunmen belonging to Habar-Jeclo/Soolamadaw sub-clan reportedly opened fire against a Truck belonging to Dhulbahante/Reer Hagar sub-clan in the vicinity of Horufadhi area (39km N of Buuhoodle) in the evening of 12/12. Reports indicate that about six gunmen who were onboard of the truck opened fire in response while the vehicle speed off and manage to escape. The incident was reportedly in revenge of the killing of Habar-Jeclo man by Dhulbahante militias. The shootout triggered tensions and the two sub-clans were reportedly mobilizing their militias for possible revenge killings. No casualties were reported.

Two armed militias hailing from Habar Gidir and Biimaal fought in Buulo Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 12/12. The fighting was stopping and resuming throughout the day. At least four people were killed and more than that number got injured.
Habar Gidir/Saad militia reportedly shot and killed an elderly man from Majeerten/Umar Mohamud in Tuulocad Village (10km E of Galkacyo) in the morning of 12/12. The motive is unknown.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a CID Officer in the vicinity of Aargada (Wadajir District) in the morning of 12/12. The victim was heading to his duty when the incident happened. Perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces outpost in Ceymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 12/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a government intelligence officer in Shibis District on 12/12.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF and al Shabaab forces clash during the evening hours in Baardheere. Al Shabaab propaganda stated ENDF ""suffered greatly.""

Clan militias hailing from Gaaljecel and Jajeele clashed in the vicinity of Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the morning of 13/12. The fighting was heavy and both sides exchanged different types of gunfire. More than 10 people were killed during the clash and more than 20 people got injured. The motive behind the renewed clashes is not known.

The fighting between the Habar Gidir and Biimaal clan militias resumed on the second day in Marka and its outskirts in the morning of 13/12. Both sides had been exchanging gunfire inside the town and also in the vicinity of Buufow Bacad. The casualties for todays clashes are yet to be disclosed, though some are believed. SNG did not comment on these fresh clashes between the two clan militias.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against a group of SNG soldiers manning an illegal checkpoint near Bariire (27 KM SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 13/12. Al Shabaab attackers later took over the checkpoint but retreated after some time. No casualties were reported.

The clashes between Galjecel and Jejeele militias renewed in Hawl-wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the morning of 14/12. Both sides are exchanging different types of gunfire. Hiraan clan elders appealed to SNG to intervene the situation. The fighting entered its second day in Beled Weyne town despite the presence of AMISOM forces (ENDF/Djiboutian contingent) in the town. More than five people including civilians were killed and more than that number was injured in the clash.

A RCIED was targeted at SNA military pick-up in Baraawe town in the afternoon of 14/12. The device exploded after the vehicle passed the point where it had been planted. The SNA personnel opened gunfire after the blast. No casualties were reported.
IED attack against KDF near Beled Xaawo (14/12). The device was planted by al Shabaab. Causalities not known or reported.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a police woman in the vicinity of Liido (Cabdi Casiiss District) in the night of 14/12. Perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed two civilians in drive by shooting in the vicinity of Siigaale neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 14/12. One of the victims was working for a UN agency while the other was an INGO worker. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. Perpetrators escaped.

Two clan militias from Galjecel and Jejeele exchanged gunfire briefly in the vicinity of Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the afternoon of 15/12 despite efforts of the local clan elders to stop the fighting. Casualties from the two warring sides are currently unknown. A total of fifteen had been counted over three days with 10 casualties on the 13th and 5 on the the 15th.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG Forces defensive positions outside Afgooye town in the evening of 15/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF took over control of Dhusamareeb airport in the early morning of 15/12. The motive behind the new deployment and take-over is not clear but sources report that Galmudug administration is likely to shift to Dhusamareeb town in the coming two weeks. Dhusamareeb is now under the control of ASWJ militia but Ethiopians are brokering Galmudug-ASWJ talks which might lead to Galmudug-ASWJ integration.

A nomadic man hailing from Majerteen/Isse Mohamud sub-clan stabbed and injured a nomadic man from Dhulbahante/Nuur Ahmed sub-clan in the outskirts of Garowe on 15/12. Police arrested the perpetrator while the victim was admitted to Garowe hospital. Reports indicate that Dhulbahante pastoralists take-away with camels belonging to the perpetrator after his arrest.

A clan militiaman shot and killed a high ranking SNG soldier in the vicinity of Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the morning of 16/12. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear. The victim was at the frontline involving deployment of government forces to separate fighting clan militias when the incident happened. The perpetrator was arrested.

A RCIED targeted against SNA pickup near Afgooye town in the morning of 16/12. The forces open fire in to different direction in response to the attack. Six soldiers were injured while the vehicle was destroyed.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a group of SNA soldiers near Bariire (27km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 16/12. No casualties were reported.

More than hundreds of residents of Xudun reportedly staged peaceful demonstration on 16/12 in protest against oil exploration companies in the region. The angry protestors marched in the streets of Xudun chanting anti-oil exploration companies slogans. The rally ended peacefully.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Muse Boqor mosque (Waaberi District) in the evening of 16/12. Some of the reports indicate that the victim was a former al Shabaab defector. Perpetrators escaped.

An armed clash reportedly erupted between Somaliland army and Dhulbahante clan militias loyal to Khatumo administration in Godaalo near Arooley Village (44km SW of Taleex) on 17/12. The Dhulbahante militia are opposed to oil exploration being conducted by a foreign company authorized by Somaliland Government. The two sides reportedly exchanged both light and heavy gunfire after which the militias withdrew. Slight injuries of combatants were reported.
Unidentified attacker(s) threw a hand grenade at NISA forces in Beyturaas neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 17/12. No casualties were reported. Perpetrator(s) escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked Darawish base in Galgala Mountain using mortars on the evening of 17/12. The two sides also exchanged fire. There no reports of casualties.

Hundreds of people a staged a demonstration in Garowe in protested against return to 4.5 power-sharing formula for the 2016 elections. The demonstrators were shouting slogans against the 4.5 system. Similar demonstrations were held in Galkacyo and Burtinle towns.

Gunmen from Majeerten/Issa Mohamud carjacked a lorry belonging to Majeerten/Omar Mohamud in Dangoroyo Village (110km NE of Garowe) in the night of 18/12. The gunmen fired shot in the air during the carjacking. They took the vehicle to the direction of Eyl (221km NE of Garowe). The motive is said to be linking to the previous dismissal of PIA (Puntland Intelligence Agecny) director and the government because his sub-clan believes that his sacking was political.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in Gol-Weyn town (22km W of Marka) in the afternoon of 18/12. The explosion was followed by armed confrontation between the AMISOM forces and al Shabaab attackers. The exchange of gunfire lasted for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. AMISOM forces in Gol-Weyn later opened gunfire against a public mini-bus which was moving along the road and killed five passengers on spot in retaliation for the attack.

Hundreds of people a staged a demonstration in Garowe in protested against return to 4.5 power-sharing formula for the 2016 elections. The demonstrators were shouting slogans against the 4.5 system. Similar demonstrations were held in Galkacyo and Burtinle towns.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in Gol-Weyn town (22km W of Marka) in the afternoon of 18/12. The explosion was followed by armed confrontation between the AMISOM forces and al Shabaab attackers. The exchange of gunfire lasted for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. AMISOM forces in Gol-Weyn later opened gunfire against a public mini-bus which was moving along the road and killed five passengers on spot in retaliation for the attack.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of police officers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Awbaale neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 18/12. The police conducted a security operation in the afternoon and arrested many suspects. One policeman was injured in the explosion.

Gunmen hailing from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud carjacked two lorries belonging to Majeerten/Isse Mohamud in the vicinity of Burtinle on 18/12. The carjacking was in revenge of lorry seized by Isse Mohamud in Dangoroyo Village.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack an AMISOM-ENDF convoy on the outskirts of Beled Weyne on 18/12. The attack began with a landmine explosion, which hit an armoured vehicle carrying Ethiopian soldiers. It is confirmed that the explosion has completely destroyed the vehicle on the spot. ""Death and injuries"" reported, no numbers provided.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed four SNGF soldiers who left their base in Baardheere for unknown reason and were travelling to Garbarhaarey in Faan Weyn (48km SE of Garbarhaarey) on the 19/12. Two soldiers were killed in the ambush while the other two managed to escape in the bush.

A Somaliland soldier shot at passengers in a Toyota Noah at the southern checkpoint in Laas Caanood on 19/12. Reports indicate that the incident happened after the passengers, who were mostly youths, refused to alight to be searched and had an argument with the soldier. The soldier was arrested. The passengers were also arrested but later released. A bystander was injured in the shooting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Police Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Disgruntled Jubaland (JL) soldiers from Ogaden/Awulyan sub-clan attacked JL police commissioner in his office in Farjano neighbourhood in Kismaayo on 19/12. One of his body-guard was killed during the attack while the commissioner escaped unhurt. The motive of the attack is said to be connected in the alleged killing of another JL soldier by the police commissioner over a land dispute on 03/12. The commissioner was briefly detained over this incident but later released by the JL president. JL forces imposed a curfew on the town after the attack from 19:00 up to 06:00.

Gunmen opened gunfire against Galgaduud Regional Governor Hussein Ali Wehliye (Cirfo) in drive by shooting in the vicinity of Shaqaalaha (Hodan District) on 19/12 afternoon. The identity of the attacker is not yet known although the governor condemned al Shabaab elements to be behind the attack. Some sources also linked the attack to clan revenge.

Unidentified sniper shot and killed a police officer inside Hawl-Wadaag District Police Station in the morning of 19/12. The police conducted security operation after the incident and arrested a number of suspects.

VBIED exploded in front of Al-Kowthar Supermarket (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 19/12. The target of the attack is not yet known but the vehicle was parked along Maka Al Mukarama road where Somali Government officials frequently use. At least three people were killed and twenty others got injured in the blast. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.

At least four people were killed and nine wounded on 19/12 in a gun attack on a government official in Somalias capital Mogadishu that was followed shortly afterwards by a car bombing. Witnesses said gunmen opened fire on a senior government official on a road leading to the presidential palace, injuring him and sparking a gun battle with his security guards. Though no group was claimed responsibility, al Shabaab are suspected as the perpetrator.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unknown perpetrators hurled a hand grenade against AMISOM base in Sarta Minashibiyo in Marka on 20/12. The device exploded but no casualties were reported and perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against AMISOM/SNGF base in Buur Dhuxunle (33km SE of Rabdhure) early morning of 20/12. Al Shabaab was firing small arms against the position and immediately retreated. AMISOM/SNGF did not respond. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNGF convoy travelling outside Qoryole (18km SE of Jalalaqsi) in the morning of 20/12. Al Shabaab hit the convoy but immediately withdrew into the bush. Two SNGF were killed.
Unknown perpetrators hurled a hand grenade against SNGF on foot patrol near the market in Awbaale neighbourhood on 20/12. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab attack AMISOM-Djibouti forces on Jalalaqsi on 20/12, killing three.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit-and-run attack against NISA soldiers in Sarta Qabyada (Yaaqshiid) on 21/12. After ten minutes of exchange of gunfire, the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unknown man armed with pistols shot and killed a man working for the Somalia Central Bank in Medina Hospital neighbourhood (Wadajir District) on 21/12. The motive is unknown and perpetrators managed to escape.

A Somali man from the diaspora was shot and killed in a drive-by shooting in Carwo Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) by unknown assailants in the afternoon of 21/12. Some reports indicate that the victim was working for NISA but NISA did not admit the claims. The motive of the assassination is unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNA checkpoint in the vicinity of Cumar-Beere Village (9km NW of Afgooye) in the evening of 21/12. The fighting lasted less than ten minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab kidnaps a man from Harin clan on the evening on 21/12. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters beheaded him and placed his head back in front of his house. SNFG conducted a security operation early in the morning searching for the perpetrators. A man suspected to be an al Shabaab fighter and who hails from Asharaf Clan was killed by SNGF.

Two groups of ISWA soldiers engaged in a shootout in Berdale neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the evening of 21/12 after two soldiers tried to take the gun of a fellow soldier by force for unknown reasons. Three soldiers were injured in the shooting and were admitted to Baidoa hospital for treatments. Security forces immediately reached the area after the incident but no arrests were reported.

A group of SNG soldiers launched an attack against al Shabaab checkpoint near Aw Dheegle (36km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 21/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Seven causalities (Radio Mustaqbal).

Al Shabaab kidnaps a man from Harin clan on the evening on 21/12. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters beheaded him and placed his head back in front of his house. SNFG conducted a security operation early in the morning searching for the perpetrators. A man suspected to be an al Shabaab fighter and who hails from Asharaf Clan was killed by SNGF.

SNA forces conducted a security operation in Ruusiya neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 21/12. A hand grenade was targeted against SNA personnel during the operation by unidentified attackers. A number of suspects were arrested in the operation.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a woman in the outskirts of Buur Dhuxunley Village (34km SE of Rabdhure) in the evening of 21/12. The woman is said to have been married to a SNG soldier based in Buur Dhuxunley and left for a few days to visit her relatives. Her body was found in the outskirts of the village by her family members. The motive of the killing is currently unknown.

A woman, hailing from Asharaf sub-clan was killed in her house by unknown perpetrators in Goof-Gadud Village (29km NW of Baidoa) on 21/12. The motive is unknown but reports state that she had links with SNGF.

SNG soldier killed a woman who hails from Asharaf Clan during a security operation in Goof Gaduud Burey Haraw Village (Baidoa District) on the morning of 21/12. Report Indicate that the soldiers accused her that her son was among one of the perpetrators that beheaded a man and woman in Goof Gaduud in the night of 21/12.
Government forces overtake several al Shabaab-controlled villages near Awdheegle, killing five. The names of the villages are not known or their names were not released.
Government forces clash with al Shabaab at Buulodeey location, Diinsoor district on 22/12. Five reported al Shabaab dead.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Local media reported that there was an airstrike against al Shabaab fighters in Shanta America (Kurtunwarey District) in the early morning of 22/12. The attack was probably conducted by drones (likely United States origin). It is believed that top al Shabaab officials were targeted in the attack. Later reports indicate a top commander (""Ubaidah"") was killed in the strike, along with four others.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against a group of SNA personnel on foot patrol in the vicinity of Beyturaas neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 22/12. The SNA soldiers shot and killed a man in the neighbourhood whom they accused of being the perpetrator of the attack.

A brief armed clash erupted between newly trained SNGF and a local police officer after the SNGF ordered the police man to put down his weapon. The soldiers took his gun and no casualties were reported. After negotiation, the gun was returned to the police officer.

Two armed clan militias (both unidentified) fought over a land ownership dispute near the western checkpoint (Garowe) in the morning of 22/12. Security forces intervened and arrested all the militias from the two sides. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a local businessman in Sheekh Abrone neighbourhood (Marka) in the night of 22/12. The motive of the killing is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade against the residence of Lower Shabelle deputy governor, Ali Nuurre, in the night of 22/12. No casualties were reported and the perpetrator(s) escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeting AMISOM convoy exploded in Caymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 22/12. AMISOM forces opened fire and sealed off the area in response to the blast. The explosion damaged one vehicle but casualties are currently unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan aircraft bomb al Shabaab location at Beexaani, outside of Kismayo. Seven civilians were believed to be killed unintentionally by the strike. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

Property destruction: Four men from Habar Jeclo/Basanbur sub-clan set fire on a farm belonging to a man from Habar Jeclo/Biciido sub-clan in the vicinity of Bixin (30km NW of Ceel-Afweyn) on 23/12 over farms ownership dispute. The perpetrators escaped but their clan elders and Ceel-Afwayn police are pursuing them in the mountains near Bixin.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces in Marka Town fired artillery and mortars to Janaale and Ceel Haji in the night of 23/12. No casualties were reported. Related, AMISOM forces left Ceel Haji in the morning of 23/12 and al Shabaab fighters occupied it in the afternoon.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces in Marka Town fired artillery and mortars to Janaale and Ceel Haji in the night of 23/12. No casualties were reported. Related, AMISOM forces left Ceel Haji in the morning of 23/12 and al Shabaab fighters occupied it in the afternoon.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces in Marka Town fired artillery and mortars to Janaale and Ceel Haji in the night of 23/12. No casualties were reported. Related, AMISOM forces left Ceel Haji in the morning of 23/12 and al Shabaab fighters occupied it in the afternoon.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked ISWA force position near in animal market in Berdale neighbourhood on 23/12. Attackers fired small arms fire combined with RPG and briefly engaged with ISWA forces at their base. Attackers retreated and no casualties were reported.
Two groups of SNG forces exchanges gunfire in Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) on 23/12. No reported causalities.
ISIL (those formally loyal to al Shabaab) and al Shabaab clash in the Galgala area, exchanging fire late into the night. The extent of casualties caused by the fighting is not known.

Media reported that al Shabaab court has publicly executed two men in Bariire (27km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 23/12. The judge stated that one of the executed men was SNG chief in Mareerey while the other one was SNA soldier.

ISWA soldier shot and killed a teenage boy and injured another one in Barxada neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the morning of 23/12. The teenagers were walking behind the soldier who opened fire after becoming suspicious of them. The victim died on the spot while the injured boy was rushed to Baidoa hospital for treatments. The soldier escaped.

Hundreds of people including women and children staged demonstrations in front of town hall where the president was meeting local clan elders in Beled Weyne on 23/12 to convince them accept his recent circular which stipulated, inter alia, regional state formation conference venue to be Jowhar town. During the demonstrations, the protesters burnt tyres and chanted slogans against presidents proposal, such as No to Jowhar, No to bribe givers/takers and others. Security forces later dispersed them by firing shots in the air. No casualties resulting from the demos were reported.
The residence of a government official is attacked with hand grenades during the evening hours. No loss of life or mention of casualties.
Al Shabaab and those loyal to ISIL clash in Timirshe on 24/12. Three ISIL fighters were reportedly killed while unspecified numbers of others were injured.

A man hailing from Xawadle, Ali Madaxweyne sub-clan and a member of ASWJ was shot and killed by a local militia man Habar-Gidir/Ayr, Habar Iji sub-clan) in Matabaan on 24/12. The motive behind the killing is said to be clan revenge for the killing of the assailant clan-member seven years ago by the victims clan in Belet Weyn. Clan elders are negotiating to avoid further revenge killings.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a woman in Buufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the night of 25/12. The dead body with gunshots was seen in the morning of 26/12 and the motive behind the killing is unknown. Unconfirmed reports suggest that the killing is linked to clan revenge. The victim hails from Habar-Gidir clan.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AMISOM-Kenyan and Jubaland forces oust al Shabaab from Beexaani following a air strike and clash. Somali Memo disputes the claim of retreat. No reported casualties. Date of final clash not clear, though came following an air strike on 23/12 - source dated 25/12.
An unidentified gunman killed a army sergeant in Dharkeynley District on 26/12.

Gunmen hailing from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud reportedly shot and killed an elderly man from Habar-Gidir/Saad in Taarrogo area (12km W of Galkacyo) in the afternoon of 26/12. The motive of the killing is reportedly related to past clan revenges. The perpetrators escaped.
A SNG soldier shot and killed a female student in Bakara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) over unknown reasons in the morning of 26/12. No arrest was reported.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNA officer in the vicinity of Ajabka (Dharkenleey District) in the morning of 26/12. The perpetrators escaped from the scene.
Five members of al Shabaab, targeting a government official with an IED at Bakale, die with their explosive detonates prematurely.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a police station in Buur Dhuxunle (33km SE of Rabdhure) on 27/12. The attackers used RPG and smaller weapons during the assault. One police man was injured and later succumbed to his injuries while a civilian was hit by a stray bullet. The attackers withdrew.

Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces based in Qoryooley in the evening of 27/12. The fighting lasted for about one hour after which the SNG forces retreated from some parts of the town. Al Shabaab did not take over the town but they entered into the western side of the town where they stayed until the morning of 28/12. Latest information stated that al Shabaab withdrew from Qoryooley and the SNG forces are in full control of the town. At least seven combatants were confirmed dead during the fight.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters abducted three Somalia local aid-workers, working for a local NGO in Tubaake Village (15km SE of Bardheere) on 27/12. The staffers were conducting outreach nutrition program but were stopped and taken to an unknown location. The motive is unknown. However, following local elders intervention the staffers were released later and return to their base in Bardheere.
A SNG soldier shot and killed two civilians in Balcad town in the evening of 27/12. The motive behind the killing is unknown. Balcad district police confirmed the arrest of the perpetrator.

A group of people staged a protest in front of Lughaya MCH to protest against poor health services on 28/12. The protestors demanded better services from the staff after they failed to treat several cases of rattlesnake bites which caused the death of several people in the area. The demonstrators threw stones at the MCH during the protests. Police arrived and dispersed the protestors while arresting five of them.

An IED was targeted against SNGF supply vehicle in Baardheere town in the afternoon of 28/12. Five SNG soldiers were injured in the blast, two of them seriously and were later flown to Kenya for treatment.

Unidentified armed militia stormed Belet Xawo prison to free a man who was earlier arrested by the local police for being an al Shabaab suspect on 28/12. The armed militia managed to free their man without any casualties but later engaged in an armed battle with the local police who mobilized after the attack in the outskirts of the town. At least seven casualties including civilians were reported from the battle.

Police shot and killed a man in Net Fish neighbourhood in Berbera on the evening of 28/12. The motive is unknown. The police were on patrol when the incident happened. Six police officers were arrested in connection with the shooting. Local residents took to the streets in protest against the killing. Police shot in the air and dispersed the demonstrators.

Police shot and killed a man in Net Fish neighbourhood in Berbera on the evening of 28/12. The motive is unknown. The police were on patrol when the incident happened. Six police officers were arrested in connection with the shooting. Local residents took to the streets in protest against the killing. Police shot in the air and dispersed the demonstrators.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces base in the vicinity of Baar Raaxo (Hawl-Wadaag District) in evening of 28/12.The SNG soldiers opened gunfire in response to the attack. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base near the Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 28/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

SNGF, after receiving a tip about on-going Zakat collection by al Shabaab in Furule (or Doonkaxare) (approx. 18km SW of Bulo Burte) attacked al Shabaab fighters and engaged with them in an armed clash. Two al Shabaab fighters, including the Head of Zakat collection in the area were killed while SNGF lost one soldier in the battle. SNGF returned to their base in Bulo Burte.
Al Shabaab and SNGF clashed briefly in Beeray village (approx. 15km N of Bulo Burte) on 29/12. Al Shabaab fighters retreated and no casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked KDF convoy in Jungal (23km W of Baardheere) in the afternoon of 29/12. Both sides engaged in an armed clash before the attackers withdrew. First reports indicate that 2 KDF soldiers were killed while casualties on the attackers side are unknown. Later, the Shabelle Media Network reported 11 al Shabaab dead.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNA forces based outside Afgooye in the night of 29/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shaabab fighters attacked an AMISOM/SNGF base in Taraka Village (49km SW of Baardheere) in the morning of 29/12. Reports indicate that around six SNGF were killed while the casualties on the attackers side is unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters carjacked an ambulance in the outskirt of Dhusamareeb town in the night of 29/12. The carjackers also abducted the driver and another person to unknown location. Reports show that the Ambulance was contacted by some people who were pretending to be patients and asked the hospital to send an ambulance, but locals believe that this was an al Shabaab trap. The motive behind the abduction so far is unknown.

Two groups of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire in the vicinity of Jazeera (Wadajir-Medina District) in the afternoon of 29/12 over money extorted from an illegal checkpoint in the area. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a journalist in a drive by shooting in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 29/12. The journalist, Omar Faruq Osman, survived the assassination but one of his guards and a civilian bystander were injured in the shooting. The attackers escaped from the scene. No group claimed the responsibility.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: An IED of unknown origin exploded in Kulbiyow (33km SW of Badhaadhe) targeting a KDF rotation convoy on 30/12. First reports indicate that one KDF vehicle was damaged by the explosion but human casualties are expected but are not known so far. The KDF convoy was on its way to Badhaadhe.

A group of Borama residents staged demonstration against a construction of Amoud University to expand its premises on 30/12. The protestors were claiming the ownership of the land under construction. Police arrived at the scene to disperse the protestors however they belted the police with stones prompting the forces to fire warning shots at the air. No casualties were reported.

ISWA/SNG forces on security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Yabyab village (19km NE of Xudur) in the evening of 30/12. The two sides briefly exchanged gun-fire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. The ISWA/SNG forces returned to their bases. Two al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the clash.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF (or ENDF - multiple sources contradict) position in Diinsoor on 30/12. Reports indicate that the attackers fired RPG rounds fired from a distance against the SNGF position however SNGF did not responded. The attackers withdrew and no casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and run attack against an illegal checkpoint allegedly manned by SNG soldiers in Mushaani (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 30/12. No casualties were reported.

A group of armed in SNA uniforms opened gunfire against a public mini-bus in Tixsiile (21km NW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 30/12. The shooting came following an escalated dispute over money extortion. Three passengers were injured in the shooting incident.
Youths attacked a group of holding a New Years celebration with sticks and stones on 31/12. The youths injured four people and destroyed several cars. It is not clear as to the motive of the attack.

Six suspected al Shabaab members reportedly established an illegal checkpoint in Suweeto neighbourhood (Bosasso) in the early morning of 31/12. The suspected al Shabaab members tortured a civilian man near the Bosasso prison and carjacked two vehicles belonging to private companies.
Al Shabaab executed five they suspected of espionage in Saacow and the nearby location of Abdirahman Yare.
Unidentified assassins shoot and kill a Turkish national outside a mosque in Hodan District on 01/01. The reason for the targeting is not known.
In the wake of the chaos caused by two groups of warring clan militias, al Shabaab took over Buq Koosaar without a fight.

Scuffles broke out between two youth groups from Habar Yonis and Dhulbahante sub-clans in Daalo neighbourhood (Ceerigaabo) on 01/01 following a dispute over territorial control. Ceerigaabo police intervened, shot in the air and arrested 5 people from both sides.

Two clan militias from Gaal Jecel and Jajeele sub-clans clashed in the vicinity of Buq-Goosaar (50km SW of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 01/01. At least seven combatants from both sides were killed in the clash which lasted for several hours.

Al Shabaab fighters fired at least six projectiles (SPG9 OR B10) against Xalane Base (Waberi District) in the early morning of 01/01. Four of them landed in an open ground and two landed in the sea. The rounds were probably fired from Jazeera side. No injuries reported.
Al Shabaab attacked a Heliwa police station the evening of 01/01. The police officers responded, killing three of the attackers and capturing one.

Two people reportedly died, one of them the suicide bomber in an explosion that happened at a restaurant near the National Theatre in Mogadishu on 2 January. It is reported that four other people were injured in the explosion. Some of the injured work for the Somali government and the rest are civilians who were taking tea at the restaurant. There was no immediate claim of responsibility but officials will likely blame the Al-Shabaab group.

The employees of Somaliland citizenship registration demonstrated in front of the mayors office in Borama in 02/01 over unpaid salaries. The employees said that they have closed the office and will remain so until the dispute is resolved.
Unidentified gunmen have reportedly killed a civilian while driving a luxury car in Hodan District on 03/01. It is not clear if the victim was a civilian or government official.
Local militias (not identified) and al Shabaab fighters briefly clashed in Moor Eri (approx. 35km S of Maxaas) on 03/01. No casualties were reported.

Somali National Army (SNA) and local clan militia fought in Baraawe in the morning of 03/01 over unknown reasons. The fighting lasted almost one hour after which the military forces overpowered the local militia. Three combatants from the militia were confirmed dead while three SNA soldiers were injured in the fighting. The situation is calm (at the time of this report) and there is a possibility of recurrence of the clashes.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters beheaded a traditional elder in Rabdhure Town in the night of 03/01. The elder previously spoke very critical about the insecurity of the town which is created by al Shabaab.

Local media reported that two dead bodies of traders were found in the vicinity of Ceel Shiil (3km W of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 03/01. Locals confirmed that the victims were Ceel Shiil villagers. Al Shabaab are believed to be responsible (Somali Dhacdo). The two were likely targeted for regularly conducting business with SNG soldiers.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Local taxi drivers staged a massive demonstration in front of the local municipality and the main tarmac road, halting businesses and traffic movements in Garowe in the morning of 03/01. The protest came after government banned local taxis to ferry Khat sellers to and from the western checkpoint on suspicion of smuggling alcohol. Garowe police arrested some of the protestors.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and severely injured a civilian man in CC neighbourhood (Karaan District) in the evening of 03/01. The motive of the attack is unknown and perpetrators escaped.

At least one person was killed and another injured when unidentified armed assailants attacked an apartment housing Turkish nationals near Mogadishus main airport in Hamar Jabjab. The attack occurred during the nighttime hours of 04/01. Perpetrators not known.

Al Shabaab fighters clashed with SNG forces in Warmahan (31km NW of Afgooye) in the early morning of 04/01. Initial reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters overrun the town and confiscated a technical from SNGF while SNG forces retreated to Afgooye. The SNG forces reportedly suffered at least 8 fatalities and five injuries.

Ceerigaabo local government supported by the police destroyed small kiosks constructed illegally at the central grocery market in Ceerigaabo on 04/01. A group of kiosk owners attempted to stop the operations but two of them were arrested including a kiosk owner from Habar Yonis/Mohamud Hamud sub-clan who stabbed and injured one of the local government staff from Habar-Jeclo/Basan Buur sub-clan during the operations.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: A RCIED targeted AMISOM/KDF convoy heading to Afmadow on its way from Dhoobley in Hawina (approx. 90km SW of Afmadow) in the morning of 04/01. One vehicle was damaged and three KDF soldiers were injured.
Al Shabaab fighters attack SNG forces in Ceel Shiil Village (3km SW of Ceel Buur) on 04/01. No causalities reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: IED explosion targeted AMISOM/ENDF convoy in Leego (48km SE of Buur Hakaba) in the afternoon of 04/01. The explosion was followed by a brief armed clash which lasted for 30 minutes. Causalities could not be confirmed.

A group of suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF position in Carbiska settlement (5km SE of Afgooye) on 04/01. After a brief exchange of gun-fire, al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Police reports indicate that armed men from Majeerten/Dishishe sub-clan shot and killed two people and injured another over land dispute in Xange area near Dalwayn Village (83km N of Qardo) on the evening of 04/01. The victims hail from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud sub-clan and were searching for gold on the dispute land when the incident happened.The perpetrators escaped. The killing caused tension in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Puntland customs police briefly exchanged gunfire with militias from Galmudug in the vicinity of Darxumo Market (Green line) in Galkacyo in the morning of 04/01 over taxation dispute. Stray bullets reportedly killed a businessman from Dir clan and injured another civilian. No other casualties were reported and the situation is calm.

column9: Habar Jeclo-Ahmed Farah Sub-Clan Group (Somalia); Women (Somalia)
column17: Suspected Dhulbahante gunmen opened fire at a herd of camels belonging to Habarjeclo/Ahmed Farah sub-clan in the vicinity of Qocondhaale near Horufadhi Village (39km N of Buuhoodle) on 04/01. The camels were fetching water at the time of the incident. The gunmen destroyed jerry-cans and reportedly sexually assaulted a woman who was herding the camels before escaping from the area. The motive of the incident remains unknown. The incident comes one day after elders from Dhulbahante/Cigaal Naaleeye sub-clan and Habarjeclo/Ahmed Farah sub-clan reached peace agreement in Meygaagle Village.

Unidentified perpetrators driving in a SURV vehicle tried to assassinate a Turkish national outside MIA in the late hours of 04/01. SNGF and his private security guards engaged the attackers in a gun-battle before they withdrew. Initial reports indicate that one of the attackers was killed and one security guard got injured.

Two groups of SNGF briefly exchanged gunfire after one group stopped a vehicle with SNGF on security operation at Zobe junction (Hodan District) and they became suspicious of each other on 04/01. No casualties were reported.

Two unidentified perpetrators armed with pistols shot and severely injured a man in Biyo Daaga (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 04/01. The motive is unknown but reports suggest that the victim was working with the government forces. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Following the capture of War Maxan by al Shabaab forces, government forces were able to recapture the village later the same afternoon. Additional casualties not known.

A device believed to be an UXO exploded in the vicinity of Bali Busle Village (145km S of Laas- Qoray) on 05/01, killing two boys and seriously injuring another. The boys were brothers and hail from Warsangeli sub-clan. The victims were herding goats when the incident happened. The device is believed to have been planted in the area during the civil war era.

Traders protested against new taxes imposed by Puntland government on imported goods at the port of Bosasso in the morning of 05/01. The traders refused to collect their goods from the port as result of the new tax tariff.

SNGF attacked Aw Misigey (approx. 23km NE of Buur-Hakaba). They were supported by helicopters departing from Wanla Weyn District in Lower Shabelle. First reports indicate that sixteen al Shabaab fighters including their commander were killed and one managed to escape.

A group of gunmen from Mareehan/Wagardhac sub-clan reportedly opened fire and carjacked a Toyota Mark II (2) car belonging to Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud sub-clan in the vicinity of Garsoor neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) in the evening of 05/01.
Unknown perpetrators hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces on foot patrol on 05/01. The grenade landed at an empty space and exploded causing no casualties. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Suspected al Shabaab fighter attacked a SNGF base located near Ivo S Company on 05/01. Both sides exchanged gun fire before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: A powerful explosion hit a Kenyan convoy passing the road linking Dhooblay district and Taabto area in Lower Jubba. The blast killed a Kenyan commander and about 10 of his escorts, and forced the convoy to be stranded at the scene of the attack for several hours.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM-Somali forces overtake Towfiq village near the central town of Galad during a military offensive in the area. Causalities, if any, were left unreported.
Somali forces have killed ""several"" Al-Shabab fighters in fighting against the group in southwestern Somalia town of Buurhakaba. No reported soldier dead.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a SNG soldier in Buulo Mareer Village (27 KM SW of Marka) on 06/01. Other SNGF who were rushing to the scene opened fire killing two civilian by-standers, presumably without intention. Perpetrators managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Goof Gaduud Village (30km NW of Baidoa) on 06/01. Four soldiers were killed and four others were injured. Three civilians were also injured in the clash.

SNG police attacked two SNGF who set up an illegal check-point at Jambaluul (6km NE of Afgooye) on 06/01. The forces arrested the two soldiers, manning the illegal check-point and no casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a house in Beled Xawo where SNG police were staying on 06/01. Causalities, injuries no reported.

Two groups of SNGF clashed in Zona K neighbourhood on 06/01. One Group was forcefully on eviction and demolishing operation but was engaged by the other SNGF group who inhabit the area. Two civilians were killed and the two groups were mediated by AMISOM/SNGF.

Two groups of suspected al Shabaab fighters carried out coordinated attacks on SNGP and NISA troops position in Biyo Degaanka and Abdiwayel Cinema neighbourhoods on 06/01. No casualties were reported and attackers withdrew.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a NISA outpost in Caymiska neighbourhood on 06/01. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire that lasted for around 15 minutes before attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Suspected al Shabaab execute a 90-year-old man in Rab Dhuure district (exact location not known) on 06/01. The killing caused area SNG forces to respond, killing four of the suspected responsible.
Suspected al Shabaab execute a 90-year-old man in Rab Dhuure district on 06/01. The killing caused area SNG forces to respond, killing four of the suspected responsible.
A former al Shabaab commander, who defected in 2015, is shot and killed on 06/01 in Berdera by suspected al Shabaab.

An IED exploded in Haween Village (18km NW of Baidoa) targeting a lorry deploying troops from Baidoa town to Goof Gaduud Burey Village in the morning of 07/01. The IED explosion injured eleven soldiers who are now receiving medical assistance in Baidoa Hospital.

Al Shabaab fighters targeted an ISWA reinforcement convoy with an IED near Sanilow Village (25km NW of Baidoa) on 07/01. Immediately after the explosion an armed clash between ISWA and al Shabaab fighters erupted. Two ISWA soldiers were killed and four others were injured. Casualties on al Shabaab side are not known.

Unknown perpetrators launched a mortar attack from an unknown location targeting most likely Villa Somalia on 07/01. First reports indicate that all rounds fell in civilian neighbourhoods killing two people. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab detonate a roadside bomb targeting a AMISOM convoy in the Shalaamboot region. The explosion caused damage to the vehicle.

Hundreds of Galkacyo (South) residents staged in a peaceful demonstration against the Speaker of the Somali parliament following his visit to Dhusamareeb in the morning of 08/01. The speaker together with other parliamentarians visited Dhusamareeb on 06/01 to meet with leaders of ASWJ on a peace mission to de-escalate the political tension with Galmudug State. The protest took place in Gaalkacyo.

Unidentified attackers armed with knives and other crude weapons reportedly assaulted a freelance journalist in Buuhoodle on 08/01. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. The perpetrators escape while the victim was later admitted to Manhal Hospital in Laas Caanood.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A group of Bossaso residents hailing from Majerteen/Dashiishe sub-clan staged a demonstration in Bossaso in the morning of 08/01 in protest against Puntland presidents speech accusing him of siding with their opponent (Osman Mohamud). The presidents speech was calling for peaceful coexistence between the two sub-clan following a land dispute. The protest turned to violent while police at the scene responded with live bullets. One person was killed while another two others were injured.

At least 12 people were killed and 25 others were wounded in a battle between al Shabaab fighters against Somali government troops and South West Administration forces in the village of Goofguduud on 08/01.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against AMISOM/KDF contingent base in Badhaadhe town on 09/01.The sides briefly clashed for about 10 minutes after the attackers withdrew. The Kenya Daily reported the SNG forces reported with gunfire, killing 19 of the attackers.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against ISWA forces based in the outskirt of Baidoa town in night of 09/01. No casualties were reported from both sides.

Two groups of farmers hailing from two sub-clans of Gadabuursi clashed using sticks and stones on 09/01 over dispute on farm irrigation in Qodax Village (22km SE of Borama. Local elders intervened and managed to separate the two groups. No casualties were reported.

Gunmen dressed in Somali military uniform have opened fire on a civilian bus in Warsheekh town of middle Shabelle region, killing one person and injuring 5 others. The reason of the attack is not known.
Al Shabaab attacks the car of an army colonel in Shibis on 10/01, killing him. The explosive was detonated remotely.

Unidentified attackers hurled simultaneously two hand grenade against SNG police based in the former Orphanage centre in Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the evening of 10/01. The perpetrators escaped. No casualties were reported.

Gunmen from Warsangeli/Reer Haji sub-clan open fire against a convoy of five lorries transporting goods from Bossaso to Ceerigaabo and Ceel-Afwayn in the vicinity of Bali Busle village (145km S of Laas-Qoray) in the night of 10/01. The attackers exchanged fire with gunmen onboard of the lorries. Reports indicate that the attacked vehicles three belongs to Habar-Jeclo while the other two belongs Warsangeli and apparently the attackers were targeting vehicles of Habar-Jeclo in a revenge for a boat belonging to the attackers sub-clan seized by Somaliland coastal guards after the forces rescued some illegal Ethiopian immigrants. Following the shootout a civilian bystander from the attackers sub-clan was injured and later succumbed to his injuries. At the time of reporting all the five vehicles were being held in Bali Busle pending investigation of who killed the deceased man while the victim of the relatives refused to bury the body until the real perpetrator is identified.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Bardheere police station in the afternoon of 10/01. The clash reportedly lasted for several hours. Reports indicate that the fighting was triggered following the murder of a former al Shabaab defector on 06/01 who was part of SNG forces in Bardheere. A soldier was killed during the fighting while unspecified number of soldiers were injured as well as a civilian.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNG position in Carbiska (5km E of Afgooye) on 10/01. No reported causalities.

Suspected magnetic IED planted in a car detonated in Manaboliyo Junction (Shibis District) in the morning of10/01. A government official was killed while another one was injured. No one has claimed the responsibility for the attack.
One soldier is dead and two others wounded when unidentified attackers hurled a pair of grenades at their location near an Afgooye orphanage.

An IED targeted a vehicle belonging to a businessman and well-known farmer in Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 11/01. The businessman was killed while two other people were injured in the explosion.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit and run attack against SNG forces Rimaygacmeed (6km SW of Afgooye) on 11/01. No causalities reported.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the principal of Al-Cayn secondary school and a lecturer of Ganane University (Sh. Mohamed Cadow Hilowle) from Rahanweyn/Geledle sub-clan and inured two of his children in Baidoa in the night of 11/01. The motive behind the killing us currently unclear. Reports indicate that the victim previously used to support al Shabaab fighters.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a prominent businessman in Afgooye on 11/01.

Hundreds of people held a demonstration in Warta Nabadda (Wardhiigleey) district, Banaadir region [Mogadishu], in support of peace in Mogadishu and the elimination of Al Shabaab. They carried placards stating their feelings.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces based in Danow village (16km NW of Marka) on 12/01.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Garowe local government supported by police officers demolished illegally constructed small kiosks along Sodanka road on 12/01. A group of kiosk owners tried to stop the operation and in the process a kiosk owner from Issa Mohamud stabbed and injured a local municipal officer from Majerteen/Biciidyahan. The police arrested seven people including the perpetrator who stabbed the officer.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AMISOM/KDF contingent attacked using artillery and mortar fire against a group of al Shabaab fighters spotted near Bula Gaduud Village (30km NE of Kismaayo) in the evening of 13/01.The attack lasted for about three hours and no casualties were reported from al Shabaab side so far.

A large number of Somaliland troops were reportedly deployed in Bali-Hadhac (62km NE of Buuhoodle) on 13/01. The motive behind the fresh deployment is currently unclear however, some reports suggest that the deployment is due to political tensions in the region and the mobilization of forming new regional state comprises of Dhulbahante and Warsangeli lands. The forces were reportedly dispatched to prevent Khatumo president of holding any meetings in Buuhoodle district. Further reports suggest that the forces proceed to Bali Cad village (51km SE of Buuhoodle) along Somalia Ethiopia border and later takeover of the village in the morning of 14/01. The village is current Khatumo headquarter, however no armed clash was reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attacked against AMISOM/KDF contingent base in Kolbiyow Village (38km SW of Badhaadhe) in the evening of 13/01.The clash lasted for about 15 minutes and both sides used light weapons before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A group of youth gangs armed with clubs reportedly assaulted and looted hawkers of Ethiopian nationals in Tuurta neighbourhood (Burco) on 13/01 for allegedly relating the Ethiopian nationals to a recent incident where a man from Ethiopia was accused of being a man-eater after he allegedly killed a young girl near Burco. Elders intervened and stopped the youth gangs from robbing the vendors.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly abducted another al Shabaab fighter in the vicinity of Idale village (56km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 13/01 while heading towards Baidoa. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters suspected the member of being spy for SNG forces.
Iranian aid agency was looted in Mogadishu by some locals on 13/01 after Somalia cut its diplomatic relations with Iran.
Somali forces shoot and kill four members of al Shabaab during a security operation in Maxaas.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces based in Ceel-Shil village (3km SW of Ceel Buur) on 14/01. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters used rocket propelled grenades and heavy machine guns which lasted for several hours however, according to media reports the attackers were repulsed back. At least nine al Shabaab fighters and a SNG soldier were killed in the clash while unspecified numbers from both sides were injured. Conflicting report: Somali Memo reported al Shabaab took over the town.

Gunmen hailing from Dir briefly exchanged gunfire with armed men collecting stones at quarry site hailing from Habar Gidir/Saad sub-clan in near Hiiraan one IDP camp in Galkacyo south on 14/01. A stray bullet reportedly killed a woman in the IDP camp.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG base in Cumar Beere (9km NW of Afgooye) on 14/01. No reported causalities. SNG forces vacated the village as result of the attack. It is not clear if al Shabaab took control of the village following the attack.

A RCIED planted on a road side exploded in front of a restaurant in Bardaale (55km NW of Baidoa) in the evening of 14/01. A SNG soldier and refugee returnee from Dadaab camp were killed while two other civilians were injured. Perpetrators not known.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Ex-control Afgooye (Dharkenleey District) in the night of 14/01. The exact reason behind the cause of the clash is currently unclear, however there are two accounts; one of the version suggest that a group of SNG forces who were base at the residential house of one of the SNG military commanders Col. Hassan Mohamed clashed within themselves while the other version suggest that a group of SNG forces attacked a SNG military base in the area where the fighting lasted for several hours. Unspecified number of soldiers were killed while several other were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A member of AMISOM kills a civilian in Golweyn for unknown reason.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a complex attack against AMISOM/KDF contingent base in Cell Cadde Village (50km SW of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 15/01. The early morning attack started with a vehicle loaded with explosive devices driven by a suicide bomber to open up the access gate while other al Shabaab fighters fought their way inside to the base. Initial information suggest that heavily armed al Shabaab fighters engaged fiercest fighting with Kenyan Defence Forces which lasted for several hours. Al Shabaab spokesman for military operation Sheikh Abdiaziz Abu-muscab, said that their fighters have captured the base and seized heavy military arsenal. According to media reports both pro-al Shabaab and independent news outlets said that Kenyan forces have suffered heavy casualties however exact numbers of casualties from both sides could not be established at the time of reporting. A month following the attack the number of Kenyan dead is believed to be between 180 - 200 (Associated Press).

An IED exploded destroying a motor-cycle and killing its driver on the airport road (18km NW of Jowhar) on 15/01. The target is not clear but is assumed to be targeting an AMISOM convoy frequently used the road, though not present at the time.

A gunman from Marehan shot and killed another man from the same clan in Cabud Waaq in the morning of 15/01. The motive is reportedly a dispute over land ownership. The perpetrator escaped and no arrest was reported.

Residents of Buuhoodle town staged anti-Somaliland rally on 16/01. The rally was aimed to express the locals support to Khatumo forces following the takeover of Balli Cad Village by Somaliland forces. The protestors matched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration led by its president. Key speakers at the rally called for attacks against Somaliland forces.

An IED targeted a KDF convoy passing in Likooley Village (96km SW of Beled Xawo) in the afternoon of 16/01. One vehicle was reportedly destroyed while villagers also reported the sound of heavy gun-fire. Casualties are unknown.

A gunman from Jejeele shot and injured a civilian man hailing from Galjecel in Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the evening of 16/01. The victim was reportedly trespassing a private farm belonging to the perpetrator. Elders of both sub-clans are trying to defuse the situation.
Al Shabaab sentenced two men to death and publicly executed them in a firing squad in Aw Dheegle Village (38km SW of Afgooye) on 16/01. The two men were accused of spying for SNG forces.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG police on foot patrol on Jamhuriya Road in the evening of 16/01. No causalities reported.
Al Shabaab attacked a group of Kenyan forces in Dhamase. Casualties of death and military equipment were reported on the Kenyan forces, specific numbers not known.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters raided a private house in Alwileh, Beled Xawo District (approx. 25km NW of Ceel Cadde), killing the owner of the house and allegedly four KDF soldiers who seek sanctuary in the house after the Ceel Cadde attack on 17/01. No other casualties were reported.
Unidentified helicopter shot and killed two herders near Xuliya Village (57km SE of Laas Qoray) on 17/01.

Armed militia from Galjeel opened fire at a private truck in Faranjibaley (approx. 5km W of Belet Weyn) and killed a man from Jejeele and injured another one. It is not clear if this incident is revenge for the shooting of a Galjeel man in a day earlier in Hawl-wadaag neighbourhood.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a mini-bus driver in Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 17/01. The motive behind the killing is reportedly a dispute over money extortion at a check point. No arrest was reported.

KDF Military reportedly killed three civilians in a grazing area called Sanoe near Ceel Cadde (60km SW of Garbahaarey in the afternoon of 17/01. Reports indicate that KDF carried out security/search operation for its soldiers taken by al Shabaab fighters and reportedly killed three nomads herding their livestock.

Unknown perpetrators shot and killed two SNG soldiers in Kuwait neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the night of 17/01. The motive is unknown and the perpetrators escaped. There are unconfirmed reports that the killers are members of a clan militia based in the area.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a NISA security outpost in the livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 17/01. No casualties were reported.

Movement of forces: Following a large scale attack and ultimate take-over of Ceel Cadde on 15/01, al Shabaab exits the city on 17/01. It is not clear if SNG or KDF forces have yet regained control of the town.

Kenya defence forces (KDF) warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab in the vicinity of Ceel Cadde (55km SW of Garbahaarey) in the morning of 18/01. Reports Indicate that the airstrikes reportedly caused civilians casualties and displacement of population. Included among the al Shabaab dead was senior leader Maalim Janow, the leader of the Abu Zubeir brigade. Exact total figures not known.

Reports indicate that an unknown warplane conducted air strikes against suspected al Shabaab position in Arabow village (47km NE of Buale) in the afternoon of 18/01. Residents reports indicate that the targeted base was destroyed but no human casualties were reported.

More than a hundred people staged an anti-Somaliland demonstration in Ceel-Buh Village (116km E of Ceerigaabo) on 18/01. The demonstrators were chanting anti-Somaliland slogans over unfulfilled developmental pledges made by Somaliland government to Warsangeli-inhabited areas.
