Unconfirmed reports indicate that anti-Somaliland politicians lobbying for the formation of regional state for Dhulbahante and Warsangeli sub-clans in Sanaag Region were behind the rally.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked an SNG forces position in Rimaygacmeed (6km SE of Afgooye) on 18/01. Attackers withdrew and no casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers shot and killed a Quranic teacher in the outskirts of Bulo Burte town in the morning of 18/01. The motive is currently unknown and the perpetrators escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces in the vicinity of Barakat Cemetery (Yaaqshiid District) in night of 18/01. The attackers withdrew and no casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab forces shot and killed four AMISOM-KDF forces found hiding in a house near Ceel Cadde. The soldiers had apparently been in hiding following the attack on the city on 15/01.

KDF forces reached Ceel Gadde again on 19/01 after the al Shabaab attack. KDF forces concentrated on search operation but no IEDs were discovered. Al Shabaab fighters left the town already two days before and no armed clash was either reported. Kenyan forces were able to overtake the town.

Two groups of ISWA forces clashed in Diinsoor in the afternoon of 19/01. The clash was triggered after Diinsoor DC and ISWA local commander exchanged undisclosed heated argument and then the DC hit the commander using his vehicle followed by shootout between their escorts. One of the body guards of the DC was injured during the exchange of gunfire while the DCs vehicle was burnt after it was hit by bullet at the fuel tank. Ethiopian forces intervened and separated the two sides.

Somaliland forces and Khatumo militia clashed in Kalabaydh Village (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the night of 19/01. The two sides used both light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. The attack was initiated by the Khatumo forces from Sahdheer (59km SW of Laas Caanood). Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED targeted AMISOM convoy on the road between Bulo Mareer and Gol-Weyn villages (28& 21km respectively) in the morning of 19/01 followed by an ambush from suspected al Shabaab fighters. AMISOM forces after a short brief of armed clash repulse the attackers. Casualties unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces based in Mushaani village (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 19/01. The attackers withdrew immediately and no casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab fighters executed an elderly man accused of being a witch-doctor in Kurtunwaarey in the afternoon of 19/01.

Kenyan fighter jets have launched airstrikes in Ceel Gaduud and Dabley [southwestern Somalia] parts of Somalia in pursuit of Al-Shabab militants who killed Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] soldiers on 15/01. Date of the strikes not known - sources dated 19/01. No reported causalities.

Kenyan fighter jets have launched airstrikes in Ceel Gaduud and Dabley [southwestern Somalia] parts of Somalia in pursuit of Al-Shabab militants who killed Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] soldiers on 15/01. Date of the strikes not known - sources dated 19/01. No reported causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked an ENDF convoy near Lanta Garaski (approx. 15km N of Waajid on 20/01. Attackers fired small arms fire against the convoy and escaped. ENDF continued with their journey to Buurdhuxunle. No reported causalities.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF defence post in Carbiska (5km SE of Afgooye) on 20/01. Attackers withdrew immediately and no casualties were reported.

Two men, first suspected to be members of Jubaland security forces were executed by firing squad east of Jilib town on 20/01. The men who hail from Ogaden sub clan were caught on their way towards Kenya boarder with no exact area mentioned. None of the Jubaland force commanders admitted that the killed men were among Jubaland forces.
Unidentified clan militia attack an al Shabaab location in Adan Yabaal, Middle Shabeelle, killing six.

A group of al Shabaab fighters launched a complex attack against Seafood and Beach View restaurants on 21/01. The attack began with a VBIED explosion at the entrance of the restaurants followed by around five attackers entering the restaurants from the beach side and firing at customers. Security guards from the restaurants engaged the al Shabaab fighters in a gun-fire exchange before NISA and Gaashaan forces arrived and took over the operation. Roughly an hour later, a second explosion (a suspected VBIED) happened outside of the restaurants but causing no casualties as the place was already cleared by NISA. Between 22:45 and 23:10, around six explosions of hand grenades were reported. Reports indicate that more than 25 people including a national UN staff and six attackers were killed and more than 50 others, including a national INGO staff were wounded.

A group of al Shabaab fighters launched a complex attack against Seafood and Beach View restaurants on 21/01. The attack began with a VBIED explosion at the entrance of the restaurants followed by around five attackers entering the restaurants from the beach side and firing at customers. Security guards from the restaurants engaged the al Shabaab fighters in a gun-fire exchange before NISA and Gaashaan forces arrived and took over the operation. Roughly an hour later, a second explosion (a suspected VBIED) happened outside of the restaurants but causing no casualties as the place was already cleared by NISA. Between 22:45 and 23:10, around six explosions of hand grenades were reported. Reports indicate that more than 25 people including a national UN staff and six attackers were killed and more than 50 others, including a national INGO staff were wounded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Two people have been killed after Al-Shabaab fighters ambushed an African Union army convoy which later resulted in heavy fighting near the southern Somalia town of Buulo Mareer.

Local militia from Xawadle sub-clan attacked an al Shabaab position in Mabaax Village (75km E of Bulo Burte) on 21/01. Reports indicate that AMISOM/SNG forces reached the village after the clash however is not known if they will remain in there. One militia and two al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash.

Locals reported that a missile hit a location outside Kananax Village (43km SE of Diinsor) on 22/01. It is not clear who and how the missile was fired as no noise of a plane was heard during the time. Casualties are unknown. The target of the shelling is not known, military or civilian.
KDF conducted an airstrike in Ceel Gaduud (48km SW of Garbarhaarey) on 22/01. Casualties were unable to confirm. The target of the strike was not articulated by the source.

Khatumo forces reportedly carried out hit-and-run attacks against Somaliland forces based in Bali Cad and Widhwidh Villages (49km N and 51km E of Buuhoodle) in the night of 22/01. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with both light and weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Khatumo forces reportedly carried out hit-and-run attacks against Somaliland forces based in Bali Cad and Widhwidh Villages (49km N and 51km E of Buuhoodle) in the night of 22/01. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with both light and weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Khatumo troops reportedly carried out hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Kalabaydh Village (30km S of Laas Caanood) in the night of 22/01. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No causalities reported.

More than a hundred Rahanweyn traders staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo on 23/01. This follows after governor of Sanaag Region gave Rahanwayn traders a seven-day ultimatum to leave Ceerigaabo. The demonstrators requested Somaliland president to intervene and give them enough time to prepare for their exit. Police dispersed the demonstrators. Reports six traders were arrested during the protest.

Residents of Buuhoodle town staged anti-Somaliland rally on 16/01. The rally was aimed to express the locals support for Khatumo forces following the takeover of Balli Cad Village by Somaliland forces. The protestors matched in the streets of Buuhoodle chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and burned the Somaliland flag. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration led by its President.

A group of Ethiopian Oromo ethnic staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Somaliland ministry of Interior in Hargeisa on 24/01 in protest against new instructions issued by Somaliland government to deport Ethiopian national, mainly Oromos. The protestors requested from the government to reconsider the instructions and review the issue case by case while also asking for more time if the government fail to honour their request. Some protestors stated that they stayed in Somaliland over 40 years and owned assets. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators.
Unknown assailants shot and killed a SNGF soldier in Bundo Weyn in the evening of 24/01. The perpetrators managed to take his AK-47 and escaped from the scene.
KDF planes launched an airstrike against [al Shabaab locations] Daar Village (31km NW of Baardheere) on 24/01. Casualties are still unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF position in Carbiska (5km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 24/01. There was a brief exchange of gun-fire before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two groups of SNG forces exchanged gun-fire in the vicinity of Ex-Control Afgooye (Dayniile Distrct) in the morning of 24/01. Reason behind the clash is said to be land dispute related between Habar-Gidir and Murusade. Both sides suffered casualties (numbers not known) while the situation is still tense.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed and attacked an ENDF convoy heading from Xudur to Tayeelow in Shiida Village (26km NE of Xudur) on 25/01. Attackers fired small arms and RPGs against the convoy but retreated immediately after ENDF/ISWA forces responded. No casualties were reported but one hut caught fire in the village after being hit by a round of RPG.

Two groups from SNG police and ISWA forces clashed near ISWA presidential palace (Baidoa) in the morning of 25/01. The clash was allegedly triggered after SNG local police commander ordered some of ISWA military personnel to be disarmed because of their absenteeism in the military barracks while the military officers ignored prompting shootout. Two soldiers were killed while another one was injured.

A group of people from southern Somalia staged a demonstration in front of the immigration office in Borama on 25/01. The group were protesting against the decision by the Somaliland government to expel all non-citizens. The protestors appealed to the government to reconsider its deportation decree. Police dispersed them and arrested five of them after they refused to leave the area.
Armed gunmen shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Wajir neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 25/01. The motive is believed to be clan revenge. The victim hails from Biimaal clan.

Al Shabaab fighters destroyed a donkey cart heading to Burdhuxunle in Lanta Garaski (15km N of Wajiid) on 25/01. The owner was badly beaten and warned against transporting goods to ENDF/SNGF. At the time of the incidents, the donkey was not carrying goods.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a brief hit and run attack against NISA troops in Biyo Degaanka on 25/01. Attackers withdrew immediately and no casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces leave Baadhaade on 26/01; al Shabaab quickly fills the void.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: KDF helicopters bombed a grazing area approximately 20km NE of Hoosingow (Badhaadhe District) in the afternoon of 26/01. The area is inhabited by pastoralists and casualties are unknown. The specific target of the KDF is not known.

A gunman hailing from Habar-Yunis/Ali Saciid sub-clan shot and killed a SPU officer in Burco in the afternoon of 26/01. The incident happened after a group of police officers including the victim went to stop a construction of a disputed plot of land. The perpetrator who claims the ownership of the disputed land was later arrested by the police.

Reports indicate that KDF troops withdrew from Ceel-Cadde Village (55km SW of Garbarhaarey) shortly after mid night on 26/01. Al Shabaab fighters took over the control of the town without any clash. The motive behind the withdrawal of KDF military is no clearly known, but thought to be military strategy.

Somaliland army pulled out of Bali Cad Village (51km E of Buuhoodle) and established temporary base in the areas of Bali Hadhac (62km NE of Buuhoodle) on 26/01 for an undisclosed reason. The forces were initially part of the troops that recently took over the control of the village from Khatumo administration.

Al Shabaab fighter ambushed a KDF convoy, travelling from Ceel Cadde to Likooley on 26/01. The attack was opened with an IED explosion and followed by an exchange of gun-fire. Unconfirmed reports indicate that two KDF vehicles were destroyed and the District Commissioner of Ceel Cadde, travelling with the convoy was seriously injured. Further reports indicate that the KDF convoy had to remain at the targeted place and did not arrive in Dhamase as expected.
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF convoy near Likooley (95km SW of Belet Xawo) on 26/01. The ambush reportedly started with an IED explosion before the attackers moved in. No reported casualties.
SNG forces conducted a security operation in Safarnooleys Village (51km SE of Luuq) on 26/01. The forces captured a suspected al Shabaab fighter and beheaded him. No other casualties were reported.

A gunman from Dashiishe shot and injured another man from Issa Mohamud in Tuurjaale neighbourhood (Bossaso) in the evening of 26/01. Reports indicate that the shooting followed after the perpetrator and the victim had physically assaulted each other for undisclosed reasons. The perpetrator escaped while the victim was taken to hospital.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces on foot patrol near Biyo Degeenka (Hodan District) in the night of 26/01. No causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against AMISOM (Burundians) base inside Kabka compound (Hodan District) in the evening of 26/01. The AMISOM forces responded with gunfire after the attack. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a businessman in the medical section of Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 26/01. The motive behind the killing is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.
Kenyan forces kill an al Shabaab ""commissioner"" in the Likooleey area of Ceel Cadde. The commissioner may have been in the custody of the Kenyan military at the time of this death.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: An IED hit a KDF convoy in Kolbiyow (33km SW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 27/01. Initial reports indicate that one KDF was killed and nine others wounded while one APC was damaged. Helicopters from Kismaayo are said to have flown to the area to medevac the injured soldiers to Dhobley.

Local residents of Maydh (50km N of Ceerigaabo) held a peaceful demonstration on 27/01 in protest against the director of health in the region from Warsangeli. The protestors accused the director of diverting all health facilities to eastern Sanaag where his clan dominates and they called government to intervene the matter.

Gunmen reportedly hailing from Dhulbahante shot and killed a driver of a vehicle transporting khat in the outskirts of Hoosingo (97km NW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 27/01. The victim hail from Sheekhal clan and the incident was reportedly related to previous revenge killings.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland intelligence forces shot and injured a poet from Darood/Ogaden sub-clan in Aargo - Fanoole Neighbourhood of Kismaayo in the morning of 27/01. The man was reportedly shot after ignoring a stop order form the forces during an ongoing security operation. He was hospitalized locally and later medevaced to Mogadishu.

A magnetic IED attached to a vehicle exploded in the vicinity of Mogadishu Cinema (Wadajir/Medina District) in the afternoon of 27/01. The vehicle belonged to one of the military officers who was not in the car when the incident happened. Two civilian bystanders were slightly injured in the blast.
An anti-al Shabaab protest is held in Abdul-Aziz 28/01. The protest was a direct response to an attack on a Liido beach restaurant.

Dir clan militias attacked Xawadle forces in Deefow (29km NW of Belet Weyn) on 28/01. At least 1 Xawadle militiaman was killed and another one was injured. Casualties from Dir side are unknown. Both militias were concentrating in the vicinity of Deefoow and tensions remained high. Lieu police is also at the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AMISOM/KDF reportedly withdrew from their base in Bula Gudud (32km NE of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 28/01. Reports indicate that the KDF forces moved to Kismaayo and so far this is the third base Kenya forces vacated. Further reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters immediately moved in to the village.

A group of al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Abiikarow (13km NW of Marka) in the morning of 28/01. The soldier and another civilian man were driving a motorbike when the incident happened. The SNG soldier was killed and the civilian was injured in the ambush.
Garowe residents staged a peaceful demonstration against 4.5 formula in Barhada square in the morning of 28/01.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland intelligence force shot and injured a man from Darood/Marehan at Somalistar (Calanley neighbourhood) in Kismaayo on 28/01. The man was reportedly holding a black plastic pistol, and tried to run away after he saw the approaching forces. A stray bullet fired during the incident reportedly killed an intelligence officer (Darood/Ogaden) and injured a female civilian (Darood/Marehan).

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a custodial officer in the vicinity of Dabakaya Madow neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the morning of 28/01. The victim was reportedly on his way to work when the incident happened. The perpetrators escaped.
Suspected al Shabaab gunmen attacked and injured a judge in Baardheere on the evening of 29/01.

National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) conducted a security operation targeting al Shabaab operatives in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 29/01. NISA captured unspecified number of al Shabaab fighters and seized weapons. One NISA soldier and one al Shabaab combatant were killed during a shootout, while the operation was ongoing.

A peaceful demonstration supporting the 4.5 formula for allocation of parliamentary seats took place in Baidoa town in the morning of 29/01. The demonstration was organized by the local administration.
A large number of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of the mayor offices in Eyl on 29/04 in support of Puntland Presidents decision to oppose 4.5 formula. The mayor addressed the rally.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against the residence of Baraawe DC in Baraawe town in 29/01. No casualties were reported. Perpetrators escaped.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Arrests: A joint SNG/AMISOM operation yields 50 al Shabaab arrests in Jowhar.

Clan militias hailing from Majerteen/Wabeeneeye sub-clan and Warsangali/Dubeys sub-clan clashed in vicinity of Qaw village (16km W of Bosasso) on the afternoon of 30/01. The confrontation was linked to a land dispute and it lasted for about one hour. Casualties are unknown. Governor of Bari region and the regional police commissioner, supported by 10 technicals, reached the area to prevent further clashes. The situation remains tense.

A SNG soldier opened gunfire against a group of civilians in the vicinity of Via Ejito (Hamar Weyne area) on 30/01 for unknown reasons. The perpetrators escaped. Three civilians were injured in the shooting.
Al Shabaab clashes with AMISOM Kenyan forces in Baardheere. A ""number"" of Kenyan soldiers are said to have been killed and wounded in the ambush.

Arrests: SNFG soldiers, with strong support of AMISOM-KDF, conducted a large-scale house to house security operation in Baardheere town in the morning of 31/01. Reports indicate that about 100 suspects were arrested during the operation. The security operation followed the assassination attempt on Baardheere court judge.

Youth hailing form Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo sub-clans fought in Barwaaqo neighbourhood (Ceerigaabo) on 31/01 following a dispute at a wedding ceremony. Ceerigaabo police intervened, shot in the air, and arrested 4 people from both sides.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF reconnaissance unit near Taraka village (approx. 47kms E of Baardheere) in the afternoon of 31/01. The KDF forces were assessing the road between Faafax Dhuun (approx. 26kms E of Taraka) and Taraka at the time of the attack. Casualties are unknown. Following the attack, KDF forces shelled Jungal (approx. 23kms E of Baardheere) and Taraka. The two incidents of shelling were locally perceived as indiscriminate. No reports about casualties of the shelling are currently available.
Khatumo forces launch attack against Somaliland forces in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) on 31/01. No causalities reported.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a KDF reconnaissance unit near Taraka village (approx. 47kms E of Baardheere) in the afternoon of 31/01. The KDF forces were assessing the road between Faafax Dhuun (approx. 26kms E of Taraka) and Taraka at the time of the attack. Casualties are unknown. Following the attack, KDF forces shelled Jungal (approx. 23kms E of Baardheere) and Taraka. The two incidents of shelling were locally perceived as indiscriminate. No reports about casualties of the shelling are currently available.

A number of Renting Vehicle owners demonstrated in front of the governors office venue complaining about the National Electoral Commission (NEC) renting regulation. Those drivers accusing the NEC of making the regulation difficult for those drivers to work in the NEC Registration Campaign. The NEC has made a condition for the renting vehicles in which new models for Land Cruisers 4X4 and should be in good condition and verified from a certain Garage which became a difficult to majority renting vehicle owners in the town.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Local taxi drivers staged a large demonstration in front of the local municipality and on the main Garowe tarmac road, halting businesses and traffic movements in Garowe in the morning of 31/01. The protest was a response to governments decision to ban local taxis from carrying khat sellers. The ban followed suspicions that alcohol is being smuggled together with khat. Unspecified number of protestors were arrested.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Garowe central jail forces demonstrated over unpaid salaried and denied access to officials who tried to enter the jail on 31/01. The protesting forces stated that the protest will continue until the dispute is resolved. The central jail was built by UNODC for pirates during presidency of Abdirahman Farole.

A group of women and children from Daray Macaane staged a peaceful demonstration complaining about the piles of garbage which had been dumped in the area. The piles from the town had been dumped thus affecting the Hygienic situation of the area and caused many diseases to the area inhabitants. The police came to the scene and dispersed the gathering, there is no arrests or casualties reported.
Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland troops in vicinity in the vicinity of Xudun in the evening of 01/02. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Ceelasha locality (12km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 01/02. The victim used to be a broker and the motive behind his killing is so far unknown. Perpetrators escaped.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Street protests turned violent after security forces tried to break up anti-government match in Bosasso town on 01/02. Puntland soldiers fired into the air with volleys of gunfire being heard across the city. The protesters were taking to streets in support of detained Youth leader identified as Abdiasis Farah Haji Saed. Two deaths reported.

About five mortar rounds landed in the northern residential side of Villa Somalia in the morning of 01/02. A child was killed and seven other civilians were injured. It is unclear who fired the mortars.

NISA personnel manning a legal checkpoint near KM4 opened gunfire at armed an armed escort along the airport road in the early morning of 01/02. The NISA reportedly opened the fire after the armed guards refused to stop at the checkpoint. NISA temporarily detained the guards for interrogation.

A suicide-style bomb is detonated on a passenger Airbus 321 shortly after takeoff (at 11,000 feet) from Mogadishu. One death reported (the bomber), and the aircraft landed safely. The bomber may have been ridden a wheel-chair as an effort to conceal the explosive. In the week that followed al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack, stating the target of the attack was senior western officials. A passenger believed to be the bomber was killed, probably after being propelled out of the aircraft in the explosion, investigators said. Several other injuries reported. Twenty arrests were later arrested in connection with the attack.

An ISWA soldier was shot dead after he opened fire in the main Baidoa police station shooting a police officer on 02/02. The circumstances are still unclear but reports indicate that the ISWA soldier had complaints about the arrest over a civilian and that led to the dispute.

Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland troops in Waqdariya army base near Laas Caanood in the evening of 02/02. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. A Somaliland soldier reportedly sustained minor injuries.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Kenyan forces vacate Sarinleey base in Baardheere and are replaced by Ethiopian soldiers, reasons unclear.

An unidentified gunman shot and killed a prominent businessman from Majerten/Omar Mohamud sub-clan in Bosasso in the evening of 02/02. The motive of the incident is yet to be established and the perpetrator escaped from the scene.
A gun man from Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud shot and killed another man from Majeerteen/Ali-jibrahil in the noon of 02/02 on Garowe, reasons unclear.

An under vehicle IED exploded in Xamar Jabjab district in the early evening of 02/02. The vehicle belonged to the head of an LNGO, who, alerted by a by-stander, had moved away from the car when the blast happened. Despite the magnitude of the explosion, which was heard 2Km away, nobody resulted injured. The car owner was, at the time of the incident, accompanied by his brother, an INGO staffer. However, initial investigations suggest that none of them might have been the target, but rather a third person: the newly appointed Chief Accountant of the Sea Port, who happens to rent an apartment in the same building as the victim, and has the exact same vehicle.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a civilian man in the vicinity of Hormuud Telecom at Bakara market in the afternoon of 02/02. The victim used to work for Hormuud Telecom and the reason behind his attack is currently unknown. Perpetrators escaped.
Al Shabaab attacks and kills an unspecified number of Kenyan forces in Taraka.

Many people continued to protest against the manager of the Customs Office for the second day running in Zaylac on 03/02 over the construction of a concrete wall which extended from the customs office to the main entrance of the Zaylac Fishermen Association building. The protests continued after police refused to release five fishermen who were arrested in early demonstrations on 02/02. The protests turned violent after the protestors burnt tyres. Police shot in the air to disperse the crowd and arrested seven people.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM troops on foot patrol near Gol-Weyn Village (22km SW of Marka) in the morning of 03/02. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the al Shabaab fighters retreated. Pro-al Shabaab website claimed that six Ugandans were killed in that attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed AMISOM-KDF contingent with three RCIED explosions in a sequence and fired with small guns at Jeldesa area of Tabta Village neighbourhood (aaprox 55 KM SW of Afmadow town) on 03/02 afternoon. No human casualties reported and no property damaged, the explosions missed the target according to reports from the residents and travellers who got caught up in the ambush.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces in Goof-Gaduud (Burey Haraw area) (29km NW of Baidoa) on 03/02. The fighting lasted for several hours and SNG military officer told the media that they have overpowered the attackers. Causalities could not be established.

A group of SNA personnel ambushed an al Shabaab minibus near Cali Fool Dheere Village (21km NE of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 03/02. Both sides engaged in a serious exchange of gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters were defeated. The al Shabaab mini-bus came from Cali Fool Dheere Village where they were collecting tax due to the weekly market day and heading towards Ceel-Baraf when the incident happened. Eight al Shabaab fighters were killed in the attack.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in Ceelasha settlement (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 02/03. No Casualties were reported.

AMISOM/KDF forces vacated Khadijio Hagi (Bulo Haji) Village (34km SW of Belet Xaawo) in the night of 03/02. Some of the residents left with KDF in fear of al Shabaab, who immediately took over control of the town. Reports indicate that al Shabaab fighters called the locals at a public gathering, threatening that they know those who used to collaborate with KDF/SNGF and will punish them. KDF moved to Hareri Holse in Arabiya near the border on the Kenyan side.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian man on 03/02. The motive is believed to be a clan revenge. The victim hails from Habar Gidir. The tension is relatively high in Marka and gunfire could be heard in the town following the shooting.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a police officer who was in a crowd of civilians in the vicinity of Radarka (Dayniile District) in the night of 03/02. The police officer and three civilians were reportedly injured in the attack. The attackers escaped.
Kenyan forces exit Khadijo Hagi village, al Shabaab quickly enters the village. No violence reported.

Heavy clashes between Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers and Al-Shabaab embarked in Ali Foldhere locality near the southern town of Mahaday in middle Shabeelle region. An unspecified number of dead reported.
Suspected al Shabaab targets an airport security official with an IED. The security official was not harmed, though three others died in the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: AMISOM/Uganda has vacated Marka Town. This move comes after SNGF left the town yesterday evening. Residents report that al Shabaab is in the sea port and also in other Government buildings, and leading Friday prayers in the mosques. The motive of the move of AMISOM is unclear at this stage.

An IED targeting a SNA convoy in Ceel Wariir (Ceel Xarar)(approx. 20km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 05/02. The explosion hit and damaged one of the SNA vehicles. Three soldiers were killed by the blast and five others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF faced an ambush at Yoontoy Yarey Village neighbourhood (25KM NE of Kismaayo) which turned into a heavy clash that lasted for 2hrs, both sides used heavy machine guns, mortars and artillery then al Shabaab withdrew. No human casualties or property damaged as residents report.

column9: Mutiny of Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
column17: An ISWA soldier defected with his AK-47 rifle to al Shabaab fighters in Aliyow Doyoow Village (31km SE of Baidoa) in the night of 05/02. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly gave him money amounting to $150 in exchange for his gun. The soldier was later beheaded in his house by unidentified assailants.

Two groups of farmers hailing from two sub-clans of Gadabuursi fought using sticks and stones in Geerisa over a dispute of a pasture land on 05/02. Local elders intervened and managed to separate the two sides, no casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces outpost near the Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 05/02. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers retreated. No casualties were reported.

Students from Farah Omar secondary school staged a peaceful demonstration on the road from Radio Hargeisa to the Ministry of Education in 26 June District (Hargeisa) in the morning of 06/02 in protest against an order from the Ministry of Education of allegedly transferring best teachers in the school to other schools according to the students claims.

Local clan militias clashed with Somaliland police in Qarasgoy Mountain near Sheikh town on 06/02 following dispute over land ownership. The clash followed after the government granted the disputed land to a foreign investor from Kuwait to develop a solar plant station to supply electricity to Sheikh and surrounding villages. The fighting was initiated by the local gunmen who claimed the ownership of the land. A Somaliland police officer was slightly injured. The police arrested three gunmen while the rest managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNA convoy in the vicinity of Buufow Bacaad in the morning of 06/02. The attackers managed to seize a military vehicle and destroyed another one. Four SNA soldiers were reportedly killed in the fighting. Casualties on al Shabaab side could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and Biyamal attack al Shabaab location in Marka a day following the sect gaining control of the city. Causalities not known, though the clash caused a large displacement of the area population.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed an intelligence officer, head of Dharkenleey District Intelligence along with two of his guards in drive-by shooting in the vicinity of Siliga (Wadajir District) in the afternoon of 06/02. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Ali-Kamiin (Wardhiigley District) in the afternoon of 06/02. The motive behind the killing is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

More than hundred people staged a demonstration in front of Sheikh police station on 07/02 in protest against the arrest of a group of elders by Somaliland authority. The arrest of elders followed after local clan militias clashed with Somaliland police in the previous day in Qarasgoy mountain over a land dispute and the government is trying to put pressure on the elders to surrender the escaped gunmen. Reports indicate that an ongoing construction belonging to a Kuwaiti foreign investor has been suspended following the armed clash, arrest of elders and subsequent demonstration. The rally ended peacefully.

An IED attached to a vehicle belonging to the deputy DC for Bardheere district detonated in Bardheere in the morning of 07/02. The victim was former ASWJ spokesperson and he sustained slight injuries.

Al Shabaab fighters took control of Weel Cade Village (Approx. 135km NW of Badhaadhe) in the morning of 07/02. Following the takeover the fighters reportedly ordered local residents to vacate some part of the village saying that its strategic point for the Mujahidin. Reports indicate that pro-Jubaland local clan militias manning a checkpoint at the village escaped before the al Shabaab arrival. Further reports in the morning of 08/02 indicate that the local population deserted the village.

Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces in Widhwidh (49km N of Buuhoodle) in the evening of 07/02. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy artillery during the clash which lasted for about an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. A Somaliland soldier reportedly sustained minor injuries.

Two groups of gunmen from Dhulbahante and Habar-Jeclo reportedly exchanged gunfire in Qocondhaale near Horufadhi Village (39km N of Buuhoodle) on 07/02. The motive behind the shooting remains unknown but is believed to be related to previous dispute between the two clans. After brief shootout the two groups reportedly retreated from the incident scene. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Danow (Marka District) in the night of 07/02. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab fighters were reportedly spotted setting up two different bases around Ballidhidin Village (87km S of Qandala) on 07/02.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a crowd of people in Qoryooley town in the evening of 07/02. A man was confirmed dead and six others were injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a civilian man from Rahanweyn/Laysaan sub-clan in Kashiidow Village (42km NW of Baidoa) in the morning of 07/02. Reports indicate that the victim (a driver) was beheaded in his house after he allegedly refused to come out. The motive behind the killing is currently unclear.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Arrests: SNG/AMISOM forces jointly conducted security operations in Xamar Jab Jab and Waaberi districts in the morning of 07/02. About 500 suspects were arrested during the operations. Reports indicate that the forces arrested people from the roads, residential houses and even some were picked from public buses. The arrested targets are not known.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in the vicinity of Hanta Dheer neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the morning of 07/02. The motive behind the intra-clash is believed to be over a land dispute. The fighting groups hail from Murusade and Habar-Gidir. Three soldiers were reportedly killed in the clash and seven others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases near Golaa and Naxariis villages (18km and 30km NE of Buale) as well as Sokela Village(48km E of Buale) in the afternoon of 08/02. The exact number of casualties are unknown but local residents have reported to have seen dead bodies of two farmers believed to have been killed by stray bullets from one of the targeted al Shabaab bases. They also confirmed a thick smoke hovering over the targeted bases. Al Shabaab warned residents not to visit the area and the villages along the eastern and the southern sides of the River Juba. Later reports (Daily Nation) indicate 53 members of al Shabaab, including a top commander were killed in the strike.

Heavily armed SNA forces entered and took over the control of Marka town in the morning of 08/02 without any resistance from al Shabaab fighters. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly pulled out of the town prior the arrival of the Somali Military. The SNA forces settled all the strategic positions of the town.

Property destruction: A group of Dhulbahante militias loyal to Somaliland Minister of Health opened fire and stormed the office of a local journalist working for Somali Channel TV in Buuhoodle on 08/02 over resignation reports of a pro-Somaliland soldier. The incident comes after the reporter broadcasted a press conference in which the soldier, who was one of the local commanders of Dhulbahante militia loyal to the Somaliland Minister of Health stated to have resigned from his position. The militia destroyed some of the equipment in the office while confiscating others. It is not clear if any civilians were present at the time of the facilitys attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases near Golaa and Naxariis villages (18km and 30km NE of Buale) as well as Sokela Village(48km E of Buale) in the afternoon of 08/02. The exact number of casualties are unknown but local residents have reported to have seen dead bodies of two farmers believed to have been killed by stray bullets from one of the targeted al Shabaab bases. They also confirmed a thick smoke hovering over the targeted bases. Al Shabaab warned residents not to visit the area and the villages along the eastern and the southern sides of the River Juba.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrikes against al Shabaab bases near Golaa and Naxariis villages (18km and 30km NE of Buale) as well as Sokela Village (48km E of Buale) in the afternoon of 08/02. The exact number of casualties are unknown but local residents have reported to have seen dead bodies of two farmers believed to have been killed by stray bullets from one of the targeted al Shabaab bases - later reports (Associated Press) confirm that an al Shabaab commander (Abdirahim Mohamed Warsame) and 10 others were killed in the strike. They also confirmed a thick smoke hovering over the targeted bases. Al Shabaab warned residents not to visit the area and the villages along the eastern and the southern sides of the River Juba.

A RCIED was targeted against SNA vehicle near Danow Village (16km NW of Marka) in the morning of 08/02. The vehicle was heading to Qoryooley when the incident happened. One soldier was reportedly injured in the blast. Perpetrators not known.

Two clan militias from two Habar Jeclo/Ahmed Farax sub-clans (Cali Muse & Ba Cawrala) exchanged gunfire in Huluul Village (57km W of Ceel-Afweyn) on 08/02 following a dispute over the selection of a new prominent elder to be the chief elder for both sub-clans. Each sub-clan wanted the new elder to be selected among their sub-clan. Ceel-Afweyn police forces conducted security operations and arrested the two men who were leading the militias and transferred them to Ceel-Afweyn for further investigations. No casualties were reported.
Dhulbahante militias clash with Somaliland forces following an attack by the former on a radio station earlier in the day. Causalities not reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Qoryooley on 08/02. The fighting lasted for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

An unspecified number of troops loyal to Khatumo administration took over the control of Buurowadal Village (90km E of Laas Caanood) on 08/02. The motive behind the takeover is currently unclear however, reports indicate that it is due to a new strategy in which Khatumo wants to mobilize Dhulbahante local and expand its control in Sool region.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected Kenyan warplanes conducted airstrike against al Shabaab base at Berhani Village (approx. 45km NW of Kismaayo) in the morning of 09/02. The warplanes carried out repeated airstrikes against the same point. Reports indicate that there was unspecified numbers of casualties including death and injuries from al Shabaab side. Further reports indicate one of the warplanes ""a helicopter"" landed briefly at the targeted area but it is not clear what they picked from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces based in Qoryooley town fired mortar rounds and heavy artilleries against al Shabaab hideouts in the vicinity of Camp II (approx. 10km NW of Qoryooley) in the afternoon of 09/02. Reports indicate that the shelling also affected civilian population in the area. Two civilians were confirmed dead in the attack while livestock and other properties were also damaged.

A group of students and teachers in Dila town staged a peaceful demonstration on 09/02 in protest against poor education facilities in the town. Police arrived at the scene, dispersed the protestors and arrested three people after they allegedly refused to leave the scene.

An IED targeted a pick-up truck used by new police recruits on the road that links the unpaved road from the police training base to the tarmac road near Kismaayo Airport (Kismaayo) in the morning of 09/02. The vehicle was damaged by the explosion but there were no casualties.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a group of SNG soldiers at a checkpoint in Cumar-Beere (9km NW of Afgooye) in the evening of 09/02. The al Shabaab fighters reportedly took over the checkpoint. Casualties are unknown.

Militiamen loyal to Somaliland Minister of Health and Khatumo forces clashed near Abdi Guray Plaza Hotel in Buuhoodle in the night of 09/02. The clash was reportedly triggered by an earlier ambush against Somaliland minister of health by Khatumo forces. Both sides reportedly used light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for several hours after which the pro-Somaliland militias withdrew. Khatumo forces reportedly suffered unspecified numbers of injuries. Latest reports suggest that tensions flared up between pro-Somaliland and pro-Khatumo and both sides are mobilizing their respective militias.
Two ISWA soldiers exchanged gunfire in Baidoa in the afternoon of 09/02 over unknown reasons. A stray bullet hit and injured a civilian man.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNA personnel in the vicinity of Beyturaas neighbourhood (Marka) in the morning of 09/02. Another hand grenade was also thrown against SNA soldiers on foot patrol in Ruusiya neighbourhood in the same morning. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenyan air forces launch air strikes on al Shabaab locations on Berhani village. Any causalities have yet to be established. Strikes were also launched in Jubbada Hoose, near Kismayo.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: A US drone targets three al Shabaab locations, Dhiig Beerta, Keli Liibaan and Dharshiinley all near Qoryooley on 09/02. The head of social affairs of the Lower Shabeelle regional administration, said alShabaab suffered casualties in the airstrikes, specific numbers known.
At least one person was killed and two others sustained wounds in a clash between troops in the federal government of Somalia in Bardera city on 10/02.

SNG forces based in Kamoor Village (25km NE of Belet Xaawo) vacated their base and moved back to Belet Xaawo on 10/02. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly have take over the control of the village. No reports of armed clash.

Residents confirmed that two civilians were killed and five others were injured in Baardheere Khat Market in the morning of 10/02 after fighting erupted between two groups of SNG forces. The fight flared up after a group of government soldiers tried to disarm several soldiers who instead opened gunfire in the market area. Victims were rushed to hospital to receive medical treatment. No arrests were reported.

Khatumo forces reportedly carried out hit-and-run attacks against Somaliland forces based in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) in the night of 10/02. The Somaliland forces reportedly responded with both light and heavy fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG soldiers manning an illegal checkpoint in Mushaani Village (14km NW of Marka) in the evening of 10/02. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly and casualties could not be established.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack at SNG forces outpost in the outskirts of Afgooye in the night of 10/02. Casualties are unknown.

Local residents staged anti-Somaliland rally and expressed support for Khatumo administration in Buuhoodle on 10/02. The rally comes a day after militias loyal to Somaliland Minister of Health attacked guards of Khatumo president in the town. The protestors marched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. The rally is believed to be organized by the Khatumo administration led by its president.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters beheaded a local cleric in Jameeco Mubaarak Village (21km SE of Bulo Burte) in the night of 10/02. The victim was sleeping in his house when the perpetrators came and picked him and later executed him outside. Reports also indicate that suspected al Shabaab fighters warned the local community against burying the body. The motive behind the beheading is currently unknown.

A man from Ali Saleban sub-clan of Majerteen shot and killed a man from Ugar Saleban sub-clan of Majerteen in Timirshe Village (38 km N of Iskushuban) on the night of 10/02. The motive of the incident is not known. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and SNA forces took over Biyo-Cado Village (35km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 11/02. No clashes were reported from the village and al Shabaab fighters reportedly withdrew prior to the arrival of the allied forces. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against a police outpost in the vicinity of Hanti-Wadaag (Jowhar) in the evening of 11/02. The perpetrators escaped. One police officer was slightly injured in the attack.

Khatumo troops reportedly carried out hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) in the night of 11/02. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No reported causalities.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired at least six mortar rounds at MIA in the morning of 11/02. It is not clear where these mortar rounds were fired from but it is believed that it was a close proximity to the airport. Two Ugandan soldiers were injured in the attack, though it is not clear if they were the target of the attack. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility.
Al Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed SNA convoy near Ceel-Qooxle Village (Ceel Bur District) in the afternoon of 12/02. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

A group of youths demonstrated against a local NGO in Xarrirad on 12/02. The youths were complaining that the local NGO had not recruited them in the voters registration awareness programme in the village. The urged the National Electoral Commission (NEC) to look into the matter.

Khatumo riding with battle wagons reportedly open fire at local pastoralist in teashops in the vicinity of Geed Xamarka near Carro Wayn Village (45km N of Buuhoodle) on 12/02. The motive of shootouts remains unclear. Stray bullets reportedly hit and killed pastoralist from Habarjeclo clan while unspecified number of pastoralist including two other Habarjeclo pastoralist sustaining injuries. Khatumo elements reportedly escaped. The victims were admitted to Buuhoodle and Burao hospitals.
Unidentified attackers throw hand grenades at government forces in Marka. Causalities reported, though numbers unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: An IED of unknown origin targeted Burundian contingent of AMISOM at Via-Afmadow of Shaqalaha neighbourhood in Kismaayo in on the afternoon of 13/02. No casualties reported as the IED missed the target and exploded before the convoy passed. Security operation is on-going but so far, no arrests were reported.

SNGF attacked Buur Weyn Village (29km N of Bulo Burte) early in the morning of 13/02. Al Shabaab vacated the village without any resistance but re-grouped with reinforcement from other al Shabaab fighters and attacked Buur Weyn before mid-day. Although SNGF received also reinforcement from other SNGF units, they were defeated by al Shabaab and had to vacate and returned to their base in Bulo Burte. AMISOM did not send reinforcement to assist SNGF. SNGF reported one injured soldier while casualties on al Shabaab side are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters captured and killed two militia men (identity not known) in the vicinity of K60 (27km NW of Marka) in the morning of 13/02. The militia men were travelling in a public bus when a group of al Shabaab fighters emerged suddenly and opened the fire against the vehicle. Two civilian passengers were also injured in the shooting.

Armed clan militias launched an attack against the office of an INGO in Buulo Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 13/02. These attackers who allegedly hail from Biimaal clan briefly exchanged gunfire with the office guards after which the attackers withdrew. This incident is believed to be related to clan conflicts in Lower Shabelle Region as the most of the office guards hail from Habar-Gidir. No casualties were reported.

A teenager from Habar Jeclo/Adurahim died following fist fight with another teenager from Habar Yonis/Abdi Hamuud in Ceerigaabo in night of 13/02. The incident caused tension amongst the victims sub-clan. The reason for the fight is not known.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at some SNG soldiers on patrol in the main market in Marka on the morning of 13/02. The soldiers reportedly opened gunfire in response to the attack. No casualties were reported.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Xawaadley Village (27km NW of Balcad) in the night of 13/02. The men quarrelled over unknown issue which initially led to fist fight before the soldier shot the man. The perpetrator was arrested by the security forces.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters threw a hand grenade against SNG soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Wajir Street (Marka) in the morning of 13/02. Perpetrators escaped. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Human traffickers and Puntland Marine Police Force (PMPF) clashed in Ceelaayo Village (77km E of Laas-Qoray) 12/02. The human traffickers were reportedly members of Warsangeli sub-clan and had been planning to smuggle Ethiopian immigrants to Yemen when the clash took place. One soldier was killed in the clash. The PMPF arrested 10 -14 men they suspected to have been part of the attackers and 10 immigrants.

A group of youths demonstrated in Gabiley town in the morning of 14/02 in protest against a delegation from Hargeisa, comprising of Minister of Finance and the first lady. The protestors interrupted the first ladys speech and accused the government of being corrupt. Police arrived at the scene and arrested about 15 demonstrators.

More than a hundred people, mostly drivers of tricycle (Tuktuk) staged a demonstration against the local authority in the western part of Burco on 14/02 in protest against a directive issued by the local authority and municipal council of relocating them to a new stage and also changing the routes they play in the town. The drivers fought with the police forces and blocked the roads with their tri-cycles. Additional police arrived at the scene and arrested a number of protesters.

At least three mortar projectiles landed in Kismaayo airport close to the UN compound inside the premises in the afternoon of 14/02. The incident happened after the UN regular flight departed from the airport. No damage or casualties were reported.

Two groups of herders from Dhulbahante/Ali Geri sub-clan and Habar-Jeclo/Muse Abokor sub-clan reportedly exchanged gunfire in Geed Xamarka near Carro Wayn Village (45km N of Buuhoodle) on 14/02. The motive behind the incident remains unknown but is believed to be a revenge related to recent killing of Habar-Jeclo herders in the area. After brief shootout the two groups reportedly retreated from the incident scene. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified armed militias attacked the residence of former DC of Marka in Buulo Jaan which lasted for twenty minutes after which the attackers retreated. It is not clear if the attackers were al Shabaab fighters or another unnamed group. Two injuries reported.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a SNG official in Afgooye town on 14/02 morning. The reason of the killing is not clear but the shooting followed a verbal dispute which escalated between the soldier and the official. The perpetrator was arrested.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Danwadaagaha neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina District) in the evening of 14/02. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Weapons Seizure: According to pro-al Shabaab media reports a drone reportedly operated by the United States crashed in Sandacaar (18km SE of Ceel Waaq) on 14/02. The drone was armed with six missiles which did not explode. Al Shabaab confiscated the drone and the missiles. No casualties were reported. The Pentagon denied the crash.

Students from Mohamud Ahmed Ali secondary school staged a violent demonstration in Mohamud Haybe District (Hargeisa) in the morning of 15/02 in protest against high school fees and transfer of teachers by the government. The protestors smashed windows of several vehicles belonging to the government during the demonstration. Police dispersed the protestors using live bullets which some regarded as excessive force. No reported causalities, however.

Local residents staged anti-Somaliland violent demonstrations and expressed their support for Khatumo administration in Buuhoodle on 15-16/02. The protests comes a day after pro-Somaliland elders from Dhulbahante held a press conference and condemned the militiamen loyal to Khatumo who killed two Habar-Jeclo herders in Geed Xamarka village near Carro Wayn village (45km NE of Buuhoodle). The protesters marched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and burned tires while also damaged and destroyed windscreens of private vehicles. The two protests is believed to be organized by the Khatumo administration.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds against AMISOM/SNA camps in Shalaambood (5km NW of Marka) in the night of 15/02. Reports indicate that the mortars were fired from Janaale direction. No casualties were reported.

SNG forces conducted security operations in villages around Rabdhure in the afternoon of 15/02. The forces shot and killed several al Shabaab fighters (exact numbers not listed) in Imilow village (10km SE of Rabdhure).

Clashes broke out between two youth groups from Dhulbahante and Habar-Jeclo sub-clans in Daalo neighbourhood on 15/02 following a dispute over territorial control. Ceerigaabo police intervened, shot in the air and arrested two teenagers from both sides.

A group of youths demonstrated against a delegation of vice president and chairman of Kulmiye party during their visit to Qol ujeed village (25km NW of Borama) on 15/02. The protestors were complaining about poor socio economics of the town and blamed the government of not supporting the region. Police arrested nine protesters and transferred them to Borama.

A Group of Ceerigaabo Toyota vehicle owners staged demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo ministry of Planning office in the morning of 15/02. The protestors accused the Ministry of Planning official of been favouritism in renting services and bringing vehicles from Hargeisa. This followed after Somaliland Ministry of National Planning conducted a survey in Ceerigaabo town in which most of the vehicles responded to the survey were from Hargeisa. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators. No arrest was made.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters raided a residential house in Biyo-Cado Village (36km NE of Jowhar), abducted a man and later beheaded him in the outskirt of the village in the night of 15/02. The motive behind this incident is currently unknown. The village is recently taken by the allied forces and its under the control of the government.

An al Shabaab court in Ceel Ware (32km SW of Bulo Burte) sentenced a man in to a death penalty in the afternoon of 15/02. The man was accused of being a spy for SNG and the court found him guilty and he was later executed in a public firing squad.

Unidentified attackers shot and killed a mother and her son in drive-by shooting in Suuq Bacaad neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the afternoon of 15/02. The motive behind the attack is currently clear but some of the reports suggested that there was a land dispute between the victims and other people. The perpetrators escaped.

A magnetic IED attached to a vehicle belonging to former defence minister for Transition Federal Government Mr. Muhyadiin Haji Ibrahim exploded in the vicinity of KM4 (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 15/02. The Former minister was killed in the explosion while another person onboard of the same vehicle was injured. Al Shabaab later confirmed responsibility.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a police checkpoint in Al Baraka junction (Hodan District) in the evening of 15/02. No casualties were reported.

Local residents staged anti-Somaliland violent demonstrations and expressed their support for Khatumo administration in Buuhoodle on 15-16/02. The protests comes a day after pro-Somaliland elders from Dhulbahante held a press conference and condemned the militiamen loyal to Khatumo who killed two Habar-Jeclo herders in Geed Xamarka village near Carro Wayn village (45km NE of Buuhoodle). The protesters marched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and burned tires while also damaged and destroyed windscreens of private vehicles. The two protests is believed to be organized by the Khatumo administration.

SNG forces launched an offensive against al Shabaab fighters base in Waamo/Dhanfaruur Village (25km S of Buur-Hakaba) in the evening of 16/02. Reports indicate that one SNG was killed and another one injured in the clashes while casualties from al Shabaab side could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted coordinated attacks in Afgooye in the night of 16/02. The al Shabaab fighters attacked three positions simultaneously, at Mukayga base, the Police Station and the Bar Ismail checkpoint. The fighting lasted for more than an hour after which the attackers managed to take full control of Afgooye town. The al Shabaab attackers also seized two military vehicles, one civilian vehicle and confiscated small arms and they stayed in the town until 05:00 in the morning. Initial reports confirms death of three SNG soldiers and four civilians.

Two groups of SNG forces clashed in Belet Xawo in the morning of 16/02 following after two commanders disputed over the commanding of the police station. The DC arrived at the scene and managed to intervene between the two fighting forces. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run-attack against SNA base in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 16/02. After a brief armed clash the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An IED that was planted at the roadside under a second hand cloth sellers table exploded at Balcad Junction of Shaqaalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the night of 16/02. The IED targeted Jubaland forces that were on security patrol. No human casualties reported but the table and its surrounding was damaged.
SNG police and NISA personnel exchanged gunfire over unknown reasons in Dabka junction (Hodan District) in the morning of 16/02. No casualties were reported.
Arrests: Somali government forces capture two al Shabaab commanders (not identified) outside of Diinsoor on 16/01.

A SNG soldier manning a check point in the outskirts of Baidoa town indiscriminately opened fire against a public mini-bus in Mayafulka (7km NE of Baidoa) on 17/02. The motive is reportedly about taxation dispute where the driver refuse to pay money. The driver and another passenger were injured.
Al Shabaab fighters and SNG forces briefly clashed in the vicinity of Barakaat Cemetery (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 17/02. No casualties were reported.

Reports indicate that a UXO/Mine accidentally exploded in Arabow Village (48km NE of Buale) in the morning of 17/02. Further reports indicate that the device was remnant of an airstrikes by unknown war planes early in February and a group of al Shabaab fighters were inspecting the remaining at the scene when the explosion occurred. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed while another one was injured.

Unidentified perpetrator(s) planted an IED in to a vehicle (Land cruiser) belonging to Jubaland Minister of Social Affairs in Shirkole of Farjano neighbourhood in the evening of 17/02. The Minister was supposed to meet with Jubaland president at statehouse however his driver received information regarding the IED fitted in the vehicle and changed to another car instead. An EOD team arrive and safely dismantled the device after communication network was suspended. The security forces arrested three people, relatives of minister on suspicion ground. Latest reports on 18/02 indicate that the security forces again arrested more suspects and currently could not be determined the number of people arrested.

Local government authority and police officers destroyed illegal constructions on a main road in Jigjiga Yar area (Hargeisa) in the morning of 17/02. Some of the owners opposed the operation and hurled stones at the police, destroying some mirrors of civilian cars. Police responded by firing bullets and arresting at least 10 people for damaging vehicles and disrupting police operations.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED of unknown origin targeted an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Mariin-Gubaay (50km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 17/02. One of the convoy vehicles was damaged by the explosion. A Somali driver was reportedly injured in the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/SNG convoy in Gol-Weyn Village (22km SW of Marka) in the evening of 17/02. The ambush was followed by fierce armed clash between the two sides which lasted for about twenty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers retreated. Three civilians were injured by stray bullets.

Unidentified gunmen attacked a registrations office in the vicinity of Sabawanag (76km NE of Baki) on 17/02. A police officer guarding the registration venue was injured while the office was destroyed and the staffers escaped unhurt. The reason this incident is currently unclear however it could be a border dispute in the area.
Kenya-AMISOM forces attack al Shabaab forces at Siidimo, killing 20, including a notable IED expert.

Defusal: An IED was discovered in a dumping pit near the soccer stadium in Isbartiiba section of Farjano in Kismaayo neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 18/02. The explosive was discovered after an intelligence received a tip-off from a local resident who became suspicious about a box place at the road side.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNA positions in Shalaambood Village (10km W of Marka) in the night of 18/02. Both sides engaged in a heavy fighting after which the attackers were repulsed. Casualties are unknown.

A young man from Ali Saleban was shot and killed by unknown assailant in Biyo-kulule neighbourhood of Bosasso town in the night of 18/02. Motive of the incident is yet to be established. The body was removed from the scene and taken to Bosasso General Hospital. Three suspects were arrested and detained in Bosasso Central Police Station in connection with the murder.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces in Abdi Wayel Cinema neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the night of 18/02. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly but no casualties were reported.

A hand grenade was thrown by unidentified attackers against a group of SNA personnel in the vicinity of Wajir Street in Marka in the evening of 19/02. The hand grenade landed on a crowd of civilians and soldiers. One SNA officer and two civilians were killed in the blast while two civilians and two SNA personnel were injured. Sources confirm that SNA in Marka later executed a suspect.

KDF warplanes carried out an air strike against suspected al Shabaab fighters military camp in Qudaxley (15km N of Garbahaarey) on the morning of 20/02. Casualties are unknown so far. Local residents are trying to escape away from the areas which KDF Airforce is targeting, which led to displacements of the resident communities. No causalities reported.

A group of people staged a peaceful demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo court on 20/02 to express their anger against the regular postponement of cases against local youth gangs and grass land disputes. The demonstrators were mostly parents and nomads. Ceerigaabo police arrived the scene and dispersed the crowd.

A RCIED was targeted against a vehicle carrying the DC of Baraawe, Huseen Mahamed Barre (Jeex), in the morning of 20/02. The explosion hit the vehicle and injured the DC. Deputy DC of Baraawe District confirmed that the attacker was arrested by the security forces.

Local clan militias reportedly engaged in an armed clash with al Shabaab fighters in an area near Ceel-Huur Village (60km N of Xarardheere) in the afternoon of 20/02. One combatant from the local militias was reportedly injured in the clash while unconfirmed reports suggest that eight al Shabaab fighters were killed in the clash. Reports say that the fighting broke out after al Shabaab fighters attempted to forcefully collect Zakat (alms) from the local herders.

An armed clashed broke out between two groups of SNGF in Beled Xawo on the morning of 20/02. The fighting broke out after one group tried to stop the other from taking taxation from the market and public transports. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNA personnel on foot patrol in Wajir Street (Marka) in the evening of 20/02. No causalities.

A group of people, mostly businesswomen, staged a demonstration at Laas Caanood grocery market on 20/02. The demonstrators were protested following reports that the market has been sold to a local businessman.
Al Shabaab attacks SNG forces in Heliwa, resulting in a heavy exchange of gunfire. No reported causalities.

A group of local residents in Lughaye staged a peaceful demonstration on 21/02 in protest against the recent attack against voter's registration office in Sabawanag on 17/02. The protestors called for the government to solve disputes on district boundaries in the area.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired four mortar rounds against Baidoa airport on 21/02. Three rounds landed in the protected area close to Salamey IDP and the other landed outside. No causalities or damages were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Garas Weyne Village (47km NW of Xudur) on 21/02. Both sides were using small arms fire and no casualties were reported. Al Shabaab fighters retreated.

A group of drivers and conductors of lories staged a peaceful demonstration in Laas Caanood on 21/02 in protest against tax increase by Somaliland authority. Police arrived at the scene, dispersed the protestors and arrested unspecified numbers of demonstrators.

Hundreds of people staged a peaceful demonstration in KM4/ in front of the parliament/Dajirka along Maka Al-Mukarama road in the morning of 21/02. The demonstrators urged the government to mention the status that Mogadishu will have after 2016. The protestors had slogans indicating the need for Mogadishu residents to have equal rights as the other residents living in other regions. The provisional Constitution of the Federal Republic of Somalia states that Mogadishu will have special regulation that will be endorsed by the parliament.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack a group of Ugandian soldiers delivering supplies to Baidoa. Casualties reported, exact figures not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab forces ambushed a group of AMISOM-Ethiopia forces at Leego on 22/02. The attack destroyed one of the vehicles in the convoy. No causalities.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces as well as some residents of Ad and El-Abdi villages [in central region of Mudug] engaged al Shabaab forces in their area, killing 22.

Two groups of SNG military (sector 21) engaged an internal clash in the outskirt of Cadaado town in the morning of 22/02. The motive behind the clash is currently unknown but unconfirmed reports indicate that the two groups fought on clan lines (Marehan vs Ayr). Galmudug officials intervened and managed to stop the fighting. Four combatants from both sides were killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters' ambushed AMISOM/SNG forces convoy near Yaaq Biri Weyne (22km W of Wanla Weyne) in the morning of 22/02. The attack started with a RCIED attack which destroyed an oil tanker followed by gunfire which lasted for hours while part of the convoy managed to reach Leego later in the afternoon. Four vehicles were destroyed and eleven combatants from both sides were killed in the attack.
A SNG soldier hailing from Hawiye/Ajuran shot and killed his colleague (Rahanweyn) in Hawl-Wadaag (Baidoa) in the evening of 22/02 over unknown reason. Police arrested the perpetrator.

A RCIED exploded in Carafaat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 22/02 shortly after a SNG pickup passed at the incident scene. A civilian bystander was reportedly injured in the blast. The perpetrator escaped.
Arrests: NISA forces arrest a senior al Shabaab official in Bakara Market on 22/02. No name released.
Arrests: A senior al Shabaab leader (identity not known) is arrested by government forces in a hotel in Bakaro market in Hodan on 23/02.
A RCIED detonated near the market (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 23/02. Three civilians were injured in the blast. No arrests were made in connection with the attack.

SNG forces on a security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters briefly in Doonfuul (14km NE of Xudur Town) in the evening of 23/02. The al Shabaab fighters withdrew after brief exchange of gunfire and no casualties were reported.

An unidentified gunman opened gunfire against a public mini-bus in the vicinity of Buunda weyn (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 23/02. Two passengers were injured in the shooting and the attacker was arrested.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a brief hit-and-run attack against NISA base at the Sarta Qabyada building (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 23/02. The attackers withdrew immediately and no casualties were reported.

Khatumo forces carried out hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle Town). The forces fired motor shells towards Somaliland army camps but missed their target. One pastoralist sustained injuries in the shelling and the Khatumo forces retreated back to Buuhoodle Town.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNA/AMISOM forces took over Caadley and Ceel-Baraf villages (41km & 55km NE of Jowhar Town) in the morning of 24/02. Al Shabaab fighters made no resistance and left the villages before the arrival of the allied forces.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNA/AMISOM forces took over Caadley and Ceel-Baraf villages (41km & 55km NE of Jowhar Town) in the morning of 24/02. Al Shabaab fighters made no resistance and left the villages before the arrival of the allied forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM convoy near Qurac-Madoobe (22km NE of Jowhar Town) in the afternoon of 24/02. Both sides exchanged in a gunfire for some time after which the AMISOM convoy managed to proceed its journey. The convoy came from Ceel-Baraf and was heading to Mahadaay when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.

A group of local residents believed to be pro-Khatumo reportedly gathered and staged a demonstration in Laas Caanood on 24/02 in protest against bill-boards erected by Somaliland National Electoral Commission in the town urging the locals to registers as voters. The protestors reportedly destroyed a number of bill-boards. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed them. They also arrested a number of protestors.

More than a hundred people staged a peaceful demonstration in Dhanaano Village (62km N of Caynabo Town) on 24/02 against the head of the village over slow developmental progress in the village. The demonstrators requested the minister of interior and the president to replace the head of the village for failing his duties.

An unidentified attacker opened gunfire indiscriminately against a crowd near Caalin Cafeteria in Horseed neighbourhood (Baidoa) in the noon of 24/02. The cafeteria is frequented by ISWA MPs in the afternoons. Three civilians were killed and three others were injured in the shooting. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the attacker is a NISA officer who is now under arrest. The motive of the attack is unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
