column17: A brief shoot-out broke out between Puntland and Galmudug forces in Taarrogo area (12km W of Galkacyo Town) in the morning of 24/02. Five injuries reported.

The body of a young man was found in the vicinity of Oodweyne neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the morning of 24/02. The victim was stabbed with a knife by unknown attackers and several wounds could be seen on his body. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown.

SNG forces clashed with suspected al Shabaab fighters in the vicinity of Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 24/02. The al Shabaab fighters withdrew after a brief exchange of gunfire. No casualties were reported.
Army infighting kills three, including two civilians in Baidoa on 24/02. Four wounded. The cause of the clash is not known.

KDF launched an airstrike at Tuulo Barwaqo (21km SE of Garbahaarey Town) in the morning of 25/02. At least six missiles were reportedly fired and only one exploded. Ten al Shabaab, including four top commanders were killed in the blast.

Khatumo forces reportedly carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) in the night of 25/02. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No reported casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an ambush against ENDF/SNFG convoy travelling from Leego to Baidoa in the afternoon of 25/02 in Daynuunay Village (18km SW of Baidoa). AMISOM convoy was attacked several times and so far four casualties were reported on ENDF/SNGF side.

Decapitated bodies of two men were found in the vicinity of Xujub (11km SE of Beled Weyne Town) in the morning of 25/02. The victims were apparently beheaded and no group has so far claimed responsibility for the killing.

A gunman shot and killed a civilian man, wounding another man in Rako Village (78km NE of Qardho) on 25/02. The incident is said to be linked to previous clan revenge killings, perpetrator not identified.

An ISWA soldier who tried to stop a rickshaw which did not stop for him opened fire in Berdale neighbourhood on 25/02. One civilian woman was killed by a stray bullet and another succumbed to her injuries a short while later. No arrest was reported.

At least six mortar rounds were fired from an unknown location against Villa Somalia (Wardhiigleey District) in the afternoon of 25/02. Four of them landed inside Villa Somalia Complex, injuring some staff from the prime minister's office while the other two landed in a populated area killing an unknown number of civilians - Agence France Presse counts four, including two children. Al Shabaab immediately claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against the office of the DC of Kaxda neighbourhood (Dharkeynley District) in the evening of 25/02. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. Casualties are unknown.

A vehicle loaded with explosives detonated between SYL Hotel and peace garden (Xamar Weyne District) in the night of 26/02 after NISA forces instructed the driver to stop at a checkpoint. After the explosion, gunmen tried to storm SYL hotel but they were stopped and killed by the hotel guards. Another car bomb exploded outside the nearby peace garden thirty minutes after the first explosion. Some of the Mogadishu families visits peace garden with their children on weekends. The attackers did not manage to enter SYL hotel due to the resistance of the hotel guards. Ministry of Internal Security released a statement and stated that five NISA personnel were killed in the first explosion. According to hospital sources, more than 15 civilians were killed in the attack and close to thirty others were injured. The security forces mentioned that the attackers were five in number, two drivers and three attackers. According to Police, the explosives were estimated to be 200kg, the biggest explosion Mogadishu experienced.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: The African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM), supported by the Somali troops, killed at least ten Al-Shabaab militants and injured 20 others near Somalias southwestern town of Hudur on 26/02.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNA personnel on foot patrol in the vicinity of Beytu-raas (Marka) in the evening of 26/02. The hand grenade reportedly landed on an empty place. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy travelling from Wajiid to Buur Dhuxunley in Lanta Gasarta Village (pprox.16 KM N of Waajid) on 26/02. After exchange of gun-fire, the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded an ISWA soldier who hails from Jilible sub clan of Rahanwein in the morning of 26/02 in Ceel Garas Village (35km NE of Xudur) who previously defected from ISWA forces. Reports indicate that the ISWA soldier sold his AK-47 rifle and wanted to live in Ceel Garas village, under control of al Shabaab and was consequently beheaded.
Unknown men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNGF soldier in Bundo Weyn neighbourhood of Beled Weyne on 27/02. The motive is unknown and assailants managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired at least three rounds of mortar fire against the new airport in Kismaayo on 27/02. At least three rounds landed inside KDF protected area. No casualties reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED was targeted against AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Ceel-Wareegow (11km NE of Marka town) in the afternoon of 27/02. AMISOM soldier was injured in the blast while the explosion also damaged an AMISOM vehicle.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNA forces took over control of Qoor-Dheere Village (35km E of Jowhar) from al Shabaab fighters in the morning of 27/02. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly vacated the village without resisting the allied forces.

IWSA forces coming from Tayeeglow on security operation clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Mubarak (39km SE of Xudur) on 27/02. ISWA forces were defeated and retreated back to their base in Tayeeglow. Four ISWA soldiers were injured in the armed clash.

Two groups of people from Habar Jeclo/Biciido and Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis sub-clans reportedly clashed using knives and other crude objects following a dispute over land ownership in Dhabar Dalool near Ceel-Afwayn on 27/02. An older woman from Habar Yonis/Sacad Yonis was injured in the clash. Ceel-Afwayn police arrived at the scene arrested two men; one from each side.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against AMISOM/SNA forces in Buufow Bacaad Village (5km NW of Marka town) in the afternoon of 27/02. These forces were deployed in Buufow Bacaad to receive a convoy from Mogadishu. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab fighters retreated to Janaale direction. According to locals, al Shabaab brought injuries in Janaale. The exchange of gunfire also caused the death of number of goats which were caught in the crossfire. No specific report of human fatality.

A number of people demonstrated in Lughaye against the attack carried by gunmen against voters' registrations office in Sabawanag area on 27/02. The demonstrators called on the Somaliland government to arraign the suspects in court. They also called on the government to intervene in the ongoing dispute over boundaries between Hargeisa and Lughaya districts.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Tension reportedly ran high between the Puntland forces and Dhulbahante militiamen loyal to Khatumo administration in the vicinity of Buuro Wadal Village (90km E of Laas Caanood) on 27/02 following a dispute over territory controls. This followed after the pro-Khatumo militiamen took over the control of the village without any confrontation from Puntland and established checkpoint. The tension reportedly triggered a large amount of force mobilization from both sides for possible armed clash, causing panic among the local residents.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unknown gun men attacked one of the top intelligence commanders of Jubaland while he was heading to his house in the centre of Shaqalaha neighbourhood. The same group again attacked a JLF vehicle that was on patrol near Hanta Biyaha, Kismayo. They managed to escape and no casualties were reported. After the incidents JLF conducted a security search operation in the area.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit and run attack against AMISOM base in Maslax compound (Heliwa District) in the night of 27/02. The attack started with mortars followed by face to face confrontations, after which the attackers withdrew. One person was confirmed dead while three civilians were injured.

Two men armed with pistols shot and killed a shopkeeper inside her shop in Siinaay Junction (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 27/02. The motive behind the killing is not known. The attackers escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED exploded prematurely near Tabta (75km SW of Afmadow) in the afternoon of 28/02. AMISOM forces in the area responded with heavy gun fire in the direction of the explosion. No casualties were reported.
A woman was killed and two other civilians were injured following after security forces open fire to disperse local people that tried to storm Baidoa hospital searching for their family members.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNAG forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters near Biyo-Cado Village (36km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 28/02. Both sides exchanged heavy and light weapons during the clash after which AMISOM/SNG forces overpowered the al Shabaab fighters. Two combatants from both sides were confirmed dead.
Somaliland police arrested three protestors in Lawya Caddo on 28/02 after they were allegedly accused of disrupting the voter registration exercise.

A group of parents staged a peaceful demonstration in Badhan (106km E of Ceerigaabo) on 28/02 in protest against Puntland ministry of Education. These demonstration came after the Ministry increased fee for the forthcoming Puntland secondary and intermediate exams in 2016. They urged Puntland ministry to solve the issue otherwise their students will not sit for the exam. Somaliland and Puntland holds their secondary & intermediate exams in most of eastern Sanaag districts (Badhan & Dhahar) every year.

Gunmen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Saad reportedly shot and killed a herder man from Majerteen/Isse Mohamud in an area near Semade Village (30km W of Jariban) in the evening of 28/02. The motive of the killing is not yet clear but it is believed to be related to past clan revenges. The victim was reportedly deaf. The perpetrators escaped.
A man from Majerteen/Isse Mohamud sub-clan shot and killed a man from Madhibaan in the vicinity of Kalabeyr Village (60km W of Garowe) on the afternoon of 28/02. The perpetrator was arrested.

A SVBIED (minibus) that was parked in front of Baidoa Hotel exploded near Dahabshiil office in Baidoa in the evening of 28/02 where locals assemble in the afternoon causing high number of casualties. A few seconds later a suicide bomber (assumed to be a female) entered a very popular 'Beder Restaurant' and exploded her suicide vest. The restaurant is frequented by traditional elders, politicians, diasporas for sharing ideas and information during evening tea time. A large number of security forces were deployed in the town, curfew was imposed for the night and movement of vehicles and people was restricted. Reports from medical source indicate that 37 people died in the two attacks including a medical doctor working for Bihow hospital while over 50 people were injured, some of them with serious injuries. Victims with serious injuries are expected to be air lifted to Mogadishu for specialized treatment. Al Shabaab has claimed the responsibility of the two attacks. Other sources hold 55 dead.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: PIS (Puntland Intelligence Service) soldier shot and killed a local council officer over land dispute in the morning of 28/02. The incident happened after the local council officer attempted to grab land in Bixin area. The perpetrator was among PIS soldiers deployed to the area to prevent massive land grabbing. The perpetrator was arrested.

Militiamen believed to be loyal to Khatumo forces reportedly fired RPG and mortar rounds against Somaliland forces based in the vicinity of Qorilugud Village (38km NW of Buuhoodle) on 29/02. The rounds reportedly landed in pastoral area close to Maygaagle and Qorilugud villages.

Militiamen believed to be loyal to Khatumo forces reportedly fired RPG and mortar rounds against Somaliland forces based in the vicinity of Qorilugud Village (38km NW of Buuhoodle) on 29/02. The rounds reportedly landed in pastoral area close to Maygaagle and Qorilugud villages.

Reports from Afgooye confirm that al Shabaab fighters took-over Laantabuur (11km SW of Afgooye) from SNA forces in the evening of 29/02. SNA personnel reportedly vacated the base after they received information regarding al Shabaab fighters planning to attack the base. The SNA forces retreated back to Afgooye.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Qoryooley town on 29/02. The fighting lasted for almost an hour. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a SNA soldier in Laantabuur (11km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 29/02. The soldier was out of the camp when the SNA forces vacated their camp and he came back without knowing al Shabaab presence in the camp.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces on security operation launched a hit and run attack against al Shabaab fighters in Abdale Birole (41km SW of Kismaayo) on 29/02. Reports indicate that three al Shabaab fighters manning a checkpoint in the village were killed. No casualties were reported from Jubaland side.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces attacked al Shabaab fighters mobilizing their fighters at Shandarmood Junction (20km NW of Kismaayo) on 29/02. No casualties were reported from both sides.

A group of SNG forces staged a demonstration at the General Dhagabadan Training Centre and erected road-blocks in front of the main gate to the centre. A senior Somali national army official addressed the group and they returned back to their barracks. No casualties or damages were reported.

Unidentified sniper shot and injured a civilian woman inside her residence after the attacker allegedly aimed at her from a window in Macmacaanka neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina District) in the evening of 29/02. The motive behind the attack is unknown. The perpetrator escaped.

A demonstration in protest against the arrest of Yemeni fishermen and their boats was held in Qandala on 01/03. The demonstrations were reportedly organized by individuals harbouring alleged illegal foreign fishing vessels following the arrest of the Yemeni fishermen by PMPF in Qandala on the same day. The demonstration ended peacefully.

A RCIED targeted a SNA vehicle on Mogadishu-Afgooye road near Xawo-Cabdi Locality (9km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 01/03. The explosion damaged the military vehicle and killed at least four SNA personnel. Perpetrators not known.

Two RCIEDs simultaneously targeted against SNG convoy in the vicinity of Siinka Dheer (13km NE of Afgooye) in the evening of 01/03. A brief exchange of gunfire followed the blast. Casualties and perpetrators are unknown.

SNG forces on security patrol engaged in an armed clash with al Shabaab fighters driving on a motorbike near Abaq Beeday (16km E of Xudur) on 01/03. The al Shabaab fighters managed to escape but one fighter was reportedly injured in the clash.

Militiamen believed to be from Issa Muse clan reportedly ambushed a vehicle carrying the deputy governor for Saahil region (Berbera) and the police divisional commander for the same region near Biyooley (22km NE of Sheikh) on 01/03. The motive behind the shooting remains unclear. The officials were reportedly heading to Tuulo Dhibiijo village (19km NE of Sheikh) on mission to solve conflict between farmers, owners of vehicles and vegetable dealers following after they had disputed over transportation issues. The divisional commander was killed in the incident while a body guard was slightly injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces together with local clan militias reportedly attacked al Shabaab fighters based in Caad Village (43km N of Xarardheere) in the morning of 01/03. Other reports suggest that similar fighting broke out in Ceel Cabdi Village (22km S of Xarardheere). Casualties could not established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces together with local clan militias reportedly attacked al Shabaab fighters based in Caad Village (43km N of Xarardheere) in the morning of 01/03. Other reports suggest that similar fighting broke out in Ceel Cabdi Village (22km S of Xarardheere). Casualties could not established.

A group of youths and women staged violent demonstration in Ceel-Afwayn on 03/03 in protest against the killing of Saahil Police divisional commander in Biyooley near Sheekh on 01/03 by clan militias believed to be from Issa Musa. The demonstration turned violent after the protestors closed roads and burned tires. Ceel-Afwayn police forces arrived at the scene, open fire at the air and dispersed the demonstrators. No casualties or arrests were reported.
Somali security forces killed seven fighters from the Al-Qaidah-linked Al-Shabab group in Abdale Birole on the evening of 01/03.
At least four soldiers have been killed after a military convoy was hit by a roadside bomb outside Mogadishu. The perpetrators are not known.
Military forces carry out an operation in Xudur District - exact location not known - on 02/03, encountering and clashing with al Shabaab, killing 6.

A group of youths mostly hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Basanbur sub-clans staged a demonstration in Ceerigaabo on 02/03 in protest against the killing of their fellow clansman (Police visional commander in Berbera) in Biyooley near Sheekh on 01/03 by clan militias believed to be Issa Musa. The demonstration turned into violent after the protestors closed roads and burned tires. Ceerigaabo police supported by military forces arrived at the scene, open fire at the air and dispersed the demonstrators. No casualties or arrests were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked two bases of SNG forces in Beytu-raas and Saraha neighbourhood (Marka) in the early morning of 02/03.The fighting lasted for about thirty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. The attackers reportedly left two dead behind.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in the outskirt of Afgooye town in the night of 02/03. The fighting lasted for a few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Heavy fighting broke out in Dhusamareeb town between pro-Galmudug militia, led by former SNGF commander who switched sides last year and ASWJ in Dhusamareeb in the early hours of 02/03. The fighting is still on-going, seemingly Pro-Galmudug militia having the upper hand. More than seven combatants from both sides were confirmed dead while more than that number were injured. Civilians also suffered unknown numbers of losses. Galmudug forces have taken over Mareer Guur (28 KM NE of Dhusamareeb) after ASWJ went to Dhusamareeb for reinforcement. Both sides mobilizing reinforcement which could affect other areas like Cabud Waaq, Guriel and Xerale.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Heavy fighting broke out in Dhusamareeb town between pro-Galmudug militia, led by former SNGF commander who switched sides last year and ASWJ in Dhusamareeb in the early hours of 02/03. The fighting is still on-going, seemingly Pro-Galmudug militia having the upper hand. Galmudug forces have taken over Mareer Guur (28 KM NE of Dhusamareeb) without resistance after ASWJ went to Dhusamareeb for reinforcement.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG police outpost in the vicinity of Gubta neighbourhood (Dayniile District) in the night of 02/03. After a brief exchange of gunfire the attackers withdrew. No reports of casualties.

A group of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire with an armed man in the vicinity of Zobe neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 02/03. The motive behind the armed clash is unknown. A civilian bystander was killed in the shooting.

Unidentified armed men opened gunfire against a private vehicle passing near Suuqa Weyn (Wadajir/Medina District) in the night of 02/03. The vehicle belonged to former Wadajir DC who was not in the car when the incident happened. The driver was injured in the shooting. The perpetrators escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired about ten mortar rounds against Hawo Tako neighbourhood in Afgooye town in the evening of 03/03. First reports indicate that about fourteen (14) civilians were injured in the attack while civilian residential were damaged.
Local residents in Ceel Afweyn stage violent demonstrations to protest against the killing of a police commander by clan militias on 03/03. No reported injury.

An IED attached to a tree exploded at the Barcaleen Check-point on the road between the Kismaayo airport and the town. The tree use to be a tax collection checkpoint and was completely destroyed. Two staff from Jubaland Ministry of Finance were injured in the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a brief hit and run attack against an ENDF convoy in Safar-Nooley (15km SE of Diinsoor) on 03/03. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against an ISWA police based in Mayafulka (7km NE of Baidoa) on 03/03. The exchanged of gunfire lasted for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Four militiamen allegedly claiming to be from the Barre Hiraale militias beheaded a 50 year old farmer hailing from Darood/Bartire sub-clan on the eastern side of Juba river near Yoontoy Yarey (25km NE of Kismaayo) on 03/03.
Unidentified attackers hurled two hand grenades against SNG police forces at Baar Ubax Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 03/03. No casualties were reported.

Scuffles broke out between two youth groups from Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo sub-clans in Barwaaqo (Ceerigaabo) on 04/03 following a dispute over territorial control. Ceerigaabo police arrived the scene and arrested four.

Agreement: A local al Shabaab commander surrenders to SNG forces in Qoryooley in the afternoon of 05/03. The defector is called Sheikh Mohamed Haji Ali and he used to command about ten al Shabaab fighters. Qoryooley authority confirmed the defection and added that they are transferring him to Mogadishu for investigation. The man was alone and no other fighters were accompanying him.

Detonation: An IED exploded prematurely as suspected al Shabaab fighters wanted to plant it in the outskirts of Goof Gaduud (27km SW of Baidoa) on 05/03. Reports indicate that one al Shabaab fighter was killed and another injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces based in Buufow Bacaad fired unknown number of mortar rounds at Janaale town (14km NW of Marka) and the neighbouring villages in the night of 05/03. According to local reports, the mortars caused unspecified number of civilian injuries. The intended target is not clear.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNG soldiers on foot patrol inside Qoryooley town in the evening of 05/03. No casualties. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy near Gol-Weyn Village (22km W of Marka) in the afternoon of 05/03. Both sides exchanged different types of gunfire during the clash. The AMISOM convoy came from Mogadishu and was heading to Baraawe when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceel-Baraf Village (55km NE of Jowhar) on 05/03 night. The fighting reportedly lasted for thirty minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties cannot be established.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds against KDF military base in Buulo Garas village (approx.1.25km W of Bardheere) in the morning of 05/03. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Explosions from unknown origin target Ethiopian forces in Baardheere on 05/03. Of the three dead two were civilians. It is not clear if the perpetrators were at the scene or the explosives were IEDs.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: KDF jets launch attacks on Jilib area on 05/03, target believe to be Hassan Ali Dhoore. The majority of missiles landed in nearby agricultural fields. One death reported. A second source indicites the US conducted the airstrike.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks government forces location near Baraawe town during the nighttime hours. The fighters attacked the SNA base with rocket propelled grenade launchers and machine guns before they were repulsed by the coalition forces comprising of AU and Somali troops. No reported causalities.

Somaliland police in Allay Baday village (37km SW of Gabiley) arrested at least 15 teenagers on 06/03 after they staged a demonstration against a visiting minister of Agriculture. The protestors accused the government of been corrupt and failed to meet the promises they made during last election adding that the authorities also neglecting their village. Reports indicate that the demonstrators were supporters of WADANI party (opposition) while the police accused them of causing disturbance.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Mudul-Brawe (5km NE of Baraawe) in the night of 06/03. After brief exchange of gunfire the attackers retreated. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers launched an attack against SNA base in Shalaambood (10km W of Marka) in the night of 06/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. No Casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: American drones fired missiles and other explosives against an alleged an al Shabaab training camp in Raso in the morning of 06/03. Reports indicate that neighbouring villagers reported to have seen black smoke and sounds of explosions from the area. The Pentagon believes 150+ al Shabaab dead in the strike. It is believed there was a mass meeting or a ""graduation ceremony"" of sorts for al Shabaab fighters in the area which accounts for the high number of dead. Other reports indicitate the group may have been gathered to launch an attack on AMISOM-KDF forces in the area.

An IED exploded at a civilian checkpoint at Beled Weyne airport on the morning of 07/03. The explosion injured at least five, including two AMISOM soldiers. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM and SNG forces, bases in Qoryooley in the night of 07/03. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Militiamen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Saad shot and killed two men hailing from Marehan/Wagardhac sub-clan in an area near Saaxo Village (70km SW of Galkacyo) in the afternoon of 07/03. The motive of the killing was allegedly associated with previous clan clashes and revenge killings between the two sub-cans. The incident caused tension in the area. No other casualties were reported.

Unidentified three masked men armed with clubs reportedly assaulted a woman and broke her arm in Farah Omar neighbourhood (Burco) on 07/03. Reports indicate that the woman recently deserted the ruling party 'Kulmiye' and joined WADANI party (opposition). The exact motive behind the incident is currently unclear, however, it could be related to party-hopping by large supporters of Kulmiye to WADANI party. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Motor rounds landed in Via-Afmadow, Shaqaalaha neighbourhood in Kismaayo town in the morning of 08/02. The motors hit in an open place inside a civilian compound and no casualties were reported. The motors are said to have targeted an AMISOM (Burundian) base near Via-Afmadow.

Two groups of SNG soldiers fought in Buurdhuubo (35km SE of Garbahaarey District) in the afternoon of 08/03. The fighting started when a commander tried to disarm a group of soldiers following the refusal of his orders. One soldier was killed in the fighting.

Khatumo forces reportedly carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Bali-Hadhac Village (62km NE of Buuhoodle) in the night of 08/03. Following the attack the Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weapons during the clash which lasted for several hours after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Gunmen (pastoralists) hailing from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan reportedly shot and injured a herder man hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sa'ad sub-clan in the vicinity of Damerale (45km E of Galkacyo) on 08/03. The motive of the shooting was reportedly related to previous clan revenge. The injured man was taken to Galkacyo (South) Hospital. No arrest was reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man inside Bakara market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 08/03. The motive behind the attack is not known. The perpetrators escaped.

An RCIED targeted against ISWA military vehicle in Korow-Rooge (15km SE of Baidoa) near Mayafulka in the morning of 09/03. Further reports confirm that soldiers were heading to Daynuunay to receive their salaries. The explosion resulted unspecified number of injuries.
Somaliland forces left Bali-Hadhac Village and set up a temporary base in Carro Weyn Village (45km NE of Buuhoodle) on 09/03.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against SNG forces base in Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 09/03. Both sides exchanged different types of gunfire before the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

A tricycle motor best known as 'Tuktuk' loaded with explosives detonated in the vicinity of 21st October neighbourhood (Waaberi District) in the morning of 09/03. The explosion occurred after the police instructed the driver to stop but the driver went out of the vehicle and ran away. The police arrested four people in connection with this incident. The number of causalities and injuries was not reported or unknown.

A carbomb exploded near the entrance of Xerada Gaadiidka Booliska (Police Transport Compound) in Cabdicasiis District in the morning of 09/03. The explosion happened near a teashop where a group of soldiers and civilians were having their tea. Reports indicate that there was ongoing police training in the compound when the explosion happened. Three police officers and at least one civilian bystander were killed in the attack.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNG forces on foot patrol outside Shalaambood (7km SW of Marka) in the morning of 09/03. The fighting lasted for about 30 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Two bodies of al Shabaab fighters were reportedly seen in the battle field.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: SNG forces, aided by US Naval airpower launched an attack at Aw-Dheegle (Afgooye District) in the morning of 09/03. According to information from the ground a helicopter landed in Aw-Dheegle town and engaged fighting with al Shabaab fighters in the town. Further reports indicate that SNG forces broke all the doors of the ADC Compound, the district administration and the police station. The attacking forces were reportedly present in Aw-Dheegle close to two hours then left. Four al Shabaab dead bodies were seen in the town in the morning. Some reports claim 10 dead.

An IED exploded near Bardheere Police Station in the morning of 10/03. SNG police conducted a security operation in the area where the explosion took place and several people suspected of having link with the IED incident were arrested. Two civilian bystanders were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNG forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters in Miir-Taqwo (53km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 10/03. Heavy fighting followed where both sides exchanged different types of weapons. Two combatants from both sides were killed in the clash.

Somaliland forces from Oog village near Caynabo on the main road to Laas Caanood were dispatched to Ceegaag village (48km N of Buuhoodle) in the morning of 10/03. Initial reports suggest that the forces take over the village without resistance from Khatumo forces who were based there. The movement of Somaliland troops and the takeover triggered tensions and panic in the local inhabitants in the area.

An ISWA soldier abducted a civilian man and later killed him in the vicinity of Mayafulka (7km NE of Baidoa Town) in the afternoon of 10/03. The victim was travelling on a mini-bus to Mogadishu when the incident happened. The victim hails from Marehan while the perpetrator hails from Rahanweyn/Leysan sub-clan. The motive is believed to be clan revenge and the perpetrator was later arrested.
At least two civilians were killed and nine others wounded in a bomb planted in a tea shop in Garbaharey explodes. No group has yet to claim responsibility.

An IED planted in a teashop exploded in Qansax Dheere in the evening of 11/03. The security forces conducted security operations after the explosion and arrested seventy people in connection with the explosion. Two people were killed and five others were injured in the blast.

Local residents staged anti-Somaliland demonstration in Buuhoodle on 11/03 while also expressed their support to Khatumo administration. The protest was triggered following deployment of Somaliland forces in the areas of Ceegaag village. The protestors marched in the streets of the town chanting anti-Somaliland slogans and burnt tires. The rally was reportedly organized by the Khatumo administration.

Unidentified armed group believed to be from Habar-Jeclo opened fire at vehicle (Toyota Noah) belonging to Dhulbahante/Reer Hayaag sub-clan in the area of Oog village (23km E of Caynabo) on 11/03 after attempts to stop the vehicle failed. The vehicle was ferrying passengers from Burco to Buuhoodle when he incident happened and the driver speed off and managed to escape unhurt. The incident is reportedly related to previous killing of Habar-Jeclo man by Dhulbahante militias in Geed Xamarka near Carro Weyn village (45km NE of Buuhoodle). This incident triggered tensions in the area especially local travellers between Burco, Laas Caanood and Buuhoodle. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces launched an attack against a group of unidentified armed militias who erected an illegal road-block in Godin Labe Village (46km NE of Dhusamareeb) in the afternoon of 11/03. The fighting lasted for almost one hour after which the Galmudug forces overpowered the militiamen and managed to destroy the illegal road-block. Two men from the militias and a civilian bystander were reportedly killed in the clashes.
A group of unidentified Wabxo-area militia attacked a group of al Shabaab during the evening hours of 11/03, killing four.
Kenya air forces launch attacks against al Shabaab locations at Reys Qode. ""Several"" reported killed, no specific numbers given.

An explosive device suspected to be a RCIED targeted against a group of tax collectors in the vicinity of Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 12/03. The Deputy DC of Afgooye Mr. Mahdi Ahmed Hassan stated the authorities are still investigating what caused the explosion. Eight people including civilians were injured in the blast. No arrest was reported in connection with this incident.

Two groups from Khatumo and Somaliland forces reportedly exchanged gunfire which lasted for a few minutes in the vicinity of Ceegaag Village (48km N of Buuhoodle) in the afternoon of 12/03. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a local elder in the outskirts of Xarardheere Town in the night of 12/03. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Local youths staged demonstration in Carmo (100km S of Bossaso) in the morning of 12/03 in protest against increased transport fares in the town. The demonstration turned in to violent after the protesting youths started throwing stones at vehicles using the main road (Qardho Bossaso road) hence disrupting traffic movement. Police arrived at scene, dispersed the protestors and arrested about 20 youths and later taken them to Carmo Police Station. No reports of casualties during the demonstration.

Eight are wounded when a roadside bomb targeted a group of government soldiers in Kismayo on 12/03. Of the wounded, four were solders and four were civilians who were injured after the solders opened fire indiscriminately in response to the blast.

Eight are wounded when a roadside bomb targeted a group of government soldiers in Kismayo on 12/03. Of the wounded, four were solders and four were civilians who were injured after the solders opened fire indiscriminately in response to the blast.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SNG forces conducting a security operation in the vicinity of Ceel-Cali (64km SW of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 13/03. Both sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG soldiers position in Qoryooley in the night of 13/03. The soldiers opened gunfire in response to the attack. Two soldiers were injured in the blast. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Shalaambood (10km W of Marka Town) in the evening of 13/03. The motive behind the attack is unknown and the perpetrators escaped. A security operation was conducted the following day leading to 100 arrests.

Al Shabaab fighters hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNA soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Beytu-raas (Marka) in the evening of 13/03. Casualties are unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Two men armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a civilian man in Bakara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 13/03. The man was working for Dahabshiil Money Transfer and was on his way home when the incident happened. The motive behind the attack is unknown while the attackers escaped.
Al Shabaab gains control of Garcad on the evening of 14/03, no reported violence. Between 200-400 al Shabaab left the village the following morning, heading North East along the coastal line.

Djiboutian coast guards engaged in shooting with Somaliland coast guards in Ceebaad Island (16km N of Zeylac) on 14/03. One Somaliland soldier was killed and two others injured in the shooting. Casualties from the Djiboutian side is unknown and the motive of the shooting is currently unclear.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed two young men in the vicinity of Buulo Jaan neighbourhood (Marka) in the night of 14/03. The motive is believed to be clan revenge. The two victims hail from Dir clan and the perpetrators escaped.

Two gunmen from Habarjeclo/Soolamadaw sub clan shot and killed a truck driver from Dhulbahante/Samakaab sub-clan in City Plaza neighbourhood (Burco) in the morning of 14/03. The motive of the killing is said to be revenge against the killing of Habarjeclo herder by Dhulbahante gunmen in Buuhoodle. The perpetrators initially escaped but were later seized by the police.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Militia groups reportedly affiliated to Puntland and Galmudug administrations clashed in the vicinity of Damerale Village (45km E of Galkacyo) in the afternoon of 14/03. The clashes reportedly broke out due to ethnic tension related to theft in the area. Both sides reportedly deployed more militias to the area. Eleven combatants were killed (Radio Kulmiye) in the clash and three others were injured.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug Daraawiish forces attacked a police outpost near Cadado Police Station in the morning of 14/03. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Two police officers were reportedly injured in the shooting and the motive behind the attack is currently unknown.
Al Shabaab abducts three humanitarian workers from Siidimo on 15/03.

Kulmiye political party supporters staged a demonstration against a delegation from Wadani political party who went to the area to receive new members to the party. The demonstrators threw stones at the delegation which led to clashes between the supporters of the two political parties. Police arrived at the scene and arrested more than 10 people from the two sides.

ISWA/SNG forces conducted a security operation and clashed with suspected al Shabaab fighters in Kurman Village (21km NW of Diinsoor) on 15/03. The joint forces took over the village for two hours before they retreated to their main base in Diinsoor. One suspected al Shabaab fighter and one ISWA soldier were killed in the operation.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNG soldiers in Qoryooley in the evening of 15/03. Three soldiers and three civilian bystanders were reportedly injured in the attack and the perpetrators escaped.
Al Shabaab gains control of Garmaal on the morning of 15/03, no reported violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: An al Shabaab assault on a AMISOM-KDF camp in Afmadow on 15/03 causes 19 al Shabaab dead following the Kenyan response.

Khatumo forces ambushed Somaliland forces in Widh Widh Village (49km NE of Buuhoodle) in the night of 16/03. The two sides reportedly engaged in fierce fighting that went on for hours after which Khatumo forces withdrew. No causalities were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters and Puntland forces clashed near Garmaal Village (144km SW of Bandar Beyla) in the morning of 16/03. The fighting was reportedly initiated by Puntland forces who launched an attack against al Shabaab positions in the village. Both sides reportedly suffered casualties but exact figures remain unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces attack al Shabaab location in Kulub on 16/03. Casualties not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack against Jubaland forces in Afmadow Town in the early morning of 16/03. Reports indicate that five battle wagons including two big trucks carrying fighters penetrated into the town and launched an attack on Afmadow Police Station using different kinds of weapons including hand mortars, RBGs, automatic machine guns and several hand grenades. The fighting lasted about an hour and two Jubaland soldiers were killed while three others were injured. Several houses were also burnt by stray bullets and hand grenades. The al Shabaab fighters retreated from the town and casualties from al Shabaab side remains unknown.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces outpost in Bakaara junction (Hawl-Wadaag side) in the night of 16/03. No causalities, the perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab ambushes a Kenyan convoy at Kolbiyow, destroying the vehicle and killing eight.

Residents of Zeylac on 17/03 held a peaceful demonstration in protest against the killing of a Somaliland coast guard by Djiboutian marines on 14/03. The protesters accused Djibouti government of violating Somaliland territorial waters. They called on Somaliland government to defend its borders.
A SNG police vehicle was targeted with an IED in Dhagaxtuur section (Afgooye) in the morning of 17/03. The driver and another soldier were injured in the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: A KDF convoy was targeted with an IED in Gulshu, a farmland located between Kolbiyow and Raskambooni along the border (approx. 45km SW of Badhaadhe) in the afternoon of 17/03. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA forces' convoy in the vicinity of Gol-Weyn Village (22km SW of Marka) in the morning of 17/03. The forces were transporting food supplies to SNA forces in Buulo Mareer when they were attacked. Both sides exchanged gunfire which lasted for about an hour. Casualties from both sides remain unknown at this stage.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds against the bases of Puntland Army at Af Urur area of Galgala on the night of 17/03. Casualties could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Bad-Qado area near Godobjiraan Village (70km NE of Jariiban) on the afternoon of 17/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting that lasted for hours. Casualties could not be established. The al Shabaab fighters involved in the clash arrived on boats in Garacad on the evening of 14/03 and were about 400 fighters.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Seventy al Shabaab are killed and 30 captured during four days of fighting (17-20/03) with Puntland forces in Suuj, Nugaal.

Unidentified drones (likely US; no other group operating drones in the area) reportedly bombed al Shabaab position in Suuj Village (81km SW of Bandar Beyla) in the night of 17/03. Casualties are unknown.

Two suspected al Shabaab fighters armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG police officer in Warta Nabaada (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 17/03. The victim was the head of investigations in the Warta Nabaada neighbourhood. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Puntland police forces outpost in Warshad Galay in Garsoor Neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) on the evening of 18/03. No casualties, the perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Al Shabaab attacks a police checkpoint at Bossaso the evening of 18/03. Two police reported dead.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Seventy al Shabaab are killed and 30 captured during four days of fighting (17-20/03) with Puntland forces in Suuj, Nugaal.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces in Shalaambood fired mortars against civilian populated areas in Abiikarow (13km W of Marka) in the night of 18/03. The mortars landed on a pastoralist family and reportedly injured a civilian while also killing a large number of goats. The incident was confirmed also by Shalaambood chief but AMISOM did not comment on this.

Khatumo forces reportedly carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland forces based in Qorilugud area (46 km NW of Buuhoodle) on 18/03. Somaliland forces reportedly responded to attack with heavy weaponry fire. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceel-Baraf (55km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 18/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire for almost twenty minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a khat vehicle near Komorogoof village (32km SW of Doolow) on 18/03. The vehicle and the cargo was burned and the driver was taken to an unknown location.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Seventy al Shabaab are killed and 30 captured during four days of fighting (17-20/03) with Puntland forces in Suuj, Nugaal.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified assailants attack a police outpost at Garsoor on 19/03. No causalities reported.

SNGF conducted a security operation in Ceel Jelow (19km S of Waajid) on 19/03. One al Shabaab fighter was killed. The security operation was conducted to flush out al Shabaab fighters who are engaged to destroy civilian property which is intended to be transported to ENDF/SNGF in Waajid. The forces returned back to their base in Waajid.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian man in Gol-Weyn (22km W of Marka) in the evening of 19/03. The victim was a khat dealer and he used to sell khat to the SNG forces in Buulo Mareer. The motive behind the killing is unknown and no group claimed responsibility.

Police shot and injured three people at voters' registration centre in Berbera on the morning of 19/03. The incident happened after applicants for the voters' cards surged and rushed to get the card which led to disorder.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM-KDF logistic convoy contingent heading to Afmadow and started with an IED detonation followed by heavy exchange of gun fire at Abaya Bilow grazing area near Xaya Village (about 45km SW from Afmadow Town) on 19/02 afternoon. The attack lasted more than three hours and both sides have exchanged small and heavy arms fire. One APC and one big truck (lorry-loaded with assorted items) were heavily damaged by the IED and RBP fire. Two helicopters reached the location later for rescue reasons and over three hundred JLF forces from Afmadow and Dhoobley were also brought in and the convoy spent the night at the point where the ambush happened. Two JLF and seven others from AMISOM soldiers were reportedly killed, two JLF soldiers and ten AMISOM soldiers were injured. Agence France Presse claims 21 dead.

Unidentified gunmen believed to be Biimaal attacked a farm in Macalinka Village (Afgooye District) in the night of 19/03. The guards of the farm exchanged gunfire with the attackers for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. The farm belongs to a Habar Gidir man. One of the farm employees was killed in the attack.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a police officer in Matabaan town (63km NE of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 20/03. The motive behind the killing is believed to be dispute over the ownership of a local water reservoir. The perpetrators escaped but they are being pursued.
Unidentified war planes conducted several airstrikes at Sindigow (42km SW and Jigesa, approx. 37km SW of Afmadow) on 20/02. No casualties. The targets of the air strikes are not known.

SNGF/ISWA jointly carried out an attack against an al Shabaab base where al Shabaab demanded zakat animals from pastoralist in Bandhumi Village (15km NE of Diinsoor) in the early morning of 20/03. Reliable sources indicate that the fighting between the combatants resulted in three al Shabaab fighters being killed and no causalities/injuries reported on SNGF side.
Arrests: ISWA security forces on security patrol discovered a RCIED hidden in a metal container close to their base in Garas Weyne (49km NW of Xudur) on 20/03. Two al Shabaab suspects were arrested.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters opened indiscriminate gunfire against a civilian bus in the outskirt of Buulo Mareer (29km W of Marka) in the morning of 20/03. The bus left Buulo Mareer and was heading to Jeerow Village when the incident happened. The motive behind the attack is unclear. Three passengers were reportedly killed in the attack and two others were injured. Perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against the residence of a prominent Puntland politician called Mohamed Ali Yusuf 'Gaagaab' in the evening of 20/03. The explosive landed in an empty space and no causalities were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified assailants hurled a hand grenade against a mobile checkpoint setup in the proximity of Bosasso Main Market on the evening of 20/03. Reports indicate that the grenade landed on an empty place and the perpetrator(s) managed to escape. Police opened fire after the blast. There were no immediate reports of casualties or arrest, though one death was recorded later by the Shabelle Media Network.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired several mortar rounds followed by a hit and run attack against the positions of Puntland Darwish forces in an area between Af-Urur and Sugure of Galgala (40km S of Bosasso) on the evening of 20/03. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire that lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Reports indicate that one of the militants was killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Reports indicate that an armed clash between Puntland security forces and alleged al Shabaab fighters occurred near Yakayake Village (30km S of Qardho) on 20/03. Reports indicate the fighting started after local community informed the security forces who attacked the al Shabaab fighters. The al Shabaab fighters were reportedly part of those who fought in Suuj area and were escaping presumably towards Galgala. The clash lasted for an hour. One soldier and seven al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed. Other al Shabaab fled from the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Tabakaraale area (about 60km SE of Jariiban) in the morning of 20/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNG soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Jamhuuriya (Karaan District) in the night of 20/03. Injuries, fatalities not known. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Seventy al Shabaab are killed and 30 captured during four days of fighting (17-20/03) with Puntland forces in Suuj, Nugaal.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Reports indicate a refugee returnees convoy from Kenya Dadaab camp have survived air booming conducted by suspected Kenyan fighters Jets near Waraha Dhobley (approx. 100km SW of Bu'aale). No human and property damage reported from the scene and returnees proceeded with their travel the following day safely. The targets of the bombing are not known.

Heavily armed al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNA base in Lantabuur (12km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 21/03. A fierce fighting went on more than an hour after which the attackers took over the base. Al Shabaab claimed killing dozens of SNA soldiers in the attack, but these claims could not be independently verified. Neutral sources confirmed that al Shabaab seized three battle wagons, three other vehicles including a water bowser and a lorry. Al Shabaab left the base before the sunrise and went towards Aw-Dheegle town.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces' base in Carbiska (5km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 21/03. The attack was simultaneous with al Shabaab fighters' raid on Lantabuur SNA base. It is believed the intention was to prevent any military reinforcement that could go to Lantabuur. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Al-Shabaab in Lower Jubba have spread bullets at a crowd that was cutting down vegetation for use in burning of charcoal in the locality of Buur Gaabo. Three deaths reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces attacked al Shabaab fighters in Garacad area (60km E of Jariiban) in the morning of 21/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. Casualties could not initially be established, though the governor later confirmed 10 al Shabaab dead.

A RCIED was targeted against SNG forces vehicle passing in Tii-da neighbourhood (Daynile) in the afternoon of 21/03. The explosion hit the vehicle causing the death of a soldier and the injury of three others. Following the attack security forces made several arrests.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected Kenyan war planes targeted al Shabaab bases at Beer Yamaarug (65km SW of Bu'aale town) on 22/03. Residents report there were repeated airstrikes at this location which is deep in the bush. Casualties are unknown because the area is a closed zone for al Shabaab fighters and pastoralists are banned from using roads leading to it for grazing.

A group of Toyota Noah drivers from Dhulbahante staged a demonstration in Laas Caanood on 22/03 in protest against Salama Bus Company after it brought buses from Burco which have cheaper fare than the Noah vehicles. These new buses will ply from Laas Caanood to Hargeisa. They were chanting of not tolerating this new company.

More than 200 people staged a peaceful demonstration in Bosasso on 22/03 to support and celebrate the victory of Puntland Defence Forces in their recent clashes with al Shabaab fighters in Suuj Village (Bandar Beyla). The demonstrators marched on the main tarmac road, near the market and municipality council of Bosasso. Police took all security measures and the rally ended peacefully.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNA personnel on foot patrol in Beyturaas neighbourhood (Marka) in the evening of 22/03. Casualties not reported. Perpetrators escaped.

SNG forces on foot patrol and a group of al Shabaab fighters engaged in a brief armed clash in the vicinity of Barakaat Cemetery (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 22/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Arrests: Puntland police forces arrest 156 al-Shabaab suspects during a security sweep in Bossaso.

Dir clan militiamen affiliated to Puntland administration killed three suspected al Shabaab fighters near Towfiiq Village (66km S of Jariiban) in the morning of 23/03. The incident happened after local pastoralists tipped off the Dir militia about the presence of seven al Shabaab fighters in area. The three were killed after they refused to surrender. The other four were arrested. It remains unclear whether they will be handed over to Puntland authorities.
Al Shabaab forces gain control of Af Barwaaqo following an Galmugug retreat on 23/03.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenya air forces launch attacks against al Shabaab near Baadhaade. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Kenya air forces launch attacks against al Shabaab near Jilib. Causalities not known.
An ISWA Darawish soldier was shot and killed and his colleague wounded by suspected al Shabaab fighters inside Qansaxdheere on 24/03. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Ruusiya (Marka) in the evening of 24/03. The motive behind the killing is not known but unconfirmed report stated that the victim sent text messages to a number of Marka residents pretending to be al Shabaab member before he was targeted. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces reportedly attacked al Shabaab fighters in Af-barwaaqo area (130km N of Hobyo) in the morning of 24/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. Casualties could not be established. The previous day Galmudug forces had retreated from the town giving al Shabaab control of the area.
Unidentified men shoot and kill a Quran teacher following Friday prayers. Four men were arrested the following day. The motive of the murder is not known.

A group of youths demonstrated against the governor during a visit to visit to Ceel Gaal (50km SW of Zeylac)on 25/03. The group was complaining of the current severe drought in the area and lack of response from the Somaliland government. They also accused the government of not initiating development projects in the village. The youths reported shouted anti-Somaliland slogans. Efforts by the governor to persuade them calm down bore no fruit, forcing him to leave the village. No violence reported.

Khatumo forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against Somaliland troops in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) on 25/03. Somaliland forces reportedly responded with light and heavy weaponry fire during the clash which lasted for an hour after which the Khatumo forces withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed two local businessmen in Ceel-Baraf Village (55km NE of Jowhar) in the evening of 25/03. The reason behind the killing is unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Security forces dispatched from Qardho to conduct search operations clashed with a group of al Shabaab fighters in Bixin area (Bandar Beyla District) in the afternoon of 25/03. The security forces over-powered the al Shabaab fighters who were hiding in the area and managed to arrest 17 militants. Two police officers and one al Shabaab fighter were injured in the clash. The al Shabaab fighters are believed to be those who had escaped from Suuj Valley during the recent anti-al Shabaab operations.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces and al Shabaab fighters reportedly clashed again in an area near Af-barwaaqo Village (130km N of Hobyo) in the morning of 25/03. Reports indicate that the two sides engaged in a heavy fighting. It is reported that Galmudug forces killed a number of al Shabaab fighters. Galmudug lost an officer. Unconfirmed reports suggest that al Shabaab fighters destroyed a battle wagon belonging to Galmudug forces.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG forces outpost in the vicinity of Black Sea (Hodan District) in the night of 25/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the attackers withdrew. No Casualties were reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali troops backed by AMISOM soldiers have ""pushed"" al Shabaab out of villages in the outskirts of Wajid town. No reported violence.
Police open fire on a group of anti-Hassan Sheikh Mohamud protesters, wounding three. No reported violence from the demonstrators.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against a teashop in Qoryooley in the afternoon of 26/03. The bomb missed the target and landed on an empty place causing no casualties.

A group of youth from a local sports organization staged a demonstration against the regional sports director in Laas Caanood on 26/03. Although the motive is unclear, unconfirmed reports suggest that the demonstration might have been organized by pro-Khatumo diaspora who are on visit to Laas Caanood and organizing a football tournament.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA forces on the road between Biyo-Cado and Ceel-baraf (Jowhar District) in the afternoon of 26/03. Both sides reportedly engaged in a serious exchange of gunfire after which the SNA convoy went back to Biyo-Cado. The SNA forces left Biyo-Cado and were heading to Ceel-Baraf Village when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces base in Ceelasha (12km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 26/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers retreated. Casualties are unknown.

column9: UCID: Justice and Welfare Party of Somaliland
column17: Unidentified gunmen attacked the residence of Berbera UCID party representative in Gacan Libah District (Hargeisa) on the evening of 26/03. The motive is unknown. The gunmen injured the daughter of the party official and escaped.

Several youths attacked Crown Hotel with sticks and stones in Koodbuur District (Hargeisa) on the evening of 26/03. The motive remains unclear. Four people were injured in the attack. Three vehicles were also destroyed in the attack. The group escaped before the arrival of the police.

Al Shabaab killed at least 5 charcoal labours, burnt property and took away over 10 vehicles in Buscbusc (30km SE of Badhaadhe) and Kidi Faani Village (30km SE of Badhaadhe) on the night of 26/03. Reason is said that the area residents opposed the al Shabaab role and refused to pay tax.

Al Shabaab killed at least 5 charcoal labours, burnt property and took away over 10 vehicles in Buscbusc (30km SE of Badhaadhe) and Kidi Faani Village (30km SE of Badhaadhe) on the night of 26/03. Reason is said that the area residents opposed the al Shabaab role and refused to pay tax.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Galhagoog Village (130km N of Hobyo) on the afternoon of 26/03. Galmudug authorities reportedly said that their soldiers had killed about 20 al Shabaab fighters in the clash and captured and others.

Hundreds of Mogadishu residents staged a public rally against UN's Somalia and Eritrea Monitoring Group (SEMG) in Daljirka Dahsoon (Boondheere District) on 26/03 morning. The demonstrators demanded the Federal Government of Somalia to take serious measures on the threat posed by SEMG to Somali people and public institutions. The rally was peaceful and it was organized by leaders of civil society. The protestors were waving slogans highlighting the alleged violation of the SEMG on both public and private individuals in Somalia, which dedicated its resources to defame individuals to the extent of alleging innocent citizens as suicide bombers in one of its reports.

SNA and NISA forces exchanged gunfire in the vicinity of KM4 neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina District) in the night of 26/03. The clash started after SNA personnel on a military pick-up ignored NISA checkpoint after which the NISA personnel responded with gunfire. The SNA pick-up stopped, and they were released after identification. One SNA soldier was reportedly injured in the armed clash.

Teachers in Ceel-Afweyn staged a demonstration against Education Director of Sanaag Region on 27/03 and accused him of not paying them their training per diems following after Sanaag Ministry of Education held a training in Ceerigaabo for all teachers of the region. Ceel-Afweyn Police forces arrived at the scene and dispersed the demonstrators but no arrest was made.
Al Shabaab forces gain control of Ceel Baraf on 27/03 following a SNGF retreat the previous day. No reported violence.

Scuffles broke out between two youth groups from Habar Yonis and Habar Jeclo sub-clans in Barwaaqo neighbourhood (Ceerigaabo) on 27/03 following a dispute over territorial control. Ceerigaabo police intervened, shot in the air and arrested four youths from both sides.
A RCIED planted under a tree frequented by SNG forces detonated in Buurane Village (19km N of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 27/03. Casualties are unknown or not numbered. No arrests were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly clashed with armed militias loyal to the former governor of Bari Region in Gurur Village (65km SE of Qandala) in the morning of 27/03. The two groups exchanged heavy gun fire which lasted for about half an hour. One the governor's militiamen was injured in the clash. The clash ends the non-official 'no-aggression agreement' between al Shabaab and the governor's militia. The disgruntled politician has been seeking refuge among his kinsmen in the area after leaving Bosasso following reports that the government had been planning to arrest him over demonstrations in Bosasso.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM forces base in Mudul-Brawe (5km NW of Baraawe) in the night of 27/03. The fighting lasted for twenty minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

An unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade against a crowd of civilians and SNG soldiers in Qoryooley town on 27/03 afternoon. Following the attack, SNG forces conducted security operation and arrested 50 suspects in connection with the attack. A civilian bystander was injured in the attack.

A male body was found inside the compound of Jubaland minister for international relations (MOPIR) on 27/03. The reasons is not clear as there are two conflicting reports. One version states that the man was killed because he sexually assaulted a woman while the other version suggest that he was killed by the minister's body guards after he attempted to kill the minister.

Gunmen believed to be from Dhulbahante/Farah Ali sub-clan shot and seriously injured a civilian man from Dhulbahante/Samakaab Ali Sub-clan in Farax Xaskule neighbourhood in Laas Caanood on 27/03 over revenge killings between the two sub-clans. The perpetrators escaped. Tension ran high between the two sub-clans leading to police forces conducting security operations in the evening of 28/03. No arrest was reported during the operation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: An unidentified perpetrator hurled a hand grenade at a mobile police check point in the vicinity of NECTO area in Bosasso on the evening of 27/03. The perpetrator managed to escape. No reports of casualties, injuries.

Unidentified attackers hurled hand grenade against SNG soldiers in the vicinity of Salama Hotel (Hawl-Wadaag District) and against Wadajir District Police Station in the evening of 27/03. No casualties were reported in either attack.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a businessman inside a mosque in the vicinity of Puntland Cinema (Heliwa District) in the night of 27/03. The victim was a well-known businessman called Sade Mahad Dirir. He was the owner of the residence of former Mogadishu mayor General Muungaab. Perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen raided the residence of a NISA officer and killed him in the morning of 27/03. The wife of the officer was also injured in the shooting. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. Hodan District Police stated that they are still investigating the matter. Perpetrators escaped.
Government troops are attacked by al Shabaab in the Biyo Dageenka area of Hawl Wagaag on the evening of 28/03. Causalities not known.

An IED was attached to a place frequented by ISWA/SNA forces in Berdale (approx. 51km W of Baidoa) in the morning of 28/03. Reports indicate that the IED exploded near Berdale town entrance checkpoint. No casualties or injuries were reported from the blast and no one was captured in connection of the attack.

Armed men from Jajele car-jacked a private lorry belonging to a Xawadle man in the Halgan section in the west of the town on 28/03. SNG police forces managed to get the lorry back but one hijacker was injured during the exercise. The incident is related to previous clan issues.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A RCIED targeted against ENDF convoy in the vicinity of Ceel-Laheley (Ceel Bur District) in the morning of 28/03. The device reportedly hit a vehicle and destroyed it. The convoy was travelling between Dhusamareeb and Ceel-Bur when the incident happened. Sources confirmed casualties although the exact figures are unknown.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG and AMISOM forces' bases in Qoryooley town in the night of 28/03. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the attackers withdrew. Unconfirmed number of al Shabaab fighters were injured in the clashes.

Al Shabaab fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG force's outpost near the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the night of 28/03. Both sides engaged each other using different types of gunfire including RPGs. Casualties from both sides are unknown.
Mortar rounds from unknown origin fall on Leego the night of 28/03. Casualties not known or reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A road-side bomb from unknown origin exploded, targeting Ethiopian forces in Berdale on 29/03. Five deaths, other wounded reported
Police officers were attacked with several hand grenades in Laanta Towfiiq, Yaaqshiid. The sound of the grenade explosions could be heard in the surrounding area. Two injuries reported.

Intelligence forces headquarters at Baar Ayaan junction of Yaaqshiid were attacked with hand grenades. After the grenade attack, intelligence forces opened heavy gunfire. Perpetrators, causalities not known.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a frontal attack on government intelligence forces at the former court building in Suuqa Xoolaha, Mogadishu on 29/03. Casualties not known.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNA/AMISOM forces conducted a security operation against al Shabaab fighters in Laanti-Garaska Village (60km SE of Waajid Town) in the morning of 29/03. Reports indicate that both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the area. No casualties were reported.

Three gunmen from Dhulbahante/Wacays sub-clan shot and injured a pastoralist man hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Ahmed Farah sub-clan in the vicinity of Qorilugud (46km NW of Buuhoodle) on 29/03. The perpetrators are believed to be pro-Khatumo militias and their motive is currently unclear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces and clan militias reportedly from Dashishe sub-clan clashed in Dalweyne Village (84km N of Qardho) on the afternoon of 29/03. The fighting, which lasted for about an hour, broke out after the clan militias attempted to establish an illegal check point. Additional security forces were dispatched to the area. One soldier and two clan militias were reportedly wounded. The security forces seized a battle wagon and other unspecified number of weapons from the clan militia. The clan militia fled the area after the clash.

Weapons Seizure: NISA Forces captured a vehicle (Toyota Carib) loaded with explosives in the vicinity of Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the morning of 29/03. The NISA conducted the operation acting on information received from the public. Three AK47 rifles were also seized by the security forces. The NISA dismantled the explosives. It is not clear if the suspected were arrested.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed the chairman of Siinaay business community in the vicinity of Siinaay (Wardhiigley District) in the morning of 29/03. The motive behind the killing is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a group of police forces in the vicinity of Black Sea (Hodan District) in the night of 29/03. No casualties were reported and the attackers escaped.

A group of youths together with community leaders staged a peaceful demonstration in Ceerigaabo in the morning of 30/03 in support of the postponement of the ongoing voters registration exercise for a month in order to address the current drought in the country.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces fired artillery/mortar rounds from Leego (48km SE of Buur-Hakaba) in the morning of 30/03 following fears of possible attacks by al Shabaab fighters from that area. No casualties were reported.

Pro-Khatumo militias reportedly open fire against pastoralist from Habar-Jeclo travelling near Dhilaalo village (27km NE of Buuhoodle) on 30/03. Reports indicate that the pastoralists shot back in defence forcing the attackers to retreat back. The motive behind the attack is currently unclear. Causalities/injuries not known.

Supporters of the old LA in Buur Hakaba organized a demonstration in Buur Hakaba town against the newly appointed ISWA authorities for Buur Hakaba on 30/03. The protesters demanded that the newly appointed administration is taken back by ISWA to Baidoa.

Unidentified gunmen opened gunfire against a teashop where a SNA soldier and some civilians were sitting in the vicinity of ex-Control Afgooye (Hodan District) in the evening of 30/03. The motive behind the attack is unknown but it is believed that the SNA soldier was the target. The SNA soldier and at least three civilian bystanders were killed in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

A magnetic IED attached to a vehicle detonated in the vicinity of Macalin Nuur neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the evening of 30/03. The vehicle reportedly belonged to one of the parliament staff and the incident happened at the gate of his residence. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen in a drive-by shooting sprayed bullets against a car carrying a group of doctors in Taleex neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 30/03. The victims were working for DEVA Hospital, A private Turkish hospital in Mogadishu. The motive behind the attack is currently unknown. Two Turkish doctors and four Somali nationals including three doctors were killed while five other Turkish nationals and a Kenya teacher were injured in the same attack.
