Somalia Prime minister condemned the attacked and termed it a massacre while also sending condolence message to the relatives of the victims saying that he shares the pain with them.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade at police security outpost in Bakara junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 30/03. No casualties were reported. Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of police officers on foot patrol near Hawl-wadaag Police Station (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 30/03. The device reportedly missed the target causing no casualties. The attackers escaped.
Defusal: Police discover and remove a hidden explosive of unknown origin planted in a Baardheere police station on 30/03.

SNG forces attacked a local militia (Makane/Bantu) in Bundo Weyn on 31/03. In the exchange of gun fire one militia and one SNG soldier were injured. SNG forces confiscated a technical belonging to the clan militia. The reason for the attack and confiscation is unknown. No arrests were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy in the outskirts of Ceel Lalelay (35km SE of Dhusamareeb) on 31/03. No casualties were reported.

An IED exploded at a tea-shop in Awdiinle (27km NW of Baidoa) on 31/03. The tea-shop is frequented by SNGF. One soldier was seriously injured while four civilians suffered light injuries. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a convoy of AMISOM and local militias near Janaale Village (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 31/03. The exchange of gunfire lasted more than 30 minutes. The allied forces left from Buufow Bacaad and were heading towards Janaale when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown but two helicopters landed in Shalaambood and reportedly evacuated a number of injured UPDF soldiers.

A suicide bomber detonated his suicide vest near Uunlaye Hotel in Israac neighbourhood (Galkacyo North) on the morning of 31/03. The suicide bomber was targeting Puntland's Mudug regional chief accountant. Six people, including the chief accountant, some of his body guards and the suicide bomber, were killed in the blast. The al Shabaab military operation's spokesperson Sheikh Abdiaziz Abu Muscab said that the al Shabaab was behind the blast.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: American drone strike reported against al Shabaab leader Hassan Ali Dhoore on 01/04 at a unnamed location 20 miles south of Jilib. A US defence official said the strike targeted a vehicle Dhoore was riding in with two other al Shabaab members. Conflicting report: Somali National Army Deputy Commander stated that Somalia's Commandos together with special American forces killed a senior Amniyat leader Hassan Ali Dhoore on 01/04 in Tortoorow (49km W of Afgooye).
Khatumo forces reportedly fired mortars rounds at Somaliland forces based in the vicinity of Qorilugud Village (38km NW of Buuhoodle) on 01/04. No causalities or damages were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a hit-and-run attack against a SNG forces' position in Diinsoor town on 01/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire including RPGs for about ten minutes, after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Two clan militias from Rahanweyn/Gelidle and Luways sub-clans clashed in Tufka (30km SW of Qansax Dheere) in the morning of 01/04.The clash was triggered by a land dispute. One combatant was killed while three others were injured. Local elders mediated to prevent further clashes.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNA forces and al Shabaab fighters engaged in an armed clash near Janaale (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 01/04. AMISOM and SNA forces left from Buufow Bacaad and moved closer to Janaale when al Shabaab fighters ambushed the allied forces on their way to Janaale. AMISOM/SNA forces went back to their positions in the afternoon. Casualties from both sides are unknown.

A police officer shot and wounded a man in neighbourhoods of Xaafatul Carab, near Red Sea Hotel in Bosasso on 01/04. The victim was taken to the Bosasso General Hospital for treatment. The motive was unclear and the perpetrator was arrested.

Locals confirmed that unidentified drones (likely US; no other group operating drones in the area) bombarded the outskirts of Janaale (14km NW of Marka) where al Shabaab fighters were meeting in the afternoon of 01/04. ""Dozens"" of al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed (Radio Kulmiye reports 22) in the attack according to locals. Abdi-Rashid Buqdube, a middle rank al Shabaab official was among the people killed in Janaale area. Unconfirmed report also indicate that al Shabaab Janaale chief 'Qarilow' was also killed in the attack.
A overnight grenade attack on a mosque kills two and injured fifteen. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces in Buufow Bacaad fired unconfirmed rounds of mortar fire against al Shabaab positions in Janaale Village and surrounding suburbs in the morning of 02/03. Most civilians displaced from the affected villages. Casualties are unknown.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Xaawa Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 02/04. The perpetrator(s) escaped.

A SNGF military officer was shot and killed in Baardheere town by two unidentified men armed with pistols on the night of 02/04. The perpetrators managed to escape. It is not clear if the officer was on duty at the time. Following the murder, the SNGF conducted security operation but made no arrest.

A 27 year-old al Shabaab foreign fighter from Tanzania was executed by firing squad after he was sentenced to death by an al Shabaab court in Jilib on 02/04. The man was accused of working for the CIA and he reportedly admitted to the charge.

Al Shabaab fighters shot dead a NISA officer and a broker in drive-by shooting attack in the vicinity of Xaawa Taako (Wadajir District) in the morning of 02/04. The attackers who were in vehicle opened gunfire against the car carrying the security officer and the broker. The attackers escaped. Al Shabaab claimed the responsibility of the attack.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of Tabeelaha Sheekh Ibrahim (Dharkenley District) in the night of 02/04. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed two NISA officers in drive-by shooting in the vicinity of Afarta Jardiino (Boondheere side) on 02/04 morning. Perpetrators escaped. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

SNG forces opened gunfire against a crowd of civilians inside Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 02/04. The motive behind the attack is so far unknown. Two civilians were reportedly killed in the shooting.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Suspected American war planes hit an al Shabaab base at Abdidhoore Village (40km W of Kismaayo) in the morning of 02/04. Real casualties could not be established but residents report the base was completely destroyed and saw five dead bodies lying near the village which were later buried. Further reports indicate that over 20 al Shabaab fighters killed in bombing, were buried at Barhani and Golol shinbir villages in the afternoon of 02/04.

An unidentified war plane attacked an unknown vehicle that was passing near Qumane Rooble farm in Makakaago (Approx, 55km NW of Jamaame town) on 03/04. The vehicle is completely destroyed by the missile, causalities not reported. No one was allowed to access the area by the time of the incident.

Fighting reportedly broke out between SNG military and Jubaland forces in Belet Xaawo Town in the afternoon of 03/04. At least two soldiers from the two sides were reportedly killed while three soldiers and two civilians were also injured.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Horseed neighbourhood (Jowhar) in the morning of 03/04. The motive behind the killing is so far unknown. The perpetrator was arrested by the security forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland security forces on a patrol arrested a man suspected of being an al Shabaab operative in Garowe in the evening of 02/04. The man died after he was reportedly tortured.

Al Shabaab fighters fired two mortar rounds (other sources claim 7) against Villa Somalia in the afternoon of 03/04. The mortars landed on civilian areas outside Villa Somalia. According to unconfirmed reports, two civilians were injured in the mortar attacks.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a NISA officer in a drive-by shooting in the vicinity of Ceel Gaabta neighbourhood (Xamar Weyne District) in the morning of 03/04. The victim becomes the fourth NISA officer killed in Mogadishu within 24 hours.
Al Shabaab assassinates a government official identified as Abdullahi Abdi Adan on 03/04 in Baardheere.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab regains control of Janaale following the retreat of AMISOM forces who had earlier in the day themselves gained control of the town.

An IED allegedly hidden in a roof of a teashop frequented by SNG forces exploded in Bardheere town in the morning of 04/04. At least eight, including civilians, were seriously injured by the blast. District police arrived at the scene later but made no arrest.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces together with a local militia entered Janaale Town (14km NW of Marka) in the morning of 04/04. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly withdrew the town prior to the arrival of the AMISOM forces. Reports indicate that civilians have started to leave the town and its surrounding villages in fear of armed clashes. AMISOMs presence was short lived: the force retreated later the same evening prompting al Shabaab to retake control of the town.

ISWA Special Forces conducted a security operation in the vicinity of Raxoole (47km SW of Diinsoor) in the morning of 04/04. The forces conducting the operation briefly clashed with al Shabaab fighters. An al Shabaab fighter was killed while an ISWA soldier was injured.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of As-Salaam neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the morning of 04/04. The motive is unknown and the attackers escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: At least three KDF fighter jets supported by ground troops attacked al-Shabab bases in Berhani. Two al Shabaab fighters killed, others captured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM/ENDF convoy in Ulajarad (21km SE of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 05/04. Both sides used light and heavy weapons during the fighting. Casualties could not be established.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNA/ENDF convoy in the outskirts of Adan Yabaal Town in the afternoon of 05/04. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about an hour after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Pro-al Shabaab website claimed that they destroyed two vehicles from ENDF. Al Shabaab fighters left the town while the allied forces are stationed in the outskirts of the town and the residents are fleeing their homes in fear of armed confrontations between the two sides.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at SNG forces' security outpost in Baar Ubax Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the night of 05/04. No casualties were reported and the attackers escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a SNA official in the vicinity of Siigaale neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the evening of 05/04. The guards of the residence responded with gunfire after the blast. A civilian bystander was injured in the hand grenade attack.
A lawmaker survives an assassination attempt the morning of 05/04, two body guards killed. Al Shabaab claim responsibility.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM/ENDF and SNA forces took over Adan Yabaal town without resistance in the afternoon of 06/04. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the town prior to the arrival of the allied forces. Apparently the town was under the control of al Shabaab fighters for the last eight years. Al Shabaab attempted an attack on the ENDF forces later in the evening.

Unidentified warplanes bombed several locations under the control of al Shabaab in the outskirts of Bulo Gudud Village (35km NW of Kismaayo) in the morning of 06/04. There have been some casualties according to the locals but the exact figures are yet to be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An AMISOM/ENDF contingent conducted a security operation along the road between Mabaax (86km NE of Jalalaqsi) and Adan Yabaal in the morning of 06/04. The convoy was hit by an IED of unknown origin near Mabaax village. Three soldiers were injured.
Unidentified warplanes bombed al Shabaab base in Abdi Gooji, a grazing land near Xagar Village (49km E of Afmadow) in the morning of 06/04. There are no casualties reported at this stage.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A landmine targeted an AMISOM/ENDF convoy in the outskirt of Nuur Fanax (42km SE of Belet Weyn) in the morning of 06/04, destroying a water tanker. The forces responded with gunfire. Later they received reinforcement from troops based in Halgan village (41km NW of Bulo Burte), these forces stayed overnight at the scene while helicopters landed at the location, probably to medevac the injured. No reported fatalities.

Armed men believed to be al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against an SNG forces' position in Lafoole (6km SE of Afgooye) in the night of 06/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM/ENDF and SNG forces jointly conducted a security operation in Laanta Garaska Village (60km SE of Waajid) in the afternoon of 06/04. The joint forces briefly clashed with al Shabaab fighters, who then retreated from the area. Reports indicate that both sides suffered fatalities and injuries but exact numbers are currently unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy near Qurac-Madoobe (23km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 06/04. Following the ambush a brief armed clash occurred, but the convoy managed to proceed on its trip. The forces were heading to Biyo-Cado when the ambush happened. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a AMISOM-ENDF/SNA base in the northern outskirt of Adan Yabaal town on the night of 06/04. Both sides used different types of weapons including RPGs before the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown. AMISOM forces had recently peacefully gained control of Adan Yabaal.

ISWA military forces carried out an attack against an al Shabaab fighters' base in Gurbaan village (60km SW of Diinsoor) in the night of 06/04. According to an unconfirmed report both sides exchanged heavy gunfire. The ISWA forces managed to take over the village. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed while four ISWA soldiers were injured.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of local tax collectors in Dhagaxtuur neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 06/04. A tax collection officer and a civilian bystander were injured in the attack. The attackers escaped.

A gunman from Dashiishe sub-clan shot and killed another man from Majerten/Osman Mohamud sub-clan in Xaafatul Carab neighbourhood (Bosaso) in the early morning of 06/04. The motive of the incident is currently unknown and the police have launched investigations into the matter, however, no arrests were made so far.

Following the death of a clan elder in prison, reported yesterday, a group of people (mainly youths and women) staged a demonstration in front of Ceerigaabo hospital, in protest to a report stating that the incident was a natural death. The protestors claimed that the prison guards refused to take the victim to hospital before his death. Military forces responded to the protest in order to disperse them; in the process a female protestor was seriously injured. The soldier, the injured woman and the deceased elder all hail from the same sub-clan.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a SNG forces outpost in Cali-Kamiin Junction (Wardhiigley District) in the night of 06/04. The forces opened fire in respond to the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Suspected American war planes conducted several air strikes against al Shabaab positions in Jilib town on the night of 06/04. Reports indicate the jets targeted al Shabaab logistic points and burnt unspecified numbers of weapons, food and fuel, besides one truck mounted with artillery was also reportedly destroyed at Kulanka shareecada (law gathering) point in the town. Any causalities were left unreported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNA forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters in Jacar and Derri (41 & 40km S/SE of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 07/04. The allied forces engaged the al Shabaab fighters controlling the two villages and managed to take both of both over. Casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNA forces launched an attack against al Shabaab fighters in Jacar and Derri (41 & 40km S/SE of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 07/04. The allied forces engaged the al Shabaab fighters controlling the two villages and managed to take both of both over. Casualties could not be established.
At least two people were killed and 13 others injured when unidentified perpetrators fired mortar rounds at residential areas near the presidential palace on the evening of 07/04.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired four rounds of mortars, most probably targeting Villa Somalia, in the evening of 07/04. One round landed close to Oto-Oto in Waaberi District, killing and injuring a number of children playing. A second round landed close to the National Theatre and Xamar Jab Jab. Casualties here are unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired four rounds of mortars, most probably targeting Villa Somalia, in the evening of 07/04. One round landed close to Oto-Oto in Waaberi District, killing and injuring a number of children playing. A second round landed close to the National Theatre and Xamar Jab Jab. Casualties here are unknown.

SNG forces conducting a security patrol around Haj-pasta neighbourhood (Waaberi District) clashed with unidentified armed men driving in with two cars. After an exchange of gunfire SNG forces pursued the gunmen. Reports indicate that the forces managed to arrest some people from one of the cars, which was reportedly carrying a mortar gun while the second car and its occupants escaped. Some civilian bystanders were reportedly injured in the shootout.
Al Shabaab fire shells at an SNG base in Ambareeso area, Baraawe district on the morning of 07/04. Causalities reported, no specific numbers given.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attack a ENDF convoy outside of Halgan on 07/04, killing at least two. The battle began with a land mine explosion followed by an assault. At the time of the report the fighting was ongoing.

Unknown helicopters carried out air strikes against an al Shabaab location in Kamsuuma Village (20km NE of Jamaame) on 08/04. No damage or human casualties were reported. According to rumour the airstrikes targeted an al Shabaab senior commander.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against AMISOM base in Ceel-Baraf in the night of 08/04. The fighting lasted for more than 30 minutes and both sides exchanged different types of weapons during the fight. casualties from both sides remain unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a Rahanweyn/Hadame/Ligse civilian from the village committee in Garas Weyne (54km N of Xudur) in the night of 08/04. Reports indicate that the al Shabaab fighters opened fire against the victim's house after he refused to come out. The motive behind the killing is currently unknown.

A pastoralist hailing from Issa Muse/Abdalle Qoyan sub-clan armed with a dagger reportedly assaulted and injured another pastoralist hailing from Abdalla Arab sub-clan in the vicinity of Boodhley village (30km N of Burco) on 08/04 following a dispute over land ownership. Police arrested the perpetrator while the victim succumbed to his injuries later in a hospital. The incident reportedly triggered tension and panic among the warring clans in the village concerned about possible revenge killings. Latest reports on 10/04 indicate that the police arrested two local elders, relatives of the perpetrator.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Suspected US drones attack al Shabaab locations in Jilib on 08/04. Reports indicate that the airstrikes completely destroyed a police station in the town, where several al-Shabab members were at the time, though no specific numbers of fatalities given.
Al Shabaab fighters throw a hand grenade into a group of soldiers near Toorotoorow bus station in Afgooye, killing five.

Property destruction: Unidentified attackers set fire to five shops and a small petrol station in the vicinity of Wajir neighbourhood (Marka) in the night of 09/04. The motive behind the attack is believed to be a clan related issue. The owners of the destroyed businesses hail from Habar-Gidir clan.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy near Km 60 (27km NE of Marka) in the evening of 09/04. The explosion reportedly destroyed a water tanker. The convoy came from Mogadishu and was heading towards Buulo Mareer when the incident happened. Casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired six mortar rounds against the AMISOM base in Danow Village (16km W of Marka) in the morning of 09/04. Two rounds landed inside the base causing an unknown number of casualties, while the remaining four landed outside the base injuring three women. Sources confirmed that AMISOM evacuated injured soldiers together with the three civilian women by air. AMISOM forces fired back mortars after the attack but no details are available.

ISWA forces carried out an attack against an al Shabaab base in Bur-Heybe (32km NE of Buur-Hakaba) in the morning of 09/04. The forces took control of the village. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Newly trained ISWA forces carried out a security operation against an al Shabaab base in Jameecada village (30km NE of Buur-Hakaba) in the morning of 09/04. The forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters during the operation after which the al Shaabab fighters retreated from their base. The ISWA forces captured a Toyota vehicle loaded with commodities and a motor bike. Three al Shabaab fighters were injured.

Local residents of Buuhoodle staged a peaceful demonstration on 09/04 in protest against the Somali Federal Government while expressing their support for Khatumo administration. The demonstration was organized by Khatumo administration over the recent visit by Somalia Prime Minister to Puntland and the 4.5 election agreement. The Khatumo administration says that they are being ignored, and have not been included in the new deal. Protestors marched in the streets of the town chanting slogans against the recent deal.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of tax collectors in the livestock market (Afgooye) in the afternoon of 09/04. Two tax officers were reportedly injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces took over Jana Cabdalle Village (60km SE of Afmadow) without resistance from al Shabaab in the morning of 09/04. Following the takeover, the Jubaland forces burnt down an al Shabaab police post in the village. No human casualties or arrests were reported. The forces stayed in the village until 23:00. Upon their return to their base in Kismaayo they were ambushed near Saac Mooja (approx. 5km NW of Kismaayo). During the ambush al Shabaab fighters used small weapons. No casualties were reported from either side.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces took over Jana Cabdalle Village (60km SE of Afmadow) without resistance from al Shabaab in the morning of 09/04. Following the takeover, the Jubaland forces burnt down an al Shabaab police post in the village. No human casualties or arrests were reported. The forces stayed in the village until 23:00. Upon their return to their base in Kismaayo they were ambushed near Saac Mooja (approx. 5km NW of Kismaayo). During the ambush al Shabaab fighters used small weapons. No casualties were reported from either side.

ASWJ militia reportedly opened gunfire against a group of women who demonstrated against them in Dhusamareeb town on 09/04 morning. The motive behind the demonstration is said to be related to land dispute. ASWJ authority did not comment on the incident. Three of the women injured in the shooting are receiving medical treatment in Dhusamareeb hospital.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against a security outpost of SNG forces in Al Baraka junction (Hodan District) in the night of 09/04. casualties are unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG forces in Caymiska neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 09/04. Both sides engaged in a brief exchange of gunfire before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against Dharkenleey Police Station (Dharkenleey District) in the night of 09/04. casualties are unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

A vehicle parked outside a restaurant packed with explosives in Shibis detonates, killing three, including a child on 09/07. Though no group as claimed responsibility, local authorities speculate the involvement of al Shabaab.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attacks and overtakes Dif village on 09/04, destroying property and recovering weapons. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF clashed with al Shabaab and Murusade militia in Baraagta Hasan Yeber, Ceel Buur District, source dated 09/04. Al Shabaab claimed 50 ENDF dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Local media reported heavy fighting between AMISOM/SNA and al Shabaab fighters in Ulajarad (21km SE of Ceel Buur) on 10/04. The SNA commander in Ceel Buur zone stated that they killed about 12 al Shabaab fighters in the fighting, a claim which could not be independently verified. It is not clear who initiated the fighting at this stage.

Local residents in Jidhi village (91km SW of Zeylac) staged a demonstration in an attempt to loot food aid donated by a foundation from the United Arab Emirates and distributed by a LNGO on 10/04. The food aid was in two lorries and local residents, fearing the aid would be insufficient, tried to loot it. Police escorting the LNGO opened fire in the air to disperse the rowdy population, allowing the staff in charge of the distribution to escape with both lorries and their full load.

A gunman from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan opened fire at a man hailing from Sheekhal near Godod (30km E of Galkacyo) in the afternoon of 10/04. The man missed the target but stray bullets seriously injured another man from the same sub-clan as the perpetrator, while the targeted man escaped unhurt. Other Omar Mohamud militias in the area arrested the perpetrator.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces occupied Canjeel Village (28km NE of Kismaayo), in al Shabaab territory on 10/04. Al Shabaab had vacated the area and there were no clashes. After two hours the Jubaland forces left the area again, allowing al Shabaab to reoccupy the village.

An IED targeted the District Commissioner's vehicle near GIIRGIIR Pharmacy in Belet Xaawo in the afternoon of 11/04. Reports indicate that the DC escaped unharmed but two of his security staff were injured. The device was most likely planted inside the vehicle. SNGF carried out security operations in the area where the explosion took place, but no arrests were reported.

Unknown war planes conducted several air strikes against an al Shabaab base close to Yoontoy Yarey Village (25km NE of Kismaayo) in the night of 11/04. At least six al Shabaab fighters were killed while others were injured and the targeted base was destroyed. Reports indicate that the head of al Shabaab military in Jamaame district, Abu Hashim Ibnu Osman (Dir/Biyamal) was killed in the airstrike.

Non-violent activity: Reports indicate that unidentified assailants made a drive-by shooting at Karaama One Hotel & Restaurant in Bosasso in the evening of 11/04. The Hotel was hosting a meeting by Ali Saleban elders at the time of attack. The motive of the incident is yet to be confirmed but unconfirmed sources suggest that the incident is an act of retaliation by Omar Mohamud sub-clan for the killing of a prominent businessman in February 2016. The perpetrators escaped from the scene. The incident led neither to casualties nor to arrests.

Two gunmen hailing from Haber-Gidir/Suleiman exchanged gunfire in Mirjicle village (32km SE of Cabud Waaq) in the afternoon of 11/04. One of the gunmen was killed in the shootout, while four civilian bystanders were injured. NISA forces in the area arrested the other gunman.

An unidentified masked man armed with a pistol believed to have links with al Shabaab reportedly shot and killed a man from Dhulbahante/Baharsame-sub clan in the vicinity of Tuulo Qodax neighbourhood (Las Anod) in the evening of 11/04. Reports indicate that the victim was a former senior al Shabaab commander who defected in 2014. The victim was reportedly arrested by the Somaliland government in a joint security operation conducted with Ethiopian support and was later released on bail. Unconfirmed reports indicate that the victim was currently member of Somaliland Intelligence.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against Kaaraan District Police Station in the night of 11/04. The police reacted with gunfire following the explosion. A police officer was injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.
Five are dead in a al Shabaab car bomb explosion outside a restaurant near a local government headquarters in Hamar Weyne district on 11/04.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: SNG and ENDF forces gain control of Galcad following a al Shabaab withdrawal.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: United States forces launch a pair of drone strikes on al Shabaab locations near Kismayo on 11/04 and 12/04. Twelve reported dead over the two days.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against ISWA forces positioned in the former Afgooye Secondary School in the night of 12/04. casualties are unknown. Perpetrators escaped.

Al Shabaab carjacked over seven civilian vehicles (trucks and Mini-buses) from Bu'ale Town to transport fighters towards Afmadow. The fighters alighted deep in the bush between the two districts (approx. 70km W of Bu'ale) on 12/04. Some of the hijacked drivers released last night reported that they had to transport a high number of al Shabaab troops; further reports indicate that al Shabaab is planning a complex attack in one of the JLF and AMISOM controlled towns and villages in Lower Juba to respond to the airstrikes against them.

A drone strike of unknown origin (likely US; no other group operating drones in the area) targeted Jasiira Village (2km E of Qoryooley) in the afternoon of 12/04. At the time of writing all information regarding this incident remained sketchy. Local residents, however, reported at least two missiles hit the area. Casualties could not be established. The targets of the strikes were not reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: United States forces launch a pair of drone strikes on al Shabaab locations near Kismayo on 11/04 and 12/04. Twelve reported dead over the two days.

An IED apparently targeting tax revenue collectors exploded in the livestock market of Afgooye in the morning of 13/04. It is thought the device was planted at the incident scene. At least one soldier and two bystanders were killed while six other bystanders were injured. The perpetrators escaped.

Clan militias from Galjecel and Jejeele clashed in Iarmoghe (19km W of Belet Weyne) in the morning of 13/04. The area reportedly received little rain, which may cause competition for pasture and explain the clan conflict. The fighting lasted for nearly an hour. No casualties were reported.

An IED apparently targeting tax revenue collectors exploded in the livestock market of Afgooye in the morning of 13/04. A soldier and two bystanders were killed and six others injured. The target of the blast is unknown.
Unknown assailants are attacking Cadado Airport (around 5 km SE of Cadado town). An exchange of gun-fire can be heard. No more details are available at the moment.

The dead bodies of two young men working in Uunlaaye hotel were found in the vicinity of Gobsho (20km N of Galkacyo) in the morning of 13/04. Their bodies were riddled with gunshots. Perpetrators, motive not known.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a vehicle carrying khat near Dhanfarur village (15km N of Buur-Hakaba) in the afternoon of 13/04. As the result of the shooting the driver was killed while the attackers burnt the vehicle and its load. The rest of the passengers managed to escape.
An unknown assailant hurled a hand grenade against a SNG army base in Shalaambood (9km SW of Marka) on 13/04. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators escaped.

An unknown assailant hurled a hand grenade against a SNG checkpoint in Ali-Kamiin neighbourhood (Wardhiigley District) in the afternoon of 13/04. The SNG forces' opened fire in response to the blast. The perpetrator managed to escape. No reported casualties.
SNG and al Shabaab forces clash in Buur Xakaba on 13/04, at least one soldier dead reported.

""A contracted driver for a UN agency was abducted by suspected Al Shabaab fighters near Likoley and Elade, Gedo region in Somalia while carrying humanitarian supplies to a distribution site. The truck was looted. As a result of this incident, deliveries of humanitarian supplies have not resumed to those areas. The driver was released after one week.""
Unknown assailants throw and grenades against the home of a Somali lawmaker on 14/04, injuring four civilians.
Military forces and local militia clash over extorted checkpoint money on 14/04. casualties not known.

The clan clash between Galjecel and Jejeele in Iarmoghe of 13/04 spilled over to Higli village (17km W of Beled Weyne) in the morning of 14/04, again over disputed pastureland. The clash had stopped at the time of reporting while elders from both sides stepped in to avoid further escalation of similar fights. One person was injured in this second clash.
Two militia groups from Galjecel and Jejeele clashed in Hawo Tako neighbourhood (Beled Weyne) in the afternoon of 14/04. Three combatants were killed while several others were injured.

Two groups of clan militias from Biiyamal and Habar-Gidir clashed in Marka in the morning of 14/04. The fighting most likely was triggered by disputes on tax collections from public transports. SNG forces, local leaders and elders have stepped in in order to secure a ceasefire. One combatant was killed while three others were injured.

Two groups of SNA forces briefly exchanged gunfire in Mahadaay town (22km N of Jowhar) in the morning of 14/04, over an alleged dispute about money extorted from a checkpoint. Causalities not reported.

The Somaliland authorities in Lowyacado have destroyed several illegal constructions that were used for smuggling. The area's residents demonstrated against the destructions and refused to clear the area. The police arrested several people, which were transferred to Zeylac central prison, and proceeded with the demolitions.

Reports indicate that five local armed men who were originally charcoal burners and from Badhaadhe Town attacked an al Shabaab cell in Buula Haji Village (69KM W of Kismaayo Town) on 15/04 to rescue and release their colleagues who were under al Shabaab arrest. The five men managed to release their men after a brief clash. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked Gol-Weyn (22 KM SW of Marka) on 15/04/2016. The fighting took more than two hours, both sides using heavy weaponry. Unconfirmed information indicates that six AMISOM soldiers were killed and one was taken alive by al Shabaab.
Somali forces launch an attack on an al Shabaab base in Bur Eyle (Buur Heybe) village, Bay region. casualties not known.

Anti AMISOM demonstrations are on-going in Buulo Mareer and angry villagers are burning tires to demonstrate against AMISOM forces after recent reports of the forces killing civilians earlier in the day.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against Afgooye police station in the early morning of 16/04. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly after which the al Shabaab attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland sets up a military base in Garad (60km SE of Jariiban) on 16/04, following the recent al Shabaab infiltration in coastal villages in Mudug region.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: On 16/04/2016, a civilian Toyota Carib, travelling from Buulo Mareer to Mogadishu met AMISOM soldiers outside Bulo Mareer (29 KM SW of Marka) who immediately shot at the bus, killing two civilian men, a 85 year old woman and a young girl.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: AMISOM forces killed four civilians (an older woman, a girl and two men, reportedly from the same family) near Buulo Mareer town (29km W of Marka) in the morning of 16/04. The victims were traveling from Buulo Mareer towards Mogadishu when Ugandan AMISOM soldiers opened fire against their vehicle. The AMISOM spokesman admitted the incident and stated that they regret the killing of innocent Somalis, adding that AMISOM and Somali Police Force are investigating the matter.

Anti al Shabaab drones (likely US; no other group operating drones in the area) from an unreported origin conducted an air bombardment against al Shaabab military vehicles in Ceel Cadde village (55km SW of Garbaharey town) in the afternoon of 16/04. Community sources indicate that an unknown number of high-ranking al Shabaab officials were injured and/or killed in the air strike operation, and three al Shabaab vehicles were destroyed.

Two men armed with pistols shot and killed an old lady in the vicinity of Sey Biyaano (Hodan District) in the night of 16/04. The motive behind the killing is unclear but reports indicate that the lady used to work with the local authority. Perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified gunmen kill two women and wounded two others in Dharkenley District. At least one of the victims was custodial staff for the UN.
An unidentified person threw a hand grenade at a check point on Bundo Weyne bridge, no injuries, causalities reported.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier in Xawo Tako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 17/04. The attackers also stole the victim's gun before escaping.
SNGF/SWSPF on security operation attacked an al Shabaab base in Laba-Warood (8 KM east of Diinsor) on 17/04. One al Shabaab fighter was killed and one al Shabaab and one SNGF were wounded.

Gunmen from Habar-Gidir/Sacaad sub-clan reportedly opened fire against two men from Darood/Leelkase near Jeexdin (15km E of Galkacyo) on 17/04. The gunmen missed their target and instead killed several goats. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen attack Dudumo village, killing at least seven. Those killed included several very young children. Al-Shabaab later arrested the killers but they were ultimately released due to clan pressure.

Property destruction: Unidentified attackers burned down three houses in Marka town in the night of 18/04. The destroyed houses belong to members of the Habar Gidir sub-clan and is believed to be related to clan revenge. Three generators used for farm irrigation were also destroyed in Jeebeey Village (17km W of Marka) on 17/04. The destroyed generators also belong to Habar Gidir farmers.

Property destruction: Unidentified attackers burned down three houses in Marka town in the night of 18/04. The destroyed houses belong to members of the Habar Gidir sub-clan and is believed to be related to clan revenge. Three generators used for farm irrigation were also destroyed in Jeebeey Village (17km W of Marka) on 17/04. The destroyed generators also belong to Habar Gidir farmers.

Property destruction: Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at Karaan District Police Station in the night of 18/04. The device landed on an empty space, causing no casualties. The perpetrators escaped.

Four armed men driving a Toyota Noah vehicle killed a NISA government officer and Boondheere District officer in a drive-by shooting in the vicinity of Nasiib Buundo (Boondheere District) in the afternoon of 18/04. Security forces confronted with the attackers near General Daud neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) following the attack. Seeing the security forces, the perpetrators went out of the vehicle and started to resist. An explosion believed to be remotely detonated by the attackers blew up immediately. One of the attackers was killed in the exchange of gunfire and another one with injuries was captured by the security forces. One female bystander was also killed in the blast.

Four armed men driving a Toyota Noah vehicle killed a NISA government officer and Boondheere District officer in a drive-by shooting in the vicinity of Nasiib Buundo (Boondheere District) in the afternoon of 18/04. Security forces confronted with the attackers near General Daud neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) following the attack. Seeing the security forces, the perpetrators went out of the vehicle and started to resist. An explosion believed to be remotely detonated by the attackers blew up immediately. One of the attackers was killed in the exchange of gunfire and another one with injuries was captured by the security forces. One female bystander was also killed in the blast.

ISWA forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters in War Caddey (37km SW of Rab Dhuure) in the morning of 19/04. One al Shabaab fighter was killed and two others were injured after the two sides engaged in gunfire. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew while ISWA forces returned to Waajid.

Unidentified armed men killed seven civilians in the vicinity of Sinai (12km SW of Marka) in the night of 19/04. Reports indicate that the victims belong to the same family. The motive behind the attack is not known but unconfirmed reports indicate that the attack might be a clan revenge. The victims hail from Biimaal clan.

Local media reported that unidentified attackers fired a RPG against a lorry parked inside Afgooye town in the night of 19/04. The district police stated that they are investigating the incident. The driver and his conductor were both killed while the lorry, which was loaded with business supplies, was completely destroyed.

A SNG soldier shot and killed a man, working for a money transfer company at Bundo Weyne bridge check-point in the evening of 19/04. The soldier was arrested and is being investigated. Reports further indicate the two days before; an unknown person hurled a hand grenade at the same check-point, causing no injuries.

Gunmen opened fire in a drive-by shooting against a public mini-bus in the vicinity of former milk factory (Hodan District) in the evening of 19/04. Reports indicate that the gunmen were allegedly SNA personnel. Three passengers were reportedly killed in the shooting. Banadir Regional Administration spokesman stated that the Ministry of Defence has handed over the perpetrators to the Regional Administration for trial.

A vehicle carrying Khat from Mogadishu to Marka was hit by an IED in Abrone neighbourhood (Marka) in the afternoon of 20/04. One passenger was killed and the driver was injured in the blast. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM (unknown Djibouti or Ethiopia), SNG and Galmudug security forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters in Ulajarad village (21km SE of Ceel Buur) in the morning of 20/04. A source known as Goobjoog reported 25 dead.

The newly trained ISWA police carried out their first Security operation in villages under Baidoa district on 20/04. Report indicate that they clashed with al Shabaab fighters for 30 minutes in War Cadoy village (3 KM SW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 20/04. Two al Shabaab fighters died in the fighting.
ISWA forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters in the outskirts of Baidoa on 20/04 and killed two al Shabaab fighters.

A man hailing from the Dhulbahante/Bah Cabdale sub-clan shot and killed a man hailing from the Warsangeli/Baha Ogayslabe sub-clan near Damale-Xagare Village (115km SE of Ceerigaabo) on 20/04. The shooting is reportedly related to a previous killing between the two sub-clans. The perpetrator escaped.

Armed militiamen suspected to be from the Biimaal sub-clan shot and killed a civilian in Lafoole College neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the early morning of 20/04. The motive is said to be related to the ongoing clan revenge killings between Biimaal and Habar Gidir. The perpetrators managed to escape. At the same time, suspected Biimaal gunmen shot and killed a civilian man from Habar Gidir in Xaawo Taako neighbourhood (Afgooye) in the morning of 20/04. The perpetrators escaped and tensions are high in the area as fears grow over a possible escalation of the ongoing revenge killings between the two sub-clans.
Unidentified men shoot and kill two government soldiers in Hodan District on 21/04.

An IED was planted on 21/04 near a bridge in Baardheere Town frequently used by ENDF vehicles. A Tuk-Tuk (food truck) drove over the device and exploded injuring the driver and two passengers, who were brought to Baardheere hospital for treatment. Perpetrators managed to escape and no arrests were reported.

Unidentified attackers shot and injured a security guard of a petrol station in Shalaambood (8km SW of Marka) on 21/04. The victim is from Habar Gidir and the motive is believed to be related to the ongoing clan revenge killings between Habar Gidir and Biimaal sub-clans in the region.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded an ISWA soldier who hails from Rahanwayn sub clan of Leysan Orse in Bulo Iiidow village (approx. 5km NW of Afqooye) in the night of 21/04. Reports indicate that al Shabaab abducted him from Bulo Iidow and they beheaded him the outskirt of the town. The resident community confirmed that the victim was an ISWA newly trained soldier who comes from Bardalle but now he was a civilian working for building company.
Gunmen from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud shot and injured a man from same sub-clan in Qoryacad neighbourhood in Qardho on the afternoon of 21/04. The motive is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a young girl in Ceel-Jaale (6km SW of Marka) in afternoon of 21/04. The motive is believed to be clan revenge. According to the ground information the young victim hails from Habar Gidir but her mother is Biimaal and that is why she was targeted. The attackers managed to escape.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed two police officers in the vicinity of Bakara junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 21/04. The victims were collecting tax revenue from the vehicles when the incident happened. Perpetrators escaped from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A land mine plated at Aawdiinle by al Shaabab detonates, killing six Ethiopian soldiers, including a commander.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Troops of Somalia and the AMISOM killed at least three members of al Shabaab and injured four others in an operation in the Bakool villages of Warcaddoy, Goobad and Gumuro. The joint forces gained control of all three areas.

Kenyan air forces launch attacks on al Shabaab locations at Behani and Abdalla Birole, both near Kismayo, on the evening on 22/04. Casualties not known. There was no immediate verification of the casualties on al Shabaab, but the Jubbaland commander says senior militant leaders were targeted in the airstrike.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Troops of Somalia and the AMISOM killed at least three members of al Shabaab and injured four others in an operation in the Bakool villages of Warcaddoy, Goobad and Gumuro. The joint forces gained control of all three areas.

ISWA security forces went to Buulo Xaawo (60 KM SW of Baidoa) on security operation as result of the killing of a man in the morning on 22/04. After a brief armed clash, al Shabaab fighters abandoned the village and fled. Two al Shabaab affiliated women (unknown if they were combatants or simply loyal to al Shabaab) were shot and killed by ISWA forces as they were unable to flee.

Group of youth staged demonstration against SONYO Umbrella organization and Ministry of Youth near Imperial Hotel in Hargeisa on 22/04. The demonstrators requested Somaliland president against the two institutions for their failure to create youth development projects to prevent illegal migration to Europe. This demonstration comes days after a boat heading to Europe carrying many Somaliland youths sunk.

Group of youth staged demonstration against SONYO Umbrella organisation and Ministry of Youth in Ceel-Afweyn on 22/04. The demonstrators requested Somaliland president take action against the two institutions for their failure to create youth development projects to prevent illegal migration to Europe. This demonstration comes days after a boat heading to Europe carrying many Somaliland youths sunk.

Suspected Biimaal militia raided the residence of Habar Gidir man in Muuri Village (17km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 22/04. The owner reportedly managed to escape. Two civilian bystanders were killed in the attack. The motive is said be clan retaliation. The tension between the militia of the two clans is escalating and expanding to new areas.
A farmer from Shiidle minority clan was shot and killed by suspected Abgaal militia at his farm in Raage Ceele (46 KM NE of Warsheikh) on 22/04. The motive is unknown and no arrests were reported.

Kenyan air forces launch attacks on al Shabaab locations at Behani and Abdalla Birole, both near Kismayo, on the evening on 22/04. Casualites not known. There was no immediate verification of the casualties on al Shabaab, but the Jubbaland commander says senior militant leaders were targeted in the airstrike.

A gunman from Dhulbahante/Egal Naleeye sub-clan reportedly shot and killed his fellow clansman in the vicinity of 22/04 for undisclosed dispute. The perpetrator was the brother of an al Shabaab prisoner (Jama Kuutiye-held in a Somaliland prison) who killed Kenyan lady working for GTZ in 2004.The murderer reportedly escaped.

NISA forces seized a vehicle carrying suspected al Shabaab fighters and explosives/weapons at Hararayale junction on 22/04. The occupants were arrested and explosives were seized. Unconfirmed reports indicate that NISA forced the arrested occupants to call the bomb maker but instead a vehicle laden with explosives arrived and exploded, killing one and wounded two other NISA soldiers.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Troops of Somalia and the AMISOM killed at least three members of al Shabaab and injured four others in an operation in the Bakool villages of Warcaddoy, Goobad and Gumuro. The joint forces gained control of all three areas.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Ten are dead as Liyu Police paramilitaries clash with local residents in Dhac Dheer. At the time of the report (23/04) the fighting was still ongoing.

column6: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: An armed land dispute clash occurred between Liyu Police paramilitaries (Ethiopian special police) and Habar-gidir/Sacaad clan militia at the Somalia/Ethiopian border in Daacdheer (approx. 100 KM SW of Galkacyo) on 23/04. Reported casualty figures are still very controversial but most local media report that 20 people died and around 40 were injured from both sides. As of 24/04, no other clashes were reported from the area.

A group of gunmen from Cidagale sub-clan attacked Somaliland police escorting water drilling rig in Qool-Caday area (45Km S of Hargeisa) on 23/04. The incident happened after local elders reportedly rejected the water drilling project in the area to provide water for a ranching project. Three police officers and two militiamen were injured in the shoot-out.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An AMISOM convoy, travelling from Shalaambood (10 KM NW of Marka) to Ceel Jaale (6 KM NW of Marka) were hit by a suspected al Shabaab road-side bomb. Villagers reported a gun-fight after the explosion but casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab launched an attack against AMISOM base in Buulo Sheekh (5 KM SE of Qoryoley) in the night of 23/04. Casualties cannot be confirmed at this stage.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab launched an attack against AMISOM base in the outskirts of Qoryoley in the night of 23/04. Casualties cannot be confirmed at this stage.

Two unknown men, armed with pistols shot and killed the chairman of Hawl-Wadaag neighbourhood of Belet Weyne on 23/04. The perpetrators managed to escape. The motive is unknown as reportedly some people were opposing his leadership and on the other hand, al Shabaab activities seem to increase in the village.
Unknown attackers hurled a hand grenade in a populated tea-shop in the evening of 23/04 in Buur Hakaba. So far three people are confirmed injured by the explosion. Perpetrators managed to escape.

Villagers found the decapitated body of a man hailing from Leysan sub-clan in Buulo Xaawo (60 KM SW of Baidoa) on 23/04. Reports indicate that he was accused by al Shabaab to work with and spy for ISWA, though the source does not further identify the possible perpetrator.

""A local female INGO staff worker was detained by Al-Shabaab fighters in Jamaame. She and five other civilians were detained at the same time and put in jail. She was on leave at the time and accused of working for an American NGO. She spent more than a week in prison and was conditionally released (she was required to stay in the village pending investigation on the charges brought against her by Al-Shabaab). The aid worker was released on April 24th, 2016.""

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab propaganda reports an attack on AMISOM-ENDF in Waajid district on 24/04, causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab propaganda reports an attack on AMISOM-ENDF and SNG forces at Diinsoor on 24/04. The attack resulted in a ""ferocious"" fighting, causalities not reported.

Citizens of Jidhi area (90 KM SW) demonstrated against a local NGO distributing food aid, after they brought a food donation that was not sufficient for the people of that area, as a huge number of them from neighbouring zones and requested the employees to add them to the beneficiaries' list. However the NGO representatives couldn't fulfil this request. They ran from the scene after they noticed the mob could not be controlled. The food aid was looted.

Baardheere police station was targeted with a suspected IED on 24/06. The device exploded injuring two local police men and a woman present at the station. They were rushed to the hospital for treatment. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Reports indicate that SNGF on security operation clashed in Warmahan (30 KM NW of Afgooye on 24/04. Casualties or outcome cannot be established at the moment.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM Military camp in Buulo Mareer (28 KM SW of Marka) on 24/04. Al Shabaab fighters attacked the camp from several directions. al Shabaab fighters retreated, causalities from both sides are unknown.

ISWA special police and military forces went on security operation to Raydabow (22 KM NW of Buur Hakaba) on 24/04. First al Shabaab left the village without resistance but left some operatives back in town. Special Forces surrounded a house were some fighters stayed and tried to arrest them. First reports state that one fighter exploded while five others were shot and killed. Three al Shabaab fighters were taken into custody. Elsewhere on the town, military forces clashed with al Shabaab, killing three, and taking their bodies to nearby Buur Xakaba.

Two gunmen from Warsangeli sub-clan shot and killed a security guard of Golis Telecommunication Company in Bosasso on the evening of 24/04. The motive is reportedly a dispute between the perpetrators and the victim. The victim hails from Majeerteen/Isa Mohamud sub-clan. Police arrested the perpetrators.

ISWA soldier opened gun fire against a crowd watching the display of three dead al Shabaab that have been brought from the fight in Raydabow on 24/04 to Buur Hakaba. The injured people, a business man and two women, hit by stray bullets were rushed for medical support to Baidoa Hospital.

Unidentified armed men shot and killed a man, said to work with the SNG in front of his house in Talex neighbourhood between the two evening prayers on 24/04. First attackers throw stones against the victim's vehicle to make him come out of his residence before they shot and killed him. No arrests were reported.

Fishermen in Berbera staged a demonstration on 25/04 in protest against new taxes introduced by Somaliland's Ministry of Fisheries. The protestors marched in the streets and burnt tyres. Anti-riot police dispersed them and arrested three protestors.

ISWA Forces carried out an attack on an al Shabaab base in Yowkoyow village (32KM SE of Xudur) in the early morning of 25/04. Reports indicate that both sides suffered an unknown number of causalities and that al Shabaab vacated the base.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a business man in livestock Market (Heliwa) in the afternoon of 25/04 while opening his shop. the perpetrators escaped.
At least four soldiers have been injured after gunmen attacked the residence of a Somali member of parliament in Hodan District on 26/04.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: The Islamic State (IS) section in Somalia issued a statement claiming responsibility for their first attack in Somalia. The statement, circulated on social media, declared that its fighters detonated an IED against an AMISOM vehicle in the vicinity of Tredisha.(km13 on the Afgoye road) in the outskirts of Mogadishu, on 26/04. The authors of the communique admitted not knowing what the results of the attack were: death or injuries, or mere damage to the vehicle. The African Union Mission representative in Somalia, Lt. Col. Joe Kibet, admitted that an IED had struck a convoy of six vehicles moving from a Ugandan AMISOM forward operating base towards Mogadishu International Airport but stated that the explosion had missed its target and caused no damage whatsoever. This was confirmed by Abdikamil Moalim Shukri, speaking for Somalia's Ministry of Internal Security. This statement marks the first time IS officially assumes authorship for an attack in Somalia.

SNGF, with the support of AMISOM, took over Janale town (13 KM NW of Marka) in the morning of 26/04 without any fight. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew before their arrival. Forces conducted house to house searches and one IED exploded, injuring four SNGF. Around 17:00 in the late afternoon, joint forces withdrew again and returned to their base in Shalaambood (7 KM SW of Marka). Al Shabaab fighters immediately returned to the town. The motive of this in and out operation into Janaale is unknown. No other casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNG/ISWA forces base in Daynuunaay (19km SE of Baidoa) in the early morning of 26/04. The two sides reportedly engaged in heavy fighting. Al Shabaab fighters were also reported to have ambushed SNG/ISWA reinforcement from Baidoa on the road between Daynuunaay and Baidoa. Reports indicate al Shabaab gained control of the village, but withdrew an hour later. Both sides suffered losses, however, the exact figures could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED exploded in Garasiyani village (55km NW of Bulo Burte) in the afternoon of 26/04. The device detonate in a shade where AMISOM (unknown origin) convoys usually stops between Beled Weyne and Halgan. Two civilians were injured and taken to Beled Weyne for treatment.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: SNGF, with the support of AMISOM, took over Janale town (13 KM NW of Marka) in the morning of 26/04 without any fight. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew before their arrival. Later, forces conducted house to house searches and one IED exploded, injuring four SNGF. Around 17:00 in the late afternoon, joint forces withdrew again and returned to their base in Shalaambood (7 KM SW of Marka). Al Shabaab fighters immediately returned to the town. The motive of this in and out operation into Janaale is unknown. No other casualties were reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: SNGF, with the support of AMISOM, took over Janale town (13 KM NW of Marka) in the morning of 26/04 without any fight. Al Shabaab fighters withdrew before their arrival. Later, forces conducted house to house searches and one IED exploded, injuring four SNGF. Around 17:00 in the late afternoon, joint forces withdrew again and returned to their base in Shalaambood (7 KM SW of Marka). Al Shabaab fighters immediately returned to the town. The motive of this in and out operation into Janaale is unknown. No other casualties were reported.

Nearly 40 battle wagons with large number of pro-Puntland troops and other Dhulbahante clan militias onboard, reportedly gathered and staged parade against the president of Khatumo administration Prof. Ali Khalif Galayr in Buuhoodle on 26/04. The protestors marched on the streets chanting anti-Khatumo president slogans accusing him of fuelling the ongoing insecurity in the region. The protestors shot bullets using light weapons and artillery rounds in the air ordering the Khatumo president to leave Buuhoodle.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An unidentified attacker hurled a hand grenade against AMISOM soldiers on foot patrol near Qoryooley Bridge in the evening of 26/04. The forces opened fire in all directions in response to the blast. Three SNG soldiers and a civilian bystander were injured by the blast. The attacker managed to escape.

A gunman hailing from Daarod/Jibrahiil sub-clan shot and killed another man from Dhulbahante/Jamac Siyaad sub-clan in Ceerigaabo on 26/04. The dispute was reportedly related to Khat business. The perpetrator was arrested by the police. The Somaliland military set up checkpoints in the town as a precautionary measure against clan retaliation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A group of Jubaland intelligence forces attacked an al Shabaab position in Shandarmood (Approx. 20km NW of Kismaayo) in the morning of 26/04. The attackers claimed to have killed two al Shabaab fighters while injuring two others, however, this claim could not be independently verified. Shortly after the attack the Jubaland forces returned to their base.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AMISOM/KDF and Jubaland security forces jointly launched an offensive operation against a fortified al Shabaab checkpoint in Abdale Birole Village (41km SW of Kismaayo) in the morning of 26/04. The allied forces overran & destroyed it and took control of the village after a brief armed clash. Following the takeover, the Jubaland forces torched an al Shabaab shelter next to the checkpoint. Later the Jubaland forces met with clan elders and discussed the security situation in the area. No casualties were reported from either side.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a local businessman in the vicinity of Salaam neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the morning of 26/04. The victim was opening his shop when the incident happened. The attackers escaped.

Tensions ran high after gunmen from the Dhulbahante/Reer Hagar sub-clan opened fire against vehicles from the Ali Geri. The incident happened in the outskirts of Buuhoodle, on 27/04, and was reportedly triggered by a dispute between Reer Hagar and Ali Geri sub-clans about khat supplies to the town. Elders from both sides stepped in to mediate and avoid escalation of the conflict. One person from the Ali Geri sub-clan was killed, while two others were injured, including a bystander woman.

Two rival youth gangs from Dhulbahante & Habar-Yunis clashed using clubs in Kulmiye neighbourhood (Ceerigaabo) on 27/04. The fighting was reportedly related to the killing of a Dhulbahante man by a Darood/Jibrahiil member who has blood ties with the Habar-Yunis. (Specific events of which, location not known) Police arrested five members from both groups.
Al Shabaab launched an attack on a military base in Hodan District on the evening of 28/04. The attack was described as ""bloody,"" though no word of causalities.
Al Shabaab attacks government forces in Biyo Cadde, one dead, others wounded.
Al Shabaab fighters launched an attack against SNGF base in Biyo-Cado (37km NE of Jowhar) in the night of 28/04. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG police in the Black Sea neighbourhood, in the evening of 28/04. After five minutes of fighting the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched simultaneous hit and run attacks against SNG forces' positions in former Perfume Factory and Ex-control Balcad neighborhoods in the evening of 28/04. Both sides briefly exchanged gunfire after which the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG and ASMISOM forces overtake the Shabeellaha Dhexe areas of Runir-god, Nur-dugle and Ad-adey. Though the forces were met with resistance, there were no reported causalities.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG and ASMISOM forces overtake the Shabeellaha Dhexe areas of Runir-god, Nur-dugle and Ad-adey. Though the forces were met with resistance, there were no reported causalities.

Al Shabaab launches a coordinated attack on a SNG military base in Heliwa district. Soldiers at the base managed to ward off the attack after engaging heavy gun battle with the attackers. Residents said both sides suffered casualties, but there are no confirmed figures.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Five unknown armed men and Jubaland security forces who were on foot patrol clashed in Shaqalaha neighbourhood in Kismaayo town on 29/04 night. After a brief exchange of fire the men escaped into Shaqalaha neighborhood with no casualties from both sides. A large number of security officers were deployed in the neighborhoods to search for the offenders and arrested around seven people, accused to be connected with the attack.

Unidentified men armed with AK- 47 rifles reportedly shot and killed a pregnant woman and injured her husband at their home in an area near Buulo Bacley IDP camp in Galkacyo on the night of 29/04. The motive of the shooting is not yet clear. The victims hail from southern Somalia. No arrest were made.

Arrests: SNGF on security operation apprehended a vehicle laden with explosives in the vicinity of Royal Restaurant on 29/04 which was supposedly the target. The restaurant is usually frequented by Diaspora. The device was diffused and no casualties and no arrests were reported.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters fired heavy machine guns against a NISA post in Aymiska neighborhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the evening of 29/04. The two sides exchanged fire for about 20 minutes after which the attackers withdrew. A NISA soldier was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Two civilians are injured after a roadside bomb struck an AMISOM-ENDF convoy in Nuur Fanaax (Nuur Fanah). A truck was reported destroyed. It is not clear if there were any AMISOM causalities.

A hand grenade was hurled against a Jubaland intelligence vehicle at Qalinle Junction in Gulwade section of Shaqalaha Neighborhood (Kismaayo) on 30/04. Reports indicate that the head of the intelligence's finance office was driving the vehicle. The device landed in an open space after the vehicle passed the junction and no casualties were reported.

SNGF on military operation took over Ruun-Nirgood (63km SE of Adan Yabal) and other small settlements in the outskirts before midday of 30/04. No clashes were reported and AS vacated the villages before arrival of the SNGF.

Al Shabaab fighters and Warsangeli clan militia reportedly clashed in Geeldora area (50km S of Laas-Qoray) in the morning of 30/04. The motive of the incident is probably related to the decision of Warsangeli elders to oppose the growing influence of al Shabaab in the areas, as it is reported that al Shabaab fighters descended from Galgala area to stop local clan militias from organizing and mobilizing themselves. There are no immediate reports of casualties.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked a taxi (Probox) transporting Khat from Bilis Qooqaani to charcoal camps in Kismaayo District in the afternoon of 30/04. The driver and two other armed occupants briefly exchanged fire with the al Shabaab fighters and managed to escape in the bush leaving behind their car. Three al Shabaab fighters were killed in the shootout while al Shabaab burnt down the cargo and confiscated the car.
Warsangeli clans clash with al Shabaab at Geed La Rifay on 30/04. Casualties not known.

column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
column17: A SNGF soldier shot and killed a military commander in Baardheere town in the afternoon of 30/04. SNGF arrested the perpetrator. The motive behind killing is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland Special Force unit trained to conduct hit and run attacks, attacked al Shabaab position located at Abdi Dhoore Village (30km W of Kismaayo) on 30/04. The attack lasted more than 30 minutes and Jubaland forces claim to have killed three al Shabaab fighters and injured an unknown number of others. After the attack Jubaland forces returned to their base.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration; Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017)
column17: Joint AMISOM/SNG/Galmudug forces re-took Galcad village (65km NW of Ceel Dheer) from al Shabaab on 30/04. Casualties not known.

An IED explosion took place in Liberia road in Waberi/Medina District. So far no casualties are reported. The owner/driver parked her vehicle in front of her house, and was not on board when the vehicle exploded. The motive is unknown but her husband is said to work for the SNG.
Two SNA (Somali National Army) soldiers were killed and eight wounded in a live market blast in Ooryooley on 01/05. Authorities suspected al Shabaab as the perpetrator.

Unidentified armed men in military uniforms opened fire at a truck carrying passengers in Ceeldoofaar Village (90km S of Bosasso) in the afternoon of 01/05. Two passengers were injured in the shooting. The motive was unclear. No arrests were made.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Unknown attackers hurled two hand grenades against an AMISOM/SNGF post in Ruusia neighborhood on 01/05. The grenades failed to hit the intended target but instead injured three civilian bystanders. SNGF started a security operation after the attack but no arrest was reported.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked Ruun-Nirgood (63km SE of Adan Yabal) in the morning of 01/05 from three different directions. There are reports of population displacement due to the ongoing fierce fighting. Reports indicate that al Shabaab managed to take control of the village again and have seized some military vehicles. Unconfirmed reports indicate that more than 20 SNGF were killed including two senior commanders. Al Shabaab claims 50 Somali dead.

An IED exploded at a SNGF check-point at the animal market in Qoryooley on 01/05. Two SNG soldiers were killed while two others and a civilian bystander were injured. No arrest was reported in connection with the incident.

Two groups from Gadabuursi and Issa clashed using daggers and sticks in Xariirad (57km NW of Borama) on 01/05 following a dispute over ownership of a water-well. The skirmishes started after one group tried to fence off the water point, triggering conflict with the other group. Police arrived at the scene and separated the two fighting groups. Three people - two from Gadabuursi and one from Issa - were injured. It is feared the current tension might degenerate into more armed clashes.

A body of a six year old girl was found in October neighborhood of Burco on 01/05. Police are still searching and investigating the perpetrator(s). This is second case of a similar incident in Burco where a 10 year old girl was killed.
Two unknown gunmen shot and killed a SNG soldier in Suuq Liif neighborhood and took the victim's gun. The perpetrators escaped.
Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and seriously injured a man working for SNG in Liberia neighborhood on 01/05. The perpetrators escaped.
At least two people were reportedly wounded following a hand-grenade explosion at a mosque in Mogadishus Waberi district on the night of 2 May. Perpatrators not known.

An unknown attacker hurled a hand grenade against a SNGF outpost at Bunda Weyne Bridge on 02/05. A civilian bystander was injured in the explosion. Following the explosion, SNG soldiers fired a warning shot to stop a tuk-tuk approaching the bridge, which killed a passenger.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a SNGF convoy between Captain Laas (approx. 16km W of Marka) and Shalaambood (8km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 02/05. The two sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 20 minutes after which the al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established.
Unknown men, armed with pistols shot and killed a school teacher in Hawl-Wadaag neighborhood on 02/05. The motive is unknown while the attackers escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters burnt 7 donkey carts transporting charcoal, slaughtered the donkeys and arrested over 27 charcoal burners near Canjeel village (30km N of Kismaayo) in the morning of 02/05. Further reports indicate they have also killed three charcoal burners in the same area after they allegedly refused to surrender to al Shabaab fighters.

An unknown attacker hurled a hand grenade against a SNGF outpost at Bunda Weyne Bridge on 02/05. A civilian bystander was injured in the explosion. Following the explosion, SNG soldiers fired a warning shot to stop a tuk-tuk approaching the bridge, which killed a passenger.

About hundred people, mostly women, staged a demonstration in front of the parliament and the ministry of finance in Garowe in the morning of 02/05. The demonstrators reportedly protested over the depreciation of the Somali shilling against the dollar, which caused inflation. Reports indicate that several vehicles were damaged by the protestors.

SNG forces shot and killed two women in Walaq Village (63km NW of Baidoa) in the evening of 02/05. Reports indicate that the government forces came from Waajid, came across these women and started shooting at them. The motive behind the killing is unknown and the perpetrators are under police custody.

An IED, apparently attached to a private vehicle, exploded close to Kulan Pharmacy on Liberia road on 02/05. The target is said to be a NISA officer who frequently pass the area. No casualties were reported. NISA personnel conducted a security operation and arrested a number of youths after the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An AMISOM supply convoy was targeted with an IED at Ex-Control Balcad on 02/05 afternoon. A vehicle was damaged by the explosion and no other casualties were reported.

Reports indicate that a senior AS commander called Abu Ayman from Bajuni clan was captured by AS in Jamaame in the evening of 03/05. His capture is reportedly related to his supposed intention to defect to IS.

The Central Command of Somali National Army (SNA) stated that its Special Commandos raided and destroyed an IS training camp in Janaale (13km NW of Marka) on 03/05. According to information released by state run media, the Special forces killed 12 IS fighters including a foreign fighter (a photo of his corpse appeared in the media) and captured other fighters alive. This claim could not be independently verified. Currently the town is controlled by al Shabaab. Contradictory reports indicate that the operation was conducted in Jamaame district (Lower Juba) and not in Janaale.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces clashed with clan militiamen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sacad sub-clan manning an illegal checkpoint at the outskirt of Galkacyo (2km S of Galkacyo) in the morning of 03/05.
