The two sides exchanged fire for about 30 minutes after which the clan militias withdrew. The fighting reportedly broke out after Galmudug forces reached the area to convince the militias to leave the area (in an effort to clear the roads south of Galkacyo of militia checkpoints). Two combatants were reportedly killed in the clash and four others were injured while eight clan militias were arrested by the Galmudug forces.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces clashed with clan militiamen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sacad sub-clan manning an illegal checkpoint at the outskirt of Galkacyo (2km S of Galkacyo) in the morning of 03/05. The two sides exchanged fire for about 30 minutes after which the clan militias withdrew. The fighting reportedly broke out after Galmudug forces reached the area to convince the militias to leave the area (in an effort to clear the roads south of Galkacyo of militia checkpoints). Two combatants were reportedly killed in the clash and four others were injured while eight clan militias were arrested by the Galmudug forces.

Mortars rounds were fired from an unknown location (most likely from Kaxda in Dharkenleey) against MIA (local airport) in the morning of 03/05. It is confirmed that five rounds (probably B10) landed inside MIA and at least one round inside the UN compound, Waaberi District. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility through their Radio Andalus (a pro-AS local FM) and stated that the purpose of the attack was to scare the newly arrived British soldiers. It is not clear if the soldiers were in fact a target. No casualties were reported.

Detonation: An unknown assailant hurled a hand grenade against a SNG police outpost at Hawl-Wadaag road junction in the evening of 03/05. The device landed in an open area and no one was injured. The perpetrator escaped.

Shooting, Galbeed Police Station, Dharkenleey District, Mogadishu, 03/05/2016, 08:30. Two SNG police officers were involved in a shootout following an escalated dispute in Galbeed Police Station (Dharkenleey District) in the morning of 03/04. As a result of the shooting, one of them was killed while the other was injured. Other police officers in the area arrested the injured officer and investigated the incident.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug gunmen and a militia from Dhusamareb clash leading to a number of deaths.
At least one policeman is killed and four others injured in a grenade attack by unidentified assailants at a livestock market in Afgoye town.

More than 200 local residents staged a peaceful demonstration in protest over the increasing exchange rate of the dollar against the Somali shilling in the proximity of Bosasso Main Market (milk section) and the main tarmac road in the morning of 04/05. Business premises were closed during the protest. The event ended peacefully.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Reports indicate that six mortar rounds were fired by Al Shabaab and hit Kismaayo airport. So far no casualties were reported and Kenyan AMISOM are firing artillery back in the suspected direction.

The Central Command of Somali National Army (SNA) stated that its Special Commandos raided and destroyed an IS training camp in Janaale (13km NW of Marka) on 03/05. According to information released by state run media, the Special forces killed 12 IS fighters including a foreign fighter (a photo of his corpse appeared in the media) and captured other fighters alive. This claim could not be independently verified. Currently the town is controlled by al Shabaab. Contradictory reports indicate that the operation was conducted in Jamaame district (Lower Juba) and not in Janaale.

A group of tricycle (tuktuk) drivers clashed with a group of taxi operators using machetes in Burco on 04/05, over disputes related to the exploitation of public transportation routes. This disorder started after the local authority allowed taxi operators to work the same routes as public buses and tuktuks. The tuktuk drivers, opposing the new rules, blocked some roads with their tuktuks. Police arrived at the scene and arrested number of tuktuk drivers.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland interior minister is injured, along with others, during crossfire between two groups of Puntland security forces.

SNA forces took over Cali-Gaduud Village (48km NE of Cadale) in the morning of 05/05 without resistance from al Shabaab militants. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly withdrew from the village prior the arrival of the forces. Report indicate that the forces were on their way towards Ruun-Nirgood town, which al Shabaab fighters took over on 01/05, following a fierce battle between al Shabaab fighters and the SNA forces.

An unknown assailant hurled a hand grenade against a tea-shop in the centre of town, frequented by ISWA Special Police Forces (SPF) on 05/05. A civilian bystander was injured. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A road-side IED, said to be previously planted by suspected al Shabaab members, was remotely detonated, killing one soldier and wounding another in the proximity of Puntland forces' defence base in Galgala (45km SW of Bosasso) on 05/05. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against a group SNG forces on foot patrol in the vicinity of Maajo neighbourhood (Waaberi District) in the night of 05/05. SNG forces conducted security operation in the following morning and arrested unidentified number of suspects from the area. Casualties are unknown.
Demonstrators rally in support of Galmudug State forces who are clearing illegal checkpoints in Galkayo.
Al-Shabab fighters claim killing two government soldiers in Burhakaba District of Bay Region.
Islamic state fighters assaulted National intelligence agency (NISA) troops with ""light weapons"" in Sinkadir area in the outskirts of Mogadishu. Casualties not reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: At least two Al-Shabaab militants were killed and two government soldiers injured after the insurgents attacked a local administrator of Bardhere town in Gedo region. AMISOM-ENDF were also involved.

Six people from Majeerten/Omar Mohamud sub-clan were kidnapped by suspected armed clan militias from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud sub-clan in Sanjilbo Village (8km NE of Qardho) on the evening of 06/05. The perpetrators took their captives to Xabaalreer Village (47km NE of Qardho).

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Three Galmudug security force members started shooting at Galmudug interim headquarters to express their dissatisfaction over unpaid salaries on 06/05. Other forces at headquarters responded with gun-fire and the three soldiers managed to escape.
Demonstration to support Somalias Supreme Court chairman held in Mogadishu.
Hand grenade explosion targeting government forces injures three in Mogadishu.

Small scale traders staged a demonstration in front of the parliament building in Garowe on the morning of 07/05 in protest against the depreciation of the Somali shilling against the dollar, which caused inflation. The protestors called on Puntland government to look into the current inflation caused by the depreciation of the Somali shilling.
Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds against SNGF base in Baardheere Airport in the night of 07/05. Reports indicate that five mortars landed at the base. Casualties could not be established.

Two groups of SNG forces fought in the vicinity of Xaawa Taako neighbourhood in Afgooye in the morning of 07/05. The motive behind the intra-clash is unknown. One soldier and a civilian bystander were reportedly injured in the shoot-out.

Ceerigaabo local municipal council supported by the police destroyed small kiosks constructed illegally at the central grocery market in Ceerigaabo on 07/05. A group of kiosk owners attempted to stop the operations but three were arrested by the police.

Suspected Biimaal militia shot and killed a mentally sick civilian man in the vicinity of Buufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the morning of 07/05. The victim hails from Habar-Gidir, and was heading to Marka on foot when he was intercepted by the militiamen. The motive is believed to be clan revenge.

Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a prominent businessman called Omar Abdulle 'Omar Dheere' in Israac neighbourhood of Galkacyo (North) in the evening of 07/05. The victim was reportedly shot after the dusk prayer while leaving Salama Mosque. The perpetrators escaped.

Armed group hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sacad sub-clan shot and killed a house-wife and injured two of her children near Ceel-lahelay (44 km S of Jariiban) in the evening of 06/05. The motive is believed to be related to clan-revenge. The victims are nomadic family ad hail from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNG police on foot patrol in the vicinity of Abu Hureyra Mosque in Bakaara Market (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 07/05. The government forces opened gunfire after the blast. Two civilian bystanders and two police constables were injured in the attack. The attackers escaped.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a police checkpoint in the vicinity of the livestock market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 07/05. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

An unknown perpetrator armed with an AK-47 rifle shot and killed a civilian in Xero Ruush (Hodan District) in the evening of 07/05. The victim was operating a shop in Xero Ruush neighbourhood. The perpetrator escaped.

Al Shabaab clash with South-West Administration militia in Bardaale on 08/05, killing two militiamen and wounding four others. Al-Shabab fighters also captured two rifles from the South West State militiamen.

A group of tuktuk (tricycle) operators staged a demonstration, blocking the main road in front of local government offices in Borama on 08/05, in protest against tax increases. Police arrived at the scene to disperse the protestors, arresting five.

Patrolling SNGF opened gun-fire against a vehicle, suspected to be belong to al Shabaab in Seynilow (31km SW of Xudur) on 08/05. The driver was killed in the shooting while two civilian passengers were injured.

ISWA-SPF attacked an al Shabaab base in Buulo Xaawo (57km SW of Baidoa) on 08/05. Reports indicate that four al Shabaab fighters were killed and two ISWA soldiers were injured in the armed clash. The ISWA forces later returned to their base in Bardale.

ISWA-SPF exchanged gunfire with al Shabaab fighters on a motor-bike near Abaq-Beedey (16km E of Xudur) on 08/05. An al Shabaab fighter was killed while the other managed to escape injured. The ISWA forces returned to their base in Xudur.

The body of an unidentified man with gunshot wounds was discovered in the vicinity of Galkacyo (5km N of Galkacyo) on 08/05. The victim is believed to hail from southern Somalia and seems to have been tied before being shot dead.

Unidentified armed assailants opened fire and injured a businessman from Majeerten/Osman Mohamud in a drive-by shooting in Qardho, on the evening of 08/05. The perpetrators managed to escape. The incident caused tension in Qardho town.

A civilian man was killed by armed Biimaal militiamen manning an illegal checkpoint in Lambar 50 (22km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 08/05. The victim hails from Digil/Tunni sub-clan and the motive behind the killing is unknown.

A suicide car bomber struck the entrance of Somalias traffic police headquarters in the capital on 09/05, killing four people and injuring nine others. Other sources claim between six and nine dead. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

Hundreds of bus drivers gathered and demonstrated against increased taxation by the ISWA administration in the morning of 09/05. The protestors were waving slogans demanding a stop of the tax collection. The gathering was not addressed by anyone and it concluded peacefully.

A RCIED targeted a SNA convoy near Cali Gaduud village (48km NE of Cadale) in the morning of 09/05. The convoy left Cadale and was heading to Cali Gaduud Village when the incident happened. One SNA vehicle was damaged by the blast. Human casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a KDF base in the outskirts of Baardheere town in the night of 09/05. Both sides used different types of gunfire before the al Shabaab militants withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Biimaal militias attacked SNA forces based in Shalaambood settlement (8km W of Marka) in the evening of 09/05. The fighting lasted for few minutes before the armed militias retreated. One combatant was killed and four others were injured in the attack.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against a SNGF base in Buur Dhuxunley (34km SE of Rab Dhuure) on 09/05. After a brief gunfire exchange, the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Gunmen (pastoralist) hailing from Majerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan reportedly shot and killed a herder hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sacaad sub-clan and injured another in the vicinity of Damerale (45km E of Galkacyo) on 09/05. The motive of the shooting was reportedly related to previous clan revenges. The injured man was taken to Galkacyo (South) Hospital for treatment. No arrest was reported.

Unidentified gunmen driving a motorbike shot and killed two civilian men in the vicinity of Afisyooni neighbourhood (Waaberi District) in the morning of 09/05. Banadir Regional Administration stated that they captured the perpetrators.
Two groups of SNG soldiers exchanged gunfire after they became suspicious of each other near the Mayor's Office (Xamar Weyne District) in the afternoon of 09/05. No casualties were reported.
A Somali commando unit kills 15 al Shabaab fighters during a raid on a camp in Galcad on 11/05. The previous day a similar raid took place at Toratorow.

Local pastoralists and al Shabaab fighters clashed in Gamboole village (45km W of Jowhar) in the afternoon of 10/05. The fighting was initiated by al Shabaab fighters following a refusal of the local pastoralists to pay Zakat. After a thirty-minute fight the al Shabaab fighters defeated the pastoralists and confiscated large number of livestock. Four pastoralists were killed.

Unidentified attackers armed with machine guns and hand grenades, believed to be pro-Khatumo, reportedly hurled a hand grenade at the main gate of the governor's residence in Laas Caanood in the night of 10/05. The governor bodyguards and the attackers reportedly exchanged gunfire. Both sides used both light and heavy weapons during the armed clash, which lasted for an hour, after which the attackers retreated. No casualties were reported in that clash. Police and military conducted a joint security operation and searched for the attackers in different neighbourhoods, and in the outskirts of Laas Caanood.

Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNGF base in Waajid town in the night of 10/05. After exchange of gunfire for about 15 minutes, the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
ISWA Police Forces conducted a security operation in Lamo-Warood (11 km north of Diinsoor) on 10/05 and briefly clashed with al Shabaab fighters. No casualties were reported.

More than hundreds of people staged a demonstration in Laas Caanood on 10/05 in protest against depreciation of Somali Shilling against the dollar resulting in high inflation. The protestors were angered about huge amounts of Somali notes, allegedly published by the Puntland administration, that flooded the market. Police arrived at the scene and fired live bullets to disperse the protestors who blocked some roads. No casualties or arrests were reported.
Arrests: Somaliland police arrested a reporter from a local website in Borama on 10/05, after he published a report against 18th May celebration.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Defusal: Jubaland intelligence officers disabled an IED at a tea shop around Kumade at Waamo section of Farjano neighbourhood in Kismaayo in the morning of 10/05 after a tip from the tea shop owner. The intelligence officers disabled the IED safely. No arrests were made thus far.

An IED attached to a vehicle belonging to a civilian man exploded in the vicinity of Liberia road (Waaberi District) in the afternoon of 10/05. A young boy was injured. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces near Caafi water factory alongside industrial road (Dayniile District) in the night of 10/05. The government forces who were reportedly escorting deputy DC of Dayniile opened gunfire after the blast. A district official was reportedly injured.
Unidentified attackers threw a hand grenade against SNG forces on foot patrol in the vicinity of livestock market (Heliwa District) in the evening of 10/05. No casualties were reported.

Weapons Seizure: SNG security forces apprehended a vehicle loaded with explosives in the vicinity of Sayidka Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the morning of 10/05. The vehicle was parked and left in Sayidka Junction and no arrests were made in relation to the incident. The Police (EOD team) reportedly dismantled the device. No casualties were reported.
Gunmen riding motorbikes shot and killed a member of Mogadishu Airport staff on 10/05. No claim of responsibility, though the source names al Shabaab as a possible suspect.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Somali forces raid a al Shabaab base in Tortoroow on 10/05, killing an unknown number of militants, while others were captured. Two unidentified helicopters were also involved in the attack, which several sources believe were the United States.

Residents of Beled Weyne staged a violent demonstration on 11/05 in protest against depreciation of Somali shilling against the dollar. The current rate reached SoSh 30,000 per $1 compared to the previous rate of 22,000. The protestors destroyed small stands used for money exchange and burnt tyres. The current tensions arose after new Somali notes, allegedly printed in Puntland, flooded the market. The local authorities stepped in and announced fixed new rates: buying rate SoSh 23,600 per $1 and selling rate SoSh23, 400 per $1. This move seems to have quelled the protests.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG force's base in former orphanage school (Afgooye) in the night of 11/05. A SNG soldier was reportedly injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit and run attack against AMISOM base in Buufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the night of 11/05. The fighting lasted for about 20 minutes. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

Two clan militias hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sacad and Marehan/Wagardhac sub-clans clashed in an area near Saaxo Village (70km SW of Galkacyo) on 11/05. The motive of the clash was allegedly associated with previous clan clashes and revenge killings between the two sub-cans. Three combatants were allegedly killed in the clash (from both sides), while another was injured. The clash revived tensions in the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a AMISOM position in Mudul Baraawe (5km NW of Baraawe) in the night of 11/05. The fighting lasted for about twenty minutes after which the attackers retreated. Casualties were not reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland Police Marine Forces (PMPF) and militia from Majeerten/Wabeneye clashed over a land dispute in Qaw Village (35 km W of Bosasso) in the morning of 11/05. The fighting broke out after the PMPF ordered workers to stop construction work at a site, claiming the land belonged to PMPF, after which the clan militia came and attacked the PMPF. A militiaman was killed and three others were injured. The PMPF reportedly suffered no casualties. Although local clan elders have intervened, the situation is tense.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces on foot patrol in the vicinity of Carwo-Itko (Wardhiigley District) in the evening of 11/05. The forces opened fire in response to the blast. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack at SNG forces in the vicinity of the Livestock Market (Heliwa District) in the night of 11/05. The fighting lasted for few minutes after which the attackers withdrew. Casualties could not be established.

Unidentified gunmen shot and injured a SNG soldier in Dabaqaynka neighbourhood (Dharkenleey District) in the night of 11/05. The gunmen took a pistol from the victim and disappeared. No arrests reported in connection to this incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Weapons Seizure: Jubaland forces recover a large cache of weapons from al Shabaab in Belet Xaawo region on 11/05, no reported violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: AMISOM and Somali forces attack al Shabaab positions in Mareerey. ""Heavy fighting"" reported, though no report as to the number of causalities.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Somali forces, along with the aid of the United States commando forces, raid a al Shabaab location at Saabid on 12/05. The Pentagon later confirmed five al Shabaab dead and control of the village. Drone blasts were reported during the operation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks Kenyan AMISOM forces at Tabta on 12/05. Al Shabaab claims a ""number of [Kenyan] dead.""
A unidentified herder group clashed with al Shabaab over extortion payments levied against them, 5 dead, ten taken hostage.
Somali forces gain control of Bariirre without violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Defusal: KDF forces manning the main gate to Kismaayo airport discovered a suspected IED which was placed under a tree on 13/05. EOD was informed and discovered the following items: 20-liter plastic container, Motor cycle battery, alternative small battery receiver, connecting wires (cables) and insulating tape wrapped around the container. The items lacked detonator and main charge (explosives). No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNGF troops in Sagaal-Geed (12km SE of Bulo Burte) on 13/05. Both sides exchanged heave gun-fire. Four SNGF were killed and another 11 were wounded in the clash.

ISWA military carried out an ambush attack against al Shabaab base in outskirt of Diinsoor town in the afternoon of 13/05. Reports indicate that both sides exchanged small arms fire. Two mid-level al Shabaab officers reportedly were killed during the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Arrests: ENDF arrested the DC of Garbahaarey, Nuur Sheekh Maxamed Buraale, in the afternoon of 13/05. Reports indicate that he was interrogated for a few hours and later was released. The motive behind the arrest is not known.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters ambushed a vehicle carrying khat in Xagar (3km NE of Bulo Burte) on 13/05. The driver was killed and the vehicle and the khat together with an AK 47 confiscated by al Shabaab.
Unidentified warplanes bomb an al Shabaab base near Afgooye on the evening of 13/05, no reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM forces in Waajid district attack and overtake an al Shabaab base at el-Malable area on 13/05. Nine dead reported.
Unidentified gunmen clash with military forces at Tarbunk intersection in Mogadishu on 13/05, causing undisclosed casualty.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab retreated from several positions in Shabeellaha Dhexe on 13/05, following ""heavy military onslaught"" from AMISOM and SNG forces in the region. No specific towns or villages were named by the source. Causalities unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and Somali forces clash in Buulobarde on 14/05. Five al Shabaab dead, as well as one civilian.
Two Somali police officers on the evening of 14/05 sustained injuries following a landmine explosion on the outskirts of Mogadishu.

Hundreds of people staged demonstration in the vicinity of Sheekh Bashir neighbourhood in Burao on 14/05 in protest against the mayor of Burao Mr. Mohamed Yusuf 'Muraad'. This followed after the locals accused the mayor of failing in his responsibilities and called for him to quite office following heavy floods chanting slangs against the mayor. They also burnt tires during the demonstration.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNA/AMISOM forces took-over Adan Yabaal town in the morning of 14/05. No armed clashes were reported as al Shabaab fighters withdrew from the town before the allied forces entered Adan Yabaal.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: After gaining control of Adan Yabaal, SNA/AMISOM forces set up a base at Mabaax, north of the town.
Al Shabaab assassins shot and killed a SNG soldier in the vicinity of UNICEF MCH (Waaberi District) in the night of 14/05. Perpetrators escaped.

An IED was targeted at a SNG police vehicle by al Shabaab fighters in the vicinity of KM13 (Hodan District) in the morning of 14/05. Two police officers were injured in the attack and the vehicle was partially damaged by the blast. Attackers escaped.

Arrests: SNG NISA forces seized a vehicle and seven laptops from Nasrudiin neighbourhood (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the afternoon of 14/05. Banadir Regional spokesman stated that al Shabaab fighters were planning to use the vehicle and the laptops for explosions. The security forces also arrested a man who was planting explosives into the seized computers. In addition to this, SNG officials added that they found a list of IS operatives in Somalia from the computers.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked a military base in Halgan village in Hiiran region on the night of 15/05, but were repulsed by African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) and Somali forces. No causalities yet confirmed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attack AMISOM and SNG forces in Maxaas, causing ""casualties of death and injuries on both sides of the fighting.""
Al Shabaab executed four older men on 15/05 after accusing them of spying for SNG forces.

Unknown war planes conducted an airstrike targeting an al Shabaab base near Kamsuma Village (20km NE of Jamaame) in the night of 15/05. The airstrike reportedly killed 7 al Shabaab fighters and injured an unknown number of other fighters. According to local sources the base was completely destroyed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An RCIED targeted a AMISOM convoy near Roobow village (22km NE of Baraawe) in the morning of 15/05. The convoy was heading to Baraawe town when the incident happened. One of the AMISOM vehicles was damaged by the blast. No casualties were reported.

Non-violent activity: Suspected al Shabaab fighters attacked a private residential house belonging to a senior SNGF commander in Belet Xaawo in the night of 15/05. It is not clear if the officer was in the home at the time of attack. SNG police later conducted a search operation. No casualties were reported.

Somaliland police forces supported by Special Protection Unit (SPU) raided a house in Half London neighbourhood in Ahmed Dhagah District (Hargeisa) in the night of 15/05. The house is allegedly used by al Shabaab. The occupants exchanged fire with the security forces for about 15-20 minutes. Following the shootout the security forces conducted a search operation in several sections of Hargeisa. There is no confirmation of the rumoured escape of some al Shabaab operatives. One SPU officer was reportedly injured while two al Shabaab operatives were arrested during the raid.

Unidentified gunmen allegedly from Majerteen/Ugas Saleban shot and killed two men from Ali Saleban in the vicinity of Jedad Village (57km E of Qardho) in the afternoon of 15/05. The incident is believed to be related to clan revenge killing between the two sides. Police and local elders are investigating the murder, leading to at least one arrest.

An IED attached to a vehicle detonated in front of Sheikh Cabdi Mosque near Cali Kamiin Junction (Wardhiigley District) in the afternoon of 15/05. The owner of the vehicle, who works for the Somalia Central Bank, was inside the mosque when the incident happened. Four civilian bystanders were injured in the attack.

Unidentified attackers driving a vehicle hurled a hand grenade against SNG forces based in the vicinity of S Company (Heliwa District) in the evening of 15/05. No casualties were reported. The perpetrators escaped.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Somali troops and ""unidentified white commandos"", suspected to be American, staged an assault on an al-Shabab base in Bariirre on 16/05. [The source] reported that al-Shabab militants were forced to vacate their base in Barire after the firefight. Causalities not known.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Somalia's Special Commandos (Danab) and AMISOM Forces, supported a raid of an al Shabaab base in Bariire (27km SW of Afgooye) by American forces in the morning of 16/05. The allied forces were reportedly using helicopters to drop the troops at K50 in a nearby village and heavy fighting ensued. Local residents confirmed that SNA Commandos entered the town while al Shabaab fighters pulled out. Suspected American helicopters conducted an airstrike against retreating al Shabaab fighters. Somalia Army officials said that they released prisoners from the village and captured several al Shabaab fighters. The joint forces reportedly stayed two hours, then left. The exact reasons behind the raid are unclear. The number of casualties remains unknown.

A group of youths and few elders hailing from the Habar-Jeclo sub-clan staged a demonstration in front of the Sanaag Regional Electoral Commission office in Ceerigaabo on 16/05. The group accused the commission of not recruiting their youths in the current voter registration process. The commotion started after the commission officials removed from the recruitment exercise a group of young people hailing from the aforementioned clan, who had forged certificates. Police arrived at the scene and dispersed the protesting group. Two elders and four young people were arrested. The two elders were later released on bail.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Somalia's Special Commandos (Danab) and AMISOM Forces, supported a raid of an al Shabaab base in Bariire (27km SW of Afgooye) by American forces in the morning of 16/05. The allied forces were reportedly using helicopters to drop the troops at K50 in a nearby village and heavy fighting ensued. Local residents confirmed that SNA Commandos entered the town while al Shabaab fighters pulled out. Suspected American helicopters conducted an airstrike against retreating al Shabaab fighters. Somalia Army officials said that they released prisoners from the village and captured several al Shabaab fighters. The joint forces reportedly stayed two hours, then left. The exact reasons behind the raid are unclear. The number of casualties remains unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired mortar rounds against a ENDF/SNGF base in Baardheere airport, in the evening of 16/05. After the shelling, the two sides briefly exchanged gunfire before al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties from the shelling and the subsequent armed clash could not be established.

Al Shabaab fighters in Xarardheere district reportedly started to forcefully recruit students from the Koran schools (Madarasa) on 16/05. The group is reportedly targeting teenagers. The recruitment drive seems to be related to al Shabaab's agenda to improve their military capacity in the region. It is not clear whether the group will send those youngsters to be trained or to fight directly.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against SNG police on foot patrol in the vicinity of Bakara Junction (Hawl-Wadaag District) in the evening of 16/05. No casualties were reported. The attackers escaped.

Renewed clan clashes have broken out in Hawlwadaag neighbourhood of Belet Weyne Town between Gaaljecel and Jajele militia. The clash is ongoing. This comes at a time when civilians are already displaced on the other side of the town by the river floods; now others are being displaced due to clan fighting. Casualties are unknown so far. This armed clash is part of an ongoing cycle of clan revenge.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against an AMISOM base in Mudul Baraawe (5km NW of Baraawe) in the night of 17/05. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Somaliland police shot and severely injured a man following a security operation in Hargeisa University neighbourhood in the afternoon of 17/05. The man was suspected of having links with a detained al Shabaab suspect whose phone call logs showed multiple calls between he and the victim.

Gaaljecel militia shot and killed two elderly pastoralists from Jajele in Bar Ganlave (33km SW of Beled Weyne) in the evening of 17/05. The killing is related to the ongoing clashes between Gaaljecel and Jajele clan militias in Beled Weyne; tensions in the village are high.

A local councillor was abducted by unidentified gunmen believed to be from his own sub-clan in Burco on 17/05. The motive of the abduction remains unclear but it is believed to be related to a recent no-confidence motion tabled by some local councillors including the abducted official against the mayor of the town over corruption allegations. The councillor and the mayor both hail from the same sub-clan (Habarjeclo/Reer Biniin). The abducted councillor was reportedly taken to Naqdhibiijo Village (46km SE of Burco). Burco police conducted security operations in the outskirts of the town in search of the abducted official.

A civilian was killed by gunmen in KM60 (27km NE of Marka) in the evening of 17/05. There are conflicting reports emerging about the killing. One version indicates that the man was travelling with a bus and that he was killed for clan revenge by Biimaal militia. Other sources suggest that he was killed by AMISOM forces in KM 60 after he approached their base. The victim appears to hail from Habar Gidir clan.

A man hurled a hand grenade against a group of SNG soldiers on foot patrol in the vicinity of Ex-Control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the night of 17/05. The soldiers responded with gunfire and reportedly killed the attacker.

Suspected al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a NISA outpost in Biyadegenka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) on 17/05. Both sides exchanged small arms fire before attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Maanaboolyo (Boondheere District) in the night of 17/05. The victim used to run a money exchange kiosk. The motive behind the attack is unknown. The perpetrators escaped.
Clashes continue for a second day between Gaaljecel and Jajele militia in Belet Weyne. Five dead between the two days. Some sources claim nine dead in total.

Pro-Khatumo residents staged demonstrations against Somaliland's 25th Anniversary in Widhwidh Village (49km N of Buuhoodle) on 18/05. The protestors marched in the streets, chanting anti-Somaliland slogans. Somaliland army officers reportedly fired live bullets in the air and dispersed the protestors. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: A RCIED exploded in Xaawa-Cabdi locality (9km SE of Afgooye) in the morning of 18/05. Reports indicate that a AMISOM convoy was passing when the device exploded, but it missed the target. No casualties were reported.

A large number of pro-Khatumo local residents staged violent demonstrations against Somaliland's 25th Independence Day celebrations in Laas Caanood on 18/05. The protestors marched in the streets chanting anti-Somaliland slogans, burning tyres and throwing stones at police forces. The security forces reportedly fired live bullets at protestors, leading to the death of one and the injury of another. Shooting was ongoing at the time of reporting in various neighbourhoods, including Farxaskule, Madareemin and Gooladda.
According to sympatric media, al Shabaab forces attack a KDF base in Faafax Dhuun, ""[inflicting] heavy losses on the soldiers.""

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a Jubaland forces base in Hoosingo Village (97km NW of Badhaadhe Town) in the night of 18/05. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about ten minutes, after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. No casualties were reported from both sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack, and briefly overtake Hosingow village from Kenyan and Jubaland forces. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: An unidentified man threw a hand grenade against Jubaland forces on foot patrol at Qalinle junction in Gulwade of Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismaayo) in the evening of 18/05. No casualties or arrests were reported.
Clashes continue for a third day between Gaaljecel and Jajele militia in Belet Weyne. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed SNAF troops on foot patrol in Elasha settlement near Elasha junction road vicinity. The exchange of gunfire lasted for about ten minutes after which the al Shabaab attackers were repelled. Two SNAF soldiers were reportedly injured.

Hundreds of local residents took to the streets to stage a peaceful public rally against the National consultative forum in Mogadishu at Daljirka Dahson monument in Bondhere District. Protesters demanded for FGS to take serious measures to have their power sharing and autonomous regional administration.

Two group of SNAF and NISA soldiers clashed in Wadajeri Airport Road at KM 4 NISA CP one area. The clash came after SNAF soldiers, onboard two trucks, attempted to pass the NISA checkpoint at KM 4. SNAF soldiers ignored NISA soldiers' instruction to stop. The exchange of gunfire lasted for about ten minutes. One SNAF soldier was seriously injured by the gunfire and the vehicle ferrying SNAF soldiers was destroyed.
A hand grenade was hurled at NISA defensive CP at Livestock Market near S. Company. Soldiers reacted with gunfire. There were no reports of casualties. The assailants managed to escape.
An unidentified suicide bomber struck a cafe in Wardhigley district on 19/05. Two confirmed dead, including the bomber. The target of the blast may have been SNG soldiers who frequent the business.
Clashes continue for a fourth day between Gaaljecel and Jajele militia in Belet Weyne. Causalities not known.

Unidentified armed men hurled a hand grenade at SNAF soldiers on foot patrol in Elasha neighborhood. Unconfirmed reports indicated that at least one SNAF soldier was injured by the explosion. The attackers managed to escape from the scene.

ISWA soldiers briefly clashed among themselves in Buurhakaba District after an attempt was made to disarm a fellow soldier. The soldier resisted from being disarmed and there was an exchange of small arms fire. Other soldiers supported the resistant soldier which enabled him to engage other soldiers for a short period. There were no reports of causalities.
A man from Siwakhron sub-clan was shot and seriously wounded by suspected armed men from alleged Ali Saleeban sub-clan in Noobir village. The motive is not clear.

At least one al-Shabaab commander was killed and another captured during heavy fighting between the militants and Somali National Army (SNA) in Hudur town, the capital of Bakool region of southwest Somalia on 21/05.
Clashes continue for a fifth day between Gaaljecel and Jajele militia in Belet Weyne. Causalities not known.
A dead body of an unidentified man was found in the suburb, North West of Galkayo. The cause of death was a gunshot to the body. The motive remained unknown.
Somali forces kill a al Shabaab commander and capture another during an operation at Yabyab on 21/05.
Al Shabaab carries out a grenade attack on Jowhar airfield, resulting in the deaths of at least seven soldiers.
Government forces kill three al Shabaab in Asdan Yabaal on 22/05.
Clashes continue for a sixth day between Gaaljecel and Jajele militia in Belet Weyne. Causalities not known. Military forces helped quell the violence on the final day.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: Police reported that an IED planted along the road near Balikhadar and Galgala exploded (c. 50 km South West of Bossaso). Four Darawish soldiers were seriously wounded. They were transferred to Bossaso General Hospital for further treatment. Perpetrators identities not known.

A hand grenade was hurled at SNPF soldiers on foot patrol in via Liberia vicinity near the police station. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions. There were no reports of casualties. The assailants managed to escape.

An unconfirmed report indicated that an unidentified armed men (later determined to be al Shabaab) using pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Israac neighbourhood. The motive was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks an AMISOM base in Qoryooley the evening of 23/05. The battle that followed caused casualties, though the numbers of dead and wounded are not known.
Unidentified gunmen attack Abudwaq on 22/05, killing four. The attack is believed to be related to clan issues.

A roadside bomb targets a military checkpoint in Hodan district on 23/05. Four government soldiers were killed in the explosion. Troops returned fire after the explosion, wounding a number of civilian bystanders. The identities of the perpetrators are not known.

Non-violent activity: Al Shabaab fighters hijacked four civilian vehicles that transported assorted goods on the road between Beletweyne and Bulo-Burte. Civilians confirmed that al Shabaab drove the vehicles to Tardo village

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed a vehicle transporting khat from Belethawa town to Garbaharrey Districts. The incident took place c. 20 km South of Belethawa. The driver was killed and two other passengers reportedly escaped from the scene. Al Shabaab burnt the vehicle together with the khat.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded an old man near Doonfuul village (c. 18 km North East of Xudur town). The man was not associated with local administration and government forces based in Xudur town. The motive behind the killing was not clear.

A delegate, led by Somaliland Minister of Water was shot during a visit in Taleh. The delegation went to assess the destruction done in previous weeks due to heavy rains. The delegate was shot by civilians who were anti-Somaliland. The delegate, wounded, immediately left the town after the incident.
Al Shabaab launch a drive-by shooting style attack on a security checkpoint wounding two.
Al Shabaab attacked a group of government soldiers in Heliwa, but caused no injury.

A civilian was shot and killed while he was driving a vehicle at Suuq-Liif neighbourhood in Dharkeynley district by unknown armed men. The motive of the killing was not clear. The assailants managed to escape.

A roadside bomb targets a military checkpoint in Hodan district on 23/05. Four government soldiers were killed in the explosion. Troops returned fire after the explosion, wounding a number of civilian bystanders. The identities of the perpetrators are not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A landmine detonates in Goob Weyn, possible targeting Jubabland forces who were in the area. It has been confirmed that the explosion caused casualties including deaths and injuries, exact numbers not known.
Al Shabaab attacks a khat transport vehicle at Kamoor Waraabey location, near Belet Xaawo, killing the driver.
Unspecified warplanes bombed al Shabaab targets in Berhani Village (c. 45 km North West of Kismayo town). Casualties not known.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack on SNAF defensive base in the outskirt of Adan Yabal town (Mabaax). There was an exchange of gunfire after which al Shabaab fighters withdrew. Casualties could not be established at the time of reporting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A Puntland soldier opened fire on a fellow soldier causing injuries.

Two groups of SNAF troops clashed in the vicinities of the Ex-American Embassy (Siliga) neighbourhood in Dharkenley District over disputed land related matters. The soldiers were divided along clan lines namely Hawiye/Agbaal and Hawiye/Hawaadle sub clans. Soldiers from both sub clans suffered some casualties during the clash, numbers not known.

Unidentified attackers hurled a HG at a Police CP on Maka-Almukarama road near Shaqaalaha Junction in Hodan District. Two soldiers and one civilian male bystander were injured by the blast. Soldiers reacted with gunfire to suspected directions.
A civilian man was shot and killed by a NISA soldier at El-Gabta area in Hamarweyne District. Police operating at the scene apprehended the perpetrator. The motive of the killing was not clear.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab forces ambushed a SNG and AMISOM-KDF convoy near Dhobley on 24/05, 25 al Shabaab killed, including a junior commander.
At least two people were killed and two others wounded when government troops fought each other over a land in Mogadishus Maalim Nur neighbourhood.
Puntland Custodial Corps protested against non-payment of salary for the last five months.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired six rounds of 82mm mortar bombs against AMISOM base at Bulo Burto (c. 120 km South of Beletweyne town). It was reported that the mortars missed the target and landed outside Hegal FOB AMISOM defence position. There were no reports of causalities.

There was an armed clash between Qubeys clan, sub-clan of Dir and Suleiman clan, sub-clan of Habagidir at Maalis-Moge vicinity near Bacadwayne Village in Hobyo District (c. 140 km South West of Hobyo). The clash was related to previous clan revenge. Four persons were shot and injured. Galmudug Security Forces were deployed to prevent further clashes.
A group of women clashed over unknown reasons in Hodan neighbourhood of Garowe. One woman was seriously wounded after she was stabbed.
Wagardahac clan militias kill a Saad man in Ceel Mudan, near Galinsoor.

A man from Sa'ad clan, sub-clan of Habargidir was shot and killed by armed men from Wagardhac clan, sub-clan of Marehan at Ceel-Mudan vicinity in Adado District (c. 35 km North West of Galinsoor). The motive was believed to be clan retaliation.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A remote controlled IED placed by the roadside exploded on 25 May, impacting a vehicle, killing two PMPF soldiers and wounding six others. Initial reports indicated that the IED was planted along an access road leading to Galgala. Perpatrators identities not known.
A body of a dead woman was found at Kabiid (c. 40 km South of Erigavo). The woman was travelling on foot from Kulaal. The cause of death was not clear.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed an SNPF senior police officer who worked for CID in Seybiano neighbourhood near Ex. American Embassy (Siliga). The motive was not clear and the perpetrators managed to escape.
SNAF troops clashed with suspected al Shabaab fighters in Huriwa Perfume Factory neighbourhood. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 5 minutes. No reports of causalities.

Unidentified armed men wearing SNPF uniforms on a Toyota pickup shot and killed a civilian tuktuk driver near Mubarak Hotel along Maka Al Mukarama Road in Hodan District. This incident took place after the tuktuk driver failed to give way for the Toyota Pickup. It is not clear if the perpetrators were legitimate military.
Unknown armed men using pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Bacadlaha vicinity in Hamarweyne. The motive was not clear and the perpetrators escaped.

Armed men in SNAF uniforms using AK 47s shot and killed a civilian public minibus conductor near Hormud Branch building in Wadajir District. The motive was attributed to refusal to pay extortion money. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene. It is not clear if the perpetrators were legitimate military.
At least 11 Al-Shabaab killed and two government soldiers wounded on 25/05 after fighting between the group and Somalia National Army (SNA) in El-Wak (Ceel Waaq) town in Gedo region.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab ambushes a convoy of AMISOM-ENDF soldiers in Lagaley on 26/05, leading to gun battle of more of three hours. Al-Shabaab officials have claimed through their media that they have killed around 30 soldiers and destroyed military trucks, though these numbers have not been verified.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: AMISOM and SNG forces, supported by aircraft, carry out a raid on Toratorow, dislodging al Shabaab from the village. The fighters left the town soon after and al Shabaab in turn filled the void. At least two al Shabaab killed.
An IED planted in a restaurant detonates during a meeting with government officials in Buurdhuubo. Five injuries reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab regained control of Toratorow (near Afgooye) after AMISOM and SNG forces vacated the village.

Local police officers clashed at Belethawa Police Station. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for almost ten minutes. The reason behind the clash was not clear. There were no reports of casualties.

column9: Private Security Forces (Somalia); Government of Somaliland (2010-)
column17: Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill the personal bodyguard of the Mayor of Berbera. It is not clear if the victim was armed.
Two Saad women are abducted by suspected Wagardahac clansmen near Galinsoor.
An unidentified gunman shoots and kills a civilian in Hodan.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A bomb has hit a Puntland military convoy in Galgala, killing two. It is believed al Shabaab are responsible.

Twin explosions struck a busy tea-shop in an area near the southern town of Buurdhuubo in Gedo province, wounding at least four people, including the cities administrator. No group has yet claimed responsibility for the attack.
A landmine kills two children in Afmadow on 27/05.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab targets Ethiopian forces with an IED in Garass America village, Luuq District. Casualties not known.
Saad and Omar Mohamud clans clash in Teerage vicinity, near Gaalkacyo, resulting in two fatalities.
Al Shabaab ambushed and killed a SNG soldier in Laanta Garaska.
Al Shabaab launch an IED and hit-and-run style attack on government forces in Adale. No lives lost.
Soldiers clash along clan lines in Wardhigley. An unspecified number of causalities reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: The Pentagon on 01/06 announced that a U.S. drone strike on 27/05 had targeted a senior military commander of al-Shabab in ""south-central Somalia,"" (speculated as in Shabeelaha Hoose)Abdullahi Haji Daud. U.S. officials later confirmed he was killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An al Shabaab roadside bombing against AMISOM-ENDF forces in Yurkud kills three soldiers on 28/05.

At least two Somali security force members were killed, and two others wounded when a convoy they have been travelling in was targeted with an al Shabaab roadside bomb explosion at Xaafadda Taree, near Mogadishu.
Al Shabaab forces overtake Kabtan Laas village following a brief battle with SNG forces. Causalities not known. Kabtan Laas lies near Marka.
Al Shabaab attacked a SNG vehicle travelling north of Xudur, no casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM and ISWA forces clash in Buur Xakaba over control of a checkpoint. No casualties.
ISWA soldiers clashed with al Shabaab in Heteerra Jiffa resulting in one fatality on each side.
Al Shabaab planted roadside bomb targeted a NISA vehicle, killing two and injuring three.
A hand grenade attack on a police post in Hodan, three injuries reported.

A roadside bomb struck a pickup truck carrying National Intelligence and Security Agency soldiers on 28/05. The soldiers were travelling from Mogadishu to the village of Siinka Dheer located on Mogadishu-Afgooye road when they were targeted with the explosion in Tarey Disho locality. Two dead, two wounded. Perpetrators not known.
Somali soldiers shot dead two people in a food distribution line near the central Somali town of Beledwayne after the crowd began pushing and shoving each other.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab ambush a group of AMISOM-ENDF forces in Qansax Dheere on 29/05. The figure of casualties from the two fighting sides cannot yet be verified, though fatalities are implied by the source.
Suspected al Shabaab shoot and kill a civilian in Karaan.
Al Shabaab combatants attack a group of SNG soldiers at Xudur, Bakool Region. At least one person has been confirmed killed and several others have been wounded in the fighting.
A military officer is killed after he left a mosque following evening prayers. The unidentified perpetrators escaped.
Al Shabaab forces attack a military checkpoint at Siinka Dheer, kill five soldiers.
SNG and al Shabaab clash in Yabyab, one al Shabaab death reported.
Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a group of soldiers, who responded with gunfire. Two soldiers dead and two civilians injured.
A members of Dhulbahante militia shot and killed a member of Isse Mohamed in Garowe.
Al Shabaab attacked a group of soldiers in Heliwa. Five reported dead.
A hand grenade is thrown at a police forces near a school in Hawl Wadaag. No reports of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Four Puntland soldiers are injured when their vehicle struck a land mine in the Galgala area. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.

A commander (Mohamed Mohamud Ali, known as ""Dulyadin""), believed to have orchestrated the 2015 attack on Kenyas Garissa University has been killed, along with fifteen others, in a special forces raid in Buulo Gaduud during the late night hours. The bodies of the dead were later publicly displayed in Kismayo.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab launches a two day, overnight siege on the Ambassador Hotel in Mogadishu, killing fifteen, including two members of Parliament. Forty others injured. The two elected officials had duel British citizenship. AMISOM forces responded, killing all attackers, numbers not known.
Government and ""anti-AS"" forces carried out an air strike in Kunya Barow, killing an al Shabaab commander.
Two unarmed civilians of Ali Saleban are killed by a gunmen from Ali Jibrial.
Al Shabaab shoots and kills a defector in Balad.
Al Shabaab attacked a vehicle belonging to a former government official in Buusha, near Afgooye. Four killed and two injured.
An IED from unknown origin targeted SNG forces in Heliwa. No reports of casualties.
Al Shabaab attacks a SNAF base, followed by an exchange of gunfire. No reports of causalities.
The National Intelligence and Security Agency, NISA, says it has killed a senior Al-Shabaab officer known as ""Suheyb"" in an operation in the village of Kuunya Barrow, Lower Shabeelle Region.
On 1 June, al-Shabab commander Mohamed Kuno aka Gamadhere was killed in a well-organised operation that took place at Bula-Gaduud locality. It is not clear if others were killed in the operation.

Al Shabaab launches a two day, overnight siege on the Ambassador Hotel in Mogadishu, killing twenty, including two members of Parliament. Forty others injured. The two elected officials had duel British citizenship. AMISOM forces responded, killing all attackers, numbers not known.
Al Shabaab gunmen kill a defector in Kismayo on 01/06. The victim had recently worked for the government in the area.

Al Shabaab launches a two day, overnight siege on the Ambassador Hotel in Mogadishu, killing twenty, including two members of Parliament. Forty others injured. The two elected officials had duel British citizenship. AMISOM forces responded, killing all attackers, numbers not known.
Security forces clash with al Shabaab in Berhani. Three civilians were killed in apparent crossfire.
Al Shabaab shot and killed a soldier Bondhere district.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab launches a two day, overnight siege on the Ambassador Hotel in Mogadishu, killing fifteen, including two members of Parliament. Forty others injured. The two elected officials had duel British citizenship. AMISOM forces responded, killing all attackers, numbers not known.
Police forces clash with al Shabaab in Misir village, near Diinsoor. Police killed one al Shabaab fighter and recovered weapons from the fleeing remainder.
Two Dulbahante sub clans clash in Dharkein Genyo, near Las Anod. Ten fatalities and 30 injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: A convoy transporting Kenyan defence forces (KDF) was targeted in a roadside bomb explosion outside Liboi town near Somali border on 03/06. The bomb blast has destroyed one of vehicles in the convoy, causing unidentified casualties. Al Shabaab are beloved responsible.
Military forces clash with an unidentified clan group in Hawadley, Balad District. Causalities not known.
Protest over the warring clans of Jajele and Galjacel in the area.
ASWJ soldiers protest over unpaid salaries.
Two groups of Biyamaal clan clash over revenge issues. One combatant was killed, two others injured.
Clashes between two Dulbahante sub clans clash for a second day. No reported fatalities the second day.
Gunmen of Ali Saleban attacked and wounded a man from Jambeel, reasons unknown.
Al Shabaab attacked a soldier in Kawagody neighbourhood (Wadajir/Medina). Casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fired three mortar bombs at an AMISOM location resulting in the injury of an AMISOM soldier and the destruction of a UN bus.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed an old man who worked at the Parliament building.

Three civilians are dead in Hawadley, Balcad District, in an apparent clan related attack. The local administration in Hawadley said it was investigating the culprits behind the killing of the three people. The perpetrators behind the killings are not yet known. The previous day government forces engaged suspected clan militia in a gun battle.
Somaliland army was ambushed by a local militia in Dhumays near Widhwidh. No reports of casualties.
Galjacel militia killed a man and injured another from Jajale in the outskirt of Belet Weyne.
Unidentified assailants threw a hand grenade at soldiers in Marka, injuring two civilians bystanders.
Gunmen suspected of belonging to al Shabaab group shot and killed a female journalist working for state-run Radio Mogadishu on 05/06.
A KDF convoy was ambushed in between Baardhere and Faxfaxdoon village. The convoy was transporting food stuff to the troops. No causalities reported.

SNA and KDF troops were attacked at Buusar village (c. 50 km East of Ceel Waaq District). It is believed that SNA and KDF defended the base after a confrontation with al Shabaab fighters that lasted for few minutes. There were no reports of causalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked AMISOM troops based at Bufow-Bacaad settlement (c. 4 km North West of Merka town). The exchange of gunfire involved the use of RPGs and heavy guns and al Shabaab were finally forced to withdraw. AMISOM started shelling al Shabaab suspected frontlines after al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

Two group of SNAF soldiers clashed in Mukayga CP in Afgoye. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 25 minutes. The SNAF soldiers disputed over the sharing of extortion money. The situation was stabilized after mediation by other SNAF soldiers. One SNAF soldier was reportedly injured during the exchange of gunfire.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: A Puntland Dwarish soldier shot and killed his fellow soldier over an unknown dispute.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: SNA forces and Jubaland Forces liberated Juugal and Cali Xareed villages (c. 40 km West of Baardheere town). The two villages were under AS control. AS reportedly moved out of the villages without any confrontation.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: SNA forces and Jubaland Forces liberated Juugal and Cali Xareed villages (c. 40 km West of Baardheere town). The two villages were under AS control. AS reportedly moved out of the villages without any confrontation.

A HG was hurled at the residence of Dayniile District Commissioner (DC) at Radeerka village. The security guards posted at the residence of the DC reacted with gunfire. The attacker was apprehended by the guards. There were no reports of casualties from the security personnel.

Unidentified armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab elements, shot and killed three SNAF soldiers in the area of the Livestock Market Bus Station in Huriwa District. The armed men, dressed in SNAF uniform, alighted from a bus together with the soldiers and then opened fire at them. The attackers managed to escape.

Unknown assailants, armed with pistols, shot and killed an unarmed SNAF senior officer at Tabelaha area in Dayniile District. The motive behind the attack was unknown and the perpetrators managed to escape.

Suspected SNAF soldiers opened fire at a public minibus in Jamhuuriya vicinity in Karan when passengers on the bus resisted to give extortion money. One civilian passenger was killed while three others were injured. The attackers managed to escape.

""Targeted killings"" by gunmen armed with pistols have also occurred in Hodan district on 06/06. The source details killings of police officers by unknown gunmen elsewhere in the city, but only provide a small amount of information in this instance. It is not clear if any of there assassination attempts were successful. A total of 6 security personnel are killed during the evening of 06/06. This is divided between three events.

An officer and his security guards were killed (specific numbers not known) in Suuqa Hoolaha neighbourhood in Hiliwaa district by unidentified gunmen. Elsewhere in the city, a police commander is killed in Tabeellaha Sheikh Ibrahim area. A total of 6 security personnel are killed during the evening of 06/06. This is divided between three events.
A cargo vehicle carrying [military forces] was destroyed during an al Shabaab attack on the outskirts of Huddur district in Bakool region. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack on SNAF troops based at Masjid Ali Gaduud vicinity (c. 25 km from Adale District). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about one hour after which al Shabaab withdrew. Two SNAF soldiers were killed while three others injured.
Unidentified armed men attempted to ambush the Chairman of Bari Appeal Court in Jiingada village (c. 90 km of South Bossaso). There were no reports of casualties.

Al Shabaab fighters beheaded a civilian female at Bulo-oman area (c. 3 km North East of Arabow village and c. 57 km East from Bu'ale). The victim was kidnapped from Yaaqbarweyn area of Bay region in Diinsoor District before the murder. The motive behind of killing not known.
Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and severely injured a municipal senior officer.

In el-Tusbahle neighbourhood, Dayniile district, an explosion targeted assembled federal government soldiers on 06/06. Casualties remain unknown. A total of 6 security personnel are killed during the evening of 06/06. This is divided between three events.
[Al Shabaab] forces carried out fierce attack on AMISOM-KDF bases in Busaar area of Gedo. Causalities not known.
Unidentified gunmen kill a police commander in the Tabeellaha Sheikh Ibrahim area of Mogadishu.
A fierce fighting between [al Shabaab] and [soldiers] occurred at Buufow and Number 50 areas in Lower Shabelle region. Causalities are not known.
A soldier was killed by al Shabaab in Hodan district in Mogadishu.
Al Shabaab attacks a group of five soldiers in Heliwa district on 07/06, killing two.
An al Shabaab roadside bomb hits a vehicle carrying government soldiers. The explosion occurred on the outskirts of Afgooye. Causalities not known.
Two clan militias from the Ali Saleeban sub-clan and Osman Mohamed sub-clan exchanged gunfire over an unknown grievance. Casualties could not be determined.

On 8 June, in Walaweyne district al Shabaab conducted a hit and run attack on troops based in the town. There was an exchange of gunfire for 25 minutes and the militants were forced to withdraw. Casualties could not be established.
On 8 June, in Wardhigley District, a driver was killed and two civilian bystanders were injured when an IED attached to his car detonated. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab carried out large-scale attack on Ethiopian bases in Waajid district in Bakool region. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab forces carried out an attack on government position on the outskirts of Masaajid Ali Gaduud area in Middle Shabelle.
About six soldiers were killed following an al Shabaab ambush at Suuqa Hoolaha neighbourhood in Mogadishus Hiliwaa district.
An elderly female activist known as Dhudi Yusuf is shot and killed in Gaalkacyo on the evening of 08/06 by unknown assailants.
On 9 June, in Qardho, a person was killed and two others injured when they came into contact with an anti-personnel mine.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: On the 9 June, al Shabaab militants launched an attack against an AMISOM (DJAF contingent) base in Western Bulo Burto. The attack lasted about 30 minutes and there were no reports of casualties.

On the 9 June, anti-AS forces conducted airstrikes in the Almadow and Galgala Mountain areas. The operation was confirmed by Puntland Officials and reportedly an unspecified number of al Shabaab fighters were killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against AMISOM KDF position in Tabta village (c. 60 km East of Dhobley). There were no reports of casualties.
On 9 June, ISWA soldiers acting on information engaged al Shabaab militants near Bulo Jadiid village. Causalities not known.
On 9 June in Hodan district, a NISA soldier was shot and killed by unknown gunmen.
On 9 June, an unidentified man shot and killed the Branch DC for Wardhigley District. The motive for the killing remain unclear and the attackers managed to escape.
Al Shabaab forces killed 17 government soldiers during an operation on the outskirts of Tiyeeglow district. Al Shabaab seized 7 guns as well.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab forces carried out attack on the ""Christian troops of Kenya"" station at Tabta area. Casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An al Shabaab car-bombing and subsequent raid allegedly kills more than 60 AMISOM-ENDF soldiers when it detonated at a Halgan military base on 09/06. The Sudan Tribune reported the deaths of 248 al Shabaab, which the Ethiopian government later verified, but denied they had lost the 60 claimed by al Shabaab, but did not provide additional numbers. Somali government soldiers were also involved in the counter-attack.
Two men, a Kenyan and a Somali, were also executed on 10/06 by a firing squad in the al-Shabab-controlled town of Jilib. The two were accused of being under cover agents for Western intelligence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 10 June, al Shabaab fighters conducted an ambush attack on an ENDF convoy at Wabxa. The confrontation lasted for 30 minutes and nine al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed.
On 10 June, unknown war planes reportedly conducted airstrikes against suspected al Shabaab positions in Hargeysa Yerey Village. Casualties or other information could not be determined.
On 10 June, in Taalla-Cad, a pastoralist from Shiikhaal clan was shot and killed by another pastoralist from the same clan. The killing was related to a clan related dispute.

A man from Osman Mohamud/Warfaa Mohamud sub-clan was shot and killed by an armed man from the same sub-clan in Xingood area of Qardho. The man was shot due to a land dispute. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.
Two IED incidents reported in Yaaqshiid on 10/07. No reported fatalities. The target of the attacks and perpetrators are not known.
Detonation: On 10 June, in Yakshid District, unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at a NISA check point. The device missed its intended target and no one was injured in the incident.
Armed gunmen killed Muhammad Jimale, the administrator of Wardhiigley, at Sinai junction.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-ENDF and al Shabaab forces clash in Ceel Cali on 10/06. Al Shabaab backed media reports add that the attack inflicted ""fatal casualties on the Ethiopian troops.""
Al Shabaab executes four of their own in Bulo Fulay, accusing them of conspiring with the CIA. Three victims were shot by firing squad, the fourth beheaded.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland soldiers protest non-payment of salaries in Gaalkacyo.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: On 11 June, in Merka an IED targeting an AMISOM convoy detonated killing one AMISOM soldier and injuring two others. One AMISOM lorry was also damaged by the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM convoy moving from Mogadishu heading towards Shalamboot at Buufow - Bacad area in Merka District exploded. One AMISOM lorry was hit and damaged by the blast. AMISOM soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions. Initial report indicated that one AMISOM soldier was killed while two others were injured.
On 11 June, in Belet Xaawa, an IED planted at a check point manned by Kenyan police exploded. Later two other IEDs exploded in the same area. No causalities reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: On 11 June, ENDF and SNA soldiers for unknown reasons vacated Adan Yabal town and as a result al Shabaab fighters quickly took control without any resistance.

On 11 June in Luuq, a hand grenade was hurled at the residence of a Federal Member of Parliament. The perpetrator attempted to storm the house, however the security guards on duty engaged the assailant but he managed to escape. The MP's child was wounded during the incident.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed two young boys who were returning from a football field at Kaawo Godey neighbourhood in Dharkenley District. The motive of the killing was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape.
A Taw vehicle was destroyed, five soldiers killed, and four others wounded following an al Shabaab roadside bomb explosion at Ceel Wareegow area in Lower Shabelle region.

Unknown warplanes have hit al-Shabaab bases in Weelmarow area, 30 kms outside the southern Somali town of Afmadow. Sources close to al-Shabab conform the attack but declined to mention the casualties caused by the aerial attack.

Two groups of government forces clashed at Adado. The clash erupted after certain soldiers were not listed to receive their salaries at that moment. The reason for the clash was payment of salaries. Three soldiers were shot and killed while two others were injured.
Biyamaal sub clan traded gunfire among themselves over a clan related dispute. One death reported.
On 12 June in Shalamboot one al Shabaab militant was killed and two soldiers injured in an clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM ENDF convoy en route to Yasooman (c. 42 km West of Maxaas District) reportedly took control of the village. There was no confrontation with al Shabaab as they retreated from village voluntarily.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An Ethiopian soldier shot and killed a man passing near the CP on the opposite side of the bridge in Dollow. The man was believed to have been alerted with warning shot where he refused to follow the warning. Other reports confirmed that the victim was mentally challenged.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a NISA soldier while on his way home in Zeybiano neighbourhood. (It is not clear if the soldier was armed at the time) The motive of the killing was not clear.
Al Shabaab forces attacked a [government forces] base at the former perfume factory building in Mogadishu. Causalities not known.
Unidentified gunmen clad in SNA uniform have opened fire on a lorry on 12/06 near Bulo Gumurey village in Somalias Middle Shabelle region, killing at least three passengers.
A hand grenade was hurled at [government] militias passing inside Marka town. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Kenyan forces withdrawal from Wabho village on 12/06, al Shabaab quickly fills the void.
Al Shabaab fighters kidnapped 13 traditional elders from the village of Gamboole. The 13 were taken to Show, Hiiraan region, where they are currently being held.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: At least three Somali soldiers were killed and six others were wounded following arguments between Somali troops and Galugdug militia in central Somali town of Cadaado.
A Somali parliamentarian survived an assassination attempt in which two people were wounded in Luuq. The gunmen remain unidentified.
Unknown gunmen reportedly opened fire at a group of people coming from night prayers at a mosque in Buuhoodle seriously injuring 3 people.

Unidentified gunmen wearing SNAF uniforms reportedly shot and killed a civilian Tuk Tuk Driver near Hawo Tako village in Balcad District. The incident took place after the Tuk Tuk driver failed to abide by instructions to stop in front of DC's Office gate.

Initial reports indicated that unidentified gunmen armed with pistols reportedly shot and severely injured an unarmed SNAF senior official at Jungal vicinity in Yaqshid district. The motive is not yet clear and assailants managed to escape.
Rival forces of Sharif Hassan [Sheikh Adan] clashed in Baidoa on 13/06. Ten reported deaths.
Al Shabaab attacks government forces in Shalaambood, causing a gunfight. An unspecified number of causalities reported.
A group of unidentified armed men kill a government administrator in Shibis district.
Two government soldiers were killed on the outskirts of Diinsoor district in Bay region. The killed soldiers firearms were taken away.
Unidentified clan members killed four civilians in Galoley, Jowhar district on 13/06, motive not known.
Residents at Sh Madar neighbourhood burnt tires and blocked roads in protest against the agreement between SL and DWP on Berbera port.

Reports indicate that militias from Biyamaal clan carried out an attack against Habargidir militias based at the Bariire farm area in Awdhegle district. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire several times after brief intervals and received reinforcements from their clans. The reason for the clash is likely to be clan based rivalry/revenge. Three combatants from the warring groups were killed while an unknown number were injured.
Al Shabaab forces attacked [government soldiers] base in Qoryooley. At least four deaths reported.
Suspected al Shabaab launch mortar shells is various districts of Mogadishu including, Wardhigley, Villia Somalia, Hawl Wadaag,Waaberi, Daynile and Wadajir. casualties not known.
Suspected al Shabaab launch mortar shells is various districts of Mogadishu including, Wardhigley, Villia Somalia, Hawl Wadaag,Waaberi, Daynile and Wadajir. casualties not known.
Suspected al Shabaab launch mortar shells is various districts of Mogadishu including, Wardhigley, Villia Somalia, Hawl Wadaag,Waaberi, Daynile and Wadajir. casualties not known.
Suspected al Shabaab launch mortar shells is various districts of Mogadishu including, Wardhigley, Villia Somalia, Hawl Wadaag,Waaberi, Daynile and Wadajir. casualties not known.
Suspected al Shabaab launch mortar shells is various districts of Mogadishu including, Wardhigley, Villia Somalia, Hawl Wadaag,Waaberi, Daynile and Wadajir. casualties not known.
Suspected al Shabaab launch mortar shells is various districts of Mogadishu including, Wardhigley, Villia Somalia, Hawl Wadaag,Waaberi, Daynile and Wadajir. casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Mortar fires hit Ethiopian defences in Halgan district in Hiiraan region. Causalities not known.
