Two clan militias from Galjacel sub clan clashed over an argument of checkpoint taxi collection near the vicinity of Hawlwadaag Bridge west of Belet Weyne town. It was reported that both sides exchanged gunfire for less than ten minutes. One death reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM Convoy moving from Afgoye and heading towards number 50km exploded at Adow Dibile vicinity (08km West of Afgoye district). One AMISOM truck was damaged by the explosion as eyewitness confirmed. One soldier killed in the blast. Following the blast several soldiers pursued the fleeing attackers, killing two.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed a SNAF soldier on his way home at Beytul Raas vicinity in Merka District. It is not clear If the soldier was armed or on duty at the time.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM Convoy moving from Afgoye and heading towards number 50km exploded at Adow Dibile vicinity (08km West of Afgoye district). One AMISOM truck was damaged by the explosion as eyewitness confirmed. One soldier killed in the blast. Following the blast several soldiers pursued the fleeing attackers, killing two.

A brief armed clash between SNPF and SNAF troops was reported at Dayniile's Radeerka vicinity. The reason seems to be a case of mistaken identity soon after a recent mortar attack. No casualty reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-ENDF and SNG forces regain control of a military base at Yasooman. It is not clear if there was a clash between the actors.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A vehicle was burned, 11 Ethiopian soldiers killed and more that number wounded following an al Shabaab bomb explosion on the outskirts of Ufurow in Bay region.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab forces carry out fierce attack on Ethiopian forces defences in Waajid district. Causalities not known.
At least two people including a local government official in Dharkenley were killed by suspected al-Shabaab travelling on a motorcycle during the morning hours of 15/06.
Al Shabaab carried out an attack on Howlwadaag police station in Mogadishu. Casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An RCIED targeting an ENDF/SNA convoy heading to Qansax-Dheere exploded at Shanta Mundul (approx. 10kms SW of Qansax-Dheere district). Casualties are not known and the convoy reportedly proceed to Qansax-Dheere district.

Fighting erupted between Habar Jeclo and Dulbahante gunmen at Yeyle after a man from Habar Jeclo was gunned down by a Dulbahante man due to a dispute. Reinforcement from both sides sparked fighting that lasted for almost one hour. Two people were confirmed killed and two others injured.

Detonation: Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade at SNPF personnel on foot Patrol near Bakara junction road in Hodan District. The device missed its target. No casualties were reported and attackers managed to escape from the scene.
A bomb squad, including a commander were killed following an al Shabaab bomb explosion at Kilometre 4 in Mogadishu. Exact numbers of dead not known.

A water tanker and two armoured vehicles were destroyed during explosion and a surprise attack on the outskirts of Danow and Goolweyne areas in Lower Shabelle region. The occupants who were [soldiers] were either killed or wounded in the attacks, exact numbers not known.

A water tanker and two armoured vehicles were destroyed during explosion and al Shabaab surprise attack on the outskirts of Danow and Goolweyne areas in Lower Shabelle region. The occupants who were [soldiers] were either killed or wounded in the attacks, exact numbers not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An RCIED reportedly targeting an AMISOM Convoy moving from Shalamboot and heading towards Buulo Mareer town exploded at Golweyn vicinity in Kurtunwarey (90km West of Mogadishu). At least two AMISOM soldiers were reportedly killed and one AMISOM convoy vehicle damaged by the explosion. No comment from AMISOM regarding this incident but al Shabaab militants claimed responsibility.

An official identified as Siow who was working for the administration of Yaqshid municipal was killed at Suuq Bacaad neighbourhood in Mogadishu. Siow was the deputy mayor and the treasurer of the town municipality.
Al Shabaab gains control of Yasooman after government forces withdrew.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: At least seven militants were killed and five others arrested in heavy fighting between Somali National Army backed by the African Union peacekeeping forces and Al-Shabaab late on Friday in Barowe town in Lower Shabelle region. Al Shabaab claims 10 AMISOM dead.
A hand grenade was hurled at a place where government forces were chewing Khat. The attack occurred near Black sea junction in Hodan district, Mogadishu. Causalities not known.

Khatumo militia reportedly attacked SLA base in Widhwidh resulting in a heavy armed conflict that lasted for almost 1 hour. Khatumo state militia used battle wagon and attacked from multiple directions. SL Army managed to defend its position and Khatumo state militia later withdrew to Widhwidh centre which they still occupy. An unconfirmed number of casualties were reported on both sides.

SNA soldiers on reconnaissance mission briefly exchanged small arms fire with al Shabaab fighters on the outskirts of Buurdhuxunle village (approx. 30kms SE of Rabdhure district). Al Shabaab fighters escaped from the area immediately after the gunfight. One SNA soldier was reportedly injured. Casualties from the al Shabaab side could not be established.

Two armed clan militias from Ali Saleeban and Ugaar Saleeban sub-clans exchanged gunfire at Xeradaa Muudal area, c.15km of Southeast Qardho. No immediate casualties were reported and 6 perpetrators from both sides were detained by police and transferred to the Qardho Police Station for further investigation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: According to reports from locals at Albeet area approx. 17 km W of Husungo, al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM KDF convoy travelling from Dhobley to Hosungo at Albeet. There was a brief exchange of gun fire before al Shabaab retreated from the scene. No casualties reported.

A Dhulbahante man was stabbed and killed by an unknown individual near the UNCC compound. The assailant managed to escape from the scene but was apprehended the next morning at Rabaable 28 km South West of Garowe by the police.

A group of al Shabaab fighters carried out hit and run style attack against the NISA checkpoint at Huriwa's Livestock market neighbourhood. The exchange of gunfire lasted for about 10 minutes. No casualties reported and al Shabaab militants were pushed back.

Heavy fighting erupted in Marka between two unidentified rival clan militias. At least five combatants were killed on the warring sides and many were wounded. The wounded include civilians, having been hit by stray bullets.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Two vehicles, a pickup truck and a cargo vehicle were burned, and tens of Ethiopian soldiers killed after a [al Shabaab] surprise attack and a roadside bomb explosion along the road linking Elbuur and Dhuusamareeb districts.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab forces carried out an attack on Ethiopian forces convoy in Ceel Lahelay in Galgaduud. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Based in Shalaambood, al Shabaab fired long range mortar shells at AMISOM positions in Buufow causing causalities of unknown number. In response, AMISOM forces launched shells to the al Shabaab position. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Based in Shalaambood, al Shabaab fired long range mortar shells at AMISOM positions in Buufow causing causalities of unknown number. In response, AMISOM forces launched shells to the al Shabaab position. Al Shabaab causalities not known.

There was an armed clash between Dir and Suleiman clan militiamen at Maalis-Moge, in the vicinity of Bacadwayne village in Hobyo District (c. 12 km West of Bacadwayne village). The clash was related to previous clan conflicts. No casualties reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed AMISOM/SNA forces near Kurtun (approx. 30kms NE of Qansax-Dheere), prompting a brief exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. AMISOM forces discovered and safely removed IEDs on the road after the incident. The convoy reportedly proceeded to Baidoa the next morning.
Two men from Ayr clan, sub-clan of Habargidir were shot and killed and their guns confiscated by al Shabaab fighters at Warshubo village.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against AMISOM KDF/JLF position at Hosungo village (approx. 90 km SE Dhobley). Reportedly al Shabaab fighters directed small arms fire towards the AMISOM/JLF position from a distance. The joint forces responded, and al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. No casualties reported.

Guards at the premises of the Minister of interior were forced to fire in the air to disperse unspecified number of women who were protesting the ministers' decision to jail a staff of the ministry. The staff member, who was later released, tried to climb the fence of the Ministers premises while in possession of an axe.

Detonation: A Tuk Tuk motorcycle loaded with a VBIED device prematurely exploded after the driver ignored instructions by NISA soldiers to stop for checking at German Factory (Xero Jarmal) neighbourhood in Dayniile District and attempted to escape from the scene. Only the Tuk Tuk driver died. No other casualties were reported. The motive is not yet clear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attack Kenyan forces base in Hoosingow area. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Two vehicles were burned and a number of Ethiopian forces were either killed or wounded following an al Shabaab ambush along the road linking Huddur and Ceelbarde in Bay and Bakool regions.
A soldier is killed in Daynuunay district, perpetrators not known.
A hand grenade was hurled at a vehicle carrying government soldiers. The vehicle was passing inside Bakaara Market in Mogadishu. Causalities not known.

A huge demonstration that turned violent was reportedly held in Darar Weyne to protest against the newly established local authority that was formed in Erigavo few weeks ago. The demonstrators indicated that the community was not involved in the selection of their leader. The demonstrator put the blame to the Ministry of interior. Another group supporting the nomination confronted the demonstrators prompting fist fights. Gun fire was heard and an unspecified number of people were injured.

Detonate/Dismantle:An explosion occurred at Geedweeyne village, Gedo region (around 35 km SE of Dollow town) after an IED targeting a police station was detonated by SNA police. The perpetrator who was identified by the locals reportedly escaped from the scent. No casualties reported.

SPU groups serving UNSOM, UNICEF and others from NGOs staged a protest over delayed payments. They suspended supporting operations and gathered at GIH. Subsequently, UN representatives intervened and held dialogue with the SPUs.

A man was shot and killed by an armed man in Cada-kibir village (c. 60 km West of Adado). The killing was in connection to previous clan revenge between the two sub-clans of Suleiman clan. The perpetrator was arrested by the local clan elders and handed over to Galmudug police.
A man from Osman Mohamud sub-clan was shot and wounded by his fellow clansman at Xingood area west of Qardho due to a land dispute.

Unknown men armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed a male civilian who was walking from a Mosque at Macmacanka neighbourhood in Dharkenley district. The motive is unknown and perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols, suspected to be al Shabaab militants reportedly shot and killed a civilian Auto Mechanic man at 77 IDPs camps in Dayniile district. The motive is not yet clear and perpetrators managed to escape.
At least one person was killed and six others were wounded in a grenade attack on a Somali army checkpoint in the southern coastal city of Marka. Al Shabaab suspected.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An al Shabaab-planted IED destroys a vehicle in an AMISOM convoy near Mahadaay, causalities not immediately known. AU troops clashed with Al Shabab fighters shortly after explosion, causalities equally unknown in the subsequent clash. Sources said AMISOM soldiers have indiscriminately opened fire on a nearby civilians, killing a cattle herder and wounded four others after the Al Shabab militants ambush attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An al Shabaab-planted IED destroys a vehicle in an AMISOM convoy near Mahadaay, causalities not immediately known. AU troops clashed with Al Shabab fighters shortly after explosion, causalities equally unknown in the subsequent clash. Sources said AMISOM soldiers have indiscriminately opened fire on a nearby civilians, killing a cattle herder and wounded four others after the Al Shabab militants ambush attack.
A security officer identified as Abdi Muhammad Gulled was sustained serious wounds during an al Shabaab operation in Daynille.
Eight soldiers were killed and their guns taken away following an al Shabaab ambush on the outskirts of Qansaxdheere in Bay region. Similarly seven others were wounded during the ambush.
Two soldiers were killed and another wounded after they were ambushed [by al Shabaab] at Suuqa Xoolaha neighbourhood in Mogadishu.

Violent demonstrations took place in Berbera this morning. Demonstrators set up road blocks on most of the roads in the town and burned tyres in the streets. SL police intervened and arrested unidentified number of the demonstrators in efforts to end the demonstration.
The former governor, along with 100 armed supporters, established a base in Biyo Kulule.
Al Shabaab attack a kill a security official in Jowhar on 21/06.

Somaliland Police clashed with community pastoralists at Qolcade following the Ministers of Interior and Livestock joint visit to confer with elders to enforce Somaliland Forestry Authority decision to preserve part of Qolcade. Five civilians and three police officers were injured and were reportedly being treated at Hargeisa hospitals. Tension remained high in the area due to government deployment of additional security forces.

SFG forces clashed with al Shabaab fighters who were collecting illegal tax from local residents at Masegawayn village (c. 28 km North East of Ceel-Dheer). The exchange of gunfire lasted for an hour. Seven al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the fighting.
Qubeys and Suleiman clans clash, eight killed, ten wounded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters carried out a probing attack against ENDF/ISWA forces in Tiyeeglow district (Approx. 90kms SE of Xudur). Al Shabaab fired small arms fire from a distance towards the ENDF/ISWA position in the town and retreated from the area. ENDF/ISWA forced did not respond. No casualty was reported from the incident.

ISWA soldiers attacked al Shabaab fighters at Bulo Fur village (approx. 10km NE of Qansax-Dheere district), prompting an armed clash that forced al Shabaab fighters to retreat from the village. ISWA soldiers briefly took control of the village but later withdrew, returning to their base in Qansax-Dheere district. Nine (09) al Shabaab fighters and five (05) ISWA soldiers were reportedly killed in the attack. One (01) PKM and two (02) rifles of AK47s were confiscated from ISWA soldiers during the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unknown men hurled a hand grenade at a JFS Soldier who was reportedly walking in Shaqalaha neighbourhood. One civilian was killed on spot by the explosion while the targeted soldier was seriously injured. The perpetrators managed to escape. JISA forces conducted a security operation but there were no reports on any arrests.

An unidentified person armed with a pistol reportedly shot and killed a male Government employee at Mana Bolyo in the vicinity of Shibis district. The motive is not clear and the perpetrator managed to escape.

Suspected Al Shabaab elements carried out a Hand Grenade attack against a Police post situated near a Military Training Compound along Tribunka Road in Hodan District. A Policeman and a female civilian bystander were wounded by the explosion. The Perpetrators escaped.
Eight dead due to clan fighting in Khaydaro, southern Mudug.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Suspected al-Shabaab fighters have fired several mortar rounds at Ethiopian military base in Halgan village. At least one civilian reported dead.
A child was killed and six others were seriously injured in a mortar attack on 22/06 in a village in Hodan district. Al Shabaab are believed to be responsible.
While pursuing al Shabaab in Gedo region, Kenyan forces air forces strike Ilaale location, near Ceel Waaq, killing four children. No reported combatant dead.

Non-violent activity: An unspecified number of civilian trucks headed to Kismayo were carjacked by al Shabaab fighters at Weelmaro area (c. 60 km East of Afmadow). The trucks were driven towards an unknown destination. The motive behind the carjacking was not known. A significant number of al Shabab fighters were observed at Bu'ale and Jilib headed towards West of Afmadow/Hagar
Crowds protest against the arrest of a Ayr clan leader.

A group of mainly teenagers blocked the road with burning tires in Sheikh Village. They protested against the recent joint venture agreement between Somaliland Government and a company from Dubai on the management of Berbera Port.

There was an armed clash between Qubays clan, sub clan of Dir, and Suleiman clan, sub clan of Habargidir, at Qaydarrey Village (c. 120 km South of Galkayo). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about three hours. Tension remained high as additional clan militia were mobilized. Galmudug Forces intervened to stop further clashes. Casualties not known. A similar clash occurred in the area two days earlier.

There was a demonstration against the arrest of HCTV journalist by Ethiopian authorities in Wajaale town of Gebiley. Demonstrators demanded for the immediate release of the journalist who was accused of false propaganda against the Ogadeen Administration on Jama Dubad killing.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and killed a local government municipal soldier who was collecting taxi revenue at Suuqa Weyn Market in Wadajir/Medina District. The motive of the attack was not clear. The assailants managed to escape.

Unconfirmed report indicated that an unidentified armed man using a pistol shot and killed a civilian man who worked with an NGO at Nasrudin Mosque vicinity in Howlwadag District. The motive of the assassination was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Mutiny of Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces clash with those loyal to former governor Abdisamad Mohamed Galan. casualties of unknown number reported after the Galan forces repulsed the attack.

Al Shabaab fighters ambushed Makane and Galjacel clan militias manning a CP located at Burjada Ceynta (c. 3 km West of Beletweyne town). Reports suggested that the militias collected illegal taxes from vehicles transporting goods and passengers. Al Shabaab fighters hid within the passengers and attacked the CP killing one militiaman and injuring another. The injured were taken to a local hospital located west of Hawlwadaag District.

Unidentified gunmen armed with AK 47 guns shot and killed three civilians from one family (Father and his two Sons) in their home at Dhagaxtuur neighbourhood in Afgoye District. The motive is not yet clear but unconfirmed reports describe it as clan revenge. Perpetrators managed to escape.

Unknown armed men suspected to be al Shabaab operatives reportedly shot and killed a chief clan elder (Mohamed Aden Nor aka 'Arabey') in front of his home in Afgoye's 21 October vicinity. The reason behind this attack is unknown and assailants managed to escape.

Two SNAF groups engaged in an exchange of gunfire near Karan Police station in Karan district. The soldiers who were divided along clan lines clashed over distribution of food. Reports indicate that at least one person was killed while five others mainly civilians were injured.
A hand grenade was hurled at Local Government Police tax collectors on duty in Howlwadag's Bakara Market. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators managed to escape.
Between 1 and 4 soldiers killed, and several wounded in a bomb blast at an army checkpoint in Heliwa on the morning of 23/06.
Kenyan forces repel an al Shabaab attack at Dhamase after hours of heavy fighting. Causalities not known.

Militias from the Begedi clan on a revenge mission reportedly carried out an attack against Habargidir militias based at the Omar Beere farm area in Afgoye district. There was an exchange of heavy gunfire for about one hour. At least three militants were injured. Tension remained high in the area.

Mr Hassan Hussein Sharlawe aka Hassan Nuur a Somali Diaspora (British Citizen) was reportedly abducted by al Shabaab fighters at Tarda village (Approx. 185km East of Belet Weyne town). The reason for the abduction is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed JLF at (Sarirah) area approx. 6km NW of Husungo. Reportedly the JLF were on their way back from a security patrol on the outskirts of the village during the attack. Two government soldiers were killed and seven others injured. AMISOM KDF troops also reached the scene right after the incident but the perpetrators had managed to escape from the area after the incident. The number of casualties on the al Shabaab side is unknown.
Al Shabaab launch mortar rounds on Wardhigly and Hodan districts. No deaths reported in Wardhigley.
A hand grenade was hurled at an SNPF checkpoint near Howlwadag junction road in Howlwadag district. No casualties reported and perpetrators escaped.

Unconfirmed reports indicate that unknown gunmen driving a small luxury Vehicle hurled two hand grenades at Hodan Police station and Milk Factory respectively followed by a light gunfire exchange that lasted for about 10 minutes. The attackers were repelled and their motive remains unclear. No reports of casualties.
Suspected al Shabaab mortar shells kill one in Hodan district and wound others during the night-time hours.

Al Shabaab detonate a car bomb followed by a raid on Naasa Hablood hotel, which is often used by politicians, during the early morning hours. At least 11 dead. Following the attack, security forces moved in a attempted to re-take the hotel. At least two dead in the counter attack.

Al Shabaab detonate a car bomb followed by a raid on Naasa Hablood hotel, which is often used by politicians, during the early morning hours. Between 11 and 14 initially thought dead, though the number was eventually raised to sixteen in the following days. Following the attack, security forces moved in a attempted to re-take the hotel. At least two al Shabaab dead in the counter attack.

ISWA special police forces attacked an al Shabaab position at Buur Eyle village (approx. 60kms NE of Buurhakaba district). There was an extended armed clash which forced al Shabaab fighters to retreat from the position. ISWA forces reportedly withdrew from the village immediately after the incident. The attack was reportedly part of a security operation ISWA forces conduct in areas under the district of Buurhakaba. Three al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the attack. In relation to the above incident, al Shabaab fighters ambushed ISWA police forces returning to their Base in Buurhakaba at Shiidaalow village (20kms NE of Buurhakaba district). There was a brief exchange of gunfire before the AS fighters retreated from the area. One ISWA soldier was reportedly killed. ISWA soldiers safely arrived at their base in Buurhakaba district.
Two sub-clans hailing from the Dulbahante clan clashed over an ongoing blood compensation matter in Xidh, Sool Region. No causalities reported.

A fierce gun battle erupted between two Dulbahante sub clans (Bahabarsame and Qayaad) at Xidh-Galool (69km SW of Lasanod and 228km SE of Burao). Reportedly, the fighting is linked to a series of disputes between the two sub clans on the mode of blood compensation for previous killings. Efforts by SLA and dulbahante elders to diffuse the tension have been fruitless. The clash lasted for about half an hour. No confirmation of casualties.

ISWA special police forces attacked an al Shabaab position at Buur Eyle village (approx. 60kms NE of Buurhakaba district). There was an extended armed clash which forced al Shabaab fighters to retreat from the position. ISWA forces reportedly withdrew from the village immediately after the incident. The attack was reportedly part of a security operation ISWA forces conduct in areas under the district of Buurhakaba. Three al Shabaab fighters were reportedly killed in the attack. In relation to the above incident, al Shabaab fighters ambushed ISWA police forces returning to their Base in Buurhakaba at Shiidaalow village (20kms NE of Buurhakaba district). There was a brief exchange of gunfire before the al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. One ISWA soldier was reportedly killed. ISWA soldiers safely arrived at their base in Buurhakaba district.

An unidentified man hurled a hand grenade at the residence of a member of the local authority in Buurhakaba district (approx. 60kms SE of Baidoa). One person was reportedly killed and another injured in the explosion. A second hand grenade landed inside the house but did not detonate. The perpetrator managed to escape from the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Two people were shot and wounded by a policeman in the proximity of Laanta Hawada stadium due to a food distribution dispute.

A suspicious vehicle (Toyota Noah) was ordered to stop by NISA officer on duty as it approached 21 October School. As the NISA officer approached the vehicle, the VBIED immediately exploded killing the suicide bomber and seriously injuring the NISA officer. The location was some 600 meters SE of NASA Hablod -1 hotel. The real target of the VBIED was not known.
Government forces repel an al Shabaab attack on Maxaas, at least four dead, 21 arrested.
Kenyan defence forces (KDF) have fired at least nine mortar rounds on a residential area in Gedo region near Somali border with Kenya on 26/06, killing one civilian.

A bomb-disposal unit member was confirmed dead as he was trying to defuse a IEDs planted outside the KDF military camp in Baardheere. No group or individual has claimed credit for the blasts, but suspicion falls on Al Shabaab.

A hand grenade was hurled at SNAF soldiers on foot patrol at a small market situated at Dhagahtur vicinity in Afgoye district. At least four people including a SNAF soldier and three civilian bystanders were reportedly injured by the blast. Perpetrators managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters conducted a probing attack against SNA position in Rabdhure district. They used small arms fire combined with RPGs against the SNA base in the town. SNA forces responded with small arms fire and al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area. No casualty was reported.

An ISWA soldier shot and killed a fellow soldier after a dispute in Hawlwadag neighbourhood of Baidoa. A violent argument reportedly broke out between the two men and the perpetrator reportedly shot and killed the victim. The exact reason behind the incident is unclear yet. The perpetrator was arrested.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly took over Goofgaduud Shabellow from SNA soldiers without resistance after SNA force vacated the village. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly arrested several people including local elders after they took over the village. The circumstances surrounding the detention of the civilians are unclear.

One of the Galkayo District Council members for Puntland, Said Xayle, was shot and killed while another man accompanying him was injured by two armed men in front of victim's residence in Garsoor Village, SW of Galkayo. The perpetrators managed to escape. PL security forces conducted security operation after the incident and arrested 40.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed three civilian pastoralists near Eel Leheli village. The motive is not yet clear but the victims reportedly used to deliver livestock products to Xudur town near Ele-leheli village (approx. 25kms SW of Xudur town). The victims were killed in their residences

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: An exchange of gunfire occurred between armed police officers loyal to the former deputy police commander who was recently sacked and security guards of Bari Police Division office in Bossaso. The former deputy police commander took over Bari division police office. One police officer was wounded. Following the incident, Bari governor intervened, calmed down and solved the problem. The Former Deputy Police commander reportedly moved his soldiers to the town and situation returned back to normal.

Unidentified gunmen armed with Pistols reportedly shot and killed a Government soldier at Seybiano vicinity in Hodan District. The motive of the assassination is not yet clear and perpetrators managed to escape.

A hand grenade was hurled at SNPF checkpoint near Bakara Market junction road in Howlwadag District, followed by gunfire which lasted for about 5 minutes. No casualties were reported and the perpetrators managed to escape.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate an army colonel near his residence.
Unidentified gunmen attack and kill a government official in Gaalkacyo.
A hand grenade was hurled at SNPF soldiers at Municipal Office in Merka's Saraha vicinity. At least one civilian bystander was reportedly injured by the blast. Perpetrators managed to escape.

Al Shabaab fighters and SNA forces briefly exchanged gunfire near El- Leheli village (approx. 25km SW of Xudur town). The SNA forces were on security operation against al Shabaab elements in the area during the incident. Al Shabaab fighters retreated from the area and no casualty was reported.

One person was shot and killed and two others injured after clan militia men from Sa'ad clan, sub-clan of Habargidir ambushed a vehicle that was heading to Galkayo at Jeexdin (c. 15 km East of Galkayo). The three victims were from Omar Mohamud clan, sub-clan of Majeerten. The attackers managed to escape from the scene.
On 27 June, a Habar Yonis clansman stabbed and severely injured a fellow clansman in Oodweyne.

A man was shot and killed by another man near Abudwak airfield due to clan retaliation between two sub-clans of Marehan. The perpetrator was arrested by his clan elders and handed over to Galmudug police in Abudwak.

Unconfirmed reports indicate that two hand grenades were hurled at an SNPF checkpoint located near the DC's Office in Kahda settlement. Two SNPF soldiers were injured. ISIS claimed responsibility for the attack. Perpetrators managed to escape.
Suspected al Shabaab militants armed with pistols reportedly shot and killed an unarmed NISA soldier at Via Liberia vicinity in Waberi district. Perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM forces clash with al Shabaab, retake Goof Guduud. Two al Shabaab dead.
A fierce battle between two armed clan militiamen of unknown identity has erupted west of Beledweyne. No details of casualties.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: [Al Shabaab] ambushed Jubbaland and Ethiopian troops outside Kismayo city. Causalities not known.
KDF jets strike al Shabaab locations (not named) in Gedo region killing 40.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: At least one person has been killed and several others wounded in fighting between Somali government forces backed by Ethiopian troops that are part of AMISOM [African Unions Mission in Somalia] troops and al-Shabab movement in the town of Galhareeri, Galguduud Region.

Demonstrations were reported in Beletweyne where hundreds of people including children and elderly men and women took to the streets to protest against the FGS for the selection of New Hawadle Ugaas. They blocked the roads, burned tyres and pictures of the head of state (Hon Hassan Sheikh Mohamoud).

Violent demonstrations were reported in Burao against action against Somali people by Ethiopian authority zone 5 of Ethiopia. Demonstrators burned tires, blocked roads and attacked several businessmen from Ogaden (Ethiopia). They also expressed discontent with SL authorities for remaining silent on the issue. Police fired in the air to disperse the crowd. The demonstration ended without any human casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected al Shabaab militants carried out an ambush attack against AMISOM Convoy at Dabayodle Village approx. 30km North East of Jowhar District. The exchange of heavy gunfire lasted for about one hour before attackers were repelled. No reports of casualties.

Two people were found dead on the southern outskirts of Lasanod. One of the victims was identified as a community elder involved in the negotiation/reconciliation of Dharkein Genyo clashes between two Dulbahante Sub-clans. The men were driving towards the town when they were killed. Nobody has yet claimed responsibility or been arrested.

Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed a local civilian on the outskirts of Rabdhuure district (approx. 90kms W of Xudur). The victim was reportedly a member of the local youth committee that works with the local authority on youth issues. The exact motive behind the killing is unclear yet. But it is suspected that he was killed because of his collaboration with the local authority of the district.

Al Shabaab fighters reportedly beheaded one of the people (Abdullahi Durow) they abducted from Goofgaduud village early this morning near Manaas village (approx. 30kms SW of Baidoa town). The body of the victim was placed on the main road between Baidoa and Goofgaduud village where the victim was abducted before. The motive behind the killing is unknown.

A man from Sa'ad clan was shot and killed by gunmen from Omar Mohamud clan near Jeexdin (c. 18 km East of Galkayo). The motive was clan retaliation (Ref: DSR on 28 June 2016). The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Jubaland Darwish forces with AMISOM troops conducted security operation against al Shabaab suspected position outside Kismayo. The joint forces reportedly reached Singaler/Wirkoy area (approx. 35kms NW of Kismayo). AS fighters and anti-AS forces briefly exchanged gunfire near the said locations. AS fighters reportedly retreated from the area and no casualty was reported from the incident.

The beheaded body of a female resident in Wajid district was found in the suburbs of Wajid (approx. 90kms SW of Xudur). The victim reportedly left the town to herd some goats on her normal daily routine, but went missing for two days. The motive is unknown and al Shabaab is suspected to have perpetrated the incident.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: On 28/06, suspected US drones hit Al shabaab bases near Jilib town in Middle Jubba region. Causalities not known.

Unidentified gunmen armed with Pistols reportedly shot and killed one SNAF soldier (Ali Mohamed Adow a.k.a Ali waal) and took his rifle at Haji Gabow vicinity in Dharkenley District. The motive is not yet clear and perpetrators managed to escape.
One SNA soldier reportedly shot and killed a Tuk Tuk tricycle driver at Ex. Control Afgoye in Wadajir/Medina District over extortion money dispute. Perpetrator was arrested and detained.

The FGS Finance Director at the Ministry Air & Transport (Abdirizak Ali aka Anod) was reportedly shot and killed by one of his bodyguards inside his office in Shangani District. The motive is not yet clear but the guard was reported to have demanded for some money from the director before he shot him. The Perpetrator managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab militants reportedly hurled a hand-grenade at an SNPF checkpoint at Black - Sea junction road in Howlwadag District neighbourhood. One SNPF personnel was reportedly injured. Perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.
Unknown foreign military warplanes have carried out an airstrike on Al Shabaab controlled area of Mahadaay. The bombardment killed an unknown number of pastoralists and their livestock.
Government forces clash with al Shabaab between Gacanlaw and El Dhere area in Hiiraan region. Both sides used heavy weaponry in the battle. Causalities reported, numbers not known.

A group of people held demonstrations to denounce the arrest of a TV journalist in Wajaale town and demanded his immediate release. Ethiopian authorities held him following the broadcast of a programme on Jamac Dubad incidents.
Suspected al Shabaab militants reportedly shot and killed one SNAF soldier and took his rifle at Merka market in Merka District. The motive is not yet clear and perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified men armed with Pistols reportedly shot and killed a male civilian who was allegedly linked to the DC near THE DC's Office in Howlwadag District. The motive is not yet clear and assailants managed to escape.

At least 1 person has been killed and three others sustained injures in a bomb attack on a military convoy carrying Somali soldiers in Mogadishu along Factory Road. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrator.

Suspected al Shabaab militants carried out an ambush attack against a SNAF water tanker escorted by five SNAF soldiers from Afgoye Heading to Lanta Buuro at Adow Dibile Village approx. 8km South West of Afgoye District. The exchange of heavy gunfire lasted for about 20 minutes. Al Shabaab militants reportedly killed two SNAF soldiers and captured three others. They also destroyed the Water tanker. No al Shabaab casualties were reported.
A suspected al Shabaab IED targets a bus between Lafoole and Mogadishu, killing 20 and injuring others.
Kenyan Air Forces carry out strikes on an al Shabaab position Belet Xaawo in response to an attack in Lamu, Kenya. The strikes killed ""militants and civilians.""

Southwest Special Police Forces (SWSPF) reportedly attacked an al Shabaab position in Gurban village (approx. 45km W of Dinsoor district). There was a brief exchange of gunfire before al Shabaab fighters retreated. Four al Shabaab fighters including a mid-level al Shabaab commander (Ali Nur aka Iskooda) were reportedly killed and three SWSP forces injured. SWSP forces returned to their base after the incident. The attack was part of routine security operation targeting al Shabaab elements in areas close to the district.

Suspected al Shabaab militants carried out an ambush attack against SNAF (Luxury Vehicle) escorted by three SNA soldiers near Wahara Adde Market Huriwa district. The exchange of gunfire lasted for about 15 minutes. One SNAF soldier was reportedly killed and two others injured.

Unidentified gunmen armed with Pistols reportedly shot and killed a famous Mullah (Aidid Hassan Hussein) who was allegedly working with a Government TV station at Israac village in Hamarjajab District. The Victim was shot as he came out of Mosque after isha pray. The motive of the assassination is not yet clear and attackers managed to escape.

A hand grenade was reportedly hurled at SNGF soldiers on foot patrol at Seybiano vicinity in Hodan District. The soldiers survived the explosion but two bystanders were killed by the blast. The motive is not yet clear and the assailants managed to escape.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab takes control of Rab Dhuure after AMISOM-ENDF forces withdrew. No reported violence.
Two people were killed and 18 were wounded during an early morning mortar attack against several neighbourhoods of Baidoa. Al Shabaab suspected.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters gain control of Rab Dhuure and Buur Dhuxunle after AMISOM forces withdrew. No reported violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters gain control of Rab Dhuure and Buur Dhuxunle after AMISOM forces withdrew. No reported violence.

A group of civilians looted Non Food item (NFI) destined for victims of the recent rains in Hargeisa, at Shaab neighbourhood. The NFIs were being distributed jointly by UN Agencies and an NGO. UN Staff members were safely removed from the area but a UN vehicle'S rear window was broken.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: A group of al Shabaab fighters carried out a hit and run attack against the AMISOM base at Mudul Barawe neighbourhood in Barawe district. Both sides exchanged heavy gunfire for about 15 minutes after which al Shabaab militants retreated. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters reportedly ambushed an AMISOM (KDF Contingent) convoy heading to Kulbiyow at Ali Wali area (approx. 8kms SW of Kulbiyo, the borderline between Kenya and Somali). The convoy was reportedly heading to Kulbiyo village. An explosion initiated the ambush followed by an armed clash between the two sides. One KDF military truck was reportedly damaged by the explosion. Casualties from the incident are unknown.

Unknown armed men (later suspected to be al Shabaab) shot and killed a local elder and member of village committee (Omar Maqasin) in Hawlwadag neighbourhood of Beledweyne. The victim reportedly came from his residence and was heading to a local mosque during the incident. The motive is not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape and no one was arrested in connection of this incident.

One person was killed by al Shabaab fighters at Gal-Cad village (c. 60 km North West of Ceel-Dheer). The victim was captured shortly before he was executed. Reportedly, al Shabaab accused the victim of having links with SFG.
Weapons Seizure: An explosives-laden car has been seized by the Somali security forces (police) in the capital Mogadishu on the evening of 02/07.
A senior Somali military commander has been wounded when unknown gunmen have attacked his vehicle near Abudwak town.
One SFG soldier was shot and killed and another injured by ASWJ militants at Huurshe near Xeraale village (c. 45 km South West of Abudwak) during an armed clash.

A hand grenade was hurled at SNAF soldiers on foot patrol in Merka's Abroone neighbourhood. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions. One SNAF soldier was injured by blast and the assailants managed to escape.

Suspected al Shabaab militants carried out an attack against SNAF defensive base near Shalamboot town (approx. 9 km North West of Merka district). Both sides exchanged gunfire before al Shabaab militants were repelled. Casualties could not be established.

One person from Ayr clan was shot and killed by a gunman from Saleban clan in an area between Caada-kibir and Godinlabe (approx. 32kms) SE of Adado. The killing is related to clan retaliation between the local clans. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

Unidentified armed men with AK 47 rifles attacked and injured two male civilians who were traveling with a lorry fetching Water from Degelema heading to Barkinta village (approx. 35km S of Dhobley ) at the Border line between Kenya and Somalia. Victims were reportedly taken to Kenya for further medical treatment. The perpetrators managed to escape. The motive is unknown.
A hand grenade was reportedly hurled at Mirra Khat Market in Merka's Owbale section. At least two civilian bystanders were injured. The motive is not yet clear and perpetrators managed to escape.
An unidentified gun man shot and killed a taxi driver near Rooble in Biyo kulule. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A roadside bomb blast reportedly hit an African Union force convoy travelling near Mahaday town in Middle Shabelle region. Al Shabaab suspected as perpetrator.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab overtakes Galcad after AMISOM exit. No violence reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF/SNA forces reportedly withdrew from Buurdhuxunle village (approx. 30kms SE of Rabdhure district) and reportedly headed to Wajid district. Motive behind the withdrawal is unknown. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly took over the town immediately after the withdrawal of ENDF/SNA forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters reportedly fired a number of RPG rounds combined with small arms fire against AMISOM (ENDF Contingent) convoy near Beer Xaano village (approx. 30kms S of Beledweyne town). AMISOM forces reportedly responded with heavy weapons and small arms fire. No casualty was reported. Al Shabaab fighters reportedly escaped from the area.

A hand grenade was hurled at SNGF soldiers on foot patrol in Merka's Beytu - Raas vicinity. Soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions. Casualties could not be ascertained but assailants managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: One person was killed and another seriously injured by PL security forces at Dhagaxyacado village (approx. 13kms) west of Galkayo. The incident occurred after the soldiers opened gun fire on a vehicle transporting Khat (Miira) from Galkayo to Bursalah. The reports added that the driver failed to stop the vehicle at the checkpoint manned by security forces.
An RCIED apparently targeting SNGF reportedly detonated at Radeerka neighbourhood in Dayniile District. Casualties could not be stablished and perpetrators escaped.

Two SNGF soldiers reportedly engaged in an argument over an unknown issue and subsequently exchanged gunfire at Cagadhiig Police camp in Wardhigley's Cagadhiig neighbourhood. One soldier was killed and the other severely injured. The motive is not yet clear.

Unidentified gunmen armed with pistols shot and killed a municipal senior officer on duty (collecting revenue from business shops) at Abdalla - Shideye vicinity in Howlwadag's Bakaro Market. The motive is unclear and perpetrators managed to escape.
Military forces gain control of Dhuboy, Malable and Galweel on 04/07 without violence.
A clan influenced attack on Hogdugaag kills one and injures another.
Military forces gain control of Dhuboy, Malable and Galweel on 04/07 without violence.
Military forces gain control of Dhuboy, Malable and Galweel on 04/07 without violence.

An RCIED targeting the SNA exploded near an SNA. check point and hit a civilian vehicle in Bardhere. No casualties/injuries were reported, however, vehicle windows (glass) were shattered. Al Shabaab militants are suspected to be behind this attack.

A group of al Shabaab fighters attacked a NISA checkpoint at the Huriwa's SOS junction road. The exchange of gunfire lasted for about 10 minutes before al Shabaab attack was repelled. No casualties reported.
At least 16 people were injured on Tuesday in a grenade attack on Medina market in Wadajir district.
An explosive near a water well in Dhabaa, near Dhamase, targets Kenyan forces. One area resident was killed and two others were wounded in the blasts. Al Shabaab are suspected as perpetrators.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Reports from Bay and Bakool Regions indicate that al-Shabab fighters have shelled bases belonging to Ethiopian troops in the towns of Wajid and Diinsoor. Several injuries reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Reports from Bay and Bakool Regions indicate that al-Shabab fighters have shelled bases belonging to Ethiopian troops in the towns of Wajid and Diinsoor. Several injuries reported.

Al Shabaab militants reportedly attacked SNAF defensive bases at Qoryoley's Bulla Sheikh Vicinity. The exchange of gunfire lasted for about 10 minutes before al Shabaab militants withdrew. No casualties were reported.

A hand grenade was reportedly hurled at SNAF checkpoint in Huriwa, Wahara Adde neighbourhood. SNAF soldiers reacted with gunfire at suspected direction. No casualties were reported and perpetrators managed to escape.
Two people were killed and three others wounded after fierce fighting erupted in central Somali town of Cadaado, Galguduud Region between police forces and a militia loyal to a local businessman.
Al Shabaab executed two men accused of killing journalists ""several months ago.""
At least 3 people were killed, and 10 others wounded in twin grenade blasts at an army barracks in Marka. Al Shabaab suspected. The blasts were followed by gunfire.

Al Shabaab hijacked two vehicles carrying khat near Dhobley after opening fire on the drivers. The fate of the vehicles and passengers remain unknown after Al Shabaab took them to undisclosed location in Lower Jubba region

An IED apparently planted on a private vehicle owned by one clan elder reportedly detonated near Dahabshil new building in Waberi's 1 March neighbourhood. The car was parked outside his home at the time of explosion. Causalities not reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Unidentified gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab fighters carried out an ambush attack against an AMISOM Convoy at El Baraf village, 30Km NE of Mahaday town. The exchange of gunfire lasted for about 20 minutes before al Shabelle fighters were repelled. No report of casualties.

Two persons were shot and killed and another injured by gunman at Garsoor village SW of Galkayo. The victims were sitting at a crowded teashop when the perpetrator opened gun fire. The perpetrator was arrested and his motive remains unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: At least two PMPF soldiers were reportedly wounded by a road side IED explosion on the road from Bossaso to Galgala mountains.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A remote controlled IED targets an AMISOM-ENDF convoy at Rab Dhuure. No reported deaths. Though no group has claimed responsibility the source suspects al Shabaab. Following the blast the soldiers opened fire at nearby residents, killing two civilians.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A remote controlled IED targets an AMISOM-ENDF convoy at Rab Dhuure. No reported deaths. Though no group has claimed responsibility the source suspects al Shabaab. Following the blast the soldiers opened fire at nearby residents, killing two civilians.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: AMISOM (Djiboutian) forces in an attempt to clear an illegal checkpoint in Liiqliiqato Bridge, Hawlwadag neighbourhood of Western Beledweyne exchanged gunfire with clan militias at the checkpoint. The clan militias set up the checkpoint during the last incident of armed clash in that part of the town. AMISOM forces are reportedly at the location. No casualty was reported from the incident.

The SNA reportedly carried out an attack against an al Shabaab stronghold at Gobanle in the Lower Shabelle region. The SNA overran the al Shabaab base from where most al Shabaab attacks have been planned. This victory is very significant for the SNA and the FGS. Casualties could not be established and there was no comment from al Shabaab.
Police reported that at least one person from Ali Saleeban sub clan was killed by Ali Jibrail in Ufeyn, 115km SE of Bossaso. Intial reports indicate that the motive is related to clan revenge.

Non-violent activity: An al Shabaab militant was reportedly caught planting an EID on Belet-Xaawa main road during the night. The incident was reported to Dollow LA which instructed SNA in Belet-Xaawa to get hold of the perpetrator. Later on SNA from Dollow was dispatched to Belet-hawa to take over the perpetrator and bring him to Dollow. The person is currently under custody of Dollow SNA. According to information the perpetrator has given more information concerning some civilians in Belet-Xaawa who pretend to be businessmen but are involved in al Shabelle activities.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: An exchange of gunfire occurred between Local police and armed clan militiamen from Dishiishe clan in Waaciye Village c.50km NE of Qardho. The situation arose when police tried to arrest clan militia men involved in illegal smuggling and the clan militiamen refused to surrender. Three people were injured.
Hundreds of protesters staged demonstrations in Somali capital Mogadishu on Monday against recent suicide attack on holy city of Madina.

Somali government troops, who are organised along clan lines, today clashed in Mogadishus Siliga neighbourhood. The gun battle was triggered by a dispute over ownership of a piece of land containing structures. At least two civilians were killed and eight others were wounded in the gunfight.

A clan militia exchanged small arms fire briefly near Deefow village (approx. 35kms NW of Beledweyne) after a group of the same clan militia attempted to secure livestock from the others. The locals immediately intervened and removed the disputed livestock from the area. The livestock was reportedly robbed from Hawadle clan. No casualties reported.

Detonation: Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade against SNA forces position at Buundaweyn in Halwadag neighbourhood west of Beledweyne town. The hand grenade landed and exploded outside the SNA post in an open area. No casualty was reported from the incident. The perpetrator managed to escape.

Al Shabaab claims to have overtaken Marka. Casualties not known. The SNG denies these claims, though a police commander later admitted during a radio interview that al Shabaab did in fact enter the town. It is believed Somali soldiers left their posts in the town in protest of pay.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired six rounds of mortars targeting an ENDF base in the northern side of the town. They reportedly fired 82mm mortar rounds which landed outside the ENDF base. None of the mortars landed in the town. ENDF forces responded with artillery but no casualty was reported from the incident.

A shootout was reported this morning between police and a man claiming ownership of a plot of land near Berbera regional court. The man armed with a pistol fired several shots before running away. No casualties were reported.

Hundreds of people, mainly civilians, gathered in front of Isbaheysiga (alliance Mosque) in Hamarjajab district protesting against the recent explosions that rocked the holy Mosque in Medina, Saudi Arabia on Monday 4 July 2016. The protest was a sequel to the call for Muslim leaders in the community to condemn the attack. Protesters waved banners decrying the militant act. The demonstration was peaceful and there were no restrictions imposed on movement.
Al Shabaab rammed a car packed with explosives into a Somali army base southwest of the capital, near Afgooye. An exchange of gunfire followed. Twelve al Shabaab and ten soldiers dead.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: At least three people are known to have been killed in a fierce gunfight between troops within the regional administration of Puntland state in an area between Bosaso and Qardho. The battle has led to the deaths of three soldiers. The nature of the clash was related to control of a checkpoint.
Al Shabaab attacks a army checkpoint with an explosive in Hawl Wadaag on 11/07, killing one.

Al-Shabab fighters temporarily overran a Somali government military base in Laanta Buur. The militants attacked the base at around 1:30 a.m. Monday local time, killing soldiers and seizing weapons and military trucks, security officials said. The attack began with a suicide car bomb at the main entrance of the base, followed by massive attack by hundreds of heavily armed attackers. Some soldiers at the base reportedly attempted to defend themselves but were overpowered. Causality number vary, some as high as 30.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Former Bari region claimed Puntland presidential guards have shot and killed civilians in Waciye and Xidho areas in Bari region. Date(s) unknown, causality number not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Defusal: Security operations conducted by the Jubbaland Intelligence Security Agency Forces discovered a prepared IED in via Afmadow neighbourhood. Reports indicate that civilians in the village sighted the IED which was concealed in garbage area and contacted security forces. The Jubbaland Intelligence forces couldn't dismantle the device successfully but they manage to destroy it safely.

A female pastoralist was killed by unidentified gunmen at her family house at Lama-ali-biid vicinity (c. 25 km east of Galkayo). The motive is likely to be related to clan revenge. The perpetrators managed to escape from the scene.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces and ""local militia"" exchange fire after AMISOM attempted to dismantle illegal roadblocks in Belet Weyne. The clash caused ""loss of life."" Other sources refer to the actors as ""Somali soldiers.""
Military forces in Marka abandon their posts, leave the town in protest of pay.
Alleged soldiers clash among themselves over khat in Dharkenly. The fighting has resulted in casualties, including death and injuries. Causalities also reported among area civilians.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Former Bari region claimed Puntland presidential guards have shot and killed civilians in Waciye and Xidho areas in Bari region. Date(s) unknown, causality number not known.

A police station in Mogadishus Waberi district is reported to have been attacked with multiple explosives. The sounds of the powerful explosions could be heard across the cities downtown, with no reports of the type of the blasts and who carried out. Causalities not known.
Suspected al Shabaab kills two Ethiopian nationals in Buuhoodle.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SWSPF/SNA base in Goofgaduud Shabellow village (approx. 25kms SW of Baidoa). Al Shabaab reportedly fired several rounds of RPGs and briefly engaged in an armed clash with SWSPF/SNA forces before they took over the base from SWSPF/SNA soldiers who retreated. Causalities not known. SWSPF/SNA reinforcements reached the village and recaptured it from al Shabaab fighters without resistance. SWSPF/SNA forces are currently in control of the village.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked SWSPF/SNA base in Goofgaduud Shabellow village (approx. 25kms SW of Baidoa). Al Shabaab reportedly fired several rounds of RPGs and briefly engaged in an armed clash with SWSPF/SNA forces before they took over the base from SWSPF/SNA soldiers who retreated. Causalities not known. SWSPF/SNA reinforcements reached the village and recaptured it from al Shabaab fighters without resistance. SWSPF/SNA forces are currently in control of the village.

Unidentified armed men using pistols shot and injured a civilian in Halwadag Neighbourhood, West of Beletweyne town. The victim was rushed to hospital for medical treatment. The motive behind the incident was not clear. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A woman was seriously wounded after a group of women attacked her using an axe at the main milk market of Bossaso. The victim was taken to Bossaso General Hospital. The perpetrators managed to escape and police were reported to be investigating.

Al Shabaab militants hurled a HG at SNGF CP located near Biyadegenka in the Livestock market in Huriwa. The soldiers reacted with gunfire towards suspected directions. Casualties could not be established and the perpetrators managed to escape.
Suspected al Shabaab kidnap a female civilian in Luuqjelow. He body was lasted discovered decapitated.

Defusal: Security forces thwart a large attack by suspected al Shabaab on a Mogadishu hotel on 14/07. Local government spokesman Abdifitah Omar Halane said that a car loaded with high-explosive bombs had been intercepted with an individual linked to Al Qaida affiliated al-Shabaab group. No violence reported.
Al Shabaab fighters have executed ""a number"" of individuals accused of killing others in clan hostilities in the region. Date(s) not known - source dated 14/07.

Two Kenyan soldiers and one Somali soldier were killed Friday when al-Shabab militants ambushed their convoy in Ceel Waaq District. Regional military officials said the ambush began with a massive roadside explosion which destroyed a Kenyan military vehicle, killing the two Kenyan soldiers and wounding others. Al-Shabaab fighters then fired on the convoy and exchanged heavy gunfire with Kenyan and Somali National Army soldiers. Officials said at least three militants were killed in the fighting. Later, Somali Memo reported 11 KDF dead.
Hundreds of demonstrators gathered in Mogadishu to protest the attempted coup in Turkey.
Al Shabaab forces carried out an attack on a checkpoint in Burane area which is located on the outskirts of Mahadday district, killing several soldiers.

At least one person is known to have been killed, and 2 were wounded in a clan fight in the central town of Beledweyne, 350Km north of Mogadishu on Sunday. The clash is believed to be over land. The identities of the clans are not known.

Al Shabaab attacked a group of government soldiers in Elka-Geela, Balad District during the late night hours. At least eight federal government soldiers were killed in the attack. Al-Shabaab fighters captured a vehicle belonging to federal government forces and weapons.
Al-Shabaab forces waged an attack on a checkpoint manned by [government forces or allies] in El Gelow area which falls under Balad district. Seven dead, weapons seized.
Al Shaabab briefly overtook Qoryooley, including a police station and military bases. No reported casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: At least 14 Somali civilians were killed and three others wounded following a shooting between Ethiopian troops and al-Shabab fighters in War Diinle. Witnesses claim the ENDF forces opened fire indiscriminately on the civilians following the clash. No reported dead among the combatants.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: At least 14 Somali civilians were killed and three others wounded following a shooting between Ethiopian troops and al-Shabab fighters in War Diinle. Witnesses claim the ENDF forces opened fire indiscriminately on the civilians following the clash. No reported dead among the combatants.
At least 1 Somali soldier died, and 2 others were wounded on Monday in a bomb attack at army checkpoint in Afgoye town on Lower Shabelle region. Al Shabaab believed responsible.

A Habar Jeclo/Ahmeed Farax sub-clan man was stabbed and killed by a fellow clansman in Lasgalol Valley near Laas Domaare (c. 57 km West of Ceel-Afweyn) due to a land dispute. The perpetrator escaped from the scene.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: At least five soldiers have been killed after Puntland and Somaliland troops clashed in Bodda Ad, near Dhahar, northern Sanaag region. The clash was related to a voter registration exercise.
At least eight soldiers serving with Somali National Army (SNA) are confirmed killed in a massive Al Shabaab attack at military checkpoint near Balad town.

SNPF personnel shot at a public minibus when the driver refused to stop at a CP located at Zobe Junction in Wadajir District. A 16-year-old boy was killed during the incident. SNPF personnel conducted a security search operation where they succeeded in apprehending the SNPF officer who was involved in the incident.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: AMISOM/Djibouti forces clash with SNA forces during an attempted arrest of the latter. An SNA soldier was reported dead. Following the clash local residents demonstrated, condemning the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF (Leyu Police) clashed with a group of Ogaden National Liberation Front (ONLF) members near Mataban (c. 70 km North East of Beletweyne). Eight ONLF members were killed and four others were captured. ASWJ in Mataban captured one ONLF militias who was transferred to Leyu Police. ONLF members were headed to the Ethiopia-Somali border at the time of the incident.

Relatives of a khat dealer clashed with a group of men at the khat market in Baidoa Town. There was an exchange of small arms fire. The clash occurred after the khat dealer disputed with a man over payments of khat which later escalated into a clan issue between Hari and Leysan clans. ISWA intervened and defused the situation. The perpetrator was arrested and police were reportedly conducting further investigation.

Unidentified armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab fighters, carried out a hit and run attack against SNAF defensive base in Ali Fool Dheere vicinity in Mahaday (c. 25 km East of Jowhar District). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters were repelled. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Unidentified armed men, suspected to be al Shabaab militants, carried out a hit and run attack at AMISOM base at Danow (c. 16 km North West of Merka District). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which the attackers were repelled. There were no reports of casualties.
AMISOM/Djibouti forces clash with SNA forces during an attempted arrest of the latter. An SNA soldier was reported dead. Following the clash local residents demonstrated, condemning the incident.
A deceased body, said to be Ethiopian, was discovered near the entrance of Bossaso police CP. The cause of death was not clear. Police were reported to be investigating.

A business woman operating a butchery in Galkayo town organized a demonstration against a private butchery company that slaughtered goats, cows and camels. Puntland local government in Galkayo town convened a special committee to resolve the issue.

Two groups of SNAF soldiers clashed at Ex. Control Afgoye in Medina/Wadajir District. There was a brief exchange of gunfire. The clash was triggered after SNAF soldiers belonging to Hawiye/Abgal clan allowed a fellow clan female khat dealer to access the town without extorting them. Other soldiers from Hawiye/Hawadle were disgruntled and reacted with gunfire. There were no reports of casualties at the time of reporting.
Protests over a AMISOM/SNA clash continue into a second day.
Hundreds of people took to the streets in Somalias northern town of Dahar on Wednesday to protest against the military incursion of Somaliland admin forces in Sanaag region.

Pro Puntland supporters conducted a demonstration in Xin-Galool, Badhan and Dhahar Districts of Eastern Sanaag to protest against Somaliland voter registration process and deployment of troops in Sanaag region. Tension in the area remained very high.

Pro Puntland supporters conducted a demonstration in Xin-Galool, Badhan and Dhahar Districts of Eastern Sanaag to protest against Somaliland voter registration process and deployment of troops in Sanaag region. Tension in the area remained very high.

Suspected al Shabaab militants shot at a public minibus at the outskirt of Bullo Marer town in Lower Shabelle. One civilian passenger was killed while three others were injured. The motive behind the attack was unknown. The perpetrators managed to escape.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab fighters and JISA forces clashed at Wurkoy village (c. 37 km North East of Kismayo town) near Bulo Gudud Village on the road to Mogadishu. The exchange of gunfire lasted for about 40 minutes. JISA confirmed killing more than five al Shabaab and injuring more than five others.
A NISA soldier shot and killed another soldier at Israac vicinity in Hamarjajab District after a dispute erupted. The perpetrator managed to escape.
At least two people are known to have been killed, and two others wounded after unknown gunmen have opened fire on a civilian bus between Bulo-Mareer and Golwayn villages in Lower Shabelle region.
Al-Shabaab fighters blew up Wirkoy Bridge, which is not that far from Buulo Gaduud, in an apparent attempt to slow down a multi-actor assault on Buulop Gaduud.
Al Shabaab have retaken Ali-Gadud mosque area in southern Somalia after Government troops pulled out of the town.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Somali government and Jubbaland troops, backed by US air support, have carried out an attack on al-Shabab base in the village of Buulo Gaduud. The combined force conducted a frontal attack on Buulo Guduud as US planes bombed the groups positions. After a pitched battle, the combined force captured the village from al-Shabab. ""Massive"" al Shabaab casualties reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Somali National Forces (SNA), backed by African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) troops, killed three Al-Shabaab militants during a security operation in Jubba region in southern Somalia on Thursday at Buurkoy location.
Suspected al-Shabab fighters have attacked a Burundi army base Ceelasha Biyaha. The fighting caused heavy casualties but the exact number still remains unknown.

Kenyan military fired mortar rounds on Dhamase in Gedo region of southwestern Somalia which is under the control of Al Shabaab fighters. Scores of civilians and livestock were killed in the barrage. Al Shabaab dead not known.

column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: A roadside bomb hit an AMNISOM convoy, destroying a troop transport vehicle. No fatalities reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Shaken by a roadside bomb that had hit their troop transport truck, AMISOM troops fired on a crowd that had gathered around the destroyed vehicle, killing 2 unarmed civilians and critically injuring several others.
Two are dead when al Shabaab attacks government forces in Adale town, Middle Shabelle.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab have launched a massive attack on African Union forces base at El-Jalle area, near Marka city. At least one death reported.
Al Shabaab behead a prominent peace activist in Qansax Dheere.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: At least 13 people were killed when two vehicles packed with explosives went off as they were driven towards a base for African Union troops in the Somali capital. The base is near a UN office. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility asserting 27 dead. One of the bombers was later learned to be a former MP.

There was a violent demonstration in Sheikh in reaction to Hargeisa Military Court's sentence of eight Essa Musa clansmen to death over the murder of the late Chief of Police for Sahil region, Abdirisak Yusuf Mohamed Asary. One protestor was injured after a vehicle carrying khat drove through the demonstration. SLP and SLA were deployed in and around Sheikh. The situation reportedly remained tense.
An RCIED planted near a police military CP in Balguri neighbourhood of Afgoye exploded. Two civilian bystanders and a SNGF soldier were injured. The perpetrator managed to escape unidentified.

SNAF Special Forces, supported by Anti-al Shabaab forces, raided an al Shabaab base in Awdhegle village (c. 40 km West of Afgoye District). SNAF troops took control of the town. Two al Shabaab fighters were killed while three others were injured. SNAF Special forces reportedly left the town after two hours and returned to Afgoye. Al Shabaab militants retook control of the Town.

There was a violent demonstration in Berbera after Hargeisa Military Court sentenced eight people to death over the murder of the late Chief of Police for Sahil region, Abdirisak Yusuf Mohamed Asary. Angry protestors burnt tyres and blocked the main roads in town. The police fired warning shots to disperse the crowds.

A man from Baadi Cade sub-clan stole a vehicle from the town. The man was pursued by AMISOM Djiboutian forces. The man shot at the AMISOM troops injuring one soldier. The AMISOM soldiers shot and killed the man in apparent self-defence. The clan of the deceased held a demonstration. Unconfirmed reports indicated that AMISOM troops compensated the clan and the demonstration was halted.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack against SNAF troops based in Maqudha vicinity (c. 5 km East of Mahaday District). There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An RCIED targeting an AMISOM troop convoy detonated along Idow Jalaad road in Leego village (c. 30 km North West of Walaweyne District). The convoy was moving from Leego to Mogadishu. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 15 minutes. Five people including Leego town District Commissioner, namely Abukar Abdullahi Al-Adala, who accompanied the AMISOM convoy died, four AMISOM soldiers were injured and one AMISOM truck was damaged by the explosion. The perpetrators managed to escape. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility of the attack.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: An IED placed on the roadside targeting a PIS convoy was remotely detonated by alleged al Shabaab members on the road between Bossaso to Galgala Mountain (c. 50 km South West of Bossaso). Two PIS soldiers were wounded. The victims were taken to PIS Military Hospital in Bossaso.
Kenyan air forces launch strikes on al Shabaab locations on Ceel Cadde. Casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters have launched a coordinated assault on a military base belonging to African Union mission in Somalia (AMISOM) located in the outskirts of Mogadishu on 26/07 night. Reports say Al Shabaab militants attacked the military base, which is run by Burundian troops who are part of the AMISOM near Elasha Biyaha, 18Km southwest of Mogadishu with mortars. Details of the casualties unclear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Two Ugandan soldiers were injured and eight Somali nationals killed in an early morning car-bombing attack on the African Union forces base in Halane, Madiina.

There was a second day of violent demonstration in Berbera which was sparked by Somaliland President's visit to Hargeisa who attended the opening ceremony for the construction of Hargeisa-Berbera road. The demonstrators targeted the President in protest of the death sentence of eight people who were accused of the murder of the former Chief of Police for Sahil region. An unspecified number of demonstrators were arrested and detained at Berbera Police Post.

There was a demonstration in Burao in reaction to Hargeisa Military Court's sentence of eight Essa Musa clansmen to death over the murder of the late Chief of Police for Sahil region, Abdirisak Yusuf Mohamed Asary. Demonstrators barricaded roads and burnt tyres in the vicinity of Egal hotel and at a roundabout close to Police Division Headquarters. Police attempted to disperse the demonstrators. A number of demonstrators were arrested.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab militants carried out a hit and run attack against Burundian troops based at Arbacow vicinity (c. 15 km West of Mogadishu in Afgoye District). The attack was initiated by the firing of RPGs targeting AMISOM base followed by heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes after which al Shabaab militants withdrew. There were no reports of casualties.

An unknown armed group attacked Somaliland base at Adhicadeeye. There was an exchange of gunfire involving the use of RPGs which lasted for about one hour. Casualties and fatalities could not be confirmed at the time of reporting. At the time of the attack, dignitaries from Somaliland and community elders from Mohamud Garrad clan of Dulbahante held a meeting on the process of reconciliation among the clan members.

A prominent businessman, named Elder Hassan Tifow, was shot and killed by clan militias from Biyamaal sub clan at Tullo Galjecel village (c. 20 km North East of Merka District). The motive behind the incident was attributed to clan revenge between Galjecel and Biyamaal sub clans. The perpetrators managed to escape.

A hand grenade was hurled at an SNGF checkpoint near the 77 IDP camp in Industrial Road vicinity in Dayniile. The device missed the target. There were no reports of casualties. The perpetrators managed to escape.
Al-Shabab has executed a young man whom they claimed had previously killed someone in Buulo Fulaay.

A group of al Shabaab fighters attacked NISA CP at SOS Junction Road in Huriwa. The attack was initiated by an RPG attack followed by a heavy exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 20 minutes after which al Shabaab fighters were repelled. There were no reports of casualties.

Two groups of SNAF soldiers clashed at Asluubta vicinity in Dharkenley District.
