The clash erupted after one group of SNAF soldiers demolished an illegal structure which displeased the other group of SNAF soldiers. There was an exchange of gunfire which lasted for about 30 minutes. One soldier was killed while three others were injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US and African Union forces attacked the town of Awdhiigley (Awdheegle) where they faced resistance. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Al-Shabaab fighters shelled a US and Ugandan military base known as Number 60 Base in southern Somalia region of Lower Shabelle. Causalities not known.
Khatumo officials accuse Somaliland forces of attacking the towns of Egaa and Widhiidh, Sool Region. Dates not known - source dated 28/07. Casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: AMISOM forces fire mortar shells at al Shabaab position in KM60 area, al Shabaab returns long-range fire. No reports of causality.
Al Shabaab and government soldiers clash in Mudulow following an air strike. The soldiers destroyed an al Shabaab base, killing ten and injuring ten.
A prominent businessman from La Anod was attacked and severely wounded shortly after he had supported journalists to report on resistance to voter registration in Awrbogays
A man is shot and killed in Garsos, near Gaalkacyo in suspected clan retaliation. Identities not known.
A hand grenade is thrown at a soldier in Wadajir causing no casualty or injury.
Khatumo officials accuse Somaliland forces of attacking the towns of Egaa and Widhiidh, Sool Region. Dates not known - source dated 28/07. Casualties not known.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Government forces backed by AMISOM-ENDF clash with al Shabaab at Moro Gabey. Five deaths reported.
Al Shabaab shot two government soldiers in Halgan area.
Al Shabaab shot and killed two soldiers in Halgan. The perpetrators confiscated the soldiers Kalashnikovs.
The manager of a telecom company was shot and injured after leaving a mosque. Motive unknown.
Al Shabaab abducted two women affiliated with the local government in Ceel Garas.
A fierce gunfight between Somali federal government forces and local armed militia broke out at Bulo Sheikh over control of a checkpoint. ""Several"" killed.
An IED detonated near a military convoy in Moro Gabey. Three soldiers injured.
Military forces clash with an unidentified clan militia over the operations of an illegal checkpoint in Qoryooley. One death reported, three injuries.
Military forces attack an al Shabaab position in Garas Weyne. The soldiers gained control of the area following the clash. One al Shabaab reported dead.
Gunmen from an unnamed sub-clan of Murusade shot and killed seven from another sub-clan in Ceel-Shiil.
Suspected al Shabaab assassinated an army colonel while he travelled home. Perpetrators escaped.
A tea shop frequented by government soldiers is targeted with an IED. Three soldiers injured.

After taking control of Beerhani without violent incident, government forces vacate the town, only to be ambushed by al Shabaab fighters who they, themselves retook the village. Government forces claim three al Shabaab dead.

After taking control of Beerhani without violent incident, government forces vacate the town, only to be ambushed by al Shabaab fighters who they, themselves retook the village. Government forces claim three al Shabaab dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: AMISOM and al Shabaab forces clash in Abacow, near Afgooye. Al Shabaab were soon repelled following 25 minutes of gunfire and shelling. Casualties not known.
Two soldiers injured following an exchange of gunfire in Afgooyes Buulo Sheikh.
Warsangeli militia shoot an Ethiopian couple in Xin-Galool, killing one.
Soldiers open fire on a civilian mini-bus in Carah Guduud. One injury reported.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a court official for unknown reason Dharkenley.
Unidentified men shot and killed a local government official in Yaaqshiid.
A magnetic IED attached to a government officials car detonates, killing a civilian bystander. The government official was not in the car at the time of the attack. Perpetrators not known.
An al Shabaab IED targeted soldiers in Heliwa. Two dead, two injured.
Al Shabaab fighters launched a complex attack against a police outpost in Hodan. Four police officers, five civilians, and four al Shabaab killed in the exchange of gunfire.
Clan militias clash in Ximcade, near Ceel Buur. Twelve deaths reported.
Residents of Borama protest local government negligence in regard to basic services.
""Anti-al Shabaab"" war planes struck al Shabaab targets in Golool Shibir, near Kismayo. Casualties not known.
Two civilians are shot and injured by suspected al Shabaab elements near a local mosque.
Soldiers shoot and kill a bus driver after he refused to stop at a checkpoint.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Police and Ali Saleban militia clash in Iskushuban for unknown reason. Casualties not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attacked a Jubaland forces base in Hoosingo, no report of casualties.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attacks JSF in Dif village, causing the 30 minute clash. Al Shabaab took control of the village. No reports of casualties.
A hand grenade is thrown at a group of soldiers in Hawl Wadaag, one seriously injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM/SNG base in Qoryooley, causing a battle that lasted about 30 minutes. Casualties not known.
Al Shabaab takes control of Ximcade following a clan clash the previous day. No reported violence in the takeover.
A man from Rahanweyn is shot and killed by a man from Osman Mahmud, reasons unknown.
Detonation: Al Shabaab throws a hand grenade at a government building in Yaaqshiid. No reported causalities.
Defusal: Soldiers discovered a dismantled IED in Waberi.
Two groups of soldiers clash in Wardhigley over the recent destruction of buildings in the area. One death reported.
Al Shabaab shot and killed a businessman in Bondhere.
An unidentified person threw a hand grenade at the entrance of a police station. No reported causality.
At least one soldier killed and others wounded in a grenade attack in Dharkenley.
Marehan clan militias attacked a police station in order to free fellow clansmen who had been recently arrested. No reported causalities.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: An Oromo woman shot and wounded an armed Puntland soldier in Laag for unknown reason.
At least four Al-Shabaab militants were killed in heavy fighting between the group and security forces at Bula-Haji, 90 kilometres west of Kismayo.
Al Shabaab assassinated a prominent elder as he left a Mosque outside (Arbiska location) Mogadishu on 04/08.
Fighting between clan militias in Ceel Afweyn cause the death of three and five injures.
Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed a woman on Dharkenly for unknown reason.
Police forces entered Ceel Garas and are met with al Shabaab resistance. Eleven reported killed in the exchange.
Al Shabaab attacked soldiers in Goof Guduud, but are driven back following an exchange of gunfire. No reported causalities.
Al Shabaab elements attacked a cola camp in Buuilo Xaaji killing four labours and injuring seven others before destroying four trucks loaded with coal.
A prominent businessman is shot and killed in Bula Marer for unknown reason.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Up to a dozen mortar rounds were launched on various areas of Baidoa, destroying homes and causing one death and several injuries. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility. AMISOM responded with artillery fire. Two al Shabaab reported dead.
A hand grenade is thrown at a UN compound in Mogadishu, no reported injury.
Military forces ward of an al Shabaab attack on Bulo Marer. Al Shabaab claims ""scores"" SNG forces dead.
A Somali minister survived an assassination attempt Sunday when a hand-grenade was thrown at his car in the capital.
Military forces attacked al Shabaab positions at Goorisane and manage to take over the base. Casualties not known.
Al Shabaab attacked the residence of a Warsangeli clan member in Laasqoray over suspicions of collaborating with US agents. Four people reported abducted.

At least four Somali government soldiers have been wounded, some critically in double explosions in northern Mogadishu in the early hours on Monday morning. No group has claimed the responsibility for both attacks, but the Al Shabaab militants are known to be carrying out such assaults.
Al Shabaab attacks a military base in Shalaambood during the overnight hours. Government forces repelled the attack, warring causalities not known - a civilian was injured in the attack.

Somali National Army (SNA) soldiers secured control of a key area near the town of Jowhar known as Madah-Kisi in Southern Somalia, following combat with Al Shabaab fighters on Tuesday. The fighting between SNA and Al Shabaab has led to the deaths and injuries of unspecified number of people.
Suspected al Shabaab threw a grenade at government soldiers in Bakaara Market, killing two, including a soldier.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: United States forces raid a al Shabaab residence in Saakow, causing a exchange of gunfire. Seven senior al Shabaab killed in the exchange. Following the attack al Shabaab in the area disrupted telecommunication masts in the area.
A prominent elder is assassinated in Hodan on 10/08. Perpetrators not known.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a journalist, along with his wife at their home in Baidoa.
Al Shabaab militants claim to have killed at least 10 soldiers after an attack on Somali military base located in the outskirts of Afgoye town in Lower Shabelle region Wednesday night.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab launches an attack on AMISOM and SNG forces in Hudur on 11/08. At least three SNG soldiers reported killed.

Unidentified attackers threw a grenade on a vehicle carrying security force in Dharkenly. The attack has left at least five people, including two security guards wounded. Several suspects were appended the following day.
Al Shabaab clashes with military forces in Afgooye, causing al Shabaab to withdraw. Two civilians reported killed in the exchange of gunfire.
Ministry of Agriculture employees protest over unpaid salaries. Police dispersed the protesters.
A man stabs another in Yalho, reasons unknown. It is not known if the attack was fatal.
Clan retaliation kills two in Dhac Dheer.
Al Shabaab shoots and kills a police officer in Hamar Jabjab district.
Local government official has been shot and killed by men armed with pistols in Shibis.
Al Shabaab fighters clash with Gaaljecel over a beheading the previous month. Two al Shabaab dead, including a commander. 18 al Shabaab arrested.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian businessman in Kurtunwaarey for unknown reason.
A clan-related attack caused the loss of two lives in Dalsar, near Abudwaq.
Al Shabaab attacks a police station in Afgooye, engage in battle. No reports of causalities.
Suspected clan related murder in Bula Marer on 12/08. Perpetrator/victim identities not known.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Somali and US military forces raid a al Shabaab base in Sakow, recovering weapons and killing key al Shabaab figure Abu Ubeida and his aid, as well as 28 others. The aid took place between 11/08 and 13/08.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces are accused of the murder of a civilian and the rape of seven girls. Date(s) not known - authorities reported the incident on 13/08.
Two Ethiopian immigrants were attacked and injured by an armed man in Bossaso, reasons not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces capture a al Shabaab member who was later shot and killed during an escape attempt.
An IED placed under a vehicle owned by a soldier detonated. The soldier was not in the car at the time of the explosion.
Soldiers, suspected to be renegades, shot at a truck carrying civilians. One dead, and several others injured. Reasons for the attack are not known.
Three al-Shabab fighters have been killed after military forces attacked an al-Shabab base in the outskirts of central town Beledweyne. Among the dead include a commander known as Abdi Aden.
Military forces clash with Suleiman clan in Godinlabe over access to a checkpoint. One militiaman killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An al Shabaab IED targeted a AMISOM convoy outside of Wanla Weyne. Causalities not known.
A man is stabbed and killed over ownership of farm land.
Al Shabaab detained two civilians in or near Saacow. The two individuals had a past of working with anti-al Shabaab forces.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED targeted a AMISOM convoy in Heliwa. Two civilians were injured in the blast.
Soldiers opened fire on a vehicle travelling in Hawl Wadaag, killing the driver. It reason for the gunfire is not known.

Unidentified gunmen kill a rickshaw driver in Dharkenley for unknown reason. The Government officials said rickshaw driver has witnessed the shooting dead of clan lady working for UNHCR office in Mogadishu early this year.
Somali soldiers clash in Cadaado over payment, four confirmed dead.
Residents violently protest against the recent dismissal of a Somaliland minister by the President. This was the first day of a two day protest.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab attack AMISOM and SNG soldiers near Baraawe. Casualties could not be established.
A police officer is shot and wounded by Parliament security officials in Bossaso for unknown reason.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Somali National Army (SNA) backed by Africa Union peacekeeping mission (AMISOM) on Monday captured four locations near Bardhere town: Matano, Anole, Tubako and Qutaley. Casualties not known.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Somali National Army (SNA) backed by Africa Union peacekeeping mission (AMISOM) on Monday captured four locations near Bardhere town: Matano, Anole, Tubako and Qutaley. Casualties not known.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Somali National Army (SNA) backed by Africa Union peacekeeping mission (AMISOM) on Monday captured four locations near Bardhere town: Matano, Anole, Tubako and Qutaley. Casualties not known.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Somali National Army (SNA) backed by Africa Union peacekeeping mission (AMISOM) on Monday captured four locations near Bardhere town: Matano, Anole, Tubako and Qutaley. Casualties not known.
Military forces raid and overtake al Shabaab checkpoints at Sunguni, which lies north of Jubba River. Casualties not known. Date not known - source dated 16/08.
In Hargeisa Yarey in Jilib district, combat vehicles were destroyed and a number of Al-Shabab militiamen killed in a military raid on the area. Date not known - source dated 16/08.
Two soldiers are injured in a al Shabaab hand grenade attack in Afgooye.
Khat dealers protest against a tax increase on the product.
Residents violently protest against the replacement of a port manager.
Residents violently protest against the recent dismissal of a Somaliland minister by the President. Police dispersed the protesters.
Soldiers clash with al Shabaab in Lafaale. No reports of causalities.

Dhulbahante clansmen attacked the Somaliland Minister of Finance as he travelled near Las Anod. There was a gun battle when the security personnel who were escorting the official returned fire. No casualties reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A man is shot and wounded by suspected police in Sanjilbo, outside Qardho. Motive not clear.
Arrests: Security forces arrest 313 who were suspected to have involvement in al Shabaab.
At least two people have been killed in fighting between a group of Somali government forces and another group who were also dressed in armed forces uniform in Hamar Jab Jab.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: The African Union forces (AMISOM) in Somalia are reportedly fired mortar rounds on residential areas near the southern port city of Marka on Tuesday, causing casualties. Al Shabaab is believed to have hideouts in the area, though the bombing were described as indiscriminate.
A Somali police official has escaped an assassination attempt after a bomb exploded inside his residency in southwestern town of Bardhere.
Two dead in an armed clash between Saad and Majeerteen clans in Yacoyub, near Ballibusle.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks AMISOM/SNG forces at Qoryooley. No reports of casualties.
A member of the electoral commission was shot and injured by unknown gunmen while travelling between Hargeysa and Berbera.
Al Shabaab takes over military camps in Lafaale after continued fighting. There are reports of casualties on both sides, numbers not known.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Three al-Shabab fighters were killed on Wednesday by the Somali National Army (SNA) with support from the African Union troops in the country (AMISOM). The joint team of security operatives were on a routine patrol in the Abdalla-Biroole area when they ambushed the insurgents. Al Shabaab claims they killed a US soldier travelling with the patrol. The SNA forces were able to gain control of the village.
Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a group of SNG soldiers on patrol in Hawlawadag at 2200 hrs. The soldiers returned fire following the blast, no report of causalities.
Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at the residence of SNG solders in Diinsoor at 2100 hrs. The soldiers returned fire, though no reports of causalities.
Jejele clan militias shot dead a Galjael clan member at Madoobe in revenge of the death of Jejele member previously.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces, along with an unnamed anti-al Shabaab militia clash with al Shabaab on the outskirt of Buulo Gaduud. Three al Shabaab killed in the forty minute battle.
An IED detonated at Sinay junction in Mogadishu, killing a civilian bystander and injuring three others. Perpetrators not known.
On 18 August unidentified gunmen shot and killed a civilian man in Yaaqshiid District.
Unidentified men shot and killed a civilian in Sii-Sii neighbourhood for unknown reason.
A car laden with explosives detonates at a police checkpoint killing one and wounding two others. There was no immediate claim of responsibility.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) forces backed by Somalia National Army on Friday killed four Al-Shabaab militants during a security operation in Bula-gudud area in southern Somalia.
Students protest the poor state of educational institutions in Dila.
An IED detonated near soldiers in Bangalow neighbourhood, no fatalities.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab has fired mortar rounds on Burundian peacekeepers military base at Elasha Biyaha area, about 18 kilometers south-west of Mogadishu on Friday mid-night. The overnight mortar attack has sparked a fierce gunfight between Al Shabaab fighters and Burundian soldiers who are serving under the African Union mission in Somalia (AMISOM). There was no immediate report of casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: An IED targeted an AMISOM-ENDF convoy, damaging a truck. Causalities not known.
Police block the Wadani Party presidential candidate from entering Las Anod. The action caused a protest from his supporters.
An IED planted at a location near SNG soldiers detonates in Agoon neighbourhood near Marka, wounding one. A second IED hit an AMISOM Caspir.
Al Shabaab attack police in Manaas, killing three. The police returned fire, though al Shabaab causalities are not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab carried out an attack on AMISOM-Burundi forces at El-Arbao village near Afgooye. Al Shabaab were repelled after a 30 minute gunfight. Causalities not known.
A hand grenade is thrown at police in Hodan district. A civilian bystander was injured. The unidentified perpetrators escaped.
Security forces clash with al Shabaab in Goof Guduud. Three reported military dead, al Shabaab causalities were ""heavier.""

Two IEDs detonated at a market in North Gaalkacyo killing 27, including ten government soldiers. 60 wounded. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack. It is not clear if the perpetrators were on the scene at the time of the attack.
Following a unsuccessful hand grenade attack on a police station, the perpetrator is perused and shot by security forces.
A young boy is stabbed and wounded by unidentified perpetrators for reasons unknown.
A hand grenade at thrown at a police patrol in Fagah neighbourhood. Several injured, one civilian bystander dead.
Several mortar rounds are fired near the Ministry of Transport and the residence of the Mayor of Mogadishu. One round landed at a petrol station causing a fire. No other causalities reported.
Al Shabaab launched an attack against a government base in Moro Gabey. Twelve people, including one civilian were killed, others injured. The Al Shabaab causality count could not be established.
Security forces clash with al Shabaab near Tufka, Diinsoor district. Five killed in the fighting.
Two Hawiye sub clans clash over control of land in Afgooye. One death, two injuries reported.
A boy is stabbed and wounded by unidentified perpetrators for reasons unknown. A similar incident occurred in Qardho the previous day.
Police clash with unidentified men with AK47s. The police managed to disarm the men and take them into custody.
An unidentified person threw a hand grenade at the residence of a local commissioner in Yaaqshiid, injuring a guard.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM forces kill eight members of al Shabaab in Baidoa on 22/08.
An IED detonated in Qaydar Edi killing four camels. The target of the strike is not known.
An IED destroyed a donkey cart and injured the driver in Bisigle.
SNG forces attack a al Shabaab position in Yabyab village. One al Shabaab fighter killed.
Military forces clash with al Shabaab in Qansax Dheere. Two soldiers were injured in the clash, al Shabaab causality not known.
Dhulbahante militia fired warning shots at election demonstrators in Mayegaagle. No reported injuries. There were also similar demonstrations in Buuhodle, Arolay, Talexo and Horufadhe.
Dhulbahante militia fired warning shots at election demonstrators in Mayegaagle. No reported injuries. There were also similar demonstrations in Buuhodle, Arolay, Talexo and Horufadhe.
Dhulbahante militia fired warning shots at election demonstrators in Mayegaagle. No reported injuries. There were also similar demonstrations in Buuhodle, Arolay, Talexo and Horufadhe.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and SNG forces clash with al Shabaab in Wardhabaale and Luuqjeelow. AMISOM were able to overtake the areas following a gunfight. However, al Shabaab regained control of the areas after the government allied forces left the area later in the day. Three soldiers reported injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: An IED targets an AMISOM convoy travelling between Buufow and Elwaregow damaging the vehicle. Causalities not known at the time of reporting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and SNG forces clash with al Shabaab in Wardhabaale and Luuqjeelow. AMISOM were able to overtake the areas following a gunfight. However, al Shabaab regained control of the areas after the government allied forces left the area later in the day. Three soldiers reported injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and SNG forces clash with al Shabaab in Wardhabaale and Luuqjeelow. AMISOM were able to overtake the areas following a gunfight. However, al Shabaab regained control of the areas after the government allied forces left the area later in the day. Three soldiers reported injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and SNG forces clash with al Shabaab in Wardhabaale and Luuqjeelow. AMISOM were able to overtake the areas following a gunfight. However, al Shabaab regained control of the areas after the government allied forces left the area later in the day. Three soldiers reported injuries.
Dhulbahante militia fired warning shots at election demonstrators in Mayegaagle. No reported injuries. There were also similar demonstrations in Buuhodle, Arolay, Talexo and Horufadhe.
Security forces protest non-payment of salaries in Hargeysa.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Somali and AMISOM police forces clash with SNG forces in Dharkenley after the soldiers refused to drop their weapons when ordered. Three injuries reported.
An unidentified person threw a hand grenade at the home of a government minister in Hamar Weyne. Three guards injured, one of whom died later in hospital.
Eighteen people have killed in fighting involving Somali forces and al-Shabab in Moro Gabey, Bakool region in the countries southwest.
An IED planted on the rooftop of a teashop frequented by soldiers detonates, injuring eight, including five soldiers.
An IED targeted a group of government forces at Kurtunwaarey. No causalities reported.
Four al Shabaab fighters attacked and killed a soldier in Belet Weyne.
Al Shabaab attacked soldiers in Goof Guduud on 24/08. No reports of causalities.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces attack and overrun an al Shabaab base at Golasciumbi. No known causalities. Following their retreat, the al Shabaab forces attacked a Juba convoy at nearby Gabow Gabdhole. Two al Shabaab killed in the second battle.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces attack and overrun an al Shabaab base at Golasciumbi. No known causalities. Following their retreat, the al Shabaab forces attacked a Juba convoy at nearby Gabow Gabdhole. Two al Shabaab killed in the second battle.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Agreement:80 members of ASWJ defect to Galmudug administration in Galgadud State.
Unidentified assailants targeted a security patrol in Heliwa, injuring one of the soldiers.

Al Shabaab fighters attacked an immigration official outside his residents in Hawl Wadaag. In response, armed guards returned fire. One member of al Shabaab, one guard and two bystanders were killed in the gunfight.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed a senior SNG officer at his residence in Dharkenley.
A police officer shot and killed a civilian man for unknown reason in Abdul-Aziz on 24/08.
A bomb blast targeted on crowded cafe in Bardere in Gedo region has left at least 13 people injured. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM base in Budbud. After heavy fighting al Shabaab was eventually pushed back. Causalities not known.

Al Shabaab gunmen stormed a restaurant in the Somali capital Mogadishu on Thursday and gunfire is ongoing after a suicide car bomb earlier exploded at the restaurant. Between 10-15 dead. The siege lead to a counter attack from security forces, where at least two soldiers died.

Al Shabaab gunmen stormed a restaurant in the Somali capital Mogadishu on Thursday and gunfire is ongoing after a suicide car bomb earlier exploded at the restaurant. Between 10-15 dead. The siege lead to a counter attack from security forces, where at least two soldiers died.

A car bomber detonated an explosive near the Turkish Embassy in Mogadishu, prompting a response in gunfire from area police. Causalities not known. It is not known if the target of the bombers attack was the Embassy.
Al Shabaab ambushed a group of government soldiers outside of Waajid near Aleemow. At least one al Shabaab causality.
An Ethiopian man is attacked with an axe in Bossaso. The fate of the victim not known.
Dhulbahante sub clan attacks another in Farda Fuulka, near Las Anod. One death reported.
An RCIED targeted and struck soldiers on patrol ion Yaaqshiid, killing and injuring two.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: The Somali army, backed by the African Union peacekeeping troops, killed at least seven Al-Shabaab militants on 27/08 in a fighting at Surayo location, about 15km from Burdhubo town in the southern Somali region of Gedo
A hand grenade is thrown at a police outpost in Afgooye. No causalities reported.
Clan militias clash near the Green Line in Gaalkacyo. No causalities reported.
SNAF launched an operation against an al Shabaab base at Ajaawa. Two soldiers killed and four injured. Causalities on the al Shabaab side are not known.
Suspected clan militia (not identified) kill a man for unknown reason in Afgooye.
Unidentified men shot and wounded a man from Dashiishe clan for unknown reason.
Khatumo militia attacked a vehicle carrying election materials in Banyal, Buhoodle District. No causalities reported.
A police officer is shot and killed by a pair of unidentified assailants.
Soldiers exchange gunfire for unknown reason in Hamar Jabjab.

Unidentified assailants target a local market with an IED over formation of a local authority. Two dead, four injured. Following the attack police clash with the suspected assailants injuring one officer.
Police destroy illegal structures, causing several residents to resist. Several arrests reported.
Somaliland forces attack a convoy escorting the Khatumo regional president, sparking a clash with military escort. Heavy gunfire exchanged, no causalities.

Unidentified assailants target a local market with an IED over formation of a local authority. Two dead, four injured. Following the attack police clash with the suspected assailants injuring one officer.
Unidentified persons attack a police officer in Afgooye causing injury to the officer and two bystandars.
Two RCIED attacks against civilian areas in Bula Hawa. Three killed, others injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A Puntland soldier shot and injured a taxi driver for unknown reason.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attacked a ENDF convoy in Hinshilow, near Rab Dhuure. A civilian was killed by a stray bullet.
ISWA soldiers attack an al Shabaab position at Habedow, killing one soldier. Fatalities from al Shabaab side not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab forces attacked ENDF soldiers in Buur Dhuxunle prompting a clash. No reported causality.
Khatumo supports hold a violent protest against a visit from the Somaliland delegation in Sahdheer, near Las Anod.
Al Shabaab executes a prominent elder in Belet Weyne on 29/08.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Reports form Beled Hawo town in Gedo region in Somalia indicate that at least four people have been confirmed dead and eight wounded in the fighting between residents and soldiers loyal to Jubaland. Fighting broke out when Jubaland soldiers attacked a house meeting by militia who were preparing to carry out attacks against Jubaland.
Unidentified persons hurled a hand grenade at a group of police officers in Hawl Wadaag. No causalities.
Workers of a Turkish-based company protest over terms of service.
A remote-controlled roadside blast ripped through a military vehicle carrying Somali National army (SNA) soldiers at Sinka-Dheer. No immediate reports of causalities. Perpetrators not known.
Airport workers protest against management.
Two soldiers (or two dressed in SNGF uniforms) open fire on a civilian bus injuring five.
Agreement: A senior al Shabaab leader (unnamed) surrendered to Somali officials under an amnesty programme.
Al Shabaab forces attack and overrun military bases at Muuri and Lambar-konton, causalities not known.
Al Shabaab forces attack and overrun military bases at Muuri and Lambar-konton, causalities not known.
[Al Shabaab] fighters have killed at least 10 soldiers in overnight raids on Somali government and African Union military bases in the K-50, Ala-Yasir and Muri areas (outside Afgooye).
[Al Shabaab] fighters have killed at least 10 soldiers in overnight raids on Somali government and African Union military bases in the K-50, Ala-Yasir and Muri areas (outside Afgooye).

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: A U.S. Africa Command press release stated U.S. forces conducted a strike against al-Shabaab near Gobanale, Somalia. Two deaths reported. The target of the strike is not known.
Government forces carrying an attack on al Shabaab positions at Sarino village (8km west of K50), killing one and over taking the village.
Members of Dhulbahante sub clan kidnap two from Warsangeli-Aden Siciid in the basis of clan revenge.
Al Shabaab abducts four civilians from their homes in Ato and takes them to an unknown location.
A SVBIED detonated at a hotel near Villa Somalia. 26 dead. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.

A senior al-Shabaab commander, Mohamed Mahir Ahmed, is killed in an airstrike from unknown origin the night of 01/09 on the groups military camp in southern Somalia town of Jilib. It is not clear if others were killed or wounded in the strike.
Unidentified clan militias clash over two days in Ceel Afweyn. Three dead and others wounded.
Government forces overtake Rage Dhere village near Marka from al Shabaab following a battle. Causalities not known.
Sub clans of Isaq clash in Dararweyne over water and grassland. Seven reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM convoy between Danow and Bula-Mare. AMISOM responded with gunfire. Causalities not known.
Unidentified men shot and killed a clan elder from Jejele west of Belet Weyne. The motive is believe to be related to clan revenge.
Ali Saleban militia shot and wounded a man from Ali Jibrail on the basis of clan revenge.
Al Shabaab attacks Biyo-Ade area of Jowhar district on the evening of 01/09, Three deaths reported.
Unidentified clan militias clash over two days in Ceel Afweyn. Three dead and others wounded.
Clan related violence in Gaalkacyo. One death reported. Following the incident, security operatives and the perpetrator clashed, resulting in injuries to two civilians.
Al Shabaab and SNAF clash in Ceel Waregow, causalities not known.
Clan related violence in Gaalkacyo. One death reported. Following the incident, security operatives and the perpetrator clashed, resulting in injuries to two civilians.
Clan related violence in Dameera-Cad, near Ceel Bardaale. One death reported.
A civilian is killed by suspected al Shabaab in Las Anod.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: An al Shabaab IED targeted Puntland forces in Galgala area, wounding 10.
An armed man attacks an injures a civilian in Kahshiqai for unknown reason.
Military forces regain control of Muuri, date and violence unknown.
Locals looted a food aid distribution site. Police attempted of disperse the crowd. One small boy was accidentally shot and killed.
Al Shabaab gains control of Addow Dibille, Lanta Buro and Muuri, near Afgooye, causalities not known. The forces left the area the following day.
Belet Weyne residents protest from 02/09 - 04/09 against FGS and IGAD over the central state formation process. The protests were peaceful.

Al Shabaab members attack a members of Tayeeglow District Council in Biyooley, near Tayeeglow. Security operatives and al Shabaab exchanged small arms fire. The official was injured and two security and one al Shabaab were killed in the attack.
Two SNAF soldiers clash, one death. Motive not known.
A hand grenade attack against military and police in Yaaqshid. No causalities reported.
Belet Weyne residents protest from 02/09 - 04/09 against FGS and IGAD over the central state formation process. The protests were peaceful.
ISWA forces clash with al Shabaab at Irinleyi, near Berdale. No causality reported.

Heavy fighting broke out 03/09 between Somali national army (SNA) soldiers and fighters belonging to al Shabaab in Tiyeglow town in Bakol region. The gunfight erupted after al Shabaab fighters assaulted SNA base in the town, sparking deadly scuffle that has led to the death of several soldiers and militants.

At least 2 people were killed and 4 others wounded after violent demonstration broke out in Las Anod. The protest started after people held a rally against recent killing of Dhabshil Bank official. Local police attempted to break up the demonstration, leading to the violence.
At least five soldiers are reported to have been killed in a bomb blast near the city of Afgoye (at Wayo-arag area) in Somalias Lower Shabelle province on 04/09. Al Shabaab suspected as perpetrators.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Somali and AMISOM forces attack an al Shabaab position in Berdale. No reported causalities.
Belet Weyne residents protest from 02/09 - 04/09 against FGS and IGAD over the central state formation process. The protests were peaceful.
Al Shabaab clash among themselves over the arrest of Islamic State members. Causalities not known.
ISWA forces ambushed al Shabaab at Saydheelow. Three al Shabaab dead.
Clan related violence over money. One death reported.
Galjecel clan attacked and killed two men from Jajele near Belet Weyne.
Al Shabaab attacks soldiers in Heliwa. No reported causalities.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US forces conduct an air strike at Tortoroow, four deaths reported.
Three are wounded in a grenade attack at a tea shop near Towfiq Junction. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked a group of Ugandan forces at K60 village in Afgooyle district. Scores of AMISOM forces reported killed by al Shabaab.

Somali and helicopter-based US forces attack an al Shabaab position at Toorotoorow. Twelve al Shabaab dead, including at least two commanders. Other members of the group were captured. Violence continued the following day.
Warsangeli-Reer Salah militia attack and hijack two trucks belonging to members of another sub-clan (not identified) in Xingalool. The driver of one of the trucks was shot and injured.
Clan related violence in Buur Baali. One death reported.
A young boy is stabbed and wounded in Bossaso. Perpetrators not known.
A civilian man is shot and killed for unknown reasons in Wardhigley.
Soldiers clash over the arrest of the colleague.

A Somali businessman was critically wounded after a bomb concealed under his car seat exploded in Mogadishu on Monday morning along Makka Al Mukarama, a busy road linking the airport to Villa Somalia.

At least 15 people have been killed and many others wounded in fighting between rival clan militias in Sarjimale, eastern Mudug region. The warring militias belong to two rival clans from Galmudug and Puntland regional administrations. The two sides are battling for grazing land in the area.
Several rounds of mortar shells have hit a site close to the Somali presidential palace in Mogadishu, causing several injuries and one death. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.

ISWA soldiers shot and killed two people and injured another after soldiers attempted to disperse relatives of a incarcerated man who was arrested on suspicions of al Shabaab activity. The people assembled to demand the mans release.

Al Shabaab attacked a SNA base at Budbud sparking a four hour clash. Al Shabaab eventually gained control of the village the following day. Somali army reported two al Shabaab dead, al Shabaab reports three Somali soldiers dead.
An RCIED targeting an SNAF battle wagon exploded along Afgoye road at KM13 settlement. Three soldiers and two civilian bystanders were injured in the blast.
Clan militias clash in Marka. One civilian reported dead.
Militia from Arab/Abdalla clan carjacked a vehicle owned by Majeerteen and abducted the driver.
An RCIED targeting a Toyota pickup belonging to a district official detonated injuring two soldiers and three bystanders. The government official was not on board at the time of the attack.
At least three people were killed and several others were injured in a landmine explosion at Bakaara Market. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.

Two people have been killed and 10 others wounded when gunmen opened fire indiscriminately on diners inside a restaurant in central Somalia town of Abuudwaaq. The motive behind the shooting remains unclear. The attackers are said to have escaped from the scene.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Somali forces backed by foreign forces (unknown identity, though it stands to reason they were American as a similar raid was carried out on nearby Toorotoorow by their air forces the previous day) and warplanes have attacked al-Shabab military bases near southern town of Qoryooley. ""[Losses] inflicted.""
Clan clash in Baar Gacallawe related to previous clan issues. One member of Gaaljecel was killed in the exchange.
Numbering 200, knat sellers protest over price.
Al Shabaab kills a civilian man at Ceeylo Garre, near Muqakoori.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: A Darawish soldier shot and wounded another in Galgala area for unknown reason.

Al Shabaab attacked a SNA base at Budbud sparking a four hour clash. Al Shabaab eventually gained control of the village the following day. Somali army reported two al Shabaab dead, al Shabaab reports three Somali soldiers dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attack a AMISOM position in Qoryooley District, leading to a long gun battle. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: Several mortar rounds have landed near Halane compound in Wardhigley, which serves as the largest military base for African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) in Mogadishu on Thursday. Perpetrators not known. One civilian reported injured.
A man from Hawadle-Hawiye clan was killed after militiamen from Saad clan opened fire on a truck in Diilin-Caano, near Banddiiradley.
A Dir pastoralist was killed by armed men from Suleiman at Barag.
Several mortar rounds are fired into Wadajir District, but do not cause causalities. Perpetrators not known.
A police officer is shot and killed by a colleague for unknown reason.
A Somali military commander is shot and killed by his body guard in Dharkenley.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: The African Union (AU) peacekeeping troops backed by Somali National Army (SNA) captured Abdale Birole from al Shabaab on 08/09. No casualties from AU/SNA side. Al Shabaab casualties not known.
An RCIED exploded at a police post. No reports of causalities.
Unidentified armed men shot and killed a man from Jajelee clan in Haaji Nor unknown reason.
A civilian is shot and killed by suspected clan militia (unnamed).
Al Shabaab shot and killed a civilian driver for unknown reasons.
Four SNAF soldiers clashed with other soldiers manning the CPs along Prison Road. Motive not known. No reports of causalities.
Hundreds held a demonstration in Belet Weyne against the state formation conference of Hiiraan and Middle Shabelle regions. The protest was peaceful.
A truck belonging to Isse Mohamud sub-clan was hijacked. A passenger and driver were abducted by gunmen from Kaskiqabe sub clan.
Two are shot and killed by gunman from Osman Mahmud. Motive not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab forces vacate Jana Cabdalle; Jubaland forces gain control.
A hand grenade was hurled at NISA soldiers on patrol along Towfiq junction. Two bystandards were injured.
Six unidentified armed men attacked the home of an armed civilian. After an exchange of gunfire the homeowner was injured.
Suspected al Shabaab launched an attack on a police station, leading to a an armed clash. No reports of causalities.
At least one person was confirmed killed, and several others wounded in a renewed clan (unidentified) clashes in the southern strategic port city of Marka on Saturday.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed a JSF convoy at Canjeel, leading an exchange of gunfire. One JSF soldier killed, four others injured. Unknown AS causalities.
A man from Dishiishe sub clan was shot and killed by a man from Osman Mohamud in Buula Qodax in Qardho district.
A reporter for a newspaper is attacked and injured by unknown assailants.
Al Shabaab and Somali forces clash in El Ahmed and El Addow areas located in the outskirts of Marka. Government forces repulsed the Al Shabaab attack and killed fighters. Two soldiers wounded.
Al Shabaab and Somali forces clash in El Ahmed and El Addow areas located in the outskirts of Marka. Government forces repulsed the Al Shabaab attack and killed fighters. Two soldiers wounded.
Khatumo elements attack a voter registration office in Las Anod. The attackers battled police and abducted one.
Unidentified assailants throw a hand grenade at soldiers around Towfiq hotel. No reports of causalities.
Looting: Soldiers open fire on khat shops, loot the stands. No reported causalities.
An Al Shabaab member is shot and killed by a unnamed militia member. The reason for the killing is not known.
Government forces attempt to remove an illegal road block outside Wanlaweyne, causing heavy fighting. One soldier reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM and SNAF forces launched an operation in Awdheegle killing a local al Shabaab official.
Suspected al Shabaab opened fire on a civilian driver, forcing him to flee his vehicle. The perpetrators took the car and escaped.
A civilian is killed by an unidentified armed men in North Gaalkacyo.

SNAF forces clashed with police after being restricted from accessing a road near Villa Somalia. Afer an hour-long exchange of gunfire one police officer and two soldiers were killed. Three journalists injured.
At least four Somali national army soldiers are known to have been killed in an al Shabaab attack in Afgoye district at Addow Dibille locality.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED planted between Elasha and El Arbaow detonated, damaging a AMISOM vehicle. No causalities.
An al Shabaab member assassinates a commander in Ceel Garas.
Al Shabaab exchanged gunfire with a group of gang members/robbers who had established a an illegal checkpoint. Two of the gang members were killed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces launch an operation against al Shabaab in Buulo Gaduud. No reported causalities.
A civilian man in a donkey cart was shot and killed by ""freelance militia.""
A civilian is struck by an IED outside of Kismayo, killing five passengers.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AMISOM and SNG forces clash with al Shabaab in Goob Weyn, 25 al Shabaab reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AMISOM forces capture Kiunga location near Goob Weyn from al Shabaab. Eight al Shabaab reported dead.
Al Shabaab attack and briefly overtake Muuri, heavy losses reported on both sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF forces vacate from Moqokori, al Shabaab fill the void.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A young girl is shot and killed by a police officer during a food distribution exercise, reasons unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Somali government troops, with the support of AU soldiers have launched an offensive on Busley town which is under the control of Al Shabaab. Following a clash, government and allied forces dislodge al Shabaab. Causalities not known.
Soldiers open fire on looters at a market. A bystander was reportedly injured.
Soldiers clash over unknown reason in Mukayga outside of Afgooye. One death reported.
A group of SNAF troops opened fire on a group of khat sellers in Afgooye, injuring a civilian. The attackers then looted the knat.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: PMPF and Wadamuge clan clash in Bargaal. No causalities reported.
Al Shabaab attacks Ceel Waaq, twelve dead in the ensuing clash. Al Shabaab gained control of town.
KDF military planes attacked al Shabaab positions at Qalwiley. Casualties not known.
ISWA forces kill an al Shabaab member during an operation.
Abdalla-Arab gunmen shot and killed a Habar Jeclo herder in Togdheer region. The attack caused ethnic tensions in the area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A police officer is stabbed and killed by an unidentified man at Garsoor village.
A civilian is shot and killed by unidentified armed men. Motive not known.
A hand grenade is thrown at a SNAF outpost. No causalities reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Somali and AMISOM regain control of Ceel Waaq after al Shabaab flees.
Kenyan air forces conducted air strikes on Damase village, near Ceel Waaq. No causalities reported.
SNAF forces carried out a hit-and-run attack against al Shabaab at Dufley Daud. Causalities not known.
Two are shot and killed during clan related violence in Tulo Qorax.
Unidentified persons shot and killed a man in Belet Weyne.
An SNAF officer is killed by al Shabaab gunmen.
A clan elder is assassinated by al Shabaab gunmen. The attack occurred either on 17/09 or 18/09.
An al Shabaab SVBIED rammed into a SNAF convoy in Daynille, killing a senior commander and seven troops.
A musician is assassinated by al Shabaab gunmen.
An IED detonated at a tea shop often frequented by soldiers. One civilian bystander was injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM convoy at Wabxo causing an exchange of gunfire. Causalties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targeted a AMISOM convoy outside of Ceel Waregow. Causalties and perpetrators not known.
Students pelt shops and homes in protest of a lack of teachers at their school.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Police personnel guarding the Garowe airport embarked on a protest over a salary issue.
A hand grenade is thrown at the residence of the District Commissioner, landing in an outside area and injuring a civilian.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A suspected al Shabaab IED damages a AMISOM vehicle. Several arrests of suspected perpetrators occurred following the incident.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces kill six civilians for unknown reason in Waaya Arag outside of Afgooye.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab and ENDF forces clash between Ceel Buur and Wabho. Causalties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Marka District causing the damage to the vehicle.
Pro Somaliland students demonstrators block roads.
A SNA patrol engaged a al Shabaab member near Kurta, killing him following an exchange of gunfire.
Soldiers and al Shabaab clash in Hurto village, near Baidoa. One al Shabaab dead.
Al Shabaab attacks SNA soldiers in Ceel Ahmed. Casualties not known.
Al Shabaab ambushed a convoy of NISA personnel, resulting in the injury of a civilian.

At least one soldier was killed and three others wounded after two groups of soldiers fought near Mogadishus Adan Adde Airport. The fighting erupted after security forces at a checkpoint stopped police officers heading to the airport.
Demonstration in support of Somaliland Presidents upcoming election.
A man was shot to death and his son injured by unidentified gunmen in Kooshin neighbourhood.
Police forces clash with al Shabaab in Hamar Jabjab. No casualties reported.
""Two national staff members and their driver were shot and killed while travelling from Balanbal to Cadub Waaq. Reportedly, they were specifically targeted by another clan due to a work dispute.""
Thousands of people gathered in Somali capital to protest against a maritime claim made by the Keyan government. They chanted slogans against Nairobi before gathering at Mogadishu Daljir monument.

Security forces attack al Shabaab positions near Beerhani, source dated 25/09. Eight al Shabaab reported killed, others captured. Unidentified airplanes had earlier in the week launched air strikes on the position, date not known.
An explosive targeted a vehicle carrying a military intelligence official in Mogadishu. One death reported.
Residents protest against the temporary lifting of [a] ban by Puntland authorities.
Kenyan forces launch a mortar barrage against al Shabaab positions in Dhamase, killing ""many people (likely civilian) and livestock.""
Unidentified warplanes attack al Shabaab positions in Toorotoorow, Causalities not known.
Clash between ethnic militias over grazing rights. Two killed and three injured.
Residents protest against the temporary lifting of [a] ban by Puntland authorities. This was the second day of the protest.
South West administration forces clash with al Shabaab at Idale. Seven al Shabaab and two soldiers killed.

Fighting between two groups of security forces erupted when the bodyguards of Jowhar district commissioner attacked police officers who arrested a man they said was in possession of illegal drugs. Causalties not known.
Residents protest against a police operation in the city.
Suspected al Shabaab assassinates a notable businessman in Marka.
Al Shabaab hurled a hand grenade at a tea shop, injuring seven.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A convoy of Puntland security forces were ambushed by Majeerteen-Osman Mahmud Sub-Clan Militia in Heema. The soldiers warded off the attack, killing one of the attackers.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US forces launch an air strike on al Shabaab elements outside of Kismayo, killing a commander and four bodyguards.

Security forces attack al Shabaab positions near Beerhani, source dated 25/09. Eight al Shabaab reported killed, others captured. Unidentified airplanes had earlier in the week launched air strikes on the position.
Al Shabaab attacks SNA soldiers in Marka, one death reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A Puntland police officer is shot and killed by an unknown individual in Garowe.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland Intelligence Agency personnel protest unpaid salaries. One the same day there is also a protest over an Indian court ruling that involves Somali ex-pats.
Al Shabaab attacks a NISA group in Heliwa, no casualties.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Two al-Shabaab fighters have been killed after Somali forces supported by African Union troops launched attack on Monday in the outskirt Somalias southern city port of Kismayo.
Clash between soldiers and al Shabaab in Liimaale. Ten deaths believed.
On 27 September 2016, two youths shoot and kill a teacher over alleged witchcraft practices.

Gunmen riding in a car shot and wounded Colonel Abdullahi ""Mayonge"" Hussein Mohamed, the deputy prosecutor for the Somali military court, in Mogadishus Wardhiigley district. His driver was killed in the attack.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate a journalist in Mogadishu.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Anti-al Shabaab forces - later confirmed to be American after Pentagon comment - carried out an air strike on a al Shabaab location in Jeexdin. Nine al Shabaab dead. The date of the attack is not entirely known; likely either 27/09 or 28/09.
Protest occur in Gaalkacyo over two days in regard to war against al Shabaab. Specifics not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al-Shabaab fired a number of mortars at a base belonging to Ethiopian troops in Halgan. No reported casualties.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: A US air strike targeting al Shabaab mistakenly strikes local militia. Ten deaths reported, three wounded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces clash with al Shabaab at Jeexdin, 15 al Shabaab dead, vehicles and weapons captured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An al Shabaab RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Ceelasha, damaging a vehicle. Following the explosion, AMISOM forces opened fire injuring three civilian bystandards.
Marehan and Gabaween clans clash over disputed land in Luuq. No reports of casualties.
SNAF forces based in Buufow village clashed with al Shabaab near Janale town. Two al Shabaab and one soldier killed, three injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An al Shabaab RCIED targeted an AMISOM convoy in Ceelasha, damaging a vehicle. Following the explosion, AMISOM forces opened fire injuring three civilian bystandards.
Unknown individuals looted and burned shops belonging to Habar Yonis clan.
Protest against an Indian court ruling, which sentenced a group of Somali pirates.
Al Shabaab carried out an attack on a police post, leading to an exchange of gunfire. No reports of casualties.
Three people have been killed after a bomb exploded at a market in Mogadishus Karan district. The target of the explosion is still unknown. No group has so far claimed responsibility.
Al Shabaab shot and killed a Ministry of Justice official in Waberi District Thursday evening.
A grenade attack against soldiers in Belet Weyne, several injuries reported.
Several mortar rounds land in Bulo Hubey, no casualties. Origin location and source not known.
Four mortar rounds landed in Wadajir, one landing at a UN compound. No personnel injured.

At least two people were killed and five injured Saturday when a car parked nearby and loaded with explosives blew up near a restaurant in Mogadishu. Al Shabaab suspected. The explosive was detonated remotely.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US warplanes have hit several al-Shabaab military bases in southern Somalia village of Birta Dheer. According to an American report, the air raid killed ""a number"" of fighters. Others injured.
Suspected to be affiliated with al Shabaab, a suicide car bomber targets Godka Jiliow prison killing five. The prison is run by Somali National Intelligence and Security Agency.
Peace agreement/talks: Dhulbahante and Habar Jeclo clan militias negotiate and implement a peace agreement.

About a hundred local residents of Laas Caanood reportedly staged a demonstration in Laas Caanood on 01/10 to protest the arrest of a Quranic teacher suspected of having links with AS operatives in Laas Caanood. The protestors marched in the streets demanding the immediate release of the Quranic teacher. The demonstration ended with violence.
A group of fire fighters are arrested following a protest against unsafe working conditions.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civil servant in Dabakaaya Madoow neighbourhood (Dharkenley District) in the evening of 01/10. The victim used to work in Mogadishu International Airport. The attackers escaped.
At least four people were wounded in an overnight remote bomb blast at a restaurant in Garbaharey, no causalities known. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters have fired several mortar shells at an Ethiopian military base in El Ali area, Hiiraan region of central Somalia on Sunday mid night.

A RCIED planted by the roadside hit ISWA forces in Buur Hakaba in the afternoon of 02/09. An ISWA soldier was killed and three others were wounded by the explosion. ISWA forces conducted a security operation in response to the attack, but no one was arrested. Perpetrators not known. A second blast occurred a half an hour later.
Protest for the release of a teacher in Las Anod.

Armed men from Jajele clan killed a man in Burjadaciinta village (about 3km Sof Beled Weyne) in the night of 02/10. The victim, who hails from Rahanweyn/Eeylo sub-clan, was mistaken by the militias to be from Galjecel clan.

An unidentified drone (likely US; no other group operating drones in the area) dropped eight rockets on an AS base located at Godaan village (22km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 02/10. Casualties cannot be confirmed. Perpetrators not known or reported.

An IED probably attached to a vehicle exploded in the vicinity of Rajo IDP camps (Wadajir District) in the morning of 02/10. The target of the attack is unknown. Two civilians were reportedly injured. No arrests were made. Perpetrators not known.
A remote-operated bomb has killed two Somali soldiers and left scores of others injured in Diinsoor. Al Shabaab are the suspected perpetrator.

About hundreds of Xudun residents staged a demonstration on 03/10 in protest against the arrest of a quranic teacher suspected of having links with AS by the Rapid Response Unit (RRU). The protestors marched in the streets with placards calling for the immediate release of the teacher. On 02/10 sources reported similar demonstrations for the teacher's release in Laas Caanood. The RRU has transferred him to Hargeisa for further investigations.

A group of khat traders demonstrated in front of local government offices in Borama on 03/10 in protest against the new taxation rate issued by the local authority. Police arrived at the scene and arrested 5 people, after they refused police orders to disperse.

SNG forces manning a checkpoint at Siinka Dheer (14km SE of Afgooye) along Mogadishu-Afgooye road opened fire against a minibus transporting vegetables to Mogadishu in the afternoon of 03/10. The motive behind the shooting is unknown. A passenger was killed while the driver and the conductor were injured.

Two families from Habar-Yunis/Abdalle-Haamud and Maxamud-Hamud sub-clans clashed using sticks and stones in Qoof Village (68km S of Ceerigaabo) on 03/10, following an escalated dispute over land ownership. Two men from both sides were seriously injured.

SNG forces under the command of Wadajir District Administration shot and killed a SNA officer in the vicinity of Suuqa Weyn (Wadajir District) in the morning of 03/10. The motive behind the attack is unknown. Other SNA personnel reportedly came at the scene and managed to take the deceased's body. No arrests are reported in regards to the incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Unidentified attackers hurl a grenade at a Jubaland military post, two deaths and other injuries reported.
Somali armed forces have killed 14 al-Shabaab fighters in a security operation in the Lower Shabelle region in southern Somalia, exact location not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters shelled an AMISOM Djibouti base in Hawl Wadaag neighbourhood of Beled Weyne in the night of 04/10. More than ten rounds were fired against the base. The sound of the shelling created anxiety amongst local residents. No civilian casualties were reported, but, some houses have been affected due to close proximity to the base.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired about 5 mortar rounds against an AMSIOM base in Bufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 04/10. In response, AMISOM forces fired back at least two rounds of mortars in the direction where al Shabaab mortars were coming from. One of these mortars landed in a residence at Farango-Luunge village (10km NW of Marka) and reportedly killed five members of a family, including three children.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters fired about 5 mortar rounds against an AMSIOM base in Bufow Bacaad (5km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 04/10. In response, AMISOM forces fired back at least two rounds of mortars in the direction where al Shabaab mortars were coming from. One of these mortars landed in a residence at Farango-Luunge village (10km NW of Marka) and reportedly killed five members of a family, including three children.

A suspected al Shabaab operative hurled a hand grenade against a vehicle of Jubaland intelligence in Gulwade section of Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Kismayo) in the morning of 04/10. The device landed in an open space causing no casualties. No arrest was reported. An hour later a second grenade attack occurred elsewhere in the city. No casualty.

A hidden VBIED exploded prematurely after the car got a flat tire. Five injuries, including the driver. The driven was a lecturer on a campaign trail for a candidate at the time of the attack. Perpetrators not identified.
Unidentified attackers shot and killed two SNG soldiers in the vicinity of Ex-Control Balcad (Heliwa District) in the morning of 04/10. The attackers escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces launch mortars at an al Shabaab location near Janaale, five civilians reported dead. AMISOM later denied this claim.
Inter-clan clash among Galjacel, two fighters dead. Several civilian bystandards wounded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked an AMISOM ENDF contingent in Lamo Warood, leading to a gun battle. Two al Shabaab reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy in the vicinity of Mahadaay (22km NE of Jowhar) on 05/10. The ambush started with a RCIED explosion followed by direct confrontation. Local residents reported that AMISOM forces opened fire after the explosion and that there were casualties among both AMISOM and civilians - number not reported.
Detonation: An al Shabaab IED, planted to target AMISOM forces in Uffurow, detonates prematurely killing three members of al Shabaab.
A traditional elder is shot and killed by suspected al Shabaab in Baardheere.

Al Shabaab fighters carjacked a public transportation vehicle and abducted the 13 people on-board. The incident happened in the afternoon of 05/10 in Abdow Dibille village (5km SW of Afgooye), on the road to Marka. The vehicle and passengers were probably taken to Sabiid and Caanoole village. The vehicle came from Mogadishu and was heading to KM50 village. This is the fourth vehicle carjacked by AS in this area.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces clash in Iskushuban, one death reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug security forces and local militia clashed over an illegal checkpoint. Three wounded.
A traditional elder is shot and killed in a Wadajir cafe. The motive is believed to be politically influenced.

Two unidentified men armed with pistols shot and killed a traditional elder and injured another person in Bar Milano coffee shop in Aargada neighbourhood (Wadajir District) on the afternoon of 05/10. The perpetrators managed to escape. The motive of the killing is assumed to be connected to the political turmoil caused by the election process.
A roadside bomb kills a Somali soldier in Qansax Dheere, perpetrator not known.

Students and other bystanders stoned a mini bus near Nuradeen school on 06/10. The vehicle which was parked in the area for some time was carrying foreigners with cameras, which provoked the fury of the crowd. Two of the foreigners (origin not known) and the driver were injured.
A man from Rahanweyn is shot and killed by a man from Ogaden in a dispute over land.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland intelligence forces on 06/10 clashed with 10 Jubaland soldiers who tried to release an arrested man, who was suspected of being behind a series of hand grenade attacks in Calanley neighbourhood on 04/10. After a brief clash 9 of them were arrested by the intelligence forces, while two intelligence officers were injured in the fighting. It is rumoured that the District Commissioner is behind the grenade attacks, after a dispute about the composition of the candidate list submitted by the Jubaland government. The DC has been placed under house arrest.
Al Shabaab executes a man they accused of murder on Buulo Fulaay.
Property destruction: Al Shabaab fighters burned a house because of its owners having collaborated with SNG forces in Buulo Bashiir village ( 20km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 07/10.
Militia groups from North and South Gaalacyo clash at Garsoor over land. Seven killed, 18 injured. The clash occurred over two day, with all fatalities accounted on the first day.

Local business people demonstrated in front of Tog Wajaale government offices on 07/10, near the main border crossing between Somaliland and Ethiopia. The demonstrators complained of tax hikes recently imposed by the local government. They also accused local government officials of excessive corruption and nepotism.
Militia from Galjecel shot and killed two from Baadi Cadde clan in Wagada, near Belet Weyne.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: JISA forces and bodyguards of the mayor clash in Kismayo. One JISA soldier injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: At least six fighters were killed and nine others wounded in clashes Friday between forces from Puntland and Galmudug Administration.
A soldier is shot and killed by suspected al Shabaab in Heliwa.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: At least five people were injured on Saturday evening in a mortar attack on a residential area in Bulo Hubey. The attack was believed to be targeting a AMISOM base. No immediate claim of responsibility, though al Shabaab are expected as perpetrators.
Two dead in an clan revenge attack, identified of the actors not known.
Militia groups from North and South Gaalacyo clash at Garsoor over land. Seven killed, 18 injured. The clash occurred over several days, with all fatalities accounted on the first day.

SNG forces conducted a security operation in the bushy areas of Fidi Carootay settlement (approx. 29km NE of Marka) in the morning of 08/10. In the operation, SNG forces briefly clashed with AS fighters and reportedly killed three of them on the spot, also confiscating their AK 47 rifles.
Qayaad and Baharsame sub clans of Dhulbahante clash in Dharkein Genyo, Sanaag. Eight deaths reported.

A RCIED detonated in a SNG soldiers' outpost in the vicinity of the Ministry of Defence (Dayniile District) in the evening of 08/10. There are conflicting stories on the cause of the explosion as some sources suggested that the blast was caused by a hand grenade and not an IED. Two SNG soldiers were injured in the attack. No arrests were reported in connection to the incident.
Seven mortar rounds are fired into residential areas of Wadajir. 14 people, including a member of UN personnel were injured in the attack. Perpetrators not known.
A civilian is shot and killed by unidentified armed men. Motive not known.
Violent demonstration over the demolition of illegal structures.
Peaceful demonstration against the planned movement of a regional capital.
Khat vendors violently demonstrated over taxes of their product.
Clashes among militia groups continued into the third day. One person was wounded.

Militiamen from Dhulbahante/Qayaad sub-clan attacked militiamen from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub-clan in Sahdheer village (59km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 09/10. The Baharsame militiamen responded with heavy gunfire forcing the attackers to retreat. Tensions rose after Baharsame militias conducted a reprisal attack against Qayaad militias in Dharkeyn Genyo (80km SE of Buuhoodle) leading to the exchange of gunfire between both sides. No casualties were reported in either incident.

Militiamen from Dhulbahante/Qayaad sub-clan attacked militiamen from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub-clan in Sahdheer village (59km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 09/10. The Baharsame militiamen responded with heavy gunfire forcing the attackers to retreat. Tensions rose after Baharsame militias conducted a reprisal attack against Qayaad militias in Dharkeyn Genyo (80km SE of Buuhoodle) leading to the exchange of gunfire between both sides. No casualties were reported in either incident.

Ceerigaabo frankincense traders demonstrated in front of the municipal office on 10/10. They were angry about a group of frankincense businessmen in Hargeisa who received funds from The World Bank by falsely claiming that they represent Ceerigaabo frankincense traders. They asked the town authorities to evict the Isma'ala Frankincense Company, which they accused of illegally surveying Ceerigaabo frankincense resources.

Supporters of the Kulmiye party on 10/10 interrupted a ceremony in Gabiley welcoming ex-Kulmiye leaders who recently joined the Wadani opposition party. The demonstrators burnt the Wadani party flags and tires while they were demonstrating.
Violence among militias continue in Garsoor. Four people, including civilians were wounded.
Suspected al Shabaab threw a hand grenade at a government tax collection centre. No reports of fatalities.
Soldiers open fire on a group of civilians in an effort to clear an area. One death, one injury reported.

column9: Makane Clan Group (Somalia); Rahanweyn Clan Group (Somalia)
column17: Armed men from Hawadle clan shot and killed two, one from Makane and another from Rahweyn.
A vehicle loaded with explosives detonates while the unidentified perpetrator fled. A bystander was killed and four others injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Puntland and Galmudug forces clash, causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab has launched an overnight mortar attack on military base belonging to Ethiopian forces in Ceel Cali. Reports of the casualties on Ethiopian forces from the mortar shelling remain unclear.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Ethiopian forces pull out of Ceel-Cali following a mortar attack the previous day. Al Shabaab later takes the village
Following the exit of Ethiopian forces in Ceel Cali, al Shabaab overtakes the village and executes four civilians on charges of spying.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks AMISOM forces in Qoryooley. The fighting comprised of shelling and direct attack. Heavy causalities ""possible.""
A man was killed and two others wounded in Qalanqal village (20km S of Cabudwaaq) on 11/10 in a clash between two sub-clans of the Habar-Gidir/Ayr: the Cayiliwaa and the Yabar-dhowrakace/Burale.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF/ISWA forces safely dismantled a RCIED left on the roadside in Berdale neighbourhood, near Dahabshiil offices in the night of 11/10 following a tip-off from the members of the public. The group who placed the device are not known.

A gunman hailing from Habar-Yunis/Jibriil-Turwa sub-clan shot and seriously injured another man from Habar-Yunis/Cabdi-Xamud in Booca village (9km W of Ceerigaabo) on 11/10 following an escalated dispute over pastureland. The victim was taken to Ceerigaabo Hospital, while the perpetrator escaped.
Two unidentified men, armed with pistols shot and killed a NISA officer in Tabakayo- Agaar neighbourhood on 11/10. The perpetrators escaped.
Three people believed to be Al shabaab members lost their lives in a landmine bomb they were planting on a road at Ex-control Balad junction in Mogadishu.
On 12 October 2016, locals shoot and wound two suspected robbers in Bossaso.
After al Shabaab forcibly stops several passengers travelling near Afgooye, they clash with government forces attempting a rescue. No reports of casualties.
Saad and Wagardhac militias clash at Bali Cad over a revenge issue. Ten killed and 16 wounded.
A man is stabbed and wounded in Bossaso, perpetrator not known.

AS fighters carried out a retribution killing in Gal Hareri (90km W of Ceel Buur) on 12/10. The killing was carried out against a young man who had previously killed another man in Ceel Qoxle village (22km NW of Ceel Buur).

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: A member of the Presidential guard shot and killed a man for disputed or unknown reason.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab regains control of Afmadow without violence. AMISOM forces had taken temporary control of the area earlier in the day,

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AMISOM and JSF forces overtake Afmadow without al Shabaab resistance. Several hours later the contingent vacated the area causing al Shabaab to regain control.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
