column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A joint AMISOM/Jubaland force took over Harbole Village (19km S of Afmadow) on 12/10. AS fighters left the village before the joint forces' arrival, thus no clashes happened. After taking over the village, they returned to their base in Afmadow, and AS fighters reoccupied the village.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Fighting broke out between Galmudug state forces and local militias in Godinlabe Village (46km NW of Dhuusamareeb) in the morning of 12/10. The militias had established a roadblock on the main road to Cadaado, and were reportedly extorting money from motorists. ASWJ troops came to the support of the local militias and took over the town of Godinlabe after Galmudug forces retreated. Casualties remain unknown, but ASWJ says they have captured prisoners and confiscated armoured vehicles.
Al Shabaab kill two soldiers in Qansax Dheere district after they claim the pair were trying to steal property from Muslims in the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Seventeen Ethiopian forces were killed while several others were also wounded in an al Shabaab explosion attack that occurred in the outskirts of Baidoa town [southwest Somalia] on 13 October.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: At least 15 people were killed and many more were wounded today in an hours-long battle between Galmudug and Puntland forces in Gaalkacyo. The two groups had clashed in the area several days earlier.

A RCIED planted in the roadside struck a ISWA/SNA military vehicle in Daynuunay (19km SE of Baidoa) in the morning of 13/10. The explosion resulted in the death of six soldiers. Perpetrators not known.
Al Shabaab detonates an RCIED targeting unidentified anti al-Shabaab militia. Three civilian bystandars killed, seven others injured.
Al Shabaab attacks an anti-al Shabaab clan militia in Ceel Baraf, Mahadaay district. One member of the militia killed. Other fighting was also going on in the area, including an RCIED attack.

AS fighters carjacked a Toyota Carib vehicle and abducted the two passengers who were on board of it in Ceel Saliini village (30km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 13/10. Reportedly the two individuals were taken to Gendershe village which is an AS stronghold. The two were later killed.
AS fighters assassinated a nomadic man in front of his house at Fidi Carootaay Settlement (approx. 29km NE of Marka) in the night of 13/10. The motive behind the assassination is unknown.
Detonation: Al Shabaab attempts to plant an IED along a road in Heliwa, only having it detonate prematurely. Three perpetrators reported dead.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Ahlu Sunna Wal Jama takes control Gudinlabe town in Galgaduug region after heavy with Gulmudug. At least five dead.
A bomb has ripped through a small teashop in Mahaday town, killing at least one person, and wounding six others, mostly innocent civilians. Perpetrators not known.

Al Shabaab executed two men including Kenyan man accused spying for UK and Kenya Intelligence Agencies Witness said. The executions took place in Jilib town in Somalias southern Middle Jubba region on Thursday.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters launched a raid on African Union forces military outpost in El Baraf area in Middle Shabelle region, south of Somalia on Thursday. Causalities not known.
A group of SNAF soldiers, loyal to a disgruntled candidate, forcefully entered and took over a conference HQ.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched several mortar rounds against AMISOM/SNAF positions in Qoryooley. A civilian was reported killed. AMISOM responded in suspected directions, casualties not known.

Police in Burco conducted a security operation in the vicinity of Mohamed Ali neighbourhood in the evening of 14/10, and arrested youth suspected of being gangsters. Later, parents of the arrested youngsters gathered in front of the police station, and police fired several shots in the air to disperse them. No casualties are reported.
SNA forces conducted a raid on a mid-level al Shabaab operatives location at Dudumaale. Following an exchange of gunfire, the target was reported killed and two others injured.
Al Shabaab kills a civilian man in Ceel Cali, motive unknown.

A man hailing from Habar Yonis/Muse Turwa shot and seriously injured a man from Habar Jeclo/Basan Buur following an escalated dispute over grazing land in Dagaar valley near Dhaban (40km S of Ceerigaabo) on 14/10. The victim has been taken to Ceerigaabo Hospital for treatment, and the perpetrator was later arrested by the police in Ceerigaabo.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier shot and killed another in Kismayo after one refused a vehicle search.
A NISA soldier is shot and killed by unidentified individuals in Yaaqshiid.
Al Shabaab launched several mortar rounds at ""anti-al Shabaab"" militia in Qoryooley. Many of the rounds landed in a civilian area, causing at least one death.
Arrests: ISWA forces arrest a senior al Shabaab leader in Baidoa.
An RCIED planted at the office of the District Commissioner detonated, seriously injuring him.

Somaliland authorities in Lugahaye destroyed illegally built houses on 15/10. The buildings where used for storing fuel and fish which are smuggled to Yemen. Several locals who have demonstrated against the demolition were arrested by the police.

AS fighters abducted two local Madrassa teachers from their houses in Fidi Carootaay Settlement (approx. 29km NE of Marka) in the night of 15/10. Reportedly AS killed one of them, while they tortured the other one and then released him. The motive behind the incident is not clear, although it is thought that AS is doing that because they are suspecting that local people are collaborating with the Biyamaal clan militias who are fighting against them.
Al Shabaab attacked a group Biyomal farmers in Saddo Arootey. One teacher killed, two others wounded.
Al Shabaab kidnapped and later beheaded a Biyomal clan member in Gendershe.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Sporadic gunfire reported between Puntland and Galmudug forces in Garowe. Two killed and three wounded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Fighting between Puntland and Galmudug forces continue. One combatant was reportedly killed in the clash and another was injured. The fighting voluntarily stopped after the sun set.

Arrests: National Intelligence and Security Agency (NISA) forces shut down Xog-Ogaal newspaper headquarters in MogadishuBakara market (Hawl-Wadaag District) on the evening of 15/10. The security forces also arrested the editor of the newspaper. The paper manager indicated that the security forces also took documents from the office.
An IED placed outside the residence of a NISA officer detonated, no casualties.

Al Shabaab attacked an SNAF forces from Biyomal-Dir clan in Muuri. The attacks took over the settlement, burning several houses. Later, the SNAF forces regrouped and again took back control of the area. casualties not known.

Al Shabaab attacked an SNAF forces from Biyomal-Dir clan in Muuri. The attacks took over the settlement, burning several houses. Later, the SNAF forces regrouped and again took back control of the area. casualties not known.

SNG forces based in Muuri village carried out a security operation on the main road of Afgooye/Marka at Laanta buur village (11km SW of Afgooye town) in the afternoon of 16/10. During the operation, the SNG forces clashed with AS fighters who were ferrying with two mini buses. AS fighters managed to escape with their buses, and no casualties were reported from both sides.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed an AMISOM convoy in Golweyn, causing retaliation. One civilian bystander was killed and five others wounded.
Biyomal clan militia attacked al Shabaab forces based in Hambala village, near Gandarsh. casualties not known.
Al Shabaab attack an SNAF base in Ceel Waregow and was eventually repelled after 30 minutes of fighting. One SNAF soldier death reported - al Shabaab dead not known.
Unidentified gunmen opened fire on a tea shop in Godobjiran, 250km south of Garowe. The target was believe to be the towns mayor, as he was present at the time. Five civilians wounded.

An armed man hailing from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan reportedly shot and killed a man hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sacad sub-clan in Bayra village (32 km SE of Galdogob) in the morning of 16/10. Reports suggest that the victim was khat dealer who have taken khat to Goldogob town.
Al Shabaab attacked a mini-bus by ramming it with a car loaded with explosives in Buur Dhuxunle. Four reported dead - unknown if this number includes the perpetrators.
A man from Saad clan was killed by an armed man from Omar Mohamud at Beyra, near Gaalkacyo.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland soldiers with one battle wagon reportedly captured Puntland Bank (Galkacyo branch) in the morning of 16/10, in protest of several months of unpaid salaries, lack of medical treatment and other negligence. The soldiers were periodically shooting in the air to disperse crowds of people who came in the area. It is reported that the soldiers left the bank premises after the government promised them their salary payments. No theft was reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Puntland and Galmudug forces exchanged gunfire about 10 minutes in Galkacyo in the afternoon of 16/10. The two sides reportedly used heavy weapons including artilleries. No casualties were reported.
A security guard for the attorney general was shot and killed by two unidentified men.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: It is reported that an American drone did airstrikes in the al-Shabaab strongholds of Al-Madow Mountains on 16/10. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched several mortar rounds against AMISOM/SNAF positions at K50 settlement. No casualties reported.
Two mortar rounds are launched by al Shabaab on Ceel Waregow. No casualties reported.
A group of pastoralists attempt to loot food aid, causing police to disperse the group.

Reports from local sources suggest that AS militias in Galgala mountains executed one of their commanders hailing from Dhulbahan clan on suspicion of spying to government forces in the Calmadow mountains of Galgala on 17/10.
Al Shabaab abducted two civilians from Dudumale village. Whereabouts and fate unknown.

Armed man hailing from Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud shot and injured a man hailing from Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud in Israac neighbourhood in the evening of 17/10. The motive of shooting is not clear. The perpetrator had escaped.
An employee of the immigration department was shot and killed by an unidentified perpetrator.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab conduct a mortar attack on a AMISOM base in Qoryooley on 17/10. AMISOM forces respond with mortar fire. Unconfirmed casualties reported, numbers not known.

Anti-al Shabaab clan forces (not identified) attacked al Shabaab fighters in Garadid, near Afgoye. Two al Shabaab battlewagons destroyed, 11 al Shabaab were killed, one injury, and a senior commander captured.

AS fighters ambushed vehicles carrying wounded SNG soldiers, injured by AS's attack to Afgooye, in Calamada Settlement (Approx. 4.5km SE of Afgooye) in the evening of 18/10. Casualties of this ambush are unknown.

AS fighters launched hit-and-run attack against SNG force's base in the vicinity of Livestock Market (Heliwa District) on 18/10. Both sides exchanged gunfire for about twenty minutes before the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.

Al Shabaab attacks Afgooye killing 10, including soldiers and civilians. The attackers also suffered casualties. The attack began with a car-bombing, which was followed by an assault. Al Shabaab briefly took control of an area of the city, but it was wrestled back with the aid of AMISOM forces. Numbers of casualties vary upon the source - some as high as 35.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks Afgooye killing 10, including soldiers and civilians. The attackers also suffered casualties. The attack began with a car-bombing, which was followed by an assault. Al Shabaab briefly took control of an area of the city, but it was wrestled back with the aid of AMISOM forces. Numbers of casualties vary upon the source - some as high as 35.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters fired two mortar rounds against AMISOM and SNGF bases' at Halane neighbourhood in Qoryooley town in the night of 19/10. In response, AMISOM fired two mortars towards the direction which they were suspecting AS were at the time. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG forces together with AMISOM carried out security operation in Sabiid Anole village (8km W of Afgooye) in the evening of 19/10. The joint forces have taken over the village, which was a stronghold of AS in the last two years, without any clash. No arrests were reported.

SNG forces based in Muuri carried out security operation in Bariire village (23km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 19/10. In the operation, the SNG forces have shortly exchanged gunfire with AS fighters, who were retreated back from the village. Reportedly the SNG forces destroyed one of AS's vehicles and killed unconfirmed number of their fighters.

Unidentified armed men killed a Biimaal militiaman outside his house in Hawo Tako neighbourhood of Afgooye in the evening of 19/10. Reportedly, the deceased came from Muuri and was visiting his family in Afgooye when the incident happened. The motive behind the killing is unknown.
Al Shabaab kidnapped a pastoralist after he was forced to pay zakat for his camels. The man was taken to an unknown place.

AS fighters in Jabad Cade village (21km SW of Marka) carjacked a minibus with its 12 passengers on-board, mainly hailing from Biyamaal clan, and took them to Daydoog village in the afternoon of 19/10.
A number of youths attacked a Wadani office using stones. A number of vehicles in the surrounding area were damaged during the incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: A Jubaland soldier shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Calanley of Kismayo in the morning of 19/10. The motive behind the murder is unknown. The perpetrator was arrested and he is now in the police custody.

Anti-al Shabaab clan militia gain control of Gendershe and Jilib-Marka settlements without resistance, freeing many of al Shabaabs prisoner they abandoned after fleeing. The militia left the areas shortly thereafter.
Al Shabaab infighting wounds two in Madashon, southwest of Bossaso.
Inter-al Shabaab fighting in Galgala. One death reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Renewed clashes between Galmudug and Puntland forces in Gaalkacyo. casualties could not be established.
A clan elder is shot and killed by two unidentified gunmen.
Two men armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG soldier around Moalim Nur Mosque area in the evening of 20/10. The perpetrators managed to escape.

Unidentified persons shot and killed a clan elder in Yaaqshid. The attack was likely political: [The victim] was one of the countries leading clan chiefs who were expected to pick delegates for the upcoming parliamentary elections.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: AMISOM-Djibouti contingent clashed with Gaaljecel militia in Beletweyne. One AMISOM soldier killed, three civilian injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launch an attack against anti-al Shabaab militia in Aabacow village, near K50. Al Shabaab briefly overtook the village. Soon after SNAF and AMISOM reinforcements again overtook the village. Two al Shabaab dead in the counter attack.

Al Shabaab launch an attack against anti-al Shabaab militia in Aabacow village, near K50. Al Shabaab briefly overtook the village. Soon after SNAF and AMISOM reinforcements again overtook the village. Two al Shabaab dead in the counter attack.
Non-violent activity: A vehicle transporting khat is hijacked by unidentified clan militia who are believed to be supporters of the governor in Dharjaale. No report of causalities.
Al Shabaab attacks two commercial vehicles travelling between Marka and Mogadishu. The trucks were burnt and the drivers were later released.
Al Shabaab conducted a public execution of three alleged to be western spies.
A public transport driver was shot and killed by a ISWA after refusing extortion payment.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED targets passing AMISOM forces, injuring only a civilian. Perpetrators not known.
The body of an unidentified man is discovered on the outskirts of Ceerigaabo. Perpetrators and motive not known.
The body of a teenage boy was spotted in the east of Ceerigaabo on 22/10. The victim who hails from Marjeerteen/Omar Mohamud sub-clan is said to have been killed with sticks.
A man from Ali Saleban sub-can was shot and wounded by a man from Osman Mohamud in Haafun area, 100km SE of Iskushuban. Motive not clear.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A PMPF soldier is shot and wounded by an unidentified armed man, motive not known.

column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Puntland authorities destroyed illegally built houses along Garowe's roads on 22/10. The buildings were used for business and residence. Some of the owners were arrested after they demonstrated against the demolition.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Seven are dead and 23 wounded in continued fighting between Galmudug and Puntland forces. Fighting ended at sunset.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Fresh fighting has erupted between Puntland and Galmudug forces in Galkacyo in the afternoon of 22/10. The two sides used both small arms and heavy artilleries. Seven combatants are allegedly killed in the clash and 21 others were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attacked Jubaland soldiers in Afmadow. Two JSF soldiers and one civilians were killed, three others injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: More than 140 al Shabaab fighters were killed by KDF soldiers during a botched attack in Somalias Afmadhow area in Lower Jubba. The gun battle lasted for three hours.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces based in Buufow fired mortar rounds at al Shabaab positions in Janaale. Casualties not known.
A vehicle transporting khat is fired upon by supporters of the former governor in Albaraka area. No reports of causalities.
The day following a clash between Gaaljacel militia and AMISOM, locals gather to protest the AMISOM presence, but are quickly dispersed by police.
Property destruction: Al Shabaab burns Bulo Gian village. No causality reported.
An RCIED targeted ISWA soldiers, injuring three, including a civilian. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab ambushed coalition forces at Tijeeg Buul. Two al Shabaab reported dead, following an exchange of gunfire.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNAF and AMISOM forces launched an attack on al Shabaab forces in Halamba village, near K50. One al Shabaab combatant was killed in the attack.
Soldiers open fire on a group of civilians in Afgooye for unknown reasons. Two injuries reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Armed clash begun in the west side of Beled Weyne town between AMISOM/Djibouti forces and Galjecel clan militia on 23/10. The fighting was triggered after AMISOM troops tried to expand their defence line into a civilian area that contained business premises and residential blocks, which angered the local people. So far, one AMISOM soldier was killed and another wounded, while two militiamen were wounded also in the clash.
Anti-al Shabaab clan militia clash with al Shabaab in El-addow, near Ceel Jale. Following an exchange of gunfire, a civilian was injured. Causalities among the warring sides could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF forces withdrew from Halgan village, reasons unknown. Shortly thereafter, al Shabaab took control of the area.

Unidentified armed men with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in Afgooye vegetables market at the vicinity of Hawa Taako neighbourhood in the morning of 23/10. The motive behind the killing is unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AS fighters attacked Jubaland soldiers who were on foot patrol inside Afmadow town in the night of 23/10. Both sides exchanged gunfire but AS fighters launched an attack against Jubaland base in the town. The fighting went on and sporadic gunfire continued until 03:00 the following morning when AS fighters completely withdrew from the town. Two Jubaland soldiers were killed in the attack while an old civilian lady died as a result of a stray bullet inside her residence. Four Jubaland soldiers were reportedly injured. Casualties from AS side could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Fighting continues in Garsoor. Five killed, others injured.

A suicide bomber, driving a vehicle rigged with explosives attempted to evade a security patrol in Bondhere, crashing the car into the building wall of a radio station, causing the explosives to detonate. Apart from the death of the driver, four others were injured. Shabelle Media Network reports three dead. Target and perpetrator identity not known.
Unidentified gunmen assassinate a government intelligence officer in his Mogadishu home.
An explosion in a khat market leaves a woman dead. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AS fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy withdrawing from Halgan in Nur Fanax (42km S of Beled Weyne) on 24/10. The convoy was heading to Beled Weyne. Number of casualties are not known.

Property destruction: Al Shabaab fighters burnt down a house of a civilian said to be a supporter of Bimal militias in Tisnaar village (3km N of Marka) in the evening of 24/10. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Heavy fighting broke out between AS and Ethiopian forces in the outskirt of Wabxo town on 24/10. The battle begun when AS fighters ambushed an Ethiopian convoy heading to Ceel Buur. This convoy is said to be composed by the ENDF contingent that previously vacated Moqokori and moved to Maxaas.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: AS fighters attacked Jubaland soldiers who were on foot patrol inside Afmadow town in the night of 23/10. Both sides exchanged gunfire but AS fighters launched an attack against Jubaland base in the town. The fighting went on and sporadic gunfire continued until 03:00 the following morning when AS fighters completely withdrew from the town. Two Jubaland soldiers were killed in the attack while an old civilian lady died as a result of a stray bullet inside her residence. Four Jubaland soldiers were reportedly injured. Casualties from AS side could not be established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Fresh fighting has erupted between Puntland and Galmudug forces in Galkacyo in the morning of 24/10. The two sides have exchanged small arms and heavy artillery fire. There were casualties, both death and injuries, but no reliable numbers, as fighting was still raging at the time of reporting. Some stray bullets and artillery shells hit residences in Israac neighbourhood, and fresh displacements were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM Djibouti base in Belet Weyne, beginning with a large explosion from a suicide blast, then with gunfire. At least 10 fatalities reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Members of the Islamic State attack and overtake Qandala from Puntland forces. Causalities not known. Following the attack, Puntland forces openly blamed the Somali government for aiding in the attack.

Hundreds of local residents staged a demonstration in Qorilugud (38km NW of Buuhoodle) on 25/10. They were protesting the death sentence which Togdheer Regional Court handed to two men hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Soolomodaw sub-clan, who killed a man from Dhulbahante/Samokaab-Ahmed sub-clan in Burco on 14/03.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Two rounds of mortars were fired against the AMISOM/Djiboutian base in the outskirt of Jalalaqsi town on 25/10. The AMISOM forces didn't respond to the attack and no civilian casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Detonation: Unidentified men hurled a hand grenade which landed and exploded in an open space in Santarka Shaqallaha neighbourhood, close to a Jubaland forces base, but causing no casualties. The security forces in response conducted a security operation in the neighbourhood.
Islamic State forces withdraw from Qandala a day after capturing the area. It is not clear if Puntland forces retook the city.
Ten al Shabaab dead and seven injured over three days of fighting with military forces in Baardheere. Four government soldiers reported dead on the final day.
Accusing them of spying for AMISOM, al Shabaab executed two civilians after they captured Tayeeglow. Xinhua reports five executions.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF forces withdraw from Tayeeglow, al Shabaab takes control soon thereafter.

Bimal militias took over Garshiine village (5km NW of Marka) in the afternoon of 26/10. The militias had reportedly been informed about an AS collection of maize from that village as tax. The AS fighters retreated from the village before the arrival of the Bimal militias, who then burnt the stockpile of maize collected as tax.

Borama public transport drivers conducted a peaceful demonstration in front of local government offices in Borama on 26/10 in protest against a new fee that been issued by the local government. The drivers were claiming that the fee has not been decided on in a legal manner by the local government committee, and was only decreed by the mayor.

Property destruction: Al Shabaab fighters burnt down 7 cottage houses owned by civilians and the only water well in Buulo Macallin Osmaan settlement (14km NE of Marka) in the evening of 26/10. As a result, the residents fled from the village. No human casualties were reported so far. This act of arson is one of many actions taken by AS fighters these past days to empty the area around Marka off civilians, which they suspect of collusion with the Bimal militias that are fighting with AS in Lower Shabelle.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: ENDF helicopters medevacked injured ENDF forces from Ceel Buur to the Level II AMISOM Hospital in Beled Weyne on 26/10. It is not clear if the soldiers were wounded during a clash among themselves (ENDF personnel in the area have had a history of internal disputes), or if they are the victims from the AS ambush of their convoy in Wabxo. According to unconfirmed reports, an Oromo commander was killed and several other soldiers injured during clashes.

SNA forces carried out an ambush attack against AS fighters in Bakal village (8km NE of Baardheere) in the afternoon of 26/10. This comes after SNA got information that AS was planning to conduct an attack against SNA forces in Bakal. Reports indicate that both sides briefly exchanged gun fire. Casualties are unknown.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified perpetrator(s) hurled a hand grenade at a police station in Biyo Kulule neighbourhood of Bosaso, which caused the injury of several detainees in the compound on the evening of 26/10. Police arrested suspects in connection with the incident and the wounded were rushed to Bosaso General Hospital for treatment. No one claimed responsibility so far.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Reports received from local sources indicate that AS Galgala fighters ambushed a PSF convoy in the vicinity of Madarshoon area near Galgala village (53km SW of Bosaso) on the evening of 26/10. The shootout lasted for a short while, after which the AS fighters reportedly retreated back to their hideouts while the convoy proceeded to its destination. No reports were given of casualties.

Exchange of gun-fire was reported near the Juba Hotel, between SNG forces and unknown armed men. It appears a vehicle refused to stop for a security check, and was chased by security forces after it managed to evade the control.
At least four Somali soldiers were killed and two others wounded in an attack by suspected al Shabaab in Heliwa.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Heavy fighting between al Shabaab and AMISOM forces at K50. Causalities on both sides, numbers not known.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed an army colonel; forces near him return fire, killing one of the perpetrators.
Ten al Shabaab dead and seven injured over three days of fighting with military forces in Baardheere. Four government soldiers reported dead on the final day.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a school teacher for unknown reason. Shortly thereafter, area residents organized a protest to call for justice in the death.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column8: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Fighting broke out between ENDF military groups in Baardheere town in the morning of 27/10. Casualties cannot confirmed. One of the groups is reported to be hailing of Amhara ethnic group of Ethiopia. The motive behind the fighting is reported to have links with the recent political unrest in Ethiopia. For more on Ethiopian withdrawals from Somalia.
Unidentified gunmen shoot and kill a school teacher for unknown reason. Shortly thereafter, area residents organized a protest to call for justice in the death.

Women, youth and elders from Warsangeli/Nuux-Cumar sub-clan staged a demonstration against Puntland in Yubbe village (62km SE of Ceerigaabo) on 27/10. The demonstrators were chanting anti-Puntland slogans alleging failed promises made to Warsangeli/Nuux-Cumar. The motive of this demonstration remains unclear yet it seems that their sub-clan candidate has failed to be elected to one of Puntland's upper house seats.

A group of unidentified armed men aboard a vehicle opened fire against NISA personnel based in the former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the night of 27/10. The injury of a NISA soldier was so far confirmed. The attackers escaped.

At least four Somali soldiers have died during fighting with al-Shabaab near the southwestern town of Baardheere. The fighting began following an aerial bombardment from Kenyan forces at nearby Ali Hared. Causalities from the air strike not known.

At least four Somali soldiers have died during fighting with al-Shabaab near the southwestern town of Baardheere. (Al Shabaab fighters reported dead over three days of fighting) The fighting began following an aerial bombardment from Kenyan forces at nearby Ali Hared. Causalities from the air strike not known.

SNGF/ISWA attacked an AS base in Kulanjerer (40km E of Waajid) on 28/10. Both sides briefly exchanged small arms fire. AS retreated from the village and suffered one fatality. SNGF/ISWA returned back to their base in Xudur. During the fight, the local Hormuud communication tower was damaged and the network was cut off.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS ambushed an AMISOM convoy travelling from Shalambood to Bulo Mareer town at Golweyn village (24km SW of Marka) on the main road to Baraawe in the morning of 16/10. The ambush was followed by an armed clash in the village between AS fighters and AMISOM. An old woman and a 8-years old girl were killed in the crossfire. The clash has also led the population to flee.
Gunmen belonging to sub-clans of the Habar-Jeclo/Biciido and Habar-Yonis/Sacad-Yonis exchanged gunfire in the area of Faleeryale (76km S of Laas Caanood) on 28/10. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An African Union military vehicle has been destroyed when al-Shabaab fighters ambushed an army convoy in the outskirts of southern town of Buula Mareer. Heavy fighting ensued after the ambush which killed a number of Ugandan soldiers, who are part of African Union peacekeeping mission.
Al Shabaab abducts an elder in Afmadow.

Biimaal militia clashed with AS fighters in Barire, an AS stronghold, (23km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 29/10. The militia managed to take over the village after a short clash with AS fighters but retreated after three hours. Four AS fighters were reportedly killed in the clash and their AK 47 rifles confiscated.

Two armed men with pistols, suspected AS, shot and killed an SNGF member in front of his house in Mbagathi neighbourhood of Afgooye town at midnight on 29/10. It is not clear if the soldier was on duty at the time of the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab launched several mortar shells at SNG/AMISOM positions in Xudur. At least 1 person was confirmed killed, and several injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Suspected Kenya military jets have conducted an airstrike in southern Somalia, targeting an Al Shabaab training camp in Malenda. According to reports ""several"" were killed in the airstrike.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Somali forces recapture Goof Guduud from al Shabaab, hours after they have first gained control of the town. Eight al Shabaab dead, four Somali/AMISOM dead.
Two group of SNG soldiers clash over control of a checkpoint. Four reported deaths.

AS fighters abducted a Biimaal clansman from his farm at Busleey Da'uud village (13km NE of Marka) in the morning of 30/10. This abduction is part of a series of repressive actions lately committed by AS fighters against Biimaal civilians in Marka and Afgooye.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attack and overtake Goof Guduud from joint SNG and AMISOM forces. Seven Somali soldiers reported dead.
Four people have been killed in fighting between forces loyal to two parliamentary candidates (Bashir Mohamed Adan ""Habashow"" and Rabio Sheikh Nurow) in Baidoa.

Armed men thought to be from a local militia called Macawuusley attacked an AS base inside Moqokori town on 31/10. So far the injury of a child was confirmed. The number of casualties inflicted to the combatants remains unclear, due to the remoteness of the area.
Militiamen from Hawadle clan attacked al Shabaab fighters in Moqukori. During an exchange of gunfire a small child was injured.

Biimaal militias attacked the house of the AS Amir for Marka coastline areas in Ceel Axmed village (17km SW of Marka) in the night of 31/10. A short armed clash between the militias and the guards of the Amir erupted, resulting in the killing of two guards. The Amir managed to escape.

Militiamen belonging to Habar-Yonis/Sacad-Yonis shot at gunmen belonging to Dhulbahante/Naleeye-Ahmed in the vicinity of Shinbiraaley village (9km SE of Xudun) on 31/10. This happened when Sacad-Yonis militiamen suspected that the other group was of the opposing Habar-Jeclo/Biciido clan. The Dhulbahante gunmen responded with gunfire and both sides retreated from the area. Elders intervened and managed to calm down the situation. Causalities not known.
A man from the Ayr/Ayanle sub-clan was killed in Guri Ceel town (61km SW of Dhusamareeb) by an armed man from Ayr/Habanji on 31/10. The reason behind the killing remains unclear.
Al Shabaab beheaded two civilians and shot and killed another in two separate incidents in Tayeeglow.
Unidentified helicopters conducted air strikes against ISIL locations on Karimo, near Qandala. Casualties not reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy as ambushed by al Shabaab between Miirtuugo and Ceel Baraf settlements. The AMISOM convoy was damaged; the soldiers returned gunfire and the attackers were overpowered. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM/SNAF forces are attacked in Janaale by al Shabaab. There was an exchange of gunfire. Casualties could not be established.
ISWA and SNA forces withdrew from Goof Guduud; al Shabaab took control of the village without resistance.
A man is stabbed and wounded over a land issue.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column7: Operation Ocean Shield: NATO Mission in the Indian Ocean, Gulf of Aden and Arabian Sea (2009-2016)
column17: Puntland coastguard forces, said to be with a NATO warship shelled ISIL fighters in Qandala. Causalities not known.
Clan militias attempted to ambush a government delegation near Godinlabe. No reported of causalities.
Militia from Jajeele clan clashed with Gaaljecel at Hargeblow, 17km west Beletweyne over land. One injury reported.
Unidentified warplanes conducted airstrikes at al Shabaab positions in Yumbis settlement. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab launched an ambush on AMISOM military camps in K50 on the evening on 02/11. Causalities not known.
A man from Hawrarsame clan of Marehan was shot and killed by a man from Dalal clan over suspected clan issues.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug and Puntland forces clash in Garsoor, south of Gaalkacyo. Three killed, seven wounded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Fresh fighting erupted between Puntland and Galmudug forces in Galkacyo in the afternoon of 02/11. The two sides reportedly exchanged small arms and artillery for about 40 minutes. Five combatants were reportedly killed in the clash and about 10 others injured. By 03/11 the fighting had stopped.
A delegate in the upcoming Somali Lower-House elections was shot and killed In Wadajir by two armed al Shabaab assailants.
Four killed and a dozen wounded in an IED attack on a Kenyan convoy in Busaar. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack.
Somali security forces have detained two suspects whom they said have shot and killed a traditional elder in Mogadishus Wadajir district on Wednesday afternoon.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters launched an attack against Halane AMISOM base in Qoryooley on 03/11. Both sides engaged in heavy fighting before attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
ISWA/SNGF troops took over Goof Gaduud Shabellow from AS for the second time on 03/11. AS vacated the village before the troops arrived and no fighting was reported.
Al Shabaab attempt to assassinate someone only described as an ""old man."" Following the attempted killing, security forces launched a security clearing measure.
At least 6 people are known to have been killed, and 10 others were wounded on Thursday in a deadly renewed clan clashes in the town of Abudwak in Galgaduud region
A suicide car bomber targeted an army convoy near parliament headquarters in Somalias capital on Saturday evening, killing two soldiers. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: An AMISOM (Burundian) supply convoy was targeted with a RCIED which damaged a military vehicle and wounded at least one soldier in Qurac Madoobe (23km NE of Jowhar). The explosion was followed by the exchange of small arms fire by both sides before attackers withdrew. The AMISOM convoy was driving from Ceel Baraf to Mahaday.

Gunmen hailing from Majerteen/Isse-Mohamud sub-clan opened gunfire at Sama-Hele Hotel in Garowe in the evening of 04/11. The gunmen were angry at the selection of the members of the Somalia Lower House by traditional elders. The hotel hosts election delegates. No casualties were reported.

A male Jubaland electoral delegate stabbed another male delegate to death at Aargo section of Farjano neighbourhood in Kismaayo town on 04/11 in the afternoon. Both men hail from Hawiye/Sheikhal/Awqudub sub-clan, but they were supporting opposing candidates. The perpetrator was immediately arrested and detained by the police.
Al Shabaab claims credit for a suicide car bombing targeting Somali forces at Sayidka junction, Mogadishu. ""Heavy causalities"" reported, later described as 20.

Arrests: Police arrested the traditional elder Ugas Abdirahman Diriye hailing from Habar-Jeclo/Cimraan sub-clan in Burco on 05/11. The reason behind the arrest may be that Habar-Jeclo/Cimraan sub-clan members have changed their support from the Kulmiye ruling party to the Wadani opposition party.

A group of people staged a demonstration in Barhada roundabout in Garowe in the morning of 05/11. They accused some of the elders involved in the selection of the members of Somalia's Lower House of nepotism. The protesters chanted anti-traditional elder's slogans and called for the intervention of the international community.

Gunmen believed to be hailing from Hawadle clan killed a man near the border close to Feerfeer in Beled Weyne district on 05/11. The victim, who hails from Sheikhal clan, was a cattle herder in the area. The reason behind the killing is not yet clear, but it is said that the perpetrators mistakenly killed the victim thinking that he hails from Dir/Surre sub-clan.

Unidentified gunmen assaulted an electoral committee member hailing from Arab-Salah clan in Garowe on 05/11. The gunmen reportedly accused him of nepotism in the election of the candidates for the Lower House of the Somali Federal Parliament. No arrests were reported.

AS fighters abducted two women who hail from Rahanweyn/Hadame sub-clan in Labaatan Jirow (48km NE of Baidoa) in the morning of 05/11. Reports indicate that one of the abductees was an ISWA police officer while the other one is a civilian. AS beheaded the police woman and is holding the other woman captive.
Arrests: SNG forces arrested suspects in the vicinity of Busleey (Boondheere District) on 05/11, reportedly for planting IEDs.

An armed man hailing from Abgaal/Waceysle killed a militiaman hailing from Abgaal/Daud in Weydoow (Dayniile District) in the morning of 05/11. Later in the evening, two clansmen hailing from Abgaal/Waceysle sub-clan were killed by militiamen from Abgaal/Daud on a revenge mission.

AS fighters attacked local militiamen who set up an illegal checkpoint on 06/11. The attack happened in an area called Shiilo Madoow (approx. 4km S of Beled Weyne) Three militiamen were killed in the fighting that ensued, while one of them sustained minor injuries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters fired about five rounds of mortars against Ceel Jaalle AMISOM base (approx. 6km SW of Marka) in the night of 06/11. In response, AMISOM shelled the nearby area with mortars. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters fired about seven mortar rounds against an AMISOM base in Ceel Baraf (55km NE of Jowhar) in the morning of 06/11. Casualties are unknown. There is no information from AMISOM regarding the incident.
Two groups of SNG forces fought in Mahaday for unknown reasons on 06/11. One of the soldiers was killed and another injured in the fighting.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: SNG forces together with AMISOM forces in Qoryooley town reached camp 2 village for patrolling activities (5km NW of Qoryooley) in the morning of 06/11. The joint forces were ambushed by AS fighters on their way, leading to a fight that lasted for an hour before the attackers withdrew. Casualties from both sides could not be established.

AS fighters searched houses, vehicles and pedestrians in Jilib town on the night of 06/11. They arrested over 45 elders during the search operation. Further reports state that 30 of those arrested were later released after going through investigations. It is also reported that two men, hailing from Duduble and Ogaden clans, were killed while the remaining 13 are in custody.

A man hailing from Dhulbahante/Jama-Siyad sub-clan shot and killed a local municipal council tax collector hailing from Majerteen/Isse-Mohamud sub-clan in Garowe on 06/11. The incident happened after the tax collector tried to remove and confiscate the door of the man's home over unpaid annual tax. Shortly afterwards, police arrived and arrested the perpetrator.

Clan militias hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sacad sub-clan abducted and later killed a well-known sheikh, from the Tablighi sect, in the green line area of Galkacyo on 06/11. The sheikh, from the Majerteen/Omar-Mohamud sub-clan, used to cross the green line to preach peace among the fighting sides. It has been suggested that he may have been slightly mentally challenged.

A gunman from Dhulbahante/Jama-Siyaad sub-clan shot and killed a man from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub clan in Xidh Xidh area (75km NE of Buuhoodle) on 06/11. The motive of the killing remains unclear. The incident triggered tensions and panic among local clans. Somaliland Police and army troops were deployed in Laas Caanood. Police also arrested six Jama-Siyaad elders to compel them to seize the escaped murderer.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Fresh fighting has erupted between Puntland and Galmudug forces in Galkacyo in the morning of 06/11. Both sides reportedly exchanged small arms and heavy weapons fire. More than 27 combatants and 6 civilians were reportedly killed in the clashes and more than 100 others were injured. The UN interrupted its flights to Galkacyo Tensions are still high in the town.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Korontada (Wadajir District) in the night of 06/11. The victim was seemingly one of the delegates selected to elect a member of Somalia's Lower House. The perpetrators escaped

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A Somali official says al Shabaab has fired several of mortar bombs at a military outpost belonging to AU mission in Somalia (AMISOM) -Burundi in El-Baraf village, Mahadaay District. Five soldiers deaths reported.
Biimaal militias ambushed AS fighters at Kali Caafimaad (20km NE of Marka) on 07/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire for 20 minutes. Two AS fighters were reportedly killed in the clash.

Gunmen from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub-clan shot and killed a man and injured another three from the Dhulbahante/Qayaad sub-clan in Dhammay village (82km NE of Buuhoodle) on 07/11. The killing seems to be in revenge for an earlier attack. Shortly after, Qayaad gunmen ambushed a vehicle belonging to the Baharsame clan and killed a man from Dhulbahante/Ali-Geri (possibly by mistake) and injured two Baharsame clansmen on board the vehicle.

A RCIED hit a group of SNG forces boarding a vehicle in Cabdalla Shideeye section of Bakara Market (Hawl Wadaag District) in the morning of 07/11. Some of the victims were police, while others were local municipality officers. Four soldiers were injured in the attack.
At least five people have been killed in fighting between two groups of pastoralists in Sool region, exact location not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Clash between Galmudug and Puntland forces - 25 reported dead. The Puntland post claims 40 dead.
An RCIED targeting the vehicle of the Chief of Elasha settlement administration exploded in Elasha town, Afgoye. The target survived the attack but the vehicle was damaged. Two bystandards injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: AS launched a mortar attack on an AMISOM base in Ceel Baraf (60km NE of Jowhar) on 08/11. AMISOM did not issue any statement regarding the incident. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab fighters shot and killed two SNA soldiers from Hawadle clan in Buundaweyne neighbourhood, Belet Weyne.

AS fighters confiscated an estimated 50 goats and 30 cows from Biimaal nomadic families at Nagaadweyne village (17km NE of Marka) in the morning of 08/11. Shortly after the incident, the victims informed Biimaal militias, who engaged AS in an armed clash outside the village, which reportedly lasted for about an hour. The Biimaal militias managed to get back the livestock. An AS vehicle (mini-bus) was reportedly destroyed during the clash and the men on board were killed, numbers not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Two groups of Jubaland forces clashed over land in Kismayo. Two soldiers injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A remote controlled IED targets an AMISOM convoy at Carbiska. One truck was damaged by the explosion. Human causalities not known.

Arrests: Two local journalists working for Bulsho TV were arrested by police in Borama on 09/11. The reason behind their arrest is unclear but it is suggested that the Mayor of Borama ordered their arrest after they allegedly published an article criticizing his development record.

AS fighters took over Goof Gaduud Shabellow (25km SW of Baidoa) in the morning of 09/11. ISWA/SNA Forces retreated to the outskirts of the town AS fighters entered the it. Reports indicate that the motive behind the withdrawal of ISWA/SNA forces is shortage of military supplies and lack of salaries.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-Ethiopian forces kill seven civilians in Dac following a firefight with al Shabaab. Motive unknown.
Small arms fire from unknown origin was heard from Garsoor section. A civilian was reported injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: IS militants and PMPF (Puntland Marine Police Force) clashed in an area 7km E of Buruc Village in Qandala District in the afternoon of 09/11. The two sides exchanged gunfire for about half an hour. Unconfirmed reports indicate that one IS militiaman was injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Puntland and Galmudug forces engaged in a brief exchange of gunfire at Puntland customs checkpoint in Garsoor neighbourhood of Galkacyo in the evening of 09/11. It was reported that Galmudug forces initiated the fighting. Both sides used machine guns and RPGs. A female bystander was reportedly injured in the clash.

Unidentified gunmen aboard a vehicle shot and killed a well-known Somali elder in a drive-by shooting in the vicinity of KM5 (Hodan District) in the morning of 09/11. The motive behind the killing has not yet been established but the elder reportedly participated in the electoral delegates' selection process for the ongoing Lower House Parliamentary elections. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AMISOM-Ethiopia forces clash with al Shabaab at Dac. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked AMISOM-Burundi forces in Ceel Baraf causing ""massive"" causalities.
A Somali elder is killed by unidentified perpetrators in a drive-by style shooting, leaving a second injured.
Suspected Kenyan fighter jets have conducted an airstrike on al Shabaab locations in Buaale District. Causalities not known.

AS launched a heavy attack on the SNGF checkpoint at Buulo Foolyo 1 neighbourhood of Afgooye in the night of 10/11. The heavy gunfire reportedly wounded two SNGF members. The casualties from AS fighters' side could not be established.

An unidentified gunman shot and killed a man hailing from Majerteen/Ali Saleban sub-clan in the vicinity of New Bosaso neighbourhood in Bosaso town on the night of 10/11. The motive of the incident is not clear. No reports of immediate arrest.
Unidentified warplanes have bombed al-Shabaab bases in the outskirts of southern Somalia town of Buale. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: NATO warships have fired missiles into the IS held town of Qandala, while Puntland forces exchanged fire with the group along the beach. Causalities not clear.

column6: Operation Ocean Shield: NATO Mission in the Indian Ocean, Gulf of Aden and Arabian Sea (2009-2016)
column17: NATO warships have fired missiles into the IS held town of Qandala, while Puntland forces exchanged fire with the group along the beach. Causalities not clear.
Unidentified gunmen kill two civilians in Afgooye. The two may have been targeted in revenge for animosity between two fraternal clans in Lower Shabelle region.
At least 10 people have been killed and over a dozen injured in a clan clash Ariad in Galgudud. The identities of the clans are not known.

A RCIED exploded inside a privately owned football field at Isku Filan section of Fanole neighbourhood of Kismaayo town on 11/11. The IED apparently missed its target as no property or human casualties were reported, but the intelligence services arrested the owner and the guard of the field.

Two clan militias, from Marehan and Dir/Faqa-Mohamud, clashed in Tuulo Jilibey (65km N of Cabudwaaq) on 11/11. The fighting was sparked by a dispute over grazing land, aggravated by the failing Deyr season rains. Five people died in the confrontation and seven were wounded.

AS fighters launched a huge attack on SNGF base at Muddun village (8km NW of Baraawe) in the morning of 11/11. Both sides exchanged different kinds of fire. There may be many casualties on both sides, but no exact information was available.

A RCIED exploded as a SNG police vehicle had just passed it in the vicinity of Black Sea (Hodan District) in the afternoon of 11/11. The SNG police opened gunfire after the blast. One civilian bystander was injured in the explosion.

Gunmen belonging to the warring Dhulbahante clans Qayaad and Baharsame exchanged gunfire in Laas Caanood in the evening of 12/11, injuring a bystander. Somaliland forces immediately intervened and reportedly arrested several militiamen and confiscated some weapons.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AS fighters ambushed an ENDF convoy traveling from Mogadishu to Baidoa in the morning of 12/11 at Mooda Mooda village (25km NE of Baidoa). Both sides exchanged automatic gunfire, resulting in one ENDF military vehicle burned. After the incident telecommunications were switched off, until the convoy reached its final destination.
Unidentified assailants seriously wounded a member of the Jama Tabliq religious group in Beled Weyne town on 12/11.

AS fighters abducted three traditional elders from their homes at Yaaq Biri Weyne Village (22km W of Wanla Weyn) and took them to an unidentified location in the morning of 12/11. The elders were reportedly involved in a Humanitarian Aid Distribution Campaign that was recently implemented in the village.

About 20 AS fighters abducted a man hailing from Warsangeli/Dubeys near Laag village on 12/11, and reportedly took him towards Almadow Mountains. Their motive may be that they suspect him of being an informer for Puntland.

Militia loyal to the SNG Minister of Finance Maxamed Aadan Ibraahim (Fargeeti) attacked the residence of one of the delegates of Disow sub clan (Mr Yarrow Aden) in the afternoon of 12/11. Mr. Fargeeti, himself was defeated when he contested for the position of MP for his sub-clan. Mr. Fargeeti accused the process of being unfair. Mohamud Moalin Yahye was elected to be the MP. Causalities left unreported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland security forces clashed with other Jubaland forces that were heading to their base not far from the junction, at Fii-Afmadow road junction in Shaqalaha neighbourhood of Kismaayo on 12/11 night. The reason of the clash is not clear. No casualties were reported.
Unidentified gunmen shot and killed an SNG soldier in Nasteexo neighbourhood, (Wadajir District) in the morning of 12/11. The motive for the attack is unknown. The attackers escaped.
Al Shabaab gunmen shoot and kill a government soldier in Bakaara Market.

Majerteen/Omar Mohamud militiamen with a Toyota Mark 2 reportedly attempted to carjack a lorry belonging to a Hawiye/Hawadle clansman along the main road linking Galkacyo to Bosaso, at Salama IDP Camp (10km N of Galkacyo) in the evening of 13/11. The gunmen allegedly injured the driver and his assistant after opening fire at the lorry. It is believed that the militia are protesting against the reopening of the road that links Galkacyo North and South. Police secured the vehicle although the perpetrators escaped.

Arrests: An IED, believed to be magnetic and which was attached to a vehicle, detonated in the vicinity of Suuqa Beerta (Waaberi District) in the afternoon of 13/11. The vehicle belonged to a businessman who was not inside the car when it detonated. Security forces arrested the owner for questioning. No casualties were reported.
Gunmen have shot and killed at least one Somali soldier and wounded two people in an attack on security forces in Wardhigley. Perpetrators not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab carry out two land mine explosions in Buur Xakaba, first against military forces (AMISOM-Ethiopia), then against a police post the following morning. A senior government official was killed in the first attack.

Property destruction: Militiamen from ASWJ stormed the station of Radio Galgaduud, which operates in Guri Ceel town, on the evening of 14/11. The militiamen ordered the staff to switch off the Radio and leave the building, before they confiscated the FM Transmitter and other important equipment. The reason for this measure is unclear, but it seems that the said Radio Station may have aired content that the ASWJ didn't like.
SNA forces ambushed al Shabaab fighters travelling in a tuktuk near Doondardiir village. After an exchange of gunfire, al Shabaab escaped. No reports of causalities.
Following al Shabaabs retreat from Tayeeglow, they regroup and attack again. No report of causalities.

ISWA and SNG forces attack al Shabaab in Tayeeglow. Following an exchange of gunfire, government forces recaptured the village. Initially, it was believed three government soldiers injured and five al Shabaab fighters injured.

Unidentified gunmen, believed to be from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub-clan, opened fire at a house belonging to a Dhulbahante/Qayaad clansman in Laas Caanood in the evening of 14/11. The motive of the shooting remains unclear. No causality reported.

Biimaal militia opened fire on a private SUV car that was transporting commodities from Mogadishu to Marka via Jazeera road at Cad Cadeey village (10km NE of Marka) in the evening of 14/11. The driver was injured as a result. The motive behind this attack is said to be to a retaliatory response against the AS which has conducted similar attacks on the Afgooye-Marka road that the Biimaal militia controls, thus limiting their revenue base as the latter used to extort money from the road users. The Biimaal hope to sabotage the revenue collection of the AS which taxes vehicles using the Jazeera road.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab attacked a JSF/AMISOM base located at Hoosingo. Following 30 minutes of small arms fire, al Shabaab retreated. No reports of causalities.
Suspected al Shabaab shot at NISA security forces at Miisaanka-dhuxusha area, Yaaqshiid. One soldier and civilian bystander injured.

Troops from the AMISOM, along with Somali forces have killed 12 Al-Shabaab fighters and captured a town in Baraawe District. As al Shabaab forces fled they shot and killed two civilians in retaliation.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Troops from the AMISOM, along with Somali forces have killed 12 Al-Shabaab fighters and captured a town in Baraawe District. As al Shabaab forces fled they shot and killed two civilians in retaliation.

Al Shabaab carry out two land mine explosions in Buur Xakaba, first against military forces (AMISOM-Ethiopia), then against a police post the following morning. A senior government official was killed in the first attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Joint AMISOM-SNG forces took control of Miir Taqwo village (53km NE of Jowhar town). No violence reported.

AS fighters confiscated about 41 camels and killed 4 camel herders in Maalin Siid settlement (64km SW of Afgooye) on 15/11. The victims hail from Biimaal clan. This is part of a series of confiscations of livestock and killings of Biimaal herders by AS.

A clansman hailing from Marehan/Howrarsame killed a civilian man hailing from Marehan/Reer-Siyaad in Cabudwaaq on 15/11. The reason of the killing is not known, but it is believed to be part of ongoing revenge killings between the two sub-clans.

Unidentified drones (likely US; no other group operating drones in the area) bombed suspected AS camps in God- Kabash area, South of Laanta Buur village (11km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 15/11. Locals from Laanta Buur village report that they heard about 18 strikes. The number of casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: A number of mortar rounds were fired from an unknown location and landed in the vicinity of Mogadishu Stadium (Wardhiigleey District). AMISOM forces have a big base in the stadium. It is not yet known if the attack caused casualties.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Joint AMISOM-SNG forces took control of Mirtuugo from al Shabaab without violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected Kenyan Air Force jets have carried out an airstrike on al-Shabaab training camps at Luglaaw (Laan-Goori). Four deaths reported.
Al Shabaab retakes Tayeeglow after launching a raid that included suicide car bombs gunfire. At least four Somali soldiers were killed.

An RCIED that was attached to the wall of a tea shop exploded near Aargo Junction, opposite K2 building of Lower Juba Governor's office in Fanoole neighbourhood of Kismaayo town, in the morning of 16/11. The RCIED targeted government officials including soldiers that usually buy tea from the shop. Four civilians were injured in the attack. No arrests have been reported. Perpetrator identity not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters launched a number of mortar attacks against an SNA/AMISOM base in Miir Taqwo village (53km NE of Jowhar town) on 16/11 night. This occurs just a day after the joint AMISOM/SNA forces took over Miir Taqwo from the AS. The number of casualties could not be established.
Marehan subclans clashed at Abudwak town. Five killed, 13 injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM soldier guarding Galmudug State House shot and killed one of the electoral delegates in front of the election venue in Cadaado on the morning 16/11. The slain delegate, who was protesting against the process of the election, reportedly barred other delegates from the entering the election venue and this provoked the AMISOM soldier to shoot him. The perpetrator was arrested.
Unidentified armed groups clashed in Gaalkacyo at the borderline between the North and South sections of the city. No reports of causality.
A group of Lower Shabelle Peoples Guard forces attacked al Shabaab outside Marka. Three al Shabaab killed in the attack.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab fighters attacked an AMISOM position at K60 settlement, near Afgooye. An exchange of gunfire lasted an hour. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters launched an attack on the AMISOM and SNGF base at KM60 (26km NE of Marka) in the night of 16/11. The AS fighters encountered a defensive response from the joint forces. There is possibility of casualties from both sides, but no clear reports have been received so far.

Galmudug forces shot and killed a man who was attacking parliamentarian elections delegates with a knife. The incident was related to disputes between politicians and delegates from Murursade clan, though it is not clear if either actor is part of or representing this group.

AS fighters in the evening of 17/11 arrested and tortured a Biimaal clansman in Ceel Xaaji Neighbourhood of Marka. The victim's brother was assassinated by AS a night ago (16/11). The man was later released. This has caused fear and displacement in the residents of the neighbourhoods of Xaafad Ruusiya and Abosivo of Marka.

AS fighters assassinated a Biimaal clansman and burnt three houses owned by Biimaal civilians in the neighbourhood of Ceel Xaaji in Marka, in the evening of 16/11. AS and Biimaal have been engaged in bloody clashes since last September.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified assailants fired what is suspected to be a RPG against Miir police station in the evening of 17/11. The police and the gunmen engaged in a brief shoot-out, before the attackers withdrew. The motive of the attack is not clear. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: JSF attacked an al Shabaab base in Bura, 65km south-west of Dhobley. One JSF, six al Shabaab reported killed.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces ambushed AS fighters at Bura grazing area (about 84km W of Kismaayo) in the morning of 16/11. The ambush started with explosions and turned into heavy clash that destroyed a battle wagon and a water tanker of the AS fighters. Jubaland forces killed 10 fighters and confiscated 5 AK 47 rifles. One Jubaland soldier was killed in the clash and three others were injured, according to local residents. Later in the afternoon around 15:00 AS displayed one dead body from Jubaland at Kamjiron village.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces shot and killed a man who was attacking parliamentarian elections delegates with a knife. The incident was related to disputes between politicians and delegates from Murursade clan, though it is not clear if either actor is part of or representing this group.
Two hand grenades were hurled at the residence of a police officer, injuring five of the officers family. Perpetrators not known.

An SNA soldier, Abgaal/Wacbudan sub-clan, was killed by Abgal/Harti militiamen in Haji Cali village (20km NW of Cadale) on the night of 17/11/2016. The incident comes after weeks of disputes over the control of illegal checkpoints in the area.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: A joint force consisting of Jubaland, AMISOM/ENDF and US soldiers, conducting a security operation supposedly to facilitate the ongoing elections in Kismaayo, were targeted with an RCIED at the outskirts of Buur koy (Wirkoy) village (19km SW of Jamaame) on the morning of 18/11. The bomb ripped apart an AMISOM/ENDF military truck and led to the death of four soldiers and the injury of three others, residents report. An intense armed clash pitting the joint forces against the AS fighters ensued. Residents reported the death of 6 AS fighters. The joint forces took control of the village and reportedly recovered AS owned weapons including IED making materials.

SNGF confiscated weapons and destroyed two cars belonging to AS in a security operation conducted in Buulo Sheekh village (4km SE of Qoryooley) in the evening of 18/11. In retaliation, AS attacked the SNGF forcing them to leave behind the weapons and the cars. Causalities not known.

Unidentified assailant(s) reportedly shot and injured a man from Hawiye/Sheekhal sub-clan in the vicinity of Dr. Rooble Clinic in Biyo Kulule neighbourhood of Bosaso on 19/11. The motive of the incident is not clear. The perpetrator escaped. Police arrested a suspect in connection with the incident.

Gunmen believed to be from Galjecel clan assassinated a herdsman from Jajele clan on 18/11. The victim was herding his livestock in a grazing land called Dameeralasys, (approx. 23km W of Beled Weyne).

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed an off-duty SNG soldier in the vicinity of Buundo Koowaad (Xamar Jab Jab District) in the night of 18/11. The attackers escaped. SNG forces reached the scene but no arrests were reported.
Al Shabaab attacks a military location at Buufow Bacaad. Causalities not known; civilian houses reported destroyed.
Al Shabaab attacked a military base in Muuri, leading to a gunfight. Witness described the battle as ""deadly,"" but provided no fatality number.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Six al Shabaab dead after a clash with AMISOM forces in Bulo-Gadud area.

Habar Gidir/Sacad militiamen reportedly started shooting near a hotel hosting Galmudug President in Galkacyo South in the night of 19/11. The president's guards returned fire. No casualties were reported. A local journalist who reported that Puntland's Forces attacked the Galmudug President's hotel, an allegation denied by the Galmudug authorities, was arrested but released the following day.

Security Forces and unidentified gunmen exchanged fire in the vicinity of Weydoow (Dayniile District) in the afternoon of 19/11. One of the soldiers got injured in the fighting while one of the gunmen was apprehended.

At least three people were injured when two groups of gunmen clashed outside a polling station in Jowhar where parliamentary elections are taking place. The fighting came after a dispute among parliamentary candidates. Hiirshabelle regional administration vice-president is among those wounded in the clash.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: At least three Ethiopian soldiers serving with the African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) have been killed in a IED bomb attack at Bulo-Gadud village. Perpetrators not known, though coalition forces had killed six members of al Shabaab the previous day.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Jubbaland forces backed Ethiopian and foreign forces thought to be U.S. military personnel have launched a joint offensive on the Al Shabaab-held area Berhani. The joint forces overran the area, causing the al Shabaab elements to flee. Many houses destroyed, causalities not known.

Detonation: An IED accidentally exploded in a group of AS fighters in a former AMISOM Base at Ceel Xaaji Neighbourhood in Marka in the evening of 20/11. Two AS fighters were reportedly killed in the explosion.
Suspected Jajele gunmen killed a Galjecel clansman on 20/11 in the outskirts of Beled Weyne. This latest killing seems to be a revenge killing for the Jajele man killed last Friday.

Two Dhulbahante/Farah-Ali clansmen armed with AK47s shot and killed a man from Dhulbahante/Reer-Elmi sub-clan in Laas Caanood in the morning of 20/11. This killing is linked to previous revenge killings between both sub-clans. The perpetrators attempted to escape but police managed to arrest them. The victim's sub-clan refused to bury him until the perpetrators are brought to justice, but later traditional elders and local authorities intervened and the victim is now buried.

Reports indicate that 20 AS fighters kidnapped two Warsangeli men in the vicinity of Galgala on 20/11. The motive is not clear. It appears that one of the men used to be a member of Puntland armed forces, and that he left the forces for personal reasons.

An SNA soldier shot and killed a civilian man in Cadale town on the night of 20/11. It is believed he wanted to avenge a man killed in Haji Cali village (20km NW of Cadale) on 17/11 (see report above). Both the perpetrator and the victim hail from Abgaal/Warsangeli clan. No arrests were reported.

AS assassins shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Siinaay (Wardhiigleey District) in the evening of 20/11. AS claimed on their website that the victim was an SNG intelligence officer. The perpetrators escaped.

AS fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against a base of SNG forces in the former Perfume Factory (Heliwa District) on the night of 20/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the attackers withdrew. Casualties are unknown.
Suspected al Shabaab conduct a bomb attack against police forces in Mogadishu, killing and injuring two.

Fighting erupted between two militias from Galjecel and Jajele clans in the outskirts of Beled Weyne town on 21/11. Six combatants died in the clashes while eight others were wounded. The fighting is believed to be linked to the recent revenge killings that marred the rural areas these two clans inhabit.

AS fighters launched an attack against the Lower Shabelle People's Guards (LSPG) base in Danow village (16km NW of Marka) in the evening of 21/11. The attackers encountered fierce resistance from the LSPG. The number of casualties could not be established.

AS fighters indiscriminately opened fire on a house owned by Biimaal civilians, killing two brothers at Balafleey section of No.50 (Airstrip) village (21km SW of Afgooye) on 21/11. Shortly after, the Biimaal militia reached the scene of the incident and engaged the AS fighters in a gunfire battle. The resulting casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters launched an attack against AMISOM and Pro-SNG militia bases in No.50 (Airstrip) (21km SW of Afgooye) in the night of 21/11. Both sides engaged in a thirty minute battle, in which both light and heavy weapons were used, before the AS fighters withdrew. AS claimed that they killed 2 of the AMISOM/Pro-SNG militia but the exact number of casualties remains unknown.

AS fighters indiscriminately opened fire on a house owned by Biimaal civilians, killing two brothers at Balafleey section of No.50 (Airstrip) village (21km SW of Afgooye) on 21/11. Shortly after, the Biimaal militia reached the scene of the incident and engaged the AS fighters in a gunfire battle. The resulting casualties are unknown.

A Majerteen man shot and injured a man from Madhibaan clan in Darxumo Market area, at the Galkacyo green line, in the afternoon of 21/11. The motive of the shooting is not yet clear. The perpetrator escaped.
Al Shabaab reportedly shot and killed a herdsmen from Biya-maal sub-clan if Dir. The incident is related to an ongoing inter-clan conflict.
A soldier was shot and killed by unidentified gunmen in Kahda. The perpetrator confiscated the victims weapon and escaped.
Al Shabaab battles SNG soldiers on the evening of 22/11 at K50. Two reported SNG deaths.
Al Shabaab clashes with a ""local militia"" in K50 and Bariirre on 22/11. Reports said both warring sides have suffered ""heavy losses"" in both areas.
Al Shabaab clashes with a ""local militia"" in K50 and Bariirre on 22/11. Reports said both warring sides have suffered ""heavy losses"" in both areas.

Two groups of Somali government forces have engaged in a gun battle in the neighbourhood of Xereryaale in Mogadishu district of Wardhigley. Reports indicate that fighting between two groups of government forces erupted after officers stopped a vehicle in which a senior commander was travelling. The commander is reported to have sent for reinforcement leading to a gun battle between the traffic officers and the unidentified soldiers in Wadnaha road. Three deaths reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al-Shabaab has shelled an African Union military base in Leego area in southern Somalia. The African Union troops retaliated by firing artillery towards al-Shabab positions. Causalities not known.
Somali forces backed by Ethiopian troops have launched attacks in the al Shabaab held town of Berhani, causing the controlling forces to flee before the attackers arrived.
Al Shabaab overtake Goof Guduud following a gun battle with SNG forces. At least 4 SNA soldiers are reportedly killed, and scores wounded. Xinhua reported 11 dead.

Al Shabaab clashed with unidentified local gunmen in Dumaaye village. The fighting took place after local residents refused to pay Zakawat to al Shabaab. Three local fighters injured.
