No report of causalities from the al Shabaab side. -- However, a report the following week had 40 dead in the ""week long battle.""

column8: ULFSSCR: Unity and Liberation Fronts of Sool, Sanaag and Cayn Region
column17: Militiamen, believed to be members of the newly established 'Unity and Liberation fronts of SSC Regions', attacked with mortar fires against Somaliland forces based in Waqdari area near Laas Caanood on 23/11. The incident happened near a place which Somaliland President stayed overnight his recent visit of Laas Caanood. There are no reports of casualties from the attack.
Suspected AS fighters armed with AK47 rifles killed a Biimaal clansman at his farm in Bariire village (23km SW of Afgooye) in the afternoon of 23/11.
A man from Ismail Yonis sub-clan is shot and wounded by a gunmen from Osman Mohamud Warfaa Ali sub-clan at Buula Qodax neighbourhood in Qardho.
A traditional elder is killed by unidentified gunmen near K50.

Reports from Manapoliyo residential area near Shibis District [Mogadishu] say there has been an explosion that has caused casualties. A man working for the United Arab Emirates is said to have been killed in a [Toyota] Carib car which was bobby-trapped. Three other people were injured. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility for the blast.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters ambushed an AMISOM convoy travelling on the Marka-Baraawe road at Golweyn village (24km SW of Marka) and reportedly killed a number of AMISOM soldiers and badly damaged one of the convoy's vehicles, in the afternoon of 24/11. The AMISOM forces responded with gunfire and reportedly killed ""several"" AS fighters. The convoy was returning from Bulo Mareer town to its base at Shalambood village.

A gunman from Dhulbahante/Baharsame sub-clan attacked and engaged in a shootout with a group of youths hailing from Dhulbahante/Qayaad sub-clan in Royal Park, in Laas Caanood, in the evening of 24/11. The motive for the shootout is related to recent revenge killings between the two clans. One of the Qayaad youths was killed in the shootout while another 5 were injured.

Al Shabaab clash with local gunmen at Dumaaye on 25/11. Seven killed, a dozen wounded. A similar clash occurred in the area on 23/11. It is not clear if the militia is the same group. A report the following week had 40 dead in the ""week long battle.""

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An IED attack was targeted against AMISOM convoy on the industrial road near Caafi Factory (Dayniile District) in the afternoon of 25/11. The device which was planted on the road damaged one of the AMISOM vehicles, prompting retaliatory gunfire by the AMISOM forces. One civilian reported dead. Perpetrators not known.

Suspected AS fighters aboard a small vehicle opened gunfire on a group of SNG soldiers in the vicinity of Golden Hotel (Yaaqshiid District) in the night of 25/11. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the attackers withdrew. Two combatants from both sides were reportedly killed in the fire exchange.
Al Shabaab gain control of Laantabuur following a gun battle with government forces. Al Shabaab claims ""several"" government soldiers killed.

A suspected car bomb has killed at least 11 people and injured another 16 when it exploded at a police checkpoint next to a busy market in Waberi. Medical sources told the news source the death toll could be as high as 30. Al Shabaab suspected as perpetrator. A later reported claimed 20 dead.

An RCIED attack hit a SNA convoy at Sabuun village in Mahaday area (18km NE of Jowhar). Local residents report that at least three soldiers were killed and another wounded in the attack. Perpetrators not known.

Two groups of Biimaal Militia and AS fighters on patrol clashed in Laantabuur village (11km SW of Afgooye town) and both sides engaged in a short gunfire exchange. So far, no casualties were reported.
An armed man hailing from Majerteen/Isse-Mohamud shot and killed his clansman over a land dispute in Garowe in the night of 26/11. The perpetrator escaped and is still at large.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US forces descended from a helicopter upon a group of al Shabaab in Dugulle located 50 km north of Qoryoley. Six al Shabaab reported shot dead before the airborne forces were extracted.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Government and AMISOM forces regain control of Laantabuur following an non-violent exit by al Shabaab.

Heavily armed Galjecel and Jajele clan militias clashed in the outskirts of Beled Weyne town on 25/11. Five combatants from both sides were confirmed dead, while seven others were wounded. Later, when SNG sent reinforcements to restore peace, an unidentified sniper shot and killed a soldier. The fighting took place in the mountainous area of Baali (6km W of Beled Weyne).

Heavily armed Galjecel and Jajele clan militias clashed in the outskirts of Beled Weyne town on 25/11. Five combatants from both sides were confirmed dead, while seven others were wounded. Later, when SNG sent reinforcements to restore peace, an unidentified sniper (likely Gaaljecel or Jejele militia) shot and killed a soldier. The fighting took place in the mountainous area of Baali (6km W of Beled Weyne).

Defusal: NISA officers disarmed an IED that was buried in a secluded area near Ilka Code village (16km N of Beled Weyne) on 27/11. The officers who were acting on a tipoff excavated the area and then found the IED. The head of NISA in Hiraan described the found explosives as 'lethal weapon aimed at the destruction of the Somali people.'

Local pastoralists and AS fighters clashed again in Dumaaye Village (36km NW of Xarardheere) in the morning of 27/11. The fighting was allegedly initiated by AS fighters, following a refusal by the local pastoralists to pay alms (Zakat). AS fighters overpowered the pastoralists and confiscated their livestock. About 10 combatants were reportedly killed in the clash. Tension remains high in the area.

AS fighters attacked SNA soldiers and captured four of them from Mahaday town (22km NE of Jowhar town) in the night of 27/11. Several soldiers were wounded. Casualties on AS side could not be established.

A group of armed men aboard a vehicle opened gunfire on another small vehicle in the vicinity of Shaqalaha neighbourhood (Hodan District) in the night of 27/11. The identity of the armed men and their motive remains unknown. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Galmudug forces (some sources describe the actor as ""local residents"") clash with al Shabaab over forced taxation in Harardhere. 26 al Shabaab killed and others wounded.

AS abducted a businessman from Ceel Gamboole village (48km NW of Jowhar) on the afternoon of 28/11. The abductee hails from Galjecel/Caloofi sub-clan. The local residents staged a demonstration demanding his release.

column8: ULFSSCR: Unity and Liberation Fronts of Sool, Sanaag and Cayn Region
column17: Militiamen, believed to be members of the newly established 'Unity and Liberation fronts of SSC Regions' reportedly carried out hit-and-run attacks against the Somaliland forces based at Daraymadobe in Laas Caanood on 28/11. Somaliland forces responded with gunfire and artillery shells forcing the militiamen to retreat. No casualties were reported.

Local pastoralists and AS fighters clashed for the third time in the past week in Dumaaye Village (36km NW of Xarardheere) on 28/11. AS fighters burnt homes in the village before confiscating a large number of livestock. Local residents note that the death toll for the last three days has risen to 30, most them AS fighters.

AS abducted a businessman from Ceel Gamboole village (48km NW of Jowhar) on the afternoon of 28/11. The abductee hails from Galjecel/Caloofi sub-clan. The local residents staged a demonstration demanding his release.

Gunmen hailing from Dhulbahante/Farah-Ali clan abducted three Habar-Jeclo clansmen and carjacked their vehicle in the vicinity of Qarac Lagu Dhal village (79km E of Laas Caanood) on 28/11. The incident is reportedly linked to the sentencing of two Dhulbahante/Farah-Ali clansmen who were convicted of murdering a Dhulbahante/Reer-Elmi clansman by the Somaliland Regional Court in Laas Caanood. The perpetrators sought to pressure the government to release the convicted clansmen. Traditional elders intervened and managed to secure the release of the hostages and the vehicle.

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Joint SNA and suspected US forces carried out an offensive against an AS military camp in Tortoorow village (48km NE of Afgooye) in the midnight of 28/11. The joint forces who reportedly left the Leego military base reached the village by helicopter and landed a short distance from the operation area before engaging the AS fighters in an armed clash. AS claimed that it forced the attacking force to retreat without incurring any casualties.

Defusal: ISWA/SNA forces carried out a security operation in Berdale town (51 km W of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 29/11, after they were informed of an IED that was planted in the Berdale airstrip. The ISWA/SNA forces discovered the IED and managed to disable it.
Habar-Yunis/Muse-Ismael clansmen attack and injure a local chief in Kulmiye.
Al Shabaab and a local militia again clash in Dumaaye and its surrounding areas following heavy violence in the are the previous week. Causalities not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: An IED hit a Puntland Maritime Police Force (PMPF) vehicle in the vicinity of Sugure village (35km S of Bosaso) in the morning of 29/11. Three soldiers reportedly died in the attack while eight others were injured.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Puntland and Galmudug militias engaged in a brief fire exchange at Puntland customs checkpoint in Garsoor neighbourhood of Galkacyo in the morning of 29/11. The cause of the shootout is unclear but the Galmudug side reportedly initiated the shooting. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified gunmen shot and killed two SNA soldiers in the vicinity of Beerta Jaadka (Hodan District) in the night of 29/11. The attackers also seized the guns of the slain soldiers. The victims were reportedly buying khat when the incident happened.

Unidentified attackers, armed with pistols, shot and killed an old man in Arafat neighbourhood (Yaaqshiid District) in the morning of 29/11. The motive for the assassination remains unknown but the elder reportedly came from Cadaado the previous day. The perpetrators escaped.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a group of SNG soldiers who were foot patrol in the vicinity of Black Sea of Hodan District in the night of 29/11. The attackers escaped. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: A number of mortar rounds fired by AS fighters landed on an ENDF military base near Waajid Airport on 30/11. Casualties have not been reported.

Armed clan clashes flared up between two Habar-Jeclo sub-clans, Imraan and Ahmed-Farah, in Gumbur Libaax village (55km E of Burco) on 30/11. The fighting was triggered by a land dispute that was simmering for the last couple of months. One Imran clansman was killed in the clash and the two sides are reportedly arming themselves for fresh confrontations.
Arrests: Police in Hargeisa arrested a journalist on 30/11. The motive of the arrest remains unknown but it is believed to be linked to press coverage critical of Somaliland president.

An unknown gunman shot and killed a Habar-Jeclo/Reer-Yunis clansman in the vicinity of Xadhadhanka village (154km SE of Burco) on 30/11. The gunman also seized a gun belonging to the deceased. The motive for the killing remains unknown. The perpetrator escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Puntland and Galmudug militias engaged in a brief exchange of fire between Garsoor and Wadajir neighbourhoods in the afternoon of 30/11. Two people were reportedly hit and injured by stray bullets in the south. A school in Wadajir neighbourhood (South) and a community centre in Garsoor neighbourhood (North) were also damaged by the stray bullets. The shoot-out is a violation by both sides of the agreed ceasefire.

Unidentified attacker(s) hurled a hand grenade at NISA personnel who were based in a garage located in the Black Sea neighbourhood of Hodan District on the night of 30/11. The garage was seized by NISA in connection with an IED attack that happened in the Suuqa Beerta market in Waaberi district on 26/11. No casualties and arrests were reported. Injury not known .

Men believed to be followers of the opposition party, Wadani, assaulted a local poet, Jama Ilka-Jiir, in Hargeisa on 30/11. It is believed that the incident was politically motivated as the poet has been reciting poems that are critical of the Wadani party.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Two AMISOM/SNG forces are dead following a clash with al Shabaab.
Unidentified clan militia ambush an al Shabaab convoy. Two al Shabaab dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Two al Shabaab dead following a clash with suspected AMISOM forces in Jowhar.
The district commissioner [DC] of Jalalaqsi town, Mohamed Abdulle Fidow, has been injured in an ambush attack by armed al Shabaab fighters in central Somalia on Thursday [1 December].
Al Shabaab attacks a qat delivery vehicle in Garbahaarey, killing one and injuring others. Al Shabaab had recently decreed gat to be an illegal substance.

ISWA/SNA forces attacked an AS fighters' base in Dhurey (18km SE of Waajid) in the afternoon of 01/12. The ISWA/SNA forces launched the assault after being informed of an AS meeting at the target base. Residents reported the death of 4 AS fighters and 3 ISWA/SNA soldiers.
At least 11 government soldiers were killed, and three others wounded in a heavy fighting between al Shabaab fighters and Somali troops in Duuray. Xinhua reports two al Shabaab deaths.
NISA forces are targeted with an al Shabaab IED. Outcome not known.

Two local sub-clans belonging to the Dhulbahante/Ahmed Garaad clan briefly clashed over land and water dispute in Higlo Goodir village (47km NE of Buuhoodle) on 02/12. The fighting began when one of the sub clans attempted to construct a water reservoir and the other clan opposed the move. The incident caused panic among residents. However, no casualties have been reported.
An unidentified armed man shot and injured a man hailing from Dhulbahante clan in Ajuuke area of Bosaso on 02/12. The perpetrator escaped.

Suspected AS fighters launched a hit-and-run attack against the NISA base inside the former perfume factory (Heliwa District) in the night of 02/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces forcibly overtake a bank in Gaalkacyo after salary payments were delayed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Three civilians are killed in a al Shabaab-targeted bombing of ""rural Lower Shebelle"" - location not known.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: The Lower Shabelle People's Guard (LSPG), a group of clan fighters opposed to AS, together with AMISOM forces attacked AS fighters in Bariire village (23km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 03/12. The joint forces engaged AS in a gunfire that lasted for three hours before AS fighters retreated. Two LSPG fighters and an AMISOM soldier were wounded in the clash while casualties from AS remain unknown.

Construction workers employed by a foreign company demonstrated in Xumba Wayne area against what they claimed to be low wages and delayed payment of salaries. The workers are working at a dam construction project funded by the UAE Red Crescent.

AS fighters opened fire and wounded a Habar-Gidir militiaman who was said to be a former SNA soldier in Wajeer Market of Beytraas neighbourhood, Marka, in the evening of 03/12. The man was targeted due to his previous association with the government as an SNA soldier.

Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a civilian man in the vicinity of Baqaar Feysal neighbourhood (Heliwa District) in the evening of 03/12. The victim was a businessman who ran a travel agency. The motive for the murder is unknown. The attackers escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Al Shabaab launches mortar rounds against Ethiopian forces in Waajid. Local residents in Wajid town said they heard sounds of several explosions from the mortar shelling landed in the camp, but reported no casualties from the attack. The attack may have occurred on 04/12.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: On 03/12, at least seven Islamic state members were killed in clashes between Puntland forces in Bashaashin village, just 50km west of Qandala town in Bari region. Puntland forces have been advancing toward Qandala, an ISIL stronghold.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces clash with ISIS between Qandala and Toga Afbashaashin in Bari. Puntland forces have been advancing toward Qandala, ""clearing the way to the town."" There were reports that Puntland forces gained control of Qandala proper, though commanders dismiss the claim. (The town was confirmed captured at a later date). Casualties on ""both sides of fighting"" (Dalsan Radio). Social media reports 40 dead, unconfirmed.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM) said AU and Somali forces have killed at least seven al Shabaab members during a confrontation in Bariirre 04/12.

Pastoralists hailing from Digil/Garre sub-clan killed a Digil/Jiido clansman over pasture disputes in Iidow Guudow village (8km NE of Kurtunwaarey town) in the night of 04/12. The murderers were arrested by AS.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US forces either bomb or shell an al Shabaab position in Wanlaweyn. KIA unknown.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Weapons Seizure: A surveillance drone belong to an US intelligence agency crash lands in Bariirre, al Shabaab recovers the wreckage.

column6: Operation Ocean Shield: NATO Mission in the Indian Ocean, Gulf of Aden and Arabian Sea (2009-2016)
column17: NATO warships positioned in the Gulf of Aden shell IS forces in Qandala. Fatalities not known.
Government forces clear an al Shabaab checkpoint in Garasdaay. No causalities reported.
At least six people were killed and 10 others injured in a remote-controlled land mine explosion targeted a police checkpoint in Baidoa. Authorities believe al Shabaab are responsible.

Around 5 December 2016, Raskamboni militia group loyal to the current president of Jubbaland state harassed and detained civilians in Kismayo town (Kismaayo, Lower Juba), after two soldiers were recently killed.
Al Shabaab gain control of Qaayib village after government forces vacate the area. No reported violence.
Unidentified attackers armed with pistols shot and killed a SNG police officer in the vicinity of Via Liberia in the afternoon of 05/12. Perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Unidentified drones, thought to be American owned, struck an AS military camp in Ibraahim Madkeey village (36km NW of Afgooye) in the evening of 05/12. The exact number of AS casualties from the airstrike is not known

column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Somali commandos unity backed by US Special Forces in helicopters bombed al Shabaab bases at Omar Beere location, near Tortoroow, in Lower Shabelle region during the overnight hours. It is not immediately clear the damages caused by the strike. Following the strike, several al Shabaab commanders were captured by Somali land forces who raided the area.

Three civilians were injured in a RCIED attack on a local flour mill in Buur Hakaba town in the evening of 05/12. The IED may have been planted in the mill the night before. Al Shabaab believed responsible. Secondary sources indicated 10 dead, 30 wounded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM clashed with al Shabaab Qoryooley. Five al Shabaab arrested.
Unidentified persons kill a civilian in Bakaara Market on 06/12, reasons not known.

Non-violent activity: Local clan militias from Majeerteen/Isse-Mohamud sub-clan briefly took over the control of Garowe airstrip in the morning of 06/12 following a land dispute over the ownership of the land near the airport. About 40 heavily armed militias reportedly occupied the airport. Traditional elders intervened and successfully removed militias from the airport. The airport is currently under construction and hosts Turkish constructors.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AS fighters ambushed an AMISOM/KDF convoy heading from Afmadow to Dhobley at Hawina grazing area (94km SW of Afmadow). The ambush which reportedly started with an IED explosion damaged one of the convoy's trucks. Both sides exchanged gunfire briefly before the AS fighters withdrew. The resulting casualties are unknown.
AS fighters launched an attack on SNA force's checkpoint in Warmahan village (30km NW of Afgooye) on 06/12. The two sides clashed briefly before the attackers withdrew. No casualties reported so far.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Security forces reported that a vehicle driven by a Puntland soldier hit an anti-tank mine on the road between Afkarim (38km SE of Qandala) and Qandala in the afternoon of 06/12. The truck was seriously damaged but no casualty was reported.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Dervish Force
column17: AS fighters planted and exploded a RCIED against a Darawish forces' vehicle, which was carrying supplies, at Balikhadar area of Galgala (37km S of Bosaso) on 06/12. The vehicle was damaged by the explosion, but no human casualties caused.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US forces launch an air strike against an al Shabaab location at Duduble. Unknown outcome.
At least three are killed and several injured in a clash between government forces and al Shabaab in War Maxan. A secondary report claims the event was a gree-on-green incident.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces retake Qandala from IS forces following a fight. 30 IS, four government soldiers killed in the operation. Note: 25,700 people have fled their homes over the period of fighting.

AS fighters launched a heavy attack against SNA/ISWA joint forces' base in Goof Gaduud Burey (30km NW of Baidoa) in the night of 07/12. AS fighters reportedly managed to take control of the town for a few hours before the SNA/ISWA forces returned and pushed them out. 6 SNA/ISWA soldiers were killed in the fighting while 4 others were injured. AS casualties are unknown.
Al Shabaab ambushed government forces in Wararaxleey, killing three.
Al Shabaab attacks Goof Guduud, leading to a overnight battle. Eight causalities reported over two days.

Biimaal militias attacked a Habar-Gidir clan militiaman at his house in Horseet Laanta 1 neighbourhood of Marka in the night of 07/12. The assaulted and present friends returned gunfire against the attackers. No casualties were reported.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US forces bomb a al Shabaab location at Kumbareere on 07/12. No immediate report of causalities.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US forces carry out an air strike against Islamic State in or near Qandala. Causalities unknown. Actor 2 may be mistaken; many analysists believe the US did not engage IS forces in Somalia until November 2017.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces again forcibly enter a Gaalkacyo bank while protesting non-payment of salary. Forces had attempted the same tactic earlier in the week.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An al Shabaab IED strikes an AMISOM convoy at Bulo Mareer. Outcome unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: At least four Kenyan defence force soldiers were killed, several injured in a bomb attack on KDF military convoy in southern Somalia on 07/12. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.

Two groups of SNG Forces fought among themselves over tax collection in Shalaambood village (8km W of Marka) in the afternoon of 08/12. The disputed taxes are usually collected from road users. At least two soldiers were killed in the clash.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Suspected US war planes conducted several air strikes on Mansoura village (10km NW of Jilib town) in the morning of 07/12. The planes destroyed the AS base in the village. Locals report that at least one senior AS official was killed in the attack.
Al Shabaab takes control of Goof Guduud from government forces following a lengthy overnight battle. Four causalities reported on each side of fighting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An al Shabaab roadside bomb targets a AMISOM convoy near Bulo Mareer. Four AMISOM soldiers reported dead.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Weapons Seizure: AMISOM forces raid an al Shabaab IED factory, 7 al Shabaab arrested. No reported violence.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: AS fighters ambushed joint forces consisting of Jubaland, AMISOM and American soldiers at Abdi Dhoore Village (30km W of Kismaayo town) in the morning of 09/12 while they were on security patrol. The ambush started with an IED attack, followed by small arms fire exchange. AS withdrew shortly after and no casualties have been reported from both sides.

At least two people have been killed and a third wounded after a suicide car bomb filled with explosives went off at a checkpoint manned by Somali national security agency (NISA) officers in Sinka-Dheer.

Two hand grenades were hurled at the residence of the former Wardhiigleey DC, Ms. Deka Abdulkadir, in Caga Dhiig neighbourhood (Wardhiigley district) on the night of 10/12. Shortly after the explosions, the attackers also opened fire at the guards of the residence. Four people were reportedly injured in the hand grenade attack. The perpetrators, suspected to be al Shabaab, escaped.
Government forces clash with unidentified clan militia. Causalities not known.

Armed militiamen hailing from Habar-Gidir/Sacad sub-clan shot and killed a man hailing from Marehan/Wagardhac sub-clan and injured another Leelkase clansman on 09/12. The motive is currently unclear. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AMISOM forces are targeted with a roadside bomb while travelling between Tabta and Qoqani. Several soldiers are feared dead. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.
An al Shabaab suicide car-bomb targets a police post at the entrance of the Port of Mogadishu. At least 20 dead - al Shabaab claims 30, other sources claim 29 with 50 injured.

An al Shabaab suicide car-bomb targets a police post at the entrance of the Port of Mogadishu. At least 20 dead, plus the bomber - al Shabaab claims 30, other sources claim 29 with 50 injured. Police forces arrested a suspect the following week.
Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade against a NISA outpost in Aden Adde junction (Wardhiigleey district) in the night of 11/12. No casualties were reported. Perpetrators escaped.

AS fighters launched an attack against SNG forces base near the Livestock Market (Heliwa district) in the night of 11/12. Both sides exchanged gunfire before the attackers withdrew. No casualties were reported.
Al Shabaab claims they have gained control of Ceel Waaq following a overnight raid wounding four soldiers. The forces left the following morning, SNG retook the town without violence.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Targeting Jubaland forces, suspected al Shabaab hurls two hand grenades into a Kismayo restaurant. Three dead, seven wounded. Dalsan Radio claims the explosives were land mines.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy is struck by an al Shabaab IED. One reported wounded.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Heavy fighting between Puntland and Galmudug forces in Gaalkacyo. Fatalities, injuries not known.

Suspected al Shabaab attacked and injured a male elder in the vicinity of Siliga (Wadajir district) in the night of 11/12. The victim reportedly came from Jowhar where he participated in the Lower House elections. The perpetrators escaped.
Al Shabaab claims they have gained control of Ceel Waaq following a overnight raid wounding four soldiers. The forces left the following morning, SNG retook the town without violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: AS fighters attacked an AMISOM convoy with a roadside mine/IED, destroying two trucks which were carrying goods for the AMISOM base in Ceel Baraf village. The attack took place in an area between Mahaday and Ceel Baraf (22km and 55km NE of Jowhar town respectively) on 12/12. The AMISOM convoy reportedly suffered unspecified further casualties.

Residents of Haybe Yaabe village held a peaceful demonstration in front of Borama local authority's office to protest against a perceived lack of response to water scarcity in the town and the absence of local government officials from the town. The demonstrators demanded the election of a new local council. The police did not intervene.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: A group of Puntland soldiers interrupted and stopped a reconciliation meeting between Puntland and Galmudug local authorities which was taking place at the green line market in the morning of 12/12. The soldiers, who were complaining of delayed salaries, then moved on to the Puntland bank and briefly took control of it. They later moved back to their base after their commanders intervened.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Forces affiliated to Puntland and Galmudug states engaged in a brief shoot-out at Puntland customs checkpoint in Garsoor neighbourhood of Galkacyo on 12/12. It is not clear who initiated the shoot-out. No casualties were reported.

Unidentified attackers hurled a hand grenade at a police outpost in Bakara Junction (Hawl-Wadaag district) in the evening of 12/12. A civilian bystander was reportedly injured in the attack. The perpetrator(s) escaped.

An IED explosion, believed to be remotely detonated, occurred in the vicinity of Sarkuusta neighbourhood (Dharkenley district) in the afternoon of 12/12. The target is believed to be the security forces. No casualties were reported.

Al Shabaab have executed between 2-5 electoral delegates near the coastal city of Harardheere in Mudug region. The electors had recently voted for a new MP. The attack may have occurred the following day.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Two simultaneous blasts ripped through a convoy carrying AU soldiers serving with AMISOM near Mahaday district in Middle Shabelle region on 12/12. Sources said AMISOM convoy was targeted in remote-controlled land mine explosions as it drove between Biyo Adde and Mir Tuugo areas by al Shabaab. Two causalities reported. Al Shabaab believed responsible
A Somali government soldier was shot and killed by suspected al Shabaab gunmen in Qoryoley.
Senior ASWJ officials escaped assassination. Injuries, perpetrators not known.
Government forces raid an al Shabaab base, causing them to flee. The government forces recovered weapons.

SNG forces based in Teedan village, on 13/12, opened fire at a vehicle carrying 4 SNG soldiers that were headed to Guriceel with the intention of defecting to ASWJ. The defecting soldiers had deserted their base in Maxaas town (approx. 82km NE of Buulo Burde) and were on their way to Guri Ceel when the incident took place. The attacking SNG soldiers seized the vehicle carrying the defectors after the latter party fled. Causalities not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: AS fighters fired five mortar rounds against ENDF/SNA military base in Waajid from an unknown location in the morning of 13/12. Reports indicate that the ENDF responded with mortar fire in the direction of the attack. No civilian casualties were reported.

SNA forces, after receiving a tip off, attacked AS fighters who were gathering in Muuye Muruq village (7km SW of Qoryooley) in the afternoon of 13/12. Both sides engaged in fighting for about half an hour, and the number of the casualties are not known.

On 13 December 2016, a band of otherwise civilians attacked and killed an al Shabaab official in El Dheere Barsane, near Jowhar. The attack was in response to the ""suffering [the attacked] inflicted on local people.""
Ten are dead following an al Shabaab attack on government forces on the outskirts of Baidoa.
Al-Shabaab fighters have attacked a Somali military camp in southern town of Qoryoleey. ""Deaths and injuries"" reported. The attack may have occurred the previous day.

Gunmen hailing from Sacad-Muse/Abdalla-Abokor sub clan reportedly shot and killed a Sacad-Muse/Jibril-Abokor clansman in the vicinity of Sheekh Omar neighbourhood in Hargeisa on 14/12. The motive for the killing is believed to be over a land ownership dispute between the two groups. Police arrived at the scene and immediately conducted an operation, after which they claimed to have arrested several suspects.
An SNG soldier shot and killed a businessman after he refused his extortion demand.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Al Shabaab assassinated a deputy police commander in Bossaso ""last week"" - source dated 21/12. Al Shabaab later claimed responsibility.
Al Shabaab shot and killed 5 government soldiers while they sat in a tea shop in Heliwa.
Unknown assailants hurled a hand grenade at the Old Presidential Palace of Baidoa in the evening of 15/12. It is believed ISWA intelligence officers were the target. No casualties were reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: AMISOM troops consisting of a Djiboutian contingent based in the Hawl Wadaag section of Beled Weyne town opened fire at a lorry on 15/12 after the driver of the lorry failed to heed orders to stop as he approached the base of AMISOM. The AMISOM soldiers shot at the vehicle, wounding the driver.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: Unidentified men armed with pistols shot and seriously injured the Deputy Chief Commander of the Puntland Police in the vicinity of Madina Hotel in Laanta Hawada neighbourhood of Bosasso in the morning of 15/12. The motive for the incident is unclear. The perpetrators escaped. The Deputy Chief of the Puntland police succumbed to the injuries and died in Bosaso General Hospital on 16/12. Police arrested several suspects in connection to the incident.

A group from women from the Milk Marketers Association held a demonstration in front of the local government offices following a directive of new taxes targeting the milk business. The local government had previously seized vehicles transporting milk after they refused to pay the taxes. However, the mayor of Borama intervened and told the demonstrators that the new policy has been rescinded, effectively ending the demonstrations.

At least one person was killed and four others were wounded in a suicide car bomb blast at the Village restaurant, a popular coffee cafe in Mogadishu. The target of the blast is believed to be a police commander. Two journalists reported injured. Perpetrators not known.
Six are killed in an IED blast at an either a cafe patronized by soldiers or an army checkpoint. The blast came just hours after a car loaded with explosives was driven into a restaurant.
Green-on-green incident in Yaaqshiid. Causalities not known.

Habar-Gidir militiamen abducted a Biimaal farmer who was travelling by a lorry at a checkpoint in Shalambood village (8km W of Marka) in the morning of 16/12. The abductee was travelling from Ceel Jaalle village to Kabtaan Laas when the incident happened. The motive for the abduction is unknown.

Habar-Gidir militiamen opened fire at a group of Biimaal militiamen who were waiting for a Khat consignment at Ayuub neighbourhood of Marka, wounding one of the Biimaal militiamen in the afternoon of 16/12.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces attacked an AS fighters' base at Berhani village (35km NW of Kismaayo town) on the morning of 16/12. The Jubaland forces briefly took over the village, after a short armed clash that caused no casualties on both sides, but withdrew after three hours and returned to Kismaayo town in the evening of the same day.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Ormale clan militia supported by Jubaland forces attacked an AS base at Scimberrei (Shinbirey) grazing area (76km NW of Kismaayo) on the night of 16/12. After brief exchange of small gun fire, the Ormale militia withdrew but area residents reported that the clash resulted in the death of 3 AS fighters and 3 Ormale militiamen. The ongoing clashes resulted from a disagreement between AS and the Ormale clan on tax (Zakawat) payments, leading to the confiscation of several hundreds of camels by the AS.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Several al-Shabaab fighters have been killed and dozens injured on 16/12 during heavy fighting with Jubbaland forces in the outskirt of Kismayo.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces are accused of killing six civilians travelling by bus in Qoryooey on the evening of either 12/16 or 12/17. AMISOM forces later admitted to the fact, but claimed the vehicle failed to stop when ordered.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Arrests: Puntland forces arrest 120 al Shabaab members during a large security raid in Bossaso.

Defusal: ISWA forces, in the morning of 17/12, discovered and disabled an IED that was planted in Baidoa's former livestock market in Berdale neighbourhood. A Quranic school teacher was arrested and accused of planting the IED in the area with the aim of targeting an ISWA military checkpoint.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters launched a fierce attack on an AMISOM base in Buulo Mareer village (28km SW of Marka) in the night of 17/12. The two sides engaged in an intense armed clash that lasted for about an hour. The number of casualties from both sides could not be established.

Two groups of SNA forces briefly clashed in Leego (49km SE of Buur Hakabo) in the afternoon of 17/12. The fighting was caused by disputes stemming from checkpoint taxation. Two civilians were injured in the stray bullets.

Unidentified men, armed with a pistol, shot and killed a man in Baardheere town in the night of 17/12. Reports indicates that the victim was the bodyguard of the Baardheere district commissioner. The motive behind killing is not known and the perpetrators escaped.

Dhulbahante/Baharsame armed clansmen shot and killed two teenagers hailing from Dhulbahante/Qayaad sub-clan in the vicinity of Dharkeyn Genyo village (80km SE of Buuhoodle) on 17/12. The motive of the killing is an episode of the series of revenge killings between the two sub-clans. The perpetrators have escaped, and the incident heightened the tensions.

Armed perpetrators hailing from Ali-Saleban sub-clan shot and killed an Ali-Jibrahil clansman and injured another in the vicinity of Ufeyn on 17/12. The motive for the attack might be related to revenge killings between the two sub-clans. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy struck an IED at Ceel Wareegow, badly damaging one of the convoy's vehicles in the evening of 17/12.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Al Shabaab attack and kill nine civilians ""near Kismayo"". Later, Jubaland forces as well as a band of civilians pursued the attackers, killing three.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces gain control of Janay-Abdale and Ber-hano, source dated 17/12. Details of the battle not known.
Al Shabaab attack and kill nine civilians ""near Kismayo"". Later, Jubaland forces as well as a band of civilians pursued the attackers, killing three.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces gain control of Janay-Abdale and Ber-hano, source dated 17/12. Details of the battle not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab overtakes Mahadaay following a battle with AMISOM forces . At least two casualties. AMISOM forces retook control of the town the following morning without violence.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM soldiers shot dead a mother and her four children at El Weregow area located near the port town of Marka, about 110Km south-west of Somali capital on Sunday afternoon, reasons not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces carry out an assassination of a al Shabaab leader in Kismayo.
Green-on-green clash over an illegal checkpoint. One civilian reported injured.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AMISOM forces opened fire on a civilian minibus, six reported dead. The reason for the attack is not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Backed by locals, Jubbaland forces launched an operation in Berhani, Kaamjaroon, and Golashimbi settlements in 18/12. According to Jubba military officers who led the operation, an intense battle ensued, resulting in huge casualties. Fifteen Al-Shabab fighters and their commander were killed in the fighting. The Al-Shabaab commander was captured alive but died later from his wounds. One Jubbaland soldier was killed and two others were wounded in the fighting. Garoweonline reported fighting also occurred at Janay Abdalla

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Backed by locals, Jubbaland forces launched an operation in Berhani, Kaamjaroon, and Golashimbi settlements in 18/12. According to Jubba military officers who led the operation, an intense battle ensued, resulting in huge casualties. Fifteen Al-Shabab fighters and their commander were killed in the fighting. The Al-Shabab commander was captured alive but died later from his wounds. One Jubbaland soldier was killed and two others were wounded in the fighting. Garoweonline reported fighting also occurred at Janay Abdalla

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Backed by locals, Jubbaland forces launched an operation in Berhani, Kaamjaroon, and Golashimbi settlements in 18/12. According to Jubba military officers who led the operation, an intense battle ensued, resulting in huge casualties. Fifteen Al-Shabab fighters and their commander were killed in the fighting. The Al-Shabab commander was captured alive but died later from his wounds. One Jubbaland soldier was killed and two others were wounded in the fighting. Garoweonline reported fighting also occurred at Janay Abdalla

Unidentified men, suspected of being AS members, threw hand grenade against an intelligence forces base at Warshada Hilibka in Gulwade section of Shaqalaha neighbourhood of Kismaayo in the night of 18/12. No causalities.

A gunman from Warsangeli/Dubeys clan shot and injured his fellow clansman in the vicinity of Xera Caws in New Bosasso neighbourhood of Bosasso in the evening of 18/12. The motive of the incident is unclear. The perpetrator has escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: An armed police officer hailing from Majeerteen/Siwaqron sub-clan shot and killed another police man from Majeerteen/Isse Mohamud sub-clan in the vicinity of Miir Police station in Bosaso neighbourhood in the evening of 18/12. The motive is unclear. The perpetrator escaped.
A civilian, said to be a casual labourer, was shot and killed by two unidentified men armed with pistols in Jiiro Garoob neighbourhood on 18/12. The motive is not known. The perpetrators escaped.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column17: Puntland forces clash with Islamic State fighters outside of Qandala at El (Ceel) Ladid. Casualties not known or reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: Al Shabaab overtakes Mahadaay following a battle with AMISOM forces . At least two causalities. AMISOM forces retook control of the town the following morning without violence.
A shop owner is killed in Yaaqshiid. Perpetrators not known.

Suspected AS fighters confiscated about 65 goats and 50 heads of cattle from Biimaal herders at KM50 areas of Buulo Cadeey and Buulo Xaanshi villages (34km and 32km SW of Afgooye) in the evening of 19/12. Biimaal militia, in retaliation, pursued the rustlers and engaged them in an armed clash, finally managing to recover the livestock. This comes in the wake of an alleged AS agreement with Biimaal clan elders to cease hostilities against each other. Causalities not known.
Unidentified attackers kill two young boys at Faras Cawle. The killings may have been related to clan revenge issues.
Unidentified persons attacked a member of the opposition Wadani Party with a knife. Status of victim unknown.
AS fighters abducted a defector from his house in Isha neighbourhood of Baidoa on 19/12. It is reported that they have taken him to Buula fulaay area.

A Majerteen/Omar-Mohamud clansman, armed with a pistol, shot and injured his fellow clansman in Israac neighbourhood of Galkacyo in the morning of 20/12. The motive for the shooting was reportedly over a land dispute. The perpetrator surrendered himself to the police.
Authorities have reported al Shabaab have killed civilians ""in districts west of Kismaayo."" Dates, numbers of dead unknown.
A civilian is shot and killed in Dharkenley by an unidentified perpetrator.
Violence between two clan militias reported, causality figures not known.

Unidentified assailants, suspected of being AS members, hurled a hand grenade against a hotel(Mom) near Hirshabelle state house on 20/12. Their target is believed to be two soldiers who were guarding the hotel. Two civilians and a soldier got injured in the explosion.

Heavily armed AS fighters attacked an illegal checkpoint, in which local militias were extorting money from vehicles using the road, in Bisle village on 21/12. One of the militias was killed while they were fleeing.
Detonation: An IED accidentally exploded killing two AS fighters who were planting it on a road on the outskirts of Bula Gaduud Village (31km NE of Kismaayo) on 20/12.

A number of Berbera residents demonstrated against the Berbera Police commander, accusing him of favouring a local businessman. The demonstrating residents were out to stop the businessman from taking over a piece of land which they claimed was theirs. The Police commander instructed police officers to disperse the residents from the land, and this resulted in stone throwing and angry chants against the commander.

Non-violent activity: SNA soldiers took over checkpoints at Ceel-Geelow, Qalimow and Garsaale (17km NW, 25km NW, and 30km NW of Balcad town) respectively on 20/12. The soldiers reportedly did this to express their anger against the government over unpaid salaries.

Non-violent activity: SNA soldiers took over checkpoints at Ceel-Geelow, Qalimow and Garsaale (17km NW, 25km NW, and 30km NW of Balcad town) respectively on 20/12. The soldiers reportedly did this to express their anger against the government over unpaid salaries.
Jareer/Shidle sub-clan farmers and Abgaal/Reer-Matabaan sub-clan pastoralists engaged in an armed clash in Gaashaanle village (37km NE of Balcad). 2 people were killed in the clashes.
A civilian died after being hit by a stray bullet from two warring Dhulbahante sub-clans, the identities of which not known.

Non-violent activity: SNA soldiers took over checkpoints at Ceel-Geelow, Qalimow and Garsaale (17km NW, 25km NW, and 30km NW of Balcad town) respectively on 20/12. The soldiers reportedly did this to express their anger against the government over unpaid salaries.

Presidential Palace at Huruse Hotel in Laanta Hawada neighbourhood of Bosaso in the afternoon of 20/12. The slain administrator was from the Majeerteen/Omar Mohamud sub clan. The motive for the killing is yet to be established. Security forces were dispatched to the scene of the attack to conduct investigations and to increase security patrols in the major junctions and locations in Bosaso. The perpetrators escaped.

Armed Dhulbahante/Qayaad sub-clan militiamen attacked an area near Salahdheer village (59km S of Laas Caanood) in the evening of 20/12. The motive of the attack was in retaliation against the killing of two Qayaad sub-clan teenagers by Baharsame gunmen. An elderly woman was seriously injured in the attack.

column7: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Ormale clan Militias, backed by Jubaland forces, attacked AS fighters who were planning to loot camels from their clan at Berhani Village (35km NW of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 20/12. The militias destroyed a battle wagon from AS. 11 combatants, 7 being AS, lost their lives in the armed clash.
Al Shabaab assailants a government official in Bossaso. Puntalnd forces react with a ""major sweep"" of the city.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Ethiopia)
column17: Defusal: ENDF forces discover and dismantle an al Shabaab IED in Kismayo. No causalities.

Heavily armed AS fighters attacked an illegal checkpoint in Bisle village on 21/12, killing one of the militiamen controlling it. The militias had illegally set up the checkpoint to extort money from vehicles using the road. A similar instance occurred the previous day.

Arrests: Police arrested a reporter working for a local news website, Hadhwanagnews.com, on 21/12. The police stormed the reporter house at Ahmed Dhagax neighbourhood of Hargeisa and arrested him. The reason for the arrest is not clear but the reporter is said to have had a dispute with a Somaliland police officer, and the officer might have been behind his arrest.

Three armed men clad in SNA uniform (not clear if legitimate soldiers), demanded money from a UN food truck, which was being off-loaded by contractors at a warehouse in Ceel Waaq on 21/12. The contracted company refused to pay as they had been cleared before by the local administration. The armed men opened fire at the lorry, damaging some of the food items. Ceel Waaq local authorities intervened immediately and the three men were arrested.
Unidentified attackers assaulted and wounded a leader of the Wadani Party. A similar attack took place two days prior.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Defusal: Jubaland and AMISOM forces discovered and dismantled an IED, planted on the outskirts of Bula Guduud Village (30km NE of Kismaayo) on 21/12. On the same day, another RCIED was targeted against Jubaland forces' convoy at the same location but caused no casualties.

Unidentified armed men, clad in SNA uniforms (not clear if legitimate soldiers) and aboard a pick-up vehicle, opened fire on another small Toyota saloon car with three occupants in Seybiyano neighbourhood (Wadajir district) on 21/12. The shooting injured two of the Toyota saloon car's passengers who were later taken to Medina hospital for treatment. The motive for the shooting is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.

Two unidentified attackers, armed with pistols, shot and killed a civilian man in Dabakayo Madow neighbourhood (Dharkenley district) on 21/12. The motive for the attack is unknown and the perpetrators escaped.
A soldier shot and killed a civilian driver after extortion refusal.
A civilian is shot and killed by two unidentified armed men with pistols. Motive not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: At least three people were killed and two others injured after fighting between a local militia group backed by Jubbaland and al Shabaab near Kismayo town. Goobjoog claims ten deaths. A senior al Shabaab officer was reported captured.
At least three people were on Thursday evening killed while three others were injured when an explosion occurred at a garage near Black-Sea village in the Hodan district. Perpetrators not known.
Seven clan elders (not identified) members of electoral college captured by al Shabaab.
SNA forces shot and killed an al Shabaab fighter at Yaabal village, 42km SW from Xudur.

Somaliland army clashed with Dhulbanahte/Jama-Siyaad militiamen at Tifafle village, near Canjiid village (16km W of Laas Caanood) on 22/12. Four militiamen were injured in the clashes and twelve Jama-Siyaad clansmen, including four elders, were arrested. The clashes resulted from a dispute between the Laas Caanood local authority and the Jama-Siyaad clansmen over the drilling of a borehole in the area.

SNA soldiers opened fire on two minibuses at Balad Aamin village (15km SW of Afgooye) in the morning of 22/12, in an attempt to extort them. The buses were travelling from Awdheegle to Afgooye town. Two passengers were killed and two others wounded in the shooting. Locals report that the drivers of the buses refused to obey the order of the armed men who commanded them to stop.

Majeerten/Ali-Saleban gunmen shot and killed two Majeerten/Ugaar-Saleban clansmen in the vicinity of Duud Hooyo village (54km SW of Iskushuban) on 22/12. While the motive for the killing is currently unclear, the two sub-clans are bitter rivals and the incident might be related to revenge killings.

column8: ULFSSCR: Unity and Liberation Fronts of Sool, Sanaag and Cayn Region
column17: The newly established Khatumo offshoot 'Unity and Liberation Front of the SSC regions' carried out a hit and run attack against Somaliland forces based in Gambadhe town (30km E of Laas Caanood) on 22/12. The attackers hurled artillery shells at the Somaliland forces, who in turn responded with heavy and light weaponry, forcing the Khatumo wing to retreat. The number of casualties could not be established. This attack comes in the backdrop of an agreement in Addis Ababa between the Khatumo administration and the Somaliland government.
Al Shabaab captured seven Somali delegates who participated in the Lower House election in Adado the interim capital of Galmudug state in Bariire.
Seven are killed when al Shabaab opened fire on a mini-bus in Daynuunay.
A SNAF convoy is struck by an al Shabaab IED. Outcome not known.

The Somaliland authorities in Lowyacado destroyed several illegal structures that are used for selling smuggled goods. The area residents refused to vacate the area and demonstrated against the destruction of the structures.

ISWA forces conducting security operation clashed with AS in Jebel (39km NE of Wajiid) on 23/12. One of AS fighters was killed and a motorbike, which was before taken by AS from a civilian, was confiscated. The troops returned to their base in Xudur.

AS fighters fired an RPG round against a minibus, carrying civilians and two SNA soldiers, in Bay Burajeed (approx. 8km E of Baidoa) on 23/12. The vehicle was destroyed and the nine people on board, seven civilians and two SNA soldiers, were killed.
AS fighters assassinated a Biimaal clansman, who was AS critic, in Boorow village (26km SW of Marka) in the evening of 23/12.
Two SNA soldiers shot and killed a pregnant woman at her shop in Hawo Tako neighbourhood of Afgooye on 23/12 following a tax collection dispute. The perpetrators fled and left behind an AK47 rifle.
A soldier was shot and killed and his gun was taken by an unidentified attacker.

A police officer opened fire at a public minibus in Warshada Barfuunka neighbourhood (Heliwa District) on 23/12. A passenger on board of the bus was killed while another was wounded. The motive of the attack is not known. The police officer was arrested.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: At least seven people have died and ten others have been injured following fierce fighting between Puntland and Galmudug regional state forces in Gaalkacyo.
Four are injured after Somaliland Army and unidentified clan militias clashed in Tifafle.
An IED exploded near a bus station in Buur Hakaba on 24/12. No causalities were reported.

Two men, armed with pistols, shot and killed a well-known traditional elder hailing from the Digil/Gelledi sub-clan in Balbaley village (approx. 2.5km NE of Afgooye) for unknown reason in the morning of 24/12. The perpetrators escaped.
A driver was shot dead by a SNA soldier, after he refused to pay money at a check point in Balcad town on 24/11. No arrest was reported.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An IED attack targeted against an AMISOM convoy in Miirtaqwo village (53km NE of Jowhar) on 25/12 reportedly killed four AMISOM soldiers. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility.
Unknown assailants attacked a SNG forces' checkpoint in Tre Dishe (Dharkenley District) with an IED on 24/12. No casualties were reported.
Two civilian men are shot and killed in KPP neighbourhood by unidentified men with pistols.

A luxury car, belonging to a military Government official, was targeted with an IED in Suuqa Timir (Hawl-Wadaag district) on 24/12. SNG forces guarding the vehicle retaliated with gun fire in all directions. Casualties resulting from both the IED explosion and the gunfire remains unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Burundian convoy travelling between Mir Taqwo and Biyo Cadde is struck by an al Shabaab RCIED. Causalities not known.
Al Shabaab attack a group of pastoralists at Saagga, five reported deaths.

Al Shabaab kills an soldier and a civilian in Wadajir District. The specific target of the attack not known. Following the attack the assailant took the soldiers weapons and fled. A search for the assailant was launched the following morning.
An IED planted along the road connecting Afgoye and Mogadishu at Ceelasha Biyaha explodes in a vacant area, no reported injury. The target of the blast remains unknown.
AS fighters launched an attack on SNA forces' base at Kabtaan Laas village (approx. 14km NW of Marka) and took over the base after a brief armed clash on 25/12. Casualties cannot be established.

Two suspected US warplanes carried out airstrikes at Waaya Arag settlement (approx. 10km NW of Marka) in the night 25/12. The airstrike was followed by a brief armed clash between AS guards and joint forces of SNA and foreign soldiers who shortly after the strike. The number of casualties remain unknown.

SNA forces ambushed AS fighters who were moving in two vehicles in Doondardiir (25km S of Xudur) on 25/12. Both sides exchanged small arms fire. One AS fighter was reportedly killed and another one injured.
Two groups of SNG forces exchanged gunfire in Xawaadley over a dispute of settlement administration. Two fighters were killed and five others injured.
A group of students and school teachers demonstrated in Garbodadar village over lack of facilities and insufficient number of teachers. Police dispersed the demonstrators but made no arrests.
Hawiye/Gajecel militiamen killed two Hawiye/Ormale clansmen at a water pan in Feer Sagaro grazing area (approx. 58km NW of Kismaayo) on 25/12.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: The Prosecutor General of Bari Region Military courts was attacked by unidentified attackers, injuring he and his bodyguards.
Two groups of SNG forces exchanged small arms fire in front of the Foreign Ministry compound, over unknown reasons, on 25/12. One soldier was reportedly killed in the clash.

A group of NISA soldiers exchanged gun-fire with a group of SNG forces in Al-Baraka neighbourhood (Hodan district) on 25/12. The reason for the internal clash is unknown. A SNG soldier was killed in the fighting.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: Two suspected US warplanes carried out airstrikes at Waaya Arag settlement (approx. 10km NW of Marka) in the night 25/12. The airstrike was followed by a brief armed clash between AS guards and joint forces of SNA and foreign soldiers who shortly after the strike. The number of casualties remain unknown.
Al Shabaab members shot and killed the military prosecutor of Puntland state in the north-eastern coastal town of Bosaso on the morning of 25/12. Several arrests were made following the incident.
An unidentified gunman shoot and kills a civilian.

Al Shabaab fighters carried out an attack against SNG forces at Kabtan-laas village, near Shalanbood. After an exchange of gunfire, al Shabaab managed to overtake the village before retreating shortly thereafter. It is not clear if government forces moved back following the departure. casualties not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Suspected Kenyan war planes conducted repeated air strikes against an AS base in the outskirts of Kamjiroon Village (approx. 85km NW of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 26/12. The planes destroyed the AS base and killed unknown number of AS fighters, as area residents report.
Unidentified aircraft carried out an overnight air-bombardment on an al Shabaab position at Janaale settlement. casualties could not established.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Jubaland forces attacked an AS base at Yaaq Shiniile grazing area (47km NW of Kismaayo) in the afternoon of 26/12. After a brief exchange of small and heavy fires, Jubaland forces withdrew and claimed that they destroyed the base and killed over six AS fighters.
Defusal: An IED placed near a restaurant is discovered by police and dismantled.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Burundi)
column17: Al Shabaab attacks a AMISOM convoy, causalities not known.
Reports al Shabaab have gained control of Kabtab Laas. No reported violence.

column6: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: The US launched a drone against an al Shabaab camp. Causalities not known.
Unidentified clan militia clash with al Shabaab who were attempting to confiscate livestock at Yaaq Bishaaro, near Kissmayo, due to their league with Jubaland forces. Six herders killed.
Police kill two businessmen over a tax payment.
Defusal: Security forces discover and dismantle an al Shabaab IED in Bakaara Market.
Al Shabaab launches a number of mortar rounds at an unidentified belligerent. No deaths reported.

At least six people, including civilians, have been killed in fighting between two groups of Somali government soldiers in Hawadley village, Balad district, in Middle Shabelle region. It is believed the fighting is related to ownership or control of land in the area.

AS fighters launched an attack on Biimaal militia base at Buulo Cadeey village (approx. 32km SW of Afgooye) on 27/12. Both sides engaged in a brief armed clash before AS fighters retreated. No casualties reported.

AS fighters opened gunfire against a Toyota Noah vehicle, transporting Khat from Berdale town to Baidoa, at Jiiro Gurey village (42km NE of Baidoa) on 27/12. Three people who were aboard the vehicle managed to run away before AS torched the vehicle and the Khat it was carrying.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Galmudug Administration
column17: Two militia groups from Puntland and Galmudug exchanged fire in Horumar neighbourhood of Galkacyo town in the morning of 27/12. The shoot-out was reportedly ignited after khat dealers tried to smuggle khat from the South to the North. Two people were injured as a result.

Local business people at Suuqa Weyne (Wadajir district) demonstrated and blocked the roads leading to the market on 27/12. The demonstrators were angry at the municipal soldier who earlier killed the 3 businessmen who refused to pay the new increased tax rates on 26/12.

Suspected AS fighters launched a hit and run attack against NISA forces based in Baar-Jowhar on 27/12. Both sides exchanged gun-fire for half an hour before the attackers retreated. Casualties are unknown.
Defusal: Somali police forces discover and dismantle an al Shabaab laid explosive in a Hawl Wadaag cafe.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: After an AMISOM convoy comes under attack by remote control IED at Km60 (perpetrators not known), the attacked soldiers open fire on a group of nearby civilians in anger, killing two.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: After an AMISOM convoy comes under attack by remote control IED at Km60 (perpetrators not known), the attacked soldiers open fire on a group of nearby civilians in anger, killing two.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Jubaland forces, backed by Kenyan forces launch a joint offensive on al Shabaab at Abdale Birole. Coalition forces have reported to have ""suffered causalities,"" numbers not known.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Aid Workers (Somalia)
column17: An employee of the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) has been killed by unidentified gunmen in Amera area, near Cabudwaaq.

An IED, attached to a vehicle belonging to a businessman, exploded at Maalin Taajir area (Hawl Wadaag District) in the morning of 28/12. The vehicle was damaged by the explosion but the owner escaped unhurt.

Unknown gunmen on Wednesday evening killed an elder, who was among the electoral college voted for members of the newly inaugurated parliament. The killers are reported to have escaped from the scene immediately after shooting dead the victim.
SNAF retreated from Muqakoori, al Shabaab in total control. No violence reported.

An al Shabaab suicide bomber targets a cafe in Jalalaqsi, killing only himself. It is not clear if there were any injuries. Following the attack security operatives made several arrests of al Shabaab suspects in the area.

Street vendors in Borama town demonstrated and threw stones at the police following an eviction order by the local authority. The ensuing clash left four people injured and police arrested 5 demonstrators.
A group of Shia clerics of the ""Sufi Order"" violently overtake a Sunni mosque. Injuries not known. Police made 23 arrests.
Suspected AS fighters launched a hit and run attack against SNG forces' base in KM 50 on 28/12. The two groups engaged in fighting for an hour before AS fighters withdrew. Causalities not reported.

column8: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Liyu Police paramilitaries and local villagers clashed in Dudun Village near Bursalaax Village (50km NW of Galkacyo) on the Somalia-Ethiopian border on 28/12. The fighting was triggered after Liyu Police shot and killed a man who tried to stop them from removing the Somalia and Puntland flags raised in the village. Three people, reportedly local villagers, were killed in the clash. Casualties of the Liyu Police could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED exploded around Biya-adde apparently targeting a AMISOM convoy. casualties could not be established.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An AMISOM convoy was attacked with an IED in Biyo Cado village (36km NE of Jowhar) on 28/12. The explosion reportedly killed 5 soldiers and wounded one soldier. Perpetrators identity not mentioned.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: A remotely controlled IED was targeted against Djiboutian forces in Jalalaqsi on 28/12. The soldiers were on foot patrol when the incident happened. Local telecommunication networks were switched off after the explosion and joint AMISOM/SNA forces conducted house to house search in the town. AS claimed responsibility for the attack.
Defusal: An IED device was successfully dismantled in Baar Ubax by EOD police unit, after they were alerted by members of the public on 28/12.
An IED placed under the empty car of a businessman detonates without injury.

Al Shabaab attacks a police station Afgooye town on the evening of 29/12, before being driven back by military forces stationed in the area. Fighting was reported as ""intense."" ""Many"" al Shabaab reported killed in the fighting. A Shabelle Media Network source claims at least 5 government soldiers were killed in the fighting.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Security Force
column8: Police Forces of Ethiopia (1995-2018) Liyu Police
column17: Puntland forces clash with Ethiopian Liyu Police after the latter crossed into Somalia. At least one Puntland solider dead in the fighting.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: A suspected al Shabaab IED exploded targeted a AMISOM convoy in Carbiska (5km SE of Afgooye) on 29/12. After the explosion, gun-fire was reported. Casualties are unknown.

Two groups of SNA forces engaged in an armed clash following a dispute over taxation money at the market in Hawo Tako on 29/12. Casualties of this clash could not be established as AS fighters attacked the town half an hour later.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: An RCIED planted along the roadside of Afgoy road in Alamada village, apparently targeting AMISOM convoy heading to Mogadishu from Afgoy direction, exploded and hit one of the AMISOM vehicles which sustained minor damage. No other casualties reported.

Reports indicate that the guards of beach-view restaurant opened fire at a pick-up Toyota vehicle with 6 NISA SNA soldiers on-board passing in front of the Beach-view hotel after they suspected the vehicle. The SNA soldiers reacted and exchanged gunfire with the guards but no casualties were reported.
Unidentified perpetrators assassinate an unidentified civilian, reasons not known.
An IED detonated at Midow, targeting the DC of Baidoa. The Commissioner escaped unhurt, though a bodyguard was slightly injured.

AS fighters targeted an IED against Baidoa DC, who was travelling from Awdhiinle to Baidoa, in Midow (21km NW of Baidoa) in the afternoon of 30/12. The DC escaped from the explosion unhurt. Only a bodyguard of the DC sustained light injuries.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Jubaland Security Force
column17: Arrests: Jubaland intelligence forces, tipped off by the public, safely dismantled an IED planted at roadside in Qacle vicinity of Fanoole neighbourhood in Kismaayo on 30/12. The intelligence forces also arrested the person who planted the IED.

Two SNG forces exchanged gunfire at a wedding ceremony in Beach View Hotel in Liido beach in the night of 30/12. Five people were injured by the stray bullets, including the groom. It is not known what triggered the fighting. Some soldiers who engaged in the armed clash were arrested.
Al Shabaab threw 2 hand grenades towards SNAF checkpoint, no deaths reported.

Scuffles broke out between two women groups from Habar-Yonis/Sacad Yonis and Habar-Jeclo/Baho sub-clans in Ceel-Afweyn in the evening of 31 /12. The clash was triggered by previous hostilities between the sub-clans. Police arrested 8 women, 5 from Habar-Jeclo/Baho and 3 Habar-Yunis/Sacad Yonis.

A group of herders armed with guns, believed to be Habar-Jeclo/Soolamadaw clansmen, reportedly ambushed a water tanker belonging to Dhulbahante/Araale-Mahad clansman in the vicinity of Sool-Joogto village (23km N of Buuhoodle) on 31/12. The motive of the ambush remains unclear. The gunmen shot and killed two Dhulbahante/Araale-Mahad clansmen on-board of the water tanker. The gunmen escaped and police arrested unspecified number of people from the Habar-Jeclo residents in the area.
It is reported that an unknown airplane conducted airstrikes on AS base in in Gol Weyn (22km SW of Marka) on 31/12. Number of casualties from the incident is not known.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: AS fighters attacked an AMISOM convoy, traveling from Mogadishu to Bali Dogle, with an IED in Yaqbariweyne on 31/12. One of convoy's vehicles was damaged by the explosion. The number of casualties are unknown.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
column17: RCIED planted along the roadside of Baidoa road in Idow Jalaad village, near Wanla Weyne, exploded and reportedly hit one of the AMISOM vehicles. Casualties could not be established. Perpetrators not known.

column6: Military Forces of Somalia (2012-2017) Puntland Police Force
column17: The prosecutor of Qardho court was shot and wounded by a gunmen who also injured one police officer. The perpetrator was killed on the spot by one of the body guard police officers.
Defusal: Government forces discover and disarm an IED in Shibis.
A SNG soldier shot and killed the Deputy Commander of the Presidential Guards, Gen Qorgab, over unknown reasons in Villa Somalia on 31/12. The perpetrator managed to escape.
Al Shabaab publicly executed a 76 year old civilian man over accusations of working with the Jubaland government.
Somaliland police reportedly shoot and kill two civilians in Buuhoodle. The reason for the attack is not known.
Habar Jeclo militiamen ambushed a vehicle carrying 5 Dhulbahante men at Sooljoogto, near Buuhoodle, killing three and injuring two others.
Suspected al Shabaab attack and killed a police officer in Yaaqshiid. The attack may have been in coordination with the blast at the airport.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: An al Shabaab suicide car bomber targeted the Medina gate of Aden Adde airport, detonating near a Halane facility housing AMISOM and UN personnel. AMISOM gunfire responded to the blast. Three deaths reported. Soon after, a second bomber targeted the Peace Hotel, located at the far side of the airport, injuring civilians.

An al Shabaab suicide car bomber targeted the Medina gate of Aden Adde airport, detonating near a Halane facility housing AMISOM and UN personnel. AMISOM gunfire responded to the blast. Three deaths reported. Soon after, a second bomber targeted the Peace Hotel in Waaberi, located at the far side of the airport, injuring civilians (coded here).

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Djibouti)
column17: Defusal: An RCIED placed at an AMISOM Djiboutian Guard location in the Centre of Bullo Burte Town was spotted by the troops on Patrol. The area was immediately secured and area network switched off. The RCIED was detonated Safely.
Clan militias clash at Makiinta, near Belet Weyne. casualties not known.
A civilian businessman from Hawadale clan is shot and killed by al Shabaab at Jameeca Shill, near Bulo Burto.
At least three Somali military soldiers are reported to have been killed in an al Shabaab ambush attack near Luuq at Bashiru village.
Military secure Moro Gabey from al Shabaab. Two al Shabaab spies reported dead.
South-West forces open fire on civilians at a stadium, motives not known. Two deaths reported.

column7: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Kenya)
column17: Somali and AMISOM forces gain control of Moro Gabey after al Shabaab fled.
Police forces kill two civilians at a checkpoint, reasons not known.
Al Shabaab attacks military personnel near Jowhar. The attack led to an exchange of gunfire. Al Shabaab claims to have killed ""many"" soldiers in the shootout, though SNG has yet to confirm.

Nine al-Shabaab fighters and a government soldier were killed when government forces backed Kenyan army attacked an al-Shabaab-held town of Buusaar. Reports say the Somali army took control of Buusaar after al-Shabaab withdrew.

A demonstration was held by rowdy youths at Xero Awr neighbourhood in Hargeisa. The motive behind the demonstration is not yet clear, but information received indicates that SL police used live ammunition in an effort to try and disperse the youth. Two women reportedly sustained bullet wounds and are currently being treated at Hargeisa group hospital.
Unidentified man hurled a HG targeting the residence of ministry of health for Jubaland State in Farjano neighbourhood. A security guard was slightly injured.

Defusal: Soldiers reported a suspicious device under a tree where they normally rest in Maayafuulka (c. 5km SE of Baidoa town). They left the area and alerted AMISOM who deployed their combat engineers at the scene. An IED was discovered and safely dismantled.

Two dead bodies (male and female) suspected to be a couple, were found washed ashore between Gendershe and Jilib-marka villages. Reports indicate that the bodies were white foreigners believed to be tourists and the cause of their death and nationality remained unknown. The area where the dead bodies were found is under AS control and AS mentioned that they buried the dead bodies.
Two men, accused of a series of thefts, were sentenced to hand amputation and their right-hands subsequently chopped off by AS in a public gathering in Kurtunwarey district.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-) (Uganda)
column17: A ""number"" of African Union (Uganda) and Somali National army personnel are feared dead after their convoy was hit by a landmine in the outskirts of southern town of Bula Mareer. Perpetrators not known .
Unidentified militia clashed against al Shabaab after forcible zakat collection. 4 al Shabaab killed.
Al Shabaab attacked a civilian vehicle. Four wounded.

column6: AMISOM: African Union Mission in Somalia (2007-)
